    1614             :           scope->assoc_block = stmt;
    1615             :           parent_scope->scopes = scope;
    1616             :         }  /* if */
    1617             :       }  /* if */
    1618             :     }  /* if */
    1619             :   }  /* if */
    1620             :   if (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function ||
    1621             :       scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_block ||
    1622             :       scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_condition) {
    1623             :     /* Mark local variables of functions. */
    1624             :     temp->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = TRUE;
    1625             :     temp->source_corresp.enclosing_routine =
    1626             :                                  innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr;
    1627             :   }  /* if */
    1628             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
    1629             :   if (promote_if_necessary &&
    1630             :       innermost_function_scope != NULL &&
    1631             :       (innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->
    1632             :                                                   statics_have_been_promoted ||
    1633             :        processing_file_scope_init_routine) &&
    1634             :       var_has_static_or_thread_storage_duration(temp)) {
    1635             :     /* If statics have already been promoted out of this function, promote
    1636             :        this temporary to the file scope (in case it is referenced in the
    1637             :        initialization of a static that has already been promoted to the
    1638             :        file scope).  Do this now (before the temporary has been placed on
    1639             :        the scope's variables list).  The generated file-scope initialization
    1640             :        routine doesn't undergo the usual promotion (for good reasons; see
    1641             :        pop_generated_routine_context), so promote appropriate variables
    1642             :        individually in that context. */
    1643             :     promote_static_variable_out_of_function(temp, scope,
    1644             :                                 innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr);
    1645             :   } else
    1646             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
    1647             :   /* Do not add code here. */
    1648             :   {
    1649             :     /* Add the temporary to the scope list (at the front).  We cannot use
    1650             :        add_to_variables_list because we might be working on a scope that is
    1651             :        not on the stack. */
    1652             :     add_temporary_to_front_of_variables_list(temp, scope);
    1653             :   }  /* if */
    1654             : }  /* add_temporary_to_scope */
    1655             : 
    1656             : 
    1657             : a_variable_ptr make_temporary(a_type_ptr temp_type,
    1658             :                               a_boolean  force_static)
    1659             : /*
    1660             : Make a temporary variable whose type is "temp_type" and whose storage
    1661             : class is static if force_static is TRUE.  Return a pointer to it.
    1662             : */
    1663             : {
    1664             :   a_variable_ptr  temp;
    1665             :   a_storage_class storage_class;
    1666             : 
    1667             :   /* Allocate the variable, using auto storage unless force_static is TRUE. */
    1668             :   if (!force_static) {
    1669             :     storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_auto;
    1670             :   } else {
    1671             :     storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_static;
    1672             :   }  /* if */
    1673             :   temp = make_variable(temp_type, storage_class, NO_SCOPE_DEPTH);
    1674             :   temp->lowering_generated = TRUE;
    1675             :   temp->source_corresp.name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none;
    1676             :   return temp;
    1677             : }  /* make_temporary */
    1678             : 
    1679             : 
    1680             : a_variable_ptr make_temporary_in_scope(a_type_ptr  temp_type,
    1681             :                                        a_scope_ptr scope,
    1682             :                                        a_boolean   force_static,
    1683             :                                        a_boolean   promote_if_necessary)
    1684             : /*
    1685             : Make a temporary variable in scope "scope" whose type is "temp_type" and
    1686             : whose storage class is static if force_static is TRUE or if the scope
    1687             : is not a function-local scope.  Return a pointer to it.  If scope is
    1688             : NULL, use the nearest enclosing scope.  If promote_if_necessary is TRUE, the
    1689             : newly created temporary is immediately promoted to file scope if the temporary
    1690             : is static and statics have already been promoted out of the enclosing routine.
    1691             : Generally speaking, promote_if_necessary should be set to FALSE if the
    1692             : temporary represents something added by the compiler (e.g., exception handling
    1693             : tables), and TRUE if it represents something in the user's program.
    1694             : */
    1695             : {
    1696             :   a_variable_ptr  temp;
    1697             :   a_boolean       local_to_function =
    1698             :                               (scope == NULL) ?
    1699             :                                   (innermost_function_scope != NULL) :
    1700             :                                   (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function ||
    1701             :                                    scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_block ||
    1702             :                                    scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_condition);
    1703             : 
    1704             :   if (!local_to_function) force_static = TRUE;
    1705             :   temp = make_temporary(temp_type, force_static);
    1706             :   /* Add the temporary variable to the list of variables for the scope. */
    1707             :   add_temporary_to_scope(temp, scope, promote_if_necessary);
    1708             :   return temp;
    1709             : }  /* make_temporary_in_scope */
    1710             : 
    1711             : 
    1712             : a_variable_ptr make_lowered_temporary(a_type_ptr temp_type)
    1713             : /*
    1714             : Interface to make_temporary_in_scope for the common case where the
    1715             : nearest scope should be used and the temporary need not be static.
    1716             : Allocates a temporary variable of the indicated type and returns a
    1717             : pointer to the variable.
    1718             : */
    1719             : {
    1720             :   return make_temporary_in_scope(temp_type, (a_scope_ptr)NULL,
    1721             :                                  /*force_static=*/FALSE,
    1722             :                                  /*promote_if_necessary=*/FALSE);
    1723             : }  /* make_lowered_temporary */
    1724             : 
    1725             : 
    1726             : a_variable_ptr make_file_scope_temporary(a_type_ptr temp_type)
    1727             : /*
    1728             : Make an unnamed static variable of type temp_type in the file scope.
    1729             : Return a pointer to the variable.
    1730             : */
    1731             : {
    1732             :   a_variable_ptr temp_var;
    1733             : 
    1734             :   /* Note that the allocation will be in the file scope memory region
    1735             :      regardless of the current IL region. */
    1736             :   temp_var = make_temporary_in_scope(temp_type, il_header.primary_scope,
    1737             :                                      /*force_static=*/TRUE,
    1738             :                                      /*promote_if_necessary=*/FALSE);
    1739             :   return temp_var;
    1740             : }  /* make_file_scope_temporary */
    1741             : 
    1742             : 
    1743             : a_variable_ptr find_reusable_temporary(a_type_ptr                 temp_type,
    1744             :                                        a_temporary_list_entry_ptr *ptlep)
    1745             : /*
    1746             : Find an existing reusable temporary with the given type, and return
    1747             : a pointer to it.  If there is no such temporary, return NULL.
    1748             : *ptlep is set to point to the corresponding temporary list entry.
    1749             : If the temporary is then used, the caller should set in_use in that entry.
    1750             : On entry, if *ptlep is non-NULL, the scan starts with the entry
    1751             : following that one; this allows the user to call this routine,
    1752             : examine the temporary selected, and if it's inappropriate scan again
    1753             : starting after the entry found to find another temporary.
    1754             : */
    1755             : {
    1756             :   a_variable_ptr             temp_var = NULL;
    1757             :   a_temporary_list_entry_ptr tlep;
    1758             : 
    1759             :   if (*ptlep == NULL) {
    1760             :     /* Start at the beginning of the list. */
    1761             :     tlep = curr_context->local_temporaries;
    1762             :   } else {
    1763             :     /* Start after the entry last returned. */
    1764             :     tlep = (*ptlep)->next;
    1765             :   }  /* if */
    1766             :   for (; tlep != NULL; tlep = tlep->next) {
    1767             :     if (!tlep->in_use && tlep->var->type == temp_type) {
    1768             :       /* Found a temporary with the proper type that we can reuse. */
    1769             :       temp_var = tlep->var;
    1770             :       break;
    1771             :     }  /* if */
    1772             :   }  /* for */
    1773             :   *ptlep = tlep;
    1774             :   return temp_var;
    1775             : }  /* find_reusable_temporary */
    1776             : 
    1777             : 
    1778             : void add_to_reusable_temporaries_list(a_variable_ptr temp_var)
    1779             : /*
    1780             : Add the indicated temporary variable to the list of reusable temporaries.
    1781             : */
    1782             : {
    1783             :   a_temporary_list_entry_ptr tlep;
    1784             : 
    1785             :   if (avail_temporary_list_entries != NULL) {
    1786             :     /* Reuse a freed entry. */
    1787             :     tlep = avail_temporary_list_entries;
    1788             :     avail_temporary_list_entries = tlep->next;
    1789             :   } else {
    1790             :     /* Allocate a new entry. */
    1791             :     tlep = (a_temporary_list_entry_ptr)
    1792             :                                       alloc_fe(sizeof(a_temporary_list_entry));
    1793             : #if DEBUG
    1794             :     num_temporary_list_entries_allocated++;
    1795             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    1796             :   }  /* if */
    1797             :   tlep->var = temp_var;
    1798             :   tlep->in_use = TRUE;
    1799             :   tlep->next = curr_context->local_temporaries;
    1800             :   curr_context->local_temporaries = tlep;
    1801             : }  /* add_to_reusable_temporaries_list */
    1802             : 
    1803             : 
    1804             : a_variable_ptr make_local_temporary(a_type_ptr temp_type)
    1805             : /*
    1806             : Make a temporary of type temp_type that is used only within the current
    1807             : full expression, and can be reused after that.
    1808             : */
    1809             : {
    1810             :   a_variable_ptr             temp_var;
    1811             :   a_temporary_list_entry_ptr tlep = NULL;
    1812             : 
    1813             :   /* Look for a previously-allocated temporary we can reuse. */
    1814             :   temp_var = find_reusable_temporary(temp_type, &tlep);
    1815             :   if (temp_var == NULL) {
    1816             :     /* Allocate a new temporary variable. */
    1817             :     temp_var = make_lowered_temporary(temp_type);
    1818             :     /* Put the variable on a list of reusable local temporaries. */
    1819             :     add_to_reusable_temporaries_list(temp_var);
    1820             :   } else {
    1821             :     /* Reuse an existing temporary. */
    1822             :     tlep->in_use = TRUE;
    1823             :   }  /* if */
    1824             :   return temp_var;
    1825             : }  /* make_local_temporary */
    1826             : 
    1827             : 
    1828             : a_variable_ptr make_temporary_for_dynamic_init(
    1829             :                                           a_type_ptr         temp_type,
    1830             :                                           a_dynamic_init_ptr dip,
    1831             :                                           a_boolean          *is_reusable_temp)
    1832             : /*
    1833             : Create a temporary variable of type temp_type that will be initialized by
    1834             : the dynamic initialization in dip.  If possible a reusable temporary will
    1835             : be allocated, but in cases where the initialization may result in a
    1836             : constant portion, a non-reusable temporary will be returned.  *is_reusable_temp
    1837             : is set to TRUE if a temporary that is (or can be) reused is allocated
    1838             : (FALSE otherwise).
    1839             : */
    1840             : {
    1841             :   a_variable_ptr  temp_var;
    1842             : 
    1843             :   check_assertion(dip != NULL);
    1844             :   if (!dip->static_temp && !long_lifetime_temps &&
    1845             :       !(dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_nonconstant_aggregate) &&
    1846             :       !(dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_zero) &&
    1847             :       !(dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_constant) &&
    1848             :       !(dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_constructor &&
    1849             :         need_zeroing_for_value_initialization(dip)) &&
    1850             :       dip->has_temporary_lifetime) {
    1851             :     /* Simple case; a temporary that lasts until the end of the full
    1852             :        expression will do.  Can't use a reusable temporary if
    1853             :        the temporary may end up with an initializer. */
    1854             :     temp_var = make_local_temporary(temp_type);
    1855             :     *is_reusable_temp = TRUE;
    1856             :   } else {
    1857             :     temp_var = make_temporary_in_scope(temp_type,
    1858             :                                        (a_scope_ptr)NULL,
    1859             :                                        (a_boolean)dip->static_temp,
    1860             :                                        /*promote_if_necessary=*/TRUE);
    1861             :     *is_reusable_temp = FALSE;
    1862             :   }  /* if */
    1863             :   return temp_var;
    1864             : }  /* make_temporary_for_dynamic_init */
    1865             :   
    1866             : 
    1867             : a_variable_ptr make_unnamed_local_static_variable(a_type_ptr type,
    1868             :                                                   a_boolean  in_function_scope)
    1869             : /*
    1870             : Make an unnamed local static variable with the indicated type and return
    1871             : a pointer to it.  If in_function_scope is TRUE, add it to the function scope
    1872             : instead of the current context (which might be a block scope).
    1873             : */
    1874             : {
    1875             :   check_assertion_str(curr_context != NULL,
    1876             :                    "make_unnamed_local_static_variable: curr_context is NULL");
    1877             :   return make_temporary_in_scope(type,
    1878             :                                  in_function_scope ? innermost_function_scope :
    1879             :                                                      (a_scope_ptr)NULL,
    1880             :                                  /*force_static=*/TRUE,
    1881             :                                  /*promote_if_necessary=*/FALSE);
    1882             : }  /* make_unnamed_local_static_variable */
    1883             : 
    1884             : 
    1885             : a_variable_ptr make_lowered_variable(a_const_char    *var_name,
    1886             :                                      a_boolean       already_il_name,
    1887             :                                      a_type_ptr      var_type,
    1888             :                                      a_storage_class var_storage_class)
    1889             : /*
    1890             : Make a file-scope variable whose name is var_name, whose type is var_type,
    1891             : and whose storage class is var_storage_class.  Return a pointer to it.
    1892             : already_il_name is TRUE if the name has already been allocated in the IL;
    1893             : if not, it has to be allocated and copied.  var_name may be NULL if
    1894             : already_il_name is TRUE.
    1895             : */
    1896             : {
    1897             :   a_variable_ptr var;
    1898             :   sizeof_t       alloc_length;
    1899             : 
    1900             :   /* Allocate the variable.  Note that the subroutine allocates the variable
    1901             :      in the file scope if the storage class is static. */
    1902             :   var = make_variable(var_type, var_storage_class, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
    1903             :   if (!already_il_name) {
    1904             :     /* Copy the name to the IL region. */
    1905             :     alloc_length = strlen(var_name)+1;
    1906             :     var_name = strcpy(alloc_lowered_name_string(alloc_length), var_name);
    1907             :   }  /* if */
    1908             :   var->lowering_generated = TRUE;
    1909             :   var->source_corresp.name = var_name;
    1910             :   var->source_corresp.name_linkage =
    1911             :         (var_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified ||
    1912             :          var_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_extern) ?
    1913             :                                             (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external :
    1914             :         (var_storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static && var_name != NULL) ?
    1915             :                                             (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal :
    1916             :         /* Otherwise: */
    1917             :                                             (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_none;
    1918             : #if CHECKING
    1919             :   if (var_storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_static &&
    1920             :       var_storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_extern &&
    1921             :       var_storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    1922             :     internal_error(
    1923             :                 "make_lowered_variable: bad storage class for file scope var");
    1924             :   }  /* if */
    1925             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    1926             :   return var;
    1927             : }  /* make_lowered_variable */
    1928             : 
    1929             : 
    1930             : an_expr_node_ptr make_array_to_pointer_node(an_expr_node_ptr operand)
    1931             : /*
    1932             : Utility to create an eok_array_to_pointer node with the specified operand;
    1933             : also sets the address_taken field properly if the operand is a variable.  
    1934             : Used by lowering when adding an array decay.  The node is created as an rvalue.
    1935             : */

    1937             :   an_expr_node_ptr node;

    1940             :   set_address_taken_for_variable_or_routine_expr(operand);

    1942             :                      type_after_array_to_pointer_transformation(operand->type),
    1943             :                      operand);

    1945             :   return node;

    1947             :

    1963             : 
    1964             : 
    1965             : a_variable_ptr make_global_var_with_prefixed_name(
    1966             :                                       a_const_char            *prefix,
    1967             :                                       an_integer_kind         ikind,
    1968             :                                       a_source_correspondence *source_corresp,
    1969             :                                       an_il_entry_kind        kind)
    1970             : /*
    1971             : Create a global variable whose name is the concatenation of the indicated
    1972             : prefix and the mangled name of the entity (as identified by source_corresp
    1973             : and kind).  The variable has the integral type indicated by ikind.  This is
    1974             : used, for example, for variables that record information about potential
    1975             : template instantiations.
    1976             : */
    1977             : {
    1978             :   a_variable_ptr var;
    1979             :   char           *info_name;
    1980             : 
    1981             :   info_name = make_prefixed_object_name(prefix, source_corresp, kind);
    1982             :   /* Make the variable.  Note that it is a definition of an external name. */

    1984             :                               integer_type(ikind),
    1985             :                               (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified);

    1987             :   var->source_corresp.final_name_mangling_pending = final_name_mangling_needed;
    1988             :   return var;
    1989             : }  /* make_global_var_with_prefixed_name */
    1990             : 
    1991             : #if AUTOMATIC_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATION
    1992             : 
    1993             : void make_instantiation_info_var(a_const_char            *prefix,
    1994             :                                  a_source_correspondence *source_corresp,
    1995             :                                  an_il_entry_kind        kind)
    1996             : /*
    1997             : Create a variable whose name records information on instantiation of some
    1998             : entity.  Such variables are used as part of the automatic instantiation scheme.
    1999             : source_corresp/kind identify the entity (variable or routine) for which some
    2000             : information is to be encoded.  The name of the generated variable encodes
    2001             : the information about that entity; it consists of the indicated prefix
    2002             : (e.g., something like "__DNI__" to indicate "do not instantiate") followed
    2003             : by the mangled name of the entity.  The variable has type char (arbitrarily).
    2004             : */
    2005             : {
    2006             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    2007             :   a_variable_ptr  var;
    2008             : 
    2009             :   var =
    2010             : #else /* !MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    2011             :   (void)
    2012             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    2013             :         make_global_var_with_prefixed_name(prefix, (an_integer_kind)ik_char,
    2014             :                                            source_corresp, kind);
    2015             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    2016             :   /* Since this routine is always called after normal needed flag processing
    2017             :      (since the determination of which instantiation info variables to put
    2018             :      out is dependent on what is needed), update the needed and keep-in-IL
    2019             :      flags now. */
    2020             :   mark_as_needed((char *)var, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_variable);
    2021             :   mark_to_keep_in_il((char *)var, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_variable);
    2022             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    2023             : }  /* make_instantiation_info_var */
    2024             : 
    2025             : #endif /* AUTOMATIC_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATION */
    2026             : 
    2027             : an_expr_node_ptr make_node_for_il_constant(a_constant_ptr constant)
    2028             : /*
    2029             : Make an expression node for the given constant and return a pointer to it.
    2030             : This is used when the constant is already an allocated IL constant.  In most
    2031             : cases an rvalue is returned, but if the constant is an aggregate with array
    2032             : type, an lvalue is returned instead.
    2033             : */
    2034             : {
    2035             :   an_expr_node_ptr node;
    2036             :   a_variable_ptr   temp_var;
    2037             : 
    2038             :   /* Check whether the constant is a converted pointer-to-member-function
    2039             :      constant.  If so, it is now a ck_aggregate constant, which cannot be
    2040             :      used directly in an expression.  For that case, create a temporary
    2041             :      variable initialized with the ck_aggregate, and use the value of the
    2042             :      variable. */
    2043             :   if (check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant(constant, &temp_var)) {
    2044             :     if (is_array_type(constant->type)) {
    2045             :       node = var_lvalue_expr(temp_var);
    2046             :     } else {
    2047             :       node = var_rvalue_expr(temp_var);
    2048             :       if (!identical_types(node->type, temp_var->type)) {
    2049             :         /* Preserve the temporary's type if there's a change in type. */
    2050             :         node->orig_lvalue_type = temp_var->type;
    2051             :       }  /* if */
    2052             :     }  /* if */
    2053             :     if (constant->implicit_cast) {
    2054             :       node = add_cast_if_necessary(node, constant->type);
    2055             :     }  /* if */
    2056             :   } else {
    2057             :     /* Normal case; make a constant node. */
    2058             :     node = alloc_node_for_allocated_constant(constant);
    2059             :   }  /* if */
    2060             :   return node;
    2061             : }  /* make_node_for_il_constant */
    2062             : 
    2063             : 
    2064             : static void promote_integer_constant(a_constant *cp)
    2065             : /*
    2066             : Do integral promotion on the indicated integer constant.
    2067             : */
    2068             : {
    2069             :   a_type_ptr promoted_type = type_after_integral_promotion(cp->type);
    2070             :   a_boolean  did_not_fold;
    2071             : 
    2072             :   if (promoted_type != cp->type) {
    2073             :     type_change_constant(cp, promoted_type,
    2074             :                          /*is_implicit_cast=*/TRUE,
    2075             :                          /*maintain_expression=*/FALSE,
    2076             :                          &did_not_fold, &error_position);
    2077             :   }  /* if */
    2078             : }  /* promote_integer_constant */
    2079             : 
    2080             :

    2107             : 
    2108             : static an_expr_node_ptr node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(
    2109             :                                                         an_expr_node_ptr node,
    2110             :                                                         a_field_ptr      field)
    2111             : /*
    2112             : node is a class rvalue.  Create an expression to select the value of the
    2113             : indicated field from it, and return a pointer to the expression created.
    2114             : The result is an rvalue.
    2115             : */
    2116             : {
    2117             :   an_expr_node_ptr      field_node;
    2118             :   a_type_ptr            selection_type;
    2119             : #if CHECKING
    2120             :   a_type_ptr            node_type = skip_typerefs(node->type);
    2121             : #endif  /* CHECKING */
    2122             : 
    2123             :   check_assertion(!node->is_lvalue &&
    2124             :                   (is_ptr_to_member_type(node_type) ||
    2125             :                    is_immediate_class_type(node_type)));
    2126             :   /* This routine is similar to field_lvalue_selection_expr. */
    2127             :   /* Make the expression node for the field. */
    2128             :   field_node = alloc_expr_node((an_expr_node_kind)enk_field);
    2129             :   field_node->type = field->type;
    2130             :   node_field(field_node) = field;
    2131             :   node->next = field_node;
    2132             :   /* The selected field is an rvalue and therefore has no cv-qualifiers. */
    2133             :   selection_type = prvalue_type(field->type);
    2134             :   /* Make the field selection node. */
    2135             :   node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_field,
    2136             :                             selection_type, node);
    2137             :   check_assertion(!node->is_lvalue);
    2138             :   return node;
    2139             : }  /* node_to_select_field_from_rvalue */
    2140             : 
    2141             : 
    2142             : static void adjust_field_selection_for_anonymous_union_references(
    2143             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr node)
    2144             : /*
    2145             : node is a field selection expression.  If it refers to a field in an anonymous
    2146             : union, adjust it to make the anonymous union reference(s) explicit.
    2147             : */
    2148             : {
    2149             :   a_field_ptr                 field, au_field;
    2150             :   an_expr_node_ptr            op2;
    2151             :   a_type_ptr                  field_class;
    2152             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    2153             : 
    2154             :   /* The loop here is for cases where there are several nested anonymous
    2155             :      unions. */
    2156             :   for (;;) {
    2157             :     op2 = node->variant.operation.operands->next;
    2158             :     field = node_field(op2);
    2159             :     /* See if the field is from an anonymous union. */
    2160             :     field_class = parent_class_of(field);
    2161             :     ctsp = field_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    2162             :     if (ctsp->anonymous_union_kind != (an_anonymous_union_kind)auk_field) {
    2163             :       /* Stop when the field is not from an anonymous union. */
    2164             :       break;
    2165             :     }  /* if */
    2166             :     /* Yes, it is from an anonymous union.  Rewrite the reference.
    2167             :        Basically, we keep the field selection we have, but rewrite its
    2168             :        first operand as a field selection of the proper anonymous union out
    2169             :        of the original first operand. */
    2170             :     au_field = ctsp->anonymous_union_field;
    2171             :     /* Change "x.y" to "x.au_field.y". */
    2172             :     adjust_anonymous_union_field_selection(node, au_field);
    2173             :     /* Loop to see if the rewritten first operand still refers to an
    2174             :        anonymous union field (because there are several nested anonymous
    2175             :        unions), and if so, to rewrite it. */
    2176             :     node = node->variant.operation.operands;
    2177             :   }  /* for */
    2178             : }  /* adjust_field_selection_for_anonymous_union_references */
    2179             : 
    2180             : 
    2181             : an_expr_node_ptr au_field_lvalue_selection_expr(an_expr_node_ptr node,
    2182             :                                                 a_field_ptr      field)
    2183             : /*
    2184             : Make an expression for an lvalue reference to field "field" of "node" and
    2185             : return a pointer to it.  "node" is either a class lvalue, in which case the
    2186             : operator is ".", or a pointer to class, in which case the operator is "->".
    2187             : Differs from field_lvalue_selection_expr in that it will deal with fields
    2188             : of anonymous unions by adding the necessary intermediate field selections.
    2189             : */
    2190             : {
    2191             :   node = field_lvalue_selection_expr(node, field);
    2192             :   if (!C_mode()) {
    2193             :     /* In C++ mode, add in selections for anonymous union parent objects,
    2194             :        for both standard and nonstandard cases.  The IL coming out of the
    2195             :        front end had the nonstandard cases in and the standard cases
    2196             :        out/implied, but code in lower_dynamic_init_aggregate_constant has
    2197             :        removed the nonstandard cases too, because ctor-inits have no way
    2198             :        to express any anonymous union intermediate selections, and it's
    2199             :        easiest to start with all cases equal (i.e., having no extra
    2200             :        field selections) and add them back in as needed.
    2201             :        In C mode, there are only nonstandard cases, which the front end
    2202             :        has explicitly put into the IL, so no adjustment is needed.  We
    2203             :        don't remove anything and we don't add anything.  This is good,
    2204             :        because C mode has the cases where more than one field symbol can
    2205             :        point to a given IL field, which makes it much harder to put
    2206             :        in the missing field selections if all you have is the IL. */
    2207             :     a_symbol_ptr field_sym = symbol_for(field);
    2208             :     /* Avoid problems with the anonymous parent fields themselves, as
    2209             :        opposed to their members. */
    2210             :     if (field_sym != NULL) {
    2211             :       adjust_nonstandard_anonymous_object_field_references(node, field_sym,
    2212             :                                                           /*std_also=*/TRUE);
    2213             :     }  /* if */
    2214             :   }  /* if */
    2215             :   return node;
    2216             : }  /* au_field_lvalue_selection_expr */
    2217             : 
    2218             : 
    2219             : static void rewrite_dot_field_as_points_to_field(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2220             : /*
    2221             : expr contains an expression of the form "(*x).y"; change it to "x->y".
    2222             : */

    2232             :   set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_points_to_field,
    2233             :                     expr->type, expr->is_lvalue,
    2234             :                     operand->variant.operation.operands);

    2255             : 
    2256             : 
    2257             : void change_to_cast(an_expr_node_ptr node,
    2258             :                     an_expr_node_ptr operand_node,
    2259             :                     a_type_ptr       new_type)
    2260             : /*
    2261             : Change an existing node into a cast of operand_node to new_type.
    2262             : operand_node (as well as the resulting node) are rvalues.
    2263             : */
    2264             : {
    2265             :   check_assertion(!operand_node->is_lvalue);
    2266             :   set_expr_node_kind(node, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_operation);

    2269             :   node->variant.operation.compiler_generated = TRUE;

    2271             : 
    2272             : 
    2273             : an_expr_node_ptr add_lowered_cast_if_necessary(an_expr_node_ptr node,
    2274             :                                                a_type_ptr       new_type)
    2275             : /*
    2276             : If the given node represents an expression of a type identical to new_type,
    2277             : return the node unchanged.  Otherwise, modify the node to add a cast on top
    2278             : of it and lower that cast.  A cast to bool type (in either C++ or C99
    2279             : mode) forces the value to be 0/1 even if it was already of bool type.
    2280             : */
    2281             : {
    2282             :   /* This doesn't currently handle C++ things like related-class casts. */
    2283             :   if (!is_bool_type(new_type)) {
    2284             :     if (!il_identical_types(node->type, new_type)) {
    2285             :         /* Normal cast. */
    2286             :       node = add_cast(node, new_type);
    2287             :       if (C_mode()) {
    2288             :         lower_c99_cast(node);
    2289             :       }  /* if */
    2290             :     }  /* if */
    2291             :   } else {
    2292             :     /* Cast to bool. */
    2293             :     node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_bool_cast,
    2294             :                               new_type, node);
    2295             :     lower_bool_cast(node);
    2296             :     if (!C_mode()) change_result_type_of_operator_returning_bool(node);
    2297             :   }  /* if */
    2298             :   return node;
    2299             : }  /* add_lowered_cast_if_necessary */
    2300             : 
    2301             : 
    2302             : an_expr_node_ptr add_cast_to_char_star(an_expr_node_ptr node)
    2303             : /*

    2308             :   return add_cast_if_necessary(node, char_star_type());

    2321             : static an_expr_node_ptr integral_promote_node(an_expr_node_ptr expr)

    2332             : 
    2333             : static an_expr_node_ptr integral_promote_pm_node(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2334             : /*
    2335             : Add a cast to do integral promotion on expr, which is a pointer-to-data-member
    2336             : node.  integral_promote_node can't be used because the source type is
    2337             : still pointer to member and therefore doesn't look promotable.
    2338             : */
    2339             : {
    2340             :   expr = add_cast(expr,
    2341             :                   type_after_integral_promotion(
    2342             :                               integer_type(targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind)));

    2344             : }  /* integral_promote_pm_node */
    2345             : 
    2346             : 
    2347             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_operands_for_ne_0(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2348             : /*
    2349             : The given operand must be compared against zero (or null).  Apply integral
    2350             : promotions to the expression if needed, append a zero of the proper type as
    2351             : the next operand, and return the resulting operand pair.  (The appended zero
    2352             : is not lowered -- but needs to be -- see lower_ne_0_normalization.)
    2353             : */
    2354             : {
    2355             :   a_constant_ptr  zero = local_constant();
    2356             : 
    2357             :   if (is_integral_type(expr->type)) {
    2358             :     /* Simulate the usual arithmetic conversions. */
    2359             :     expr = add_cast_if_necessary(expr,
    2360             :                                  node_type_after_integral_promotion(expr));
    2361             :   }  /* if */
    2362             :   /* get_underlying_type is needed here for the pointer-to-member case if the
    2363             :      type is already lowered. */
    2364             :   make_zero_of_proper_type(get_underlying_type(expr->type), zero);
    2365             :   expr->next = alloc_node_for_constant(zero);
    2366             :   /* Make sure the zero is properly lowered by marking it not visited. */
    2367             :   mark_as_not_visited(node_constant(expr->next));
    2368             :   release_local_constant(&zero);
    2369             :   return expr;
    2370             : }  /* make_operands_for_ne_0 */
    2371             : 
    2372             : 
    2373             : static void lower_ne_0_normalization(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
    2374             : /*
    2375             : The given operation is a "x != 0" operation generated for boolean normalization
    2376             : purposes (either to implement eok_bool_cast, or to normalize a boolean
    2377             : controlling expression).  The second operand is the unlowered zero; the first
    2378             : operand has been lowered already.  Lower the comparison if needed (e.g., if
    2379             : the first operand is a pointer-to-member value).
    2380             : */
    2381             : {
    2382             :   an_expr_node_ptr  zero_node;
    2383             : 
    2384             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) && node_operator_is(expr, eok_ne));
    2385             :   zero_node = expr->variant.operation.operands->next;
    2386             :   check_assertion(zero_node != NULL && is_constant_node(zero_node));
    2387             :   if (node_operator_type_kind_is(expr, tk_ptr_to_member)) {
    2388             :     /* For the pointer-to-member case, the comparison must be lowered. */
    2389             :     mark_as_not_visited(node_constant(zero_node));
    2390             :     /* Note that zero_node is not lowered; that allows the subroutine to
    2391             :        generate better code. */
    2392             :     lower_pm_comparison(expr, /*operand1_lowered=*/TRUE);
    2393             :   } else if (C_mode() || gpp_mode) {
    2394             :     /* Do additional lowering for the complex, imaginary, and fixed-point
    2395             :        cases. */
    2396             :     lower_c99_ne_0_if_needed(expr);
    2397             :   }  /* if */
    2398             : }  /* lower_ne_0_normalization */
    2399             : 
    2400             : 
    2401             : an_expr_node_ptr boolean_controlling_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2402             : /*
    2403             : If lowering_normalizes_boolean_controlling_expressions is TRUE and the given
    2404             : expression is not an operator producing a boolean value, return an expression
    2405             : node obtained by adding "!= 0" on top of the given node.  Also always perform
    2406             : this normalization if the expression produces a pointer-to-member value.
    2407             : Otherwise, return the given node.  This routine is intended for code generated
    2408             : by lowering (as opposed to that resulting from direct lowering of source code).
    2409             : */
    2410             : {
    2411             :   an_expr_node_ptr  result = expr;
    2412             : 
    2413             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
    2414             :   check_assertion(!is_complex_type(expr->type));
    2415             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
    2416             :   check_assertion(!is_class_struct_union_type(expr->type));
    2417             :   if ((lowering_normalizes_boolean_controlling_expressions &&
    2418             :        (!is_operation_node(expr) ||
    2419             :         !is_operator_returning_bool(expr->variant.operation.kind))) ||
    2420             :       is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(expr->type) ||
    2421             :       is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(expr->type)) {
    2422             :     result = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne,
    2423             :                                 integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
    2424             :                                 make_operands_for_ne_0(expr));
    2425             :     lower_ne_0_normalization(result);
    2426             :   } else {
    2427             :     /* This boolean controlling expression is not being normalized -- mark
    2428             :        it as such. */
    2429             :     expr->is_non_normalized_boolean_controlling_expr = TRUE;
    2430             :   }  /* if */
    2431             :   return result;
    2432             : }  /* boolean_controlling_expr */
    2433             : 
    2434             : #if DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING || ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
    2435             : 
    2436             : an_expr_node_ptr array_first_element_addr_expr(a_variable_ptr var)
    2437             : /*
    2438             : Create an rvalue pointer expression for the address of the first element of the
    2439             : array associated with the variable var, and return it.
    2440             : */
    2441             : {
    2442             :   an_expr_node_ptr node;
    2443             : 
    2444             :   node = var_lvalue_expr(var);
    2445             :   node = make_array_to_pointer_node(node);
    2446             :   return node;
    2447             : }  /* array_first_element_addr_expr */
    2448             : 
    2449             : #endif /* DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING || ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
    2450             : 
    2451             : static a_field_ptr field_at_offset_if_any(a_type_ptr    class_type,
    2452             :                                           a_targ_size_t byte_offset)
    2453             : /*
    2454             : Return a pointer to a field at the indicated byte offset of the indicated
    2455             : class type or NULL if there is no such field.
    2456             : */
    2457             : {
    2458             :   a_field_ptr field_ptr;
    2459             : 
    2460             : #if CHECKING
    2461             :   if (!is_immediate_class_type(class_type)) {
    2462             :     internal_error("field_at_offset_if_any: bad class type");
    2463             :   }  /* if */
    2464             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    2465             :   /* It may be necessary to come up with a faster way of doing this, such
    2466             :      as storing two field pointers in the base class entry and a pointer to
    2467             :      the virtual function table pointer field in the class type supplement. */
    2468             :   for (field_ptr = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    2469             :        field_ptr != NULL;
    2470             :        field_ptr = field_ptr->next) {
    2471             :     /* Don't pick a zero-length field as the answer.  The field
    2472             :        following it is probably what's wanted. */
    2473             :     if (field_ptr->offset == byte_offset &&
    2474             :         field_ptr->offset_bit_remainder == 0 &&
    2475             :         !field_has_zero_length(field_ptr)) break;
    2476             :   }  /* for */
    2477             :   return field_ptr;
    2478             : }  /* field_at_offset_if_any */
    2479             : 
    2480             : 
    2481             : static a_field_ptr field_at_offset(a_type_ptr    class_type,
    2482             :                                    a_targ_size_t byte_offset)
    2483             : /*
    2484             : Return a pointer to the field at the indicated byte offset of the indicated
    2485             : class type.  Such a field must exist.
    2486             : */
    2487             : {
    2488             :   a_field_ptr  result = field_at_offset_if_any(class_type, byte_offset);
    2489             : 
    2490             : #if CHECKING
    2491             :   if (result == NULL) {
    2492             : #if DEBUG
    2493             :     db_abbreviated_type(class_type);
    2494             :     fprintf(f_debug, ", byte offset = %lu\n", (unsigned long)byte_offset);
    2495             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    2496             :     internal_error("field_at_offset: field not found");
    2497             :   }  /* if */
    2498             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    2499             :   check_assertion(result != NULL);
    2500             :   return result;
    2501             : }  /* field_at_offset */
    2502             : 
    2503             : 
    2504             : an_expr_node_ptr make_class_lvalue_from_var(a_variable_ptr var)
    2505             : /*
    2506             : This utility function is used to create a class lvalue expression for
    2507             : the variable var (a pointer to a class variable).
    2508             : */
    2509             : {
    2510             :   an_expr_node_ptr node;
    2511             : 
    2512             :   check_assertion(is_pointer_type(var->type));
    2513             :   node = add_indirection_to_node(var_rvalue_expr(var));
    2514             :   check_assertion(is_class_struct_union_type(node->type) && node->is_lvalue);
    2515             :   return node;
    2516             : }  /* make_class_lvalue_from_var */
    2517             : 
    2518             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_vptr_field_rvalue(an_expr_node_ptr node);
    2519             : 
    2520             : #if IA64_ABI
    2521             : 
    2522             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_vtbl_entry_expr(an_expr_node_ptr      node,
    2523             :                                              a_virtual_table_index idx)
    2524             : /*
    2525             : Make an expression for the value stored in the virtual table of the object
    2526             : pointed to by node (a class lvalue), at the position given by idx.
    2527             : idx is counted in virtual table entries.  The result is an rvalue
    2528             : of the type specified by TARG_IA64_VTABLE_ENTRY_INT_KIND (typically ptrdiff_t).
    2529             : */
    2530             : {
    2531             :   an_expr_node_ptr  vtbl_expr, index_expr, entry_expr;
    2532             : #if CHECKING
    2533             :   a_type_ptr        node_type = skip_typerefs(node->type);
    2534             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    2535             : 
    2536             :   check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(node_type) && node->is_lvalue);
    2537             :   /* Create an rvalue expression for the node's virtual table. */
    2538             :   vtbl_expr = make_vptr_field_rvalue(node);
    2539             :   /* Build a constant containing the index into node's virtual table,
    2540             :      counted in virtual table entries. */
    2541             :   index_expr = node_for_integer_constant((long)idx, targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
    2542             :   vtbl_expr->next = index_expr;
    2543             :   /* Index into the virtual table. */
    2544             :   entry_expr = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subscript,
    2545             :                                   make_vtbl_entry_type(), vtbl_expr);
    2546             :   return entry_expr;
    2547             : } /* make_vtbl_entry_expr */
    2548             : 
    2549             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    2550             : 
    2551             : an_expr_node_ptr make_vbptr_field_lvalue(an_expr_node_ptr node,
    2552             :                                          a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    2553             : /*
    2554             : Make an lvalue for the virtual base class pointer field for the base
    2555             : class indicated by bcp of the class lvalue specified by node.
    2556             : The class object is not known to be a complete object (but we couldn't do
    2557             : any better if we did know it was a complete object).
    2558             : */
    2559             : {
    2560             :   a_type_ptr       class_type, pointer_class_type;
    2561             :   a_base_class_ptr pointer_bcp;
    2562             :   a_targ_size_t    pointer_offset;
    2563             : 
    2564             :   check_assertion(node->is_lvalue);
    2565             :   class_type = node->type;
    2566             :   class_type = skip_typerefs(class_type);
    2567             : #if CHECKING
    2568             :   if (!is_immediate_class_type(class_type)) {
    2569             :     internal_error("make_vbptr_field_lvalue: not class type");
    2570             :   }  /* if */
    2571             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    2572             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    2573             :   pointer_class_type = class_type;
    2574             :   pointer_offset = bcp->pointer_offset;
    2575             :   pointer_bcp = bcp->pointer_base_class;
    2576             :   if (pointer_bcp != NULL) {
    2577             :     /* The pointer to the virtual base class is allocated in a base class.
    2578             :        Cast down to the proper base class. */
    2579             :     check_assertion(!any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(pointer_bcp));
    2580             :     node = make_base_class_lvalue(node, pointer_bcp,
    2581             :                                   /*complete_object=*/FALSE);
    2582             :     /* The following line does not use pointer_bcp->type because the type here
    2583             :        could be either that type or the corresponding type-as-subobject. */
    2584             :     pointer_class_type = f_skip_typerefs(node->type);
    2585             :     pointer_offset -= pointer_bcp->offset;
    2586             :   }  /* if */
    2587             :   /* Generate the field selection in the original class or the base class
    2588             :      we got to. */
    2589             :   node = field_lvalue_selection_expr(node,
    2590             :                                      field_at_offset(pointer_class_type,
    2591             :                                                      pointer_offset));
    2592             :   return node;
    2593             : }  /* make_vbptr_field_lvalue */
    2594             : 
    2595             : 
    2596             : an_expr_node_ptr make_vbptr_field_lvalue_from_var(a_variable_ptr   var,
    2597             :                                                   a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    2598             : /*
    2599             : Make an lvalue for the virtual base class pointer field for the base class
    2600             : indicated by bcp of the object pointed to by var.
    2601             : */
    2602             : {
    2603             :   an_expr_node_ptr node = make_class_lvalue_from_var(var);
    2604             : 
    2605             :   node = make_vbptr_field_lvalue(node, bcp);
    2606             :   return node;
    2607             : }  /* make_vbptr_field_lvalue_from_var */
    2608             : 
    2609             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    2610             : 
    2611             : an_expr_node_ptr make_vptr_field_lvalue(an_expr_node_ptr node)
    2612             : /*
    2613             : Make an lvalue for the virtual table pointer of the class lvalue
    2614             : specified by node.  The class object is not known to be a complete object
    2615             : (but we couldn't do any better if we did know it was a complete object).
    2616             : */
    2617             : {
    2618             :   a_type_ptr class_type, vptr_class_type;
    2619             : 
    2620             :   check_assertion(node->is_lvalue);
    2621             :   class_type = node->type;
    2622             :   class_type = skip_typerefs(class_type);
    2623             : #if CHECKING
    2624             :   if (!is_immediate_class_type(class_type)) {
    2625             :     internal_error("make_vptr_field_lvalue: not class type");
    2626             :   }  /* if */
    2627             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    2628             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    2629             :   vptr_class_type = class_type;
    2630             : #if !IA64_ABI
    2631             :   /* Cfront-like ABI. */
    2632             :   check_assertion_str(needs_virtual_function_table(class_type),
    2633             :                      "make_vptr_field_lvalue: class is not dynamic");
    2634             :   { 
    2635             :     a_class_type_supplement_ptr
    2636             :                      ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    2637             :     a_targ_size_t    vptr_offset = ctsp->virtual_function_info_offset;
    2638             :     a_base_class_ptr vptr_bcp = ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class;
    2639             :     if (vptr_bcp != NULL) {
    2640             :       /* The pointer to the virtual function table is allocated in a base
    2641             :          class.  Cast down to the proper base class. */
    2642             :       check_assertion(!any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(vptr_bcp));
    2643             :       node = make_base_class_lvalue(node, vptr_bcp, /*complete_object=*/FALSE);
    2644             :       /* The following line does not use vptr_bcp->type because the type here
    2645             :          could be either that type or the corresponding type-as-subobject. */
    2646             :       vptr_class_type = f_skip_typerefs(node->type);
    2647             :       vptr_offset -= vptr_bcp->offset;
    2648             :     }  /* if */
    2649             :     /* Generate the field selection in the original class or the base class
    2650             :        we got to. */
    2651             :     node = field_lvalue_selection_expr(node,
    2652             :                                        field_at_offset(vptr_class_type,
    2653             :                                                        vptr_offset));
    2654             :   }
    2655             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    2656             :   /* IA-64 ABI. */
    2657             :   check_assertion_str(needs_virtual_function_table(class_type) ||
    2658             :                       class_type->variant.class_struct_union.
    2659             :                                any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes,
    2660             :                      "make_vptr_field_lvalue: class is not dynamic");
    2661             :   {
    2662             :     a_field_ptr field;
    2663             : 
    2664             :     /* The virtual table pointer resides at offset zero in the object.
    2665             :        Work down through the first fields of classes, selecting each
    2666             :        one as we go. */
    2667             :     for (;;) {
    2668             :       field = field_at_offset(vptr_class_type, (a_targ_size_t)0);
    2669             :       node = field_lvalue_selection_expr(node, field);
    2670             :       /* Stop when we've done the field selection for the virtual function
    2671             :          table pointer. */
    2672             :       if (!is_class_struct_union_type(field->type)) break;
    2673             :       vptr_class_type = field->type;
    2674             :     }  /* for */
    2675             : #if CHECKING
    2676             :     { a_type_ptr  ptvt = pointer_to_vtbl_type();
    2677             :       if (field->type != ptvt) {
    2678             :         unexpected_condition();
    2679             :       }  /* if */
    2680             :     }
    2681             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    2682             :   }
    2683             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    2684             :   return node;
    2685             : }  /* make_vptr_field_lvalue */
    2686             : 
    2687             : 
    2688             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_vptr_field_rvalue(an_expr_node_ptr node)
    2689             : /*
    2690             : Make an rvalue for the virtual table pointer of the class lvalue
    2691             : specified by node.  The class object is not known to be a complete object
    2692             : (but we couldn't do any better if we did know it was a complete object).
    2693             : */
    2694             : {
    2695             :   node = make_vptr_field_lvalue(node);
    2696             :   node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(node);
    2697             :   return node;
    2698             : }  /* make_vptr_field_rvalue */
    2699             : 
    2700             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    2701             : 
    2702             : #if IA64_ABI
    2703             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <--- other_expr is not used in that case. */
    2704             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    2705             : an_expr_node_ptr make_any_vptr_rvalue(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    2706             :                                       an_expr_node_ptr *other_expr)
    2707             : /*
    2708             : Make an (rvalue) expression tree for the value of the virtual function
    2709             : table pointer from the class object whose address is given by the
    2710             : (rvalue) expression expr.  If the class does not itself have a virtual
    2711             : function table pointer, use the pointer from any base class.  This is
    2712             : used for typeid and dynamic_cast, to get a virtual function table from
    2713             : which information on the type of the complete object can be extracted.
    2714             : Since all base class virtual function tables will indicate the same
    2715             : complete object type, it doesn't matter which is selected.  If other_expr
    2716             : is non-NULL, it points to another copy of expr (e.g., via make_reusable_copy),
    2717             : and casts are added to that copy to make it point to the base class whose
    2718             : virtual function table pointer address is returned; *other_expr is set to
    2719             : point to the updated expression.
    2720             : */
    2721             : {
    2722             : #if !IA64_ABI
    2723             :   a_type_ptr class_type;
    2724             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    2725             : 
    2726             :   /* Get class lvalue from rvalue object pointer. */
    2727             :   expr = add_indirection_to_node(expr);
    2728             : #if IA64_ABI
    2729             :   /* For the IA-64 ABI, every object with a virtual function pointer
    2730             :      has it at offset zero, so we don't need to find a base class. */
    2731             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    2732             :   class_type = f_skip_typerefs(expr->type);
    2733             :   check_assertion_str(is_immediate_class_type(class_type),
    2734             :                       "make_any_vptr_rvalue: not class");
    2735             :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_functions) {
    2736             :     /* The class has virtual functions and therefore has a virtual function
    2737             :        table pointer (possibly shared with a base class). */
    2738             :   } else {
    2739             :     /* The class has no virtual functions.  Look for a virtual function table
    2740             :        in any base class. */
    2741             :     a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    2742             :     for (bcp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->base_classes;
    2743             :          bcp != NULL;
    2744             :          bcp = bcp->next) {
    2745             :       a_type_ptr base_class = bcp->type;
    2746             :       if (base_class->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_functions) {
    2747             :         /* Cast down to the base class. */
    2748             :         expr = make_base_class_lvalue(expr, bcp, /*complete_object=*/FALSE);
    2749             :         if (other_expr != NULL) {
    2750             :           /* Do the same thing to *other_expr. */
    2751             :           *other_expr = add_indirection_to_node(*other_expr);
    2752             :           *other_expr = make_base_class_lvalue(*other_expr, bcp,
    2753             :                                                /*complete_object=*/FALSE);
    2754             :           *other_expr = add_address_of_to_node(*other_expr);
    2755             :         }  /* if */
    2756             :         goto found_base_class;
    2757             :       }  /* if */
    2758             :     }  /* for */
    2759             :     unexpected_condition_str(
    2760             :                     "make_any_vptr_rvalue: no base class with virtuals found");
    2761             : found_base_class:;
    2762             :   }  /* if */
    2763             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    2764             :   /* Pick the virtual function pointer out of the class. */
    2765             :   expr = make_vptr_field_rvalue(expr);
    2766             :   return expr;
    2767             : }  /* make_any_vptr_rvalue */
    2768             : 
    2769             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    2770             : 
    2771             : static void change_xvalue_node_to_lvalue(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2772             : /*
    2773             : If expr is an xvalue node, change it to an lvalue node.  That's the
    2774             : standard "lowering" for such nodes.
    2775             : */
    2776             : {
    2777             :   if (expr->is_xvalue) {
    2778             :     /* Xvalues get lowered to lvalues. */
    2779             :     expr->is_xvalue = FALSE;
    2780             :     expr->is_lvalue = TRUE;
    2781             :   }  /* if */
    2782             : }  /* change_xvalue_node_to_lvalue */
    2783             : 
    2784             : 
    2785             : an_expr_node_ptr rvalue_pointer_for_class_rvalue(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2786             : /*
    2787             : Return an rvalue pointer expression for the rvalue class expression, expr.
    2788             : Try to convert the rvalue expression into an rvalue pointer if possible;
    2789             : otherwise, copy the expression into a temporary and take its address.
    2790             : Generally speaking, expr should be an unlowered expression; this allows
    2791             : any base class casts (if they exist) to be properly identified and a
    2792             : temporary variable (if one is needed) to have the proper (derived) type.
    2793             : This routine can be used on lowered expressions if the expression is known
    2794             : not to contain any top level base class casts.
    2795             : */
    2796             : {
    2797             :   a_boolean  converted;
    2798             :   a_type_ptr cast_type = NULL;
    2799             : 
    2800             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue && is_class_struct_union_type(expr->type));
    2801             :   conv_prvalue_expr_to_object_pointer(&expr, &converted);
    2802             :   if (!converted) {
    2803             :     /* Couldn't extract a pointer from the rvalue.  Copy the class rvalue to a
    2804             :        temporary and return an expression for a pointer to the temporary. */
    2805             :     an_expr_node_ptr node, top_cast = NULL, bottom_cast = NULL;
    2806             :     a_variable_ptr   temp;
    2807             :     if (is_operation_node(expr) &&
    2808             :         node_operator_is(expr, eok_class_rvalue_adjust)) {
    2809             :       /* If we're also adjusting the cv-qualifiers, do that here (by removing
    2810             :          this operation and adding a cast to the appropriate type at the end)
    2811             :          so we don't use two temporaries (on a subsequent invocation of
    2812             :          this routine). */
    2813             :       cast_type = make_pointer_type(expr->type);
    2814             :       expr = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    2815             :     }  /* if */
    2816             :     /* Remove any class rvalue base class casts so that we make the
    2817             :        temporary for the derived class and don't slice.  The casts will
    2818             :        be reattached to the new expression below. */
    2819             :     /* This test (for base class casts) only works on unlowered IL. */
    2820             :     expr = strip_rvalue_base_class_casts(expr, &top_cast, &bottom_cast);
    2821             :     if (is_constant_node(expr) &&
    2822             :         check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant(node_constant(expr), &temp)) {
    2823             :       /* ck_aggregate constants can appear in cases where a constexpr
    2824             :          constructor or function returns a class value, as well as other
    2825             :          cases.  Return the temporary that has been created for this
    2826             :          constant.  orig_lvalue_type is not set in this case (the expression
    2827             :          is known to be an rvalue). */
    2828             :       expr = var_addr_expr(temp);
    2829             :     } else {
    2830             :       temp = assign_expr_to_temp(expr);
    2831             :       expr = make_comma_node(expr, var_addr_expr(temp));
    2832             :     }  /* if */
    2833             :     if (top_cast != NULL) {
    2834             :       /* Restore the base class casts on top of the initialization of the
    2835             :          temporary. */
    2836             :       check_assertion(bottom_cast != NULL && is_operation_node(bottom_cast));
    2837             :       bottom_cast->variant.operation.operands = expr;
    2838             :       node = top_cast;
    2839             :       /* Change class types to pointer to class types on casts. */
    2840             :       for (;;) {
    2841             :         check_assertion(is_operation_node(node) &&
    2842             :                         node_operator_is(node, eok_base_class_cast));
    2843             :         node->type = make_pointer_type(node->type);
    2844             :         if (node == bottom_cast) break;
    2845             :         node = node->variant.operation.operands;
    2846             :         check_assertion(node != NULL);
    2847             :       }  /* for */
    2848             :       expr = top_cast;
    2849             :     }  /* if */
    2850             :     if (cast_type != NULL) {
    2851             :       expr = add_cast(expr, cast_type);
    2852             :     }  /* if */
    2853             :   }  /* if */
    2854             :   return expr;
    2855             : }  /* rvalue_pointer_for_class_rvalue */
    2856             : 
    2857             : 
    2858             : an_expr_node_ptr rvalue_pointer_for_class_expression(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2859             : /*
    2860             : Return an rvalue pointer expression for the class expression expr.
    2861             : expr is either an rvalue class pointer (in which case no conversion
    2862             : is necessary), or a class rvalue, or a class lvalue.  In the latter two cases
    2863             : convert the expression into an rvalue pointer and return the converted
    2864             : expression.  Generally speaking, expr should be an unlowered expression; this
    2865             : allows any base class casts (if they exist) to be properly identified and a
    2866             : temporary variable (if one is needed) to have the proper (derived) type.  This
    2867             : routine can be used on lowered expressions if the expression is known not to
    2868             : contain any top level base class casts.
    2869             : */
    2870             : {
    2871             :   if (is_glvalue_node(expr)) {
    2872             :     /* Class lvalue or xvalue. */
    2873             :     change_xvalue_node_to_lvalue(expr);
    2874             :     expr = add_address_of_to_node(expr);
    2875             :   } else if (!is_pointer_type(expr->type)) {
    2876             :     /* Class rvalue. */
    2877             :     expr = rvalue_pointer_for_class_rvalue(expr);
    2878             :   } else {
    2879             :     /* Rvalue pointer.  No change is necessary. */
    2880             :   }  /* if */
    2881             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue &&
    2882             :                   is_pointer_type(expr->type) &&
    2883             :                   is_class_struct_union_type(type_pointed_to(expr->type)));
    2884             :   return expr;
    2885             : }  /* rvalue_pointer_for_class_expression */
    2886             : 
    2887             : 
    2888             : static an_expr_node_ptr convert_rvalue_pointer_to_original_form(
    2889             :                                                     an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    2890             :                                                     an_expr_node_ptr orig_expr)
    2891             : /*
    2892             : Convert the rvalue pointer expression expr into the same form of expression
    2893             : as orig_expr; i.e., into a class rvalue or class lvalue if necessary.
    2894             : Return the converted expression.  This routine basically does the reverse
    2895             : of the conversion that is performed in rvalue_pointer_for_class_expression.
    2896             : */
    2897             : {
    2898             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue && is_pointer_type(expr->type));
    2899             :   if (orig_expr->is_lvalue) {
    2900             :     /* Class lvalue. */
    2901             :     expr = add_indirection_to_node(expr);
    2902             :   } else if (!is_pointer_type(orig_expr->type)) {
    2903             :     /* Class rvalue. */
    2904             :     expr = add_indirection_to_node(expr);
    2905             :     expr = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(expr);
    2906             :   } else {
    2907             :     /* Rvalue pointer.  No change is necessary. */
    2908             :   }  /* if */
    2909             :   check_assertion(expr->is_lvalue == orig_expr->is_lvalue &&
    2910             :                   is_pointer_type(expr->type) ==
    2911             :                                              is_pointer_type(orig_expr->type));
    2912             :   return expr;
    2913             : }  /* convert_rvalue_pointer_to_original_form */
    2914             : 
    2915             : 
    2916             : static void lower_class_selector_operand_if_any(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    2917             : /*
    2918             : This routine is called to examine the specified operation and determine if
    2919             : any of its operands are a class selector that is a class lvalue or rvalue
    2920             : rather than a pointer to class; if so, the operand is rewritten as a pointer
    2921             : to class.  On input, the expression must be unlowered (and remains so).
    2922             : */
    2923             : {
    2924             :   an_expr_node_ptr      node = NULL;
    2925             :   an_expr_operator_kind op;
    2926             : 
    2927             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
    2928             :   op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
    2929             :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_pm_field ||
    2930             :       op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_pm_func_ptr) {
    2931             :     /* First operand is a class selector. */
    2932             :     node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    2933             :   } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_member_call ||
    2934             :              op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_pm_call) {
    2935             :     /* Second operand is a class selector. */
    2936             :     node = expr->variant.operation.operands->next;
    2937             :   }  /* if */
    2938             :   if (node != NULL) {
    2939             :     overwrite_node(node, rvalue_pointer_for_class_expression(copy_node(node)));
    2940             :   }  /* if */
    2941             : }  /* lower_class_selector_operand_if_any */
    2942             : 
    2943             : 
    2944             : static an_expr_node_ptr select_lvalue_at_offset(an_expr_node_ptr  node,
    2945             :                                                 a_type_ptr        class_type,
    2946             :                                                 a_targ_size_t     offset,
    2947             :                                                 a_type_ptr        type)
    2948             : /*
    2949             : Make an expression node that is an lvalue for an entity at the given offset
    2950             : in the object of type class_type specified by node (an lvalue).  The entity
    2951             : should have the given type.  (class_type may differ from node->type in that
    2952             : it may be the corresponding "type as a subobject.")  Return a pointer to the
    2953             : new node.
    2954             : */
    2955             : {
    2956             :   a_field_ptr  field;
    2957             : 
    2958             :   check_assertion(node->is_lvalue);
    2959             :   /* If the given offset corresponds to a field we can use that field to form
    2960             :      the lvalue (the usual case).  Otherwise (e.g., for optimized empty base
    2961             :      classes), we use pointer arithmetic. */
    2962             :   field = field_at_offset_if_any(class_type, offset);
    2963             :   if (field == NULL || field->is_bit_field) {
    2964             :     /* No appropriate field; use some pointer arithmetic instead. */
    2965             :     if (offset != 0) {
    2966             :       node = add_address_of_to_node(node);
    2967             :       node = add_cast_to_char_star(node);
    2968             :       node->next = node_for_integer_constant((long)offset,
    2969             :                                              targ_size_t_int_kind);
    2970             :       node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
    2971             :                                 char_star_type(), node);
    2972             :       node = add_indirection_to_node(node);
    2973             :     }  /* if */
    2974             :     node = add_cast_to_glvalue_if_necessary(node, type);
    2975             :   } else {
