    2976             :     if (offset == 0 && !il_identical_types(type, field->type)) {
    2977             :       /* No need for a field selection for offset zero (a cast is being
    2978             :          added below anyway). */
    2979             :     } else {
    2980             :       /* Create a field selection operation and add the appropriate cast
    2981             :          if needed. */
    2982             :       node = field_lvalue_selection_expr(node, field);
    2983             :     }  /* if */
    2984             :     if (type != field->type) {
    2985             :       /* Presumably this is an optimized empty base class: it has no
    2986             :          associated field and instead we use the field whose offset it
    2987             :          shares. */
    2988             :       node = add_cast_to_glvalue_if_necessary(node, type);
    2989             :     }  /* if */
    2990             :   }  /* if */
    2991             :   return node;
    2992             : }  /* select_lvalue_at_offset */
    2993             : 
    2994             : 
    2995             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_vbase_class_lvalue(
    2996             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr node,
    2997             :                                               a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    2998             :                                               a_boolean        complete_object)
    2999             : /*
    3000             : Make an expression node that is an lvalue for the virtual base class bcp
    3001             : of the class specified by node (an lvalue).  The class object is known to
    3002             : be a complete object if complete_object is TRUE.  Return a pointer to the
    3003             : new node.
    3004             : */
    3005             : {
    3006             :   a_type_ptr       class_type, data_section_class_type;
    3007             :   a_targ_size_t    data_section_offset;
    3008             : #if IA64_ABI
    3009             :   an_expr_node_ptr second_use, temp_init_node, vbase_offset;
    3010             :   a_boolean        temp_init_used;
    3011             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    3012             : 
    3013             :   check_assertion(node->is_lvalue);
    3014             :   class_type = node->type;
    3015             :   class_type = skip_typerefs(class_type);
    3016             : #if CHECKING
    3017             :   if (!is_immediate_class_type(class_type)) {
    3018             :     internal_error("make_vbase_class_lvalue: not class type");
    3019             :   }  /* if */
    3020             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3021             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    3022             :   if (complete_object) {
    3023             :     /* We have a complete object, so we know exactly where the virtual
    3024             :        base class is (we don't have to go indirect through a pointer). */
    3025             :     data_section_class_type = class_type;
    3026             :     data_section_offset = bcp->offset;
    3027             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    3028             :     { a_base_class_ptr data_section_bcp = bcp->data_section_base_class;
    3029             :       if (data_section_bcp != NULL) {
    3030             :         /* The virtual base class is allocated in a base class.  Get an 
    3031             :            lvalue for the proper base class. */
    3032             :         node = make_base_class_lvalue(node, data_section_bcp,
    3033             :                                       /*complete_object=*/TRUE);
    3034             :         /* The following line does not use data_section_bcp->type because the
    3035             :            type here could be either that type or the corresponding
    3036             :            type-as-subobject. */
    3037             :         data_section_class_type = f_skip_typerefs(node->type);
    3038             :         data_section_offset -= data_section_bcp->offset;
    3039             :       }  /* if */
    3040             :     }
    3041             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    3042             :     /* Select the data section for the virtual base class. */
    3043             :     node = select_lvalue_at_offset(node, data_section_class_type,
    3044             :                                    data_section_offset, bcp->type);
    3045             :   } else {
    3046             :     /* We do not know whether or not we have a complete object, so we must
    3047             :        go indirect through a pointer to get to the virtual base class. */
    3048             : #if !IA64_ABI
    3049             :     /* Cfront-like ABI. */
    3050             :     node = make_vbptr_field_lvalue(node, bcp);
    3051             :     node = add_indirection_to_node(rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(node));
    3052             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    3053             :     /* IA-64 ABI. */
    3054             :     temp_init_node = NULL;
    3055             :     /* Get the offset to the virtual base out of the virtual table. */
    3056             :     second_use = make_reusable_copy_full(node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE,
    3057             :                                          &temp_init_used,
    3058             :                                          /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE);
    3059             :     if (temp_init_used) {
    3060             :       /* The node expression is complex and a temporary was used.
    3061             :          We will have to use a comma expression to ensure that the
    3062             :          temporary is set before the use in the "+". */
    3063             :       temp_init_node = node;
    3064             :       node = make_reusable_copy(node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
    3065             :     }  /* if */
    3066             :     vbase_offset = make_vtbl_entry_expr(second_use,
    3067             :                                         bcp->vbase_offset_index);
    3068             :     node = add_address_of_to_node(node);
    3069             :     /* The vbase offset is stored in bytes.  Cast node to a "char*" so
    3070             :        that pointer arithmetic is performed in bytes. */
    3071             :     node = add_cast_to_char_star(node);
    3072             :     /* The vbase offset is the offset from the start of node to the
    3073             :        start of the base class. */
    3074             :     node->next = vbase_offset;
    3075             :     node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
    3076             :                               node->type, node);
    3077             :     /* Cast back to the desired pointer type. */
    3078             :     node = add_cast(node, make_pointer_type(bcp->type));
    3079             :     if (temp_init_node != NULL) {
    3080             :       /* Add the comma expression to initialize the temporary. */
    3081             :       node = make_comma_node(temp_init_node, node);
    3082             :     }  /* if */
    3083             :     /* Convert back to lvalue. */
    3084             :     node = add_indirection_to_node(node);
    3085             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    3086             :   }  /* if */
    3087             :   return node;
    3088             : }  /* make_vbase_class_lvalue */
    3089             : 
    3090             : #if !IA64_ABI
    3091             : 
    3092             : an_expr_node_ptr make_vbase_class_lvalue_from_var(
    3093             :                                               a_variable_ptr   var,
    3094             :                                               a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    3095             :                                               a_boolean        complete_object)
    3096             : /*
    3097             : Make an expression node that is an lvalue for the base class bcp of the
    3098             : variable referred to by var (a pointer to a class object).  The class object is
    3099             : known to be a complete object if complete_object is TRUE.  Return a pointer to
    3100             : the new node.
    3101             : */
    3102             : {
    3103             :   an_expr_node_ptr node = make_class_lvalue_from_var(var);
    3104             : 
    3105             :   node = make_vbase_class_lvalue(node, bcp, complete_object);
    3106             :   return node;
    3107             : }  /* make_vbase_class_lvalue_from_var */
    3108             : 
    3109             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    3110             : 
    3111             : an_expr_node_ptr make_base_class_lvalue(an_expr_node_ptr node,
    3112             :                                         a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    3113             :                                         a_boolean        complete_object)
    3114             : /*
    3115             : Make an expression node that is an lvalue for the base class bcp of the
    3116             : class object specified by the lvalue node.  bcp may be a direct or indirect
    3117             : base class, and its derivation may include virtual steps.  The class object
    3118             : is known to be a complete object if complete_object is TRUE.  Return a
    3119             : pointer to the new node.
    3120             : */
    3121             : {
    3122             :   a_type_ptr            class_type, step_class_type, node_class_type;
    3123             :   a_derivation_step_ptr dsp;
    3124             :   a_base_class_ptr      derivation_bcp, step_bcp;
    3125             : 
    3126             :   check_assertion(node->is_lvalue);
    3127             :   class_type = node->type;
    3128             :   class_type = skip_typerefs(class_type);
    3129             : #if CHECKING
    3130             :   if (!is_immediate_class_type(class_type)) {
    3131             :     internal_error("make_base_class_lvalue: not class type");
    3132             :   }  /* if */
    3133             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3134             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    3135             :   if (bcp->is_virtual) {
    3136             :     /* The base class is a virtual base class.  Generate the code
    3137             :        to get to it. */
    3138             :     node = make_vbase_class_lvalue(node, bcp, complete_object);
    3139             :   } else {
    3140             :     /* The base class is not a virtual base class (so it has only one
    3141             :        derivation). */
    3142             :     step_class_type = class_type;
    3143             :     dsp = bcp->derivation->path;
    3144             :     /* See if there are any virtual steps in the derivation of the base class.
    3145             :        If so, the first step is to a virtual base class (the front end
    3146             :        standardizes the derivation steps up to the last virtual step into
    3147             :        an initial "leap" to the virtual base class). */
    3148             :     step_bcp = dsp->base_class;
    3149             :     if (step_bcp->is_virtual) {
    3150             :       /* Generate code for the hop to the virtual base class. */
    3151             :       node = make_vbase_class_lvalue(node, step_bcp, complete_object);
    3152             :       step_class_type = step_bcp->type;
    3153             :       /* The non-virtual steps start after the virtual step. */
    3154             :       dsp = dsp->next;
    3155             :     }  /* if */
    3156             :     /* Now any initial virtual hop has been done.  dsp indicates the
    3157             :        remaining derivation steps.  step_class_type is the unqualified
    3158             :        class type we've gotten to so far. */
    3159             :     /* Put out a field selection for each step in the derivation. */
    3160             :     /* Two class type variables are needed because the fields for the base
    3161             :        classes may have the type of the base class as a subobject or the type
    3162             :        of the base class itself (that's what node_class_type will contain)
    3163             :        and the base class entries have the type of the base class itself
    3164             :        (that's what step_class_type will contain). */
    3165             :     for (; dsp != NULL; dsp = dsp->next) {
    3166             :       /* The base class entry pointed to by dsp->base_class is the base
    3167             :          class entry relative to the original class type.  Find the base
    3168             :          class entry for this step relative to the intermediate class we
    3169             :          have gotten to. */
    3170             :       step_bcp = derivation_bcp = dsp->base_class;
    3171             :       /* For the first step the information is already correct. */
    3172             :       if (dsp != bcp->derivation->path) {
    3173             :         step_bcp = find_direct_base_class_of(step_class_type, step_bcp->type);
    3174             :         check_assertion(step_bcp != NULL);
    3175             :       }  /* if */
    3176             :       node_class_type = node->type;
    3177             :       node_class_type = skip_typerefs(node_class_type);
    3178             : #if CHECKING
    3179             :       if (node_class_type != step_class_type &&
    3180             :           node_class_type != subobject_for_class(step_class_type)) {
    3181             :         internal_error("make_base_class_lvalue: node has wrong type");
    3182             :       }  /* if */
    3183             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3184             :       node = select_lvalue_at_offset(node, node_class_type,
    3185             :                                      step_bcp->offset, step_bcp->type);
    3186             :       step_class_type = derivation_bcp->type;
    3187             :     }  /* for */
    3188             :   }  /* if */
    3189             :   return node;
    3190             : }  /* make_base_class_lvalue */
    3191             : 
    3192             : 
    3193             : an_expr_node_ptr make_base_class_lvalue_from_var(
    3194             :                                               a_variable_ptr   var,
    3195             :                                               a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    3196             :                                               a_boolean        complete_object)
    3197             : /*
    3198             : Make an expression node that is an lvalue for the base class bcp of the
    3199             : class pointed to by var.  The class object is known to be a complete
    3200             : object if complete_object is TRUE.  Return a pointer to the node.
    3201             : */
    3202             : {
    3203             :   an_expr_node_ptr node = make_class_lvalue_from_var(var);
    3204             : 
    3205             :   node = make_base_class_lvalue(node, bcp, complete_object);
    3206             :   return node;
    3207             : }  /* make_base_class_lvalue_from_var */
    3208             : 
    3209             : 
    3210             : static a_boolean is_assignment_to_temp(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    3211             :                                        a_variable_ptr   *temp_var)
    3212             : /*
    3213             : If the expression expr is an assignment to a temporary, set *temp_var
    3214             : pointing to the temporary variable and return TRUE.  Otherwise, return
    3215             : FALSE and *temp_var set to NULL.
    3216             : */
    3217             : {
    3218             :   a_boolean is_assign_to_temp = FALSE;
    3219             : 
    3220             :   *temp_var = NULL;
    3221             :   if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
    3222             :     an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
    3223             :     if (is_simple_assignment(op)) {
    3224             :       /* The expression is an assignment */
    3225             :       an_expr_node_ptr operand1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    3226             :       if (is_variable_node(operand1) &&
    3227             :           node_variable(operand1)->source_corresp.name == NULL) {
    3228             :         check_assertion(operand1->is_lvalue);
    3229             :         /* The destination is a temporary. */
    3230             :         is_assign_to_temp = TRUE;
    3231             :         *temp_var = node_variable(operand1);
    3232             :       }  /* if */
    3233             :     }  /* if */
    3234             :   }  /* if */
    3235             :   return is_assign_to_temp;
    3236             : }  /* is_assignment_to_temp */
    3237             : 
    3238             : 
    3239             : a_variable_ptr assign_expr_to_temp(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    3240             : /*
    3241             : Change the indicated rvalue expression into an assignment of the expression
    3242             : to a temporary, and return a pointer to the temporary.
    3243             : */
    3244             : {
    3245             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy, temp_node;
    3246             :   a_variable_ptr   temp;
    3247             :   a_type_ptr       temp_type;
    3248             : #if CHECKING
    3249             :   a_type_ptr       base_temp_type;
    3250             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3251             : 
    3252             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
    3253             :   temp_type = expr->type;
    3254             : #if CHECKING
    3255             :   /* Values of class types that have nontrivial copy or move constructors can't
    3256             :      be copied this way.  If such things did come up, they would probably come
    3257             :      up as enk_temp_init nodes, and one could change to the address of the
    3258             :      class temporary and store that in the temporary here.  Some versions of
    3259             :      GCC, however, have a bug in this area for classes that have a trivial copy
    3260             :      constructor but a nontrivial move constructor (with the IA-64 ABI; see
    3261             :      set_routine_calling_method_flag). */
    3262             :   base_temp_type = skip_typerefs(temp_type);
    3263             :   if (is_immediate_class_type(base_temp_type) &&
    3264             : #if IA64_ABI
    3265             :       !(gpp_mode && emulate_gnu_abi_bugs && gnu_abi_version < 40600) &&
    3266             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    3267             :       /* Watch out for types created by IL lowering. */
    3268             :       symbol_for(base_temp_type) != NULL) {
    3269             :     if (!class_symbol_supp(symbol_for(base_temp_type))->
    3270             :                                        construction_by_bitwise_copy_allowed) {
    3271             :       internal_error("assign_expr_to_temp: temp of class type with cctor");
    3272             :     }  /* if */
    3273             :   }  /* if */
    3274             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3275             :   temp = make_lowered_temporary(temp_type);
    3276             :   if (is_const_qualified_type(temp_type)) {
    3277             :     temp->initialization_rewritten_as_assignment = TRUE;
    3278             :   }  /* if */
    3279             :   temp_node = var_lvalue_expr(temp);
    3280             :   expr_copy = copy_node(expr);
    3281             :   temp_node->next = expr_copy;
    3282             :   set_expr_node_kind(expr, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_operation);
    3283             :   set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
    3284             :                     temp_type, /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE, temp_node);
    3285             :   return temp;
    3286             : }  /* assign_expr_to_temp */
    3287             : 
    3288             : 
    3289             : an_expr_node_ptr assign_expr_to_temp_and_make_expr_for_reuse(
    3290             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    3291             : /*
    3292             : Change the indicated expression (an rvalue) into an assignment of the
    3293             : expression to a temporary, then create and return a new expression that refers
    3294             : to the temporary.
    3295             : */
    3296             : {
    3297             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
    3298             :   a_variable_ptr   temp;
    3299             : 
    3300             :   temp = assign_expr_to_temp(expr);
    3301             :   /* Make a reference to the temporary as the copy. */
    3302             :   expr_copy = var_rvalue_expr(temp);
    3303             :   return expr_copy;
    3304             : }  /* assign_expr_to_temp_and_make_expr_for_reuse */
    3305             : 
    3306             : 
    3307             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_reusable_copy_full(
    3308             :                                    an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    3309             :                                    a_boolean        vars_can_change,
    3310             :                                    a_boolean        *temp_init_used,
    3311             :                                    a_boolean        treat_as_potential_prvalue)
    3312             : /*
    3313             : Return a copy of the expression tree pointed to by expr, which can be an
    3314             : rvalue or lvalue.  If it is an lvalue, it is one whose address can be taken
    3315             : (e.g., the caller has eliminated bit-field lvalues).  If the expression has
    3316             : side effects, or if its value (if it's an rvalue) or its address (if it's an
    3317             : lvalue) is affected by the values of variables and vars_can_change is TRUE, the
    3318             : original expression will be changed so that its value (or address) is stored
    3319             : in a temporary, and the copy will reference the temporary.  vars_can_change
    3320             : TRUE means arbitrary user code might be executed in the interval between the
    3321             : original use of the expression and the use of the copy, and such code might
    3322             : change the values of (user) variables.  *temp_init_used is returned TRUE if a
    3323             : temporary was used, including a reuse of an existing temporary.  When it is
    3324             : TRUE, the caller must take steps to ensure that expr is evaluated before the
    3325             : copy.  treat_as_potential_prvalue should always be FALSE (because this routine
    3326             : is only called from lowering and value categories are known at that time), but
    3327             : is left as an argument to keep the signature the same as other similar routines
    3328             : (that are called through a_reusable_copy_function_ptr pointer).  See
    3329             : make_expr_reusable_copy for a similar routine used in the front end proper.
    3330             : */
    3331             : {
    3332             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
    3333             :   a_variable_ptr   temp_var;
    3334             : 
    3335             :   check_assertion(!treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3336             :   *temp_init_used = FALSE;
    3337             :   if (is_assignment_to_temp(expr, &temp_var)) {
    3338             :     /* The expression is an assignment to a temporary, probably generated
    3339             :        by a previous call of make_reusable_copy.  Use the value of
    3340             :        the temporary. */
    3341             :     expr_copy = var_rvalue_expr(temp_var);
    3342             :     *temp_init_used = TRUE;
    3343             :   } else if (is_invariant_expr(expr, vars_can_change,
    3344             :                                treat_as_potential_prvalue)) {
    3345             :     /* The expression has no side effects and will give the same value if
    3346             :        evaluated more than once. */
    3347             :     /* A straight copy will work. */
    3348             :     /* Note that this expression will not have temporaries or object lifetimes
    3349             :        in it since it has no side effects. */
    3350             :     expr_copy = copy_expr_tree(expr, CE_NO_OPTIONS);
    3351             :   } else {
    3352             :     /* Change the original expression to assign the value to a temporary,
    3353             :        and use the temporary for the reuse.  For an lvalue case,
    3354             :        the temporary is set to the address of the lvalue, so the original
    3355             :        expression "lvalue" becomes something like "*(temp = &lvalue)". */
    3356             :     an_expr_node_ptr expr_to_save = copy_node(expr);
    3357             :     a_boolean        lvalue_case = expr->is_lvalue;
    3358             :     if (lvalue_case) {
    3359             :       expr_to_save = add_address_of_to_node(expr_to_save);
    3360             :     }  /* if */
    3361             :     /* Assign the expression to a temporary. */
    3362             :     temp_var = assign_expr_to_temp(expr_to_save);
    3363             :     /* Add an indirection if we took the address above. */
    3364             :     if (lvalue_case) {
    3365             :       expr_to_save = add_indirection_to_node(expr_to_save);
    3366             :     }  /* if */
    3367             :     overwrite_node(expr, expr_to_save);
    3368             :     /* Make the expression for the temporary.  For an lvalue, put a "*"
    3369             :        on top of that because the temporary is a pointer to the lvalue. */
    3370             :     expr_copy = var_rvalue_expr(temp_var);
    3371             :     if (lvalue_case) {
    3372             :       expr_copy = add_indirection_to_node(expr_copy);
    3373             :     }  /* if */
    3374             :     *temp_init_used = TRUE;
    3375             :   }  /* if */
    3376             :   return expr_copy;
    3377             : }  /* make_reusable_copy_full */
    3378             : 
    3379             : 
    3380             : an_expr_node_ptr make_reusable_copy(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    3381             :                                     a_boolean        vars_can_change)
    3382             : /*
    3383             : Simpler interface to make_reusable_copy_full, without the temp_init_used
    3384             : and treat_as_potential_prvalue parameters.  The caller must ensure that expr
    3385             : will be evaluated before the copy is evaluated.
    3386             : */
    3387             : {
    3388             :   a_boolean        temp_init_used;
    3389             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
    3390             : 
    3391             :   expr_copy = make_reusable_copy_full(expr, vars_can_change,
    3392             :                                       &temp_init_used,
    3393             :                                       /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE);
    3394             :   return expr_copy;
    3395             : }  /* make_reusable_copy */
    3396             : 
    3397             : 
    3398             : an_expr_node_ptr make_lvalue_reusable_copy_full(
    3399             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    3400             :                                               a_boolean        vars_can_change,
    3401             :                                               a_boolean        *temp_init_used)
    3402             : /*
    3403             : Return a copy of the expression tree pointed to by expr, which is an
    3404             : lvalue.  If the expression has side effects, or if its value is affected
    3405             : by the values of variables and vars_can_change is TRUE, the original
    3406             : expression will be changed so that its value is stored in a temporary,
    3407             : and the copy will reference the temporary.  *temp_init_used is returned
    3408             : TRUE if a temporary was used, including a reuse of an existing temporary.
    3409             : When it is TRUE, the caller must take steps to ensure that expr is evaluated
    3410             : before the copy.  See make_glvalue_expr_reusable_copy for a similar routine
    3411             : used in the front end proper.
    3412             : */
    3413             : {
    3414             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
    3415             : 
    3416             :   expr_copy = glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(expr, vars_can_change,
    3417             :                                          make_reusable_copy_full,
    3418             :                                          temp_init_used,
    3419             :                                          /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE);
    3420             :   return expr_copy;
    3421             : }  /* make_lvalue_reusable_copy_full */
    3422             : 
    3423             : 
    3424             : an_expr_node_ptr make_lvalue_reusable_copy(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    3425             :                                            a_boolean        vars_can_change)
    3426             : /*
    3427             : Simpler interface to make_lvalue_reusable_copy_full, without the temp_init_used
    3428             : parameter.  The caller must ensure that expr will be evaluated before
    3429             : the copy is evaluated.
    3430             : */
    3431             : {
    3432             :   a_boolean        temp_init_used;
    3433             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
    3434             : 
    3435             :   expr_copy = make_lvalue_reusable_copy_full(expr, vars_can_change,
    3436             :                                              &temp_init_used);
    3437             :   return expr_copy;
    3438             : }  /* make_lvalue_reusable_copy */
    3439             : 
    3440             : 
    3441             : static void change_node_to_operation(an_expr_node_ptr      node,
    3442             :                                      an_expr_operator_kind op,
    3443             :                                      a_type_ptr            type,
    3444             :                                      an_expr_node_ptr      operand,
    3445             :                                      a_boolean             is_lvalue)
    3446             : /*
    3447             : Change node to an operation node with operator op, type type, lvalueness
    3448             : as specified by is_lvalue, and operand list as given by operand.
    3449             : */
    3450             : {
    3451             :   an_expr_node_ptr node_next;
    3452             :   a_boolean        node_result_is_not_used;
    3453             : 
    3454             :   /* Preserve the next pointer and the result_is_not_used flag. */
    3455             :   node_next = node->next;
    3456             :   node_result_is_not_used = node->result_is_not_used;
    3457             :   clear_expr_node(node, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_operation);
    3458             :   node->next = node_next;
    3459             :   /* Don't need to call set_expr_result_not_used here; set_node_operator
    3460             :      calls it. */
    3461             :   node->result_is_not_used = node_result_is_not_used;
    3462             :   set_node_operator(node, op, type, is_lvalue, operand);
    3463             : }  /* change_node_to_operation */
    3464             : 
    3465             : 
    3466             : void insert_expr(an_expr_node_ptr       inserted_expr,
    3467             :                  an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3468             : /*
    3469             : Insert the expression inserted_expr at *insert_location, which is an insert
    3470             : location within an expression.  Update *insert_location so the next insertion
    3471             : will be after the expression added.
    3472             : */
    3473             : {
    3474             :   an_expr_node_ptr        orig_expr, orig_expr_copy;
    3475             :   an_expr_node_ptr        first_operand, second_operand;
    3476             :   an_insert_location_kind kind = insert_location->kind;
    3477             : 
    3478             :   check_assertion_str(is_expr_insert_location_kind(kind),
    3479             :                       "insert_expr: insert location is not expr insert");
    3480             :   check_assertion(inserted_expr != NULL);
    3481             :   if (kind == ilk_expr_creation) {
    3482             :     /* Special mode used to create an expression unattached to anything
    3483             :        else.  The first insertion defines the start of the expression. */
    3484             :     insert_location->variant.expr = inserted_expr;
    3485             :     /* Subsequent insertions are after this expression. */
    3486             :     insert_location->kind = ilk_after_expr;
    3487             :   } else {
    3488             :     /* Normal case (insertion before/after an existing expression). */
    3489             :     orig_expr = insert_location->variant.expr;
    3490             :     /* Make a comma node that has the original node and the expression
    3491             :        being inserted as its operands.  The original node is actually copied
    3492             :        so that the comma node can be put at the address of the original
    3493             :        node. */
    3494             :     orig_expr_copy = copy_node(orig_expr);
    3495             :     /* Order the operands of the comma operator depending on whether the
    3496             :        insertion is supposed to be before or after the original expression. */
    3497             :     if (kind == ilk_before_expr) {
    3498             :       first_operand = inserted_expr;
    3499             :       second_operand = orig_expr_copy;
    3500             :       /* Change the insert location so that it inserts before the second
    3501             :          expression (the original one).  Note that we cannot make an "after"
    3502             :          insertion implicitly; they are tricky and must be made explicitly. */
    3503             :       insert_location->variant.expr = second_operand;
    3504             :     } else {
    3505             :       first_operand = orig_expr_copy;
    3506             :       second_operand = inserted_expr;
    3507             :       /* The insert location is left as it is, for insertion after the original
    3508             :          node, which will be the comma node.  That's used instead of the
    3509             :          second operand to avoid problems with keeping the type of comma
    3510             :          nodes up to date when inserts are done under them in their second
    3511             :          operands. */
    3512             :     }  /* if */
    3513             :     first_operand->next = second_operand;
    3514             :     second_operand->next = NULL;
    3515             :     /* Turn the original node into a comma node. */
    3516             :     change_node_to_operation(orig_expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
    3517             :                              second_operand->type, first_operand,
    3518             :                              second_operand->is_lvalue);
    3519             :   }  /* if */
    3520             : }  /* insert_expr */
    3521             : 
    3522             : 
    3523             : void mark_stmk_inits_as_following_exec_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
    3524             : /*
    3525             : An executable statement has been inserted preceding the indicated statement.
    3526             : If that statement is an stmk_init, set follows_an_exec_statement in it.
    3527             : Do the same for any other stmk_inits immediately following it.
    3528             : */
    3529             : {
    3530             :   a_statement_ptr foll_stmt;
    3531             : 
    3532             :   for (foll_stmt = statement;
    3533             :        foll_stmt != NULL;
    3534             :        foll_stmt = foll_stmt->next) {
    3535             :     if (foll_stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_init) {
    3536             :       foll_stmt->variant.dynamic_init->follows_an_exec_statement = TRUE;
    3537             :     } else if (foll_stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_decl) {
    3538             :       /* Ignore stmk_decl statements. */
    3539             :     } else {
    3540             :       /* Some other kind of statement. */
    3541             :       break;
    3542             :     }  /* if */
    3543             :   }  /* for */
    3544             : }  /* mark_stmk_inits_as_following_exec_statement */
    3545             : 
    3546             : 
    3547             : void insert_statement_full(a_statement_ptr        statement,
    3548             :                            an_insert_location_ptr insert_location,
    3549             :                            a_boolean              perform_post_pass)
    3550             : /*
    3551             : Insert the statement "statement" at *insert_location.  Update *insert_location
    3552             : so the next insertion will be after the statement added.  If perform_post_pass
    3553             : is TRUE, a lowering post pass is performed on any top level expressions
    3554             : contained in the statement, but the caller is responsible for performing the
    3555             : post pass on any expressions that may be introduced at a secondary statement
    3556             : level (e.g., in a block or loop statement).  Performing a lowering post pass
    3557             : is harmless (so a value of TRUE is safe), but expensive so it should be
    3558             : avoided if not necessary.
    3559             : */
    3560             : {
    3561             :   a_statement_ptr         insert_stmt;
    3562             :   an_insert_location_kind kind = insert_location->kind;
    3563             : 
    3564             :   if (perform_post_pass) {
    3565             :     /* If the statement we're about to insert has any expressions, make sure
    3566             :        they have been run through the lowering post pass before the statement
    3567             :        is inserted.  Note that only top level expressions are examined here;
    3568             :        if the statement contains other expressions that need a lowering post
    3569             :        pass performed on them (e.g., in the body of a loop statement), it
    3570             :        is the caller's responsibility to perform a lowering post pass before
    3571             :        calling this routine. */
    3572             :     if (statement->expr != NULL) {
    3573             :       perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(statement->expr);
    3574             :     }  /* if */
    3575             :     if (statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for) {
    3576             :       /* For statements have additional expressions. */
    3577             :       if (statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info->increment != NULL) {
    3578             :         perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(
    3579             :                             statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info->increment);
    3580             :       }  /* if */
    3581             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3582             :       if (statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info->affinity != NULL) {
    3583             :         perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(
    3584             :                              statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info->affinity);
    3585             :       }  /* if */
    3586             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    3587             :     }  /* if */
    3588             :   }  /* if */
    3589             :   if (is_expr_insert_location_kind(kind)) {
    3590             :     /* Insert within an expression. */
    3591             : #if CHECKING
    3592             :     if (statement->kind != (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr) {
    3593             :       internal_error(
    3594             :                     "insert_statement_full: cannot insert non-expr statement");
    3595             :     }  /* if */
    3596             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    3597             :     /* Note that the expression statement is just discarded. */
    3598             :     insert_expr(statement->expr, insert_location);
    3599             :   } else {
    3600             :     /* Insert in a statement sequence. */
    3601             :     if (is_empty_statement_insert_location_kind(kind) &&
    3602             :         insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked) {
    3603             :       /* This "empty" insert location has been "marked"; record the first
    3604             :          statement to be inserted. */
    3605             :       check_assertion(insert_location->variant.statement.marker == NULL);
    3606             :       insert_location->variant.statement.marker = statement;
    3607             :     }  /* if */
    3608             :     if (kind == ilk_statement_creation) {
    3609             :       /* Create new statement. */
    3610             :       insert_location->kind = ilk_after_statement;
    3611             :     } else {
    3612             :       insert_stmt = insert_location->variant.statement.stmt;
    3613             :       if (kind == ilk_block_start) {
    3614             :         /* Insert at the start of a block. */
    3615             :         statement->next = insert_stmt->variant.block.statements;
    3616             :         statement->parent = insert_stmt;
    3617             :         insert_stmt->variant.block.statements = statement;
    3618             :         insert_location->kind = ilk_after_statement;
    3619             :       } else {
    3620             :         check_assertion_str(kind == ilk_after_statement,
    3621             :                             "insert_statement_full: bad insert location kind");
    3622             :         /* Normal case -- insert after insert_stmt. */
    3623             :         statement->next = insert_stmt->next;
    3624             :         insert_stmt->next = statement;
    3625             :         statement->parent = insert_stmt->parent;
    3626             :       }  /* if */
    3627             :     }  /* if */
    3628             :     /* Set *insert_location for the next insertion (kind is always
    3629             :        ilk_after_statement at this point). */
    3630             :     insert_location->variant.statement.stmt = statement;
    3631             :     if (statement->kind != (a_statement_kind)stmk_init) {
    3632             :       /* Set follows_an_exec_statement on any stmk_inits following this
    3633             :          insertion. */
    3634             :       mark_stmk_inits_as_following_exec_statement(statement->next);
    3635             :     }  /* if */
    3636             :   }  /* if */
    3637             : }  /* insert_statement_full */
    3638             : 
    3639             : 
    3640             : void set_insert_location_mark(an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3641             : /*
    3642             : Record the current statement insert location with a marker for future
    3643             : reference.  This is used to "remember" the location where pending
    3644             : stmk_init statements should be inserted (they need to occur before the
    3645             : statements that will be shortly inserted at this insert location).  If the
    3646             : specified insert_location is "empty" (i.e., ilk_statement_creation or
    3647             : ilk_block_start), record the fact that a marker was requested and use it to
    3648             : mark the first statement to be added (at a later time).
    3649             : */
    3650             : {
    3651             :   if (insert_location->kind == ilk_after_statement) {
    3652             :     check_assertion(!insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked);
    3653             :     insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked = TRUE;
    3654             :     insert_location->variant.statement.marker =
    3655             :                                        insert_location->variant.statement.stmt;
    3656             :   } else if (is_empty_statement_insert_location(insert_location)) {
    3657             :     check_assertion(!insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked);
    3658             :     insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked = TRUE;
    3659             :   } else {
    3660             :     unexpected_condition();
    3661             :   }  /* if */
    3662             : }  /* set_insert_location_mark */
    3663             : 
    3664             : 
    3665             : void reset_insert_location_mark(an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3666             : /*
    3667             : Reset the marker associated with insert_location.
    3668             : */
    3669             : {
    3670             :   check_assertion(!is_expr_insert_location(insert_location) &&
    3671             :                   insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked);
    3672             :   insert_location->variant.statement.is_marked = FALSE;
    3673             :   insert_location->variant.statement.marker = NULL;
    3674             : }  /* reset_insert_location_mark */
    3675             : 
    3676             : 
    3677             : a_statement_ptr insert_expr_statement(an_expr_node_ptr       node,
    3678             :                                       an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3679             : /*
    3680             : Make a statement from expression node.  Insert the statement at
    3681             : *insert_location and update *insert_location.  Return a pointer to the
    3682             : statement, or NULL if no statement was created (in an expression insert
    3683             : context).  The result of the expression is marked as not used if a statement
    3684             : is created.
    3685             : */
    3686             : {
    3687             :   a_statement_ptr stmt;
    3688             : 
    3689             :   if (is_expr_insert_location_kind(insert_location->kind)) {
    3690             :     /* Insert within an expression.  The statement need not be created. */
    3691             :     /* Run a lowering post pass on the expression before we insert it. */
    3692             :     perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(node);
    3693             :     insert_expr(node, insert_location);
    3694             :     stmt = NULL;
    3695             :   } else {
    3696             :     /* Make the expression statement. */
    3697             :     stmt = alloc_expr_statement(node);
    3698             :     /* Insert the statement at the right location. */
    3699             :     /* The lowering post pass is performed by insert_statement. */
    3700             :     insert_statement(stmt, insert_location);
    3701             :   }  /* if */
    3702             :   return stmt;
    3703             : }  /* insert_expr_statement */
    3704             : 
    3705             : 
    3706             : a_statement_ptr insert_expr_statement_set_pos(
    3707             :                                       an_expr_node_ptr       node,
    3708             :                                       an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3709             : /*
    3710             : Make a statement from expression node.  Insert the statement at
    3711             : *insert_location and update *insert_location.  Return a pointer to the
    3712             : statement, or NULL if no statement was created (in an expression insert
    3713             : context).  The result of the expression is marked as not used if a statement
    3714             : is created.  The current lowering source position is recorded in the
    3715             : statement.
    3716             : */
    3717             : {
    3718             :   a_statement_ptr stmt;
    3719             : 
    3720             :   stmt = insert_expr_statement(node, insert_location);
    3721             :   if (stmt != NULL) set_stmt_pos_to_code_pos_for_lowering(stmt);
    3722             :   return stmt;
    3723             : }  /* insert_expr_statement_set_pos */
    3724             : 
    3725             : 
    3726             : an_expr_node_ptr make_var_assignment_expr(a_variable_ptr    lvalue_var,
    3727             :                                           an_expr_node_ptr  rvalue_expr)
    3728             : /*
    3729             : Make an expression that assigns rvalue_expr to the variable lvalue_var.
    3730             : */
    3731             : {
    3732             :   an_expr_node_ptr lvalue_expr, assign_node;
    3733             : 
    3734             :   check_assertion(!rvalue_expr->is_lvalue);
    3735             :   /* Make an expression for the lvalue. */
    3736             :   lvalue_expr = var_lvalue_expr(lvalue_var);
    3737             :   /* If this variable is a parameter, mark it as having been changed. */
    3738             :   if (lvalue_var->is_parameter) {
    3739             :     lvalue_var->param_value_has_been_changed = TRUE;
    3740             :   }  /* if */
    3741             :   /* Make the assignment node. */
    3742             :   assign_node = make_assignment_expr(lvalue_expr,
    3743             :                                      (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
    3744             :                                      rvalue_expr);
    3745             :   return assign_node;
    3746             : }  /* make_var_assignment_expr */
    3747             : 
    3748             : 
    3749             : a_statement_ptr insert_assignment_statement(
    3750             :                                         an_expr_node_ptr       lvalue_expr,
    3751             :                                         an_expr_operator_kind  op,
    3752             :                                         an_expr_node_ptr       rvalue_expr,
    3753             :                                         an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3754             : /*
    3755             : Make a statement that assigns rvalue_expr to lvalue_expr using assignment
    3756             : operator op.  Insert the statement at *insert_location and update
    3757             : *insert_location.  Return a pointer to the statement, or NULL if no
    3758             : statement was created (in an expression insert context).
    3759             : */
    3760             : {
    3761             :   a_statement_ptr  assign_stmt;
    3762             :   an_expr_node_ptr assign_node;
    3763             : 
    3764             :   check_assertion(lvalue_expr->is_lvalue && 
    3765             :                   (!rvalue_expr->is_lvalue ||
    3766             :                    op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_bassign));
    3767             :   assign_node = make_assignment_expr(lvalue_expr, op, rvalue_expr);
    3768             :   /* Make and insert the expression statement. */
    3769             :   assign_stmt = insert_expr_statement(assign_node, insert_location);
    3770             :   return assign_stmt;
    3771             : }  /* insert_assignment_statement */
    3772             : 
    3773             : 
    3774             : a_statement_ptr insert_var_assignment_statement(
    3775             :                                         a_variable_ptr         lvalue_var,
    3776             :                                         an_expr_node_ptr       rvalue_expr,
    3777             :                                         an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
    3778             : /*
    3779             : Make a statement that assigns rvalue_expr to lvalue_var.  Insert the statement
    3780             : at *insert_location and update *insert_location.  Return a pointer to the
    3781             : statement, or NULL if no statement was created (in an expression insert
    3782             : context).
    3783             : */
    3784             : {
    3785             :   a_statement_ptr  assign_stmt;
    3786             :   an_expr_node_ptr assign_node;
    3787             : 
    3788             :   /* Make the assignment node. */
    3789             :   assign_node = make_var_assignment_expr(lvalue_var, rvalue_expr);
    3790             :   /* Make and insert the statement for the assignment. */
    3791             :   assign_stmt = insert_expr_statement(assign_node, insert_location);
    3792             :   return assign_stmt;
    3793             : }  /* insert_var_assignment_statement */
    3794             : 
    3795             : 
    3796             : a_statement_ptr last_statement_in_block(a_statement_ptr block_statement)
    3797             : /*
    3798             : Return a pointer to the last statement in the block pointed to by
    3799             : block_statement, or NULL if there are no statements in the block.
    3800             : */
    3801             : {
    3802             :   a_statement_ptr last_statement;
    3803             : 
    3804             :   check_assertion_str(block_statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block,
    3805             :                       "last_statement_in_block: statement not block");
    3806             :   last_statement = block_statement->variant.block.statements;
    3807             :   if (last_statement != NULL) {
    3808             :     while (last_statement->next != NULL) last_statement = last_statement->next;
    3809             :   }  /* if */
    3810             :   return last_statement;
    3811             : }  /* last_statement_in_block */
    3812             : 
    3813             : #if REWRITE_UCN_ESCAPE_CHAR_IN_LOWERING
    3814             : 
    3815             : void rewrite_ucns_in_name(a_source_correspondence *source_corresp)
    3816             : /*
    3817             : Rewrite any UCNs (universal character names, e.g., \uxxxx) in the name
    3818             : in the given source correspondence entry.
    3819             : */
    3820             : {
    3821             :   if (il_header.UCN_identifiers_used) {
    3822             :     /* Rewrite the escape character in UCNs. */
    3823             :     char *p;
    3824             :     p = (char *)source_corresp->name;
    3825             :     if (p != NULL) {
    3826             :       while ((p = strchr(p, '\\')) != NULL) {
    3827             :         *p++ = UCN_ESCAPE_REWRITE_CHAR;
    3828             :       }  /* while */
    3829             :     }  /* if */
    3830             :     p = (char *)source_corresp->unmangled_name_or_mangled_encoding;
    3831             :     if (p != NULL) {
    3832             :       while ((p = strchr(p, '\\')) != NULL) {
    3833             :         *p++ = UCN_ESCAPE_REWRITE_CHAR;
    3834             :       }  /* while */
    3835             :     }  /* if */
    3836             :   }  /* if */
    3837             : }  /* rewrite_ucns_in_name */
    3838             : 
    3839             : #endif /* REWRITE_UCN_ESCAPE_CHAR_IN_LOWERING */
    3840             : 
    3841             : static void lower_source_correspondence(
    3842             :                                        a_source_correspondence *source_corresp)
    3843             : /*
    3844             : Do IL lowering of the indicated source correspondence.
    3845             : */
    3846             : {
    3847             :   /* Track the source position for internal errors. */
    3848             :   if (source_corresp->decl_position.seq != 0) {
    3849             :     error_position = source_corresp->decl_position;
    3850             :   }  /* if */
    3851             :   if (source_corresp->name_linkage ==
    3852             :                                  (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external) {
    3853             :     source_corresp->name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external;
    3854             :   }  /* if */
    3855             : #if REWRITE_UCN_ESCAPE_CHAR_IN_LOWERING
    3856             :   rewrite_ucns_in_name(source_corresp);
    3857             : #endif /* REWRITE_UCN_ESCAPE_CHAR_IN_LOWERING */
    3858             : }  /* lower_source_correspondence */
    3859             :   
    3860             : 
    3861             : static void conv_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(
    3862             :                                                     a_constant_ptr  con,
    3863             :                                                     an_integer_kind ikind,
    3864             :                                                     a_type_ptr      class_type)
    3865             : /*
    3866             : Convert the integer constant "con" to the integer kind "ikind".  Check to
    3867             : make sure that the value will fit an integer of that size, and if not,
    3868             : issue an error.  If class_type is non-NULL, the error is related to the
    3869             : indicated class.
    3870             : */
    3871             : {
    3872             :   an_error_code     err_code;
    3873             :   an_error_severity err_severity;
    3874             :   a_constant_ptr    new_constant = local_constant();
    3875             : 
    3876             :   clear_constant(new_constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_error);
    3877             :   new_constant->type = integer_type(ikind);
    3878             :   conv_integer_to_integer(con, new_constant, /*is_implicit_cast=*/TRUE,
    3879             :                           &err_code, &err_severity);
    3880             :   if (err_code != ec_no_error) {
    3881             :     if (class_type != NULL) {
    3882             :       pos_ty_error(ec_integer_overflow_class_internal, &error_position,
    3883             :                    class_type);
    3884             :     } else {
    3885             :       pos_error(ec_integer_overflow_internal, &error_position);
    3886             :     }  /* if */
    3887             :   }  /* if */
    3888             :   copy_constant(new_constant, con);
    3889             :   release_local_constant(&new_constant);
    3890             : }  /* conv_integer_constant_with_overflow_check */
    3891             : 
    3892             : 
    3893             : #if !MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    3894             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* preserve_needed_flag is not used in this case. */
    3895             : #endif /* !MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    3896             : void set_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(
    3897             :                                     a_constant_ptr       con,
    3898             :                                     a_host_large_integer con_val,
    3899             :                                     an_integer_kind      ikind,
    3900             :                                     a_type_ptr           class_type,
    3901             :                                     a_boolean            preserve_needed_flag)
    3902             : /*
    3903             : Set the constant "con" to the integer value "con_val" with integer kind
    3904             : "ikind".  Check to make sure that the value will fit an integer of that size,
    3905             : and if not, issue an error.  If class_type is non-NULL, the error is
    3906             : related to the indicated class.  If preserve_needed_flag is TRUE, the value
    3907             : of con's "needed" flag will be preserved (used in cases where the constant
    3908             : has already gone through needed flag processing).  Note that this should be
    3909             : FALSE for constants that are not in the IL.  This version is for signed integer
    3910             : kinds.
    3911             : */
    3912             : {
    3913             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    3914             :   a_boolean needed = con->source_corresp.needed;
    3915             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    3916             :   /* Create the constant as a long and then change its type to get any
    3917             :      truncation error. */
    3918             :   set_integer_constant(con, con_val, (an_integer_kind)ik_long);
    3919             :   conv_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(con, ikind, class_type);
    3920             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    3921             :   /* If the needed flag has already been set, maintain it. */
    3922             :   if (preserve_needed_flag && needed) {
    3923             :     mark_as_needed((char *)con, iek_constant);
    3924             :   }  /* if */
    3925             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    3926             : }  /* set_integer_constant_with_overflow_check */
    3927             : 
    3928             : 
    3929             : #if !MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    3930             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* preserve_needed_flag is not used in this case. */
    3931             : #endif /* !MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    3932             : void set_unsigned_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(
    3933             :                                     a_constant_ptr        con,
    3934             :                                     a_host_large_unsigned con_val,
    3935             :                                     an_integer_kind       ikind,
    3936             :                                     a_type_ptr            class_type,
    3937             :                                     a_boolean             preserve_needed_flag)
    3938             : /*
    3939             : Set the constant "con" to the integer value "con_val" with integer kind
    3940             : "ikind".  Check to make sure that the value will fit an integer of that size,
    3941             : and if not, issue an error.  If class_type is non-NULL, the error is
    3942             : related to the indicated class.  If preserve_needed_flag is TRUE, the value
    3943             : of con's "needed" flag will be preserved (used in cases where the constant
    3944             : has already gone through needed flag processing).  Note that this should be
    3945             : FALSE for constants that are not in the IL.  This version is for unsigned
    3946             : integer kinds.
    3947             : */
    3948             : {
    3949             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    3950             :   a_boolean needed = con->source_corresp.needed;
    3951             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    3952             :   /* Create the constant as an unsigned long and then change its type to
    3953             :      get any truncation error. */
    3954             :   set_unsigned_integer_constant(con, con_val,
    3955             :                                 (an_integer_kind)ik_unsigned_long);
    3956             :   conv_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(con, ikind, class_type);
    3957             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    3958             :   /* If the needed flag has already been set, maintain it. */
    3959             :   if (preserve_needed_flag && needed) {
    3960             :     mark_as_needed((char *)con, iek_constant);
    3961             :   }  /* if */
    3962             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    3963             : }  /* set_unsigned_integer_constant_with_overflow_check */
    3964             : 
    3965             : 
    3966             : static void set_delta_constant(a_targ_ptrdiff_t delta,
    3967             :                                a_constant_ptr   delta_con,
    3968             :                                a_type_ptr       class_type)
    3969             : /*
    3970             : Set the constant entry delta_con to the constant integer value given by
    3971             : delta.  The value is an address offset.  Issue an error if the constant
    3972             : will not fit in an integer of kind TARG_DELTA_INT_KIND.  The associated
    3973             : class type is class_type, for use in the error message.
    3974             : */
    3975             : {
    3976             :   set_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(delta_con, delta,
    3977             :                                            targ_delta_int_kind,
    3978             :                                            class_type,
    3979             :                                            /*preserve_needed_flag=*/FALSE);
    3980             : }  /* set_delta_constant */
    3981             : 
    3982             : 
    3983             : void lower_ptr_to_member_constant(a_constant_ptr constant)
    3984             : /*
    3985             : Do IL lowering of a pointer-to-member constant.
    3986             : */
    3987             : {
    3988             :   a_routine_ptr    routine;
    3989             :   a_constant_ptr   constant_next = constant->next;
    3990             :   char             *constant_assoc_info = constant->source_corresp.assoc_info;
    3991             :   a_boolean        did_not_fold;
    3992             :   a_type_ptr       class_type = pm_class_type_possibly_lowered(constant->type);
    3993             :   a_constant_ptr   delta_con, func_con;
    3994             : #if !IA64_ABI
    3995             :   a_constant_ptr   index_con;
    3996             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    3997             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t delta, idx, offset;
    3998             :   a_memory_region_number
    3999             :                    region_to_switch_back_to = NULL_region_number;
    4000             : 
    4001             :   /* A pointer-to-data-member becomes an integer; a pointer-to-member-function
    4002             :      becomes a ck_aggregate to initialize a struct.  Clearly, the places
    4003             :      that reference such a ck_aggregate constant must be changed if they
    4004             :      aren't static initializations. */
    4005             :   if (constant->variant.ptr_to_member.is_function_ptr) {
    4006             :     /* Pointer to member function. */
    4007             :     repr_for_ptr_to_member_function_constant(constant, &delta, &idx,
    4008             :                                              &routine, &offset);
    4009             :     if (processing_file_scope_init_routine) {
    4010             :       /* Switch to the file scope.  Needed when lowering constants in a
    4011             :          file-scope initialization routine: the current memory region would
    4012             :          be the one for the generated routine, and the alloc_constant calls
    4013             :          below must allocate the constants in the file scope memory region. */
    4014             :       switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
    4015             :     }  /* if */
    4016             :     /* Make sure the struct type used to represent a pointer-to-member-function
    4017             :        is allocated. */
    4018             :     (void)make_mptr_type();
    4019             :     /* Allocate the constants for the initial values. */
    4020             :     /* The first field is the delta value, the offset of the class of the
    4021             :        routine relative to the class pointed to by the pointer-to-member.
    4022             :        In the IA-64 ABI, this is the second field. */
    4023             :     delta_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    4024             :     set_delta_constant(delta, delta_con, class_type);
    4025             : #if !IA64_ABI
    4026             :     /* The second field is
    4027             :          0 for a NULL pointer;
    4028             :          an index into the virtual function table (>0) is the function is
    4029             :            virtual;
    4030             :          -1 if the function is non-virtual.
    4031             :        This is not used in the IA-64 ABI.
    4032             :     */
    4033             :     index_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    4034             :     set_delta_constant(idx, index_con, class_type);
    4035             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    4036             :     /* The third field is
    4037             :          NULL for a null pointer;
    4038             :          the offset of the virtual function table pointer in the class of
    4039             :            the routine if the function is virtual;
    4040             :          a pointer to the function if the function is non-virtual.
    4041             :        Note that all three are cast to a generic pointer-to-function
    4042             :        type since they're initializing the "f" field of the struct, which
    4043             :        has that type.  In the IA-64 ABI, this is the first field. */
    4044             :     func_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address);
    4045             :     if (routine != NULL) {
    4046             : #if GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
    4047             :       if (is_multiversion_representative(routine)) {
    4048             :         /* Replace a representative routine with a target-specific version
    4049             :            if one is available. */
    4050             :         routine = lowered_mv_routine(routine);
    4051             :       }  /* if */
    4052             : #endif /* GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    4053             :       /* For a non-virtual function, a pointer to the routine. */
    4054             :       set_routine_address_constant(routine, func_con,
    4055             :                                    /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    4056             :       /* Make sure the routine type is lowered.  This call is necessary when
    4057             :          the type now is from a declaration of the function and later that
    4058             :          will be replaced by an equivalent but separate type from the
    4059             :          definition. */
    4060             :       lower_os_type(routine->type);
    4061             :     } else {
    4062             :       /* For a virtual function, the offset of the virtual function table
    4063             :          pointer in the class of the routine.  Also handles the NULL case. */
    4064             :       set_delta_constant(offset, func_con, class_type);
    4065             :     }  /* if */
    4066             :     /* Convert the pointer or offset to the generic pointer-to-function
    4067             :        type vptp.  is_implicit_cast must be FALSE to suppress a warning
    4068             :        on converting a non-zero integer to a pointer. */
    4069             :     type_change_constant(func_con, vptp_type,
    4070             :                          /*is_implicit_cast=*/FALSE,
    4071             :                          /*maintain_expression=*/FALSE,
    4072             :                          &did_not_fold, &error_position);
    4073             :     /* Change the original constant into a ck_aggregate constant. */
    4074             :     set_constant_kind(constant, (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    4075             :     /* constant->type is left alone. */
    4076             : #if !IA64_ABI
    4077             :     constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = delta_con;
    4078             :     delta_con->next = index_con;
    4079             :     index_con->next = func_con;
    4080             :     constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = func_con;
    4081             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    4082             :     constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = func_con;
    4083             :     func_con->next = delta_con;
    4084             :     constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = delta_con;
    4085             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    4086             :     switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
    4087             :   } else {
    4088             :     /* Pointer to data member. */
    4089             :     repr_for_ptr_to_data_member_constant(constant, &delta);
    4090             : #if !IA64_ABI
    4091             :     set_unsigned_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(
    4092             :                                         constant, (a_host_large_unsigned)delta,
    4093             :                                         targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind,
    4094             :                                         class_type,
    4095             :                                         /*preserve_needed_flag=*/TRUE);
    4096             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    4097             :     set_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(
    4098             :                                         constant, (a_host_large_integer)delta,
    4099             :                                         targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind,
    4100             :                                         class_type,
    4101             :                                         /*preserve_needed_flag=*/TRUE);
    4102             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    4103             :   }  /* if */
    4104             :   constant->next = constant_next;
    4105             :   /* The assoc_info field will be used to point to an associated temporary
    4106             :      variable once one is created.  The variable may have already been created,
    4107             :      so save the pointer if it's there. */
    4108             :   constant->source_corresp.assoc_info = constant_assoc_info;
    4109             : }  /* lower_ptr_to_member_constant */
    4110             : 
    4111             : 
    4112             : a_variable_ptr assoc_var_for_constant(a_constant_ptr constant,
    4113             :                                       a_boolean      const_okay)
    4114             : /*
    4115             : Returns the associated variable for a constant if one already exists, otherwise
    4116             : it creates an associated variable for the constant and returns that.  If
    4117             : const_okay is TRUE, the temporary variable should be created with a "const"
    4118             : qualification.
    4119             : */
    4120             : {
    4121             :   a_variable_ptr  assoc_var;
    4122             : 
    4123             :   if (constant->assoc_var != NULL) {
    4124             :     assoc_var = constant->assoc_var;
    4125             :   } else {
    4126             :     a_type_ptr var_type = constant->type;
    4127             :     if (const_okay) var_type = make_qualified_type(var_type, TQ_CONST);
    4128             :     /* The variable must be allocated. */
    4129             :     if (in_file_scope((char *)constant)) {
    4130             :       /* The constant is in the file scope, so use a file-scope variable.
    4131             :          The constant is possibly shared, but we're going to rewrite
    4132             :          every use of it to reference the variable instead, so the constant
    4133             :          will end up being used only in the initialization of the
    4134             :          variable (and therefore unshared). */
    4135             :       assoc_var = make_file_scope_temporary(var_type);
    4136             :       /* Make the constant the initial value of the variable. */
    4137             :       assoc_var->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_static;
    4138             :       assoc_var->initializer.constant = constant;
    4139             :       /* Make sure the constant is lowered. */
    4140             :       lower_os_constant(constant);
    4141             :     } else {
    4142             :       /* The constant is in the function scope, so use a function-local
    4143             :          static variable. */
    4144             :       assoc_var = make_unnamed_local_static_variable(var_type,
    4145             :                                                    /*in_function_scope=*/TRUE);
    4146             :       /* To initialize a local static variable to an aggregate we use
    4147             :          a local-static-variable-init entry (to avoid memory region
    4148             :          problems).  Note also that the constant is copied here (to avoid
    4149             :          some issues where the constant is in a different function scope). */
    4150             :       (void)make_local_static_variable_init(assoc_var, 
    4151             :                                             innermost_function_scope,
    4152             :                                             (an_init_kind)initk_static,
    4153             :                                             copy_unshared_constant(constant),
    4154             :                                             (a_dynamic_init_ptr)NULL);
    4155             :     }  /* if */
    4156             :     /* Save the pointer in the constant so the variable can be reused. */
    4157             :     constant->assoc_var = assoc_var;
    4158             :   }  /* if */
    4159             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    4160             :   /* In cases where needed flag processing has already been done (e.g,
    4161             :      when processing orphans), make sure assoc_var has the same needed
    4162             :      flag settings as the constant it replaces.  Note that this processing
    4163             :      is also performed on subsequent calls (i.e., when the associated
    4164             :      variable already exists) because orphan processing takes place after
    4165             :      the needed flag processing, so an associated variable that had
    4166             :      originally been set to not needed may now be in fact needed. */
    4167             :   mark_as_needed_like((char *)assoc_var, iek_variable,
    4168             :                       &constant->source_corresp,
    4169             :                       /*set_class_defn_needed=*/FALSE);
    4170             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    4171             :   return assoc_var;
    4172             : }  /* assoc_var_for_constant */
    4173             : 
    4174             : 
    4175             : a_boolean check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant(a_constant_ptr constant,
    4176             :                                                    a_variable_ptr *temp_var)
    4177             : /*
    4178             : Return TRUE if constant is a pointer-to-member constant that has been
    4179             : or will be changed into a ck_aggregate for a struct during lowering
    4180             : (that's done for pointers to member functions).  If so, create a
