    4181             : temporary variable and initialize it with the ck_aggregate constant.
    4182             : Return a pointer to the variable in *temp_var.  The variable is saved and
    4183             : reused.  This trick is necessary for cases where such a pointer to member
    4184             : constant is referenced from executable code, because a ck_aggregate can only
    4185             : be referenced in an initialization.  The caller will rewrite the
    4186             : reference to use the temporary variable instead of the constant.
    4187             : 
    4188             : Note that this routine is also used in cases where a structure
    4189             : constant is being assigned, e.g.,
    4190             : 
    4191             :   struct oo { int count;  ~oo() { } };
    4192             :   int main () {
    4193             :     oo bb[] = {1111, 1112};
    4194             :     return 0;
    4195             :   }
    4196             : 
    4197             : */
    4198             : {
    4199             :   a_boolean      troublesome = FALSE;
    4200             :   a_variable_ptr assoc_var = NULL;
    4201             : 
    4202             :   /* Note that the variable is allocated even if the constant is in
    4203             :      a different memory region and will not at this time be turned into
    4204             :      a ck_aggregate constant. */
    4205             :   if (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate ||
    4206             :       (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_ptr_to_member &&
    4207             :        constant->variant.ptr_to_member.is_function_ptr)) {
    4208             :     /* This is a troublesome pointer-to-member constant or other
    4209             :        troublesome aggregate. */
    4210             :     troublesome = TRUE;
    4211             :     /* See if the variable has been allocated already.  If so, a pointer to
    4212             :        the variable will have been stored in the constant; otherwise one
    4213             :        will be created. */
    4214             :     assoc_var = assoc_var_for_constant(constant, /*const_okay=*/TRUE);
    4215             :   }  /* if */
    4216             :   *temp_var = assoc_var;
    4217             :   return troublesome;
    4218             : }  /* check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant */
    4219             : 
    4220             : 
    4221             : static void lower_constant_list(a_constant_ptr constant_list)
    4222             : /*
    4223             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of constants and everything under it.
    4224             : */
    4225             : {
    4226             :   a_constant_ptr constant;
    4227             : 
    4228             :   for (constant = constant_list; constant != NULL; constant = constant->next) {
    4229             :     lower_constant(constant);
    4230             :   }  /* for */
    4231             : }  /* lower_constant_list */
    4232             : 
    4233             : #if IA64_ABI
    4234             : 
    4235             : a_boolean contains_ptr_to_data_member(a_type_ptr type)
    4236             : /*
    4237             : Return TRUE if zero-initializing a variable with the indicated type requires
    4238             : zero-initializing a pointer to data member.  The caller must not have
    4239             : skipped any typerefs on the type (as typerefs are used to determine whether the
    4240             : lowered type had a pointer-to-data-member).
    4241             : */
    4242             : {
    4243             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
    4244             : 
    4245             :   if (is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(type)) {
    4246             :     result = TRUE;
    4247             :   } else if (is_array_type(type)) { 
    4248             :     result = contains_ptr_to_data_member(array_element_type(type));
    4249             :   } else if (is_class_struct_union_type(type)) {
    4250             :     a_field_ptr f;
    4251             :     for (f = skip_typerefs(type)->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    4252             :          f != NULL;
    4253             :          f = f->next) {
    4254             :       if (contains_ptr_to_data_member(f->type)) {
    4255             :         result = TRUE;
    4256             :         break;
    4257             :       }  /* if */
    4258             :       /* Only the first field of a union is zero-initialized.  */
    4259             :       if (is_union_type(type)) {
    4260             :         break;
    4261             :       }  /* if */
    4262             :     }  /* for */
    4263             :   }  /* if */
    4264             :   return result;
    4265             : }  /* contains_ptr_to_data_member */
    4266             : 
    4267             : 
    4268             : static a_constant_ptr lower_zero_initialization(a_type_ptr type);
    4269             : 
    4270             : 
    4271             : static a_constant_ptr make_list_of_zeroes(a_targ_size_t  n,
    4272             :                                           a_type_ptr     zero_type)
    4273             : /*
    4274             : Return an aggregate constant containing n "zeroes" of the given type.  The
    4275             : type of the returned constant must be set by the caller.
    4276             : */
    4277             : {
    4278             :   a_targ_size_t   i;
    4279             :   a_constant_ptr  result = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    4280             : 
    4281             :   for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    4282             :     a_constant_ptr  elem_con = lower_zero_initialization(zero_type);
    4283             :     if (result->variant.aggregate.first_constant == NULL) {
    4284             :       result->variant.aggregate.first_constant = elem_con;
    4285             :     } else {
    4286             :       result->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = elem_con;
    4287             :     }  /* if */
    4288             :     result->variant.aggregate.last_constant = elem_con;
    4289             :   }  /* for */
    4290             :   return result;
    4291             : }  /* make_list_of_zeroes */
    4292             : 
    4293             : 
    4294             : static a_constant_ptr lower_zero_initialization(a_type_ptr type)
    4295             : /* 
    4296             : Return an initializer for a zero-initialized variable of the indicated
    4297             : type.  This is needed with the IA-64 ABI for entities that are
    4298             : or contain a pointer to data member, which must be initialized to -1.
    4299             : */
    4300             : {
    4301             :   a_constant_ptr con;
    4302             :   a_constant_ptr zero_con = local_constant();
    4303             : 
    4304             :   if (is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(type)) {
    4305             :     set_integer_constant(zero_con, (a_host_large_integer)-1, 
    4306             :                          targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind);
    4307             :     con = move_local_constant_to_il(&zero_con);
    4308             :   } else {
    4309             :     if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(type)) {
    4310             :       /* Use the implementation aggregate type for a pointer to member
    4311             :          function. */
    4312             :       type = make_mptr_type();
    4313             :     }  /* if */
    4314             :     type = skip_typerefs(type);
    4315             :     switch (type->kind) {
    4316             :       case tk_integer:
    4317             : #if FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED
    4318             :       case tk_fixed_point:
    4319             : #endif /* FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED */
    4320             :       case tk_float:
    4321             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
    4322             :       case tk_imaginary:
    4323             :       case tk_complex:
    4324             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
    4325             :       case tk_pointer:
    4326             :       case tk_nullptr:
    4327             :         make_zero_of_proper_type(type, zero_con);
    4328             :         con = move_local_constant_to_il(&zero_con);
    4329             :         break;
    4330             :       case tk_array:
    4331             :         check_assertion(!type->variant.array.is_variable_size_array &&
    4332             :                         !type->variant.array.is_template_dependent_size_array);
    4333             :         con = make_list_of_zeroes(
    4334             :                                type->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements,
    4335             :                                array_element_type(type));
    4336             :         con->type = type;
    4337             :         break;
    4338             :       case tk_class:
    4339             :       case tk_struct:
    4340             :       case tk_union:
    4341             :         {
    4342             :           a_field_ptr    f;
    4343             :           a_constant_ptr field_con;
    4344             :           con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    4345             :           /* Note that we generate initializers for base classes,
    4346             :              virtual function table pointers, etc., because the class
    4347             :              is prelowered.  Make sure it is. */
    4348             :           prelower_class_type(type);
    4349             :           con->type = type;
    4350             :           for (f = next_initializable_field(
    4351             :                                   type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list);
    4352             :                f != NULL;
    4353             :                f = next_initializable_field(f->next)) {
    4354             :             field_con = lower_zero_initialization(f->type);
    4355             :             if (con->variant.aggregate.first_constant == NULL) {
    4356             :               con->variant.aggregate.first_constant = field_con;
    4357             :             } else {
    4358             :               con->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = field_con;
    4359             :             }  /* if */
    4360             :             con->variant.aggregate.last_constant = field_con;
    4361             :             /* Only the first field of a union type is zero-initialized.  */
    4362             :             if (is_union_type(type)) {
    4363             :               break;
    4364             :             }  /* if */
    4365             :           }  /* for */
    4366             :           break;
    4367             :         }
    4368             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
    4369             :       case tk_vector:
    4370             :         { a_type_ptr  etp = skip_typerefs(type->variant.vector.element_type);
    4371             :           check_assertion(!vector_type_is_template_dependent(type));
    4372             :           con = make_list_of_zeroes(type->size/etp->size, etp);
    4373             :           con->type = type;
    4374             :         }
    4375             :         break;
    4376             : #endif /* GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED */
    4377             :       default:
    4378             :         unexpected_condition();
    4379             :     }  /* switch */
    4380             :   }  /* if */
    4381             :   if (zero_con != NULL) {
    4382             :     /* If zero_con was not moved to the IL above, release it now. */
    4383             :     release_local_constant(&zero_con);
    4384             :   }  /* if */
    4385             :   return con;
    4386             : }  /* lower_zero_initialization */
    4387             : 
    4388             : 
    4389             : static void fill_out_aggregate_ptr_to_data_member_initialization(
    4390             :                                                        a_constant_ptr constant)
    4391             : /*
    4392             : The indicated aggregate constant is an initializer.  If it does not
    4393             : initialize some part of the aggregate, and that part contains pointers
    4394             : to data members, add initialization constants to ensure that the
    4395             : pointers to data members are properly initialized to -1 for NULL.
    4396             : */
    4397             : {
    4398             :   a_type_ptr type = skip_typerefs(constant->type);
    4399             :   a_constant_ptr cp;
    4400             : 
    4401             :   /* Note that we need not test for unions.  If they are not at all
    4402             :      initialized, they are handled by lower_zero_initialization, which
    4403             :      handles them correctly.  If they are partially initialized, the
    4404             :      first member is (at least partially) initialized, which is all we
    4405             :      need here. */
    4406             :   if (is_array_type(type) && contains_ptr_to_data_member(type)) {
    4407             :     a_targ_size_t elem = 0;
    4408             :     /* Count the number of elements that have been explicitly
    4409             :        initialized.  Note that they have previously been run through
    4410             :        this routine so they fully initialize any pointer to data
    4411             :        members. */
    4412             :     for (cp = constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant;
    4413             :          cp != NULL;
    4414             :          cp = cp->next) {
    4415             :       if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_init_repeat) {
    4416             :         elem += cp->variant.init_repeat.count;
    4417             :       } else {
    4418             :         ++elem;
    4419             :       }  /* if */
    4420             :     }  /* for */
    4421             :     /* Initialize the remaining elements. */
    4422             :     while (elem < type->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements) {
    4423             :       cp = lower_zero_initialization(array_element_type(type));
    4424             :       if (constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant == NULL) {
    4425             :         constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = cp;
    4426             :       } else {
    4427             :         constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = cp;
    4428             :       }  /* if */
    4429             :       constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = cp;
    4430             :       ++elem;
    4431             :     }  /* while */
    4432             :   } else if (is_class_or_struct(type)) {
    4433             :     a_field_ptr f;
    4434             : #if LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS
    4435             :     a_field_ptr first_f, last_f;
    4436             : #else /* !LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS */
    4437             :     a_constant_ptr prev_con, rest_of_list = NULL, end_of_list = NULL;
    4438             : #endif /* !LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS */
    4439             :     /* Note that we generate initializers for base classes,
    4440             :        virtual function table pointers, etc., because the class
    4441             :        is prelowered.  Make sure it is. */
    4442             :     prelower_class_type(type);
    4443             :     f = next_initializable_field(type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list);
    4444             : #if LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS
    4445             :     /* Skip over the initialized fields.  Note that they have previously
    4446             :        been run through this routine so they fully initialize any pointer
    4447             :        to data members. */
    4448             :     for (cp = constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant;
    4449             :          cp != NULL;
    4450             :          cp = cp->next) {
    4451             :       check_assertion(f != NULL);
    4452             :       f = next_initializable_field(f->next);
    4453             :     }  /* for */
    4454             :     /* At this point f points to the first field that is uninitialized. */
    4455             :     first_f = f;
    4456             :     /* Find the last uninitialized field containing a pointer to data
    4457             :        member. */
    4458             :     last_f = NULL;
    4459             :     while (f != NULL) {
    4460             :       if (contains_ptr_to_data_member(f->type)) {
    4461             :         last_f = f;
    4462             :       }  /* if */
    4463             :       f = next_initializable_field(f->next);
    4464             :     }  /* while */
    4465             :     /* Create initializers for the uninitialized fields until we get to
    4466             :        the last field that contains a pointer to data member. */
    4467             :     if (last_f != NULL) {
    4468             :       f = first_f;
    4469             :       for (;;) {
    4470             :         cp = lower_zero_initialization(f->type);
    4471             :         if (constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant == NULL) {
    4472             :           constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = cp;
    4473             :         } else {
    4474             :           constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = cp;
    4475             :         }  /* if */
    4476             :         constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = cp;
    4477             :         if (f == last_f) {
    4478             :           break;
    4479             :         }  /* if */
    4480             :         f = next_initializable_field(f->next);
    4481             :       }  /* for */
    4482             :     }  /* if */
    4483             : #else /* !LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS */
    4484             :     /* Designated initializers are not being lowered, so some might appear on
    4485             :        the list. */
    4486             :     /* Skip over the initialized fields.  Note that they have previously
    4487             :        been run through this routine so they fully initialize any pointer
    4488             :        to data members. */
    4489             :     for (prev_con = NULL, cp = constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant;
    4490             :          cp != NULL;
    4491             :          prev_con = cp, cp = cp->next) {
    4492             :       if (cp->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_designator) {
    4493             :         /* If a designator is encountered, save the rest of the list off
    4494             :            to the side, generate initializers for any pointer-to-member
    4495             :            members following this point, and put the rest of the list back on
    4496             :            at the end. */
    4497             :         rest_of_list = cp;
    4498             :         if (prev_con == NULL) {
    4499             :           constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = NULL;
    4500             :         } else {
    4501             :           prev_con->next = NULL;
    4502             :         }  /* if */
    4503             :         end_of_list = constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant;
    4504             :         constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = prev_con;
    4505             :         break;
    4506             :       }  /* if */
    4507             :       f = next_initializable_field(f->next);
    4508             :     }  /* for */
    4509             :     /* Look for so-far uninitialized fields that contain pointers to
    4510             :        members and put out designators initializing them to "zero". */
    4511             :     while (f != NULL) {
    4512             :       if (contains_ptr_to_data_member(f->type)) {
    4513             :         a_constant_ptr descp = alloc_constant(
    4514             :                                           (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_designator);
    4515             :         descp->variant.designator.variant.field = f;
    4516             :         cp = lower_zero_initialization(f->type);
    4517             :         descp->next = cp;
    4518             :         if (constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant == NULL) {
    4519             :           constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = descp;
    4520             :         } else {
    4521             :           constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = descp;
    4522             :         }  /* if */
    4523             :         constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = cp;
    4524             :       }  /* if */
    4525             :       f = next_initializable_field(f->next);
    4526             :     }  /* while */
    4527             :     if (rest_of_list != NULL) {
    4528             :       /* Replace the end of the list, which starts with a designator. */
    4529             :       if (constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant == NULL) {
    4530             :         constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant = rest_of_list;
    4531             :       } else {
    4532             :         constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = rest_of_list;
    4533             :       }  /* if */
    4534             :       constant->variant.aggregate.last_constant = end_of_list;
    4535             :     }  /* if */
    4536             : #endif /* !LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS */
    4537             :   }  /* if */
    4538             : }  /* fill_out_aggregate_ptr_to_data_member_initialization */
    4539             : 
    4540             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    4541             : 
    4542             : #if ASSIGN_STRING_LITERAL_SEQUENCE_NUMBERS
    4543             : 
    4544             : static a_variable_ptr get_variable_for_string_constant(a_constant_ptr constant)
    4545             : /*
    4546             : constant is a string literal whose string constant has sequence_number != 0.
    4547             : Create and return a static variable initialized with the string,
    4548             : and associate the variable with the constant.  If a variable has already
    4549             : been associated with this constant, return it rather than creating a new
    4550             : variable.
    4551             : */
    4552             : {
    4553             :   a_variable_ptr string_var;
    4554             : 
    4555             :   check_assertion(constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string &&
    4556             :                   constant->variant.string.sequence_number != 0);
    4557             :   /* See if the variable has been allocated already.  If so, a pointer to
    4558             :      the variable will have been stored in the constant. */
    4559             :   if (constant->assoc_var != NULL) {
    4560             :     string_var = constant->assoc_var;
    4561             :   } else {
    4562             :     /* The variable must be allocated.  We make a local static variable
    4563             :        and then promote it to get it processed like other local static
    4564             :        variables. */
    4565             :     a_routine_ptr          routine;
    4566             :     a_type_ptr             constant_type = constant->type;
    4567             :     a_memory_region_number region_to_switch_back_to = curr_il_region_number;
    4568             :     check_assertion(innermost_function_scope != NULL);
    4569             :     routine = innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr;
    4570             : #if LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST
    4571             :     if (string_literals_are_const && is_const_qualified_type(constant_type)) {
    4572             :       /* The expression on top of this has already stripped the const
    4573             :          qualification, so make sure the variable type matches. */
    4574             :       constant_type = make_unqualified_type(constant_type);
    4575             :     }  /* if */
    4576             : #endif /* LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST */
    4577             :     switch_il_region(mem_region_for_routine(routine));
    4578             :     string_var = make_lowered_variable((char *)NULL,
    4579             :                                        /*already_il_name=*/TRUE,
    4580             :                                        constant_type,
    4581             :                                        (a_storage_class)sc_static);
    4582             :     check_assertion(!in_file_scope(constant));
    4583             :     /* Use a local static variable init entry to point to the constant
    4584             :        in the function scope memory region. */
    4585             :     (void)make_local_static_variable_init(string_var, 
    4586             :                                           innermost_function_scope,
    4587             :                                           (an_init_kind)initk_static,
    4588             :                                           constant,
    4589             :                                           (a_dynamic_init_ptr)NULL);
    4590             :     /* Promote the variable out of the function, and make it external
    4591             :        if that's appropriate. */
    4592             :     promote_static_variable_out_of_function(string_var,
    4593             :                                             innermost_function_scope,
    4594             :                                             routine);
    4595             :     switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
    4596             :     /* Save the pointer in the constant so the variable can be reused. */
    4597             :     constant->assoc_var = string_var;
    4598             :   }  /* if */
    4599             :   return string_var;
    4600             : }  /* get_variable_for_string_constant */
    4601             : 
    4602             : 
    4603             : static void rewrite_string_constant_as_variable(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    4604             : /*
    4605             : expr is an lvalue expression for a constant string literal whose string
    4606             : constant has sequence_number != 0.  Create a static variable initialized with
    4607             : the string, and change expr to be an lvalue for that variable.  This is used
    4608             : for string literals that must have the same address across translation units
    4609             : (e.g., those in extern inline functions).
    4610             : */
    4611             : {
    4612             :   a_constant_ptr string_con;
    4613             : 
    4614             :   check_assertion(expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_constant &&
    4615             :                   expr->is_lvalue);
    4616             :   string_con = node_constant(expr);
    4617             :   check_assertion(string_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string &&
    4618             :                   string_con->variant.string.sequence_number != 0);
    4619             :   set_expr_node_kind(expr, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_variable);
    4620             :   node_variable(expr) = get_variable_for_string_constant(string_con);
    4621             : }  /* rewrite_string_constant_as_variable */
    4622             : 
    4623             : 
    4624             : void rewrite_address_of_string_as_address_of_variable(a_constant_ptr addr_con)
    4625             : /*
    4626             : addr_con is an address constant for the address of a string literal,
    4627             : and the string constant has sequence_number != 0.  Create a static
    4628             : variable initialized with the string, and change addr_con to be the
    4629             : address of that variable.  This is used for string literals that
    4630             : must have the same address across translation units (e.g., those
    4631             : in extern inline functions).
    4632             : */
    4633             : {
    4634             :   a_constant_ptr   string_con;
    4635             :   a_variable_ptr   assoc_var;
    4636             :   a_constant_ptr   orig_con = local_constant();
    4637             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t offset;
    4638             : 
    4639             :   *orig_con = *addr_con;
    4640             :   check_assertion(addr_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
    4641             :                   addr_con->variant.address.kind ==
    4642             :                                            (an_address_base_kind)abk_constant);
    4643             :   string_con = addr_con->variant.address.variant.constant;
    4644             :   check_assertion(string_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string &&
    4645             :                   string_con->variant.string.sequence_number != 0);
    4646             :   /* Save the offset (if any). */
    4647             :   offset = addr_con->variant.address.offset;
    4648             :   /* Get the variable associated with this string or make a variable
    4649             :      if none has been allocated yet. */
    4650             :   assoc_var = get_variable_for_string_constant(string_con);
    4651             :   /* Rewrite the original constant as the address of the variable. */
    4652             :   set_variable_address_constant(assoc_var, addr_con,
    4653             :                                 /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    4654             :   /* Restore the offset (if any). */
    4655             :   addr_con->variant.address.offset = offset;
    4656             :   if (orig_con->implicit_cast) {
    4657             :     /* The original constant was cast to a different type, e.g.,
    4658             :        because its type decayed to a pointer. */
    4659             :     implicit_cast(addr_con, orig_con->type);
    4660             :   }  /* if */
    4661             :   addr_con->next = orig_con->next;
    4662             :   release_local_constant(&orig_con);
    4663             : }  /* rewrite_address_of_string_as_address_of_variable */
    4664             : 
    4665             : #endif /* ASSIGN_STRING_LITERAL_SEQUENCE_NUMBERS */
    4666             : 
    4667             : static void lower_typeid_constant(a_constant_ptr typeid_con)
    4668             : /*
    4669             : Lower a ck_address/abk_typeid constant: Its value is the address of the
    4670             : std::typeinfo object returned by the corresponding typeid(...) construct.
    4671             : */
    4672             : {
    4673             :   a_type_ptr     typeid_type = typeid_con->variant.address.variant.type;
    4674             :   a_type_ptr     orig_con_type = typeid_con->type;
    4675             :   a_source_correspondence
    4676             :                  orig_source_corresp;
    4677             :   a_variable_ptr typeinfo_var;
    4678             :   a_constant_ptr next_con = typeid_con->next;
    4679             : 
    4680             :   orig_source_corresp = typeid_con->source_corresp;
    4681             :   /* Create the initialized std::type_info variable for the type, if it doesn't
    4682             :      exist already. */
    4683             :   typeinfo_var = get_typeinfo_var(typeid_type);
    4684             :   /* Replace the constant with one that is the address of the std::type_info
    4685             :      variable, cast to the right type.  The cast is needed at least
    4686             :      to add "const", but it also covers any mismatch between the runtime
    4687             :      idea of std::type_info and the actual declaration in the user's source. */
    4688             :   set_variable_address_constant(typeinfo_var, typeid_con,
    4689             :                                 /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    4690             :   implicit_cast(typeid_con, orig_con_type);
    4691             :   typeid_con->source_corresp = orig_source_corresp;
    4692             :   typeid_con->next = next_con;
    4693             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    4694             :   /* If the constant has already been marked as needed, mark it as
    4695             :      needed again and visit its new subtree. */
    4696             :   remark_as_needed((char *)typeid_con, iek_constant);
    4697             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    4698             : }  /* lower_typeid_constant */
    4699             : 
    4700             : /*
    4701             : A couple of static variables used to "pass" information from
    4702             : prelower_aggregate_constant to prelower_class_in_aggregate.
    4703             : */
    4704             : static an_init_pos_descr_ptr
    4705             :                 prelower_aggr_con_ipdp;
    4706             :                         /* An initialization position description for
    4707             :                            the aggregate constant that is being prelowered. */
    4708             : 
    4709             : static an_insert_location
    4710             :                 *prelower_aggr_con_insert_location;
    4711             :                         /* An insert location for the aggregate constant that
    4712             :                            is being prelowered. */
    4713             : 
    4714             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- tblock is not used. */
    4715             : static void prelower_class_in_aggregate(
    4716             :                                       a_constant_ptr                  constant,
    4717             :                                       an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block *tblock)
    4718             : /*
    4719             : Called during a constant traversal to pre-lower the specified constant
    4720             : (if it's an aggregate).  The aggregate constants that are generated for
    4721             : class/struct/unions by the front end reflect the canonical layout and don't
    4722             : account for empty base classes that have been removed, layout re-ordering, or
    4723             : the insertion of pointers to virtual tables.  This routine massages the
    4724             : aggregate constant so that it will match the lowered layout.  Note that
    4725             : sub-aggregates in the constant will have their empty base classes removed and
    4726             : any base classes will have their vptrs initialized (as needed), but this
    4727             : routine itself is not recursive (relying instead on the caller).
    4728             : The routines invoked herein avoid unnecessary processing by setting flags
    4729             : in the constants that they've previously processed.
    4730             : */
    4731             : {
    4732             :   if (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate) {
    4733             :     a_type_ptr  con_type = skip_typerefs(constant->type);
    4734             :     check_assertion(!constant->has_been_prelowered);
    4735             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(con_type)) {
    4736             :       prelower_class_type(con_type);
    4737             :       /* Remove any initializers that the front end may have added for
    4738             :          empty base classes.  Do this before vptrs are inserted below. */
    4739             :       remove_initializers_for_empty_base_classes(constant,
    4740             :                                             prelower_aggr_con_ipdp,
    4741             :                                             prelower_aggr_con_insert_location);
    4742             :       if (constant->is_result_of_constexpr_call &&
    4743             :           !constant->vptr_has_been_lowered) {
    4744             :         /* Initialize any __vptr fields if they exist in the aggregate.  This
    4745             :            must be completed before the individual pieces of the aggregate
    4746             :            are themselves lowered, as well as before any designated
    4747             :            initializers are lowered. */
    4748             :         initialize_vptrs_in_class(skip_typerefs(constant->type),
    4749             :                                   (a_variable_ptr)NULL, (a_variable_ptr)NULL,
    4750             :                                   constant, (an_insert_location *)NULL);
    4751             :       }  /* if */
    4752             :     }  /* if */
    4753             :     constant->has_been_prelowered = TRUE;
    4754             :   }  /* if */
    4755             : }  /* prelower_class_in_aggregate */
    4756             : 
    4757             : 
    4758             : void prelower_aggregate_constant(a_constant_ptr        constant,
    4759             :                                  an_init_pos_descr_ptr ipdp,
    4760             :                                  an_insert_location    *insert_location)
    4761             : /*
    4762             : The aggregate constants that are generated for class/struct/unions by the
    4763             : front end reflect the canonical layout and don't account for empty base classes
    4764             : that have been removed, layout re-ordering, or the insertion of pointers to
    4765             : virtual tables.  This routine pre-lowers the specified constant and any
    4766             : aggregate constants it contains.  Pre-lowering is only needed once (and skipped
    4767             : if the constant has already been pre-lowered or in C mode).
    4768             : 
    4769             : If the aggregate constant contains dynamic initialization for optimized empty
    4770             : base classes, ipdp should point to the initialization position for the
    4771             : aggregate constant and insert_location to the location where generated code
    4772             : should be placed.  These parameters can be NULL if there is no dynamic
    4773             : initialization in the constant.
    4774             : */
    4775             : {
    4776             :   an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
    4777             : 
    4778             :   check_assertion(constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    4779             :   if (!C_mode() && !constant->has_been_prelowered) {
    4780             :     clear_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block(&tblock);
    4781             :     tblock.process_constant = prelower_class_in_aggregate;
    4782             :     prelower_aggr_con_ipdp = ipdp;
    4783             :     prelower_aggr_con_insert_location = insert_location;
    4784             :     traverse_constant(constant, &tblock);
    4785             :   }  /* if */
    4786             : }  /* prelower_aggregate_constant */
    4787             : 
    4788             : 
    4789             : void lower_constant(a_constant_ptr constant)
    4790             : /*
    4791             : Do IL lowering of the indicated constant and everything under it.
    4792             : Note that the constant must be in the IL and not on the stack (because the
    4793             : IL prefix is accessed).
    4794             : */
    4795             : {
    4796             :   a_variable_ptr temp_var;
    4797             :   a_constant_ptr addressed_con;
    4798             : 
    4799             :   if (!visited_yet(constant) && !ignore_constant_in_back_end(constant)) {
    4800             :     mark_as_visited(constant);
    4801             :     lower_source_correspondence(&constant->source_corresp);
    4802             :     if (constant->type != NULL) lower_os_type(constant->type);
    4803             :     /* Leave constant->expr unlowered if it is present. */
    4804             :     switch (constant->kind) {
    4805             :       case ck_integer:
    4806             :       case ck_float:
    4807             :       case ck_designator:
    4808             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4809             :       case ck_label_difference:
    4810             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4811             :       case ck_void:
    4812             :         /* No handling required. */
    4813             :         break;
    4814             :       case ck_init_repeat:
    4815             :         /* Make sure the repeated constant is lowered. */
    4816             :         lower_constant(constant->variant.init_repeat.constant);
    4817             :         break;
    4818             :       case ck_string:
    4819             : #if LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST
    4820             :         if (string_literals_are_const &&
    4821             :             is_const_qualified_type(constant->type)) {
    4822             :           /* If string literals are const qualified by the C++ front end,
    4823             :              the const qualification is removed here.  Adjustments to
    4824             :              the types of eok_address_of or eok_array_to_pointer nodes
    4825             :              (as well as any ck_address nodes) have already been made. */
    4826             :           constant->type = make_unqualified_type(constant->type);
    4827             :         }  /* if */
    4828             : #endif /* LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST */
    4829             :         break;
    4830             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
    4831             :       case ck_complex:
    4832             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
    4833             :         /* coverity[var_deref_model] */
    4834             :         lower_c99_complex_constant(constant);
    4835             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
    4836             :         break;
    4837             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
    4838             :       case ck_address:
    4839             :         switch (constant->variant.address.kind) {
    4840             :           case abk_variable:
    4841             :           case abk_label:
    4842             :             /* Variables and labels will have appeared on
    4843             :                lists attached to some scope. */
    4844             :             break;
    4845             :           case abk_routine:
    4846             : #if GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
    4847             :             { a_routine_ptr rp = constant->variant.address.variant.routine;
    4848             :               if (is_multiversion_representative(rp)) {
    4849             :                 /* Replace a representative routine with a target-specific
    4850             :                    version if one is available. */
    4851             :                 constant->variant.address.variant.routine =
    4852             :                                                         lowered_mv_routine(rp);
    4853             :               }  /* if */
    4854             :             }
    4855             : #endif /* GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    4856             :             break;
    4857             :           case abk_constant:
    4858             :             addressed_con = constant->variant.address.variant.constant;
    4859             : #if LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST
    4860             :             if (string_literals_are_const &&
    4861             :                 addressed_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string) {
    4862             :               /* This ck_string constant is about to be lowered from
    4863             :                  a const qualified string to a non-const qualified string,
    4864             :                  so make sure the implicit_cast field is set (if it
    4865             :                  isn't already). */
    4866             :               constant->implicit_cast = TRUE; 
    4867             :             }  /* if */
    4868             : #endif /* LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST */
    4869             :             lower_os_constant(addressed_con);
    4870             : #if ASSIGN_STRING_LITERAL_SEQUENCE_NUMBERS
    4871             :             if (addressed_con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string &&
    4872             :                 !constant->is_result_of_constexpr_call) {
    4873             :               /* Address of a string literal. */
    4874             :               if (addressed_con->variant.string.sequence_number != 0) {
    4875             :                 /* This string must be the same across multiple translation
    4876             :                    units (e.g., a string in an extern inline function).
    4877             :                    Create a variable for it. */
    4878             :                 rewrite_address_of_string_as_address_of_variable(constant);
    4879             :               }  /* if */
    4880             :             } else
    4881             : #endif /* ASSIGN_STRING_LITERAL_SEQUENCE_NUMBERS */
    4882             :             /* Do not insert code here. */
    4883             :             if (check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant(addressed_con,
    4884             :                                                          &temp_var)) {
    4885             :               /* This constant node is using the address of a pointer-to-
    4886             :                  member-function constant, which has or will become a
    4887             :                  struct represented by a ck_aggregate constant.  Since a
    4888             :                  ck_aggregate constant is not allowed here, use the address
    4889             :                  of a temporary variable initialized with the ck_aggregate
    4890             :                  constant. */
    4891             :               set_variable_address_constant_preserving_implicit_cast(
    4892             :                                               temp_var,
    4893             :                                               constant,
    4894             :                                               /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    4895             :             }  /* if */
    4896             :             break;
    4897             :           case abk_temporary:
    4898             :             /* Re-write an abk_temporary with the address of a static
    4899             :                temporary that is created. */
    4900             :             addressed_con = constant->variant.address.variant.constant;
    4901             :             check_assertion(addressed_con->kind !=
    4902             :                                               (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string);
    4903             :             lower_os_constant(addressed_con);
    4904             :             temp_var = assoc_var_for_constant(addressed_con,
    4905             :                                               /*const_okay=*/FALSE);
    4906             :             set_variable_address_constant_preserving_implicit_cast(
    4907             :                                               temp_var,
    4908             :                                               constant,
    4909             :                                               /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    4910             :             break;
    4911             :           case abk_uuidof:
    4912             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4913             :             lower_uuidof(constant);
    4914             : #else /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4915             :             unexpected_condition_str("lower_constant: abk_uuidof");
    4916             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4917             :             break;
    4918             :           case abk_typeid:
    4919             :             lower_typeid_constant(constant);
    4920             :             break;
    4921             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4922             :           case abk_cli_typeid:
    4923             :             unexpected_condition_str("lower_constant: abk_cli_typeid");
    4924             :             break;
    4925             :           case abk_cli_array:
    4926             :             unexpected_condition_str("lower_constant: abk_cli_array");
    4927             :             break;
    4928             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4929             :           default:
    4930             :             unexpected_condition_str(
    4931             :                                   "lower_constant: bad address constant kind");
    4932             :         }  /* switch */
    4933             :         break;
    4934             :       case ck_ptr_to_member:
    4935             :         lower_ptr_to_member_constant(constant);
    4936             :         break;
    4937             :       case ck_aggregate:
    4938             :         /* Make any necessary changes in constant so that it corresponds to
    4939             :            the fields in the lowered type. */
    4940             :         prelower_aggregate_constant(constant, (an_init_pos_descr_ptr)NULL,
    4941             :                                     (an_insert_location*)NULL);
    4942             : #if LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS
    4943             :         /* Re-write any designated initializers in the aggregate constant. */
    4944             :         lower_designated_initializers(constant,
    4945             :                                       (a_dynamic_init *)NULL,
    4946             :                                       (a_type_ptr)NULL);
    4947             : #endif /* LOWER_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZERS */
    4948             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
    4949             :         if (is_complex_type(constant->type)) {
    4950             :           /* GNU allows the use of aggregate syntax to initialize the real
    4951             :              and imaginary portions of a complex object.  Convert the
    4952             :              aggregate constant to the proper format before lowering. */
    4953             :           lower_c99_complex_aggregate_constant(constant);
    4954             :         }  /* if */
    4955             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
    4956             :         lower_constant_list(constant->variant.aggregate.first_constant);
    4957             : #if IA64_ABI
    4958             :         fill_out_aggregate_ptr_to_data_member_initialization(constant);
    4959             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    4960             :         break;
    4961             :       case ck_template_param:
    4962             :         /* Template parameter constants are left unlowered. */
    4963             :         break;
    4964             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES && !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
    4965             :       case ck_stack_offset:
    4966             :         /* Shouldn't come up here. */
    4967             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES && ... */
    4968             : #if FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED
    4969             :       case ck_fixed_point:
    4970             :         /* Shouldn't come up here: Fixed-point types are not currently
    4971             :            allowed in C++ modes. */
    4972             : #endif /* FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED */
    4973             :       case ck_dynamic_init:
    4974             :         /* Shouldn't come up here.  See
    4975             :            lower_dynamic_init_aggregate_constant. */
    4976             :       default:
    4977             :         unexpected_condition_str("lower_constant: bad kind");
    4978             :     }  /* switch */
    4979             :   }  /* if */
    4980             : }  /* lower_constant */
    4981             : 
    4982             : 
    4983             : void lower_os_constant(a_constant_ptr constant)
    4984             : /*
    4985             : A "possibly other scope" version of lower_constant; does nothing for
    4986             : constants in other scopes.
    4987             : */
    4988             : {
    4989             :   if (crossing_into_file_scope(constant)) {
    4990             :     /* Don't follow a pointer from the function scope into the file scope;
    4991             :        record it as a potential orphan instead. */
    4992             :     if (constant->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
    4993             :         constant->variant.address.kind == (an_address_base_kind)abk_typeid) {
    4994             :       /* The lowering of a typeid constant involves creating a typeinfo
    4995             :          variable for the specific type, which in turn requires a mangled
    4996             :          name for the type, which requires that the type be unlowered.  In
    4997             :          some configurations, for some (notably function) types, lowering of
    4998             :          an orphaned typeid constant can occur after the type has been lowered,
    4999             :          causing an assertion failure during mangling.  Generate the
    5000             :          typeinfo variable now to avoid this issue. */
    5001             :       (void)make_typeinfo_var(constant->variant.address.variant.type);
    5002             :     }  /* if */
    5003             :     possibly_add_orphaned_file_scope_il_entry((char *)constant, iek_constant);
    5004             :   } else {
    5005             :     lower_constant(constant);
    5006             :   }  /* if */
    5007             : }  /* lower_os_constant */
    5008             : 
    5009             : 
    5010             : void set_virtual_function_table_name(a_variable_ptr   vtbl_var,
    5011             :                                      a_type_ptr       class_type,
    5012             :                                      a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    5013             :                                      a_base_class_ptr ctor_bcp)
    5014             : /*
    5015             : Set the mangled name of the virtual function table variable vtbl_var.
    5016             : class_type, bcp, and ctor_bcp are as for make_var_for_virtual_function_table.
    5017             : */
    5018             : {
    5019             :   char     *name = mangled_vtbl_name(class_type, bcp, ctor_bcp);
    5020             :   sizeof_t length = strlen(name);
    5021             : 
    5022             :   vtbl_var->source_corresp.name = 
    5023             :                              strcpy(alloc_lowered_name_string(length+1), name);
    5024             :   vtbl_var->source_corresp.name_has_been_mangled = TRUE;
    5025             : }  /* set_virtual_function_table_name */
    5026             : 
    5027             : 
    5028             : a_variable_ptr make_var_for_virtual_function_table(a_type_ptr       class_type,
    5029             :                                                    a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    5030             :                                                    a_base_class_ptr ctor_bcp)
    5031             : /*
    5032             : Create the variable to contain the virtual function table for base class bcp
    5033             : when it appears in a complete object of type class_type.  If bcp is NULL,
    5034             : create the variable for the virtual function table for the class_type itself.
    5035             : If ctor_bcp is non-NULL, it is the base class for class_type as a subobject
    5036             : of some larger class type that is the actual complete object type (used
    5037             : in determining layout); class_type in that case is the type considered
    5038             : to be the complete object type for purposes of overriding (this is used
    5039             : during constructors and destructors).  The variable is an array of structs,
    5040             : each of which describes one virtual function.  At this point, the variable
    5041             : is created as an extern variable.  It might be changed later to add a
    5042             : definition.
    5043             : */
    5044             : {
    5045             :   a_type_ptr     array_type;
    5046             :   a_variable_ptr vtbl_var;
    5047             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr
    5048             :                  ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    5049             : 
    5050             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    5051             :   a_boolean      type_info_case = FALSE;
    5052             :   a_type_info_kind
    5053             :                  type_info_kind;
    5054             :   /* If the class is one of the user-visible type_info types, save
    5055             :      the vtbl pointer for use by the EH lowering routines, or use the
    5056             :      variable created by the EH routines. */
    5057             :   type_info_kind = is_type_info_type(class_type);
    5058             :   if (type_info_kind != tik_last && bcp == NULL) {
    5059             :     type_info_case = TRUE;
    5060             :     if (vtbls_for_type_info[(int)type_info_kind] != NULL) {
    5061             :       /* The virtual function table was already allocated by EH lowering. */
    5062             :       vtbl_var = vtbls_for_type_info[(int)type_info_kind];
    5063             :       goto have_vtbl_var;
    5064             :     }  /* if */
    5065             :   }  /* if */
    5066             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    5067             :   /* Make an array of virtual table entries.  The size is [] until the virtual
    5068             :      function table is defined, if it ever is in this compilation. */
    5069             :   /* Note that the array type must not be shared, because it is modified
    5070             :      later. */
    5071             :   array_type = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_array);
    5072             :   array_type->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements = 0;  /* i.e., [] */
    5073             :   array_type->variant.array.element_type =
    5074             :                          make_qualified_type(make_vtbl_entry_type(), TQ_CONST);
    5075             :   set_type_size(array_type);
    5076             :   /* Make the variable. */
    5077             :   /* Note that the variable is made with extern storage class; it might
    5078             :      be changed to internal linkage later, but the name linkage in the
    5079             :      class at this time is not necessarily its final value, so we can't
    5080             :      know the right storage class yet.  extern is the right value for
    5081             :      cases where the definition is not put out, and if the definition
    5082             :      is put out (and it always is for internally-linked classes) the
    5083             :      storage class is adjusted at that point. */
    5084             :   /* The mangled name is set later.  We don't want to force determination
    5085             :      of the module id too early. */
    5086             :   vtbl_var = make_lowered_variable((char *)NULL, /*already_il_name=*/TRUE,
    5087             :                                    array_type, (a_storage_class)sc_extern);
    5088             :   /* make_lowered_variable creates a variable with referenced set TRUE, but the
    5089             :      variable is not necessarily going to be referenced, so clear the
    5090             :      flag. */
    5091             :   vtbl_var->source_corresp.referenced = FALSE;
    5092             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5093             :   if ((ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) != 0) {
    5094             :     /* Set any required dllimport/dllexport attributes.  If the storage class
    5095             :        of the virtual table changes, we will need to update this again. */
    5096             :     vtbl_var->decl_modifiers |= (ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS);
    5097             :   }  /* if */
    5098             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5099             : #if GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
    5100             :   vtbl_var->ELF_visibility = ctsp->ELF_visibility;
    5101             : #endif /* GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
    5102             : #if SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    5103             :   if ((ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE) != 0) {
    5104             :     /* Set any required __global/__symbolic/__hidden attributes.  If the
    5105             :        storage class of the virtual table changes, we will need to update
    5106             :        this again. */
    5107             :     vtbl_var->decl_modifiers |= (ctsp->decl_modifiers & DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE);
    5108             :   }  /* if */
    5109             : #endif /* SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    5110             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    5111             :   /* If this is the virtual function table for type_info, remember it for
    5112             :      the use of EH lowering. */
    5113             :   if (type_info_case) vtbls_for_type_info[(int)type_info_kind] = vtbl_var;
    5114             : have_vtbl_var:;
    5115             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    5116             :   /* Remember the variable in the class type supplement or the base class
    5117             :      entry so it can be found when constructor/destructor lowering is done. */
    5118             :   if (ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    5119             :     /* This is a special construction virtual function table that gets
    5120             :        recorded elsewhere. */
    5121             :   } else if (bcp == NULL) {
    5122             :     ctsp->virtual_function_table_var = vtbl_var;
    5123             :   } else {
    5124             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5125             :     bcp->virtual_function_table_var = vtbl_var;
    5126             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    5127             :     /* In the IA64 ABI there are no base class virtual function table
    5128             :        variables. */
    5129             :     unexpected_condition();
    5130             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5131             :   }  /* if */
    5132             :   return vtbl_var;
    5133             : }  /* make_var_for_virtual_function_table */
    5134             : 
    5135             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
    5136             : 
    5137             : #if DEBUG
    5138             : /*
    5139             : Count of entries allocated, for debugging purposes.
    5140             : */
    5141             : static unsigned long
    5142             :                 num_construction_vtbls_allocated;
    5143             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5144             : 
    5145             : 
    5146             : static a_construction_vtbl_ptr alloc_construction_vtbl(void)
    5147             : /*
    5148             : Allocate an entry of type a_construction_vtbl, clear its fields to default
    5149             : values, and return a pointer to it.
    5150             : */
    5151             : {
    5152             :   a_construction_vtbl_ptr cvp;
    5153             : 
    5154             :   cvp = (a_construction_vtbl_ptr)alloc_fe(sizeof(a_construction_vtbl));
    5155             : #if DEBUG
    5156             :   num_construction_vtbls_allocated++;
    5157             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5158             :   cvp->next = NULL;
    5159             :   cvp->variant.base_class = NULL;
    5160             :   cvp->ctor_base_class = NULL;
    5161             :   cvp->virtual_function_table_var = NULL;
    5162             : #if IA64_ABI
    5163             :   cvp->virtual_function_table_index = 0;
    5164             :   cvp->is_subobject = TRUE;
    5165             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5166             : 
    5167             :   return cvp;
    5168             : }  /* alloc_construction_vtbl */
    5169             : 
    5170             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5171             : 
    5172             : static a_boolean base_class_has_override_on_virtual_step(a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    5173             : /*
    5174             : Return TRUE if the indicated base class has any virtual functions that are
    5175             : overridden in such a way that there is a virtual base class step between
    5176             : the class of the overridden function and the class of the overriding
    5177             : function.
    5178             : */
    5179             : {
    5180             :   a_boolean has_override = FALSE;
    5181             :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr
    5182             :             overrides = bcp->overriding_virtual_functions;
    5183             : 
    5184             :   if (overrides != NULL && any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(bcp)) {
    5185             :     if (bcp->is_virtual) {
    5186             :       /* The base class of the primary function is a virtual base class,
    5187             :          so by definition there is a virtual step between that and
    5188             :          the class of any overriding function. */
    5189             :       has_override = TRUE;
    5190             :     } else {
    5191             :       for (; overrides != NULL; overrides = overrides->next) {
    5192             :         /* See if there is a virtual step between the class of the
    5193             :            overridden function and the class of the primary function.
    5194             :            Since bcp is not virtual here (that case was handled
    5195             :            above), there is a single derivation under bcp.  Walk
    5196             :            that derivation path and see if we encounter the class of
    5197             :            the overriding function.  If not, the overriding function
    5198             :            class must appear in a virtual hop and therefore there
    5199             :            is a virtual step between the overriding and overridden
    5200             :            function classes. */
    5201             :         a_base_class_ptr overriding_bcp = overrides->base_class;
    5202             :         if (overriding_bcp == NULL) {
    5203             :           /* The overriding function is in the current class, so the
    5204             :              derivation has a virtual step. */
    5205             :           has_override = TRUE;
    5206             :           break;
    5207             :         } else {
    5208             :           a_derivation_step_ptr step;
    5209             :           for (step = bcp->derivation->path;
    5210             :                step != NULL;
    5211             :                step = step->next) {
    5212             :             if (step->base_class->type == overriding_bcp->type) {
    5213             :               /* We encountered the overriding class, so there is no
    5214             :                  virtual step. */
    5215             :               goto outer_loop;
    5216             :             }  /* if */
    5217             :           }  /* for */
    5218             :           /* We didn't encounter the overriding class, so there must
    5219             :              be a virtual step. */
    5220             :           has_override = TRUE;
    5221             :           break;
    5222             : outer_loop:;
    5223             :         }  /* if */
    5224             :       }  /* for */
    5225             :     }  /* if */
    5226             :   }  /* if */
    5227             :   if (!has_override) {
    5228             :     a_base_class_ptr sharing_bcp = bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.
    5229             :                                   extra_info->virtual_function_info_base_class;
    5230             : 
    5231             :     if (sharing_bcp != NULL) {
    5232             :       /* This base class shares a virtual function table pointer with one
    5233             :          of its base classes, so look at the override list for that base
    5234             :          class to see if any of the functions there are overridden across
    5235             :          virtual steps. */
    5236             :       /* The sharing_bcp may be an indirect base class, but go down to
    5237             :          it one step at a time. */
    5238             :       sharing_bcp = sharing_bcp->derivation->path->base_class;
    5239             :       sharing_bcp = corresponding_base_class(sharing_bcp, bcp->derived_class,
    5240             :                                              bcp);
    5241             :       if (base_class_has_override_on_virtual_step(sharing_bcp)) {
    5242             :         has_override = TRUE;
    5243             :       }  /* if */
    5244             :     }  /* if */
    5245             :   }  /* if */
    5246             :   return has_override;
    5247             : }  /*  base_class_has_override_on_virtual_step */
    5248             : 
    5249             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    5250             : 
    5251             : static a_base_class_ptr find_base_sharing_virtual_function_table(
    5252             :                                                      a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    5253             :                                                      a_base_class_ptr ctor_bcp)
    5254             : /* 
    5255             : bcp is a base class for which shares_virtual_function_info is TRUE.  Find the
    5256             : most derived class with which the virtual function table in bcp is shared
    5257             : and return that base class, or NULL if the base class shares its virtual
    5258             : function table with bcp->derived_class.  If ctor_bcp is non-NULL, the
    5259             : actual complete object being constructed is ctor_bcp->derived_class;
    5260             : that's used to see whether virtual base classes fall inside the
    5261             : subobject being built.  If they don't, then they don't share a
    5262             : virtual function table pointer with the next class up.
    5263             : */
    5264             : {
    5265             :   a_base_class_ptr derived, temp_bcp;
    5266             : 
    5267             :   check_assertion(bcp->shares_virtual_function_info);
    5268             :   while (bcp->shares_virtual_function_info) {
    5269             :     if (bcp->is_virtual && ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    5270             :       /* For a virtual base class, follow the sharing in the complete
    5271             :          object. */
    5272             :       a_base_class_ptr corresp_bcp = corresp_base_class(bcp, ctor_bcp);
    5273             :       if (!corresp_bcp->shares_virtual_function_info) break;
    5274             :       if (corresp_bcp->derived_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5275             :                                            primary_base_class == corresp_bcp) {
    5276             :         /* We've reached the complete object class without encountering
    5277             :            the subobject class, so stop here. */
    5278             :         break;
    5279             :       }  /* if */
    5280             :       /* Find the next more derived base that shares its virtual
    5281             :          function table with corresp_bcp. */
    5282             :       derived = base_classes_of(corresp_bcp->derived_class);
    5283             :       while (derived->primary_base_class != corresp_bcp) {
    5284             :         derived = derived->next;
    5285             :       }  /* while */
    5286             :       /* Stop if we've reached the class of the subobject being constructed. */
    5287             :       if (derived->type == ctor_bcp->type) {
    5288             :         if (derived == ctor_bcp) {
    5289             :           bcp = NULL;
    5290             :         } else {
    5291             :           /* We've reached some other base with the same type as ctor_bcp,
    5292             :              which means that we've left the ctor_bcp subobject. */
    5293             :         }  /* if */
    5294             :         break;
    5295             :       }  /* if */
    5296             :       /* Get back to bcp in the subobject class, if possible.  */
    5297             :       for (temp_bcp = base_classes_of(bcp->derived_class);
    5298             :            temp_bcp != NULL;
    5299             :            temp_bcp = temp_bcp->next) {
    5300             :         if (temp_bcp->type == derived->type &&
    5301             :             corresp_base_class(temp_bcp, ctor_bcp) == derived) {
    5302             :           break;
    5303             :         }  /* if */
    5304             :       }  /* for */
    5305             :       if (temp_bcp == NULL) {
    5306             :         /* We've gone outside the subobject, so stop at the current point. */
    5307             :         break;
    5308             :       } else {
    5309             :         bcp = temp_bcp;
    5310             :       }  /* if */
    5311             :     } else {
    5312             :       /* Not a virtual base class, or ctor_bcp == NULL. */
    5313             :       if (bcp->derived_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5314             :                                                   primary_base_class == bcp) {
    5315             :         /* We've reached the class of the subobject being constructed. */
    5316             :         bcp = NULL;
    5317             :         break;
    5318             :       }  /* if */
    5319             :       /* Find the next more derived base that shares its virtual
    5320             :          function table with bcp. */
    5321             :       derived = base_classes_of(bcp->derived_class);
    5322             :       while (derived->primary_base_class != bcp) derived = derived->next;
    5323             :       bcp = derived;
    5324             :     }  /* if */
    5325             :   }  /* while */
    5326             :   return bcp;
    5327             : }  /* find_base_sharing_virtual_function_table */
    5328             : 
    5329             : 
    5330             : static a_boolean is_primary_base_class(a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    5331             : /*
    5332             : Return TRUE if the indicated base class is a primary base class for some
    5333             : other class or for the class itself.
    5334             : */
    5335             : {
    5336             :   a_boolean is_primary = FALSE;
    5337             : 
    5338             :   if (bcp->shares_virtual_function_info) {
    5339             :     /* If this base class shares virtual function info, it is a primary
    5340             :        base. */
    5341             :     is_primary = TRUE;
    5342             :   } else if (bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.
    5343             :                              any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes) {
    5344             :     /* A class that declares no virtual functions but inherits some is not
    5345             :        considered to have a virtual function table pointer in the terms
    5346             :        of the Cfront-like ABI, so shares_virtual_function_info is not set
    5347             :        in its base class, but it can still be a primary base class in
    5348             :        the IA-64 ABI.  For that case we have to look for a more-derived
    5349             :        class that has this class as its primary base class. */
    5350             :     if (bcp->derived_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5351             :                                                    primary_base_class == bcp) {
    5352             :       is_primary = TRUE;
    5353             :     } else {
    5354             :       a_base_class_ptr derived;
    5355             :       for (derived = base_classes_of(bcp->derived_class);
    5356             :            derived != NULL;
    5357             :            derived = derived->next) {
    5358             :         if (derived->primary_base_class == bcp) {
    5359             :           is_primary = TRUE;
    5360             :           break;
    5361             :         }  /* if */
    5362             :       }  /* for */
    5363             :     }  /* if */
    5364             :   }  /* if */
    5365             :   return is_primary;
    5366             : }  /* is_primary_base_class */
    5367             : 
    5368             : 
    5369             : static a_virtual_table_index vptr_index(a_type_ptr       class_type,
    5370             :                                         a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    5371             :                                         a_boolean        is_complete)
    5372             : /*
    5373             : If bcp is non-NULL, bcp is a base class with a virtual function table
    5374             : pointer.  If bcp is NULL, then class_type is a class with a virtual function
    5375             : table pointer.  Return the index from the start of the virtual function table
    5376             : associated with bcp (or, if NULL, the complete object) to the location where
    5377             : the vptr should point.  If is_complete is TRUE, the virtual function table is
    5378             : the complete virtual function table for class_type; otherwise it is a
    5379             : construction virtual function table.
    5380             : */
    5381             : {
    5382             :   a_virtual_table_index       idx;
    5383             : 
    5384             :   idx = num_negative_vtable_entries(class_type, bcp);
    5385             :   if (bcp != NULL && is_complete) {
    5386             :     check_assertion(bcp->virtual_function_table_offset != -1);
    5387             :     idx += bcp->virtual_function_table_offset;
    5388             :   }  /* if */
    5389             :   return idx;
    5390             : }  /* vptr_index */
    5391             : 
    5392             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5393             : 
    5394             : static void make_construction_vtbl(
    5395             :                        a_type_ptr                      class_type,
    5396             :                        a_base_class_ptr                ctor_bcp,
    5397             :                        a_base_class_ptr                bcp,
    5398             :                        a_construction_vtbl_ptr         *construction_vtbls,
    5399             :                        a_construction_vtbl_ptr         *end_construction_vtbls,
    5400             :                        a_construction_vtbl_array_index *idx,
    5401             :                        a_construction_vtbl_array_index *first_index)
    5402             : /*
    5403             : Create a construction virtual function table entry for bcp in ctor_bcp in
    5404             : class_type.  The virtual function table is for the class of bcp, for use
    5405             : while a constructor is building a subobject of the type of ctor_bcp in
