    5406             : a complete object of type class_type.  bcp is NULL for the ctor_bcp
    5407             : class itself.  ctor_bcp is NULL for the complete class_type class.
    5408             : The *construction_vtbls and *end_construction_vtbls pointers bracket the
    5409             : list of construction vtables created so far for class_type; *index points
    5410             : to the next available entry.  *first_index is set to the index for this
    5411             : entry, unless it is already non-zero.
    5412             : */
    5413             : {
    5414             :   a_type_ptr                  vtbl_class;
    5415             :   a_construction_vtbl_ptr     cvp;
    5416             :   a_variable_ptr              vtbl_var;
    5417             :   a_construction_vtbl_ptr     old_cvp;
    5418             :   a_base_class_ptr            eff_bcp = bcp;
    5419             : #if IA64_ABI
    5420             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    5421             :   a_virtual_table_index       vtbl_index = 0;
    5422             :   a_boolean                   is_subobject;
    5423             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5424             : 
    5425             :   if (ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    5426             :     vtbl_class = ctor_bcp->type;
    5427             :   } else {
    5428             :     vtbl_class = class_type;
    5429             :   }  /* if */
    5430             : #if IA64_ABI
    5431             :   if (eff_bcp != NULL && eff_bcp->shares_virtual_function_info) {
    5432             :     /* For a base class that shares its virtual table pointer, find the
    5433             :        most derived base class that shares that same pointer, so that
    5434             :        when we look for matches (versions of virtual function tables
    5435             :        already generated) we will recognize all the bases that use
    5436             :        the same virtual function table as equivalent and when we generate
    5437             :        the table we generate the whole thing. */
    5438             :     /* The structure of the low-level routines (set up for the Cfront-like
    5439             :        ABI) requires that the vtable be generated for the most-derived
    5440             :        class that shares a virtual table pointer, whereas the test
    5441             :        in make_construction_vtbls (in accordance with the algorithm
    5442             :        in the IA-64 ABI spec) requires that VTT entries be generated for
    5443             :        the most-basic class.  Here, we're translating between the IA-64
    5444             :        view of the world and the lower-level routines' view of the world
    5445             :        by converting from the base to the most-derived class. */
    5446             :     eff_bcp = find_base_sharing_virtual_function_table(eff_bcp, ctor_bcp);
    5447             :   }  /* if */
    5448             :   if (eff_bcp != NULL) {
    5449             :     /* For a base class that has no virtual function table by the
    5450             :        Cfront-ABI definition, go down into the primary base class. */
    5451             :     while (!needs_virtual_function_table(eff_bcp->type)) {
    5452             :       eff_bcp = eff_bcp->primary_base_class;
    5453             :       check_assertion(eff_bcp != NULL);
    5454             :     }  /* while */
    5455             :   }  /* if */
    5456             :   is_subobject = (eff_bcp != NULL);
    5457             :   ctsp = vtbl_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    5458             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5459             :   cvp = alloc_construction_vtbl();
    5460             :   cvp->ctor_base_class = ctor_bcp;
    5461             :   /* Assign the next index number to this entry. */
    5462             :   ++(*idx);
    5463             :   if (*first_index == 0) *first_index = *idx;
    5464             :   if (ctor_bcp == NULL && bcp != NULL) {
    5465             :     bcp->index_in_construction_vtbl_array = *idx;
    5466             :   }  /* if */
    5467             : #if IA64_ABI
    5468             :   if (!is_subobject) {
    5469             :     cvp->is_subobject = FALSE;
    5470             :     cvp->variant.derived_class = vtbl_class;
    5471             :     if (ctor_bcp == NULL) {
    5472             :       /* This is the standard virtual function table for the complete
    5473             :          class, which has already been created. */
    5474             :       vtbl_var = ctsp->virtual_function_table_var;
    5475             :       vtbl_index = vptr_index(vtbl_class, (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    5476             :                               /*is_complete=*/TRUE);
    5477             :       goto have_vtbl_var;
    5478             :     }  /* if */
    5479             :   } else 
    5480             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5481             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
    5482             :   {
    5483             :     cvp->variant.base_class = eff_bcp;
    5484             :     if (ctor_bcp == NULL) {
    5485             :       /* This is the standard virtual function table for the base class,
    5486             :          which has already been created. */
    5487             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5488             :       check_assertion(eff_bcp != NULL);
    5489             :       vtbl_var = eff_bcp->virtual_function_table_var;
    5490             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    5491             :       vtbl_var = ctsp->virtual_function_table_var;
    5492             :       vtbl_index = vptr_index(vtbl_class, eff_bcp, /*is_complete=*/TRUE);
    5493             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */              
    5494             :       check_assertion(vtbl_var != NULL);
    5495             :       goto have_vtbl_var;
    5496             :     }  /* if */
    5497             :   }  /* if */
    5498             :   /* See if there's already an entry on the list for this
    5499             :      instance, and reuse it if so. */
    5500             :   for (old_cvp = *construction_vtbls;
    5501             :        old_cvp != NULL;
    5502             :        old_cvp = old_cvp->next) {
    5503             :     if (((
    5504             : #if IA64_ABI
    5505             :           old_cvp->is_subobject && is_subobject &&
    5506             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5507             :           old_cvp->variant.base_class == cvp->variant.base_class)
    5508             : #if IA64_ABI
    5509             :          || (!old_cvp->is_subobject && !is_subobject &&
    5510             :              old_cvp->variant.derived_class == cvp->variant.derived_class)
    5511             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5512             :         ) && old_cvp->ctor_base_class == cvp->ctor_base_class) {
    5513             :       vtbl_var = old_cvp->virtual_function_table_var;
    5514             : #if IA64_ABI
    5515             :       vtbl_index = old_cvp->virtual_function_table_index;
    5516             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5517             :       goto have_vtbl_var;
    5518             :     }  /* if */
    5519             :   }  /* for */
    5520             :   vtbl_var = make_var_for_virtual_function_table(vtbl_class, eff_bcp,
    5521             :                                                  ctor_bcp);
    5522             : #if IA64_ABI
    5523             :   vtbl_index = vptr_index(vtbl_class, eff_bcp, /*is_complete=*/FALSE);
    5524             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5525             : have_vtbl_var:;
    5526             :   cvp->virtual_function_table_var = vtbl_var;
    5527             : #if IA64_ABI
    5528             :   cvp->virtual_function_table_index = vtbl_index;
    5529             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5530             :   /* Add the entry to the end of the list. */
    5531             :   if (*construction_vtbls == NULL) {
    5532             :     *construction_vtbls = cvp;
    5533             :   } else {
    5534             :     (*end_construction_vtbls)->next = cvp;
    5535             :   }  /* if */
    5536             :   *end_construction_vtbls = cvp;
    5537             : }  /* make_construction_vtbl */
    5538             : 
    5539             : 
    5540             : static a_construction_vtbl_array_index make_construction_vtbls(
    5541             :                        a_type_ptr                      class_type,
    5542             :                        a_base_class_ptr                bcp,
    5543             :                        a_construction_vtbl_ptr         *construction_vtbls,
    5544             :                        a_construction_vtbl_ptr         *end_construction_vtbls,
    5545             :                        a_construction_vtbl_array_index *idx)
    5546             :               
    5547             : /*
    5548             : If the given class needs special versions of virtual function tables for
    5549             : use in constructors and destructors, make the variables for them now.
    5550             : Such virtual function tables are needed when virtual functions are
    5551             : overridden in virtual base classes.  The tables are to be generated for
    5552             : use when constructing/destroying a subobject described by bcp if bcp
    5553             : is non-NULL, or a complete object of type class_type if bcp is NULL.
    5554             : Add any needed vtbl entries to the list bounded by *construction_vtbls and
    5555             : *end_construction_vtbls, and increment *idx accordingly.  Return the
    5556             : index number of the first entry, or 0 if no entries were created.
    5557             : */
    5558             : {
    5559             :   a_type_ptr                      vtbl_class;
    5560             :   a_construction_vtbl_array_index first_index = 0;
    5561             : 
    5562             :   if (bcp != NULL) {
    5563             :     vtbl_class = bcp->type;
    5564             :     check_assertion(class_type == bcp->derived_class);
    5565             :   } else {
    5566             :     vtbl_class = class_type;
    5567             :   }  /* if */
    5568             :   if (vtbl_class->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
    5569             :     a_class_type_supplement_ptr     ctsp;
    5570             :     a_base_class_ptr                sub_bcp;
    5571             :     int                             pass;
    5572             : 
    5573             :     ctsp = vtbl_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    5574             : #if IA64_ABI
    5575             :     /* Add an entry for the primary virtual pointer. */
    5576             :     make_construction_vtbl(class_type, bcp, (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    5577             :                            construction_vtbls,
    5578             :                            end_construction_vtbls, idx, &first_index);
    5579             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5580             :     /* Look for base classes for which special virtual function tables are
    5581             :        needed because of the base class itself (an array of virtual
    5582             :        function table instances needs to be passed to a constructor or
    5583             :        destructor for the base class). */
    5584             :     for (pass = 0; pass != 2; pass++) {
    5585             :       /* Do non-virtual bases on the first pass and virtual bases on the
    5586             :          second pass. */
    5587             :       for (sub_bcp = 
    5588             : #if IA64_ABI
    5589             :                      ctsp->preorder_base_classes
    5590             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    5591             :                      ctsp->base_classes
    5592             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5593             :                                                 ;
    5594             :            sub_bcp != NULL;
    5595             :            sub_bcp = sub_bcp->
    5596             : #if IA64_ABI
    5597             :                               next_preorder
    5598             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    5599             :                               next
    5600             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5601             :                                            ) {
    5602             :         a_class_type_supplement_ptr sub_ctsp =
    5603             :                          sub_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    5604             :         /* The base class should have been prelowered already, so that
    5605             :            construction_vtbls is set already. */
    5606             :         check_assertion(class_has_been_prelowered(sub_bcp->type));
    5607             :         /* Process only direct and virtual base classes, and process virtual
    5608             :            base classes only in the outermost class (the outermost constructor
    5609             :            calls the virtual base class constructor). */
    5610             :         if ((pass == 0 ? (!sub_bcp->is_virtual && sub_bcp->direct) :
    5611             :                          (sub_bcp->is_virtual && bcp == NULL)) &&
    5612             :             sub_ctsp->construction_vtbls != NULL) {
    5613             :           a_base_class_ptr eff_bcp = sub_bcp;
    5614             :           if (bcp != NULL) {
    5615             :             /* Find the base class we want to process in the complete
    5616             :                object class type. */
    5617             :             eff_bcp = corresp_base_class(sub_bcp, bcp);
    5618             :           }  /* if */
    5619             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5620             :           /* Virtual base classes are processed only in a complete object,
    5621             :              so the information for them is put in a separate small array
    5622             :              passed by the complete-object constructor to the base class
    5623             :              constructor, and not included in the overall array for the
    5624             :              class. */
    5625             :           if (sub_bcp->is_virtual) {
    5626             :             a_construction_vtbl_array_index local_index = 0;
    5627             :             a_construction_vtbl_ptr         local_construction_vtbls = NULL;
    5628             :             a_construction_vtbl_ptr         local_end_construction_vtbls 
    5629             :                                                                        = NULL;
    5630             : 
    5631             :             (void)make_construction_vtbls(class_type,
    5632             :                                           eff_bcp,
    5633             :                                           &local_construction_vtbls,
    5634             :                                           &local_end_construction_vtbls,
    5635             :                                           &local_index);
    5636             :             sub_bcp->base_construction_vtbls = local_construction_vtbls;
    5637             :           } else 
    5638             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5639             :           /* Do not insert code here. */
    5640             :           {
    5641             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5642             :             /* Not a virtual base class. */
    5643             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5644             :             /* Add the base class subarray to the overall array being
    5645             :                constructed for the class. */
    5646             :             eff_bcp->base_subarray_index_in_construction_vtbl_array =
    5647             :                                 make_construction_vtbls(class_type,
    5648             :                                                         eff_bcp,
    5649             :                                                         construction_vtbls,
    5650             :                                                         end_construction_vtbls,
    5651             :                                                         idx);
    5652             :             if (first_index == 0) {
    5653             :               first_index =
    5654             :                       eff_bcp->base_subarray_index_in_construction_vtbl_array;
    5655             :             }  /* if */
    5656             :           }  /* if */
    5657             :         }  /* if */
    5658             :       }  /* for */
    5659             :       /* Only do the virtual table pointers for base classes on the first
    5660             :          pass. */
    5661             :       if (pass == 1) break;
    5662             :       /* Look for base classes that have functions that are overridden
    5663             :          in some class such that there is a virtual step between the base
    5664             :          class and the overriding class.  Those are the cases where the
    5665             :          offset between the classes of the overriding and overridden functions
    5666             :          can change if this class is embedded in a larger object. */
    5667             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5668             :       /* Note that virtual base classes cannot share a virtual function table
    5669             :          pointer with a derived class, so the virtual function pointer of
    5670             :          class_type itself is not an issue.  The functions in its virtual
    5671             :          function table have to be either declared in class_type or inherited
    5672             :          from base classes with which it shares a virtual function table
    5673             :          pointer (i.e., non-virtual base classes), and those inherited
    5674             :          functions will not require special tables. */
    5675             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5676             :       for (sub_bcp = 
    5677             : #if IA64_ABI
    5678             :                      ctsp->preorder_base_classes
    5679             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    5680             :                      ctsp->base_classes
    5681             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5682             :                                                 ;
    5683             :            sub_bcp != NULL;
    5684             :            sub_bcp = sub_bcp->
    5685             : #if IA64_ABI
    5686             :                               next_preorder
    5687             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    5688             :                               next
    5689             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    5690             :                                            ) {
    5691             :         if (
    5692             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5693             :             base_class_has_vtbl(sub_bcp) &&
    5694             :             base_class_has_override_on_virtual_step(sub_bcp)
    5695             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    5696             :             (sub_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.
    5697             :                                                any_virtual_base_classes ||
    5698             :              sub_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.
    5699             :                            any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes) &&
    5700             :             /* IA-64 ABI spec, 2.6.2 paragraph 3: "For each base class X
    5701             :                which (a) has virtual bases or is reachable along a virtual
    5702             :                path from D, ..." */
    5703             :             (sub_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.
    5704             :                                                    any_virtual_base_classes ||
    5705             :              any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(sub_bcp)) &&
    5706             :             /* " ... and (b) is not a non-virtual primary base, ..." */
    5707             :             !(!sub_bcp->is_virtual && is_primary_base_class(sub_bcp))
    5708             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5709             :                                                                      ) {
    5710             :           /* Needs a special virtual function table. */
    5711             :           make_construction_vtbl(class_type, bcp, sub_bcp,
    5712             :                                  construction_vtbls, 
    5713             :                                  end_construction_vtbls, idx,
    5714             :                                  &first_index);
    5715             :         }  /* if */
    5716             :       }  /* for */
    5717             :     }  /* for */
    5718             :   }  /* if */
    5719             :   return first_index;
    5720             : }  /* make_construction_vtbls */
    5721             : 
    5722             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
    5723             : 
    5724             : #if !CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY || ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    5725             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- Because class_type is not used in that case. */
    5726             : #endif /* !CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY || ... */
    5727             : static a_boolean base_class_needs_virtual_function_table(
    5728             :                                                    a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    5729             :                                                    a_type_ptr       class_type)
    5730             : /*
    5731             : Return TRUE if a virtual function table instance is needed for base class
    5732             : bcp when it occurs as part of a complete object of class class_type.
    5733             : FALSE means either the base class does not need a virtual function table
    5734             : (at all) or that it can share another one.
    5735             : */
    5736             : {
    5737             :   a_boolean needed = FALSE;
    5738             : 
    5739             :   if (needs_virtual_function_table(bcp->type)) {
    5740             :     /* The base class declares virtual functions, so it needs a pointer
    5741             :        to a virtual function table.  However, we may not need an
    5742             :        instance of the function table specifically for bcp-in-class_type;
    5743             :        some other instance may do. */
    5744             :     if (bcp->shares_virtual_function_info) {
    5745             :       /* The base class shares its virtual function table with a more-derived
    5746             :           base class or with class_type itself, so it does not need its own
    5747             :           virtual function table instance. */
    5748             :       needed = FALSE;
    5749             : #if IA64_ABI
    5750             :     } else {
    5751             :       /* The IA-64 ABI requires a separate vtable for this base class
    5752             :          because the typeinfo pointer identifies the derived class.
    5753             :          This is true even if --no_rtti is used: we put a null typeinfo
    5754             :          pointer in the vtable, but we don't change whether a
    5755             :          base class needs a vtable, because the ABI spec has some
    5756             :          rather specific requirements about which bases classes have
    5757             :          their own vtables. */
    5758             :       needed = TRUE;
    5759             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    5760             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    5761             :     } else if (generate_rtti_typeinfo) {
    5762             :       /* When RTTI information is generated, an entry in the virtual function
    5763             :          table identifies the type of the complete object, so a separate
    5764             :          instance is needed for each derived class even if the derived
    5765             :          class does not override any virtual functions. */
    5766             :       needed = TRUE;
    5767             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    5768             :     } else if (bcp->overriding_virtual_functions != NULL) {
    5769             :       /* Some of the virtual functions in the base class are overridden
    5770             :          in class_type, so a separate virtual function table instance is
    5771             :          needed. */
    5772             :       needed = TRUE;
    5773             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    5774             :     } else if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_functions) {
    5775             :       /* cfront puts outs virtual function tables whenever there is a virtual
    5776             :          function in the derived class, which is more often than is really
    5777             :          needed. */
    5778             :       needed = TRUE;
    5779             : #else /* !CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    5780             :     } else if (bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5781             :                                     virtual_function_info_base_class != NULL) {
    5782             :       /* This base class shares its virtual function table pointer with
    5783             :          one or more base classes.  See whether any of the base classes
    5784             :          that share have overridden functions. */
    5785             :       a_base_class_ptr      sharing_bcp =
    5786             :                              bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5787             :                                               virtual_function_info_base_class;
    5788             :       a_derivation_step_ptr dsp;
    5789             :       /* A virtual function table can't be shared with a virtual base, so
    5790             :          there can only be one derivation. */
    5791             :       check_assertion(sharing_bcp->derivation->next == NULL);
    5792             :       for (dsp = sharing_bcp->derivation->path;
    5793             :            dsp != NULL;
    5794             :            dsp = dsp->next) {
    5795             :         a_base_class_ptr other_bcp = corresp_base_class(dsp->base_class, bcp);
    5796             :         if (other_bcp->overriding_virtual_functions != NULL) {
    5797             :           /* This base class has overridden functions, so we need a
    5798             :              separate instance. */
    5799             :           needed = TRUE;
    5800             :           break;
    5801             :         }  /* if */
    5802             :       }  /* for */
    5803             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    5804             :     } else {
    5805             :       /* In other cases, no separate instance is needed. */
    5806             :       needed = FALSE;
    5807             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5808             :     }  /* if */
    5809             :   }  /* if */
    5810             :   return needed;
    5811             : }  /* base_class_needs_virtual_function_table */
    5812             : 
    5813             : #if IA64_ABI
    5814             : 
    5815             : static a_base_class_ptr emit_vcall_offsets_in_virtual_function_table(
    5816             :                                                          a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    5817             : /*
    5818             : If vcall offsets should be emitted in the virtual function table
    5819             : for bcp (a base class that is known to require a virtual function table),
    5820             : return a pointer to the virtual base class for which they should be
    5821             : emitted.  Return NULL if vcall offsets should not be emitted.
    5822             : */
    5823             : {
    5824             :   a_base_class_ptr result = NULL;
    5825             :   a_base_class_ptr virtual_bcp, primary_bcp;
    5826             : 
    5827             :   if (bcp->is_virtual) {
    5828             :     /* If bcp is a virtual base, we need vcall offsets. */
    5829             :     result = bcp;
    5830             :   } else if (!base_class_has_vtbl(bcp)) {
    5831             :     /* Non-virtual base classes that don't have their own vtables do not need
    5832             :        vcall offsets.  If the virtual base does not have its own vtable, the
    5833             :        (possibly indirect) primary base of that virtual base will emit the
    5834             :        vcall offsets. */
    5835             :   } else if (any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(bcp)) {
    5836             :     /* bcp might be a base class of a virtual base that does not itself
    5837             :        require a virtual function table (because it does not explicitly
    5838             :        declare virtual functions).  If bcp is a (direct or indirect) primary
    5839             :        base of the virtual base vcall offsets should be emitted. */
    5840             :     virtual_bcp = bcp->derivation->path->base_class;
    5841             :     /* If the virtual_bcp has its own virtual function table, then we are not
    5842             :        in the odd case described above; the vcall offsets will simply be
    5843             :        emitted with virtual_bcp. */
    5844             :     while (!needs_virtual_function_table(virtual_bcp->type)) {
    5845             :       primary_bcp = virtual_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5846             :                                                             primary_base_class;
    5847             :       /* If there's no primary base then the vcall offsets for the virtual
    5848             :          base are being emitted elsewhere. */
    5849             :       if (primary_bcp == NULL) {
    5850             :         break;
    5851             :       }  /* if */
    5852             :       primary_bcp = corresp_base_class(primary_bcp, virtual_bcp);
    5853             :       /* If the primary_bcp is bcp, then bcp is indeed the location where the
    5854             :          vcall offsets must be emitted. */
    5855             :       if (primary_bcp == bcp) {
    5856             :         result = virtual_bcp;
    5857             :         break;
    5858             :       }  /* if */
    5859             :       virtual_bcp = primary_bcp;
    5860             :     }  /* while */
    5861             :   }  /* if */
    5862             :   return result;
    5863             : }  /* emit_vcall_offsets_in_virtual_function_table */
    5864             : 
    5865             : 
    5866             : a_virtual_table_index num_negative_vtable_entries(a_type_ptr       class_type,
    5867             :                                                   a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    5868             : /*
    5869             : Determine the number of vtable entries at negative offsets required for
    5870             : the indicated class.  If bcp is non-NULL, do the determination for the
    5871             : given base class.  vtable entries at negative offsets are used to deal
    5872             : with virtual base classes in the IA-64 ABI.
    5873             : */
    5874             : {
    5875             :   a_virtual_table_index idx;
    5876             :   a_base_class_ptr      vcall_bcp;
    5877             : 
    5878             :   if (bcp != NULL) {
    5879             :     vcall_bcp = emit_vcall_offsets_in_virtual_function_table(bcp);
    5880             :     if (vcall_bcp != NULL) {
    5881             :       idx = -vcall_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5882             :                                            next_negative_virtual_table_index
    5883             :               - 1;
    5884             :     } else {
    5885             :       idx = -bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5886             :                                                  first_vcall_offset_index 
    5887             :               - 1;
    5888             :     }  /* if */
    5889             :   } else {
    5890             :     idx = -class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    5891             :                                                  first_vcall_offset_index 
    5892             :             - 1;
    5893             :   }  /* if */
    5894             :   return idx;
    5895             : }  /* num_negative_vtable_entries */
    5896             : 
    5897             : 
    5898             : static void f_make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables(
    5899             :                                              a_type_ptr            class_type,
    5900             :                                              a_base_class_ptr      bcp,
    5901             :                                              a_virtual_table_index *idx)
    5902             : /*
    5903             : Generate the variable for the virtual function table for the class type, 
    5904             : and calculate the offset to the virtual function tables for its base
    5905             : classes.  If bcp is NULL, process class_type and all of its bases; otherwise,
    5906             : process only those bases below bcp. 
    5907             : */
    5908             : {
    5909             :   a_base_class_ptr            base_bcp, eff_bcp;
    5910             :   a_type_ptr                  type;
    5911             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    5912             : 
    5913             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    5914             :     type = class_type; 
    5915             :   } else {
    5916             :     type = bcp->type;
    5917             :   }  /* if */
    5918             :   ctsp = type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    5919             :   /* Make a virtual function table for this type. */
    5920             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    5921             :     /* Generate the virtual function table variable for the class
    5922             :        itself. */
    5923             :     (void)make_var_for_virtual_function_table(class_type,
    5924             :                                               (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    5925             :                                               (a_base_class_ptr)NULL);
    5926             :     if (needs_virtual_function_table(class_type)) {
    5927             :       *idx += -ctsp->first_vcall_offset_index - 1;
    5928             :       if (ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number != 
    5929             :           VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER_NONE) {
    5930             :         *idx += ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number + 1;
    5931             :       }  /* if */
    5932             :     }  /* if */
    5933             :   } else if (base_class_needs_virtual_function_table(bcp, class_type) &&
    5934             :              !base_class_has_vtbl(bcp)) {
    5935             :     bcp->virtual_function_table_offset = *idx;
    5936             : #if DEBUG
    5937             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    5938             :       fprintf(f_debug, "Index %ld for virtual function table for ",
    5939             :               (long)*idx);
    5940             :       db_base_class(bcp, /*show_offset=*/TRUE);
    5941             :     }  /* if */
    5942             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    5943             :     *idx += num_negative_vtable_entries(class_type, bcp);
    5944             :     if (ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number != 
    5945             :         VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER_NONE) {
    5946             :       *idx += ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number + 1;
    5947             :     }  /* if */
    5948             :   }  /* if */
    5949             :   /* Recursively process the direct, non-primary base classes. */
    5950             :   for (base_bcp = preorder_base_classes_of(type);
    5951             :        base_bcp != NULL;
    5952             :        base_bcp = base_bcp->next_preorder) {
    5953             :     if (base_bcp->direct && !base_bcp->is_virtual) {
    5954             :       eff_bcp = corresponding_base_class(base_bcp, class_type, bcp);
    5955             :       f_make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables(class_type, eff_bcp, idx);
    5956             :     }  /* if */
    5957             :   }  /* for */
    5958             :   /* Recursively process the virtual base classes if we are currently
    5959             :      processing the most derived class. */
    5960             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    5961             :     for (base_bcp = preorder_base_classes_of(type);
    5962             :          base_bcp != NULL;
    5963             :          base_bcp = base_bcp->next_preorder) {
    5964             :       if (base_bcp->is_virtual) {
    5965             :         eff_bcp = corresponding_base_class(base_bcp, class_type, 
    5966             :                                            (a_base_class_ptr)NULL);
    5967             :         f_make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables(class_type, eff_bcp, idx);
    5968             :       }  /* if */
    5969             :     }  /* for */
    5970             :   }  /* if */
    5971             : }  /* f_make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables */
    5972             : 
    5973             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5974             : 
    5975             : static void make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables(a_type_ptr class_type)
    5976             : /*
    5977             : Generate the variables for the virtual function tables for the class type
    5978             : class_type if any are needed and if they have not already been generated.
    5979             : */
    5980             : {
    5981             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    5982             : #if !IA64_ABI
    5983             :   a_base_class_ptr            bcp;
    5984             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    5985             :   a_virtual_table_index       idx = 0;
    5986             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    5987             : 
    5988             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    5989             :   if (needs_virtual_function_table(class_type)
    5990             : #if IA64_ABI
    5991             :       /* For the case where a class has no virtual functions of its own,
    5992             :          but has a base class that has virtual functions, force a vtable
    5993             :          for the derived class.  In the IA-64 ABI, the derived class
    5994             :          vtable includes the vtable for its primary base class, and there
    5995             :          is no vtable for the primary base class, as opposed to in the
    5996             :          Cfront-like ABI, where the base-class-in-derived vtable contains
    5997             :          the derived class slots, and there is no vtable for the derived
    5998             :         class. */
    5999             :       || class_type->variant.class_struct_union.
    6000             :                            any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes 
    6001             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6002             :                                                                           ) {
    6003             :     /* The class has virtual functions, so it needs a virtual function table.
    6004             :        Generate it if it has not already been generated. */
    6005             :     if (ctsp->virtual_function_table_var == NULL) {
    6006             :       /* Generate the virtual function table variable for the class itself. */
    6007             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6008             :       (void)make_var_for_virtual_function_table(class_type,
    6009             :                                                 (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    6010             :                                                 (a_base_class_ptr)NULL);
    6011             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6012             :       f_make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables(class_type,
    6013             :                                               (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    6014             :                                               &idx);
    6015             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6016             :     }  /* if */
    6017             :   }  /* if */
    6018             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6019             :   /* Generate the virtual function table for each base class when it is
    6020             :      contained within a complete object of the primary class. */
    6021             :   for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    6022             :     /* Only generate virtual function tables for base classes that
    6023             :        need them and only if the virtual function table has not yet
    6024             :        been generated. */
    6025             :     if (base_class_needs_virtual_function_table(bcp, class_type)) {
    6026             :       if (bcp->virtual_function_table_var == NULL) {
    6027             :         (void)make_var_for_virtual_function_table(class_type, bcp,
    6028             :                                                   (a_base_class_ptr)NULL);
    6029             :       }  /* if */
    6030             :     }  /* if */
    6031             :   }  /* for */
    6032             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    6033             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
    6034             :   { a_construction_vtbl_ptr         construction_vtbls = NULL;
    6035             :     a_construction_vtbl_ptr         end_construction_vtbls = NULL;
    6036             :     a_construction_vtbl_array_index array_index = 0;
    6037             :     /* The class may need special versions of virtual function tables
    6038             :        for use in constructor or destructors.  Make them if needed. */
    6039             :     (void)make_construction_vtbls(class_type,
    6040             :                                   (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    6041             :                                   &construction_vtbls,
    6042             :                                   &end_construction_vtbls,
    6043             :                                   &array_index);
    6044             :     ctsp->construction_vtbls = construction_vtbls;
    6045             :   }
    6046             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
    6047             : }  /* make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables */
    6048             : 
    6049             : 
    6050             : a_variable_ptr primary_vtbl_var_for_class_if_any(a_type_ptr class_type)
    6051             : /*
    6052             : Return a pointer to the primary virtual function table for the given
    6053             : class, or NULL if there isn't one.  The "primary" virtual function
    6054             : table for the class is the one whose attributes, like whether it's
    6055             : defined, are mirrored by any other virtual function tables for the
    6056             : class.  It's usually the one recorded directly in the class type, but
    6057             : in the Cfront-like ABI if the class itself has no vtable it is the
    6058             : first one associated with a base class.
    6059             : */
    6060             : {
    6061             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
    6062             :   a_variable_ptr              vtbl_var = ctsp->virtual_function_table_var;
    6063             : 
    6064             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6065             :   if (vtbl_var == NULL) {
    6066             :     /* The class itself has no virtual function table, so look at the
    6067             :        base classes. */
    6068             :     a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    6069             :     for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    6070             :       vtbl_var = bcp->virtual_function_table_var;
    6071             :       if (vtbl_var != NULL) break;
    6072             :     }  /* for */
    6073             :   }  /* if */
    6074             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    6075             :   return vtbl_var;
    6076             : }  /* primary_vtbl_var_for_class_if_any */
    6077             : 
    6078             : 
    6079             : a_variable_ptr primary_vtbl_var_for_class(a_type_ptr class_type)
    6080             : /*
    6081             : Return a pointer to the primary virtual function table for the given class.
    6082             : There must be one.  See primary_vtbl_var_for_class_if_any for the
    6083             : definition of the "primary" virtual function table.
    6084             : */
    6085             : {
    6086             :   a_variable_ptr vtbl_var = primary_vtbl_var_for_class_if_any(class_type);
    6087             : 
    6088             :   check_assertion(vtbl_var != NULL);
    6089             :   return vtbl_var;
    6090             : }  /* primary_vtbl_var_for_class */
    6091             : 
    6092             : 
    6093             : static a_boolean virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(
    6094             :                                                   a_type_ptr    class_type,
    6095             :                                                   a_boolean     *force_static,
    6096             :                                                   a_routine_ptr *first_virtual,
    6097             :                                                   a_boolean     *optional)
    6098             : /*
    6099             : Return TRUE if the virtual function tables for the class type class_type should
    6100             : be defined (i.e., initialized) in this compilation.  Note that this should not
    6101             : be called until the end of the file scope, as its value depends on whether
    6102             : or not some function in the class has been defined.  If the virtual function
    6103             : table should be forced to be local to this compilation, *force_static
    6104             : is returned TRUE.  *first_virtual is set to point to the first noninline
    6105             : virtual function of the class if that function was used in deciding whether or
    6106             : not to put out the definition; otherwise, it's set to NULL.  If the virtual
    6107             : function table is "optional", meaning it needs to be defined only if it is
    6108             : referenced, *optional is returned TRUE.  This routine can be called from
    6109             : outside of IL lowering (with il_lowering_is_underway FALSE), but in that
    6110             : case optional virtual function tables are assumed to require a definition,
    6111             : because we can't generate or look at the actual vtable variable in that
    6112             : mode; *optional will be set as usual.
    6113             : */
    6114             : {
    6115             :   a_boolean                   defined_here;
    6116             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    6117             :   a_scope_ptr                 scope;
    6118             :   a_routine_ptr               routine;
    6119             :   a_boolean                   vtable_is_optional = FALSE;
    6120             :   a_variable_ptr              vtbl_var =
    6121             :                                  primary_vtbl_var_for_class_if_any(class_type);
    6122             : 
    6123             :   *force_static = FALSE;
    6124             :   *first_virtual = NULL;
    6125             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    6126             : #if CHECKING
    6127             :   if (ctsp == NULL) {
    6128             :     internal_error(
    6129             :                 "virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here: ctsp == NULL");
    6130             :   }  /* if */
    6131             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    6132             :   /* The virtual function tables for a class are defined in the compilation
    6133             :      that contains the definition of the lexically first non-inline, virtual,
    6134             :      non-pure member function of the class.  See ARM 10.8.1c and "New Virtual
    6135             :      Table Strategy" in the AT&T cfront 2.1 Release Notes. */
    6136             :   if (class_type->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
    6137             :                                  (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external) {
    6138             :     /* Not C++ external linkage, therefore any definition of the virtual
    6139             :        function table would have to be here, and static.  If the class is
    6140             :        not referenced at all, then no definition is needed. */
    6141             :     defined_here = class_type->source_corresp.referenced;
    6142             :     *force_static = TRUE;
    6143             :   } else {
    6144             :     scope = ctsp->assoc_scope;
    6145             :     if (scope == NULL) {
    6146             :       /* The class is declared but not defined. */
    6147             :       defined_here = FALSE;
    6148             :     } else if (!class_type->variant.class_struct_union
    6149             :                           .any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes &&
    6150             :                !class_type->variant.class_struct_union
    6151             :                           .any_virtual_base_classes) {
    6152             :       /* A class with no virtual functions and no virtual base classes should
    6153             :          not have an associated virtual function table.  We should only get
    6154             :          here with the generated typeinfo types. */
    6155             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    6156             :       check_assertion(is_generated_typeinfo_type(class_type));
    6157             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    6158             :       defined_here = FALSE;
    6159             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6160             :     } else if (vtbl_var != NULL &&
    6161             :                (vtbl_var->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
    6162             :       /* A virtual table for a dllimport-ed class should not be defined. */
    6163             :       defined_here = FALSE;
    6164             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6165             :     } else if (ctsp->named_in_inline_template_directive) {
    6166             :       /* A GNU "inline template" directive was used.  An external vtable
    6167             :          should be emitted here. */
    6168             :       defined_here = TRUE;
    6169             :       *force_static = FALSE;
    6170             :     } else if (class_type->
    6171             :                           variant.class_struct_union.explicitly_instantiated) {
    6172             :       /* The class is explicitly instantiated in this translation unit;
    6173             :          emit the vtable. */
    6174             :       defined_here = TRUE;
    6175             :       *force_static = FALSE;
    6176             : #if IA64_ABI && ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 410
    6177             :     } else if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_template_class &&
    6178             :                !class_type->variant.class_struct_union.is_specialized) {
    6179             :       /* The IA-64 ABI specifies that vtables for class templates should
    6180             :          be emitted in any translation unit where they are instantiated
    6181             :          (unless they are specialized). */
    6182             :       if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.do_not_instantiate) {
    6183             :         /* An explicit request not to instantiate; suppress vtables. */
    6184             :         defined_here = FALSE;
    6185             :       } else {
    6186             :         /* According to the ABI, the vtable should be emitted in this object,
    6187             :            but mark it optional (which has the effect of suppressing it when
    6188             :            it is not referenced -- see the check at the end of this
    6189             :            function). */
    6190             :         defined_here = TRUE;
    6191             :         vtable_is_optional = TRUE;
    6192             :       }  /* if */
    6193             : #endif /* IA64_ABI && ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 410 */
    6194             :     } else {
    6195             :       /* The class is defined. */
    6196             :       /* If the decider function of the class is defined in this compilation,
    6197             :          we should put out the virtual function tables here. */
    6198             :       routine = vtbl_decider_function_for_class(class_type,
    6199             :                                                 (a_boolean *)NULL);
    6200             :       if (routine != NULL) {
    6201             :         *first_virtual = routine;
    6202             :         defined_here = (routine->function_def_number !=
    6203             :                                                      NULL_function_def_number);
    6204             :         /* If the routine is local because of the -tlocal instantiation
    6205             :            mode, or because of --no_extern_inline in IA-64 mode and a
    6206             :            function declared inline on an out-of-class definition, make
    6207             :            the vtable local too. */
    6208             :         if (routine->source_corresp.name_linkage ==
    6209             :                                            (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal) {
    6210             :           check_assertion(instantiation_mode == tim_local ||
    6211             :                           !extern_inline_allowed);
    6212             :           *force_static = TRUE;
    6213             :         }  /* if */
    6214             :       } else {
    6215             :         /* There is no member function that meets the requirements, so we
    6216             :            cannot decide automatically on whether or not to define the
    6217             :            virtual function table.  See if a command-line option gives
    6218             :            guidance. */
    6219             :         if (virtual_function_table_definition == vfd_force) {
    6220             :           defined_here = TRUE;
    6221             :         } else if (virtual_function_table_definition == vfd_suppress) {
    6222             :           defined_here = FALSE;
    6223             : #if IA64_ABI
    6224             :         } else if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.do_not_instantiate) {
    6225             :           /* Is explicitly not instantiated (e.g., "extern template").
    6226             :              Suppress the vtable. */
    6227             :           defined_here = FALSE;
    6228             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6229             :         } else {
    6230             :           /* No command-line option.  Put out the virtual function table, but
    6231             :              make it static, because each compilation with this same class
    6232             :              will contain an instance of the definition. */
    6233             :           defined_here = TRUE;
    6234             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6235             :           *force_static = TRUE;
    6236             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    6237             :           vtable_is_optional = TRUE;
    6238             :         }  /* if */
    6239             :       }  /* if */
    6240             :     }  /* if */
    6241             :   }  /* if */
    6242             :   /* If the definition is forced to be static, then it cannot be referenced
    6243             :      from anywhere else. */
    6244             :   if (*force_static) vtable_is_optional = TRUE;
    6245             :   *optional = vtable_is_optional;
    6246             :   if (vtable_is_optional && defined_here && il_lowering_underway) {
    6247             :     check_assertion(vtbl_var != NULL);
    6248             :     vtbl_var->is_optional_vtable = vtable_is_optional;
    6249             :     /* If there aren't any (real) references in this compilation unit, then
    6250             :        the definition isn't needed here either. */
    6251             :     /* The virtual function table variable is marked as referenced for
    6252             :        references to the virtual function table (which only occur in
    6253             :        constructor and destructor wrapper code), so if the referenced flag
    6254             :        is FALSE the virtual function table is not referenced at all. */
    6255             :     if (class_type->typeinfo_var != NULL &&
    6256             :         class_type->typeinfo_var->source_corresp.referenced &&
    6257             :         !typeinfo_uncoupled_when_vtable_is_optional) {
    6258             :       /* The typeinfo variable is referenced, and this ABI couples the
    6259             :          typeinfo and vtable generation even when the vtable is optional,
    6260             :          so we need the virtual table. */
    6261             :     } else if (!vtbl_var->source_corresp.referenced &&
    6262             :                class_type->source_corresp.name_linkage ==
    6263             :                                  (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external) {
    6264             :       /* Don't suppress virtual function tables for local classes even if
    6265             :          currently unreferenced; these are lowered early in the process and
    6266             :          may be referenced later. */
    6267             :       defined_here = FALSE;
    6268             :     }  /* if */
    6269             :   }  /* if */
    6270             :   return defined_here;
    6271             : }  /* virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here */
    6272             : 
    6273             : 
    6274             : a_boolean inline_virtual_function_definitions_needed(a_type_ptr class_type)
    6275             : /*
    6276             : Return TRUE if inline virtual definitions for the indicated class are needed
    6277             : in this translation unit because of some requirement imposed by IL lowering.
    6278             : Specifically, an otherwise unreferenced inline virtual function will be
    6279             : needed if the virtual function table for the class must be defined in this
    6280             : compilation, because a pointer to it must be put in the virtual function
    6281             : table.  This routine is called for issuing diagnostics on unreferenced
    6282             : user-declared inline virtual functions that are not defined in this
    6283             : translation unit.  This routine can be called only near the end of
    6284             : the processing of the function or file scope in which the class is defined.
    6285             : */
    6286             : {
    6287             :   a_boolean     needed = FALSE, force_static, optional;
    6288             :   a_routine_ptr first_virtual;
    6289             :   a_boolean     saved_il_lowering_underway;
    6290             : 
    6291             :   if (il_lowering_needed() && !ignore_type_in_back_end(class_type)) {
    6292             :     saved_il_lowering_underway = il_lowering_underway;
    6293             :     il_lowering_underway = TRUE;
    6294             :     /* Force generation of the virtual function table variable (if any) for the
    6295             :        class. */
    6296             :     prelower_class_type(class_type);
    6297             :     /* The class should have virtual function table, since it has a
    6298             :        virtual destructor. */
    6299             :     check_assertion(class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    6300             :                                            virtual_function_table_var != NULL);
    6301             :     /* See if the virtual function table will be defined in this
    6302             :        compilation. */
    6303             :     if (virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    6304             :                                                       &force_static,
    6305             :                                                       &first_virtual,
    6306             :                                                       &optional)) {
    6307             :       /* The virtual function table will be defined in this translation unit,
    6308             :          so it will need to take the addresses of inline virtual functions. */
    6309             :       needed = TRUE;
    6310             :     }  /* if */
    6311             :     il_lowering_underway = saved_il_lowering_underway;
    6312             :   }  /* if */
    6313             :   return needed;
    6314             : }  /* inline_virtual_function_definitions_needed */
    6315             : 
    6316             : 
    6317             : a_boolean typeinfo_goes_out_where_vtable_goes_out(a_type_ptr class_type,
    6318             :                                                   a_boolean  *unknown)
    6319             : /*
    6320             : Return TRUE if the typeinfo variable for the indicated class always goes
    6321             : out where the virtual function table for the class goes out.  If the
    6322             : class has no virtual function table, the answer is FALSE (because they don't
    6323             : go out together).  *unknown is returned TRUE if it's too early in the
    6324             : compilation to give a definitive answer (e.g., because not all member
    6325             : functions of the class have been declared yet).  This routine can
    6326             : be called from outside of IL lowering, and it is careful not to change
    6327             : the class or to depend on any lowering data structures.
    6328             : */
    6329             : {
    6330             :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    6331             : 
    6332             :   check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(class_type) && !C_mode());
    6333             :   *unknown = TRUE;
    6334             :   if (is_incomplete_type(class_type)) {
    6335             :     /* The class is not fully defined yet. */
    6336             :   } else {
    6337             :     /* It's late enough that we can determine the right answer. */
    6338             :     /* Note that, for ABIs where the key function can be affected by a
    6339             :        definition outside of the class, the test below may find the wrong
    6340             :        key function if we're called too early in the compilation, but we
    6341             :        really only care that there is a key function, not which function
    6342             :        it is or whether it's defined at this point. */
    6343             :     *unknown = FALSE;
    6344             :     if (needs_virtual_function_table(class_type)) {
    6345             :       /* The class needs a virtual function table.  Generally this means the
    6346             :          typeinfo variable will go out if and only if the vtable variable goes
    6347             :          out. */
    6348             :       result = TRUE;
    6349             :       if (typeinfo_uncoupled_when_vtable_is_optional) {
    6350             :         /* In this ABI, the typeinfo variable is not constrained to go out
    6351             :            paired with the vtable if the vtable is "optional", meaning it
    6352             :            goes out only if referenced. */
    6353             :         a_boolean     force_static, optional;
    6354             :         a_routine_ptr first_virtual;
    6355             :         /* Note that we're deliberately not setting il_lowering_underway --
    6356             :            we don't want to force prelowering of the class type. */
    6357             :         (void)virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    6358             :                                                             &force_static,
    6359             :                                                             &first_virtual,
    6360             :                                                             &optional);
    6361             :         if (optional) result = FALSE;
    6362             :       }  /* if */
    6363             :     }  /* if */
    6364             :   }  /* if */
    6365             :   return result;
    6366             : }  /* typeinfo_goes_out_where_vtable_goes_out */
    6367             : 
    6368             : #if ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION < 238
    6369             : 
    6370             : a_boolean external_typeinfo_will_be_defined_for_class(a_type_ptr class_type)
    6371             : /*
    6372             : Return TRUE if an external typeinfo variable will be defined for the
    6373             : indicated class in this translation unit because of some requirement
    6374             : imposed by IL lowering.  Note that this routine should only be called
    6375             : very late in the compilation.  This processing is used to fix a problem
    6376             : with generation of destructor pointers in typeinfo variables that is fixed
    6377             : in a different and better way in version 2.38.
    6378             : */
    6379             : {
    6380             :   a_boolean     needed = FALSE, force_static, optional;
    6381             :   a_routine_ptr first_virtual;
    6382             :   a_boolean     saved_il_lowering_underway;
    6383             : 
    6384             :   if (il_lowering_needed()) {
    6385             :     saved_il_lowering_underway = il_lowering_underway;
    6386             :     il_lowering_underway = TRUE;
    6387             :     /* Force generation of the virtual function table variable (if any) for the
    6388             :        class. */
    6389             :     prelower_class_type(class_type);
    6390             :     /* See if the class has a virtual function table. */
    6391             :     if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    6392             :                                           virtual_function_table_var != NULL) {
    6393             :       /* See if the virtual function table will be defined in this
    6394             :          compilation. */
    6395             :       if (virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    6396             :                                                         &force_static,
    6397             :                                                         &first_virtual,
    6398             :                                                         &optional) &&
    6399             :           !force_static) {
    6400             :         /* The virtual function table will be defined in this translation unit
    6401             :            and will be external. */
    6402             :         needed = TRUE;
    6403             :       }  /* if */
    6404             :     }  /* if */
    6405             :     il_lowering_underway = saved_il_lowering_underway;
    6406             :   }  /* if */
    6407             :   return needed;
    6408             : }  /* external_typeinfo_will_be_defined_for_class */
    6409             : 
    6410             : #endif /* ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION < 238 */
    6411             : 
    6412             : /*
    6413             : Pointer to routine entry for the runtime routine __pure_virtual_called,
    6414             : a pointer to which is placed in virtual function table slots for
    6415             : pure virtual functions.  NULL until allocated.
    6416             : */
    6417             : static a_routine_ptr
    6418             :                 pure_virtual_called_routine;
    6419             : 
    6420             : /*
    6421             : Pointer to routine entry for the runtime routine that is to be called when a
    6422             : deleted virtual function is invoked.  A pointer to this function is placed in
    6423             : virtual function table slots for deleted virtual functions.  NULL until
    6424             : allocated.
    6425             : */
    6426             : static a_routine_ptr
    6427             :                 deleted_virtual_called_routine;
    6428             : 
    6429             : 
    6430             : static void add_init(a_constant_ptr *first_con,
    6431             :                      a_constant_ptr *last_con,
    6432             :                      a_constant_ptr init,
    6433             :                      a_boolean      prepend)
    6434             : /*
    6435             : Add init to the list of initializers bounded by first_con and last_con.
    6436             : If prepend is TRUE, add init to the front of the list; otherwise, add it
    6437             : to the end.
    6438             : */
    6439             : {
    6440             :   if (*first_con == NULL) {
    6441             :     *first_con = *last_con = init; 
    6442             :   } else if (prepend) {
    6443             :     init->next = *first_con;
    6444             :     *first_con = init;
    6445             :   } else {
    6446             :     (*last_con)->next = init;
    6447             :     *last_con = init;
    6448             :   } /* if */
    6449             : } /* add_init */
    6450             : 
    6451             : 
    6452             : static void add_vtbl_entry_init(a_targ_ptrdiff_t delta,
    6453             :                                 a_routine_ptr    func_to_call,
    6454             :                                 a_boolean        typeinfo_entry,
    6455             :                                 a_constant_ptr   *first_con,
    6456             :                                 a_constant_ptr   *last_con,
    6457             :                                 a_boolean        prepend,
    6458             :                                 a_type_ptr       class_type)
    6459             : /*
    6460             : Put out a constant to fill an entry of a virtual function table.
    6461             : The constant is added to the end (beginning) of the list given by
    6462             : *first_con and *last_con if prepend is FALSE (TRUE).  func_to_call
    6463             : may be NULL; in that case, a NULL pointer is put out for the function
    6464             : unless typeinfo_entry is TRUE, in which case a pointer to the
    6465             : typeinfo variable for class_type is put into the function pointer field
    6466             : (but if RTTI information is not supposed to be generated, null is put out).
    6467             : For the Cfront-like ABI, create a ck_aggregate constant and dependent
    6468             : constants to initialize the entry to {delta, 0, func_to_call}.
    6469             : For the IA-64 ABI, put out a single constant (a delta or a function
    6470             : pointer) rather than an aggregate; however, when typeinfo_entry is TRUE
    6471             : put out two constants (delta to start of class plus pointer to typeinfo),
    6472             : which will initialize two slots in the virtual function table.
    6473             : class_type is the class type whose vtbl is being constructed
    6474             : (for some meaning of that word), for use in error messages.
    6475             : */
    6476             : {
    6477             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6478             :   a_constant_ptr entry_aggr, i_con;
    6479             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    6480             :   a_constant_ptr delta_con = NULL, func_con = NULL;
    6481             :   a_type_ptr     pointer_type;
    6482             : 
    6483             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6484             :   /* The type of the pointer is vptp_type (a generic function pointer),
    6485             :      previously built. */
    6486             :   check_assertion(vptp_type != NULL);
    6487             :   pointer_type = vptp_type;
    6488             :   /* Allocate the subaggregate constant. */
    6489             :   entry_aggr = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    6490             :   entry_aggr->type = make_vtbl_entry_type();
    6491             :   /* Add the constant to the primary aggregate list. */
    6492             :   add_init(first_con, last_con, entry_aggr, prepend);
    6493             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6494             :   /* The type of the pointer is the same as all the other vtable entries. */
    6495             :   pointer_type = make_vtbl_entry_type();
    6496             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6497             :   /* Allocate the constants for the initial values. */
    6498             : #if IA64_ABI
    6499             :   if (func_to_call != NULL) {
    6500             :     /* There should never be a non-zero delta when we are emitting a function
    6501             :        pointer.  The IA64 ABI requires the use of thunks, rather than storing
    6502             :        deltas in the vtable. */
    6503             :     check_assertion(delta == 0);
    6504             :   } else 
    6505             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6506             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
    6507             :   {
    6508             :     delta_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    6509             :     set_delta_constant(delta, delta_con, class_type);
    6510             : #if IA64_ABI
    6511             :     if (!il_identical_types(delta_con->type, pointer_type)) {
    6512             :       /* In configurations where the delta size is smaller than the size of
    6513             :          a vtable entry, add a cast to the proper type. */
    6514             :       implicit_cast(delta_con, pointer_type);
    6515             :     }  /* if */
    6516             :     add_init(first_con, last_con, delta_con, prepend);
    6517             :     /* In the IA-64 ABI, we generally put out only a single constant.
    6518             :        The exception is when typeinfo_entry is TRUE, when we put out
    6519             :        the delta and the typeinfo pointer. */
    6520             :     if (!typeinfo_entry) goto done;
    6521             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6522             :   }  /* if */
    6523             :   /* Make the pointer to the function to call. */ 
    6524             :   func_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address);
    6525             :   if (func_to_call == NULL) {
    6526             :     if (typeinfo_entry) {
    6527             :       /* This is the typeinfo slot in the virtual function table. */
    6528             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    6529             :       if (generate_rtti_typeinfo) {
    6530             :         /* A pointer to a typeinfo variable is put into the function pointer
    6531             :            field.  This is used for the [0] entry in the table (Cfront-like
    6532             :            ABI) or the [-1] entry in the table (IA-64 ABI) when the RTTI
    6533             :            ABI changes are enabled. */
    6534             :         a_variable_ptr typeinfo_var = make_typeinfo_var(class_type);
    6535             :         /* This requires that it be possible to put a variable pointer into
    6536             :            a function pointer.  Sorry about that. */
    6537             :         set_variable_address_constant(typeinfo_var, func_con,
    6538             :                                       /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    6539             :         implicit_cast(func_con, pointer_type);
    6540             :       } else
    6541             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    6542             :       /* Do not add code here. */
    6543             :       {
    6544             :         /* Put a null typeinfo pointer in the table.  This is used when
    6545             :            RTTI is disabled. */
    6546             :         make_zero_of_proper_type(pointer_type, func_con);
    6547             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES && !IA64_ABI
    6548             :         /* If exceptions are enabled, force generation of the typeinfo variable
    6549             :            for the type because it might be referenced from some other
    6550             :            compilation unit.  When RTTI information is generated, the virtual
    6551             :            function table always points to the typeinfo variable, so this
    6552             :            processing is not needed.  In the IA-64 ABI, the typeinfo is
    6553             :            put out as a COMDAT everywhere it is used. */
    6554             :         if (exceptions_enabled) {
    6555             :           (void)make_typeinfo_var(class_type);
    6556             :         }  /* if */
    6557             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES && !IA64_ABI */
    6558             :       }  /* if */
    6559             :     } else {
    6560             :       /* Put a NULL pointer in the table.  This is used for the
    6561             :          last entry in cfront mode. */
    6562             :       make_zero_of_proper_type(pointer_type, func_con);
    6563             :     }  /* if */
    6564             :   } else {
    6565             :     if (func_to_call->pure_virtual) {
    6566             :       /* A pure virtual function.  Put the address of runtime routine
    6567             :          __pure_virtual_called in the table. */
    6568             :       func_to_call = make_prototyped_runtime_routine(
    6569             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6570             :                                           "__pure_virtual_called",
    6571             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6572             :                                           "__cxa_pure_virtual",
    6573             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6574             :                                           &pure_virtual_called_routine,
    6575             :                                           void_type(), NULL, NULL, NULL,
    6576             :                                           NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
    6577             :     } else if (func_to_call->is_deleted) {
    6578             :       /* A deleted virtual function.  Put the address of a special runtime
    6579             :          routine (that presumably causes termination) in the table. */
    6580             :       func_to_call = make_prototyped_runtime_routine(
    6581             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6582             :                                           "__deleted_virtual_called",
    6583             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6584             :                                           "__cxa_deleted_virtual",
