    6585             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6586             :                                           &deleted_virtual_called_routine,
    6587             :                                           void_type(), NULL, NULL, NULL,
    6588             :                                           NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
    6589             :     }  /* if */
    6590             :     /* Put the pointer to the function into the table. */
    6591             :     set_routine_address_constant(func_to_call, func_con,
    6592             :                                  /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    6593             :     implicit_cast(func_con, pointer_type);
    6594             :     /* Mark the routine as referenced. */
    6595             :     func_to_call->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
    6596             :   }  /* if */
    6597             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6598             :   /* The "i" field is set to zero -- it's not used in virtual function
    6599             :      tables, only in pointers to member functions. */
    6600             :   i_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
    6601             :   set_integer_constant(i_con, (a_host_large_integer)0,
    6602             :                        targ_virtual_function_index_int_kind);
    6603             :   /* Put together the aggregate constant. */
    6604             :   entry_aggr->variant.aggregate.first_constant = delta_con;
    6605             :   delta_con->next = i_con;
    6606             :   i_con->next = func_con;
    6607             :   entry_aggr->variant.aggregate.last_constant = func_con;
    6608             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6609             :   /* Add the pointer constant. */
    6610             :   add_init(first_con, last_con, func_con, prepend);
    6611             : done:;
    6612             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6613             : #if DEBUG
    6614             :   if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    6615             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6616             :     db_constant(entry_aggr);
    6617             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6618             :     if (delta_con != NULL) db_constant(delta_con);
    6619             :     if (func_con != NULL)  db_constant(func_con);
    6620             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6621             :     fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
    6622             :   }  /* if */
    6623             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    6624             : }  /* add_vtbl_entry_init */
    6625             : 
    6626             : 
    6627             : static a_routine_ptr find_virtual_function(
    6628             :                                   a_virtual_function_number   entry_number,
    6629             :                                   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp,
    6630             :                                   a_routine_ptr               primary_function)
    6631             : /*
    6632             : Find the virtual function with the number entry_number in the class whose
    6633             : class type supplement is pointed to by ctsp, and return a  pointer to it.
    6634             : The function must be found.  Start searching at the point in the member
    6635             : functions list given by primary_function (and wrap the search around
    6636             : to the beginning of the list if necessary), or start at the beginning if
    6637             : primary_function is NULL.
    6638             : */
    6639             : {
    6640             : #if CHECKING
    6641             :   int times_started_over = 0;
    6642             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    6643             : 
    6644             :   /*lint --e{850} primary_function modified in loop */
    6645             :   for (;; primary_function = primary_function->next) {
    6646             :     if (primary_function == NULL) {
    6647             : #if CHECKING
    6648             :       /* Make sure we don't loop if no routine with this number exists. */
    6649             :       if (++times_started_over > 1) {
    6650             :         internal_error("find_virtual_function: cannot find routine");
    6651             :       }  /* if */
    6652             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    6653             :       /* Start at the beginning of the list. */
    6654             :       primary_function = ctsp->assoc_scope->routines;
    6655             :     }  /* if */
    6656             :     /* Exit the loop when we find the routine we want. */
    6657             :     if (primary_function->is_virtual &&
    6658             :         primary_function->virtual_function_number == entry_number) break;
    6659             :   }  /* for */
    6660             :   return primary_function;
    6661             : }  /* find_virtual_function */
    6662             : 
    6663             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    6664             : 
    6665             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6666             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- rabcp, delta, and vcall_index are not used in that case. */
    6667             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    6668             : static a_routine_ptr make_wrapper_routine(
    6669             :                                      a_routine_ptr         overriding_function,
    6670             :                                      a_routine_ptr         overridden_function,
    6671             :                                      a_base_class_ptr      rabcp,
    6672             :                                      a_targ_ptrdiff_t      delta,
    6673             :                                      a_virtual_table_index vcall_index)
    6674             : /*
    6675             : Create or find a routine for an entry wrapper that handles "this" adjustments
    6676             : and/or covariant return types.  The routine is a version of
    6677             : overriding_function that can be used in place of overridden_function (i.e., it
    6678             : has the return type of the overridden function).  When used for IA-64
    6679             : thunks, rabcp, delta, and vcall_index provide the description of the
    6680             : function of the thunk.  The generated routine is not given a definition
    6681             : yet.
    6682             : */
    6683             : {
    6684             :   a_routine_ptr         rout, entry_routine;
    6685             :   a_type_ptr            entry_rout_type, overriding_rout_type;
    6686             :   a_type_ptr            overridden_rout_type;
    6687             :   a_param_type_ptr      ptp, prev_ptp, src_ptp;
    6688             : #if IA64_ABI
    6689             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t      return_delta;
    6690             :   a_virtual_table_index vbase_index;
    6691             :   a_base_class_ptr      virtual_bcp;
    6692             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6693             : 
    6694             : #if IA64_ABI
    6695             :   if (overriding_function->pure_virtual ||
    6696             :       overriding_function->is_deleted) {
    6697             :     /* If the overriding function is pure or deleted, there is no need for a
    6698             :        thunk.  Instead, we just use the overriding function itself; elsewhere,
    6699             :        that will be replaced with __cxa_pure_virtual or __cxa_deleted_virtual
    6700             :        as appropriate. */
    6701             :     entry_routine = overriding_function;
    6702             :     goto end_of_routine;
    6703             :   }  /* if */
    6704             :   /* Compute the return delta and virtual base index. */
    6705             :   if (rabcp == NULL) {
    6706             :     return_delta = 0;
    6707             :     vbase_index = 0;
    6708             :   } else {
    6709             :     if (any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(rabcp)) {
    6710             :       /* If there is a virtual base between the type returned by the
    6711             :          overriding function and the overridden function, find the virtual
    6712             :          base index for that base. */
    6713             :       if (rabcp->is_virtual) {
    6714             :         virtual_bcp = rabcp;
    6715             :       } else {
    6716             :         virtual_bcp = rabcp->derivation->path->base_class;
    6717             :         check_assertion(virtual_bcp->is_virtual);
    6718             :       }  /* if */
    6719             :       vbase_index = virtual_bcp->vbase_offset_index;
    6720             :       return_delta = rabcp->offset - virtual_bcp->offset;
    6721             :     } else {
    6722             :       vbase_index = 0;
    6723             :       return_delta = rabcp->offset;
    6724             :     }  /* if */
    6725             :   }  /* if */
    6726             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6727             :   /* The entry routines are added after the overriding routine, so look there
    6728             :      to see if one has already been created. */
    6729             :   for (rout = overriding_function->next;
    6730             :        rout != NULL && rout->overriding_function_for_wrapper != NULL;
    6731             :        rout = rout->next) {
    6732             :     if (rout->overriding_function_for_wrapper == overriding_function &&
    6733             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6734             :         rout->overridden_function_for_wrapper == overridden_function
    6735             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6736             :         /* In the IA64 ABI, the function that is being overridden does not
    6737             :            matter; all that matters is the adjustments that have to be made. */
    6738             :         rout->delta == delta && rout->vcall_index == vcall_index &&
    6739             :         rout->return_delta == return_delta && rout->vbase_index == vbase_index
    6740             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6741             :                                                                             ) {
    6742             :       /* Found an existing routine. */
    6743             :       entry_routine = rout;
    6744             :       goto end_of_routine;
    6745             :     }  /* if */
    6746             :   }  /* for */
    6747             :   /* Add a new routine, with the parameters of the overriding function
    6748             :      (including the right "this" parameter type), and the return type of the
    6749             :      overridden function. */
    6750             :   overriding_rout_type = overriding_function->type;
    6751             :   overriding_rout_type = skip_typerefs(overriding_rout_type);
    6752             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6753             :   check_assertion(!visited_yet(overriding_rout_type));
    6754             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    6755             :   /* The overriding routine may be an alternate entry point.  The type of 
    6756             :      such a routine has already been lowered, but that is harmless. */
    6757             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6758             :   overridden_rout_type = overridden_function->type;
    6759             :   overridden_rout_type = skip_typerefs(overridden_rout_type);
    6760             :   entry_routine = alloc_routine();
    6761             :   mark_as_not_visited(entry_routine);
    6762             :   entry_routine->compiler_generated = TRUE;
    6763             :   entry_routine->source_corresp.referenced =
    6764             :                                 overriding_function->source_corresp.referenced;
    6765             :   /* Give the new routine the same linkage as the overriding routine,
    6766             :      except that because the function is not defined yet it gets
    6767             :      sc_extern storage class if the overriding routine has
    6768             :      sc_unspecified storage class. */
    6769             :   entry_routine->storage_class = overriding_function->storage_class;
    6770             :   if (overriding_function->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    6771             :     entry_routine->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_extern;
    6772             :   }  /* if */  
    6773             :   entry_routine->source_corresp.name_linkage = 
    6774             :                               overriding_function->source_corresp.name_linkage;
    6775             :   /* Copy various properties/attributes from the overriding routine to the
    6776             :      associated thunk entry. */
    6777             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6778             :   /* If the overriding routine has the dllexport or dllimport attribute, then
    6779             :      the thunk must also have that attribute. */
    6780             :   entry_routine->decl_modifiers |=
    6781             :                            (overriding_function->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS);
    6782             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6783             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6784             : #if GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
    6785             :   entry_routine->ELF_visibility = overriding_function->ELF_visibility;
    6786             : #endif /* GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
    6787             :   entry_routine->is_weak = overriding_function->is_weak;
    6788             :   if (has_gnu_routine_supp(overriding_function)) {
    6789             :     ensure_gnu_routine_supp(entry_routine)->section =
    6790             :                                 gnu_routine_supp(overriding_function)->section;
    6791             :   }  /* if */
    6792             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6793             : #if SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6794             :   /* If the overriding routine has a Sun link scope, propagate it to the
    6795             :      thunk. */
    6796             :   entry_routine->decl_modifiers |=
    6797             :                  (overriding_function->decl_modifiers & DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE);
    6798             : #endif /* SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6799             :   set_inline_flag(entry_routine, (a_boolean)overriding_function->is_inline);
    6800             : #if ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT
    6801             :   /* Use the needed bit number from the overriding function.  This is needed
    6802             :      when instantiating inline functions. */
    6803             :   entry_routine->instantiation_needed_bit_number =
    6804             :                           overriding_function->instantiation_needed_bit_number;
    6805             : #endif /* ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT */
    6806             :   entry_routine->overriding_function_for_wrapper = overriding_function;
    6807             :   entry_routine->overridden_function_for_wrapper = overridden_function;
    6808             : #if IA64_ABI
    6809             :   entry_routine->delta = delta;
    6810             :   entry_routine->vcall_index = vcall_index;
    6811             :   entry_routine->return_delta = return_delta;
    6812             :   entry_routine->vbase_index = vbase_index;
    6813             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6814             :   entry_routine->type = entry_rout_type = alloc_type((a_type_kind)tk_routine);
    6815             :   /* Force later lowering of the routine type (one reason: to get the
    6816             :      implicit "this" parameter processed). */
    6817             :   mark_as_not_visited(entry_rout_type);
    6818             :   entry_rout_type->variant.routine.return_type =
    6819             :                                   lowered_return_type_of(overridden_rout_type);
    6820             :   *entry_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info =
    6821             :                              *overriding_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
    6822             :   entry_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info->assoc_routine = NULL;
    6823             :   entry_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info->assoc_routine_is_ctor = FALSE;
    6824             :   entry_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info->assoc_routine_is_dtor = FALSE;
    6825             :   /* Copy the parameter list. */
    6826             :   entry_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list = NULL;
    6827             :   src_ptp = unlowered_param_type_list_for_routine(overriding_function);
    6828             :   prev_ptp = NULL;
    6829             :   for (; src_ptp != NULL; src_ptp = src_ptp->next) {
    6830             :     ptp = alloc_param_type(src_ptp->type);
    6831             :     /* Force later lowering of the parameter (one reason: to add the
    6832             :        indirection on parameters passed via copy constructor). */
    6833             :     mark_as_not_visited(ptp); 
    6834             :     *ptp = *src_ptp;
    6835             :     if (prev_ptp == NULL) {
    6836             :       entry_rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list = ptp;
    6837             :     } else {
    6838             :       prev_ptp->next = ptp;
    6839             :     }  /* if */
    6840             :     prev_ptp = ptp;
    6841             :     ptp->next = NULL;
    6842             :   }  /* for */
    6843             :   /* Give the routine a mangled name. */
    6844             :   mangle_wrapper_name(entry_routine);
    6845             :   /* Insert the routine right after the overriding routine. */
    6846             :   entry_routine->next = overriding_function->next;
    6847             :   overriding_function->next = entry_routine;
    6848             :   /* Keep the last_routine pointer up to date. */
    6849             :   if (curr_translation_unit->file_scope_pointers_block.last_routine ==
    6850             :                                                        overriding_function) {
    6851             :     curr_translation_unit->file_scope_pointers_block.last_routine = 
    6852             :                                                               entry_routine;
    6853             :   }  /* if */
    6854             : end_of_routine:
    6855             :   return entry_routine;
    6856             : }  /* make_wrapper_routine */
    6857             : 
    6858             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    6859             : 
    6860             : #if IA64_ABI
    6861             : 
    6862             : static void add_vcall_offsets(a_constant_ptr   *first_con,
    6863             :                               a_constant_ptr   *last_con,
    6864             :                               a_base_class_ptr vbase,
    6865             :                               a_base_class_ptr ctor_bcp,
    6866             :                               a_targ_size_t    vbase_offset)
    6867             : /*
    6868             : *first_con and *last_con give the endpoints of the aggregate constant that
    6869             : initializes a virtual function table.  Add virtual call offsets to the
    6870             : beginning of it.  vbase is the virtual base for which we are adding vcall
    6871             : offsets.  If ctor_bcp is non-NULL, it is the base class for
    6872             : vbase->derived_class as a subobject of some larger class type that is the
    6873             : actual complete object type (used in determining layout).  The vbase_offset
    6874             : gives the offset to the virtual base class whose vtable is being made.
    6875             : */
    6876             : {
    6877             :   a_base_class_ptr                   bcp;
    6878             :   a_base_class_ptr                   overrider_bcp;
    6879             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr        ctsp;
    6880             :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr ovfp;
    6881             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t                   offset;
    6882             :   a_vcall_offset_entry_ptr           voep;
    6883             : 
    6884             :   /* Go through the vcall offset entries for vbase, adding them to the 
    6885             :      virtual table.  */
    6886             :   ctsp = vbase->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    6887             :   for (voep = ctsp->vcall_offsets; voep != NULL; voep = voep->next) {
    6888             :     /* If this vcall offset entry will be put out in a primary base class it
    6889             :        should not be put out again here. */
    6890             :     if (voep->is_primary) continue;
    6891             :     bcp = voep->base_class;
    6892             :     if (bcp == NULL) {
    6893             :       bcp = vbase;
    6894             :     } else {
    6895             :       /* Find the base corresponding to bcp in vbase->derived_class. */
    6896             :       bcp = corresp_base_class(bcp, vbase);
    6897             :     }  /* if */
    6898             :     /* Find the class in which this routine was overridden. */
    6899             :     overrider_bcp = bcp;
    6900             :     for (ovfp = bcp->overriding_virtual_functions; ovfp != NULL; 
    6901             :          ovfp = ovfp->next) {
    6902             :       if (ovfp->primary_function == voep->routine) {
    6903             :         overrider_bcp = ovfp->base_class;
    6904             :         break;
    6905             :       }  /* if */
    6906             :     }  /* for */
    6907             :     /* In a construction vtable, find the base corresponding to bcp in the
    6908             :        most derived class. */
    6909             :     if (ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    6910             :       if (overrider_bcp == NULL) {
    6911             :         overrider_bcp = ctor_bcp;
    6912             :       } else {
    6913             :         overrider_bcp = corresp_base_class(overrider_bcp, ctor_bcp);
    6914             :       }  /* if */
    6915             :     }  /* if */
    6916             :     /* The offset is the offset from vbase to overrider_bcp -- where both are
    6917             :        considered in the complete object. */
    6918             :     offset = ((overrider_bcp != NULL) ? overrider_bcp->offset : 0) -
    6919             :                                                                  vbase_offset;
    6920             : #if DEBUG
    6921             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    6922             :       fprintf(f_debug, "  vcall entry (prepend):  ");
    6923             :     }  /* if */
    6924             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    6925             :     add_vtbl_entry_init(offset, (a_routine_ptr)NULL, /*typeinfo_entry=*/FALSE,
    6926             :                         first_con, last_con, /*prepend=*/TRUE,
    6927             :                         vbase->type);
    6928             : #if DEBUG
    6929             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    6930             :       fprintf(f_debug, "    vbase_offset = %ld\n", (long)vbase_offset);
    6931             :       fprintf(f_debug, "    ");
    6932             :       if (overrider_bcp != NULL) {
    6933             :         db_base_class(overrider_bcp, /*show_offset=*/TRUE);
    6934             :       } else {
    6935             :         db_base_class(bcp, /*show_offset=*/TRUE);
    6936             :       }  /* if */
    6937             :     }  /* if */
    6938             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    6939             :   }  /* for */
    6940             : }  /* add_vcall_offsets */
    6941             : 
    6942             : 
    6943             : static a_boolean virtual_functions_match(a_routine_ptr r1,
    6944             :                                          a_routine_ptr r2)
    6945             : /*
    6946             : There is a match between r1 and r2 if there could exist a function that
    6947             : overrides both of them, i.e., if they have the same signature.  This condition
    6948             : is different from checking that both routines have the same overrider; it is
    6949             : possible that they are from distinct subobjects and no single function
    6950             : overrides both of them.  
    6951             : */
    6952             : {
    6953             :   a_boolean    result = FALSE;
    6954             :   a_symbol_ptr sym1, sym2;
    6955             : 
    6956             :   /* The routines should not have been lowered yet. */
    6957             :   check_assertion(!visited_yet(r1));
    6958             :   check_assertion(!visited_yet(r2));
    6959             : 
    6960             :   sym1 = (a_symbol_ptr)r1->source_corresp.assoc_info;
    6961             :   sym2 = (a_symbol_ptr)r2->source_corresp.assoc_info;
    6962             :   if (sym1 != NULL && sym2 != NULL && 
    6963             :       (sym1->header == sym2->header || 
    6964             :        (r1->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor &&
    6965             :         r2->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor)) &&
    6966             :       param_types_are_compatible(r1->type, r2->type, TCF_NO_FLAGS) &&
    6967             :       this_param_types_correspond(r1->type, r2->type,
    6968             :                                   /*check_as_conversion=*/FALSE,
    6969             :                                   /*check_as_operands=*/FALSE)) {
    6970             :     result = TRUE;
    6971             :   }  /* if */
    6972             :   return result;
    6973             : }  /* virtual_functions_match */
    6974             : 
    6975             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    6976             : 
    6977             : #if !IA64_ABI
    6978             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- primary_function, subobject_bcp, adjustment_bcp,
    6979             :                     overriding_function, thunk, not used in that case. */
    6980             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    6981             : static void find_delta_and_vcall_index(
    6982             :                                      a_routine_ptr         primary_function,
    6983             :                                      a_base_class_ptr      overriding_bcp,
    6984             :                                      a_base_class_ptr      overridden_bcp,
    6985             :                                      a_base_class_ptr      subobject_bcp,
    6986             :                                      a_base_class_ptr      adjustment_bcp,
    6987             :                                      a_boolean             filling_vtable,
    6988             :                                      a_routine_ptr         overriding_function,
    6989             :                                      a_targ_ptrdiff_t      *delta,
    6990             :                                      a_virtual_table_index *vcall_index,
    6991             :                                      a_routine_ptr         *thunk)
    6992             : /*
    6993             : The primary_function (declared in the overridden_bcp) has been overridden
    6994             : in the overriding_bcp, or in the overridden_bcp->derived_class if
    6995             : overriding_bcp is NULL.  Set *delta and *vcall_index where *delta is the
    6996             : constant adjustment to "this" that should be performed when calling the
    6997             : function from the overridden_bcp, and where *vcall_index, if non-zero, gives
    6998             : the virtual function table index where an additional dynamic adjustment is
    6999             : located.  For the Cfront-like ABI, *vcall_index is not used (it is set to
    7000             : zero).  If filling_vtable is TRUE, the result will be used directly for a
    7001             : vtable entry and thus can be optimized without affecting the ABI.
    7002             : subobject_bcp identifies the subobject whose vtable is being created;
    7003             : if NULL it means the vtable for the complete object is being constructed, and
    7004             : the class of that object is overridden_bcp->derived_class (it's also
    7005             : overriding_bcp->derived_class, but overriding_bcp can be NULL).  adjustment_bcp
    7006             : gives the covariant return type adjustment required for the overriding function
    7007             : (NULL if none is required).  overriding_function specifies the overriding
    7008             : function of primary_function for this vtable entry; it is used only when
    7009             : filling_vtable is TRUE, and then only when non-NULL for an optimization in the
    7010             : IA-64 ABI.  In cases (in the IA-64 ABI) where a one-step thunk has been
    7011             : identified as an optimization, return it in *thunk (if thunk is non-NULL) to
    7012             : save the caller from searching for this routine.
    7013             : */
    7014             : {
    7015             : #if IA64_ABI
    7016             :   a_base_class_ptr                   derived_bcp;
    7017             :   a_derivation_step_ptr              step;
    7018             :   a_vcall_offset_entry_ptr           voep;
    7019             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7020             : 
    7021             :   *vcall_index = 0;
    7022             : #if IA64_ABI
    7023             :   /* If there is a virtual base class between the overridden base and the
    7024             :      overriding base, the "this" pointer is adjusted in two steps: first to
    7025             :      the nearest virtual base, and then to the final overrider. */
    7026             :   derived_bcp = overridden_bcp; 
    7027             :   while (derived_bcp != overriding_bcp) {
    7028             :     /* If the derived_bcp is virtual, then we need a vcall offset. */
    7029             :     if (derived_bcp->is_virtual) break;
    7030             :     /* And if derived_bcp is a direct base, then there are no virtual bases
    7031             :        on the path. */
    7032             :     if (derived_bcp->direct) {
    7033             :       derived_bcp = NULL;
    7034             :       break;
    7035             :     }  /* if */
    7036             :     /* Find the immediate derived class of the derived_bcp.  Since
    7037             :        derived_bcp is neither virtual nor direct, there are at least two
    7038             :        steps in the derivation. */
    7039             :     step = derived_bcp->derivation->path;
    7040             :     while (step->next->next != NULL) step = step->next;
    7041             :     derived_bcp = step->base_class;
    7042             :   }  /* while */
    7043             :   if (derived_bcp != overriding_bcp) {
    7044             :     a_boolean can_optimize_to_fixed_offset = FALSE;
    7045             :     check_assertion(derived_bcp->is_virtual);
    7046             :     /* There is a virtual step in the derivation.  Check to see if we need to
    7047             :        use the two-stage thunk (adjust "this" to the beginning of the virtual
    7048             :        base sub-object, then adjust it from the virtual base sub-object to the
    7049             :        overriding function's sub-object using the vcall offset) or can
    7050             :        optimize to use a single stage thunk or the overriding function
    7051             :        directly.  In general, this optimization is possible when the "this"
    7052             :        pointer already points to the beginning of the virtual base sub-object.
    7053             :        However, applying the optimization in all such cases can cause
    7054             :        interoperability problems (for example, using a thunk that the IA-64
    7055             :        ABI does not require to be generated).  The additional conditions
    7056             :        applied below approximate the cases in which g++ performs this
    7057             :        optimization, for maximum interoperability. */
    7058             :     if (filling_vtable) {
    7059             :       a_targ_ptrdiff_t fixed_offset;
    7060             :       /* When we're filling a vtable, we know exactly the layout of the
    7061             :          complete object.  We can't always use the fixed offset we compute
    7062             :          because the ABI might not require the thunk we would need to use.
    7063             :          However, if the computed fixed offset is zero, we can always
    7064             :          optimize to using the function directly without a thunk, because
    7065             :          in that case there's no possibility of referencing a thunk that
    7066             :          doesn't exist. */
    7067             :       /* The offset is the one it takes to get from the "this" pointer we
    7068             :          have (for subobject_bcp) to the one we need (for overriding_bcp).
    7069             :          We use subobject_bcp instead of overridden_bcp to deal with the
    7070             :          case where we're building the shared-base-class part of a vtable,
    7071             :          but in the actual object the base class object is not allocated
    7072             :          at the location of the derived class.  So the base class part is
    7073             :          really not shared with a base class; it's just the right values
    7074             :          for the derived class functions that are shared with the base
    7075             :          class vtable.  In particular, the "this" going in is assumed to
    7076             :          point to the derived object (it would also point to the shared base
    7077             :          class if it were there, but it's not).  subobject_bcp always works
    7078             :          for this because we know that overridden_bcp is a possibly indirect
    7079             :          primary base class of subobject_bcp (because we got here by walking
    7080             :          down the primary base classes when laying out the vtable).  When
    7081             :          subobject_bcp is NULL, the "this" we have is for the complete
    7082             :          object, and therefore counted as being at offset 0. */
    7083             :       if (overriding_bcp == NULL) {
    7084             :         fixed_offset = 0;
    7085             :       } else {
    7086             :         fixed_offset = overriding_bcp->offset;
    7087             :       }  /* if */
    7088             :       if (subobject_bcp != NULL) {
    7089             :         fixed_offset -= subobject_bcp->offset;
    7090             :       }  /* if */
    7091             :       if (fixed_offset == 0 && adjustment_bcp == NULL) {
    7092             :         /* The fixed offset is 0, so we can use the function directly
    7093             :            with no thunk.  Note that a covariant return type requires an
    7094             :            adjustment even if the offset is 0. */
    7095             :         can_optimize_to_fixed_offset = TRUE;
    7096             :       } else if (overriding_function != NULL && adjustment_bcp == NULL) {
    7097             :         /* See if there is a one-step thunk that has already been defined that
    7098             :            will have the same adjustment to the "this" pointer (i.e., find an
    7099             :            overriding function whose vcall_index is zero and whose delta is
    7100             :            fixed_offset).  This is purely an optimization (for faster virtual
    7101             :            call runtime performance, and potentially fewer thunks), but seems
    7102             :            to also match what g++ does.  Note that we don't try to perform
    7103             :            this optimization on routines with covariant returns (g++ appears
    7104             :            not to do this either). */
    7105             :         a_routine_ptr rout;
    7106             :         for (rout = overriding_function->next;
    7107             :              rout != NULL &&
    7108             :                   rout->overriding_function_for_wrapper == overriding_function;
    7109             :              rout = rout->next) {
    7110             :           if (rout->vcall_index == 0 &&
    7111             :               rout->delta == fixed_offset &&
    7112             :               rout->return_delta == 0) {
    7113             :             /* Found an existing routine that is a one-step thunk. */
    7114             :             *delta = fixed_offset;
    7115             :             *vcall_index = 0;
    7116             :             if (thunk != NULL) *thunk = rout;
    7117             :             goto end_of_routine;
    7118             :           }  /* if */
    7119             :         }  /* for */
    7120             :       }  /* if */
    7121             :     }  /* if */
    7122             :     if (can_optimize_to_fixed_offset) {
    7123             :       /* We can optimize to a fixed offset.  The offset will be that of the
    7124             :          sub-object, if any.  (Using subobject_bcp instead of overridden_bcp
    7125             :          handles cases where the sub-object is not the leftmost node in a
    7126             :          diamond inheritance.) */
    7127             :       overridden_bcp = subobject_bcp;
    7128             :     } else {
    7129             :       /* Need to use the two-stage thunk (that uses the vcall offset).  Look
    7130             :          through the derived_bcp to find the overrider on the vcall offset
    7131             :          list. */
    7132             :       voep = derived_bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    7133             :                                                                  vcall_offsets;
    7134             :       while (!virtual_functions_match(voep->routine, primary_function)) {
    7135             :         voep = voep->next;
    7136             :       }  /* while */
    7137             :       *vcall_index = voep->vcall_offset_index;
    7138             :       /* The delta (i.e., the fixed offset) will be the offset required to
    7139             :          reach the virtual base. */
    7140             :       overriding_bcp = derived_bcp;
    7141             :     }  /* if */
    7142             :   }  /* if */
    7143             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7144             :   if (overriding_bcp == NULL) {
    7145             :     /* The function is defined in the most-derived class. */
    7146             :     *delta = 0;
    7147             :   } else {
    7148             :     *delta = overriding_bcp->offset;
    7149             :   }  /* if */
    7150             :   if (overridden_bcp != NULL) {
    7151             :     /* Subtract the offset of the class whose vtbl we are building. */
    7152             :     *delta -= overridden_bcp->offset;
    7153             :   }  /* if */
    7154             : #if IA64_ABI
    7155             : end_of_routine:;
    7156             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7157             : }  /* find_delta_and_vcall_index */
    7158             : 
    7159             : 
    7160             : static void fill_virtual_function_table(
    7161             :                                   a_constant_ptr            *first_con,
    7162             :                                   a_constant_ptr            *last_con,
    7163             :                                   a_type_ptr                class_type,
    7164             :                                   a_base_class_ptr          bcp,
    7165             :                                   a_base_class_ptr          ctor_bcp,
    7166             :                                   a_base_class_ptr          derived_bcp,
    7167             :                                   a_virtual_function_number *next_entry_number,
    7168             :                                   a_routine_ptr             first_virtual)
    7169             : /*
    7170             : *first_con and *last_con are the first and last constants in the aggregate
    7171             : initializer that initialize a virtual function table.  Add to them the
    7172             : constants for the entries that define the virtual function table for base
    7173             : class bcp when it is contained within a whole object of type class_type.  If
    7174             : bcp is NULL, generate the virtual function table for class_type itself.  If
    7175             : ctor_bcp is non-NULL, it is the base class for class_type as a subobject of
    7176             : some larger class type that is the actual complete object type (used in
    7177             : determining layout); class_type in that case is the type considered to be the
    7178             : complete object type for purposes of overriding (this is used during
    7179             : constructors and destructors).  If derived_bcp is non-NULL, it is the most
    7180             : derived base with which bcp shares virtual function info.  On exit, return in
    7181             : *next_entry_number the next entry number after the last one filled.  If
    7182             : first_virtual is non-NULL, it points to the virtual function that was used as
    7183             : the basis for a decision on whether or not to put out the virtual function
    7184             : table.  
    7185             : */
    7186             : {
    7187             :   an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr override_list;
    7188             :   a_type_ptr                         class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made;
    7189             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr        ctsp;
    7190             :   a_routine_ptr                      primary_function;
    7191             :   a_virtual_function_number          entry_number, highest_entry_number;
    7192             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t                   delta;
    7193             :   a_routine_ptr                      func_to_call;
    7194             :   a_routine_ptr                      thunk_to_call;
    7195             :   a_base_class_ptr                   sharing_bcp, imm_bcp;
    7196             :   a_virtual_table_index              vcall_index;
    7197             :   a_boolean                          use_null_function;
    7198             : #if IA64_ABI
    7199             :   a_routine_ptr                      second_func_to_call;
    7200             :   a_base_class_ptr                   vcall_bcp;
    7201             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7202             : 
    7203             :   /* Determine the override list to use. */
    7204             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    7205             :     /* No overrides; we're doing the primary list. */
    7206             :     override_list = NULL;
    7207             :     class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made = class_type;
    7208             :   } else {
    7209             :     /* Get the list of overriding functions, i.e., functions in the base
    7210             :        class that are overridden in the class_type. */
    7211             :     override_list = bcp->overriding_virtual_functions;
    7212             :     class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made = bcp->type;
    7213             :   }  /* if */
    7214             :   ctsp = class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    7215             :   /* Start generating entries at the appropriate place. */
    7216             :   entry_number = FIRST_VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER;
    7217             :   /* See if we are generating a virtual function table in a case where the
    7218             :      virtual function table is shared with a base class. */
    7219             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7220             :   sharing_bcp = ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class;
    7221             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    7222             :   /* Use the primary base class so that we are sure to get all of the virtual
    7223             :      base class offsets for intervening classes. */
    7224             :   sharing_bcp = ctsp->primary_base_class;
    7225             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7226             :   if (sharing_bcp != NULL) {
    7227             :     /* The class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made shares a virtual function pointer
    7228             :        and (part of) a virtual function table with a base class. */
    7229             : #if CHECKING
    7230             :     if (sharing_bcp->offset != 0
    7231             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7232             :         || any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(sharing_bcp)
    7233             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    7234             :                                                        ) {
    7235             :       internal_error("fill_virtual_function_table: bad vtbl sharing");
    7236             :     }  /* if */
    7237             : #endif /* CHECKING */
    7238             :     /* Fill the part of the table that is shared with the immediate base
    7239             :        class that is on the path to the base class that contains the shared
    7240             :        pointer. */
    7241             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7242             :     imm_bcp = sharing_bcp->derivation->path->base_class;
    7243             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    7244             :     /* If sharing_bcp is non-virtual it is already immediate, and if it is
    7245             :        virtual it is OK for it to be non-immediate. */
    7246             :     imm_bcp = sharing_bcp;
    7247             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7248             :     if (bcp != NULL) {
    7249             :       /* When doing this processing for a base class, we have to find the
    7250             :          corresponding base class under class_type.  The base class we
    7251             :          have was extracted from class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made. */
    7252             :       imm_bcp = corresponding_base_class(imm_bcp, class_type, bcp);
    7253             :     }  /* if */
    7254             :     fill_virtual_function_table(first_con, last_con, class_type, imm_bcp,
    7255             :                                 ctor_bcp, derived_bcp, &entry_number, 
    7256             :                                 first_virtual);
    7257             :     /* Now continue to fill the rest of the table, the unshared part, which
    7258             :        contains the functions declared in class_type that do not appear
    7259             :        in the base classes with which the virtual function table is
    7260             :        shared. */
    7261             :     /* Skip the entries on the override list that apply to the shared part
    7262             :        of the table. */
    7263             :     while (override_list != NULL &&
    7264             :            override_list->primary_function->
    7265             :                                       virtual_function_number < entry_number) {
    7266             :       override_list = override_list->next;
    7267             :     }  /* while */
    7268             :   }  /* if */
    7269             : #if IA64_ABI
    7270             :   /* Add virtual base offsets to the beginning of the virtual table. */
    7271             :   for (imm_bcp = preorder_base_classes_of(class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made);
    7272             :        imm_bcp != NULL; imm_bcp = imm_bcp->next_preorder) {
    7273             :     a_base_class_ptr b2, imm_bcp_in_complete;
    7274             :     /* Skip non-virtual bases. */
    7275             :     if (!imm_bcp->is_virtual) continue;
    7276             :     /* If the virtual base is also a base of the base class with which we
    7277             :        share a vtable, there is already an entry there. */
    7278             :     if (sharing_bcp != NULL) {
    7279             :       for (b2 = base_classes_of(sharing_bcp->type);
    7280             :            b2 != NULL; 
    7281             :            b2 = b2->next) {
    7282             :         if (b2->is_virtual && same_entities(imm_bcp->type, b2->type)) break;
    7283             :       }  /* for */
    7284             :       if (b2 != NULL) continue;
    7285             :     }  /* if */
    7286             :     /* A virtual base offset is indeed required for imm_bcp.  Find imm_bcp in
    7287             :        the complete object.  No disambiguator is necessary because imm_bcp is
    7288             :        always a virtual base class. */
    7289             :     imm_bcp_in_complete = find_virtual_base_class_of((ctor_bcp) != NULL 
    7290             :                                                      ? ctor_bcp->derived_class
    7291             :                                                      : class_type,
    7292             :                                                      imm_bcp->type);
    7293             :     /* Now, find the offset to imm_bcp_in_complete. */
    7294             :     delta = (imm_bcp_in_complete->offset - 
    7295             :                               (derived_bcp != NULL ? derived_bcp->offset : 0));
    7296             :     /* Create the vtable entry. */
    7297             : #if DEBUG
    7298             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7299             :       fprintf(f_debug, "  vbase entry (prepend):  ");
    7300             :     }  /* if */
    7301             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7302             :     add_vtbl_entry_init(delta,
    7303             :                         (a_routine_ptr)NULL, /*typeinfo_entry=*/FALSE,
    7304             :                         first_con, last_con, /*prepend=*/TRUE,
    7305             :                         class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made);
    7306             : #if DEBUG
    7307             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7308             :       fprintf(f_debug, "    ");
    7309             :       db_base_class(imm_bcp_in_complete, /*show_offset=*/TRUE);
    7310             :     }  /* if */
    7311             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7312             :   }  /* for */
    7313             :   /* Add virtual call offsets to the beginning of the virtual table. */
    7314             :   if (bcp != NULL) {
    7315             :     vcall_bcp = emit_vcall_offsets_in_virtual_function_table(bcp);
    7316             :     if (vcall_bcp != NULL) {
    7317             :       add_vcall_offsets(first_con, last_con, vcall_bcp, ctor_bcp,
    7318             :                         (derived_bcp != NULL) ? derived_bcp->offset : 0);
    7319             :     }  /* if */
    7320             :   }  /* if */
    7321             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7322             :   /* Merge the list of virtual functions under class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made
    7323             :      and the overrides from the base class (if any) to create each entry of
    7324             :      the table. */
    7325             :   highest_entry_number = ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number;
    7326             :   /* Skip the loop if there are no functions. */
    7327             :   if (highest_entry_number == VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER_NONE) {
    7328             :     goto done;
    7329             :   } /* if */
    7330             :   primary_function = NULL;
    7331             :   /*lint --e{850} entry_number modified in loop */
    7332             :   for (; entry_number <= highest_entry_number; entry_number++) {
    7333             :     use_null_function = FALSE;
    7334             :     /* Find the virtual function with the number "entry_number". */
    7335             :     primary_function = find_virtual_function(entry_number,
    7336             :                                              ctsp, primary_function);
    7337             :     /* We have the routine entry.  See if there is an override entry on
    7338             :        the override list.  The entries on the override list are in sorted
    7339             :        order by number, so if the entry exists it will be first. */
    7340             :     if (override_list != NULL &&
    7341             :         override_list->primary_function == primary_function) {
    7342             :       /* The primary function is overridden by another function.
    7343             :          The delta (value to add to the "this" pointer) is
    7344             :          the offset of the class containing the function to call minus
    7345             :          the offset of the class whose vtbl we are building. */
    7346             :       a_base_class_ptr overriding_bcp = override_list->base_class;
    7347             :       a_base_class_ptr overridden_bcp = bcp;
    7348             :       if (ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    7349             :         /* The complete object type is different than the object type
    7350             :            being used to determine overloading.  This happens during
    7351             :            construction and destruction of subobjects, and is important
    7352             :            when virtual functions in virtual base classes are overridden,
    7353             :            because the offset between the class of the overridden function
    7354             :            and the class of the overriding function can be different in
    7355             :            the complete object than it is in a complete object of
    7356             :            the subobject type.  Determine the base classes for the
    7357             :            overridden and overriding classes in the complete object. */

    7359             :           overriding_bcp = ctor_bcp;

    7364             :           overridden_bcp = ctor_bcp;

    7366             :           overridden_bcp = corresp_base_class(overridden_bcp, ctor_bcp);
    7367             :         }  /* if */
    7368             :       }  /* if */
    7369             :       func_to_call = override_list->overriding_function;
    7370             : #if IA64_ABI

    7372             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {

    7374             :            the complete entry point and one for the deleting entry point. */

    7379             :         func_to_call = alternate_entry_point(
    7380             :                                           func_to_call,
    7381             :                                           (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_complete,
    7382             :                                           /*define_now=*/FALSE);
    7383             :       } else {
    7384             :         second_func_to_call = NULL;
    7385             :       }  /* if */
    7386             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7387             :       thunk_to_call = NULL;
    7388             :       find_delta_and_vcall_index(primary_function, overriding_bcp,
    7389             :                                  overridden_bcp, derived_bcp,
    7390             :                                  override_list->return_adjustment_base_class,
    7391             :                                  /*filling_vtable=*/TRUE, func_to_call,
    7392             :                                  &delta, &vcall_index, &thunk_to_call);
    7393             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    7394             :       if (override_list->return_adjustment_base_class != NULL
    7395             : #if IA64_ABI
    7396             :           || delta != 0 || vcall_index != 0
    7397             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7398             :                                                              ) {
    7399             :         /* This is an overriding function with a covariant return type, or
    7400             :            that requires adjustments to the "this" pointer on entry.  If the
    7401             :            "this" pointer must be adjusted, or if the return value requires an
    7402             :            offset adjustment, call an entry routine that is a wrapper for the
    7403             :            overriding function that adds the necessary casts. */
    7404             :         a_base_class_ptr rabcp = override_list->return_adjustment_base_class;
    7405             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7406             :         check_assertion(rabcp != NULL);
    7407             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */

    7409             : #if IA64_ABI

    7412             :             any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(rabcp)) {
    7413             : #if IA64_ABI
    7414             :           if (thunk_to_call != NULL) {
    7415             :             /* We already know which wrapper is being called, so use it. */

    7417             :           } else
    7418             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7419             :           /* Do not insert code here. */
    7420             :           {
    7421             :             func_to_call = make_wrapper_routine(func_to_call,

    7423             :                                                rabcp, delta, vcall_index);
    7424             :           }  /* if */
    7425             : #if IA64_ABI
    7426             :           if (second_func_to_call != NULL) {
    7427             :             /* Use the alternate entry point for the primary routine as the

    7437             :           /* The function called adjusts "this" so we do not have to do it. */
    7438             :           delta = 0;
    7439             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7440             :         }  /* if */
    7441             :       }  /* if */
    7442             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    7443             :       override_list = override_list->next;
    7444             :     } else {
    7445             :       /* The primary function is not overridden.  Therefore the function
    7446             :          to call is in the same class as the vtbl and the delta is 0 (the
    7447             :          "this" pointer does not need adjustment). */
    7448             :       delta = 0;
    7449             :       func_to_call = primary_function;
    7450             : #if IA64_ABI
    7451             :       if (func_to_call->special_kind ==
    7452             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {

    7454             :            the complete entry point and one for the deleting entry point. */
    7455             :         second_func_to_call = alternate_entry_point(
    7456             :                                           func_to_call,
    7457             :                                           (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_deleting,
    7458             :                                           /*define_now=*/FALSE);
    7459             :         func_to_call = alternate_entry_point(
    7460             :                                           func_to_call,
    7461             :                                           (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_complete,
    7462             :                                           /*define_now=*/FALSE);
    7463             :       } else {
    7464             :         second_func_to_call = NULL;
    7465             :       }  /* if */
    7466             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7467             :     }  /* if */
    7468             : #if IA64_ABI
    7469             :     if (gnu_mode && gnu_version >= 40900 && !clang_mode &&
    7470             :         ctor_bcp != NULL &&

    7472             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor &&
    7473             :           func_to_call->is_virtual) ||
    7474             :          (func_to_call->overriding_function_for_wrapper != NULL &&
    7475             :           func_to_call->overriding_function_for_wrapper->special_kind ==
    7476             :                                    (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor))) {
    7477             :       /* Beginning with 4.9.0, g++ suppresses references to virtual destructors
    7478             :          (and virtual destructor thunks) from construction virtual tables in
    7479             :          order to increase the likelihood that speculative devirtualization
    7480             :          will be successful.  Invoking a virtual destructor during object
    7481             :          construction is undefined behavior, so these entries should never be
    7482             :          referred to anyway. */
    7483             :       use_null_function = TRUE;
    7484             :     }  /* if */
    7485             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7486             :     /* Create the initializing constants for this entry of the table. */
    7487             : #if DEBUG
    7488             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7489             :       fprintf(f_debug, "  function entry:         ");
    7490             :     }  /* if */
    7491             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7492             :     add_vtbl_entry_init(delta,
    7493             :                         use_null_function ? (a_routine_ptr)NULL : func_to_call,
    7494             :                         /*typeinfo_entry=*/FALSE,
    7495             :                         first_con, last_con, /*prepend=*/FALSE,
    7496             :                         class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made);
    7497             : #if IA64_ABI
    7498             :     if (second_func_to_call != NULL) {
    7499             : #if DEBUG
    7500             :       if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7501             :         fprintf(f_debug, "  second function entry:  ");
    7502             :       }  /* if */
    7503             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7504             :       add_vtbl_entry_init(delta,
    7505             :                           use_null_function ? (a_routine_ptr)NULL :
    7506             :                                               second_func_to_call,
    7507             :                           /*typeinfo_entry=*/FALSE,
    7508             :                           first_con, last_con, /*prepend=*/FALSE,
    7509             :                           class_whose_vtbl_is_being_made);
    7510             :       entry_number += 1;
    7511             :     }  /* if */
    7512             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7513             :     /* The functions are usually in order by number so set up for the
    7514             :        next iteration in the common case. */
    7515             :     primary_function = primary_function->next;
    7516             :   }  /* for */
    7517             : done:
    7518             :   *next_entry_number = entry_number;
    7519             : }  /* fill_virtual_function_table */
    7520             : 
    7521             : #if !ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
    7522             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- ctor_bcp is not used in this mode. */
    7523             : #endif /* !ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
    7524             : static void define_one_virtual_function_table(
    7525             :                                           a_type_ptr       class_type,
    7526             :                                           a_base_class_ptr bcp,
    7527             :                                           a_base_class_ptr ctor_bcp,
    7528             :                                           a_variable_ptr   vtbl_var,
    7529             :                                           a_boolean        definition_needed,
    7530             :                                           a_boolean        force_static,
    7531             :                                           a_routine_ptr    first_virtual)
    7532             : /*
    7533             : Finish the job begun by make_var_for_virtual_function_table: finish making
    7534             : a virtual function table variable.  This routine handles things that could
    7535             : not be handled yet on the other call, like setting the size and storage
    7536             : class of the variable and generating the initial value for the variable
    7537             : (i.e., the virtual function table itself).  The virtual function table
    7538             : variable to be finished, vtbl_var, is the one for the base class
    7539             : indicated by bcp when it appears within a complete object of the class
    7540             : type class_type, or the one for class_type itself if bcp == NULL.  If
    7541             : ctor_bcp is non-NULL, it is the base class for class_type as a subobject
    7542             : of some larger class type that is the actual complete object type (used
    7543             : in determining layout); class_type in that case is the type considered
    7544             : to be the complete object type for purposes of overriding (this is used
    7545             : during constructors and destructors).  If definition_needed is FALSE,
    7546             : the virtual function table should not be defined in this compilation.
    7547             : If force_static is TRUE, the virtual function table is forced to be
    7548             : local to the current compilation even if the class is externally linked.
    7549             : If first_virtual is non-NULL, it points to the virtual function that was used
    7550             : as the basis for a decision on whether or not to put out the virtual function 
    7551             : table.  In the IA-64 ABI, this routine may be called multiple times
    7552             : for the same virtual function table variable; see note below.
    7553             : */
    7554             : {
    7555             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    7556             :   a_constant_ptr              aggr_con, *first_con, *last_con;
    7557             :   a_virtual_function_number   next_entry_number;
    7558             :   a_targ_size_t               number_of_virtual_functions;
    7559             :   a_memory_region_number      region_to_switch_back_to;
    7560             :   a_base_class_ptr            derived_bcp;
    7561             : #if IA64_ABI
    7562             :   a_constant_ptr              start_of_vtbl = NULL, end_of_vtbl = NULL;
    7563             :   a_boolean                   main_vtbl = FALSE;
    7564             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7565             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t            delta = 0;
    7566             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    7567             :   a_type_info_kind            kind = tik_last;
    7568             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    7569             : 
    7570             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7571             :   if ((vtbl_var->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
    7572             :     /* A virtual table for a dllimport-ed class should not be defined. */
    7573             :     definition_needed = FALSE;
    7574             :   }  /* if */
    7575             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7576             : #if IA64_ABI
    7577             :   /* For construction vtables, each virtual function table is placed in
    7578             :      a separate variable.  For normal (non-construction) vtables, a
    7579             :      single variable contains the primary vtable and all the base class
    7580             :      vtables, concatenated together.  Determine whether we are building
    7581             :      the first/only vtable in the variable (main_vtbl == TRUE) or
    7582             :      a vtable to be added to the end of the existing contents of the
    7583             :      variable (main_vtbl == FALSE). */
    7584             :   main_vtbl = (vtbl_var->type->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements == 0);
    7585             :   if (!main_vtbl && !vtbl_var->vtable_defined && definition_needed) {
    7586             :     /* In the case of a local class whose virtual function table was not needed
    7587             :        within the class but ends up being needed outside of the class, this
    7588             :        function will have been called initially with definition_needed set to
    7589             :        FALSE (during lowering of the function scope), but will be called
    7590             :        subsequently with definition_needed set to TRUE (during file scope
    7591             :        type lowering). */
    7592             :     main_vtbl = TRUE;
    7593             :   }  /* if */
    7594             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7595             :   /* Find the appropriate virtual function table variable. */
    7596             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    7597             :     /* We're doing the virtual function table for class_type itself. */
    7598             :     ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    7599             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    7600             :     /* If this is the virtual function table for a typeinfo type, which is
    7601             :        shared between the actual typeinfo type (if declared) and the typeinfo
    7602             :        type declared by IL lowering in case there is no declaration, make sure
    7603             :        to use the correct length (from the real typeinfo type). */
    7604             :     kind = is_type_info_vtbl(vtbl_var);
    7605             :     if (kind != tik_last && types_of_type_info[(int)kind] != NULL &&
    7606             :         class_type != types_of_type_info[(int)kind]) {
    7607             :       ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number =
    7608             :         types_of_type_info[(int)kind]->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
    7609             :                                                highest_virtual_function_number;
    7610             :     }  /* if */
    7611             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    7612             :   } else {
    7613             :     /* We're doing the virtual function table for bcp in class_type. */
    7614             :     ctsp = bcp->type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    7615             :   }  /* if */
    7616             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
    7617             :   if (kind == tik_user && !definition_needed) {
    7618             :     /* If we're creating the vtable for the type_info type, but we aren't
    7619             :        going to define the vtable here, leave the array size of the vtable
    7620             :        as [].  This prevents link-time problems where the vtable size
    7621             :        differs between translation units where one uses the type_info created
    7622             :        by lowering and another uses the real type_info (which is larger because
    7623             :        it has a virtual destructor). */
    7624             :   } else
    7625             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
    7626             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
    7627             :   {
    7628             :     /* Change the array size from [] to the proper size.  Note that the type
    7629             :        was created for this variable and is known not to be shared. */
    7630             :     if (ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number == VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER_NONE)
    7631             :                                                                               {
    7632             :       number_of_virtual_functions = 0;
    7633             :     } else {
    7634             :       /*lint --e(835)*/
    7635             :       number_of_virtual_functions = ctsp->highest_virtual_function_number -
    7636             :                                             FIRST_VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_NUMBER + 1;
    7637             :     }  /* if */
    7638             :     vtbl_var->type->variant.array.variant.number_of_elements +=
    7639             :                                 number_of_virtual_functions 
    7640             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7641             :     /* The "+1" is to skip leading entries, which makes the code to access the
    7642             :        table a little cleaner.  It's also necessary for cfront
    7643             :        compatibility. */
    7644             :                                 + 1
    7645             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    7646             :     /* Add an extra zeroed entry at the end of the table for full cfront
    7647             :        compatibility (although we don't know why the entry is there). */
    7648             :                                 + 1
    7649             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    7650             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    7651             :                                 + num_negative_vtable_entries(class_type, bcp)
    7652             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7653             :                                                                               ;
    7654             :     vtbl_var->type->size = 0;  /* Force recomputation of size. */
    7655             :     set_type_size(vtbl_var->type);
    7656             :   }  /* if */
    7657             :   /* Set the linkage on the virtual function table variable. */
    7658             : #if IA64_ABI
    7659             :   if (main_vtbl) {
    7660             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7661             :     /* Set the mangled name.  This is done here instead of in
    7662             :        make_var_for_virtual_function_table to avoid determining the module id
    7663             :        before all the top-level external names are known.  Don't set the
    7664             :        name if it was set already (that happens in some rare cases). */
    7665             :     if (vtbl_var->source_corresp.name == NULL) {
    7666             :       a_base_class_ptr eff_bcp = bcp;
    7667             : #if IA64_ABI
    7668             :       /* In the IA-64 ABI, several calls of this routine fill up the primary
    7669             :          vtable for the class.  We're on the first call here, but it might be
    7670             :          for a base class if the class itself does not need a vtable.
    7671             :          Set the name on the basis of the whole class. */
    7672             :       if (ctor_bcp == NULL) eff_bcp = NULL;
    7673             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7674             :       set_virtual_function_table_name(vtbl_var, class_type, eff_bcp, ctor_bcp);
    7675             :     }  /* if */
    7676             :     if (force_static) {
    7677             :       /* When told to by the flag force_static (e.g., for an internally-linked
    7678             :          class or one with no linkage), change the storage class to
    7679             :          static and the linkage to internal. */
    7680             :       vtbl_var->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_static;
    7681             :       vtbl_var->source_corresp.name_linkage = 
    7682             :                                             (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal;
    7683             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7684             :       /* If the table has internal linkage, we cannot make it dllimport or
    7685             :          dllexport. */
    7686             :       vtbl_var->decl_modifiers &= ~(a_decl_modifier)DM_DLLFLAGS;
    7687             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7688             : #if GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
    7689             :       vtbl_var->ELF_visibility = (an_ELF_visibility_kind)evk_unspecified;
    7690             : #endif /* GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
    7691             : #if SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7692             :       /* If the table has internal linkage, we cannot give it a Sun link
    7693             :          scope. */
    7694             :       vtbl_var->decl_modifiers &= ~(a_decl_modifier)DM_ANY_SUN_LINK_SCOPE;
    7695             : #endif /* SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7696             :     } else if (definition_needed) {
    7697             :       /* For an externally-linked class whose definition is needed, change the
    7698             :          variable to an external definition. */
    7699             :       vtbl_var->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
    7700             :       /* The variable can be referenced from another compilation unit. */
    7701             :       vtbl_var->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
    7702             : #if ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT
    7703             :       if (one_instantiation_per_object) {
    7704             :         /* If there is a decider function, put the virtual function table into
    7705             :            the same slice as the decider function. */
    7706             :         if (first_virtual != NULL) {
    7707             :           vtbl_var->instantiation_needed_bit_number =
    7708             :                                first_virtual->instantiation_needed_bit_number;
    7709             :         }  /* if */
    7710             :       }  /* if */
    7711             : #endif /* ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT */
    7712             :       if (ctor_bcp == NULL) {
    7713             :         /* A normal (non-construction) vtable. */
    7714             : #if IA64_ABI
    7715             :         put_variable_into_comdat_group(vtbl_var);
    7716             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7717             :       } else {
    7718             :         /* A construction vtable. */
    7719             :         a_variable_ptr primary_vtbl =
    7720             :                            primary_vtbl_var_for_class(ctor_bcp->derived_class);
    7721             :         /* Make a construction vtable optional if the primary vtable is
    7722             :            optional. */
    7723             :         vtbl_var->is_optional_vtable = primary_vtbl->is_optional_vtable;
    7724             : #if IA64_ABI
    7725             :         /* For a construction vtable, put the variable into the COMDAT named
    7726             :            for the primary vtable for the class. */
    7727             :         check_assertion(primary_vtbl->comdat_group != NULL);
    7728             :         vtbl_var->comdat_group = primary_vtbl->comdat_group;
    7729             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7730             :       }  /* if */
    7731             :     }  /* if */
    7732             : #if IA64_ABI
    7733             :   }  /* if */
    7734             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7735             :   /* Do not put out the initial value if the class should not be defined
    7736             :      in this compilation. */
    7737             :   if (definition_needed) {
    7738             :     vtbl_var->vtable_defined = TRUE;
    7739             : #if DEBUG
    7740             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7741             :       fprintf(f_debug, "\nDefining virtual function table for ");
    7742             :       if (bcp == NULL) {
    7743             :         db_abbreviated_type(class_type);
    7744             :         fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
    7745             :       } else {
    7746             :         db_base_class(bcp, /*show_offset=*/TRUE);
