    7747             : #if IA64_ABI
    7748             :         fprintf(f_debug, "  virtual_function_table_offset = %ld\n",
    7749             :               (long)bcp->virtual_function_table_offset);
    7750             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7751             :       }  /* if */
    7752             :       if (ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    7753             :         fprintf(f_debug, "ctor_bcp: ");
    7754             :         db_base_class(ctor_bcp, /*show_offset=*/TRUE);
    7755             : #if IA64_ABI
    7756             :         fprintf(f_debug, "  virtual_function_table_offset = %ld\n",
    7757             :               (long)ctor_bcp->virtual_function_table_offset);
    7758             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7759             :       }  /* if */
    7760             :     }  /* if */
    7761             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7762             :     switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
    7763             :     /* Start the initialization by creating a ck_aggregate constant and
    7764             :        making it the initial value of the variable. */
    7765             : #if IA64_ABI
    7766             :     if (!main_vtbl) {
    7767             :       first_con = &start_of_vtbl;
    7768             :       last_con = &end_of_vtbl;
    7769             :     } else
    7770             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7771             :     /* Do not add code here. */
    7772             :     {
    7773             :       aggr_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_aggregate);
    7774             :       aggr_con->type = vtbl_var->type;
    7775             :       vtbl_var->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_static;
    7776             :       vtbl_var->initializer.constant = aggr_con;
    7777             :       first_con = &aggr_con->variant.aggregate.first_constant;
    7778             :       last_con = &aggr_con->variant.aggregate.last_constant;
    7779             :     }  /* if */
    7780             :     /* Put out the initialization for the [0] entry. */
    7781             :     /* The [0] entry includes the offset of the class whose vtbl is being
    7782             :        made in the complete class, and a pointer to the typeinfo entry for
    7783             :        the class. */
    7784             :     if (ctor_bcp == NULL) {
    7785             :       delta = (bcp != NULL) ? (a_targ_ptrdiff_t)bcp->offset :
    7786             :                               (a_targ_ptrdiff_t)0;
    7787             :     } else if (bcp == NULL) {
    7788             : #if IA64_ABI
    7789             :       delta = (a_targ_ptrdiff_t)0;
    7790             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    7791             :       unexpected_condition();
    7792             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7793             :     } else {
    7794             :       a_base_class_ptr eff_bcp = corresp_base_class(bcp, ctor_bcp);
    7795             :       delta = eff_bcp->offset - ctor_bcp->offset;
    7796             :     }
    7797             : #if IA64_ABI
    7798             :     /* Under the IA64 ABI, the sign is reversed: the value stored in the
    7799             :        vtable is added to the pointer to the base in order to get the
    7800             :        pointer to the complete object. */
    7801             :     delta = -delta;
    7802             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7803             : #if DEBUG
    7804             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7805             :       fprintf(f_debug, "  top + typeinfo entries: ");
    7806             :     }  /* if */
    7807             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7808             :     add_vtbl_entry_init(delta,
    7809             :                         (a_routine_ptr)NULL,
    7810             :                         /*typeinfo_entry=*/TRUE, first_con, 
    7811             :                         last_con, /*prepend=*/FALSE, class_type);
    7812             : #if IA64_ABI
    7813             :     /* Find the base (in the most derived class) corresponding to the subobject
    7814             :        whose vtable is being made. */
    7815             :     if (ctor_bcp != NULL && bcp != NULL) {
    7816             :       derived_bcp = corresp_base_class(bcp, ctor_bcp);
    7817             :     } else if (ctor_bcp != NULL) {
    7818             :       derived_bcp = ctor_bcp;
    7819             :     } else {
    7820             :       derived_bcp = bcp;
    7821             :     }  /* if */
    7822             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    7823             :     derived_bcp = NULL;
    7824             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7825             :     /* Put out the body of the table. */
    7826             :     fill_virtual_function_table(first_con, last_con, class_type, bcp, 
    7827             :                                 ctor_bcp, derived_bcp, 
    7828             :                                 &next_entry_number, first_virtual);
    7829             : #if IA64_ABI
    7830             :     if (!main_vtbl) {
    7831             :       aggr_con = vtbl_var->initializer.constant;
    7832             :       check_assertion(aggr_con != NULL);
    7833             :       aggr_con->variant.aggregate.last_constant->next = start_of_vtbl;
    7834             :       aggr_con->variant.aggregate.last_constant = end_of_vtbl;
    7835             :     }  /* if */
    7836             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7837             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    7838             :     /* Put out the initialization for an extra zeroed entry at the end, for
    7839             :        cfront compatibility. */
    7840             : #if DEBUG
    7841             :     if (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("vtbl")) {
    7842             :       fprintf(f_debug, "  zero entry:             ");
    7843             :     }  /* if */
    7844             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7845             :     add_vtbl_entry_init((a_targ_ptrdiff_t)0, (a_routine_ptr)NULL,
    7846             :                         /*typeinfo_entry=*/FALSE, first_con, last_con, 
    7847             :                         /*prepend=*/FALSE, class_type);
    7848             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    7849             :     switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
    7850             :   }  /* if */
    7851             : }  /* define_one_virtual_function_table */
    7852             : 
    7853             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
    7854             : 
    7855             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7856             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- class_type is not used in that case. */
    7857             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    7858             : static void define_construction_vtbls(
    7859             :                                     a_construction_vtbl_ptr construction_vtbls,
    7860             :                                     a_boolean               definition_needed,
    7861             :                                     a_boolean               force_static,
    7862             :                                     a_routine_ptr           first_virtual)
    7863             : /*
    7864             : Generate the definitions of the virtual function tables described on
    7865             : the construction_vtbls list.  These are special versions of virtual function
    7866             : tables to be used during construction of subobjects.
    7867             : */
    7868             : {
    7869             :   a_construction_vtbl_ptr     cvp;
    7870             :   a_base_class_ptr            base_class;
    7871             :   a_type_ptr                  derived_class;
    7872             : 
    7873             :   for (cvp = construction_vtbls; cvp != NULL; cvp = cvp->next) {
    7874             :     /* Do not define variables more than once (comes up with promoted
    7875             :        local classes). */
    7876             :     if (cvp->virtual_function_table_var->type->
    7877             :                                variant.array.variant.number_of_elements == 0) {
    7878             : #if IA64_ABI
    7879             :       if (!cvp->is_subobject) {
    7880             :         base_class = NULL;
    7881             :         derived_class = cvp->variant.derived_class;
    7882             :       } else 
    7883             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7884             :       /* Do not insert code here. */
    7885             :       {
    7886             :         base_class = cvp->variant.base_class;
    7887             :         derived_class = base_class->derived_class;
    7888             :       }  /* if */
    7889             :       define_one_virtual_function_table(derived_class, base_class,
    7890             :                                         cvp->ctor_base_class,
    7891             :                                         cvp->virtual_function_table_var,
    7892             :                                         definition_needed, force_static,
    7893             :                                         first_virtual);
    7894             :     }  /* if */
    7895             :   }  /* for */
    7896             : }  /* define_construction_vtbls */
    7897             : 
    7898             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
    7899             : 
    7900             : #if IA64_ABI
    7901             : 
    7902             : static void f_define_virtual_function_tables(
    7903             :                                        a_type_ptr            class_type,
    7904             :                                        a_base_class_ptr      bcp,
    7905             :                                        a_boolean             definition_needed,
    7906             :                                        a_boolean             force_static,
    7907             :                                        a_routine_ptr         first_virtual)
    7908             : /*
    7909             : Generate the variable for the virtual function table for the class type, 
    7910             : and calculate the offset to the virtual function tables for its base
    7911             : classes.  If bcp is NULL, process class_type and all of its bases; otherwise,
    7912             : process only those bases below bcp. 
    7913             : */
    7914             : {
    7915             :   a_base_class_ptr            base_bcp, eff_bcp;
    7916             :   a_type_ptr                  type;
    7917             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    7918             : 
    7919             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    7920             :     type = class_type; 
    7921             :   } else {
    7922             :     type = bcp->type;
    7923             :   }  /* if */
    7924             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    7925             :   /* Make a virtual function table for this type. */
    7926             :   if ((bcp == NULL) ? needs_virtual_function_table(class_type) :
    7927             :                       base_class_has_vtbl(bcp)) {
    7928             :     /* Generate the virtual function table variable for the class
    7929             :        itself. */
    7930             :     define_one_virtual_function_table(class_type, (a_base_class_ptr)bcp,
    7931             :                                       (a_base_class_ptr)NULL, 
    7932             :                                       ctsp->virtual_function_table_var,
    7933             :                                       definition_needed, force_static,
    7934             :                                       first_virtual);
    7935             :   }  /* if */
    7936             :   /* Recursively process the direct, non-primary base classes. */
    7937             :   for (base_bcp = preorder_base_classes_of(type);
    7938             :        base_bcp != NULL;
    7939             :        base_bcp = base_bcp->next_preorder) {
    7940             :     if (base_bcp->direct && !base_bcp->is_virtual) {
    7941             :       eff_bcp = corresponding_base_class(base_bcp, class_type, bcp);
    7942             :       f_define_virtual_function_tables(class_type, eff_bcp, definition_needed,
    7943             :                                        force_static, first_virtual);
    7944             :     }  /* if */
    7945             :   }  /* for */
    7946             :   /* Recursively process the virtual base classes if we are currently
    7947             :      processing the most derived class. */
    7948             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    7949             :     for (base_bcp = preorder_base_classes_of(type);
    7950             :          base_bcp != NULL;
    7951             :          base_bcp = base_bcp->next_preorder) {
    7952             :       if (base_bcp->is_virtual) {
    7953             :         eff_bcp = corresponding_base_class(base_bcp, class_type, 
    7954             :                                            (a_base_class_ptr)NULL);
    7955             :         f_define_virtual_function_tables(class_type, eff_bcp,
    7956             :                                          definition_needed, force_static,
    7957             :                                          first_virtual);
    7958             :       }  /* if */
    7959             :     }  /* for */
    7960             :   }  /* if */
    7961             : }  /* f_define_virtual_function_tables */
    7962             : 
    7963             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    7964             : 
    7965             : static void define_virtual_function_tables(a_type_ptr class_type)
    7966             : /*
    7967             : Generate the definitions of the virtual function tables for the class type
    7968             : class_type if any are needed.
    7969             : */
    7970             : {
    7971             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    7972             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7973             :   a_base_class_ptr            bcp;
    7974             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    7975             :   a_boolean                   need_determined = FALSE;
    7976             :   a_boolean                   definition_needed = FALSE, force_static;
    7977             :   a_boolean                   optional;
    7978             :   a_routine_ptr               first_virtual;
    7979             : 
    7980             :   /* Make sure the class type has been pre-lowered. */
    7981             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    7982             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    7983             :   if (ctsp->virtual_function_table_var != NULL &&
    7984             :       /* Do not define virtual function tables more than once (comes up
    7985             :          with promoted local classes and with the generated type_info
    7986             :          vtable). */
    7987             :       ctsp->virtual_function_table_var->init_kind ==
    7988             :                                                     (an_init_kind)initk_none) {
    7989             :     /* The class has a virtual function table.  Generate the definition
    7990             :        if it is supposed to be generated in the present compilation. */
    7991             :     definition_needed = 
    7992             :                  virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    7993             :                                                                &force_static,
    7994             :                                                                &first_virtual,
    7995             :                                                                &optional);
    7996             :     need_determined = TRUE;
    7997             : #if !IA64_ABI
    7998             :     /* Generate the virtual function table for the class itself. */
    7999             :     define_one_virtual_function_table(class_type, (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    8000             :                                       (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    8001             :                                       ctsp->virtual_function_table_var,
    8002             :                                       definition_needed, force_static,
    8003             :                                       first_virtual);
    8004             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    8005             :     f_define_virtual_function_tables(class_type, (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    8006             :                                      definition_needed, force_static,
    8007             :                                      first_virtual);
    8008             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */      
    8009             :   }  /* if */
    8010             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8011             :   /* Generate the virtual function table for each base class when it
    8012             :      is contained within a complete object of the primary class. */
    8013             :   for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8014             :     if (base_class_has_vtbl(bcp) &&
    8015             :         /* Do not define virtual function tables more than once (comes up
    8016             :            with promoted local classes). */
    8017             :         bcp->virtual_function_table_var->type->
    8018             :                                variant.array.variant.number_of_elements == 0) {
    8019             :       if (!need_determined) {
    8020             :         definition_needed = 
    8021             :                  virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    8022             :                                                                &force_static,
    8023             :                                                                &first_virtual,
    8024             :                                                                &optional);
    8025             :         need_determined = TRUE;
    8026             :       }  /* if */
    8027             :       define_one_virtual_function_table(class_type, bcp,
    8028             :                                         (a_base_class_ptr)NULL,
    8029             :                                         bcp->virtual_function_table_var,
    8030             :                                         definition_needed, force_static,
    8031             :                                         first_virtual);
    8032             :     }  /* if */
    8033             :   }  /* for */
    8034             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    8035             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
    8036             :   /* Define any special virtual function tables needed during subobject
    8037             :      construction and destruction. */
    8038             :   if (ctsp->construction_vtbls != NULL) {
    8039             :     if (!need_determined) {
    8040             :       definition_needed = 
    8041             :                  virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    8042             :                                                                &force_static,
    8043             :                                                                &first_virtual,
    8044             :                                                                &optional);
    8045             :       need_determined = TRUE;
    8046             :     }  /* if */
    8047             :     define_construction_vtbls(ctsp->construction_vtbls,
    8048             :                               definition_needed, force_static,
    8049             :                               first_virtual);
    8050             : #if IA64_ABI
    8051             :     /* Define the VTT. */
    8052             :     if (definition_needed) {
    8053             :       define_construction_vtbls_array(class_type, 
    8054             :                                       ctsp->virtual_table_table_var,
    8055             :                                       ctsp->construction_vtbls);
    8056             :     }  /* if */
    8057             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8058             :   }  /* if */
    8059             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8060             :   /* Virtual base classes have their own separate tables. */
    8061             :   for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8062             :     if (bcp->base_construction_vtbls != NULL) {
    8063             :       if (!need_determined) {
    8064             :         definition_needed = 
    8065             :                  virtual_function_table_should_be_defined_here(class_type,
    8066             :                                                                &force_static,
    8067             :                                                                &first_virtual,
    8068             :                                                                &optional);
    8069             :         need_determined = TRUE;
    8070             :       }  /* if */
    8071             :       define_construction_vtbls(bcp->base_construction_vtbls,
    8072             :                                 definition_needed,
    8073             :                                 force_static, first_virtual);
    8074             :     }  /* if */
    8075             :   }  /* for */
    8076             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    8077             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
    8078             : }  /* define_virtual_function_tables */
    8079             : 
    8080             : 
    8081             : static void define_scope_virtual_function_tables(a_scope_ptr scope)
    8082             : /*
    8083             : Make all needed definitions of virtual function tables for all classes
    8084             : in the indicated scope.
    8085             : 
    8086             : Note that the virtual function table variables were created during
    8087             : prelowering; this routine adds initial values to those variables if
    8088             : appropriate.  This routine is called at the beginning of lowering of
    8089             : each memory region, because it must be called (1) after all function
    8090             : definitions have been seen (because deciding on defining virtual function
    8091             : tables depends on knowing whether member functions of the class are
    8092             : defined in the present compilation) and (2) before members have been
    8093             : promoted out of classes (because that destroys the list of member
    8094             : functions, including virtual functions, needed in this process).
    8095             : */
    8096             : {
    8097             :   a_type_ptr      type;
    8098             :   a_scope_ptr     class_scope, block_scope;
    8099             :   a_namespace_ptr nsp;
    8100             : 
    8101             :   if (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
    8102             :     /* Temporarily set innermost_function_scope to this function scope; it
    8103             :        may be needed during the generation of virtual function tables (e.g.,
    8104             :        when prelowering a local virtual type in a function whose lowering
    8105             :        has been delayed). */
    8106             :     check_assertion(innermost_function_scope == NULL);
    8107             :     innermost_function_scope = scope;
    8108             :   }  /* if */
    8109             :   /* Visit all types to find all class types. */
    8110             :   for (type = scope->types; type != NULL; type = type->next) {
    8111             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
    8112             :         !ignore_type_in_back_end(type)) {
    8113             :       define_virtual_function_tables(type);
    8114             :       class_scope = type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->assoc_scope;
    8115             :       if (class_scope != NULL) {
    8116             :         define_scope_virtual_function_tables(class_scope);
    8117             :       }  /* if */
    8118             :     }  /* if */
    8119             :   }  /* for */
    8120             :   /* Visit all namespaces. */
    8121             :   for (nsp = scope->namespaces; nsp != NULL; nsp = nsp->next) {
    8122             :     if (!nsp->is_namespace_alias) {
    8123             :       define_scope_virtual_function_tables(nsp->variant.assoc_scope);
    8124             :     }  /* if */
    8125             :   }  /* for */
    8126             :   /* Visit all block scopes. */
    8127             :   for (block_scope = scope->scopes;
    8128             :        block_scope != NULL;
    8129             :        block_scope = block_scope->next) {
    8130             :     define_scope_virtual_function_tables(block_scope);
    8131             :   }  /* for */
    8132             :   if (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
    8133             :     innermost_function_scope = NULL;
    8134             :   }  /* if */
    8135             : }  /* define_scope_virtual_function_tables */
    8136             : 
    8137             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    8138             : 
    8139             : static a_boolean class_has_independently_allocated_virtual_base_classes(
    8140             :                                                          a_type_ptr class_type)
    8141             : /*
    8142             : Return TRUE if the class class_type has any virtual base classes that
    8143             : are allocated as part of a complete object of type class_type, as opposed
    8144             : to within base classes of class_type.  Such a class requires a
    8145             : type-as-subobject that is different from its normal type.
    8146             : */
    8147             : {
    8148             :   a_boolean        has_indep_virt_base_classes = FALSE;
    8149             :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    8150             : 
    8151             :   for (bcp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->base_classes;
    8152             :        bcp != NULL;
    8153             :        bcp = bcp->next) {
    8154             :     if (bcp->is_virtual) {
    8155             :       /* A virtual base class. */
    8156             :       if (bcp->data_section_base_class == NULL) {
    8157             :         /* A virtual base class that is not allocated within one of the
    8158             :            base classes. */
    8159             :         has_indep_virt_base_classes = TRUE;
    8160             :         break;
    8161             :       }  /* if */
    8162             :     }  /* if */
    8163             :   }  /* for */
    8164             :   return has_indep_virt_base_classes;
    8165             : }  /* class_has_independently_allocated_virtual_base_classes */
    8166             : 
    8167             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    8168             : 
    8169             : static void make_subobject_class_type(a_type_ptr class_type)
    8170             : /*
    8171             : Make a version of the indicated class type that is suitable for use when
    8172             : the class is used as a subobject.  Record the subobject type in the
    8173             : subobject_partner field of the class type supplement.  If the original
    8174             : class has no virtual base classes, the subobject type will be the same
    8175             : type.  The original class type must have been lowered just to the point where
    8176             : the fields for the virtual base class space would be added; that allows
    8177             : this routine to do a relatively simple copy of the all the fields.
    8178             : */
    8179             : {
    8180             :   a_field_ptr                 old_field, last_field;
    8181             :   a_type_ptr                  subobject_type;
    8182             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp, subobject_ctsp;
    8183             :   a_scope_depth               scope_depth;
    8184             : 
    8185             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8186             :   if ((!class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes
    8187             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    8188             :       || !class_has_independently_allocated_virtual_base_classes(class_type)
    8189             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    8190             :                                                                             )
    8191             : #if IA64_ABI
    8192             :       && (!targ_reuse_tail_padding ||
    8193             :           class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_union ||
    8194             :           ctsp->size_without_virtual_base_classes == class_type->size)
    8195             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8196             :                                                                       ) {
    8197             :     /* There are no virtual base classes and no tail padding that can be used
    8198             :        by a base class (unions cannot have base classes), so the type to use
    8199             :        as a subobject is the same as the class type itself. */
    8200             :     subobject_type = class_type;
    8201             :   } else {
    8202             :     /* Make a copy of the class type for use as the subobject type. */
    8203             :     check_assertion(class_type->kind != (a_type_kind)tk_union);
    8204             :     subobject_type = make_lowered_class_type((a_type_kind)tk_struct);
    8205             :     subobject_ctsp = subobject_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8206             :     subobject_ctsp->compiler_generated = TRUE;
    8207             :     /* Give the struct a name that is a prefix followed by the original name.
    8208             :        Also give it the same declaration position as the original type. */
    8209             :     mangle_subobject_class_name(class_type, subobject_type);
    8210             :     subobject_type->source_corresp.decl_position = 
    8211             :                                       class_type->source_corresp.decl_position;
    8212             :     subobject_type->source_corresp.is_class_member =
    8213             :                                     class_type->source_corresp.is_class_member;
    8214             :     subobject_type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function =
    8215             :                                class_type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function;
    8216             :     /* Clear the default file scope parent set by make_lowered_class_type so
    8217             :        it can be set again. */
    8218             :     subobject_type->source_corresp.parent_scope = NULL;
    8219             :     set_parent_scope(&subobject_type->source_corresp, iek_type,
    8220             :                      get_parent_scope_of(class_type));
    8221             :     /* Ideally, the referenced flag would not be set if the class type is
    8222             :        not referenced.  However, the class type might not be referenced now
    8223             :        (part-way through the compilation) and then be referenced later. */
    8224             :     subobject_type->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
    8225             :     /* The type-as-subobject gets the same alignment restriction as the
    8226             :        class type. */
    8227             :     subobject_type->variant.class_struct_union.max_member_alignment =
    8228             :                    class_type->variant.class_struct_union.max_member_alignment;
    8229             :     /* Put the struct type on the file-scope types list right after the
    8230             :        associated type.  This is done instead of calling add_to_types_list
    8231             :        because we want to get the type at the right place on the list.
    8232             :        If the class type is the last entry on some type list,
    8233             :        use add_to_types_list to get the last_type pointer updated. */
    8234             :     if (class_type->next == NULL) {
    8235             :       /* The class type is the last on a list.  Use add_to_types_list to add
    8236             :          the subobject type so that the last-pointer will be updated. */
    8237             :       if (is_class_or_namespace_member(class_type) ||
    8238             :           !class_type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function) {
    8239             :         /* For class and namespace members, and entities in the file scope,
    8240             :            add_to_types_list can figure out the right processing, and the
    8241             :            loop below fails if it runs into a namespace reactivation. */
    8242             :         add_to_types_list(subobject_type, NO_SCOPE_DEPTH);
    8243             :         goto added_to_list;
    8244             :       } else {
    8245             :         /* See if the list is one of the ones being tracked in the scope
    8246             :            stack.  This handles function-local types. */
    8247             :         for (scope_depth = depth_scope_stack;
    8248             :              scope_depth >= 0;
    8249             :              scope_depth--) {
    8250             :           if (class_type ==
    8251             :               assoc_pointers_block_of(&scope_stack[scope_depth])->last_type) {
    8252             :             /* Found the list.  Add the subobject type to its end. */
    8253             :             add_to_types_list(subobject_type, scope_depth);
    8254             :             goto added_to_list;
    8255             :           }  /* if */
    8256             :         }  /* for */
    8257             :       }  /* if */
    8258             :     }  /* if */
    8259             :     /* The class type is not the last on a list we're tracking. */
    8260             :     subobject_type->next = class_type->next;
    8261             :     class_type->next = subobject_type;
    8262             : added_to_list:;
    8263             :     /* Copy the fields of the class to the subobject type.  This includes
    8264             :        fields added for things like the virtual function table pointer. */
    8265             :     last_field = NULL;
    8266             :     for (old_field = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    8267             :          old_field != NULL;
    8268             :          old_field = old_field->next) {
    8269             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    8270             :       if (field_is_nontrivial_property_or_event(old_field)) {
    8271             :         /* Do not copy fields representing nontrivial properties or events:
    8272             :            They will be removed. */
    8273             :         continue;
    8274             :       }  /* if */
    8275             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    8276             :       /* Copy a field. */
    8277             :       copy_field(old_field, subobject_type, &last_field);
    8278             :     }  /* for */
    8279             :     check_assertion(!class_type->incomplete);
    8280             :     subobject_type->incomplete = FALSE;
    8281             :     subobject_type->size = ctsp->size_without_virtual_base_classes;
    8282             :     subobject_type->alignment = ctsp->alignment_without_virtual_base_classes;
    8283             :     /* add_to_types_list is not called on purpose.  See above. */
    8284             :     subobject_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_functions =
    8285             :                   class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_functions;
    8286             :     subobject_type->variant.class_struct_union.
    8287             :       any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes =
    8288             :                              class_type->variant.class_struct_union.
    8289             :                                any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes;
    8290             :     subobject_ctsp->size_without_virtual_base_classes =
    8291             :                                        ctsp->size_without_virtual_base_classes;
    8292             :     subobject_ctsp->virtual_function_info_offset =
    8293             :                                             ctsp->virtual_function_info_offset;
    8294             :     /* Preserve the information on sharing of virtual function table pointers.
    8295             :        This is not terribly clean, in that the base class pointed to is not
    8296             :        a base class of the type-as-subobject.  However, by the end of IL
    8297             :        lowering this field is no longer meaningful, so the value is strange
    8298             :        only during IL lowering. */
    8299             :     subobject_ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class =
    8300             :                                         ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class;
    8301             :     /* The subobject type has no virtual base classes and is therefore its
    8302             :        own type as subobject.  This prevents prelowering from being done on
    8303             :        the class type, and therefore prevents generation of virtual function
    8304             :        tables. */
    8305             :     subobject_ctsp->subobject_partner = class_type;
    8306             :     /* Indicate that this class has a distinct subobject type. */
    8307             :     ctsp->has_subobject_type = TRUE;
    8308             :   }  /* if */
    8309             :   ctsp->subobject_partner = subobject_type;
    8310             : }  /* make_subobject_class_type */
    8311             : 
    8312             : #if IA64_ABI
    8313             : 
    8314             : static a_vcall_offset_entry_ptr* compute_vcall_offset_indices(
    8315             :                                          a_type_ptr                class_type,
    8316             :                                          a_base_class_ptr          bcp,
    8317             :                                          a_vcall_offset_entry_ptr* next_offset,
    8318             :                                          a_boolean                 is_primary)
    8319             : /* 
    8320             : Compute the vcall offset indices for routines in class_type, when class_type
    8321             : is used as a virtual base.  bcp is the subobject of class_type to process, or
    8322             : NULL if the complete object should be processed.  next_offset points to the
    8323             : location where the next offset should be added.  The value returned is
    8324             : the new location where the next offset should be added.  If is_primary is
    8325             : TRUE, bcp is a direct or indirect primary base of class_type.
    8326             : */
    8327             : {
    8328             :   a_type_ptr                         base_type;
    8329             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr        ctsp, base_ctsp;
    8330             :   a_routine_ptr                      rout;
    8331             :   a_base_class_ptr                   b, b_in_derived;
    8332             :   a_vcall_offset_entry_ptr           voep;
    8333             : 
    8334             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8335             :   /* Compute the type that we are processing. */
    8336             :   base_type = (bcp != NULL) ? bcp->type : class_type;
    8337             :   base_ctsp = base_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8338             :   /* Add vcall offsets for the primary base. */
    8339             :   b = base_ctsp->primary_base_class;
    8340             :   if (b != NULL && (!b->is_virtual || is_primary)) {
    8341             :     /* Find the base (in the derived class) that corresponds to b. */
    8342             :     if (bcp != NULL) {
    8343             :       b_in_derived = corresp_base_class(b, bcp);
    8344             :     } else {
    8345             :       b_in_derived = b;
    8346             :     }  /* if */
    8347             :     next_offset = compute_vcall_offset_indices(class_type, b_in_derived, 
    8348             :                                                next_offset, 
    8349             :                                                is_primary);
    8350             :   }  /* if */
    8351             :   /* Go through all of the routines in this type, adding vcall offsets.
    8352             :      Sometimes, when processing a compiler-generated class, there is no
    8353             :      associated scope. */
    8354             :   for (rout = (base_ctsp->assoc_scope != NULL ? 
    8355             :                base_ctsp->assoc_scope->routines : (a_routine_ptr)NULL);
    8356             :        rout != NULL;
    8357             :        rout = rout->next) {
    8358             :     /* Skip things like prototype instantiations of member function
    8359             :        templates. */
    8360             :     if (ignore_routine_in_back_end(rout)) continue;
    8361             :     /* Skip non-virtual functions. */
    8362             :     if (!rout->is_virtual) continue;
    8363             :     /* Alternate entry points of constructors and destructors are not
    8364             :        expected here. */
    8365             :     check_assertion(rout->primary_ctor_or_dtor == NULL);
    8366             :     /* The routine should not have been lowered yet. */
    8367             :     check_assertion(!visited_yet(rout));
    8368             :     /* See if we already have an entry for this routine.  */
    8369             :     for (voep = ctsp->vcall_offsets; voep != NULL; voep = voep->next) {
    8370             :       /* There is a match between rout and voep->routine if there could exist
    8371             :          a function which overrides both of them, i.e., if they have the
    8372             :          same signature.  This condition is different from checking that both
    8373             :          routines have the same overrider; it is possible that they are from
    8374             :          distinct subobjects and no single function overrides both of 
    8375             :          them.  */
    8376             :       if (virtual_functions_match(rout, voep->routine)) break;
    8377             :     }  /* for */
    8378             :     if (voep != NULL) continue;
    8379             :     /* Create a new vcall offset entry. */
    8380             :     voep = alloc_vcall_offset_entry();
    8381             :     voep->routine = rout;
    8382             :     voep->base_class = bcp;
    8383             :     if (bcp && any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(bcp)) {
    8384             :       voep->is_primary = TRUE;
    8385             :     } else {
    8386             :       voep->is_primary = FALSE;
    8387             :     }  /* if */
    8388             :     voep->vcall_offset_index = ctsp->next_negative_virtual_table_index--;
    8389             :     *next_offset = voep;
    8390             :     next_offset = &voep->next;
    8391             :   }  /* for */
    8392             :   /* Now, add vcall offsets for bcp's bases. */
    8393             :   for (b = base_classes_of(base_type); b != NULL; b = b->next) {
    8394             :     if (b->direct && !b->is_virtual && b != base_ctsp->primary_base_class) {
    8395             :       /* Find the base (in the derived class) that corresponds to b. */
    8396             :       if (bcp != NULL) {
    8397             :         b_in_derived = corresp_base_class(b, bcp);
    8398             :       } else {
    8399             :         b_in_derived = b;
    8400             :       }  /* if */
    8401             :       next_offset = compute_vcall_offset_indices(class_type, b_in_derived, 
    8402             :                                                  next_offset, 
    8403             :                                                  /*is_primary=*/FALSE);
    8404             :     }  /* if */
    8405             :   }  /* for */
    8406             :   return next_offset;
    8407             : }  /* compute_vcall_offset_indices */
    8408             : 
    8409             : 
    8410             : static void compute_vbase_and_vcall_offset_indices(a_type_ptr       class_type,
    8411             :                                                    a_base_class_ptr bcp)
    8412             : /*
    8413             : Compute the virtual base offset indices for class_type.  bcp indicates the
    8414             : subobject of class_type to process; if NULL, it indicates the complete
    8415             : object.  Compute the virtual base and virtual call offsets of class_type that
    8416             : come from bcp.
    8417             : */
    8418             : {
    8419             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr        ctsp, base_ctsp;
    8420             :   a_type_ptr                         base_type;
    8421             :   a_base_class_ptr                   sharing_bcp;
    8422             :   a_base_class_ptr                   b, b_in_derived;
    8423             : 
    8424             :   check_assertion(bcp == NULL || bcp->derived_class == class_type);
    8425             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8426             :   /* Compute the type that we are processing. */
    8427             :   base_type = (bcp != NULL) ? bcp->type : class_type;
    8428             :   base_ctsp = base_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8429             :   /* If that type has a shared vtable, compute the vbase and vcall offsets for
    8430             :      the shared part first. */
    8431             :   sharing_bcp = base_ctsp->primary_base_class;
    8432             :   if (sharing_bcp != NULL) {
    8433             :     if (bcp != NULL) {
    8434             :       /* Find sharing_bcp in the complete object. */
    8435             :       sharing_bcp = corresp_base_class(sharing_bcp, bcp);
    8436             :     }  /* if */
    8437             :     compute_vbase_and_vcall_offset_indices(class_type, sharing_bcp);
    8438             :   }  /* if */
    8439             :   /* Iterate through the base classes, finding virtual bases. */
    8440             :   for (b = preorder_base_classes_of(base_type); b != NULL; 
    8441             :        b = b->next_preorder) {
    8442             :     /* Skip non-virtual bases. */
    8443             :     if (!b->is_virtual) continue;
    8444             :     /* Find this virtual base in class_type. */
    8445             :     b_in_derived = find_virtual_base_class_of(class_type, b->type);
    8446             :     /* If the virtual base has not already been assigned an index, assign
    8447             :        one now. */
    8448             :     if (b_in_derived->vbase_offset_index == 0) {
    8449             :       b_in_derived->vbase_offset_index =
    8450             :                                    ctsp->next_negative_virtual_table_index--;
    8451             :     }  /* if */
    8452             :   }  /* for */
    8453             :   /* Remember the first vcall index. */
    8454             :   if (bcp == NULL) {
    8455             :     ctsp->first_vcall_offset_index = ctsp->next_negative_virtual_table_index;
    8456             :   }  /* if */
    8457             :   /* Process vcall offsets. */
    8458             :   if (bcp == NULL || bcp->is_virtual) {
    8459             :     a_vcall_offset_entry_ptr* next_offset = &ctsp->vcall_offsets;
    8460             :     while (*next_offset != NULL) next_offset = &(*next_offset)->next;
    8461             :     (void)compute_vcall_offset_indices(class_type, bcp, next_offset,
    8462             :                                        /*is_primary=*/TRUE);
    8463             :   }  /* if */
    8464             : }  /* compute_vbase_and_vcall_offset_indices */
    8465             : 
    8466             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8467             : 
    8468             : void prelower_class_type(a_type_ptr class_type)
    8469             : /*
    8470             : Do processing that is required early in lowering for the indicated class
    8471             : type.  Such processing builds information that is necessary during the
    8472             : lowering process, but does not modify the class type.  Note that this
    8473             : routine assumes the class type is as complete as it will ever get.
    8474             : */
    8475             : {
    8476             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    8477             :   a_base_class_ptr            bcp;
    8478             :   a_type_ptr                  base_class_type;
    8479             :   a_source_position           saved_error_position;
    8480             : 
    8481             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8482             :   check_assertion(is_primary_translation_unit && !C_mode());
    8483             :   /* See if prelowering has already been done. */
    8484             :   if (!class_has_been_prelowered(class_type)) {
    8485             :     saved_error_position = error_position;
    8486             :     error_position = class_type->source_corresp.decl_position;
    8487             :     /* If the class has a definition, the processing of the definition
    8488             :        should be complete. */
    8489             :     check_assertion_str(ctsp->assoc_scope == NULL ||
    8490             :                         !is_incomplete_type(class_type),
    8491             :                         "prelower_class_type: class definition not completed");
    8492             : #if IA64_ABI
    8493             :     /* Compute the virtual base and virtual call offsets for this class. */
    8494             :     compute_vbase_and_vcall_offset_indices(class_type, 
    8495             :                                            (a_base_class_ptr)NULL);
    8496             :     /* Make a dummy field for the base class with which we share our
    8497             :        virtual function table, if any. */
    8498             :     bcp = ctsp->primary_base_class;
    8499             :     if (bcp != NULL) {
    8500             :       prelower_class_type(bcp->type);
    8501             :       base_class_type = subobject_for_class(bcp->type);
    8502             :       add_base_class_dummy_field(bcp->type,
    8503             :                                  (char *)(bcp->is_virtual ? "__v_" : "__b_"),
    8504             :                                  base_class_type, bcp->offset, 
    8505             :                                  class_type);
    8506             :     }  /* if */
    8507             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8508             :     /* Make dummy fields to reserve space for the direct base classes,
    8509             :        and add them to the field list. */
    8510             :     for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8511             :       /* Pre-lower base classes. */
    8512             :       prelower_class_type(bcp->type);
    8513             :       base_class_type = subobject_for_class(bcp->type);
    8514             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    8515             :       /* Decide whether to use the base class's type or its
    8516             :          type-as-subobject for this instance as a base class.  The
    8517             :          full type includes space for any virtual base classes; the
    8518             :          type-as-subobject does not.  This only comes up in cfront
    8519             :          compatibility mode (because cfront does not have a
    8520             :          type-as-subobject mechanism and can only use the complete
    8521             :          object type for base classes other than the first). */
    8522             :       if (bcp->complete_subobject) base_class_type = bcp->type;
    8523             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    8524             :       if (!bcp->is_virtual) {
    8525             :         /* Non-virtual base class. */
    8526             :         if (bcp->direct && !bcp->is_optimized_empty_base
    8527             : #if IA64_ABI
    8528             :             && bcp != ctsp->primary_base_class
    8529             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8530             :                                                         ) {
    8531             :           /* For a direct non-virtual base class, put out space for an object
    8532             :              of the base class, except if it is an empty base that was not
    8533             :              allocated its own space (i.e., it shares its offset with
    8534             :              another subobject). */
    8535             :           add_base_class_dummy_field(bcp->type, "__b_",
    8536             :                                      base_class_type, bcp->offset,
    8537             :                                      class_type);
    8538             :         }  /* if */
    8539             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8540             :       } else {
    8541             :         /* Virtual base class.  See if a pointer to the base class is
    8542             :            required. */
    8543             :         /* Do not put out the pointer if it is shared with a base class. */
    8544             :         if (bcp->pointer_base_class == NULL) {
    8545             :           add_base_class_dummy_field(bcp->type, "__p_",
    8546             :                                      make_pointer_type(base_class_type),
    8547             :                                      bcp->pointer_offset, class_type);
    8548             :         }  /* if */
    8549             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    8550             :       }  /* if */
    8551             :     }  /* for */
    8552             :     /* Make the virtual function table variables if they have not been made
    8553             :        already.  This must be done after prelowering of the base classes. */
    8554             :     make_vars_for_virtual_function_tables(class_type);
    8555             :     if (needs_virtual_function_table(class_type) &&
    8556             :         ctsp->virtual_function_info_base_class == NULL) {
    8557             :       /* The class has virtual functions, so it needs a virtual function
    8558             :          table pointer.  Also, the pointer is not shared with a base
    8559             :          class.  Make a dummy field for a virtual function table pointer. */
    8560             :       add_dummy_field("__vptr", pointer_to_vtbl_type(),
    8561             :                       ctsp->virtual_function_info_offset, class_type);
    8562             :     }  /* if */
    8563             :     /* Make a type for the class for use when the class is a subobject.
    8564             :        This will be the same as the class type if the class has no virtual
    8565             :        base classes. */
    8566             :     make_subobject_class_type(class_type);
    8567             :     /* If there are virtual base classes, make dummy fields to reserve space
    8568             :        for them and add those to the field list. */
    8569             :     if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
    8570             :       for (bcp = 
    8571             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8572             :                  ctsp->base_classes; 
    8573             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    8574             :                  ctsp->preorder_base_classes;
    8575             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8576             :            bcp != NULL; 
    8577             :            bcp = 
    8578             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8579             :                  bcp->next
    8580             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    8581             :                  bcp->next_preorder
    8582             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */    
    8583             :                                    ) {
    8584             :         /* Ignore non-virtual base classes. */
    8585             :         if (bcp->is_virtual
    8586             : #if IA64_ABI
    8587             :             /* Ignore direct or indirect primary virtual bases. */
    8588             :             && bcp != ctsp->primary_base_class
    8589             :             && !bcp->shares_virtual_function_info
    8590             :             /* Ignore optimized empty bases, too. */
    8591             :             && !bcp->is_optimized_empty_base
    8592             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8593             :                                                  ) {
    8594             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    8595             :           /* If the space for the virtual base class was allocated inside
    8596             :              some other base class, it need not be allocated here. */
    8597             :           if (bcp->data_section_base_class == NULL) {
    8598             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    8599             :             base_class_type = subobject_for_class(bcp->type);
    8600             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    8601             :             /* Decide whether to use the base class's type or its
    8602             :                type-as-subobject for this instance as a base class.
    8603             :                See comment above. */
    8604             :             if (bcp->complete_subobject) base_class_type = bcp->type;
    8605             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    8606             :             add_base_class_dummy_field(bcp->type, "__v_",
    8607             :                                        base_class_type, bcp->offset,
    8608             :                                        class_type);
    8609             : #if CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY
    8610             :           }  /* if */
    8611             : #endif /* CFRONT_OBJECT_CODE_COMPATIBILITY */
    8612             :         }  /* if */
    8613             :       }  /* for */
    8614             :     }  /* if */
    8615             :     /* Restore error_position as of entry to this routine. */
    8616             :     error_position = saved_error_position;
    8617             :   }  /* if */
    8618             : }  /* prelower_class_type */
    8619             : 
    8620             : 
    8621             : static void lower_type_list(a_type_ptr type_list)
    8622             : /*
    8623             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of types and everything under it.
    8624             : */
    8625             : {
    8626             :   a_type_ptr type;
    8627             : 
    8628             :   for (type = type_list; type != NULL; type = type->next) {
    8629             :     if (!ignore_type_in_back_end(type)) lower_type(type);
    8630             :   }  /* for */
    8631             : }  /* lower_type_list */
    8632             : 
    8633             : 
    8634             : static void lower_template_arg(a_template_arg_ptr template_arg)
    8635             : /*
    8636             : Do IL lowering of the indicated template argument and everything under it.
    8637             : */
    8638             : {
    8639             :   switch (template_arg->kind) {
    8640             :     case tak_type:
    8641             :       lower_type(template_arg->variant.type);
    8642             :       break;
    8643             :     case tak_nontype:
    8644             :       lower_constant(template_arg->variant.constant);
    8645             :       break;
    8646             :     case tak_template:
    8647             :     case tak_start_of_pack_expansion:
    8648             :       /* No lowering required. */
    8649             :       break;
    8650             :     default: unexpected_condition(); break;
    8651             :   }  /* switch */
    8652             : }  /* lower_template_arg */
    8653             : 
    8654             : 
    8655             : static void lower_template_arg_list(a_template_arg_ptr template_arg_list)
    8656             : /*
    8657             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of template arguments and everything
    8658             : under it.
    8659             : */
    8660             : {
    8661             :   a_template_arg_ptr template_arg;
    8662             : 
    8663             :   for (template_arg = template_arg_list;
    8664             :        template_arg != NULL;
    8665             :        template_arg = template_arg->next) {
    8666             :     lower_template_arg(template_arg);
    8667             :   }  /* for */
    8668             : }  /* lower_template_arg_list */
    8669             : 
    8670             : 
    8671             : static void lower_class_struct_union_type(a_type_ptr class_type)
    8672             : /*
    8673             : Do IL lowering on the indicated class/struct/union type.
    8674             : */
    8675             : {
    8676             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
    8677             :   a_base_class_ptr            bcp;
    8678             :   a_source_position           saved_error_position;
    8679             : 
    8680             :   saved_error_position = error_position;
    8681             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    8682             :   /* Lower the nonstatic data members. */
    8683             :   lower_field_list(class_type);
    8684             :   error_position = class_type->source_corresp.decl_position;
    8685             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
    8686             :   if (ctsp->assoc_scope != NULL) {
    8687             :     /* There is a definition for the class. */
    8688             :     /* Lower the base classes. */
    8689             :     for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
    8690             :       lower_type(bcp->type);
    8691             :     }  /* for */
    8692             :     /* Lower the member functions, local types, etc.  Note that nothing
    8693             :        is promoted out of the class at this point; the promotions get done
    8694             :        at the end of lowering the memory region of which this is a class.
    8695             :        Note that in the case of a local class, the promotion may be done
    8696             :        at the end of lowering the function scope memory region, and this
    8697             :        routine is not called until later (when processing orphans for
    8698             :        the file scope).  In that case, the scope is already empty here
    8699             :        and the erstwhile members get lowered in their promoted positions. */
    8700             :     lower_scope(ctsp->assoc_scope);
    8701             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
    8702             :     /* If some local types of member functions were promoted into the
    8703             :        class on their way to the file scope, lower them now too. */
    8704             :     lower_type_list(ctsp->promoted_local_types);
    8705             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
    8706             :   }  /* if */
    8707             :   /* Lower the template argument list, if any. */
    8708             :   lower_template_arg_list(ctsp->template_arg_list);
    8709             :   /* Lower the type-as-subobject (may already have been lowered). */
    8710             :   lower_type(ctsp->subobject_partner);
    8711             :   if (class_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_class) {
    8712             :     class_type->kind = (a_type_kind)tk_struct;
    8713             :   }  /* if */
    8714             :   error_position = saved_error_position;
    8715             : }  /* lower_class_struct_union_type */
    8716             : 
    8717             : 
    8718             : static void lower_constructor_routine_type(a_type_ptr routine_type)
    8719             : /*
    8720             : Do IL lowering of a constructor routine type.  The lowering applicable to
    8721             : all routine types has already been done.  The routine body (if any) is
    8722             : not lowered at this time (see lower_constructor_code).
    8723             : */
    8724             : {
    8725             :   a_type_ptr       class_type;
    8726             :   a_param_type_ptr first_param, added_param;
    8727             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8728             :   a_param_type_ptr prev_param;
    8729             :   a_type_ptr       subobject_type;
    8730             :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    8731             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    8732             : 
    8733             :   routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
    8734             :   /* Get the "this" parameter entry.  The routine type has already been
    8735             :      lowered, so it's the first on the list. */
    8736             :   first_param = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list;
    8737             :   /* Get the class type from the "this" parameter type. */
    8738             :   class_type = type_pointed_to(first_param->type);
    8739             :   class_type = skip_typerefs(class_type);
    8740             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    8741             :   /* If you change this, see also unlowered_param_type_list_full,
    8742             :      add_constructor_params, ctor_needs_implied_arg_list,
    8743             :      make_ctor_implied_arg_list, var_for_copy_constructor_source,
    8744             :      and add_constructor_wrapper_code. */
    8745             :   if (ctors_return_this) {
    8746             :     /* Change the return type from "void" to "pointer to class type". */
    8747             :     /* See lowered_return_type_of. */
    8748             :     routine_type->variant.routine.return_type = make_pointer_type(class_type);
    8749             :   }  /* if */
    8750             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8751             :   /* Add a parameter for each virtual base class.  See the ARM, top of
    8752             :      p. 296.  add_constructor_params does the similar processing for param
    8753             :      variables. */
    8754             :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
    8755             :     prev_param = first_param;
    8756             :     for (bcp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->base_classes;
    8757             :          bcp != NULL;
    8758             :          bcp = bcp->next) {
    8759             :       if (bcp->is_virtual) {
    8760             :         /* Use the type of the base class when used as a subobject. */
    8761             :         subobject_type = subobject_for_class(bcp->type);
    8762             :         added_param = alloc_param_type(make_pointer_type(subobject_type));
    8763             :         /* Note that the original parameter entries have already been lowered,
    8764             :            so it is not necessary to clear il_lowering_flag to ensure that the
    8765             :            whole list will be visited. */
    8766             :         added_param->next = prev_param->next;
    8767             :         prev_param->next = added_param;
    8768             :         prev_param = added_param;
    8769             :       }  /* if */
    8770             :     }  /* for */
    8771             :   }  /* if */
    8772             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    8773             :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
    8774             :     /* Add the VTT parameter. */
    8775             :     added_param = alloc_param_type(make_virtual_table_table_pointer_type());
    8776             :     added_param->next = first_param->next;
    8777             :     first_param->next = added_param;
    8778             :   }  /* if */
    8779             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8780             : }  /* lower_constructor_routine_type */
    8781             : 
    8782             : 
    8783             : static void lower_destructor_routine_type(a_type_ptr routine_type)
    8784             : /*
    8785             : Do IL lowering of a destructor routine type.  The lowering applicable to
    8786             : all routine types has already been done.  The routine body (if any) is
    8787             : not lowered at this time (see lower_destructor_code).
    8788             : */
    8789             : {
    8790             :   a_type_ptr       class_type;
    8791             :   a_param_type_ptr first_param, added_param;
    8792             : 
    8793             :   routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
    8794             :   /* Get the "this" parameter entry.  The routine type has already been
    8795             :      lowered, so it's the first on the list. */
    8796             :   first_param = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list;
    8797             :   /* Get the class type from the "this" parameter type. */
    8798             :   class_type = type_pointed_to(first_param->type);
    8799             :   class_type = skip_typerefs(class_type);
    8800             :   prelower_class_type(class_type);
    8801             :   if (dtors_return_this) {
    8802             :     /* Change the return type from "void" to "void *". */
    8803             :     /* See lowered_return_type_of. */
    8804             :     routine_type->variant.routine.return_type = void_star_type();
    8805             :   }  /* if */
    8806             : #if !IA64_ABI
    8807             :   /* Add an int parameter that will indicate whether or not we have a
    8808             :      complete object and whether or not the storage should be freed.
    8809             :      add_destructor_params does the similar processing for param variables. */
    8810             :   /* If you change this, see also unlowered_param_type_list_full,
    8811             :      add_destructor_params, dtor_needs_implied_arg_list,
    8812             :      make_dtor_implied_arg_list, and lower_destructor_code. */
    8813             :   added_param = alloc_param_type(integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int));
    8814             :   /* Note that the original parameter entries have already been lowered,
    8815             :      so it is not necessary to set il_lowering_flag to ensure that the
    8816             :      whole list will be visited. */
    8817             :   added_param->next = first_param->next;
    8818             :   first_param->next = added_param;
    8819             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    8820             :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
    8821             :     /* Add the VTT parameter. */
    8822             :     added_param = alloc_param_type(make_virtual_table_table_pointer_type());
    8823             :     added_param->next = first_param->next;
    8824             :     first_param->next = added_param;
    8825             :   }  /* if */
    8826             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8827             : }  /* lower_destructor_routine_type */
    8828             : 
    8829             : 
    8830             : a_type_ptr type_of_cctor_param_after_adding_indirection(a_param_type_ptr ptp)
    8831             : /*
    8832             : ptp points to a parameter type entry for a parameter passed via a copy
    8833             : constructor.  Return the type of the parameter after the appropriate
    8834             : indirection is added.
    8835             : */
    8836             : {
    8837             :   /* If the original type was qualified on the definition of
    8838             :      the function (and the qualifiers were removed because they
    8839             :      only mean something inside the function), put the
    8840             :      qualifiers back on the type under the pointer. */
    8841             :   a_type_ptr type = make_pointer_type(make_qualified_type(ptp->type,
    8842             :                                                           ptp->qualifiers));
    8843             :   return type;
    8844             : }  /* type_of_cctor_param_after_adding_indirection */
    8845             : 
    8846             : 
    8847             : void add_indirection_to_cctor_param_type(a_param_type_ptr ptp)
    8848             : /*
    8849             : ptp points to a parameter type entry for a parameter passed via a copy
    8850             : constructor.  Change it to add an indirection to the type.
    8851             : */
    8852             : {
    8853             :   ptp->type = type_of_cctor_param_after_adding_indirection(ptp);
    8854             :   ptp->qualifiers = TQ_NONE;
    8855             : }  /* add_indirection_to_cctor_param_type */
    8856             : 
    8857             : 
    8858             : #if !NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR && !ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED
    8859             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- routine or routine_type are not used in those cases. */
    8860             : #endif /* !NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR && !ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED */
    8861             : a_boolean should_drop_const_on_this_param_variable(a_routine_ptr routine,
    8862             :                                                    a_type_ptr    routine_type)
    8863             : /*
    8864             : Return TRUE if the top-level "const" on the "this" parameter variable of the
    8865             : indicated routine should be dropped.  routine_type is the routine type.
    8866             : routine is NULL if the routine is unknown or does not have a definition.
    8867             : */
    8868             : {
    8869             :   a_boolean drop_const = FALSE;
    8870             : 
    8871             : #if NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR
    8872             :   check_assertion(routine_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine);
    8873             :   /* If this is a constructor that can handle the allocation for a "new",
    8874             :      drop const because the allocation code assigns to "this". */
    8875             :   if (routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info->assoc_routine_is_ctor) {
    8876             :     drop_const = TRUE;
    8877             :   }  /* if */
    8878             : #endif /* NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR */
    8879             : #if ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED
    8880             :   /* If this is a constructor that contains a user-written assignment
    8881             :      to "this" (an anachronism), drop const. */
    8882             :   if (routine != NULL && routine->assignment_to_this_done) drop_const = TRUE;
    8883             : #endif /* ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED */
    8884             :   return drop_const;
    8885             : }  /* should_drop_const_on_this_param_variable */
    8886             : 
    8887             : 
    8888             : static a_type_ptr original_return_type(a_type_ptr routine_type)
    8889             : /*
    8890             : Returns the original return type of the routine whose type is 
    8891             : (lowered or unlowered) routine_type.  During lowering of a routine
    8892             : type that will return its value as a parameter, the return type is
    8893             : changed to "void" (see lower_type).  This function will determine
    8894             : the original return type and return it.
    8895             : */
    8896             : {
    8897             :   a_type_ptr                    return_type;
    8898             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp;
    8899             :   a_param_type_ptr              ptp;
    8900             : 
    8901             :   routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
    8902             :   rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
    8903             :   if (visited_yet(routine_type) && rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
    8904             :     /* The routine type returns its value as a parameter and the type
    8905             :        has already been lowered (so the return type is now "void").
    8906             :        The original type can be retrieved from the parameter that
    8907             :        was added.  Find that parameter and return its type. */
    8908             :     ptp = rtsp->param_type_list;
    8909             :     if (rtsp->this_class != NULL &&
    8910             :         rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
    8911             :       ptp = ptp->next;
    8912             :     }  /* if */
    8913             :     return_type = type_pointed_to(ptp->type);
    8914             :   } else {
    8915             :     /* Type hasn't been lowered, or this routine doesn't return its
    8916             :        value as a parameter so the type is in the usual place. */
    8917             :     return_type = routine_type->variant.routine.return_type;
    8918             :   }  /* if */
    8919             :   return return_type;
    8920             : }  /* original_return_type */
    8921             : 
    8922             : 
    8923             : static void set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag(a_type_ptr routine_type)
    8924             : /*
    8925             : Set the flag that determines whether the routine whose type is routine_type
    8926             : will be modified during lowering to return the function result in an
    8927             : additional parameter.  This is typically used for routines that return
    8928             : their class value by means of a copy constructor.  This routine may be
    8929             : called more than once for the same routine type, and an invocation of this
    8930             : routine should precede any access to value_returned_as_parameter to
    8931             : guarantee that the flag is set appropriately.  This routine also serves
    8932             : as a central location for customers who wish to customize cases where
    8933             : a function value should be returned through an additional pointer parameter
    8934             : (e.g., in the case where the returned value is a sufficiently large structure).
    8935             : */
    8936             : {
    8937             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp;
    8938             : 
    8939             :   routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
    8940             :   rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
    8941             :   if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
