    8942             :     /* Once the flag is set, it will never change. */
    8943             :   } else if (rtsp->value_returned_by_cctor) {
    8944             :     /* If the function returns its value via a copy constructor, we
    8945             :        want to rewrite it to return it through a parameter. */
    8946             :     rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter = TRUE;
    8947             : #if IA64_ABI
    8948             :     /* New return value parameter precedes 'this' in IA-64 ABI. */
    8949             :     rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this = FALSE;
    8950             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    8951             :     /* New return value parameter follows 'this' in Cfront-like ABI. */
    8952             :     rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this = TRUE;
    8953             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    8954             :   } else {
    8955             :     /* There may be additional cases (e.g., sufficiently large structures)
    8956             :        where it makes sense to return the value as a parameter.  Note
    8957             :        however that no copy constructor is invoked, so this method is
    8958             :        useful only for PODs. */
    8959             :   }  /* if */
    8960             :   /* We don't handle the case where the value is returned by copy
    8961             :      constructor and the value is not returned as a parameter. */
    8962             :   check_assertion(!(rtsp->value_returned_by_cctor &&
    8963             :                     !rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter));
    8964             : }  /* set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag */
    8965             : 
    8966             : 
    8967             : static void overwrite_type_with_new_type(a_type_ptr type,
    8968             :                                          a_type_ptr new_type)
    8969             : /*
    8970             : Overwrite "type" with a typeref to new_type, saving a copy of "type" in the
    8971             : orig_type field of the typeref.
    8972             : */
    8973             : {
    8974             :   a_type_ptr copy_of_orig_type, type_next;
    8975             : 
    8976             :   copy_of_orig_type = alloc_type(type->kind);
    8977             :   copy_type(type, copy_of_orig_type);
    8978             :   /* Change the type to a pure typeref to the new (lowered) type. */
    8979             :   type_next = type->next;
    8980             :   set_type_kind(type, (a_type_kind)tk_typeref);
    8981             :   type->next = type_next;
    8982             :   type->variant.typeref.type = new_type;
    8983             :   type->variant.typeref.orig_type = copy_of_orig_type;
    8984             : }  /* overwrite_type_with_new_type */
    8985             : 
    8986             : 
    8987             : static void lower_type(a_type_ptr type)
    8988             : /*
    8989             : Do IL lowering of the indicated type and everything under it.
    8990             : */
    8991             : {
    8992             :   a_type_ptr ptr_return_type, new_type, member_type;
    8993             : 
    8994             :   /* Note that within this routine "lower_os_type" need not be used.
    8995             :      The fact that we are lowering a type means we are lowering the
    8996             :      file scope and therefore no other type can be in a different
    8997             :      memory region. */
    8998             :   if (!visited_yet(type) && !ignore_type_in_back_end(type)) {
    8999             :     mark_as_visited(type);
    9000             :     lower_source_correspondence(&type->source_corresp);
    9001             :     /* The based types list is not lowered on purpose. */
    9002             :     switch (type->kind) {
    9003             :       case tk_void:
    9004             :       case tk_float:
    9005             :         /* No processing required. */
    9006             :         break;
    9007             :       case tk_integer:
    9008             :         if (type->variant.integer.enum_type) {
    9009             :           /* If the enumeration type has an associated list of enumerator
    9010             :              constants, lower them. */
    9011             :           if (!integer_type_supp(type)->enumerator_list_seen) {
    9012             :             /* The enumerator hasn't been defined (e.g., only a C++11-style
    9013             :                opaque declaration was seen). */
    9014             :           } else if (integer_type_is_scoped_enum(type)) {
    9015             :             lower_scope(type->variant.integer.enum_info.assoc_scope);
    9016             :           } else {
    9017             :             lower_constant_list(type->variant.integer.enum_info.constant_list);
    9018             :           }  /* if */
    9019             :         } else if (type->variant.integer.enum_info.affiliated_type != NULL) {
    9020             :           lower_type(type->variant.integer.enum_info.affiliated_type);
    9021             :         }  /* if */
    9022             :         break;
    9023             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
    9024             :       case tk_complex:
    9025             :         /* Complex types are lowered separately. */
    9026             :         break;
    9027             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
    9028             : #if FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED
    9029             :       case tk_fixed_point:
    9030             :         unexpected_condition();
    9031             :         break;
    9032             : #endif /* FIXED_POINT_ALLOWED */
    9033             :       case tk_pointer:
    9034             :        /* Note that references aren't turned into pointers, because back ends
    9035             :           shouldn't care. */
    9036             :         lower_type(type->variant.pointer.type);
    9037             :         break;
    9038             :       case tk_ptr_to_member:
    9039             :         lower_type(type->variant.ptr_to_member.class_of_which_a_member);
    9040             :         member_type = type->variant.ptr_to_member.type;
    9041             :         lower_type(member_type);
    9042             :         if (is_function_type(member_type)) {
    9043             :           /* Pointer to member function; gets replaced by a struct. */
    9044             :           new_type = make_mptr_type();
    9045             :         } else {
    9046             :           /* Pointer to data member; gets replaced by an integer. */
    9047             :           new_type = integer_type(targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind);
    9048             :         }  /* if */
    9049             :         /* Replace the original pointer-to-member type with the new type; the
    9050             :            original type is saved in the orig_type field if needed. */
    9051             :         overwrite_type_with_new_type(type, new_type);
    9052             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9053             :         /* Set the "needed" flag appropriately.  Without this, the typeref
    9054             :            could be marked as needed and that might prevent processing of
    9055             :            the underlying type. */
    9056             :         /* The class definition needed flag is set on the new type if it
    9057             :            is a class (i.e., for the pointer to member function case).
    9058             :            Previous sweeps of the IL would have noted the need for a
    9059             :            complete type, but since the type was a pointer to member at
    9060             :            that time, no class definition needed flag would have been set. */
    9061             :         mark_as_needed_like((char *)new_type, iek_type,
    9062             :                             &type->source_corresp,
    9063             :                             /*set_class_defn_needed=*/
    9064             :                                             is_immediate_class_type(new_type));
    9065             :         if (il_entry_prefix_of(type).keep_in_il) {
    9066             :           mark_to_keep_in_il((char *)new_type, iek_type);
    9067             :           if (is_immediate_class_type(new_type)) {
    9068             :             set_class_keep_definition_in_il(new_type);
    9069             :           }  /* if */
    9070             :         }  /* if */
    9071             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9072             :         break;
    9073             :       case tk_routine:
    9074             :         lower_type(type->variant.routine.return_type);
    9075             :         { a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp =type->variant.routine.extra_info;
    9076             :           a_param_type_ptr ptp;
    9077             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9078             :           a_boolean        type_changed = FALSE;
    9079             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9080             :           if (make_all_functions_unprototyped) {
    9081             :             /* Make all function types unprototyped.  Note that the
    9082             :                param_type_list is not cleared even if the function has no
    9083             :                body.  This can create a function type with prototyped == FALSE,
    9084             :                assoc_routine == NULL, and param_type_list != NULL, which is
    9085             :                not otherwise possible. */
    9086             :             rtsp->prototyped = FALSE;
    9087             :             /* We do not change old_style_params_scanned, because it's used in
    9088             :                another part of lowering to tell whether the interface used to
    9089             :                be old-style.  Back ends must watch out for that. */
    9090             :             /* We do not clear has_ellipsis on purpose.  The C-generating
    9091             :                back end depends on it in this case. */
    9092             :           }  /* if */
    9093             :           /* Make sure we initialize value_returned_as_parameter before
    9094             :              using it. */
    9095             :           set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag(type);
    9096             :           if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
    9097             :             /* Add an extra parameter in which the return address will be
    9098             :                passed. */
    9099             :             ptr_return_type = 
    9100             :                           make_pointer_type(type->variant.routine.return_type);
    9101             :             ptp = alloc_param_type(ptr_return_type);
    9102             :             /* Force lowering in the loop that follows. */
    9103             :             mark_as_not_visited(ptp);
    9104             :             ptp->next = rtsp->param_type_list;
    9105             :             rtsp->param_type_list = ptp;
    9106             :             /* The return value type becomes "void". */
    9107             :             type->variant.routine.return_type = void_type();
    9108             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9109             :             type_changed = TRUE;
    9110             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9111             :           }  /* if */
    9112             :           /* If there is an implicit "this" parameter, make an explicit
    9113             :              first parameter for it. */
    9114             :           if (rtsp->this_class != NULL) {
    9115             :             ptp = alloc_param_type(implicit_this_param_type_of(type));
    9116             :             /* Force lowering in the loop that follows. */
    9117             :             mark_as_not_visited(ptp);
    9118             :             /* The "this" parameter variable is const even though the
    9119             :                const doesn't appear on the interface (see
    9120             :                make_implicit_this_param_variable). */
    9121             :             if (!should_drop_const_on_this_param_variable(rtsp->assoc_routine,
    9122             :                                                           type)) {
    9123             :               ptp->qualifiers = TQ_CONST;
    9124             :             }  /* if */
    9125             :             /* If there is both a "this" parameter and a return value address,
    9126             :                see which comes first. */
    9127             :             if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter &&
    9128             :                 !rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
    9129             :               ptp->next = rtsp->param_type_list->next;
    9130             :               rtsp->param_type_list->next = ptp;
    9131             :             } else {
    9132             :               ptp->next = rtsp->param_type_list;
    9133             :               rtsp->param_type_list = ptp;
    9134             :             }  /* if */
    9135             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9136             :             type_changed = TRUE;
    9137             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9138             :             /* Leave the this_class and qualifiers unchanged; it's helpful
    9139             :                to have them there to determine the "this" parameter type
    9140             :                whether or not the routine type has been lowered. */
    9141             :           }  /* if */
    9142             :           for (ptp = rtsp->param_type_list; ptp != NULL; ptp = ptp->next) {
    9143             :             /* Only process each param type entry if it has not been
    9144             :                previously visited. */
    9145             :             if (!visited_yet(ptp)) {
    9146             :               mark_as_visited(ptp);
    9147             :               lower_type(ptp->type);
    9148             :               /* If the parameter must be passed using a copy constructor,
    9149             :                  change its type to pointer-to-class. */
    9150             :               if (ptp->passed_via_copy_constructor) {
    9151             :                 add_indirection_to_cctor_param_type(ptp);
    9152             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9153             :                 type_changed = TRUE;
    9154             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9155             :               } /* if */
    9156             :               /* Clear the default_arg_expr field to make the IL more
    9157             :                  like C IL.  Note this throws away the expression. */
    9158             :               if (keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il) {
    9159             :                 an_expr_node_ptr expr = ptp->default_arg_expr;
    9160             :                 if (expr != NULL) {
    9161             :                   /* If the expression has an object lifetime node at the
    9162             :                      top, eliminate it, because the expression is not
    9163             :                      staying in the IL tree. */
    9164             :                   eliminate_expr_object_lifetime(expr);
    9165             :                 }  /* if */
    9166             :               }  /* if */
    9167             :               ptp->default_arg_expr = NULL;
    9168             :             }  /* if */
    9169             :           }  /* for */
    9170             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9171             :           if (type_changed) {
    9172             :             /* Re-mark the type as we've changed its subtree. */
    9173             :             remark_as_needed((char *)type, iek_type);
    9174             :           }  /* if */
    9175             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9176             :           if (rtsp->prototype_scope != NULL) {
    9177             :             lower_scope(rtsp->prototype_scope);
    9178             :           }  /* if */
    9179             :           /* Do special lowering for constructors and destructors. */
    9180             :           if (rtsp->assoc_routine_is_ctor) {
    9181             :             lower_constructor_routine_type(type);
    9182             :           } else if (rtsp->assoc_routine_is_dtor) {
    9183             :             lower_destructor_routine_type(type);
    9184             :           }  /* if */
    9185             :         }
    9186             :         break;
    9187             :       case tk_array:
    9188             :         lower_type(type->variant.array.element_type);
    9189             :         break;
    9190             :       case tk_class:
    9191             :       case tk_struct:
    9192             :       case tk_union:
    9193             :         lower_class_struct_union_type(type);
    9194             :         break;
    9195             :       case tk_typeref:
    9196             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
    9197             :         if (vla_enabled && typeref_is_typedef(type)) {
    9198             :           /* Collect any VLA types that will need to be lowered later on. */
    9199             :           prepare_to_lower_variably_modified_typedef(type);
    9200             :         }  /* if */
    9201             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
    9202             :         lower_type(type->variant.typeref.type);
    9203             :         break;
    9204             :       case tk_template_param:
    9205             :         /* These shouldn't really get out of the front end, but they do
    9206             :            sometimes get onto a based types list, so turn them into something
    9207             :            mostly harmless.  (In addition to setting the type to an error
    9208             :            type, also clear the parent scope since it might point to a class
    9209             :            template prototype instantiation.)  The "auto" and "decltype(auto)"
    9210             :            types are an exception since they can reasonably appear in a
    9211             :            "declared_type" field. */
    9212             :         if (is_auto_type(type)) {
    9213             :           /* Overwrite an "auto" type with a typeref to void. */
    9214             :           overwrite_type_with_new_type(type, void_type());
    9215             :         }  /* if */
    9216             :         break;
    9217             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
    9218             :       case tk_vector:
    9219             :         lower_type(type->variant.vector.element_type);
    9220             :         break;
    9221             : #endif /* GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED */
    9222             :       case tk_nullptr:
    9223             :         /* The type of the nullptr or __nullptr keyword in C++ or C++/CLI.
    9224             :            Change it to a typeref to the "void *" type (the C++ Standard
    9225             :            requires it to have that size, so we use that type in the
    9226             :            lowered IL to make it happen naturally) and maintain a copy of
    9227             :            the original type for the use of IL lowering; it is not really
    9228             :            part of the IL tree. */
    9229             :         overwrite_type_with_new_type(type, void_star_type());
    9230             :         break;
    9231             :       case tk_unknown:  /* Shouldn't make it out of front end. */
    9232             :       default:
    9233             :         unexpected_condition_str("lower_type: bad kind");
    9234             :     }  /* switch */
    9235             :   }  /* if */
    9236             : }  /* lower_type */
    9237             : 
    9238             : 
    9239             : void lower_os_type(a_type_ptr type)
    9240             : /*
    9241             : A "possibly other scope" version of lower_type; does nothing for
    9242             : types in other scopes.  Note that because all types are in the file
    9243             : scope, any reference to a type while lowering a function is a
    9244             : reference to another scope, and is recorded as a potential orphan
    9245             : to be processed later.
    9246             : */
    9247             : {
    9248             :   if (!lowering_file_scope) {
    9249             :     possibly_add_orphaned_file_scope_il_entry((char *)(type),
    9250             :                                               (an_il_entry_kind)iek_type);
    9251             :   } else {
    9252             :     lower_type(type);
    9253             :   }  /* if */
    9254             : }  /* lower_os_type */
    9255             : 
    9256             : 
    9257             : static void lower_namespace(a_namespace_ptr nsp)
    9258             : /*
    9259             : Do IL lowering of the indicated namespace and everything under it.
    9260             : */
    9261             : {
    9262             :   if (!nsp->is_namespace_alias) {
    9263             :     /* Lower the members of the namespace.  Note that nothing is promoted out
    9264             :        of the namespace at this time (see do_scope_namespace_member_promotion).
    9265             :     */
    9266             :     lower_scope(nsp->variant.assoc_scope);
    9267             :   }  /* if */
    9268             : }  /* lower_namespace */
    9269             : 
    9270             : 
    9271             : static void lower_namespace_list(a_namespace_ptr namespace_list)
    9272             : /*
    9273             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of namespaces and everything under it.
    9274             : */
    9275             : {
    9276             :   a_namespace_ptr nsp;
    9277             : 
    9278             :   for (nsp = namespace_list; nsp != NULL; nsp = nsp->next) {
    9279             :     lower_namespace(nsp);
    9280             :   }  /* for */
    9281             : }  /* lower_namespace_list */
    9282             : 
    9283             : 
    9284             : static void lower_variable_list(a_variable_ptr variable_list)
    9285             : /*
    9286             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of variables and everything under it.
    9287             : */
    9288             : {
    9289             :   a_variable_ptr variable;
    9290             : 
    9291             :   for (variable = variable_list; variable != NULL; variable = variable->next) {
    9292             :     if (!ignore_variable_in_back_end(variable)) {
    9293             :       lower_variable(variable);
    9294             :     }  /* if */
    9295             :   }  /* for */
    9296             : }  /* lower_variable_list */
    9297             : 
    9298             : #if !IA64_ABI
    9299             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- variable and insert_location are not used in that case. */
    9300             : #define LOWER_INITIALIZER_LINKAGE static
    9301             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    9302             : #define LOWER_INITIALIZER_LINKAGE /*external*/
    9303             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9304             : LOWER_INITIALIZER_LINKAGE void lower_initializer(
    9305             :                                            a_variable_ptr     variable,
    9306             :                                            an_init_kind       *init_kind,
    9307             :                                            an_initializer_ptr initializer)
    9308             : /*
    9309             : Lower an initializer, which might be in a variable or a
    9310             : local-variable-static-init entry.
    9311             : */
    9312             : {
    9313             :   switch (*init_kind) {
    9314             :     case initk_zero:
    9315             : #if IA64_ABI
    9316             :       if (contains_ptr_to_data_member(variable->type)) {
    9317             :         /* An entity that is or contains a pointer to data member cannot
    9318             :            simply be zeroed, because NULL for a pointer to data member is
    9319             :            represented as -1.  The initialization must be expanded to
    9320             :            a constant. */
    9321             :         a_constant_ptr         cp;
    9322             :         a_memory_region_number region_to_switch_back_to = NULL_region_number;
    9323             :         if (in_file_scope(variable)) {
    9324             :           /* Make sure any constant allocated is in the same region as
    9325             :              the variable. */
    9326             :           switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
    9327             :         }  /* if */
    9328             :         cp = lower_zero_initialization(variable->type);
    9329             :         switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
    9330             :         if (var_has_static_or_thread_storage_duration(variable)) {
    9331             :           *init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_static;
    9332             :           initializer->constant = cp;
    9333             :         } else {
    9334             :           /* Automatic variable; use dynamic initialization to a constant. */
    9335             :           a_statement_ptr    stmk_init_stmt;
    9336             :           a_dynamic_init_ptr dip;
    9337             :           *init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic;
    9338             :           initializer->dynamic = dip =
    9339             :                          alloc_dynamic_init((a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_constant);
    9340             :           dip->variant.constant = cp;
    9341             :           dip->variable = variable;
    9342             :           stmk_init_stmt = alloc_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_init);
    9343             :           stmk_init_stmt->variant.dynamic_init = dip;
    9344             :           add_to_end_of_pending_stmk_init_statements_list(stmk_init_stmt);
    9345             :         }  /* if */
    9346             :       }  /* if */
    9347             :       break;
    9348             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9349             :     case initk_none:
    9350             :       break;
    9351             :     case initk_static:
    9352             :       lower_constant(initializer->constant);
    9353             :       break;
    9354             :     case initk_dynamic:
    9355             :       /* The dynamic init entry is either pointed to from a stmk_init
    9356             :          entry or appears on the file-scope dynamic inits list.  Handle
    9357             :          it when seen in one of those places. */
    9358             :       break;
    9359             :     case initk_function_local:
    9360             :       /* Initialization of a local static variable that is described
    9361             :          remotely by a local-static-variable-init.  Do nothing here;
    9362             :          the initialization is lowered from the function or block scope,
    9363             :          by scanning the local_static_variable_inits list.
    9364             :          That's necessary because the local static variable will be lowered
    9365             :          as part of the file scope, and the initialization (in the function
    9366             :          scope memory region) is gone by then. */
    9367             :       break;
    9368             :     case initk_binding:
    9369             :       /* The bound_expr is not lowered here; it is only lowered when actually
    9370             :          used. */
    9371             :       break;
    9372             :     default:
    9373             :       unexpected_condition_str("lower_initializer: bad kind");
    9374             :   }  /* switch */
    9375             : }  /* lower_initializer */
    9376             : 
    9377             : 
    9378             : void put_variable_into_comdat_group(a_variable_ptr  var)
    9379             : /*
    9380             : Put the specified variable into a COMDAT group with the same name as the
    9381             : variable's mangled name.
    9382             : */
    9383             : {
    9384             :   check_assertion((var->source_corresp.name_has_been_mangled &&
    9385             :                    var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) ||
    9386             :                    var->is_inline);
    9387             :   var->comdat_group = var->source_corresp.name;
    9388             : } /* put_variable_into_comdat_group */
    9389             : 
    9390             : 
    9391             : static void lower_variable(a_variable_ptr variable)
    9392             : /*
    9393             : Do IL lowering of the indicated variable and everything under it.
    9394             : */
    9395             : {
    9396             :   if (!visited_yet(variable)) {
    9397             :     check_assertion(!ignore_variable_in_back_end(variable));
    9398             :     mark_as_visited(variable);
    9399             :     lower_source_correspondence(&variable->source_corresp);
    9400             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
    9401             :     if (variable->has_variably_modified_type) {
    9402             :       /* Collect any VLA types that will need to be lowered later on.  After
    9403             :          lowering of those types, the variable will no longer have a variably-
    9404             :          modified type. */
    9405             :       variable->has_variably_modified_type = FALSE;
    9406             :       record_vla_component_types_for_lowering(variable->type);
    9407             :     }  /* if */
    9408             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
    9409             :     lower_os_type(variable->type);
    9410             :     if (variable->is_template_variable &&
    9411             :         variable->template_info->template_arg_list != NULL) {
    9412             :       lower_template_arg_list(variable->template_info->template_arg_list);
    9413             :     }  /* if */
    9414             :     if (variable->address_taken &&
    9415             :         variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_register) {
    9416             :       /* In C++, one can take the address of a register variable.  In C,
    9417             :          one is not allowed to, so change "register" to "auto". */
    9418             :       variable->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_auto;
    9419             :     } else if (force_variable_definition_via_zeroing &&
    9420             :                variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified &&
    9421             :                variable->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_none &&
    9422             :                !variable->promoted_local_static) {
    9423             :       /* In C++, there are no tentative definitions.  Use initk_zero to
    9424             :          indicate that this variable is "really" defined. */
    9425             :       variable->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_zero;
    9426             : #if IA64_ABI
    9427             :     } else if (variable->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_none &&
    9428             :                (variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified ||
    9429             :                 variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) &&
    9430             :                contains_ptr_to_data_member(variable->type)) {
    9431             :       /* The contained pointer to data member must be explicitly initialized
    9432             :          since a NULL pointer to data member is represented by -1.  */
    9433             :       variable->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_zero;
    9434             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9435             :     } else if (variable->is_member_constant &&
    9436             :                variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_extern) {
    9437             :       /* A member constant (static data member initialized within the
    9438             :          class) should be considered uninitialized if no definition
    9439             :          appeared. */
    9440             :       variable->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_none;
    9441             :       variable->is_member_constant = FALSE;
    9442             :     }  /* if */
    9443             :     if (variable->source_corresp.name_linkage ==
    9444             :                                            (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal &&
    9445             :         variable->source_corresp.name != NULL &&
    9446             :         variable->source_corresp.name[0] == '_' &&  /* For speed. */
    9447             :         strcmp(variable->source_corresp.name, "__link") == 0) {
    9448             :       /* A user written variable with the name __link is marked as needed.
    9449             :          IL lowering defines such a variable to specify startup initialization
    9450             :          through the patch/munch process.  The processing here is to pass
    9451             :          through that variable if this front end is used to compile its
    9452             :          own output. */
    9453             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9454             : #if ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT
    9455             :       if (one_instantiation_per_object) {
    9456             :         set_per_instantiation_needed_flag((char *)variable, iek_variable,
    9457             :                                     variable->instantiation_needed_bit_number);
    9458             :       }  /* if */
    9459             : #endif /* ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT */
    9460             :       mark_as_needed((char *)variable, iek_variable);
    9461             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9462             :       variable->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
    9463             :     }  /* if */
    9464             : #if DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING
    9465             :     if (var_is_return_value_variable(variable)) {
    9466             :       /* The variable is the return value optimization variable for the
    9467             :          function.  All references to it will be rewritten to refer instead
    9468             :          to the implicit parameter that gives the return-copy address.
    9469             :          Mark the variable as unreferenced.  Also turn off any initialization.
    9470             :          If there is initialization, the initialization will be put out as
    9471             :          an assignment when the stmk_init for this initialization is
    9472             :          processed. */
    9473             :       variable->source_corresp.referenced = FALSE;
    9474             :       variable->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_none;
    9475             :       variable->modified_within_try_block = FALSE;
    9476             :     }  /* if */
    9477             : #endif /* DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING */
    9478             : #if USE_LAZY_INITIALIZATION_FOR_THREAD_LOCAL_VARIABLES
    9479             :     if (is_effective_thread_local(variable) &&
    9480             :         variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    9481             :       if (all_thread_locals_have_wrappers) {
    9482             :         /* All thread_locals should have wrappers, ensure that one is created
    9483             :            for this variable (even if it is not referenced in this
    9484             :            translation unit). */
    9485             :         if (variable->init_routine.thread.wrapper == NULL) {
    9486             :           /* Create a wrapper now. */
    9487             :           (void)thread_local_wrapper_for_variable(variable);
    9488             :         } else {
    9489             :           /* A wrapper has already been created; set the storage class for
    9490             :              the wrapper and initialization routine again (they may have
    9491             :              changed from their original settings). */
    9492             :           set_storage_class_for_thread_local_routines(variable);
    9493             :         }  /* if */
    9494             : #if !LAZY_INITIALIZATION_USES_WEAK_REFERENCES
    9495             :       } else if (variable->init_kind != (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic) {
    9496             :         if (variable->init_routine.thread.init_routine == NULL) {
    9497             :           /* When we're not using weak references and wrapper routines are only
    9498             :              generated for dynamically-initialized thread_local variables, any
    9499             :              thread_local variable with external linkage that is defined in
    9500             :              this translation unit and has no initialization needs to have a
    9501             :              NULL initialization routine emitted (since other translation units
    9502             :              don't know whether or not this variable has dynamic
    9503             :              initialization, they'll emit references to this routine). */
    9504             :           make_null_thread_local_init_routine_for_variable(variable);
    9505             :         } else if (variable->init_routine.thread.init_routine->storage_class !=
    9506             :                                                      variable->storage_class) {
    9507             :           /* The storage class has changed since the routine was created. */
    9508             :           set_storage_class_for_thread_local_routines(variable);
    9509             :         }  /* if */
    9510             : #endif /* !LAZY_INITIALIZATION_USES_WEAK_REFERENCES */
    9511             :       }  /* if */
    9512             :     }  /* if */
    9513             : #endif /* USE_LAZY_INITIALIZATION_FOR_THREAD_LOCAL_VARIABLES */
    9514             :     /* Lower the initializer if any. */
    9515             :     lower_initializer(variable, &variable->init_kind, &variable->initializer);
    9516             : #if IA64_ABI
    9517             :     if (variable->is_template_variable &&
    9518             :         !variable->is_specialized &&
    9519             :         variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    9520             :       /* Ensure that variable templates are put into their own COMDAT
    9521             :          groups (but not variable templates that have been explicitly
    9522             :          specialized). */
    9523             :       put_variable_into_comdat_group(variable);
    9524             :     }  /* if */
    9525             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9526             :     if (variable->is_inline &&
    9527             :         variable->source_corresp.name_linkage !=
    9528             :                                           (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal) {
    9529             :       /* Ensure that externally-lined inline variables are put into their
    9530             :          own COMDAT groups. */
    9531             :       put_variable_into_comdat_group(variable);
    9532             :     }  /* if */
    9533             :   }  /* if */
    9534             : }  /* lower_variable */
    9535             : 
    9536             : 
    9537             : static void lower_local_static_variable_init_list(
    9538             :                                         a_local_static_variable_init_ptr lsvip)
    9539             : /*
    9540             : Lower a list of local static variable initialization descriptions.  These
    9541             : are used to represent (in the function scope memory region) initialization
    9542             : of local static variables (which are in the file scope memory region
    9543             : and therefore cannot point at the initialization in the function scope
    9544             : memory region).
    9545             : */
    9546             : {
    9547             :   for (; lsvip != NULL; lsvip = lsvip->next) {
    9548             :     lower_initializer(lsvip->variable, &lsvip->init_kind, &lsvip->initializer);
    9549             :   }  /* for */
    9550             : }  /* lower_local_static_variable_init_list */
    9551             : 
    9552             : 
    9553             : static void lower_field_list(a_type_ptr class_type)
    9554             : /*
    9555             : Do IL lowering of the fields of the indicated class and everything under them.
    9556             : */
    9557             : {
    9558             :   a_field_ptr field, next_field;
    9559             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    9560             :   a_field_ptr prev_field = NULL;
    9561             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9562             : 
    9563             :   for (field = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list;
    9564             :        field != NULL;
    9565             :        field = next_field) {
    9566             :     next_field = field->next;
    9567             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    9568             :     /* Remove any fields representing a nontrivial property or event. */
    9569             :     if (field_is_nontrivial_property_or_event(field)) {
    9570             :       check_assertion_str(!field->source_corresp.has_associated_pragma,
    9571             :                           "property field has associated pragma");
    9572             :       if (prev_field == NULL) {
    9573             :         class_type->variant.class_struct_union.field_list = next_field;
    9574             :       } else {
    9575             :         prev_field->next = next_field;
    9576             :       }  /* if */
    9577             :       field->next = NULL;  /* Defensive programming. */
    9578             :       continue;
    9579             :     }  /* if */
    9580             :     prev_field = field;
    9581             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9582             :     lower_field(field);
    9583             :   }  /* for */
    9584             : }  /* lower_field_list */
    9585             : 
    9586             : 
    9587             : static void lower_field(a_field_ptr field)
    9588             : /*
    9589             : Do IL lowering of the indicated field and everything under it.
    9590             : */
    9591             : {
    9592             :   if (!visited_yet(field)) {
    9593             :     mark_as_visited(field);
    9594             :     lower_source_correspondence(&field->source_corresp);
    9595             :     lower_os_type(field->type);
    9596             :   }  /* if */
    9597             : }  /* lower_field */
    9598             : 
    9599             : 
    9600             : static void lower_routine_list(a_routine_ptr routine_list)
    9601             : /*
    9602             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of routines and everything under it.
    9603             : */
    9604             : {
    9605             :   a_routine_ptr routine;
    9606             : 
    9607             :   for (routine = routine_list; routine != NULL; routine = routine->next) {
    9608             :     if (!ignore_routine_in_back_end(routine)) {
    9609             :       lower_routine(routine);
    9610             :     }  /* if */
    9611             :   }  /* for */
    9612             : }  /* lower_routine_list */
    9613             : 
    9614             : #if IA64_ABI
    9615             : 
    9616             : void put_routine_into_comdat_group(a_routine_ptr routine)
    9617             : /*
    9618             : Put the routine into a COMDAT group with the same name as the
    9619             : routine's mangled name.
    9620             : */
    9621             : {
    9622             :   a_routine_list_entry_ptr rlep;
    9623             : 
    9624             :   check_assertion(routine->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified);
    9625             :   /* The routine is COMDAT.  */
    9626             :   routine->use_comdat = TRUE;
    9627             :   if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
    9628             :       routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
    9629             :     /* Any alternate entry points for a constructor or destructor should get
    9630             :        the same linkage as the main entry point.  */
    9631             :     for (rlep = routine->variant.ctor_dtor.alternate_entry_points;
    9632             :          rlep != NULL;
    9633             :          rlep = rlep->next) {
    9634             :       a_routine_ptr trout, arout = rlep->routine;
    9635             :       if (arout->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    9636             :         arout->use_comdat = TRUE;
    9637             :       }  /* if */
    9638             :       /* Also mark any thunks that follow the alternate entry point. */
    9639             :       for (trout = arout->next;
    9640             :            trout != NULL && trout->overriding_function_for_wrapper == arout;
    9641             :            trout = trout->next) {
    9642             :         if (trout->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    9643             :           trout->use_comdat = TRUE;
    9644             :         }  /* if */
    9645             :       }  /* for */
    9646             :     }  /* for */
    9647             :   }  /* if */
    9648             : }  /* put_routine_into_comdat_group */
    9649             : 
    9650             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9651             : 
    9652             : #if LOWER_EXTERN_INLINE
    9653             : 
    9654             : static void lower_extern_inline_routine(a_routine_ptr routine)
    9655             : /*
    9656             : routine is an extern inline routine, and we're doing lowering of those,
    9657             : so convert the routine to a static routine.  Other transformations (e.g.,
    9658             : promoting local static variables out as external variables) are done
    9659             : elsewhere.
    9660             : */
    9661             : {
    9662             : #if !IA64_ABI
    9663             :   /* Make it a normal static inline routine. */
    9664             :   routine->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_static;
    9665             :   routine->source_corresp.name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal;
    9666             :   routine->source_corresp.externalized = FALSE;
    9667             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    9668             :   /* Make any associated thunks also static. */
    9669             :   { a_routine_ptr trout;
    9670             :     for (trout = routine->next;
    9671             :          trout != NULL && trout->overriding_function_for_wrapper == routine;
    9672             :          trout = trout->next) {
    9673             :       trout->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_static;
    9674             :       trout->source_corresp.name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_internal;
    9675             :       trout->source_corresp.externalized = FALSE;
    9676             :     }  /* for */
    9677             :   }
    9678             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    9679             : #if ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT
    9680             :   if (one_instantiation_per_object) {
    9681             :     routine->instantiation_needed_bit_number = 0;
    9682             : #if DUPLICATE_SPECIAL_STATICS_IN_INSTANTIATION_SLICES
    9683             :     /* In one-instantiation-per-object mode, such lowered extern inline
    9684             :        routines can be duplicated in each slice. */
    9685             :     routine->source_corresp.duplicate_static_in_instantiation_slices = TRUE;
    9686             : #endif /* DUPLICATE_SPECIAL_STATICS_IN_INSTANTIATION_SLICES */
    9687             :   }  /* if */
    9688             : #endif /* ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT */
    9689             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
    9690             :   if (!routine->suppress_inline_body) {
    9691             :     /* Place the routine in a COMDAT group so that the linker will
    9692             :        eliminate duplicate copies. */
    9693             :     put_routine_into_comdat_group(routine);
    9694             :   }  /* if */
    9695             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
    9696             : } /* lower_extern_inline_routine */
    9697             : 
    9698             : #endif /* LOWER_EXTERN_INLINE */
    9699             : #if GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
    9700             : 
    9701             : static void lower_mv_routine(a_routine_ptr routine)
    9702             : /*
    9703             : This is the representative routine for a family of GNU function multiversions;
    9704             : create a resolver routine if needed.
    9705             : */
    9706             : {
    9707             :   check_assertion(is_multiversion_representative(routine) &&
    9708             :                   gnu_routine_supp(routine)->
    9709             :                     mv_info.representative.targeted_versions->routine != NULL);
    9710             : 
    9711             : #if USE_X86_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
    9712             :   /* Note that a resolver routine is created only if the representative
    9713             :      routine has been referenced in some way (this seems to match g++). */
    9714             :   if (gnu_routine_supp(routine)->mv_resolver_required) {
    9715             :     /* Create a resolver routine and associate it with this ifunc routine. */
    9716             :     create_mv_resolver(routine);
    9717             :   } else {
    9718             :     /* Clear the "ifunc" attribute (since we have no resolver routine). */
    9719             :     routine->is_ifunc = FALSE;
    9720             :   }  /* if */
    9721             : #else /* !USE_X86_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    9722             :   /* Without knowing the specifics of the target architecture, a resolver
    9723             :      routine cannot be created. */
    9724             :   pos_diagnostic(es_catastrophe, ec_resolver_routine_required,
    9725             :                  &routine->source_corresp.decl_position);
    9726             : #endif /* USE_X86_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    9727             : }  /* lower_mv_routine */
    9728             : 
    9729             : 
    9730             : static a_routine_ptr lowered_mv_routine(a_routine_ptr routine)
    9731             : /*
    9732             : A reference in the IL that is being lowered is being made to routine (which is
    9733             : a GNU multiversion representative).  If the routine can be replaced by a
    9734             : target-specific version routine (i.e., no resolver is necessary), return that
    9735             : routine (otherwise return NULL).
    9736             : */
    9737             : {
    9738             :   a_routine_ptr result = routine;
    9739             : #if USE_X86_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
    9740             :   a_routine_ptr surrounding_routine = NULL;
    9741             : 
    9742             :   check_assertion(is_multiversion_representative(routine));
    9743             :   if (!gnu_routine_supp(routine)->mv_resolver_required) {
    9744             :     if (innermost_function_scope != NULL) {
    9745             :       surrounding_routine = innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr;
    9746             :     }  /* if */
    9747             :     result = find_mv_target_specific_routine(routine, surrounding_routine);
    9748             :     check_assertion(result != NULL);
    9749             :     /* Replace the reference to the representative routine with a direct
    9750             :        reference to a target-specific version.  Transfer some of the relevant
    9751             :        state information from the representative function to the
    9752             :        target-specific version. */
    9753             :     if (routine->called) result->called = TRUE;
    9754             :     if (routine->address_taken) result->address_taken = TRUE;
    9755             :     if (routine->source_corresp.referenced) {
    9756             :       result->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
    9757             :     }  /* if */
    9758             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9759             :     mark_as_needed_like((char *)result, iek_routine, &routine->source_corresp,
    9760             :                         /*set_class_defn_needed=*/FALSE);
    9761             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9762             :   }  /* if */
    9763             : #endif /* USE_X86_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    9764             :   return result;
    9765             : }  /* lowered_mv_routine */
    9766             : 
    9767             : #endif /* GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    9768             : #if LOWER_IFUNC
    9769             : 
    9770             : a_variable_ptr make_ifunc_resolver_var(a_routine_ptr rp)
    9771             : /*
    9772             : Returns the resolver_var associated with the specified ifunc routine;
    9773             : if one has not yet been created, it is created now.  The variable is
    9774             : statically initialized to the ifunc routine itself (which becomes a wrapper
    9775             : to invoke the resolver and then the resolved routine).
    9776             : */
    9777             : {
    9778             :   a_gnu_routine_supplement_ptr grsp;
    9779             : 
    9780             :   check_assertion(rp->is_ifunc);
    9781             :   grsp = ensure_gnu_routine_supp(rp);
    9782             :   if (grsp->resolver_var == NULL) {
    9783             :     a_constant_ptr   function_constant;
    9784             :     a_memory_region_number region_to_switch_back_to;
    9785             :     a_storage_class  storage_class;
    9786             :     char             *var_name;
    9787             : 
    9788             :     /* Allocate the variable and initializing constant in the file scope. */
    9789             :     switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
    9790             :     /* Make the resolver variable static if the routine is. */
    9791             :     storage_class = rp->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static ?
    9792             :                                                (a_storage_class)sc_static :
    9793             :                                                (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
    9794             :     /* Give the variable a unique name (based on the ifunc routine's name). */
    9795             :     var_name = make_prefixed_object_name("__IFV__", &rp->source_corresp,
    9796             :                                          iek_routine);
    9797             :     grsp->resolver_var = make_lowered_variable(var_name,
    9798             :                                                /*already_il_name=*/TRUE,
    9799             :                                                make_pointer_type(rp->type),
    9800             :                                                storage_class);
    9801             :     grsp->resolver_var->source_corresp.name_has_been_mangled = TRUE;
    9802             :     if (storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
    9803             : #if IA64_ABI
    9804             :       put_variable_into_comdat_group(grsp->resolver_var);
    9805             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
    9806             :       grsp->resolver_var->is_weak = TRUE;
    9807             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9808             :     }  /* if */
    9809             :     /* Statically initialize the variable to point to the ifunc routine. */
    9810             :     function_constant = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address);
    9811             :     set_routine_address_constant(rp, function_constant,
    9812             :                                  /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
    9813             :     grsp->resolver_var->initializer.constant = function_constant;
    9814             :     grsp->resolver_var->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_static;
    9815             :     switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
    9816             :   }  /* if */
    9817             :   return grsp->resolver_var;
    9818             : }  /* make_ifunc_resolver_var */
    9819             : 
    9820             : 
    9821             : void lower_ifunc_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    9822             : /*
    9823             : Re-write the expression (which is an enk_routine that refers to an ifunc
    9824             : routine) as an indirect call through the resolver variable as an optimization
    9825             : (if the lowering isn't performed, the wrapper routine will be invoked and
    9826             : the resolved routine will be invoked there).
    9827             : */
    9828             : {
    9829             :   an_expr_node_ptr new_expr;
    9830             :   a_variable_ptr   resolver_var =
    9831             :                             make_ifunc_resolver_var(expr->variant.routine.ptr);
    9832             : 
    9833             :   check_assertion(expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_routine);
    9834             :   new_expr = add_indirection_to_node(var_rvalue_expr(resolver_var));
    9835             :   if (!expr->is_lvalue) {
    9836             :     /* Original expression was an rvalue, make sure the new expression is as
    9837             :        well. */
    9838             :     new_expr = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(new_expr);
    9839             :   }  /* if */
    9840             :   check_assertion(il_identical_types(new_expr->type, expr->type) &&
    9841             :                   new_expr->is_lvalue == expr->is_lvalue);
    9842             :   overwrite_node(expr, new_expr);
    9843             :   return;
    9844             : }  /* lower_ifunc_expr */
    9845             : 
    9846             : #endif /* LOWER_IFUNC */
    9847             : 
    9848             : static void lower_routine(a_routine_ptr routine)
    9849             : /*
    9850             : Do IL lowering of the indicated routine and everything under it.  This does
    9851             : not include the function scope memory region, if any.
    9852             : */
    9853             : {
    9854             :   if (!visited_yet(routine)) {
    9855             :     check_assertion(!ignore_routine_in_back_end(routine));
    9856             :     mark_as_visited(routine);
    9857             :     lower_source_correspondence(&routine->source_corresp);
    9858             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
    9859             :     if (vla_enabled) {
    9860             :       /* Collect any VLA types that will need to be lowered later on. */
    9861             :       record_vla_component_types_for_lowering(routine->type);
    9862             :     }  /* if */
    9863             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
    9864             : #if IA64_ABI
    9865             :     if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
    9866             :         routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
    9867             :       /* Assign the constructor or destructor routine as one of the IA-64
    9868             :          entry points. */
    9869             :       set_primary_ctor_or_dtor_kind(routine);
    9870             :     }  /* if */
    9871             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9872             :     /* "lower_os_type" not needed; the routine and the type must both be
    9873             :        in the file scope. */
    9874             :     lower_type(routine->type);
    9875             :     lower_template_arg_list(routine->template_arg_list);
    9876             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    9877             :     {
    9878             :       /* The routine has a declared_type field.  Go through the parameter
    9879             :          types and remove default argument expressions. */
    9880             :       a_type_ptr decl_type = routine->declared_type;
    9881             :       /* Routines that are declared and not defined have a NULL
    9882             :          declared_type. */
    9883             :       if (decl_type != NULL) {
    9884             :         a_param_type_ptr ptp;
    9885             :         decl_type = skip_typerefs(decl_type);
    9886             :         for (ptp = decl_type->variant.routine.extra_info->param_type_list;
    9887             :              ptp != NULL;
    9888             :              ptp = ptp->next) {
    9889             :           an_expr_node_ptr def_arg_expr = ptp->default_arg_expr;
    9890             :           if (def_arg_expr != NULL) {
    9891             :             /* If the expression has an object lifetime node at top,
    9892             :                eliminate it, because the expression is not staying in the
    9893             :                IL tree. */
    9894             :             eliminate_expr_object_lifetime(def_arg_expr);
    9895             :             ptp->default_arg_expr = NULL;
    9896             :           }  /* if */
    9897             :         }  /* for */
    9898             :       }  /* if */
    9899             :     }
    9900             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    9901             : #if LOWER_EXTERN_INLINE
    9902             :     if (treat_as_extern_inline(routine)) {
    9903             :       /* Lower an extern inline routine to static. */
    9904             :       lower_extern_inline_routine(routine);
    9905             :     }  /* if */
    9906             : #endif /* LOWER_EXTERN_INLINE */
    9907             : #if IA64_ABI
    9908             :     if (routine->is_template_function &&
    9909             :         !routine->is_specialized &&
    9910             :         routine->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified &&
    9911             :         !routine->use_comdat && !routine->suppress_inline_body) {
    9912             :       /* A defined non-inline template goes into a COMDAT group.
    9913             :          Note that this is done even when the prelinker is used.  If we
    9914             :          have the COMDAT feature, it's good to be able to ignore
    9915             :          multiple copies if, say, -tused is specified in two
    9916             :          compilations and that creates two instances of a template
    9917             :          function. */
    9918             :       put_routine_into_comdat_group(routine);
    9919             :     }  /* if */
    9920             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9921             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    9922             :     { a_routine_ptr     overriding_function;
    9923             :       overriding_function = routine->overriding_function_for_wrapper;
    9924             :       if (overriding_function != NULL &&
    9925             :           !overriding_function->suppress_inline_body &&
    9926             :           overriding_function->function_def_number !=
    9927             :                                                     NULL_function_def_number) {
    9928             :         /* Add a definition for an entry/wrapper to handle covariant
    9929             :            return types or "this" adjustment, if the overriding routine is
    9930             :            defined. */
    9931             :         add_body_for_wrapper_routine(routine);
    9932             :       }  /* if */
    9933             :     }  /* if */
    9934             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    9935             : #if IA64_ABI
    9936             :     if ((routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
    9937             :          routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) &&
    9938             :         routine->primary_ctor_or_dtor == NULL) {
    9939             :       a_routine_list_entry_ptr rlep;
    9940             :       /* Create the alternate entry points for a constructor or
    9941             :          destructor, but do not define them at this time. */
    9942             :       create_alternate_entry_points(routine, /*define_now=*/FALSE);
    9943             :       for (rlep = routine->variant.ctor_dtor.alternate_entry_points;
    9944             :            rlep != NULL;
    9945             :            rlep = rlep->next) {
    9946             :         a_routine_ptr arout = rlep->routine;
    9947             :         /* Externalize the alternate entry point name if necessary. */
    9948             :         if (routine_should_be_externalized_for_exported_templates(arout)) {
    9949             :           externalize_source_correspondence(&arout->source_corresp,
    9950             :                                             /*is_variable=*/FALSE);
    9951             :           arout->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
    9952             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
    9953             :           mark_as_needed((char *)arout, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_routine);
    9954             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
    9955             :         }  /* if */
    9956             :         /* Lower alternate entry points, which are not linked into the
    9957             :            main IL tree yet, and any thunks for them.  The thunks follow
    9958             :            the alternate entry points on the "next" pointer. */
    9959             :         for (;;) {
    9960             :           a_routine_ptr arout_next = arout->next;
    9961             :           lower_routine(arout);
    9962             :           arout = arout_next;
    9963             :           if (arout == NULL) break;
    9964             :         }  /* for */
    9965             :       }  /* for */
    9966             :     }  /* if */
    9967             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
    9968             :     if (routine->special_kind ==
    9969             :                              (a_special_function_kind)sfk_lambda_entry_point) {
    9970             :       /* Define the alternate entry point of the lambda call operator now. */
    9971             :       define_default_version_of_routine(routine->variant.lambda_call_operator,
    9972             :                                         routine, (an_expr_node_ptr)NULL);
    9973             :     }  /* if */
    9974             : #if GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
    9975             :     if (is_multiversion_representative(routine)) {
    9976             :       /* Create a resolver routine, if necessary, for this versioned routine;
    9977             :          do this before lowering ifunc (as it'll need to be lowered if ifuncs
    9978             :          are being lowered). */
    9979             :       lower_mv_routine(routine);
    9980             :     }  /* if */
    9981             : #endif /* GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
    9982             : #if LOWER_IFUNC
    9983             :     if (routine->is_ifunc) {
    9984             :       /* Lower the ifunc routine. */
    9985             :       lower_ifunc_routine(routine);
    9986             :     }  /* if */
    9987             : #endif /* LOWER_IFUNC */
    9988             :   }  /* if */
    9989             : }  /* lower_routine */
    9990             : 
    9991             : 
    9992             : static void lower_label_list(a_label_ptr label_list)
    9993             : /*
    9994             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of labels and everything under it.
    9995             : */
    9996             : {
    9997             :   a_label_ptr label;
    9998             : 
    9999             :   for (label = label_list; label != NULL; label = label->next) {
   10000             :     lower_label(label);
   10001             :   }  /* for */
   10002             : }  /* lower_label_list */
   10003             : 
   10004             : 
   10005             : static void lower_label(a_label_ptr label)
   10006             : /*
   10007             : Do IL lowering of the indicated label and everything under it.
   10008             : */
   10009             : {
   10010             :   if (!visited_yet(label)) {
   10011             :     mark_as_visited(label);
   10012             :     lower_source_correspondence(&label->source_corresp);
   10013             :     /* label->exec_stmt need not be processed since it will be found in the
   10014             :        normal code traversal. */
   10015             :   }  /* if */
   10016             : }  /* lower_label */
   10017             : 
   10018             : 
   10019             : static void lower_asm_entry_list(an_asm_entry_ptr asm_entry_list)
   10020             : /*
   10021             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of asm entries and everything under it.
   10022             : */
   10023             : {
   10024             :   an_asm_entry_ptr asm_entry;
   10025             : 
   10026             :   for (asm_entry = asm_entry_list;
   10027             :        asm_entry != NULL;
   10028             :        asm_entry = asm_entry->next) {
   10029             :     lower_asm_entry(asm_entry);
   10030             :   }  /* for */
   10031             : }  /* lower_asm_entry_list */
   10032             : 
   10033             : 
   10034             : static void lower_asm_entry(an_asm_entry_ptr asm_entry)
   10035             : /*
   10036             : Do IL lowering of the indicated asm entry and everything under it.
   10037             : */
   10038             : {
   10039             :   if (!visited_yet(asm_entry)) {
   10040             :     mark_as_visited(asm_entry);
   10041             :     lower_source_correspondence(&asm_entry->source_corresp);
   10042             :     lower_constant(asm_entry->asm_string);
   10043             :   }  /* if */
   10044             : }  /* lower_asm_entry */
   10045             : 
   10046             : 
   10047             : void lower_expr_list(an_expr_node_ptr expr_list,
   10048             :                      unsigned int     is_bool_controlling_expr_mask,
   10049             :                      unsigned int     assume_expr_is_non_null_mask)
   10050             : /*
   10051             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of expressions and everything under it.
   10052             : is_bool_controlling_expr_mask is a bit mask indicating operands
   10053             : that are boolean controlling expressions.  assume_expr_is_non_null_mask is a
   10054             : bit mask that indicates which operands can safely be assumed to be non-NULL.
   10055             : The least significant bit of these masks corresponds to the first expression
   10056             : in the list.
   10057             : */
   10058             : {
   10059             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr;
   10060             : 
   10061             :   for (expr = expr_list; expr != NULL; expr = expr->next) {
   10062             :     /* Lower the expression on the list. */
   10063             :     if (is_bool_controlling_expr_mask & 1) {
   10064             :       lower_boolean_controlling_expr(expr, /*is_full_expr=*/FALSE);
   10065             :     } else {
   10066             :       lower_expr_full(expr, assume_expr_is_non_null_mask & 1);
   10067             :     }  /* if */
   10068             :     /* Move to the next bit in the masks. */
   10069             :     is_bool_controlling_expr_mask >>= 1;
   10070             :     assume_expr_is_non_null_mask >>= 1;
   10071             :   }  /* for */
   10072             : }  /* lower_expr_list */
   10073             : 
   10074             : 
   10075             : static a_param_type_ptr unlowered_param_type_list_full(
   10076             :                                                     a_type_ptr    routine_type,
   10077             :                                                     a_routine_ptr routine)
   10078             : /*
   10079             : routine_type is a lowered or unlowered routine type.  If routine is
   10080             : non-NULL, it is the associated routine.  Return the original unlowered
   10081             : parameter type list for the routine, i.e., if the type has been
   10082             : lowered, return the list after any implicit parameters added by lowering.
   10083             : */
   10084             : {
   10085             :   a_param_type_ptr              param;
   10086             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp;
   10087             : 
   10088             :   routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
   10089             :   rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   10090             :   param = rtsp->param_type_list;
   10091             :   /* Special processing is needed only if the type has already been lowered. */
   10092             :   if (visited_yet(routine_type)) {
   10093             :     /* The routine type has already been lowered, so advance past the
   10094             :        extra arguments added by lowering, if any. */
   10095             :     /* "this" parameter. */
   10096             :     if (rtsp->this_class != NULL) param = param->next;
   10097             :     if (routine != NULL &&
   10098             :         routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
   10099             : #if !IA64_ABI
   10100             :       /* For constructors, a parameter is added for each virtual base
   10101             :          class. */
   10102             :       /* Get the class type from the "this" parameter type. */
   10103             :       a_type_ptr class_type = rtsp->this_class;
   10104             :       /* coverity[var_deref_op] */
   10105             :       if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
   10106             :         a_base_class_ptr bcp;
   10107             :         for (bcp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
   10108             :                                                                   base_classes;
   10109             :              bcp != NULL;
   10110             :              bcp = bcp->next) {
   10111             :           if (bcp->is_virtual) param = param->next;
   10112             :         }  /* for */
   10113             :       }  /* if */
   10114             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   10115             :       /* For constructors, a parameter is sometimes added for the VTT. */
   10116             :       if (ctor_needs_vtt_argument(routine)) param = param->next;
   10117             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10118             :     } else if (routine != NULL &&
   10119             :                routine->special_kind ==
   10120             :                                      (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   10121             : #if !IA64_ABI
   10122             :       /* For destructors, a control parameter is always added. */
   10123             :       param = param->next;
   10124             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   10125             :       /* Skip the VTT parameter if present. */
   10126             :       if (dtor_needs_vtt_argument(routine)) param = param->next;
   10127             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10128             :     }  /* if */
   10129             :     /* If the routine returns its value via an extra added parameter
   10130             :        we need to take it into account.  Note that we're not implying
   10131             :        anything about the order of added parameters here;
   10132             :        we're just stepping over the right number.
   10133             :        The Cfront-like ABI and the IA64 ABI have the "this" and
   10134             :        return value address parameters in different orders, but
   10135             :        it doesn't matter in stepping over them. */
   10136             :     if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) param = param->next;
   10137             :   }  /* if */
   10138             :   return param;
   10139             : }  /* unlowered_param_type_list_full */
   10140             : 
   10141             : 
   10142             : a_param_type_ptr unlowered_param_type_list_for_routine(a_routine_ptr routine)
   10143             : /*
   10144             : Return the original unlowered parameter type list for the indicated routine,
   10145             : i.e., if its type has been lowered, return the list after any implicit
   10146             : parameters added by lowering.
   10147             : */
   10148             : {
   10149             :   return unlowered_param_type_list_full(routine->type, routine);
   10150             : }  /* unlowered_param_type_list_for_routine */
   10151             : 
   10152             : 
   10153             : a_param_type_ptr param_type_for_this(a_type_ptr routine_type)
   10154             : /*
   10155             : routine_type is a lowered routine type.  Return a pointer to the
   10156             : a_param_type entry for the "this" parameter.
   10157             : */
   10158             : {
   10159             :   a_param_type_ptr              param;
   10160             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp;
   10161             : 
   10162             :   routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
   10163             :   check_assertion(visited_yet(routine_type));
   10164             :   rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   10165             :   check_assertion(rtsp->this_class != NULL);
   10166             :   param = rtsp->param_type_list;
   10167             :   /* If there is both a "this" parameter and a return value address,
   10168             :      adjust for the case when the return value address comes first. */
   10169             :   if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter &&
   10170             :       !rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
   10171             :     param = param->next;
   10172             :   }  /* if */
   10173             :   return param;
   10174             : }  /* param_type_for_this */
   10175             : 
   10176             : 
   10177             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- end_traversal is not used. */
   10178             : static a_boolean ttt_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor(a_type_ptr tp,
   10179             :                                                      a_boolean  *end_traversal)
   10180             : /*
   10181             : Return TRUE (and stop the type traversal) if the specified type (tp) is
