   10182             : a function that has a parameter that is passed via copy constructor.
   10183             : end_traversal is not used.
   10184             : */
   10185             : {
   10186             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
   10187             : 
   10188             :   if (is_function_type(tp)) {
   10189             :     /* See if this function has a parameter that is passed via a copy
   10190             :        constructor.  skip_typerefs is not needed because the TTT_SKIP_TYPEREFS
   10191             :        flag ensures that any typerefs have already been stripped from tp. */
   10192             :     a_param_type_ptr              ptp;
   10193             :     a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp = tp->variant.routine.extra_info;
   10194             :     if (rtsp != NULL) {
   10195             :       for (ptp = rtsp->param_type_list; ptp != NULL; ptp = ptp->next) {
   10196             :         if (ptp->passed_via_copy_constructor) {
   10197             :           result = TRUE;
   10198             :           break;
   10199             :         }  /* if */
   10200             :       }  /* if */
   10201             :     }  /* for */
   10202             :   }  /* if */
   10203             :   return result;
   10204             : }  /* ttt_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor */
   10205             : 
   10206             : 
   10207             : a_boolean type_has_param_passed_via_cctor(a_type_ptr tp)
   10208             : /*
   10209             : Traverse the type specified by tp to see if any component of the type
   10210             : contains a parameter whose type requires a copy constructor to be called.
   10211             : */
   10212             : {
   10213             :   /* No need to traverse 'this' pointer nor exception specifications. */
   10214             :   a_type_tree_traversal_flag_set  tt_flags = TTT_RETURN_TYPE |
   10215             :                                              TTT_SKIP_TYPEREFS |
   10216             :                                              TTT_PARAM_TYPES;
   10217             : 
   10218             :   return traverse_type_tree(tp, ttt_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor, tt_flags);
   10219             : }  /* type_has_param_passed_via_cctor */
   10220             : 
   10221             : 
   10222             : a_type_ptr cast_type_for_param_passed_via_cctor(a_type_ptr source,
   10223             :                                                 a_type_ptr dest)
   10224             : /*
   10225             : An object of type "source" is about to be cast to "dest" because "source" has
   10226             : some function type component with a parameter that requires a copy constructor
   10227             : to be called (i.e., needs_cast_because_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor returns
   10228             : TRUE).  In most cases, a simple cast to "dest" is needed (because lowering will
   10229             : alter the function signature), but in cases where "dest" is a variably-sized
   10230             : array type and "source" is a non-variably-sized array type, such a cast will
   10231             : effectively convert "source" to a variably-sized array.  That can lead to
   10232             : problems if the type is later used as a source operand to an eok_bassign as
   10233             : in a case like this:
   10234             : 
   10235             :   struct A { A(const A&); };
   10236             :   template <class T> using B = void (*)(T);
   10237             :   void f(int i) {
   10238             :     new B<A>[i] { {} };
   10239             :   }
   10240             : 
   10241             : In cases like the one described above, a new array type with the same shape
   10242             : as "source" but an underlying element type of "dest" is created and returned,
   10243             : otherwise "dest" is returned.
   10244             : */
   10245             : {
   10246             :   a_type_ptr result;
   10247             : 
   10248             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
   10249             :   check_assertion(needs_cast_because_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor(source));
   10250             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
   10251             :   if (is_incomplete_array_type(dest) && !is_incomplete_array_type(source)) {
   10252             :     check_assertion(is_array_type(source));
   10253             :     result = copy_array_type_replacing_element_type(source,
   10254             :                                           underlying_array_element_type(dest));
   10255             :   } else {
   10256             :     result = dest;
   10257             :   }  /* if */
   10258             :   return result;
   10259             : }  /* cast_type_for_param_passed_via_cctor */
   10260             : 
   10261             : 
   10262             : void lower_arg_expr_list(an_expr_node_ptr   expr_list,
   10263             :                          a_type_ptr         called_rout_type,
   10264             :                          a_routine_ptr      called_rout,
   10265             :                          a_param_type_ptr   param,
   10266             :                          a_boolean          maintain_sequencing,
   10267             :                          an_insert_location *insert_location)
   10268             : /*
   10269             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of expressions and everything under it.
   10270             : The expressions are the argument list for a call.  The type of the routine
   10271             : being called is called_rout_type (the type may be lowered or not).
   10272             : If the routine is known, called_rout is non-NULL and points to it.  Note
   10273             : that if the routine requires control arguments like a "this" pointer, such
   10274             : arguments are *not* in expr_list.  If param is non-NULL, start at that
   10275             : parameter (this is used when the called routine is a copy constructor,
   10276             : to skip the input parameter).  If maintain_sequencing is TRUE, the order
   10277             : of execution of the arguments is maintained (for C and C++ function calls
   10278             : the order of execution is unspecified, but when initializing a constructor
   10279             : from an initializer-list the order must be maintained).  insert_location
   10280             : points to a location to insert code prior to the execution of the call
   10281             : (and can be NULL in cases where maintain_sequencing is also NULL).
   10282             : */
   10283             : {
   10284             :   an_expr_node_ptr              expr;
   10285             : 
   10286             :   check_assertion(!(maintain_sequencing && insert_location == NULL));
   10287             :   called_rout_type = skip_typerefs(called_rout_type);
   10288             :   /* Get the first parameter type. */
   10289             :   if (param != NULL) {
   10290             :     /* The caller is telling us where to start in the list. */
   10291             :   } else {
   10292             :     /* Start with the first parameter. */
   10293             :     param = unlowered_param_type_list_full(called_rout_type, called_rout);
   10294             :   }  /* if */
   10295             :   if (maintain_sequencing) {
   10296             :     /* Sequencing is only needed if there are two or more invariant args. */
   10297             :     a_host_large_integer invariant_args = 0;
   10298             :     for (expr = expr_list; expr != NULL; expr = expr->next) {
   10299             :       if (invariant_args == 0 && expr->next == NULL) {
   10300             :         /* No need to check last argument if there are no previous invariant
   10301             :            arguments. */
   10302             :         break;
   10303             :       } else if (!is_invariant_expr(expr, /*vars_can_change=*/TRUE,
   10304             :                                     /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE)) {
   10305             :         if (++invariant_args == 2) break;
   10306             :       }  /* if */
   10307             :     }  /* for */
   10308             :     maintain_sequencing = (invariant_args == 2);
   10309             :   }  /* if */
   10310             :   /* Track the current parameter type as we go through the list. */
   10311             :   for (expr = expr_list; expr != NULL; expr = expr->next) {
   10312             :     lower_expr(expr);
   10313             :     /* Take the address of any lvalue arguments. */
   10314             :     if (expr->is_lvalue) {
   10315             :       overwrite_node(expr, add_address_of_to_node(copy_node(expr)));
   10316             :     }  /* if */
   10317             :     if (param != NULL) {
   10318             :       /* Prototyped parameter. */
   10319             :       if (param->passed_via_copy_constructor &&
   10320             :           param->qualifiers != TQ_NONE) {
   10321             :         /* Argument passed via a copy constructor to a cv-qualified parameter.
   10322             :            The argument is a pointer, but it doesn't have the right qualifiers.
   10323             :            "void f(const A)" becomes "void f(A)" because of a C++ language
   10324             :            rule (in most modes); that will be lowered to "void f(const A*)",
   10325             :            but the lowering hasn't been done yet.  The argument has type
   10326             :            "A*", and needs to be cast to "const A*". */
   10327             :         an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy = copy_node(expr);
   10328             :         change_to_cast(expr, expr_copy, 
   10329             :                        type_of_cctor_param_after_adding_indirection(param));
   10330             :       }  /* if */
   10331             :       if (make_all_functions_unprototyped) {
   10332             :         /* Do default argument promotions on any arguments that need it,
   10333             :            because they were generated for a call to a prototyped function, but
   10334             :            we're changing all functions to unprototyped (for cfront
   10335             :            compatibility). */
   10336             :         do_default_arg_promotions_on_node(expr);
   10337             :       } else if (needs_cast_because_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor(
   10338             :                                                                  expr->type)) {
   10339             :         /* As described above, arguments that are passed via a copy
   10340             :            constructor to a cv-qualified parameter are adjusted.  If we're
   10341             :            passing a type that contains a function where (at least) one of the
   10342             :            parameters will undergo this type conversion, we need to add
   10343             :            a cast to the destination type to avoid a type mismatch. */
   10344             :         change_to_cast(expr, copy_node(expr),
   10345             :                        cast_type_for_param_passed_via_cctor(expr->type,
   10346             :                                                             param->type));
   10347             :       }  /* if */
   10348             :       param = param->next;
   10349             :     } else {
   10350             :       /* Unprototyped parameter: ellipsis. */
   10351             :       /* Widen pointers-to-data-members that have been turned into integers
   10352             :          and are passed to an ellipsis. */
   10353             :       if (is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(expr->type)) {
   10354             :         /* A pointer to data member -- widen if necessary. */
   10355             :         do_ptr_to_data_member_arg_promotion_on_node(expr);
   10356             :       }  /* if */
   10357             :     }  /* if */
   10358             :     if (maintain_sequencing &&
   10359             :         !is_invariant_expr(expr, /*vars_can_change=*/TRUE,
   10360             :                            /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE)) {
   10361             :       /* If the caller requests that argument sequencing be maintained
   10362             :          (i.e., when an initializer list is used as arguments for a
   10363             :          constructor call), create a temporary for any argument that
   10364             :          has side-effects and ensure that it is evaluated prior to the call,
   10365             :          e.g., "A{i++, i++}" becomes: "t1 = i++; t2 = i++; A(t1, t2)". */
   10366             :       a_variable_ptr   temp;
   10367             :       an_expr_node_ptr temp_node;
   10368             :       check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   10369             :       temp = make_lowered_temporary(expr->type);
   10370             :       temp_node = make_assignment_expr(var_lvalue_expr(temp),
   10371             :                                       (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   10372             :                                       copy_node(expr));
   10373             :       (void)insert_expr_statement(temp_node, insert_location);
   10374             :       overwrite_node(expr, var_rvalue_expr(temp));
   10375             :     }  /* if */
   10376             :   }  /* for */
   10377             : }  /* lower_arg_expr_list */
   10378             : 
   10379             : 
   10380             : static void add_null_preservation_code(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   10381             :                                        an_expr_node_ptr orig_source_node)
   10382             : /*
   10383             : Add the equivalent of
   10384             :    orig_source_node ? expr : NULL
   10385             : on top of expr.  The node pointed to by expr is overwritten, so the
   10386             : pointer to the overall expression remains the same.  expr and orig_source_node
   10387             : are both rvalues.
   10388             : */
   10389             : {
   10390             :   a_constant_ptr   null_constant = local_constant();
   10391             :   an_expr_node_ptr test_node, source_node, null_constant_node;
   10392             : 
   10393             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue && !orig_source_node->is_lvalue);
   10394             :   /* Make a copy of the expr node; it will be reused below as the
   10395             :      conditional operator node. */
   10396             :   source_node = copy_node(expr);
   10397             :   /* Make a NULL pointer constant of the right type. */
   10398             :   make_zero_of_proper_type(source_node->type, null_constant);
   10399             :   null_constant_node = alloc_node_for_constant(null_constant);
   10400             :   /* Make a conditional operator node out of the original node. */
   10401             :   test_node = boolean_controlling_expr(orig_source_node);
   10402             :   test_node->next = source_node;
   10403             :   source_node->next = null_constant_node;
   10404             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
   10405             :   check_assertion(!is_vector_type(expr->type));
   10406             : #endif /* GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED */
   10407             :   set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question,
   10408             :                     source_node->type, expr->is_lvalue, test_node);
   10409             :   release_local_constant(&null_constant);
   10410             : }  /* add_null_preservation_code */
   10411             : 
   10412             : 
   10413             : static an_expr_node_ptr add_decr_code_to_pointer_node(
   10414             :                                                   an_expr_node_ptr source_node,
   10415             :                                                   a_targ_size_t    byte_offset)
   10416             : /*
   10417             : Generate expression nodes to subtract byte_offset from the rvalue pointer
   10418             : represented by source_node.  Return a pointer to the new expression.  The
   10419             : expression will have type "char *" and the caller is responsible for the cast
   10420             : back to the proper type if necessary.  If the offset is zero, return the
   10421             : original node.
   10422             : */
   10423             : {
   10424             :   an_expr_node_ptr cast_to_char_star_node, offset_constant_node;
   10425             : 
   10426             :   check_assertion(!source_node->is_lvalue &&
   10427             :                   is_pointer_type(source_node->type));
   10428             :   if (byte_offset != 0) {
   10429             :     /* Cast the original node to char * to avoid scaling problems. */
   10430             :     cast_to_char_star_node = add_cast_to_char_star(source_node);
   10431             :     /* Make the node for the constant. */
   10432             :     offset_constant_node = node_for_host_large_integer(
   10433             :                       (a_host_large_integer)byte_offset, targ_size_t_int_kind);
   10434             :     cast_to_char_star_node->next = offset_constant_node;
   10435             :     /* Make the node for the pointer subtraction. */
   10436             :     source_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_psubtract,
   10437             :                                      cast_to_char_star_node->type,
   10438             :                                      cast_to_char_star_node);
   10439             :   }  /* if */
   10440             :   return source_node;
   10441             : }  /* add_decr_code_to_pointer_node */
   10442             : 
   10443             : 
   10444             : static void related_class_cast_step(
   10445             :                                an_expr_node_ptr node,
   10446             :                                a_boolean        any_nonzero_offset,
   10447             :                                a_type_ptr       virtual_step_class,
   10448             :                                an_expr_node_ptr *null_preservation_source_node,
   10449             :                                a_base_class_ptr *base_class_for_virtual_step,
   10450             :                                a_boolean        *complete_object,
   10451             :                                an_expr_node_ptr *result_node,
   10452             :                                a_targ_size_t    *derived_class_cast_offset,
   10453             :                                a_boolean        assume_expr_is_non_null)
   10454             : /*
   10455             : Do one step in the lowering of a base or derived class cast.  node points to an
   10456             : expression for the cast.  node can take the form of an rvalue pointer, class
   10457             : rvalue, or class lvalue.  On return, *result_node has been set to the (mostly)
   10458             : lowered expression; however, for derived casts, the pointer subtraction must
   10459             : still be generated by the caller (*derived_class_cast_offset indicates the
   10460             : amount to subtract), and for base class casts, a final cast to the proper type
   10461             : may still be required (for cases where the base class type is not the same as
   10462             : its type-as-subobject).  Additionally, *result_node is left in rvalue pointer
   10463             : form and must be converted back to the original form by the caller, if so
   10464             : desired.  If code to preserve NULL pointers is needed, it is started, and
   10465             : *null_preservation_source_node is set to the original node to be tested when
   10466             : the null-preservation code is completed.  *null_preservation_source_node ==
   10467             : NULL means that no NULL-preservation code is required.  No code to preserve
   10468             : NULL pointers is needed when assume_expr_is_non_null is TRUE.  The underlying
   10469             : source expression is lowered by this routine.  This routine descends
   10470             : recursively through a sequence of base-class or derived-class casts so that the
   10471             : entire sequence can be treated as one operation.  This allows optimization of
   10472             : the code to preserve NULL pointer values: we may be able to determine that it
   10473             : is not needed at all by examining the fundamental source node or the offsets in
   10474             : the base class casts (any_nonzero_offset is maintained going down to aid that
   10475             : determination).  If we cannot suppress the NULL-preservation code, we can at
   10476             : least put it just once around the whole sequence instead of around each cast in
   10477             : the sequence.  The recursive technique also allows optimization of casts
   10478             : to virtual base classes.  When a virtual step is found while descending,
   10479             : virtual_step_class is set to the virtual base class type.  Then, when the
   10480             : bottom is reached, we can set *base_class_for_virtual_step to correspond
   10481             : to the hop from the bottommost type to the step of the virtual base class,
   10482             : and also set *complete_object to indicate whether or not the underlying
   10483             : object is a complete object (if so, the virtual step can be done without
   10484             : an indirection).  Then, on the ascent, we suppress the casting steps
   10485             : preceding the virtual step, and generate optimized code for the hop to
   10486             : the virtual step.  The recursive descent also has the advantage that it
   10487             : avoids the need to look up the base class entry for each step of the cast
   10488             : more than once.
   10489             : */
   10490             : {
   10491             :   an_expr_operator_kind op;
   10492             :   a_boolean             derived, handle_virtual_at_this_level;
   10493             :   an_expr_node_ptr      source_node, local_result_node;
   10494             :   a_type_ptr            source_class, dest_class;
   10495             :   a_base_class_ptr      bcp, virt_bcp;
   10496             :   a_boolean             need_null_preservation_code;
   10497             : 
   10498             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(node) &&
   10499             :                   (node_operator_is(node, eok_derived_class_cast) ||
   10500             :                    node_operator_is(node, eok_base_class_cast)));
   10501             :   change_xvalue_node_to_lvalue(node->variant.operation.operands);
   10502             :   check_assertion(is_ptr_or_ref_type(node->type) ==
   10503             :                    is_ptr_or_ref_type(node->variant.operation.operands->type));
   10504             :   *base_class_for_virtual_step = NULL;
   10505             :   *complete_object = FALSE;
   10506             :   op = node->variant.operation.kind;
   10507             :   derived = (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_derived_class_cast);
   10508             :   source_node = node->variant.operation.operands;
   10509             :   /* Determine the source and destination class types and the relationship
   10510             :      between them. */
   10511             :   if (node->is_lvalue || !is_ptr_or_ref_type(node->type)) {
   10512             :     /* Class lvalue or class rvalue. */
   10513             :     source_class = source_node->type;
   10514             :     dest_class = node->type;
   10515             :   } else {
   10516             :     /* Rvalue pointer. */
   10517             :     source_class = type_pointed_to(source_node->type);
   10518             :     dest_class = type_pointed_to(node->type);
   10519             :   }  /* if */
   10520             :   source_class = skip_typerefs(source_class);
   10521             :   dest_class = skip_typerefs(dest_class);
   10522             :   check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(source_class) &&
   10523             :                   is_immediate_class_type(dest_class));
   10524             :   prelower_class_type(source_class);
   10525             :   prelower_class_type(dest_class);
   10526             :   /* Find the base class entry that relates the source_class to the
   10527             :      dest_class. */
   10528             :   if (derived) {
   10529             :     bcp = find_direct_or_virtual_base_class_of(dest_class, source_class);
   10530             :   } else {
   10531             :     bcp = find_direct_or_virtual_base_class_of(source_class, dest_class);
   10532             :   }  /* if */
   10533             :   /* If this step is to a virtual base class, and no previous step was a
   10534             :      step to a virtual base class, pass the virtual base class type down
   10535             :      in the recursive processing to let the bottom-most call deal with
   10536             :      the virtual step.  One would think that, because the front end
   10537             :      standardizes derivations to/through a virtual base class as a single
   10538             :      initial leap to the virtual base class, there would never be another
   10539             :      (nonvirtual) cast below (in front of) a virtual step.  Such things
   10540             :      can occur, however, when two cast sequences abut.  By doing the
   10541             :      processing in this way, we can process the sequences as one sequence
   10542             :      and optimize the step to the virtual base class. */
   10543             :   handle_virtual_at_this_level = FALSE;
   10544             :   if (virtual_step_class != NULL) {
   10545             :     /* A previous step (higher up the tree, i.e., further in the sequence
   10546             :        of casts) was a step to a virtual base class, so we do not test here. */
   10547             :   } else if (bcp->is_virtual) {
   10548             :     /* No previous step was virtual and this one is, so remember it as we
   10549             :        continue down the tree. */
   10550             :     handle_virtual_at_this_level = TRUE;
   10551             :     virtual_step_class = bcp->type;
   10552             :   } else {
   10553             :     /* No previous step was virtual and this one is not either.  Remember if
   10554             :        the offset is non-zero (if all offsets are zero, we do not need
   10555             :        NULL-preservation code). */
   10556             :     if (bcp->offset != 0) any_nonzero_offset = TRUE;
   10557             :   }  /* if */
   10558             :   /* See if there is another cast below this one.  If so, make a recursive
   10559             :      call to get down to the bottom of the sequence of casts. */
   10560             :   if (is_operation_node(source_node) &&
   10561             :       source_node->variant.operation.kind == op) {
   10562             :     related_class_cast_step(source_node,
   10563             :                             any_nonzero_offset,
   10564             :                             virtual_step_class,
   10565             :                             null_preservation_source_node,
   10566             :                             base_class_for_virtual_step,
   10567             :                             complete_object,
   10568             :                             &local_result_node,
   10569             :                             derived_class_cast_offset,
   10570             :                             assume_expr_is_non_null);
   10571             :   } else {
   10572             :     /* The node below this one is not another cast, so we have reached the
   10573             :        bottom of the sequence of casts. */
   10574             :     /* We've reached the bottom of the expression; start building the
   10575             :        returned result in local_result_node.  It's easier to do this with an
   10576             :        rvalue pointer, so convert source_node (which can be an rvalue
   10577             :        pointer, class rvalue, or class lvalue) to the desired form.
   10578             :        At the end of processing the entire sequence of related casts (in
   10579             :        lower_related_class_cast), convert this back to its original form. */
   10580             :     local_result_node = rvalue_pointer_for_class_expression(source_node);
   10581             :     /* Lower the source expression. */
   10582             :     lower_expr_full(local_result_node, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   10583             :     /* The offsets for derived class casts are summed on the way back up. */
   10584             :     *derived_class_cast_offset = 0;
   10585             :     if (virtual_step_class != NULL) {
   10586             :       /* There was a virtual step somewhere in the sequence of casts.
   10587             :          The overall cast can be viewed as an initial hop to the bottommost
   10588             :          virtual base class (this hop possibly corresponding to several cast
   10589             :          steps in the expression) followed by any remaining (non-virtual)
   10590             :          cast steps.  If we start with a complete object, the cast to the
   10591             :          virtual base class can be done without an indirection. */
   10592             : #if CHECKING
   10593             :       /* Cannot cast up from a virtual base class. */
   10594             :       if (derived) {
   10595             :         internal_error("related_class_cast_step: derived cast is virtual");
   10596             :       }  /* if */
   10597             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   10598             :       /* Find the base class entry that relates the source class
   10599             :          and the virtual base class.  We cannot use find_base_class_of
   10600             :          because we specifically want an entry with is_virtual TRUE --
   10601             :          there might be others if the base class appears as both a virtual
   10602             :          and a non-virtual base class. */
   10603             :       virt_bcp = find_virtual_base_class_of(source_class,
   10604             :                                             virtual_step_class);
   10605             :       /* virt_bcp is now the base class entry that gets us from the
   10606             :          original type (source_class) to the desired virtual base class
   10607             :          (virtual_step_class).  Pass it back up to the invocation that
   10608             :          will deal with the virtual step. */
   10609             :       *base_class_for_virtual_step = virt_bcp;
   10610             :       if (pointer_expr_complete_object_type(local_result_node,
   10611             :                                         /*call_case=*/FALSE) == source_class) {
   10612             :         /* We have a complete object, so it is possible to go directly to the
   10613             :            virtual base class without using a pointer indirection. */
   10614             :         *complete_object = TRUE;
   10615             :         /* Keep track of whether or not the cast involves a non-zero offset. */
   10616             :         if (virt_bcp->offset != 0) any_nonzero_offset = TRUE;
   10617             :       }  /* if */
   10618             :     }  /* if */
   10619             :     /* See if we need code to preserve NULL values.  NULL is supposed to
   10620             :        pass through a derived class cast unaltered.  We can suppress the
   10621             :        special code if the expression being cast can be assumed to be
   10622             :        non-NULL or if the transformation is a do-nothing transformation
   10623             :        (the offset is zero). */
   10624             :     if (assume_expr_is_non_null) {
   10625             :       /* Caller assures us that no NULL test is necessary.  This happens
   10626             :          in cases where we're lowering a "this" parameter where we're
   10627             :          assured that "this" is non-NULL (or the call through "this" to
   10628             :          the member function would have failed). */
   10629             :       need_null_preservation_code = FALSE;
   10630             :     } else if (cannot_be_null(local_result_node)) {
   10631             :       /* The source address is known not to be NULL. */
   10632             :       need_null_preservation_code = FALSE;
   10633             :     } else if (virtual_step_class != NULL && !*complete_object) {
   10634             :       /* There is a virtual step in the casts and it cannot be optimized
   10635             :          as an offset within a complete object.  Therefore a pointer
   10636             :          indirection will be required in the sequence and the
   10637             :          NULL-preservation code is required. */
   10638             :       need_null_preservation_code = TRUE;
   10639             :     } else if (any_nonzero_offset) {
   10640             :       /* There is a nonzero offset in at least one of the casts, so the
   10641             :          sequence of casts modifies the address.  Therefore the NULL-
   10642             :          preservation code is required.  Note that if the first step
   10643             :          is an optimized virtual step, its offset and the offsets of all
   10644             :          the non-virtual steps following that are reflected in
   10645             :          any_nonzero_offset. */
   10646             :       need_null_preservation_code = TRUE;
   10647             :     } else {
   10648             :       /* The casts add up to an identity transformation, so the NULL-
   10649             :          preservation code is not needed. */
   10650             :       need_null_preservation_code = FALSE;
   10651             :     }  /* if */
   10652             :     *null_preservation_source_node = NULL;
   10653             :     if (need_null_preservation_code) {
   10654             :       /* Start the code to preserve a NULL value through the casts.
   10655             :          This involves making a reusable copy of the current source node
   10656             :          and passing it up to lower_related_class_cast which will
   10657             :          call add_null_preservation_code. */
   10658             :       *null_preservation_source_node = local_result_node;
   10659             :       local_result_node = make_reusable_copy(local_result_node,
   10660             :                                              /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   10661             :     }  /* if */
   10662             :   }  /* if */
   10663             :   /* Here, local_result_node (an rvalue pointer) points to the processed
   10664             :      version of the operand of node.  Now generate the code for this step in
   10665             :      the cast sequence. */
   10666             :   /* Refetch the source class type in case what's been returned from lower
   10667             :      levels has the class type-as-subobject instead of the class type. */
   10668             :   source_class = type_pointed_to(local_result_node->type);
   10669             :   source_class = skip_typerefs(source_class);
   10670             :   if (derived) {
   10671             :     /* The offsets in a sequence of derived casts are added together.
   10672             :        lower_related_class_cast then puts out one pointer subtraction for
   10673             :        the total.  The addition here is guaranteed not to overflow because
   10674             :        it must be within one object. */
   10675             :     *derived_class_cast_offset += bcp->offset;
   10676             :   } else if (*base_class_for_virtual_step != NULL) {
   10677             :     /* There is a virtual base class step in the sequence of casts.
   10678             :        If the present level is the level of the applicable step,
   10679             :        process the cast now.  Otherwise, do nothing, because the
   10680             :        present step is elided by the virtual step optimization. */
   10681             :     if (!handle_virtual_at_this_level) {
   10682             :       /* Do nothing; the present cast is elided. */
   10683             :     } else {
   10684             :       /* Generate the code for the virtual base class cast.  There are two
   10685             :          subcases: when the source is known to be a complete object (in
   10686             :          which case no indirection is needed), and when it is not. */
   10687             :       /* Add an indirection to get a class lvalue, then take its
   10688             :          address. */
   10689             :       local_result_node = add_indirection_to_node(local_result_node);
   10690             :       local_result_node = make_vbase_class_lvalue(local_result_node,
   10691             :                                                   *base_class_for_virtual_step,
   10692             :                                                   *complete_object);
   10693             :       local_result_node = add_address_of_to_node(local_result_node);
   10694             :       /* Now that we've dealt with the virtual hop, put things back to normal
   10695             :          for levels above this one. */
   10696             :       *base_class_for_virtual_step = NULL;
   10697             :     }  /* if */
   10698             :   } else {
   10699             :     /* Non-virtual step. */
   10700             :     /* Add an indirection to get a class lvalue, then take its address. */
   10701             :     local_result_node = add_indirection_to_node(local_result_node);
   10702             :     local_result_node = make_base_class_lvalue(local_result_node, bcp,
   10703             :                                                /*complete_object=*/FALSE);
   10704             :     local_result_node = add_address_of_to_node(local_result_node);
   10705             :   }  /* if */
   10706             :   *result_node = local_result_node;
   10707             : }  /* related_class_cast_step */
   10708             : 
   10709             : 
   10710             : static void lower_related_class_cast(an_expr_node_ptr node,
   10711             :                                      a_boolean        assume_expr_is_non_null)
   10712             : /*
   10713             : Rewrite a cast from a class to a base class or from a base class to a derived
   10714             : class.  The expression "node" can be either a class lvalue, class rvalue, or an
   10715             : rvalue pointer to a class.  The source expression under any base class casts
   10716             : is lowered by this routine.  If assume_expr_is_non_null is TRUE no
   10717             : NULL-preservation code is required.
   10718             : */
   10719             : {
   10720             :   an_expr_node_ptr null_preservation_source_node;
   10721             :   a_base_class_ptr base_class_for_virtual_step;
   10722             :   an_expr_node_ptr result_node;
   10723             :   a_targ_size_t    derived_class_cast_offset;
   10724             :   a_boolean        complete_object;
   10725             :   a_boolean        is_derived_cast = FALSE;
   10726             :   a_type_ptr       node_type = node->type;
   10727             : 
   10728             :   /* Assertion checks on inputs are performed in related_class_cast_step. */
   10729             :   /* Use a recursive routine to pick up a sequence of base-class or
   10730             :      derived-class casts and generate the code for it.  Using a recursive
   10731             :      routine allows us to (a) find the whole sequence; (b) put
   10732             :      NULL-preservation code around the whole sequence (instead of around
   10733             :      each step); (c) optimize casts to virtual base classes of complete
   10734             :      objects; (d) only look up the base class entry corresponding to
   10735             :      each step once; and (e) add all the offsets for derived-class
   10736             :      casts into a single offset. */
   10737             :   /* Note that upon return, result_node will be an rvalue pointer and needs
   10738             :      to be converted back to the same form as node. */
   10739             :   related_class_cast_step(node,
   10740             :                           /*any_nonzero_offset=*/FALSE,
   10741             :                           /*virtual_step_class=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
   10742             :                           &null_preservation_source_node,
   10743             :                           &base_class_for_virtual_step,
   10744             :                           &complete_object,
   10745             :                           &result_node,
   10746             :                           &derived_class_cast_offset,
   10747             :                           assume_expr_is_non_null);
   10748             :   if (node->variant.operation.kind ==
   10749             :                                (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_derived_class_cast) {
   10750             :     /* A cast from a base class to a derived class.  The call above collected
   10751             :        the offsets and added them together.  The total is an amount to be
   10752             :        subtracted from the pointer to the base class to get a pointer to the
   10753             :        derived class.  Generate a pointer subtraction to actually adjust
   10754             :        the pointer.  The cast back from "char *" is yet to be done below. */
   10755             :     is_derived_cast = TRUE;
   10756             :     result_node = add_decr_code_to_pointer_node(result_node,
   10757             :                                                 derived_class_cast_offset);
   10758             :   }  /* if */
   10759             :   /* Wrap the expression in NULL-preservation code if necessary. */
   10760             :   if (null_preservation_source_node != NULL) {
   10761             :     /* Add the equivalent of
   10762             :          (temp != NULL) ? expr : NULL
   10763             :        on top of the expression we have. */
   10764             :     add_null_preservation_code(result_node, null_preservation_source_node);
   10765             :   }  /* if */
   10766             :   /* The result of all the processing must overwrite the original node.
   10767             :      If a final cast is required (as for the derived-class cast case or
   10768             :      selection of a base class whose subobject type is different than
   10769             :      its normal type), add a cast. */
   10770             :   if (!is_ptr_or_ref_type(node_type)) {
   10771             :     /* For the class rvalue and class lvalue cases, add a pointer to the
   10772             :        type.  When the node is converted below, the resulting type
   10773             :        will be correct. */
   10774             :     node_type = make_pointer_type(node_type);
   10775             :   }  /* if */
   10776             :   if (!identical_types(node_type, result_node->type)) {
   10777             :     /* A final cast is needed. */
   10778             :     a_boolean saved_compiler_generated =
   10779             :                                     node->variant.operation.compiler_generated;
   10780             :     result_node = add_cast(result_node, node_type);
   10781             :     if (is_derived_cast) {
   10782             :       result_node->variant.operation.compiler_generated =
   10783             :                                                       saved_compiler_generated;
   10784             :     }  /* if */
   10785             :   }  /* if */
   10786             :   /* Convert result_node (an rvalue pointer) to the same form as the
   10787             :      original node. */
   10788             :   result_node = convert_rvalue_pointer_to_original_form(result_node, node);
   10789             :   /* Overwrite the original node with the contents of the result_node. */
   10790             :   overwrite_node(node, result_node);
   10791             : }  /* lower_related_class_cast */
   10792             : 
   10793             : 
   10794             : static void compute_pm_cast_offset(an_expr_node_ptr node,
   10795             :                                    an_expr_node_ptr *underlying_node,
   10796             :                                    a_targ_ptrdiff_t *offset)
   10797             : /*
   10798             : Compute the offset to be used to perform a related class cast on a
   10799             : pointer to member.  node is an expression node for a pointer-to-member
   10800             : related class cast.  Find the bottom of the chain of similar casts
   10801             : under node and return a pointer to the non-cast node underlying that
   10802             : chain in *underlying_node.  Return the offset from that underlying node's
   10803             : class to the class of node in *offset.
   10804             : */
   10805             : {
   10806             :   an_expr_node_ptr operand = node->variant.operation.operands;
   10807             :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
   10808             :   a_type_ptr       source_class, dest_class;
   10809             : 
   10810             :   /* See if the node under this one is a cast of the same kind.  If so,
   10811             :      it can be combined with this one. */
   10812             :   if (is_operation_node(operand) &&
   10813             :       node->variant.operation.kind == operand->variant.operation.kind) {
   10814             :     /* Use recursion to get to the bottom of the chain of similar
   10815             :        casts.  Determine the type underlying the chain and compute the
   10816             :        offset from there to here. */
   10817             :     compute_pm_cast_offset(operand, underlying_node, offset);
   10818             :   } else {
   10819             :     /* The node below this one is not another cast, so we have reached the
   10820             :        bottom of the sequence of casts. */
   10821             :     *underlying_node = operand;
   10822             :     /* Start accumulating the offset from here. */
   10823             :     *offset = 0;
   10824             :   }  /* if */
   10825             :   source_class = pm_class_type_possibly_lowered(operand->type);
   10826             :   dest_class = pm_class_type_possibly_lowered(node->type);
   10827             :   prelower_class_type(source_class);
   10828             :   prelower_class_type(dest_class);
   10829             :   if (node->variant.operation.kind ==
   10830             :                                (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_pm_base_class_cast) {
   10831             :     /* Casting from a derived class to a base class. */
   10832             :     bcp = find_direct_or_virtual_base_class_of(source_class, dest_class);
   10833             :     if (bcp->is_virtual) {
   10834             :       /* For a virtual base class skip, assume that we have a whole object
   10835             :          and compute the offset from there.  The C++ language should probably
   10836             :          prohibit casts like this, because they cannot be implemented with a
   10837             :          simple offset. */
   10838             :       source_class = pm_class_type_possibly_lowered((*underlying_node)->type);
   10839             :       bcp = find_virtual_base_class_of(source_class, dest_class);
   10840             :       *offset = -(a_targ_ptrdiff_t)(bcp->offset);
   10841             :     } else {
   10842             :       /* Non-virtual base class.  Subtract the offset from the running
   10843             :          total. */
   10844             :       *offset -= bcp->offset;
   10845             :     }  /* if */
   10846             :   } else {
   10847             :     /* Casting from a base class to a derived class. */
   10848             :     bcp = find_direct_or_virtual_base_class_of(dest_class, source_class);
   10849             : #if CHECKING
   10850             :     if (bcp->is_virtual) {
   10851             :       internal_error("compute_pm_cast_offset: derived class is virtual");
   10852             :     }  /* if */
   10853             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   10854             :     /* Add the offset to the running total. */
   10855             :     *offset += bcp->offset;
   10856             :   }  /* if */
   10857             : }  /* compute_pm_cast_offset */
   10858             : 
   10859             : 
   10860             : static void lower_pm_related_class_cast(an_expr_node_ptr node)
   10861             : /*
   10862             : Rewrite a cast from a pointer to a member of a class to a pointer to a member
   10863             : of a base or derived class of that class.
   10864             : */
   10865             : {
   10866             :   an_expr_node_ptr source_node, question_node, test_node, plus_node;
   10867             :   an_expr_node_ptr offset_node, temp_node;
   10868             : #if IA64_ABI
   10869             :   an_expr_node_ptr test2_node;
   10870             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10871             :   an_expr_node_ptr select_d_node, incr_node, assign_node, comma_node;
   10872             :   a_constant_ptr   offset_constant = local_constant();
   10873             :   a_targ_ptrdiff_t offset;
   10874             :   a_variable_ptr   temp_var;
   10875             :   a_type_ptr       dest_type = node->type;
   10876             :   a_type_ptr       class_type = pm_class_type_possibly_lowered(dest_type);
   10877             :   an_expr_operator_kind
   10878             :                    op;
   10879             : 
   10880             :   /* Use recursion to find a chain of similar casts and compute the overall
   10881             :      class offset for the chain. */
   10882             :   compute_pm_cast_offset(node, &source_node, &offset);
   10883             :   /* Lower the underlying subtree. */
   10884             :   lower_expr(source_node);
   10885             :   if (offset == 0) {
   10886             :     /* When the offset is zero no cast is needed.  Overwrite the original
   10887             :        node with the underlying node. */
   10888             :     overwrite_node(node, source_node);
   10889             :     node->type = dest_type;
   10890             :   } else {
   10891             :     /* The offset is non-zero, so some work is needed. */
   10892             :     if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(dest_type)) {
   10893             :       /* Pointer to member function.  Change the node to
   10894             :            (temp = pmf, temp.i ? temp.d += offset : 0, temp)
   10895             :          The IA-64 version is
   10896             :            (temp = pmf, temp.f ? temp.d += offset : 0, temp)
   10897             :          normally, and
   10898             :            (temp = pmf, (temp.f || temp.d) ? temp.d += offset : 0, temp)
   10899             :          for the variant of the ABI for architectures where the address
   10900             :          of a function might have a low-order bit of 1.
   10901             :       */
   10902             :       /* Make sure __mptr (the struct that represents lowered pointers to
   10903             :          member functions) has been created. */
   10904             :       (void)make_mptr_type();
   10905             :       /* Create the temporary. */
   10906             :       temp_var = make_local_temporary(source_node->type);
   10907             :       /* Make a "temp" lvalue. */
   10908             :       temp_node = var_lvalue_expr(temp_var);
   10909             : #if !IA64_ABI
   10910             :       /* Make the temp.i boolean controlling expression. */
   10911             :       test_node = field_rvalue_selection_expr(temp_node, mptr_i_field);
   10912             :       test_node = boolean_controlling_expr(test_node);
   10913             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   10914             :       /* Make (temp.f || temp.d). */
   10915             :       test_node = field_rvalue_selection_expr(temp_node, mptr_f_field);
   10916             :       test_node = boolean_controlling_expr(test_node);
   10917             :       temp_node = var_lvalue_expr(temp_var);
   10918             :       test2_node = field_rvalue_selection_expr(temp_node, mptr_d_field);
   10919             :       test_node->next = boolean_controlling_expr(test2_node);
   10920             :       test_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lor,
   10921             :                                      integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   10922             :                                      test_node);
   10923             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10924             :       /* Make "temp.d += offset". */
   10925             :       temp_node = var_lvalue_expr(temp_var);
   10926             :       select_d_node = field_lvalue_selection_expr(temp_node, mptr_d_field);
   10927             :       /* Make a node for the offset constant. */
   10928             : #if IA64_ABI
   10929             :       if (targ_ia64_abi_use_variant_ptr_to_member_function_repr) {
   10930             :         /* The low-order bit of the "d" field is used to indicate whether or
   10931             :            not the function is virtual, so shift over the offset.  This is for
   10932             :            the variant of the ABI for architectures where the address of a
   10933             :            function might have a low-order bit of 1. */
   10934             :         offset <<= 1;
   10935             :       }  /* if */
   10936             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10937             :       set_delta_constant(offset, offset_constant, class_type);
   10938             :       promote_integer_constant(offset_constant);
   10939             :       offset_node = alloc_node_for_constant(offset_constant);
   10940             :       select_d_node->next = offset_node;
   10941             :       incr_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_add_assign,
   10942             :                                      mptr_d_field->type, select_d_node);
   10943             :       /* Make "temp.i ? temp.d += offset : 0". */
   10944             :       test_node->next = incr_node;
   10945             :       incr_node->next = node_for_integer_constant(0L, targ_delta_int_kind);
   10946             :       question_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question,
   10947             :                                          incr_node->type, test_node);
   10948             :       /* Make "temp = pmf". */
   10949             :       assign_node = make_var_assignment_expr(temp_var, source_node);
   10950             :       /* Make "(temp = pmf, temp.i ? temp.d += offset : 0)". */
   10951             :       comma_node = make_comma_node(assign_node, question_node);
   10952             :       /* Overwrite the original node with a "," operator to make the
   10953             :          full expression. */
   10954             :       comma_node->next = var_rvalue_expr(temp_var);
   10955             :       /* Note the use of dest_type here to ensure that information on the
   10956             :          original pointer-to-member-function type is available in case
   10957             :          there is an eok_dot_pm_call or eok_points_to_pm_call operation
   10958             :          above this one. */
   10959             :       set_node_operator(node, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   10960             :                         dest_type, node->is_lvalue, comma_node);
   10961             :     } else {
   10962             :       /* Pointer to data member.  Change the node to
   10963             :            (pdm != 0) ? pdm + offset : 0
   10964             :          In the IA-64 ABI, use -1 instead of 0 in both places (NULL is
   10965             :          represented as -1).
   10966             :       */
   10967             :       a_type_ptr pm_type = source_node->type;
   10968             :       /* Make "pdm != 0" (for the IA-64 ABI, -1 is used instead). */
   10969             :       if (!targ_ptr_to_data_member_is_promoted_integral_type()) {
   10970             :         source_node = integral_promote_pm_node(source_node);
   10971             :       }  /* if */
   10972             :       source_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(
   10973             : #if !IA64_ABI
   10974             :                                              0L,
   10975             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   10976             :                                              -1L,
   10977             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   10978             :                                              targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind);
   10979             :       test_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne,
   10980             :                                      integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   10981             :                                      source_node);
   10982             :       /* Make "pdm + offset". */
   10983             :       source_node = make_reusable_copy(source_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   10984             :       /* If the offset is negative, subtract it instead of adding. */
   10985             :       if (offset >= 0) {
   10986             :         op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_add;
   10987             :       } else {
   10988             :         op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract;
   10989             :         offset = -offset;
   10990             :       }  /* if */
   10991             :       /* Make a node for the offset constant. */
   10992             :       set_unsigned_integer_constant_with_overflow_check(
   10993             :                                     offset_constant,
   10994             :                                     (a_host_large_unsigned)offset,
   10995             :                                     targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind,
   10996             :                                     class_type,
   10997             :                                     /*preserve_needed_flag=*/FALSE);
   10998             :       if (!targ_ptr_to_data_member_is_promoted_integral_type()) {
   10999             :         promote_integer_constant(offset_constant);
   11000             :       }  /* if */
   11001             :       offset_node = alloc_node_for_constant(offset_constant);
   11002             :       source_node->next = offset_node;
   11003             :       plus_node = make_operator_node(op, source_node->type, source_node);
   11004             :       /* Cast back to the pointer to member type if it is an unpromoted
   11005             :          type. */
   11006             :       if (!targ_ptr_to_data_member_is_promoted_integral_type()) {
   11007             :         plus_node = add_cast(plus_node, pm_type);
   11008             :       }  /* if */
   11009             :       /* Make the "?" operation by overwriting the original node. */
   11010             :       test_node->next = plus_node;
   11011             :       plus_node->next = node_for_integer_constant(
   11012             : #if !IA64_ABI 
   11013             :                                                   0L,
   11014             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   11015             :                                                   -1L,
   11016             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11017             :                                              targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind);
   11018             :       set_node_operator(node, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question,
   11019             :                         dest_type, node->is_lvalue, test_node);
   11020             :     }  /* if */
   11021             :   }  /* if */
   11022             :   release_local_constant(&offset_constant);
   11023             : }  /* lower_pm_related_class_cast */
   11024             : 
   11025             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   11026             : 
   11027             : /*
   11028             : Routine entries for the runtime routines __dynamic_cast and __dynamic_cast_ref,
   11029             : once created.  NULL until then.
   11030             : */
   11031             : static a_routine_ptr
   11032             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11033             :                 dynamic_cast_ref_routine,
   11034             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   11035             :                 bad_cast_routine,
   11036             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11037             :                 dynamic_cast_routine;
   11038             : 
   11039             : 
   11040             : void lower_dynamic_cast(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11041             : /*
   11042             : Lower an eok_dynamic_cast or eok_ref_dynamic_cast expression.  The subtree
   11043             : has already been lowered.
   11044             : */
   11045             : {
   11046             :   an_expr_node_ptr src = expr->variant.operation.operands, src_copy;
   11047             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11048             :   an_expr_node_ptr orig_src_copy, vptr_expr;
   11049             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   11050             :   an_expr_node_ptr hint_expr;
   11051             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11052             :   an_expr_node_ptr null_constant_node, test_node = NULL;
   11053             :   an_expr_node_ptr desired_type_node, static_type_node, call_node;
   11054             :   a_type_ptr       cast_type, src_type, ptr_type;
   11055             :   a_constant_ptr   constant = local_constant();
   11056             :   a_boolean        reference_case = node_operator_is(expr,
   11057             :                                                      eok_ref_dynamic_cast);
   11058             : 
   11059             :   /* Rewrite the dynamic cast as
   11060             : #if IA64_ABI
   11061             :        src ?   __dynamic_cast(src, static_type, desired_type, hint) : NULL
   11062             :      or
   11063             :        (temp = __dynamic_cast(src, static_type, desired_type, hint))
   11064             :            ? temp : __cxa_bad_cast()
   11065             : #else // !IA64_ABI
   11066             :        src ? __dynamic_cast    (src, vptr, desired_type, orig_src, static_type)
   11067             :                      : NULL
   11068             :      or
   11069             :        src ? __dynamic_cast_ref(src, vptr, desired_type, orig_src, static_type)
   11070             :                      : NULL
   11071             : #endif // !IA64_ABI
   11072             :      The second form is for a cast to a reference type.  src is the
   11073             :      expression being cast (or its address, in the reference case); vptr
   11074             :      is the virtual function pointer for the class (note that it's protected
   11075             :      by the null-pointer check); desired_type is a pointer to the
   11076             :      typeinfo for the desired class, or NULL for a dynamic cast to "void *";
   11077             :      orig_src is the original source pointer in the dynamic_cast (the "src"
   11078             :      expression might have been cast to a base class if the original class
   11079             :      has no virtual function pointer); static_type is a pointer to the
   11080             :      typeinfo for the class underlying the static type of the original
   11081             :      type of the source pointer. */
   11082             :   cast_type = expr->type;
   11083             :   src_type = src->type;
   11084             :   if (reference_case) {
   11085             :     ptr_type = make_pointer_type(cast_type);
   11086             :   } else {
   11087             :     check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   11088             :     ptr_type = cast_type;
   11089             :     cast_type = type_pointed_to(cast_type);
   11090             :     src_type = type_pointed_to(src_type);
   11091             :   }  /* if */
   11092             :   cast_type = skip_typerefs(cast_type);
   11093             :   src_type = skip_typerefs(src_type);
   11094             :   /* Make the src argument for the call. */
   11095             :   if (reference_case) {
   11096             :     /* Convert the lvalue operand to a pointer. */
   11097             :     src = add_address_of_to_node(src);
   11098             :   }  /* if */
   11099             :   /* A copy is needed (because the expression is used twice) except
   11100             :      in the IA-64 reference case.  (A third copy is made below
   11101             :      for the orig_src_copy argument.) */
   11102             : #if IA64_ABI
   11103             :   if (reference_case) {
   11104             :     src_copy = src;
   11105             :   } else
   11106             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11107             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
   11108             :   {
   11109             :     src_copy = make_reusable_copy(src, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11110             :   }  /* if */
   11111             : #if IA64_ABI
   11112             :   /* For a dynamic_cast to `void *', we don't call __dynamic_cast.
   11113             :      Instead, we simply extract the offset-to-top field from the
   11114             :      vtable, and adjust the pointer. */
   11115             :   if (is_void_type(cast_type)) {
   11116             :     an_expr_node_ptr offset_to_top_node, vtbl_class;
   11117             :     /* Extract the offset to top node. */
   11118             :     vtbl_class = make_reusable_copy(src_copy, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11119             :     /* De-reference a pointer type (if any) to get an lvalue class type. */
   11120             :     if (is_pointer_type(vtbl_class->type)) {
   11121             :       vtbl_class = add_indirection_to_node(vtbl_class);
   11122             :     }  /* if */
   11123             :     offset_to_top_node = make_vtbl_entry_expr(vtbl_class, 
   11124             :                                               (a_virtual_table_index)-2L);
   11125             :     /* Cast the original pointer to `char *' to avoid scaling when
   11126             :        performing pointer arithmetic. */
   11127             :     src_copy = add_cast_to_char_star(src_copy);
   11128             :     src_copy->next = offset_to_top_node;
   11129             :     /* Make the addition node. */
   11130             :     call_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   11131             :                                    char_star_type(),
   11132             :                                    src_copy);
   11133             :   } else
   11134             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11135             :   /* Do not add code here. */
   11136             :   {
   11137             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11138             :     /* Make the vptr argument (the virtual function table pointer). */
   11139             :     vptr_expr = make_reusable_copy(src, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11140             :     /* src_copy is passed in so it can be cast to a base class if necessary. */
   11141             :     vptr_expr = make_any_vptr_rvalue(vptr_expr, &src_copy);
   11142             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11143             :     src_copy = add_cast(src_copy, void_star_type());
   11144             :     /* Make the desired_type argument. */
   11145             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11146             :     if (!reference_case && is_void_type(cast_type)) {
   11147             :       /* Cast to void* -- pass a null pointer for desired_type. */
   11148             :       make_zero_of_proper_type(make_pointer_type(make_typeinfo_type(
   11149             :                                                            tik_implementation,
   11150             :                                                            (a_type_ptr)NULL)),
   11151             :                                constant);
   11152             :     } else 
   11153             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11154             :     {
   11155             :       /* Get the typeinfo variable for the desired type. */
   11156             :       a_variable_ptr var = get_typeinfo_var(cast_type);
   11157             :       /* Pass its address as the desired_type argument. */
   11158             :       set_variable_address_constant(var, constant,
   11159             :                                     /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
   11160             :     }  /* if */
   11161             :     desired_type_node = alloc_node_for_constant(constant);
   11162             :     desired_type_node = add_cast(desired_type_node,
   11163             :                                  make_runtime_typeinfo_type());
   11164             : #if ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241
   11165             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11166             :     /* Make the pointer to the original source.  This may differ from the
   11167             :        src_copy argument in not being cast to a base class containing a
   11168             :        virtual function table. */
   11169             :     orig_src_copy = make_reusable_copy(src, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11170             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11171             :     /* Make the static_type argument. */
   11172             :     set_variable_address_constant(get_typeinfo_var(src_type),
   11173             :                                   constant,
   11174             :                                   /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
   11175             :     static_type_node = alloc_node_for_constant(constant);
   11176             :     static_type_node = add_cast(static_type_node,
   11177             :                                 make_runtime_typeinfo_type());
   11178             : #endif /* ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241 */
   11179             : #if IA64_ABI
   11180             :     /* Make the hint argument.  We use -1 as the hint value, which is
   11181             :        conservative: that gives the runtime no information about the
   11182             :        inheritance relationship between the static type and the desired
   11183             :        type. */
   11184             :     hint_expr = node_for_integer_constant(-1L, targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   11185             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11186             :     /* Link the arguments together. */
   11187             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11188             :     src_copy->next = vptr_expr;
   11189             :     vptr_expr->next = desired_type_node;
   11190             : #if ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241
   11191             :     orig_src_copy = add_cast(orig_src_copy, void_star_type());
   11192             :     desired_type_node->next = orig_src_copy;
   11193             :     orig_src_copy->next = static_type_node;
   11194             : #endif /* ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241 */
   11195             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   11196             :     src_copy->next = static_type_node;
   11197             :     static_type_node->next = desired_type_node;
   11198             :     desired_type_node->next = hint_expr;
   11199             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11200             :     /* Generate the proper call. */
   11201             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11202             :     if (reference_case) {
   11203             :       a_type_ptr param3_type = NULL, param4_type = NULL;
   11204             : #if ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241
   11205             :       param3_type = void_star_type();
   11206             :       param4_type = static_type_node->type;
   11207             : #endif /* ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241 */
   11208             :       call_node = make_prototyped_runtime_call_full("__dynamic_cast_ref",
   11209             :                                                     &dynamic_cast_ref_routine,
   11210             :                                                     void_star_type(),
   11211             :                                                     void_star_type(),
   11212             :                                                     pointer_to_vtbl_type(),
   11213             :                                                     desired_type_node->type,
   11214             :                                                     param3_type, param4_type,
   11215             :                                                     NULL, NULL, src_copy);
   11216             :     } else 
   11217             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11218             :     /* Do not add code here. */
   11219             :     {
   11220             :       a_type_ptr param2_type, param3_type, param4_type = NULL;
   11221             :       a_type_ptr param5_type = NULL;
   11222             : #if IA64_ABI
   11223             :       param2_type = make_runtime_typeinfo_type();
   11224             :       param3_type = make_runtime_typeinfo_type();
   11225             :       param4_type = integer_type(targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   11226             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   11227             :       param2_type = pointer_to_vtbl_type();
   11228             :       param3_type = make_runtime_typeinfo_type();
   11229             : #if ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241
   11230             :       param4_type = void_star_type();
   11231             :       param5_type = make_runtime_typeinfo_type();
   11232             : #endif /* ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION >= 241 */
   11233             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11234             :       call_node = make_prototyped_runtime_call_full("__dynamic_cast",
   11235             :                                                     &dynamic_cast_routine,
   11236             :                                                     void_star_type(),
   11237             :                                                     void_star_type(),
   11238             :                                                     param2_type, param3_type,
   11239             :                                                     param4_type, param5_type,
   11240             :                                                     NULL, NULL, src_copy);
   11241             :     }  /* if */
   11242             : #if IA64_ABI
   11243             :     if (reference_case) {
   11244             :       /* IA-64 ABI reference cast case, which calls __cxa_bad_cast if the
   11245             :          pointer is NULL. */
   11246             :       an_expr_node_ptr call_copy, bad_cast_node;
   11247             :       /* Create a temporary to store the result of the call. */
   11248             :       call_copy = make_reusable_copy(call_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11249             :       call_copy = add_cast_if_necessary(call_copy, ptr_type);
   11250             :       /* Build "__cxa_bad_cast()" */
   11251             :       bad_cast_node = make_prototyped_runtime_call("__cxa_bad_cast",
   11252             :                                              &bad_cast_routine,
   11253             :                                              void_type(),
   11254             :                                              NULL, NULL,
   11255             :                                              (an_expr_node_ptr)NULL);
   11256             :       make_zero_of_proper_type(ptr_type, constant);
   11257             :       bad_cast_node = make_comma_node(bad_cast_node,
   11258             :                                       alloc_node_for_constant(constant));
   11259             :       /* Build the operands for the "?". */
   11260             :       test_node = boolean_controlling_expr(call_node);
   11261             :       test_node->next = call_copy;
   11262             :       call_copy->next = bad_cast_node;
   11263             :     }  /* if */
   11264             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11265             :   }  /* if */
   11266             : #if IA64_ABI
   11267             :   if (!reference_case)
   11268             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11269             :   /* Do not add code here. */
   11270             :   {
   11271             :     /* Add a cast to the right type (from the void* return of the runtime
   11272             :        routine). */
   11273             :     call_node = add_cast_if_necessary(call_node, ptr_type);
   11274             :     /* Make the NULL for the third operand of the "?". */
   11275             :     make_zero_of_proper_type(ptr_type, constant);
   11276             :     null_constant_node = alloc_node_for_constant(constant);
   11277             :     /* Assemble the operands for the "?". */
   11278             :     test_node = boolean_controlling_expr(src);
   11279             :     test_node->next = call_node;
   11280             :     call_node->next = null_constant_node;
   11281             :   }  /* if */
   11282             :   /* Make "src ? __dynamic_cast(...) : NULL". */
   11283             :   test_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question,
   11284             :                                  ptr_type, test_node);
   11285             :   if (reference_case) {
   11286             :     test_node = add_indirection_to_node(test_node);
   11287             :     if (!expr->is_lvalue) {
   11288             :       /* Convert to an rvalue if the original expression is an rvalue. */
   11289             :       test_node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(test_node);
   11290             :     }  /* if */
   11291             :   }  /* if */
   11292             :   /* Overwrite the original node with the rewritten version. */
   11293             :   overwrite_node(expr, test_node);
   11294             :   release_local_constant(&constant);
   11295             : }  /* lower_dynamic_cast */
   11296             : 
   11297             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   11298             : 
   11299             : static void change_result_type_of_operator_returning_bool(
   11300             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11301             : /*
   11302             : If expr points to an expression whose operator returns "bool" in C++ but
   11303             : "int" in C (e.g., "!="), add a cast on top of the expression to
   11304             : make it return bool.  However, if adjust_bool_operation_types has
   11305             : noted that this case can be optimized (by setting the type to "int"
   11306             : already), do nothing.
   11307             : */
   11308             : {
   11309             :   if (bool_is_keyword &&
   11310             :       is_operation_node(expr) &&
   11311             :       is_operator_returning_bool(expr->variant.operation.kind)) {
