   11312             :     if (is_bool_type(expr->type)) {
   11313             :       an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy = copy_node(expr);
   11314             :       expr_copy->type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   11315             :       change_to_cast(expr, expr_copy, expr->type);
   11316             :     }  /* if */
   11317             :   }  /* if */
   11318             : }  /* change_result_type_of_operator_returning_bool */
   11319             : 
   11320             : 
   11321             : static an_expr_node_ptr expr_for_nullptr_type(a_type_ptr       type,
   11322             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11323             : /*
   11324             : Returns an expression of the specified type that can be used as a
   11325             : replacement for the input expression (an rvalue).  The input expression is
   11326             : either an expression having a nullptr type or one that has been cast to a
   11327             : nullptr type.  The returned expression yields a nullptr value that is cast
   11328             : to the specified type (if needed).  Typically the returned expression is
   11329             : simply a constant zero of the specified type, but can also be something
   11330             : more complicated (e.g., when the type is a pointer to member type), and can
   11331             : also contain the original expression as the first operand of a comma
   11332             : operation in cases where the expression has side effects.  The expression
   11333             : has typically been previously lowered (and is not lowered by this routine).
   11334             : */
   11335             : {
   11336             :   a_constant_ptr   zero_constant;
   11337             :   an_expr_node_ptr zero_node;
   11338             : 
   11339             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   11340             :   zero_constant = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
   11341             :   if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(type) ||
   11342             :       is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(type)) {
   11343             :     /* Pointer to member types may (if in the file scope) or may not (if
   11344             :        in a function scope) have been lowered.  We need the unlowered type
   11345             :        in order to generate the appropriate constant, but the constant can't
   11346             :        have the unlowered type, so overwrite it with the original type
   11347             :        we were given. */
   11348             :     make_zero_of_proper_type(get_underlying_type(type), zero_constant);
   11349             :     lower_ptr_to_member_constant(zero_constant);
   11350             :     zero_constant->type = type;
   11351             :     /* Note that the constant created here is a "troublesome aggregate
   11352             :        constant", and as such will be replaced by a variable when the
   11353             :        expression node is created below. */
   11354             :   } else {
   11355             :     /* Create a zero of std::nullptr type for the value of the expression. */
   11356             :     make_zero_of_proper_type(standard_nullptr_type(), zero_constant);
   11357             :     lower_constant(zero_constant);
   11358             :   }  /* if */
   11359             :   zero_node = make_node_for_il_constant(zero_constant);
   11360             :   check_assertion(!zero_node->is_lvalue);
   11361             :   /* Add a cast to the desired type. */
   11362             :   zero_node = add_cast_if_necessary(zero_node, type);
   11363             :   if (node_has_side_effects(expr, (a_boolean *)NULL)) {
   11364             :     zero_node = make_comma_node(copy_node(expr), zero_node);
   11365             :   }  /* if */
   11366             :   return zero_node;
   11367             : }  /* expr_for_nullptr_type */
   11368             : 
   11369             : 
   11370             : void lower_bool_cast(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11371             : /*
   11372             : Lower an eok_bool_cast node, which converts an operand to bool.
   11373             : */
   11374             : {
   11375             :   an_expr_node_ptr      operand = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   11376             :   a_type_ptr            result_type, orig_type = expr->type;
   11377             : 
   11378             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   11379             :   if (is_or_was_nullptr_type(operand->type)) {
   11380             :     /* The operand had a nullptr type in the unlowered IL so the result of
   11381             :        the cast will always be false; change the eok_bool_cast to an
   11382             :        expression that will return a zero of the proper type (preserving
   11383             :        the original expression if it has any side effects). */
   11384             :     overwrite_node(expr, expr_for_nullptr_type(orig_type, operand));
   11385             :   } else {
   11386             :     /* A cast to bool in C++ or C99 is rewritten as a "!= 0" test in C89. */
   11387             :     operand = make_operands_for_ne_0(operand);
   11388             :     result_type = expr->type;
   11389             :     if (C_mode()) {
   11390             :       /* In C99, the result type of the comparison is "int".  A cast will
   11391             :          have to be added later, because we really want a "bool" result. */
   11392             :       result_type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   11393             :     }  /* if */
   11394             :     set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne, result_type,
   11395             :                       /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE, operand);
   11396             :     lower_ne_0_normalization(expr);
   11397             :     if (!identical_types(expr->type, orig_type)) {
   11398             :       /* Add a final cast to bool, because that's what we really need. */
   11399             :       an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy = copy_node(expr);
   11400             :       change_to_cast(expr, expr_copy, orig_type);
   11401             :     }  /* if */
   11402             :   }  /* if */
   11403             : }  /* lower_bool_cast */
   11404             : 
   11405             : 
   11406             : void lower_bool_incr_decr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11407             : /*
   11408             : Rewrite an increment of a bool (eok_post_incr or eok_pre_incr).
   11409             : Those operations set the lvalue to true instead of incrementing.
   11410             : For C99 mode, also handles decrement of a bool, which sets the
   11411             : lvalue to its logical "not".
   11412             : */
   11413             : {
   11414             :   an_expr_node_ptr operand_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   11415             :   an_expr_node_ptr result_value_node;
   11416             :   a_constant_ptr   result_constant = local_constant();
   11417             : 
   11418             :   if (expr->variant.operation.kind == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_pre_incr ||
   11419             :       (expr->variant.operation.kind == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_post_incr &&
   11420             :        expr->result_is_not_used)) {
   11421             :     /* Preincrement: ++x becomes (x = 1).  Also used for postincrement
   11422             :        when result is not used. */
   11423             :     /* Build a constant one, but make sure it has bool type to preserve
   11424             :        bool-correctness in the IL for back ends that care. */
   11425             :     /* Expression can be an lvalue or an rvalue. */
   11426             :     set_integer_constant(result_constant,
   11427             :                          (a_host_large_integer)1,
   11428             :                          BOOL_INT_KIND);
   11429             :     result_constant->type = bool_type();
   11430             :     result_value_node = alloc_node_for_constant(result_constant);
   11431             :     operand_node->next = result_value_node;
   11432             :     set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   11433             :                       expr->type, expr->is_lvalue, operand_node);
   11434             :   } else {
   11435             :     /* Postincrement: x++ becomes (temp = x, (x = 1, temp)).
   11436             :        Postdecrement: x-- becomes (temp = x, (x = !temp, temp)).
   11437             :        Predecrement:  --x becomes (temp = x, x = !temp).
   11438             :        Decrement follows the C99 requirement; it's not valid in C++. */
   11439             : 
   11440             :     an_expr_node_ptr x_lvalue_copy =
   11441             :                           make_lvalue_reusable_copy(operand_node,
   11442             :                                                     /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11443             :     an_expr_node_ptr x_rvalue = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(operand_node);
   11444             :     an_expr_node_ptr x_rvalue_copy =
   11445             :                                   make_reusable_copy(x_rvalue,
   11446             :                                                      /*vars_can_change=*/TRUE);
   11447             :     an_expr_node_ptr assign_node, comma_node;
   11448             :     a_boolean        predecr_case = (expr->variant.operation.kind ==
   11449             :                                           (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_pre_decr);
   11450             : 
   11451             :     /* Expression can only be an rvalue. */
   11452             :     check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   11453             :     if (expr->variant.operation.kind == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_post_incr){
   11454             :       /* Increment. */
   11455             :       /* Build a constant one, but make sure it has bool type to preserve
   11456             :          bool-correctness in the IL for back ends that care. */
   11457             :       set_integer_constant(result_constant,
   11458             :                            (a_host_large_integer)1,
   11459             :                            BOOL_INT_KIND);
   11460             :       result_constant->type = bool_type();
   11461             :       result_value_node = alloc_node_for_constant(result_constant);
   11462             :     } else {
   11463             :       /* Decrement.  Build !temp. */
   11464             :       result_value_node = make_operator_node(
   11465             :                                       (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_not,
   11466             :                                       integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   11467             :                                       boolean_controlling_expr(x_rvalue_copy));
   11468             :       result_value_node = add_cast(result_value_node, x_rvalue->type);
   11469             :       if (!predecr_case) {
   11470             :         x_rvalue_copy = make_reusable_copy(x_rvalue, /*vars_can_change=*/TRUE);
   11471             :       } /* if */
   11472             :     }  /* if */
   11473             :     /* Make the assignment: (x = 1) or (x = !temp). */
   11474             :     x_lvalue_copy->next = result_value_node;
   11475             :     assign_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   11476             :                                      x_rvalue->type, x_lvalue_copy);
   11477             :     if (!predecr_case) {
   11478             :       comma_node = make_comma_node(x_rvalue, assign_node);
   11479             :       /* Change the original expression into a comma node whose second
   11480             :          operand is the overall result. */
   11481             :       comma_node->next = x_rvalue_copy;
   11482             :       set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   11483             :                         x_rvalue_copy->type, /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE, comma_node);
   11484             :     } else {
   11485             :       /* The prefix case: change the original expression into a
   11486             :          comma node where the second operand is the assignment. */
   11487             :       x_rvalue->next = assign_node;
   11488             :       set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   11489             :                         assign_node->type, /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE, x_rvalue);
   11490             :     }  /* if */
   11491             :   }  /* if */
   11492             :   release_local_constant(&result_constant);
   11493             : }  /* lower_bool_incr_decr */                  
   11494             : 
   11495             : 
   11496             : static an_expr_operator_kind corresponding_operator_for_compound_assignment(
   11497             :                                                       an_expr_operator_kind op)
   11498             : /*
   11499             : op is a compound assignment operator.  Return the corresponding simple
   11500             : operator.  For example, eok_add_assign is translated to eok_add.
   11501             : */
   11502             : {
   11503             :   switch (op) {
   11504             :     case eok_add_assign:
   11505             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_add;
   11506             :       break;
   11507             :     case eok_subtract_assign:
   11508             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract;
   11509             :       break;
   11510             :     case eok_multiply_assign:
   11511             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_multiply;
   11512             :       break;
   11513             :     case eok_divide_assign:
   11514             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_divide;
   11515             :       break;
   11516             :     case eok_remainder_assign:
   11517             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_remainder;
   11518             :       break;
   11519             :     case eok_shiftl_assign:
   11520             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_shiftl;
   11521             :       break;
   11522             :     case eok_shiftr_assign:
   11523             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_shiftr;
   11524             :       break;
   11525             :     case eok_and_assign:
   11526             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_and;
   11527             :       break;
   11528             :     case eok_or_assign:
   11529             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_or;
   11530             :       break;
   11531             :     case eok_xor_assign:
   11532             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_xor;
   11533             :       break;
   11534             :     case eok_padd_assign:
   11535             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd;
   11536             :       break;
   11537             :     case eok_psubtract_assign:
   11538             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_psubtract;
   11539             :       break;
   11540             :     default:
   11541             :       unexpected_condition_str(
   11542             :                "corresponding_operator_for_compound_assignment: bad operator");
   11543             :   }  /* switch */
   11544             :   return op;
   11545             : }  /* corresponding_operator_for_compound_assignment */
   11546             : 
   11547             : 
   11548             : void rewrite_compound_assignment(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11549             : /*
   11550             : Rewrite a compound assignment x @= y as x = x @ y.  If x has side effects,
   11551             : a temporary will be used, and the code will be something like
   11552             : (temp = &x, *temp = *temp @ y).
   11553             : */
   11554             : {
   11555             :   an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   11556             :   an_expr_node_ptr      op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   11557             :   an_expr_node_ptr      op2 = op1->next;
   11558             :   a_boolean             vars_can_change;
   11559             :   an_expr_node_ptr      op1_for_operation, op1_for_assign, op_node, op2_node;
   11560             :   a_variable_ptr        temp_var = NULL;
   11561             :   a_boolean             temp_init_used;
   11562             :   a_type_ptr            result_type = prvalue_type(op1->type);
   11563             :   a_type_ptr            operation_type;
   11564             :   a_boolean             swap_operands = FALSE;
   11565             :   a_boolean             result_is_lvalue = expr->variant.operation.
   11566             :                                         returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue;
   11567             : 
   11568             :   check_assertion(result_is_lvalue == expr->is_lvalue);
   11569             :   /* Determine the operation type, which is usually the second operand
   11570             :      type. */
   11571             :   operation_type = compound_assignment_operation_type(expr);
   11572             :   /* Make a copy of op1 to be used as the left operand of the underlying
   11573             :      operation.  op1 itself will be used as the left operand of the
   11574             :      assignment. */ 
   11575             :   op1->next = NULL;
   11576             :   vars_can_change = node_has_side_effects(op2, (a_boolean *)NULL);
   11577             :   op1_for_operation = make_lvalue_reusable_copy_full(op1, vars_can_change,
   11578             :                                                      &temp_init_used);
   11579             :   op1_for_assign = op1;
   11580             :   if (temp_init_used) {
   11581             :     /* op1 is complex and was assigned to a temporary.  Make sure that
   11582             :        the temporary is initialized before it is used by doing the
   11583             :        overall rewrite of
   11584             :          x @= y
   11585             :        as
   11586             :          ((temp = *(t = &x) @ y), *t = temp)
   11587             :        Note: The seemingly more straightforward
   11588             :          (t = &x, *t = *t @ y)
   11589             :        does not work as well if x is a "?" expression using bit fields, as in
   11590             :          (i ? f()->b1 : g()->b2) += 3;
   11591             :        because you can't save a single address temporary for that (the
   11592             :        parts up to the bit field references have different types) and if you
   11593             :        save multiple temporaries you have to be sure to initialize only those
   11594             :        from the executed part of the "?".  It's easier to go with the above
   11595             :        rewrite scheme, which allows the temporary initializations to stay
   11596             :        in their original context as part of an evaluation of the expression. */
   11597             :     temp_var = make_local_temporary(result_type);
   11598             :     op1_for_assign = var_lvalue_expr(temp_var);
   11599             :     /* Swap op1 and op1_for_operation so that the original node (the one
   11600             :        that now has the initialization of the temporary) is
   11601             :        op1_for_operation, because that will be used first. */
   11602             :     op_node = op1_for_operation;
   11603             :     op1_for_operation = op1;
   11604             :     op1 = op_node;
   11605             :   }  /* if */
   11606             :   /* op1_for_operation is used as an rvalue. */
   11607             :   op1_for_operation = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(op1_for_operation);
   11608             :   if (is_bool_type(op1_for_operation->type) &&
   11609             :       is_pointer_type(op2->type)) {
   11610             :     /* For the C++ bool += pointer case, do not change the operand types,
   11611             :        but do swap the operands so the pointer is first on the "+". */
   11612             :     swap_operands = TRUE;
   11613             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   11614             :   } else if (is_imaginary_type(operation_type)) {
   11615             :     if ((op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_multiply_assign ||
   11616             :          op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_divide_assign) &&
   11617             :         is_imaginary_type(op1_for_operation->type)) {
   11618             :       /* Both operands are imaginary: The result will be real. */
   11619             :       operation_type = float_type(
   11620             :                            skip_typerefs(operation_type)->variant.float_kind);
   11621             :     } else {
   11622             :       /* Cast the first operand (as an rvalue) to the operation type. */
   11623             :       op1_for_operation = add_lowered_cast_if_necessary(op1_for_operation,
   11624             :                                                         operation_type);
   11625             :     }  /* if */
   11626             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   11627             : #if LOWER_FIXED_POINT
   11628             :   } else if (is_fixed_point_type(operation_type)) {
   11629             :     a_type_ptr op1_type = skip_typerefs(op1_for_operation->type);
   11630             :     a_type_ptr op2_type = skip_typerefs(op2->type);
   11631             :     if (is_fixed_point_type(op1_type) && is_fixed_point_type(op2_type) &&
   11632             :         op1_type->variant.fixed_point.is_unsigned &&
   11633             :         !op2_type->variant.fixed_point.is_unsigned) {
   11634             :       /* Convert the unsigned fixed-point first operand to the corresponding
   11635             :          signed fixed-point type, because the second operand is signed. */
   11636             :       a_type_ptr               new_fx_type;
   11637             :       a_fixed_point_type_descr descr;
   11638             :       descr = op1_type->variant.fixed_point;
   11639             :       descr.is_unsigned = FALSE;
   11640             :       new_fx_type = fixed_point_type(descr);
   11641             :       op1_for_operation = add_lowered_cast_if_necessary(op1_for_operation,
   11642             :                                                         new_fx_type);
   11643             :     }  /* if */
   11644             : #endif /* LOWER_FIXED_POINT */
   11645             :   } else {
   11646             :     /* Cast the first operand (as an rvalue) to the operation type. */
   11647             :     op1_for_operation = add_lowered_cast_if_necessary(op1_for_operation,
   11648             :                                                       operation_type);
   11649             :   }  /* if */
   11650             :   /* Determine the corresponding non-assignment operator. */
   11651             :   op = corresponding_operator_for_compound_assignment(op);
   11652             :   /* Make the (x @ y) operation. */
   11653             :   if (swap_operands) {
   11654             :     op2->next = op1_for_operation;
   11655             :     op_node = make_operator_node(op, operation_type, op2);
   11656             :   } else {
   11657             :     op1_for_operation->next = op2;
   11658             :     op_node = make_operator_node(op, operation_type, op1_for_operation);
   11659             :   }  /* if */
   11660             :   if (C_mode()) {
   11661             :     lower_c99_operator(op_node);
   11662             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   11663             :   } else if (node_operator_type_kind_is(expr, tk_complex)) {
   11664             :     /* For complex operators in C++, the C99 routines can safely be called. */
   11665             :     check_assertion(gpp_mode);
   11666             :     lower_c99_operator(op_node);
   11667             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   11668             :   }  /* if */
   11669             :   /* Cast the result of the operation to the result type. */
   11670             :   op_node = add_lowered_cast_if_necessary(op_node, result_type);
   11671             :   /* Assign the result to op1 (or the temporary). */
   11672             :   op_node = make_assignment_expr(op1_for_assign,
   11673             :                                  (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign, op_node);
   11674             :   if (temp_var == NULL) {
   11675             :     /* Not using a temporary. */
   11676             :     if (result_is_lvalue) {
   11677             :       op_node->type = expr->type;
   11678             :       op_node->is_lvalue = TRUE;
   11679             :       op_node->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = TRUE;
   11680             :     }  /* if */
   11681             :   } else {
   11682             :     /* Add the final copy of the temporary to op1, and a comma expression. */
   11683             :     op2_node = make_assignment_expr(op1, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   11684             :                                     var_rvalue_expr(temp_var));
   11685             :     if (result_is_lvalue) {
   11686             :       op2_node->type = expr->type;
   11687             :       op2_node->is_lvalue = result_is_lvalue;
   11688             :       op2_node->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue =
   11689             :                                                               result_is_lvalue;
   11690             :     }  /* if */
   11691             :     op_node = make_comma_node(op_node, op2_node);
   11692             :     op_node->is_lvalue = result_is_lvalue;
   11693             :     op_node->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue =
   11694             :                                                               result_is_lvalue;
   11695             :   }  /* if */
   11696             :   overwrite_node(expr, op_node);
   11697             : }  /* rewrite_compound_assignment */
   11698             : 
   11699             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   11700             : 
   11701             : static void lower_gnu_min_max(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11702             : /*
   11703             : Lower the GNU C++ "<?" (min) and ">?" (max) operators.  expr can be either
   11704             : an lvalue or rvalue expression.
   11705             : */
   11706             : {
   11707             :   an_expr_node_ptr      op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   11708             :   an_expr_node_ptr      op2 = op1->next;
   11709             :   an_expr_node_ptr      temp1, temp2, rel_node;
   11710             :   an_expr_operator_kind op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_error;
   11711             :   a_boolean             op1_has_side_effects, op2_has_side_effects;
   11712             : 
   11713             :   /* Rewrite
   11714             :        a <? b
   11715             :      as
   11716             :        ((temp1 = a) < (temp2 = b)) ? temp1 : temp2
   11717             :   */
   11718             :   op1_has_side_effects = node_has_side_effects(op1, (a_boolean *)NULL);
   11719             :   op2_has_side_effects = node_has_side_effects(op2, (a_boolean *)NULL);
   11720             :   temp1 = make_reusable_copy(op1, op2_has_side_effects);
   11721             :   temp2 = make_reusable_copy(op2, op1_has_side_effects);
   11722             :   /* Determine the comparison operator to use. */
   11723             :   switch (expr->variant.operation.kind) {
   11724             :     case eok_gnu_min:
   11725             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lt;
   11726             :       break;
   11727             :     case eok_gnu_max:
   11728             :       op = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_gt;
   11729             :       break;
   11730             :     default:
   11731             :       unexpected_condition_str("lower_gnu_min_max: bad operator");
   11732             :   }  /* switch */
   11733             :   if (expr->is_lvalue) {
   11734             :     /* In the lvalue-returning case, the operands are lvalues.
   11735             :        In order to compare the values, we have to convert them to rvalues. */
   11736             :     op1->next = NULL;
   11737             :     op1 = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(op1);
   11738             :     op2 = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(op2);
   11739             :     op1->next = op2;
   11740             :   }  /* if */
   11741             :   /* Make "(temp1 = a) < (temp2 = b)". */
   11742             :   rel_node = make_operator_node(op, integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   11743             :                                 op1);
   11744             :   /* Assemble the "?" operation, overwriting the original node. */
   11745             :   rel_node->next = temp1;
   11746             :   temp1->next = temp2;
   11747             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
   11748             :   check_assertion(!is_vector_type(expr->type));
   11749             : #endif /* GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED */
   11750             :   set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question,
   11751             :                     temp1->type, expr->is_lvalue, rel_node);
   11752             : }  /* lower_gnu_min_max */
   11753             : 
   11754             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   11755             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11756             : 
   11757             : static void add_implied_args_to_call(an_expr_node_ptr call_expr,
   11758             :                                      a_routine_ptr    rout)
   11759             : /*
   11760             : call_expr is an expression that calls the routine rout.  If the call
   11761             : requires implied arguments (e.g., for a constructor or destructor), add
   11762             : them.  The call has already been lowered.
   11763             : */
   11764             : {
   11765             :   an_expr_node_ptr implied_arg_list, end_implied_arg_list;
   11766             :   an_expr_node_ptr func_addr_arg, this_arg;
   11767             : 
   11768             :   implied_arg_list = NULL;
   11769             :   if (rout->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
   11770             :     /* Constructor. */
   11771             :     make_ctor_implied_arg_list(rout, /*is_target_ctor=*/FALSE,
   11772             :                                &implied_arg_list, &end_implied_arg_list);
   11773             :   } else if (rout->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   11774             :     /* Destructor. */
   11775             :     make_dtor_implied_arg_list(rout, /*have_complete_object=*/TRUE,
   11776             :                                &implied_arg_list, &end_implied_arg_list);
   11777             :   }  /* if */
   11778             :   if (implied_arg_list != NULL) {
   11779             :     /* The implied arguments go after the "this" argument. */
   11780             :     func_addr_arg = call_expr->variant.operation.operands;
   11781             :     this_arg = func_addr_arg->next;
   11782             :     end_implied_arg_list->next = this_arg->next;
   11783             :     this_arg->next = implied_arg_list;
   11784             :   }  /* if */
   11785             : }  /* add_implied_args_to_call */
   11786             : 
   11787             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11788             : 
   11789             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_vtbl_entry_node(an_expr_node_ptr func_node,
   11790             :                                              an_expr_node_ptr object_node)
   11791             : /*
   11792             : Create an expression that yields an rvalue pointer for the virtual table entry
   11793             : for the function whose address is given by func_node for the object specified
   11794             : by the lvalue expression object_node.  Return a pointer to the expression
   11795             : created.
   11796             : */
   11797             : {
   11798             :   a_routine_ptr             routine_ptr;
   11799             :   an_expr_node_ptr          vptr_node, vtbl_entry_node;
   11800             :   an_expr_node_ptr          index_node;
   11801             :   a_constant_ptr            index_con;
   11802             :   a_virtual_function_number idx;
   11803             : 
   11804             :   check_assertion(!object_node->is_lvalue);
   11805             :   /* Find the routine entry. */
   11806             :   routine_ptr = routine_from_function_expr(func_node);
   11807             :   check_assertion(routine_ptr != NULL);
   11808             :   /* Make an expression tree for the value of the virtual function table
   11809             :      pointer. */
   11810             :   object_node = add_indirection_to_node(object_node);
   11811             :   vptr_node = make_vptr_field_rvalue(object_node);
   11812             :   /* Add the index for the function to the base address of the virtual
   11813             :      function to get the address of the applicable entry of the table. */
   11814             :   idx = routine_ptr->virtual_function_number;
   11815             :   index_con = alloc_constant((a_constant_repr_kind)ck_integer);
   11816             :   set_integer_constant(index_con, (a_host_large_integer)idx,
   11817             :                        (an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   11818             :   index_node = make_node_for_il_constant(index_con);
   11819             :   check_assertion(!index_node->is_lvalue);
   11820             :   vtbl_entry_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   11821             :                                        vptr_node->type, vptr_node);
   11822             :   vptr_node->next = index_node;
   11823             :   return vtbl_entry_node;
   11824             : }  /* make_vtbl_entry_node */
   11825             : 
   11826             : 
   11827             : #if IA64_ABI
   11828             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <--- vtbl_temp_var is not used in that case. */
   11829             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   11830             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <--- vars_can_change is not used in that case. */
   11831             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11832             : an_expr_node_ptr get_virtual_function_address(
   11833             :                                              an_expr_node_ptr func_node,
   11834             :                                              an_expr_node_ptr *object_node,
   11835             :                                              a_boolean        vars_can_change,
   11836             :                                              a_variable_ptr   *vtbl_temp_var,
   11837             :                                              an_expr_node_ptr *assign_node)
   11838             : /*
   11839             : Returns an expression that represents the address of the virtual function
   11840             : in the virtual function table for *object_node that corresponds to the function
   11841             : specified in func_node.  func_node is a simple expression node (i.e., one
   11842             : from which an a_routine_ptr can be extracted) that represents a virtual
   11843             : function routine.  *object_node specifies the object and is overwritten with a
   11844             : reusable copy of itself (if necessary).  vars_can_change (only used in the
   11845             : IA-64 ABI case) should be set to TRUE if the encompassing expression context is
   11846             : one in which variables can have their values changed (possibly necessitating a
   11847             : temporary for *object_node).  In the Cfront ABI, a temporary variable that
   11848             : represents the vtable for *object_node is returned in *vtbl_temp_var.  If a
   11849             : temporary variable assignment is necessary, an expression is returned in
   11850             : *assign_node (otherwise set to NULL).  The caller is responsible for ensuring
   11851             : that the assignment is performed before the returned expression is executed.
   11852             : The caller is also responsible for ensuring that the expression given
   11853             : by *object_node will not evaluate to NULL at runtime (or a segfault will
   11854             : occur in the generated code).
   11855             : */
   11856             : {
   11857             :   an_expr_node_ptr  object_node_copy, vtbl_entry_node, func_select_node;
   11858             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11859             :   an_expr_node_ptr  vtbl_temp_node;
   11860             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11861             : 
   11862             :   check_assertion(assign_node != NULL);
   11863             :   *assign_node = NULL;
   11864             : #if IA64_ABI
   11865             :   /* IA-64 ABI: The returned expression is:
   11866             :        (object->__vptr[index])
   11867             :      or, if the object is not simple,
   11868             :        (temp = object,  <- this is added by the caller
   11869             :         temp->__vptr[index])
   11870             :   */
   11871             :   if (!is_invariant_expr(*object_node, vars_can_change,
   11872             :                          /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE)) {
   11873             :     /* The object node is not invariant, so assign it to a temporary. */
   11874             :     *assign_node = *object_node;
   11875             :     *object_node = assign_expr_to_temp_and_make_expr_for_reuse(*object_node);
   11876             :   }  /* if */
   11877             :   /* Make a copy of the object address. */
   11878             :   object_node_copy = make_reusable_copy(*object_node, vars_can_change);
   11879             :   /* Make a node for the address of the virtual table entry for the
   11880             :      function. */
   11881             :   vtbl_entry_node = make_vtbl_entry_node(func_node, *object_node);
   11882             :   /* Get the function pointer stored in the virtual function table. */
   11883             :   func_select_node = add_cast_if_necessary(vtbl_entry_node,
   11884             :                                            make_pointer_type(func_node->type));
   11885             :   func_select_node = add_indirection_to_node(func_select_node);
   11886             :   func_select_node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(func_select_node);
   11887             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   11888             :   /* Cfront-like ABI: The returned expression is:
   11889             :        (vtbl_temp = (object->__vptr)+index),  <- this is added by the caller
   11890             :         vtbl_temp->f)
   11891             :      index is the virtual function table index for the virtual function.
   11892             :      If "object" is not a reusable expression, the first occurrence of
   11893             :      "object" above is replaced by "(object_temp = object)". */
   11894             :   check_assertion(vtbl_temp_var != NULL);
   11895             :   /* Make a reusable copy of the object address. */
   11896             :   object_node_copy = make_reusable_copy(*object_node,
   11897             :                                         /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   11898             :   /* Make a node for the address of the virtual table entry for the
   11899             :      function. */
   11900             :   vtbl_entry_node = make_vtbl_entry_node(func_node, *object_node);
   11901             :   /* Make the vtbl_temp temporary and an lvalue for it, and assign the
   11902             :      virtual function table entry address to it. */
   11903             :   *vtbl_temp_var = make_local_temporary(vtbl_entry_node->type);
   11904             :   *assign_node = make_var_assignment_expr(*vtbl_temp_var, vtbl_entry_node);
   11905             :   /* Make an expression that extracts the "f" (function pointer) from the
   11906             :      virtual table entry and casts it to the right function pointer type. */
   11907             :   vtbl_temp_node = var_rvalue_expr(*vtbl_temp_var);
   11908             :   func_select_node = field_rvalue_selection_expr(vtbl_temp_node, mptr_f_field);
   11909             :   func_select_node = add_cast_if_necessary(func_select_node, func_node->type);
   11910             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11911             :   /* The expression pointed to by object_node may have been modified,
   11912             :      so return the copy we made to the caller. */
   11913             :   *object_node = object_node_copy;
   11914             :   return func_select_node;
   11915             : }  /* get_virtual_function_address */
   11916             : 
   11917             : 
   11918             : void lower_virtual_function_call(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   11919             : /*
   11920             : Do IL Lowering of a virtual function call.  The operands of the expression
   11921             : have already been lowered.
   11922             : */
   11923             : {
   11924             :   an_expr_node_ptr func_node, object_node, additional_args;
   11925             :   an_expr_node_ptr func_select_node, assign_node = NULL, return_node = NULL;
   11926             :   a_type_ptr       func_type;
   11927             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   11928             :                    rtsp;
   11929             : #if !IA64_ABI
   11930             :   an_expr_node_ptr d_value_node;
   11931             :   an_expr_node_ptr vtbl_temp_node, padd_node;
   11932             :   an_expr_node_ptr cast_node; /*lint !e578*/
   11933             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   11934             :   a_boolean        args_have_side_effects = FALSE;
   11935             :   a_variable_ptr   vtbl_temp_var = NULL;
   11936             : 
   11937             :   /* The original tree has a member call node with operands as follows:
   11938             :        (1) an enk_routine node for the virtual function.
   11939             :        (2) a node for the object pointer.  (For the eok_dot_member_call case,
   11940             :            this has already been converted to a pointer.)
   11941             :        (3..n) optional additional arguments.
   11942             :      Or, in C notation,
   11943             :        member_call(func, object, additional_args ...)
   11944             :   */
   11945             :   /* In at least one case, the call is generated internally by IL lowering,
   11946             :      and the operator is eok_call rather than a member call operator. */
   11947             :   func_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   11948             :   func_type = f_skip_typerefs(type_pointed_to(func_node->type));
   11949             :   check_assertion(!func_node->is_lvalue &&
   11950             :                   func_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine);
   11951             :   rtsp = func_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   11952             :   object_node = func_node->next;
   11953             :   additional_args = object_node->next;
   11954             :   if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
   11955             :     /* The function returns its value via an added return value address
   11956             :        parameter. */
   11957             :     if (rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
   11958             :       /* The parameter added for the return address follows the "this"
   11959             :          parameter. */
   11960             :       return_node = additional_args;
   11961             :     } else {
   11962             :       /* The parameter added for the return address precedes the "this"
   11963             :          parameter. */
   11964             :       return_node = object_node;
   11965             :       object_node = additional_args;
   11966             :     }  /* if */
   11967             :     additional_args = additional_args->next;
   11968             :     return_node->next = NULL;
   11969             :   }  /* if */
   11970             :   func_node->next = NULL;
   11971             :   object_node->next = NULL;
   11972             : #if IA64_ABI
   11973             :   args_have_side_effects = expr_list_has_side_effects(additional_args,
   11974             :                                                           (a_boolean *)NULL) ||
   11975             :                            (return_node != NULL &&
   11976             :                             node_has_side_effects(return_node,
   11977             :                                                   (a_boolean *)NULL));
   11978             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   11979             :   /* Get an expression that represents the address of the function in the
   11980             :      virtual function table for the object pointer. */
   11981             :   func_select_node = get_virtual_function_address(func_node,
   11982             :                                     &object_node,
   11983             :                                     /*vars_can_change=*/args_have_side_effects,
   11984             :                                     &vtbl_temp_var,
   11985             :                                     &assign_node);
   11986             : #if IA64_ABI
   11987             :   /* IA-64 ABI: The rewritten form is
   11988             :        (object->__vptr[index])(object, additional_args ...)
   11989             :      or, if the object is not simple,
   11990             :        (temp = object,
   11991             :         (temp->__vptr[index])(temp, additional_args ...))
   11992             :   */
   11993             :   if (return_node != NULL) {
   11994             :     func_select_node->next = return_node;
   11995             :     return_node->next = object_node;
   11996             :   } else {
   11997             :     func_select_node->next = object_node;
   11998             :   }  /* if */
   11999             :   object_node->next = additional_args;
   12000             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   12001             :   /* Cfront-like ABI: The rewritten form is as follows:
   12002             :        ((vtbl_temp = (object->__vptr)+index),
   12003             :         vtbl_temp->f(object+vtbl_temp->d, additional_args ...))
   12004             :      index is the virtual function table index for the virtual function.
   12005             :      If "object" is not a reusable expression, the first occurrence of
   12006             :      "object" above is replaced by "(object_temp = object)", and the
   12007             :      second by "object_temp". */
   12008             :   check_assertion(vtbl_temp_var != NULL);
   12009             :   /* Make an expression that selects the "d" (delta) from the virtual
   12010             :      table entry and adds it to the object pointer. */
   12011             :   vtbl_temp_node = var_rvalue_expr(vtbl_temp_var);
   12012             :   d_value_node = field_rvalue_selection_expr(vtbl_temp_node, mptr_d_field);
   12013             :   /* Cast the node to "char *" to suppress scaling on the pointer addition. */
   12014             :   cast_node = add_cast_to_char_star(object_node);
   12015             :   /* Add the object pointer and the delta value. */
   12016             :   padd_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   12017             :                                  cast_node->type, cast_node);
   12018             :   cast_node->next = d_value_node;
   12019             :   /* Cast the result back to the "this" parameter type. */
   12020             :   object_node = add_cast(padd_node, object_node->type);
   12021             :   func_select_node->next = object_node;
   12022             :   if (return_node != NULL) {
   12023             :     object_node->next = return_node;
   12024             :     return_node->next = additional_args;
   12025             :   } else {
   12026             :     object_node->next = additional_args;
   12027             :   }  /* if */
   12028             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   12029             :   /* Reuse the node that was originally the first operand of
   12030             :      the virtual call (i.e., the enk_routine node) as the new
   12031             :      eok_call node.  Attach the function selection node, the object node, and
   12032             :      the additional arguments to the call node as arguments. */
   12033             :   change_node_to_operation(func_node, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_call,
   12034             :                            expr->type, func_select_node, /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE);
   12035             :   if (assign_node != NULL) {
   12036             :     /* Reuse the original call node as a comma operator node and
   12037             :        attach the vtbl_temp assignment and the eok_call nodes under it as
   12038             :        operands. */
   12039             :     assign_node->next = func_node;
   12040             :     set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma, expr->type,
   12041             :                       /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE, assign_node);
   12042             :   } else {
   12043             :     /* No assign_node, so just overwrite the original expression with
   12044             :        the call node. */
   12045             :     overwrite_node(expr, func_node);
   12046             :   }  /* if */
   12047             : }  /* lower_virtual_function_call */
   12048             : 
   12049             : 
   12050             : static void lower_virtual_function_ptr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   12051             : /*
   12052             : Do IL Lowering of an eok_virtual_function_ptr node, which is used to
   12053             : get the address of a virtual function when a bound function is cast to
   12054             : a normal function pointer (an anachronism).  The operands of the expression
   12055             : have already been lowered.  The expression is an rvalue.
   12056             : */
   12057             : {
   12058             :   an_expr_node_ptr func_node, object_node;
   12059             :   an_expr_node_ptr func_select_node;
   12060             :   an_expr_node_ptr vtbl_entry_node;
   12061             : 
   12062             :   /* The original tree has an eok_virtual_function_ptr node with operands
   12063             :      as follows:
   12064             :        (1) an enk_routine node for the virtual function.
   12065             :        (2) a node for the object pointer.  In unlowered IL, this argument
   12066             :            is a class selector (class lvalue, class rvalue, or pointer to
   12067             :            class); the argument has already been converted into a class rvalue
   12068             :            pointer by lower_class_selector_operand_if_any.
   12069             :   */
   12070             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   12071             :   func_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12072             :   object_node = func_node->next;
   12073             :   check_assertion(is_pointer_type(object_node->type) &&
   12074             :                   is_class_struct_union_type(type_pointed_to(
   12075             :                                                           object_node->type)));
   12076             :   func_node->next = NULL;
   12077             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12078             :   /* The rewritten form is as follows:
   12079             :        (object->__vptr)+index)->f
   12080             :      index is the virtual function table index for the virtual function.
   12081             :   */
   12082             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   12083             :   /* Make a node for the address of the virtual table entry for the
   12084             :      function, i.e., "(object->__vptr)+index". */
   12085             :   vtbl_entry_node = make_vtbl_entry_node(func_node, object_node);
   12086             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12087             :   /* Make an expression that extracts the "f" (function pointer) from the
   12088             :      virtual table entry. */
   12089             :   func_select_node = field_rvalue_selection_expr(vtbl_entry_node,
   12090             :                                                  mptr_f_field);
   12091             :   func_select_node = add_indirection_to_node(func_select_node);
   12092             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12093             :   /* Get the function pointer stored in the virtual function table. */
   12094             :   func_select_node = add_indirection_to_node(vtbl_entry_node);
   12095             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12096             :   /* Make sure the resulting expression is an rvalue of the correct type. */
   12097             :   func_select_node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(func_select_node);
   12098             :   change_to_cast(expr, func_select_node, expr->type);
   12099             : }  /* lower_virtual_function_ptr */
   12100             : 
   12101             : 
   12102             : static an_expr_node_ptr make_expr_for_pm_func_ptr(
   12103             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr object_node,
   12104             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr pmf_node,
   12105             :                                               a_variable_ptr   *this_temp_var,
   12106             :                                               a_variable_ptr   *func_temp_var,
   12107             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr *func_addr_node)
   12108             : /*
   12109             : This is a utility function that creates an expression for the address of a
   12110             : bound pointer-to-member-function (which is returned in *func_addr_node).  This
   12111             : utility is most commonly used during the invocation of a pointer-to-member-
   12112             : function (but the actual call operation is performed by the caller).  See the
   12113             : comments below for the details on the contents of the returned expressions.  As
   12114             : part of creating the address of the bound pointer-to-member-function, a
   12115             : temporary is created to represent "this", and that temporary is returned in
   12116             : *this_temp_var.  In most cases (i.e., when
   12117             : pointer_to_member_call_optimization_allowed is FALSE or virtual functions
   12118             : exist) a temporary is also created to contain the address of the bound
   12119             : pointer-to-member-function, and that is returned in *func_temp_var.  When a
   12120             : function temporary is not used, *func_temp_var is set to NULL.  The return
   12121             : value is typically a comma expression that contains two assignment statements:
   12122             : one for the "this" temporary and one for the "function" temporary, but in the
   12123             : case where optimization is possible, the two returned expressions (i.e., the
   12124             : return value and *func_addr_node) are separate expressions and it is the
   12125             : responsibility of the caller to ensure that they are evaluated in the proper
   12126             : order (i.e., assignment of "this" temporary, then *func_addr_node).
   12127             : object_node is the object pointer and pmf_node is an rvalue pointer-to-member.
   12128             : */
   12129             : {
   12130             :   an_expr_node_ptr select_d_node, padd_node, cast_object_node;
   12131             :   an_expr_node_ptr compare_node, select_f_node;
   12132             :   an_expr_node_ptr comma_node, this_temp_assign_node, func_temp_assign_node;
   12133             :   an_expr_node_ptr offset_node, vtbl_f_value, question_mark_node;
   12134             :   an_expr_node_ptr vtbl_addr_node, vtbl_temp_assign_node;
   12135             :   an_expr_node_ptr cast_node; /*lint !e578*/
   12136             :   a_variable_ptr   vtbl_temp_var;
   12137             :   a_type_ptr       ptr_to_vtbl_entry_type;
   12138             :   a_type_ptr       object_type = object_node->type;
   12139             :   a_type_ptr       class_type = pm_class_type_possibly_lowered(pmf_node->type);
   12140             :   a_type_ptr       routine_type =
   12141             :                                pm_member_type_possibly_lowered(pmf_node->type);
   12142             :   a_type_ptr       ptr_routine_type = make_pointer_type(routine_type);
   12143             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12144             :   an_expr_node_ptr select_i_node, this_temp_node;
   12145             :   an_expr_node_ptr select_f_for_cast_node, vtbl_d_value, this_increment_node;
   12146             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12147             :   an_expr_node_ptr select_fd_node;
   12148             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   12149             : 
   12150             :   /* For the Cfront-like ABI, the rewritten form is as follows:
   12151             :        (this_temp = (object_type *)((char *)object + pmf.d),
   12152             :                                        -- Adjust "this" pointer by delta
   12153             :                                           from pointer-to-member.
   12154             :         (func_temp = (function_type *) -- The computed function address
   12155             :                                           gets cast to the proper function
   12156             :                                           type.
   12157             :                  (pmf.i < 0) ?         -- Check virtual/non-virtual
   12158             :                                           pointer-to-member.
   12159             :                    pmf.f :             -- Function address for non-virtual
   12160             :                                           case.
   12161             :                                        -- Virtual function case:
   12162             :                    ((vtbl_temp =       -- Virtual function table entry address
   12163             :                                           is address of virtual function table
   12164             :                                           plus offset in table.
   12165             :                       *(__vtbl_entry **)((char *)this_temp + (short)(pmf.f)) +
   12166             :                                        -- Pointer to virtual function table is
   12167             :                                           found at offset pmf.f in the object.
   12168             :                       pmf.i),          -- Offset into table.
   12169             :                     this_temp = (object_type *)((char *)this_temp +
   12170             :                                                 vtbl_temp->d),
   12171             :                                        -- Adjust "this" pointer to get pointer
   12172             :                                           to subobject expected by the virtual
   12173             :                                           function.
   12174             :                     vtbl_temp->f))     -- Address of virtual function.
   12175             :      If "pmf" is not a reusable expression, the first occurrence of
   12176             :      "pmf" above is replaced by "(pmf_temp = pmf)", and the rest by
   12177             :      "pmf_temp".  See ARM 8.1.2.c for some insight into the pointer-to-
   12178             :       member-function data structure. */
   12179             :   /* It used to be possible to generate an optimized code sequence if the
   12180             :      class and its base classes have no virtual functions.  However,
   12181             :      the C++ standards process made some changes to the definition of
   12182             :      pointers to members that precludes the optimization.  See the
   12183             :      paper WG21/N0644.  Now, the optimized code sequence is generated
   12184             :      only when a compatibility option is enabled.  The simpler code is:
   12185             :        ((this_temp = (object_type *)((char *)object + pmf.d)),
   12186             :         ((function_type *)pmf.f)(this_temp, additional_args ...))
   12187             :      This seems slightly more complicated than is needed, but it makes
   12188             :      sure that if a reusable copy of pmf is needed, the temp for it
   12189             :      is initialized before the call is begun.
   12190             :   */
   12191             :   /* For the IA-64 ABI:
   12192             :         (this_temp = (object_type *)((char *)object + pmf.d),
   12193             :                                        -- Adjust "this" pointer by delta
   12194             :                                           from pointer-to-member.
   12195             :          func_temp = (function_type *) -- The computed function address
   12196             :                                           gets cast to the proper function
   12197             :                                           type.
   12198             :                  ((pmf.f & 1) == 0) ?  -- Check virtual/non-virtual
   12199             :                                           pointer-to-member.
   12200             :                    pmf.f :             -- Function address for non-virtual
   12201             :                                           case.
   12202             :                                        -- Virtual function case:
   12203             :                    ((vtbl_temp =       -- Virtual function table entry address
   12204             :                                           is address of virtual function table
   12205             :                                           plus offset in table.
   12206             :                       *(__vtbl_entry **)
   12207             :                         ((char *)this_temp +
   12208             :                                        -- Pointer to virtual function table is
   12209             :                                           found at offset zero in the object.
   12210             :                          ((ptrdiff_t)pmf.f - 1)),
   12211             :                                        -- Offset into table, dropping low-order
   12212             :                                           bit indicating virtual function.
   12213             :                     *vtbl_temp)))      -- Address of virtual function.
   12214             :   */
   12215             :   /* Make sure __mptr (the struct that represents lowered pointers to member
   12216             :      functions) has been created. */
   12217             :   (void)make_mptr_type();
   12218             :   /* Make the temporary variable for the "this_temp". */
   12219             :   *this_temp_var = make_local_temporary(object_type);
   12220             :   /* Make "(char *)object + pmf.d". */
   12221             :   select_d_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node, mptr_d_field);
   12222             : #if IA64_ABI
   12223             :   if (targ_ia64_abi_use_variant_ptr_to_member_function_repr) {
   12224             :     /* Shift right to eliminate the low-order bit, which is used to indicate
   12225             :        whether or not the function is virtual.  This applies in the variant
   12226             :        of the IA-64 ABI for architectures in which the low-order bit of
   12227             :        a function address can be 1. */
   12228             :     select_d_node->next = node_for_integer_constant(1L,
   12229             :                                                     targ_size_t_int_kind);
   12230             :     select_d_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_shiftr,
   12231             :                                         select_d_node->type, select_d_node);
   12232             :   }  /* if */
   12233             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12234             :   cast_object_node = add_cast_to_char_star(object_node);
   12235             :   cast_object_node->next = select_d_node;
   12236             :   padd_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   12237             :                                  cast_object_node->type, cast_object_node);
   12238             :   /* Cast back to the object pointer type. */
   12239             :   cast_node = add_cast(padd_node, object_type);
   12240             :   /* Make "(this_temp = (object_type *)((char *)object + pmf.d)". */
   12241             :   this_temp_assign_node = make_var_assignment_expr(*this_temp_var, cast_node);
   12242             :   if (pointer_to_member_call_optimization_allowed &&
   12243             :       class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->assoc_scope != NULL &&
   12244             :       !class_type->variant.class_struct_union.
   12245             :                              any_virtual_functions_including_in_base_classes) {
   12246             :     /* No virtual functions, so use the simpler form. */
   12247             :     /* Make "pmf.f". */
   12248             :     pmf_node = make_reusable_copy(pmf_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12249             :     select_f_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node, mptr_f_field);
   12250             :     /* Add the cast to the right pointer to routine type. */
   12251             :     *func_addr_node = add_cast_if_necessary(select_f_node, ptr_routine_type);
   12252             :     *func_temp_var = NULL;
   12253             :   } else {
   12254             :     /* Virtual functions, so use the more general form. */
   12255             :     pmf_node = make_reusable_copy(pmf_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12256             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12257             :     /* Make "pmf.i < 0". */
   12258             :     select_i_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node, mptr_i_field);
   12259             :     select_i_node = integral_promote_node(select_i_node);
   12260             :     select_i_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(0L,
   12261             :                                          targ_virtual_function_index_int_kind);
   12262             :     compare_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lt,
   12263             :                                       integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   12264             :                                       select_i_node);
   12265             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12266             :     /* Make "(pmf.f & 1) == 0", testing for the non-virtual case.
   12267             :        For the variant for architectures where the low-order bit of the
   12268             :        address of a function can be 1, the bit is in the "d" field, so
   12269             :        the code is "(pmf.d & 1) == 0". */
   12270             :     if (targ_ia64_abi_use_variant_ptr_to_member_function_repr) {
   12271             :       select_fd_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node,
   12272             :                                                         mptr_d_field);
   12273             :     } else {
   12274             :       select_fd_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node,
   12275             :                                                         mptr_f_field);
   12276             :     }  /* if */
   12277             :     select_fd_node = add_cast_if_necessary(select_fd_node,
   12278             :                                            type_after_integral_promotion(
   12279             :                                                integer_type(
   12280             :                                                     targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind)));
   12281             :     select_fd_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(1L,
   12282             :                                                     targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   12283             :     select_fd_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_and,
   12284             :                                        select_fd_node->type,
   12285             :                                        select_fd_node);
   12286             :     select_fd_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(0L,
   12287             :                                                     targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   12288             :     compare_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_eq,
   12289             :                                       integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   12290             :                                       select_fd_node);
   12291             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12292             :     /* Make "pmf.f". */
   12293             :     pmf_node = make_reusable_copy(pmf_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12294             :     select_f_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node, mptr_f_field);
   12295             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12296             :     /* Make "*(__vtbl_entry **)((char *)this_temp + (short)(pmf.f))", which
   12297             :        is the address of the virtual function table. */
   12298             :     pmf_node = make_reusable_copy(pmf_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12299             :     select_f_for_cast_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node,
   12300             :                                                               mptr_f_field);
   12301             :     /* We're using the "f" field of __mptr as an offset to the virtual table
   12302             :        pointer in the object, so it must be cast from pointer-to-function
   12303             :        to an integral type. */
   12304             :     cast_node = add_cast(select_f_for_cast_node,
   12305             :                          integer_type(targ_delta_int_kind));
   12306             :     /* Add a cast to "char *" to avoid scaling on the pointer addition. */
   12307             :     this_temp_node = add_cast_to_char_star(var_rvalue_expr(*this_temp_var));
   12308             :     this_temp_node->next = cast_node;
   12309             :     padd_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   12310             :                                    this_temp_node->type, this_temp_node);
   12311             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12312             :     padd_node = var_rvalue_expr(*this_temp_var);
   12313             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12314             :     /* We now have a pointer to the virtual table pointer in the object.
   12315             :        Cast it to a pointer to a pointer and indirect to get the value of 
   12316             :        the pointer to the virtual function table. */
   12317             :     ptr_to_vtbl_entry_type = pointer_to_vtbl_type();
   12318             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12319             :     cast_node = add_cast(padd_node, make_pointer_type(ptr_to_vtbl_entry_type));
   12320             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12321             :     /* Use a char * pointer to avoid scaling issues. */
   12322             :     cast_node = add_cast(padd_node, make_pointer_type(char_star_type()));
   12323             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12324             :     vtbl_addr_node = add_indirection_to_node(cast_node);
   12325             :     vtbl_addr_node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(vtbl_addr_node);
   12326             :     pmf_node = make_reusable_copy(pmf_node, /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12327             :     /* Make the index into the virtual function table. */
   12328             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12329             :     offset_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node, mptr_i_field);
   12330             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12331             :     offset_node = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(pmf_node, mptr_f_field);
   12332             :     /* We're using the "f" field of __mptr as a ptrdiff_t. */
   12333             :     offset_node = add_cast(offset_node, integer_type(targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind));
   12334             :     if (!targ_ia64_abi_use_variant_ptr_to_member_function_repr) {
   12335             :       /* Subtract 1 to drop the low-order bit that indicates that the
   12336             :          function is virtual.  For the variant for architectures where the
   12337             :          low-order bit of the address of a function can be 1, the bit is in
   12338             :          the "d" field, so no subtraction is needed -- "f" is simply the
   12339             :          offset. */
   12340             :       offset_node->next = node_for_integer_constant(1L,
   12341             :                                                     targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   12342             :       offset_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract,
   12343             :                                        offset_node->type,
   12344             :                                        offset_node);
   12345             :     }  /* if */
   12346             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12347             :     /* Add the virtual function table address and the offset, giving the
   12348             :        address of the virtual function table entry, and store that in
   12349             :        "vtbl_temp". */
   12350             :     vtbl_addr_node->next = offset_node;
   12351             :     padd_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   12352             :                                    vtbl_addr_node->type, vtbl_addr_node);
   12353             : #if IA64_ABI
   12354             :     padd_node = add_cast_if_necessary(padd_node, ptr_to_vtbl_entry_type);
   12355             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12356             :     /* Make the temporary variable for the "vtbl_temp". */
   12357             :     vtbl_temp_var = make_local_temporary(ptr_to_vtbl_entry_type);
   12358             :     vtbl_temp_assign_node = make_var_assignment_expr(vtbl_temp_var, padd_node);
   12359             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12360             :     /* Make "this_temp = (object_type *)((char *)this_temp + vtbl_temp->d)",
   12361             :        which adjusts the "this" pointer to be passed to the virtual
   12362             :        function. */
   12363             :     vtbl_d_value = field_rvalue_selection_expr(var_rvalue_expr(vtbl_temp_var),
   12364             :                                                mptr_d_field);
   12365             :     this_temp_node = var_rvalue_expr(*this_temp_var);
   12366             :     this_temp_node = add_cast_to_char_star(this_temp_node);
   12367             :     this_temp_node->next = vtbl_d_value;
   12368             :     padd_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   12369             :                                    this_temp_node->type,
   12370             :                                    this_temp_node);
   12371             :     cast_node = add_cast(padd_node, object_type);
   12372             :     this_increment_node = make_var_assignment_expr(*this_temp_var, cast_node);
   12373             :     /* Make "vtbl_temp->f", the address of the virtual function. */
   12374             :     vtbl_f_value = field_rvalue_selection_expr(var_rvalue_expr(vtbl_temp_var),
   12375             :                                                mptr_f_field);
   12376             :     /* Combine the three expressions that make up the virtual function
   12377             :        processing code. */
   12378             :     comma_node = make_comma_node(vtbl_temp_assign_node, this_increment_node);
   12379             :     comma_node = make_comma_node(comma_node, vtbl_f_value);
   12380             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12381             :     /* Make "*vtbl_temp", the address of the virtual function. */
   12382             :     vtbl_f_value = var_rvalue_expr(vtbl_temp_var);
   12383             :     vtbl_f_value = add_cast(vtbl_f_value,
   12384             :                             make_pointer_type(select_f_node->type));
   12385             :     vtbl_f_value = add_indirection_to_node(vtbl_f_value);
   12386             :     vtbl_f_value = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(vtbl_f_value);
   12387             :     comma_node = make_comma_node(vtbl_temp_assign_node, vtbl_f_value);
   12388             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12389             :     /* Assemble the "?:" operator. */
   12390             :     compare_node->next = select_f_node;
   12391             :     select_f_node->next = comma_node;
   12392             :     question_mark_node = make_operator_node(
   12393             :                                            (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question,
   12394             :                                            make_vptp_type(), compare_node);
   12395             :     /* Cast the generic function pointer returned from the question mark
   12396             :        operator to the proper function type. */
   12397             :     *func_addr_node = add_cast_if_necessary(question_mark_node,
   12398             :                                            ptr_routine_type);
   12399             :     /* Store it in func_temp. */
   12400             :     *func_temp_var = make_local_temporary(ptr_routine_type);
   12401             :     func_temp_assign_node = make_var_assignment_expr(*func_temp_var,
   12402             :                                                      *func_addr_node);
   12403             :     /* Combine the assignment to this_temp and the assignment to
   12404             :        func_temp into one expression using a comma operator. */
   12405             :     this_temp_assign_node = make_comma_node(this_temp_assign_node,
   12406             :                                             func_temp_assign_node);
   12407             :     /* Get the address of the function from func_temp. */
   12408             :     *func_addr_node = var_rvalue_expr(*func_temp_var);
   12409             :   }  /* if */
   12410             :   return this_temp_assign_node;
   12411             : }  /* make_expr_for_pm_func_ptr */
   12412             : 
   12413             : 
   12414             : static void lower_pm_func_ptr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   12415             : /*
   12416             : Lower an eok_dot_pm_func_ptr or eok_points_to_pm_func_ptr expression.  These
   12417             : expressions are used to implement a g++ extension to return the address from
   12418             : a bound pointer-to-member-function.  Such expressions are found only as
   12419             : arguments to cast expressions.
   12420             : */
   12421             : {
   12422             :   an_expr_node_ptr  object_node, pmf_node, func_temp_node;
   12423             :   an_expr_node_ptr  func_addr_node, this_temp_assign_node;
   12424             :   a_variable_ptr    this_temp_var, func_temp_var;
   12425             : 
   12426             :   /* Note that the first operand of eok_dot_pm_func_ptr is originally an lvalue
   12427             :      or rvalue of class type, but has been changed to an rvalue class pointer
   12428             :      by this point (see lower_class_selector_operand_if_any). */
   12429             :   check_assertion(node_operator_is(expr, eok_dot_pm_func_ptr) ||
   12430             :                   node_operator_is(expr, eok_points_to_pm_func_ptr));
