   12431             :   object_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12432             :   pmf_node = object_node->next;
   12433             :   pmf_node->next = NULL;
   12434             :   object_node->next = NULL;
   12435             :   /* Call make_expr_for_pm_func_ptr to do the heavy lifting involved in
   12436             :      creating an expression that computes the function address. */
   12437             :   this_temp_assign_node = make_expr_for_pm_func_ptr(object_node,
   12438             :                                                     pmf_node,
   12439             :                                                     &this_temp_var,
   12440             :                                                     &func_temp_var,
   12441             :                                                     &func_addr_node);
   12442             :   if (func_temp_var == NULL) {
   12443             :     /* Pointer to member call optimization was performed, so the result
   12444             :        we're looking for is in func_addr_node.  Replace the original
   12445             :        expression with a comma expression with func_addr_node (suitably cast)
   12446             :        as the second argument. */
   12447             :     check_assertion(pointer_to_member_call_optimization_allowed);
   12448             :     func_addr_node = add_cast_if_necessary(func_addr_node, expr->type);
   12449             :     this_temp_assign_node->next = func_addr_node;
   12450             :   } else {
   12451             :     /* this_temp_assign_node is already a comma node with assignments
   12452             :        to a "this" temporary as well as a "function" temporary.  Replace the
   12453             :        original node by a comma node whose second argument is the value
   12454             :        of the "function" temporary (suitably cast). */
   12455             :     func_temp_node = var_rvalue_expr(func_temp_var);
   12456             :     func_temp_node = add_cast_if_necessary(func_temp_node, expr->type);
   12457             :     this_temp_assign_node->next = func_temp_node;
   12458             :   }  /* if */
   12459             :   set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   12460             :                     expr->type, expr->is_lvalue, this_temp_assign_node);
   12461             : }  /* lower_pm_func_ptr */
   12462             : 
   12463             : 
   12464             : static void lower_pm_call(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   12465             : /*
   12466             : Do IL lowering of a pointer-to-member function call.  The operands of
   12467             : the expression have already been lowered.
   12468             : */
   12469             : {
   12470             :   an_expr_node_ptr pmf_node, object_node, additional_args;
   12471             :   an_expr_node_ptr this_temp_node, call_node;
   12472             :   an_expr_node_ptr this_temp_assign_node;
   12473             :   an_expr_node_ptr return_node = NULL;
   12474             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   12475             :                    rtsp;
   12476             :   an_expr_node_ptr func_addr_node;
   12477             :   a_variable_ptr   this_temp_var, func_temp_var;
   12478             :   a_type_ptr       routine_type;
   12479             : 
   12480             :   /* The original tree has an eok_dot_pm_call or eok_points_to_pm_call
   12481             :      node with operands as follows:
   12482             :        (1) a node giving the rvalue of the pointer-to-member.
   12483             :        (2) a node for the object pointer.  (For the eok_dot_pm_call case, this
   12484             :            has already been converted to a pointer.)
   12485             :        (3..n) optional additional arguments.
   12486             :      Or, in C notation,
   12487             :        pm_call(pmf, object, additional_args ...)
   12488             :   */
   12489             :   pmf_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12490             :   check_assertion(!pmf_node->is_lvalue);
   12491             :   routine_type = pm_member_type_possibly_lowered(pmf_node->type);
   12492             :   rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   12493             :   object_node = pmf_node->next;
   12494             :   additional_args = object_node->next;
   12495             :   if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
   12496             :     /* The function returns its value via an added return value address
   12497             :        parameter. */
   12498             :     if (rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
   12499             :       /* The parameter added for the return address follows the "this"
   12500             :          parameter. */
   12501             :       return_node = additional_args;
   12502             :     } else {
   12503             :       /* The parameter added for the return address precedes the "this"
   12504             :          parameter. */
   12505             :       return_node = object_node;
   12506             :       object_node = additional_args;
   12507             :     }  /* if */
   12508             :     additional_args = additional_args->next;
   12509             :     return_node->next = NULL;
   12510             :   }  /* if */
   12511             :   pmf_node->next = NULL;
   12512             :   object_node->next = NULL;
   12513             :   /* Call make_expr_for_pm_func_ptr to do the heavy lifting involved in
   12514             :      creating an expression that computes the function address. */
   12515             :   this_temp_assign_node = make_expr_for_pm_func_ptr(object_node,
   12516             :                                                     pmf_node,
   12517             :                                                     &this_temp_var,
   12518             :                                                     &func_temp_var,
   12519             :                                                     &func_addr_node);
   12520             :   /* Make the call operands: func_addr_node (giving the function pointer),
   12521             :      the this_temp (giving the object address), and any additional
   12522             :      arguments.  In the IA64 ABI, if there is a return value address
   12523             :      parameter it precedes the "this" parameter.  In the Cfront-like
   12524             :      ABI, it follows it. */
   12525             :   this_temp_node = var_rvalue_expr(this_temp_var);
   12526             :   if (return_node != NULL) {
   12527             : #if IA64_ABI
   12528             :     func_addr_node->next = return_node;
   12529             :     return_node->next = this_temp_node;
   12530             :     this_temp_node->next = additional_args;
   12531             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   12532             :     func_addr_node->next = this_temp_node;
   12533             :     this_temp_node->next = return_node;
   12534             :     return_node->next = additional_args;
   12535             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12536             :   } else {
   12537             :     func_addr_node->next = this_temp_node;
   12538             :     this_temp_node->next = additional_args;
   12539             :   }  /* if */
   12540             :   /* Assemble the call node. */
   12541             :   call_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_call,
   12542             :                                  expr->type, func_addr_node);
   12543             :   /* Replace the original node by a comma node with the assignment to
   12544             :      this_temp (and perhaps also func_temp) and the call under it. */
   12545             :   this_temp_assign_node->next = call_node;
   12546             :   set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   12547             :                     expr->type, expr->is_lvalue, this_temp_assign_node);
   12548             : }  /* lower_pm_call */
   12549             : 
   12550             : 
   12551             : #if !MINIMAL_INLINING
   12552             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- statement is not used in this case. */
   12553             : #endif /* !MINIMAL_INLINING */
   12554             : void lower_call(an_expr_node_ptr      expr,
   12555             :                 an_init_pos_descr_ptr ipdp,
   12556             :                 a_statement_ptr       statement,
   12557             :                 a_boolean             *expr_has_been_detached)
   12558             : /*
   12559             : Lower a call (nonmember, member, virtual, or pointer-to-member).  expr points
   12560             : to the call node.  ipdp, if non-NULL, indicates an entity into which the
   12561             : call should return its value.  If statement is non-NULL, this call is
   12562             : the top node of the indicated statement (which is an expression statement).
   12563             : If expr_has_been_detached is non-NULL, *expr_has_been_detached is set to
   12564             : TRUE if expr has been inlined as a separate statement and therefore
   12565             : detached from the IL tree; otherwise it is set to FALSE.
   12566             : */
   12567             : {
   12568             :   a_type_ptr                    rout_type;
   12569             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp;
   12570             :   an_expr_node_ptr              prev_arg_node, arg_node, temp_node, first_arg;
   12571             :   an_expr_operator_kind         op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   12572             :   a_routine_ptr                 routine = NULL;
   12573             :   an_expr_node_ptr              call_expr = expr;
   12574             : 
   12575             :   if (expr_has_been_detached != NULL) *expr_has_been_detached = FALSE;
   12576             :   /* If this call takes a class selector object as an operand, convert the
   12577             :      operand to a pointer to class. */
   12578             :   lower_class_selector_operand_if_any(expr);
   12579             :   lower_os_type(expr->type);
   12580             :   first_arg = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12581             :   check_assertion(!first_arg->is_lvalue);
   12582             :   if ((ctors_return_this || dtors_return_this) &&
   12583             :       is_routine_node(first_arg) &&
   12584             :       (node_routine(first_arg)->special_kind ==
   12585             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
   12586             :        node_routine(first_arg)->special_kind ==
   12587             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor)) {
   12588             :     /* Calling a constructor/destructor that returns "this".  The routine
   12589             :        type will be lowered; add a cast to void and rewrite the call node
   12590             :        to use the lowered return type. */
   12591             :     check_assertion(expr->type == void_type());
   12592             :     expr->type = lowered_return_type_of(node_routine(first_arg)->type);
   12593             :     overwrite_node(expr, add_cast(copy_node(expr), void_type()));
   12594             :     /* Make sure expr points to the call operation. */
   12595             :     expr = call_expr = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12596             :     first_arg = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12597             :   }  /* if */
   12598             :   arg_node = first_arg;
   12599             :   /* Extract the routine type. */
   12600             :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_pm_call ||
   12601             :       op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_points_to_pm_call) {
   12602             :     rout_type = pm_member_type_possibly_lowered(first_arg->type);
   12603             :   } else {
   12604             :     rout_type = type_pointed_to(first_arg->type);
   12605             :   }  /* if */
   12606             :   rout_type = skip_typerefs(rout_type);
   12607             :   lower_os_type(rout_type);
   12608             :   /* Make sure we initialize value_returned_as_parameter before using it. */
   12609             :   set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag(rout_type);
   12610             :   /* Note that the routine type can be lowered or unlowered at this point.
   12611             :      Usually it will be unlowered. */
   12612             :   rtsp = rout_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   12613             :   /* Lower the expression giving the address of the routine. */
   12614             :   lower_expr(arg_node);
   12615             :   prev_arg_node = arg_node;
   12616             :   arg_node = arg_node->next;
   12617             :   /* If the routine has a "this" parameter, lower it separately. */
   12618             :   if (rtsp->this_class != NULL) {
   12619             :     /* The "this" argument has been converted into a pointer to class above. */
   12620             :     check_assertion(is_pointer_type(arg_node->type) &&
   12621             :                     is_class_struct_union_type(type_pointed_to(
   12622             :                                                              arg_node->type)));
   12623             :     /* Don't bother adding NULL-preservation code for the "this" parameter.
   12624             :        If "this" is NULL, dereferencing it is going to cause an error
   12625             :        whether or not the NULL-preservation test is added, so generate
   12626             :        slightly optimized code. */
   12627             :     lower_expr_full(arg_node, /*assume_expr_is_non_null=*/TRUE);
   12628             :     if (rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
   12629             :       /* If a return value address argument will be added below, make sure
   12630             :          it follows the "this" argument. */
   12631             :       prev_arg_node = arg_node;
   12632             :     }  /* if */
   12633             :     arg_node = arg_node->next;
   12634             :   }  /* if */
   12635             :   /* If the routine returns its result to a temporary supplied by the caller,
   12636             :      add an argument for that temporary. */
   12637             :   if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
   12638             :     if (ipdp == NULL) {
   12639             :       /* This case can only occur if the customer has specifically requested
   12640             :          that the function value be returned through an additional
   12641             :          parameter (by customizing set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag). */
   12642             :       /* No dynamic initialization entry has been created (presumably because
   12643             :          the return value isn't returned via a copy constructor), so create a
   12644             :          temporary and pass its address as an additional parameter, then
   12645             :          return its value as the value for the re-written comma node.
   12646             :          I.e., change:
   12647             :               func() 
   12648             :          to
   12649             :               (func(&temp), temp)
   12650             :       */
   12651             :       /* Code to perform this transformation must be added by the customer. */
   12652             :       temp_node = NULL;
   12653             :       unexpected_condition();
   12654             :     } else {
   12655             :       /* This only happens under a dik_class_result_via_ctor dynamic
   12656             :          initialization entry. */
   12657             :       temp_node = make_address_of_init_entity_node(ipdp,
   12658             :                                                    /*using_as_dest=*/FALSE);
   12659             :       temp_node = add_cast_if_necessary(temp_node,
   12660             :                                         make_pointer_type(
   12661             :                                              original_return_type(rout_type)));
   12662             :       /* Change the result type of the call to "void". */
   12663             :       expr->type = void_type();
   12664             :     }  /* if */
   12665             :     temp_node->next = prev_arg_node->next;
   12666             :     prev_arg_node->next = temp_node;
   12667             :   }  /* if */
   12668             :   /* See if we know the specific routine being called. */
   12669             :   routine = routine_from_function_expr(first_arg);
   12670             :   /* Lower the rest of the arguments. */
   12671             :   lower_arg_expr_list(arg_node, rout_type, routine, (a_param_type_ptr)NULL,
   12672             :                       /*maintain_sequencing=*/FALSE,
   12673             :                       (an_insert_location *)NULL);
   12674             :   if (routine != NULL) {
   12675             : #if IA64_ABI
   12676             :     if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
   12677             :         routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   12678             :       /* Transform calls to a constructor or destructor into calls to the
   12679             :          "complete" alternate entry point.  That entry point needs no
   12680             :          added implied arguments. */
   12681             :       routine = alternate_entry_point(routine, 
   12682             :                                       (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_complete,
   12683             :                                       /*define_now=*/FALSE);
   12684             :       first_arg->variant.routine.ptr = routine;
   12685             :       first_arg->type = make_pointer_type(routine->type);
   12686             :     }  /* if */
   12687             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   12688             :     /* If the call is of a constructor or destructor, add the implied
   12689             :        argument(s). */
   12690             :     add_implied_args_to_call(call_expr, routine);
   12691             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12692             :   }  /* if */
   12693             :   if (call_expr->variant.operation.is_virtual_call) {
   12694             :     /* Virtual function call. */
   12695             :     lower_virtual_function_call(call_expr);
   12696             :   } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_pm_call ||
   12697             :              op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_points_to_pm_call) {
   12698             :     /* Call of a function specified by a pointer-to-member. */
   12699             :     lower_pm_call(call_expr);
   12700             :   } else {
   12701             :     check_assertion((op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_call ||
   12702             :                      op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_member_call ||
   12703             :                      op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_points_to_member_call) &&
   12704             :                     is_operation_node(expr) &&
   12705             :                     expr->variant.operation.kind == op);
   12706             :     /* Normal member or non-member call. */
   12707             :     expr->variant.operation.kind = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_call;
   12708             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   12709             :     if (inlining_enabled) {
   12710             :       do_inlining_of_call(call_expr, statement, expr_has_been_detached);
   12711             :     }  /* if */
   12712             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   12713             :   }  /* if */
   12714             : }  /* lower_call */
   12715             : 
   12716             : 
   12717             : static an_expr_node_ptr expr_for_pmf_component(
   12718             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   12719             :                                               a_field_ptr      field,
   12720             :                                               a_boolean        need_copy,
   12721             :                                               a_boolean        vars_can_change)
   12722             : /*
   12723             : expr points to an expression for an rvalue of a pointer-to-member-function
   12724             : type.  It is either a constant (lowered or unlowered) or an expression that has
   12725             : already been lowered.  Generate an expression that is the value of the
   12726             : component of the pointer-to-member-function structure identified by field, and
   12727             : return a pointer to the expression.  If the input expression is an unlowered
   12728             : constant, the generated expression is just the proper constant value of the
   12729             : proper component.  Otherwise, it is an rvalue field selection of the proper
   12730             : field.  need_copy is TRUE if make_reusable_copy needs to be called on expr in
   12731             : the nonconstant case.  If so, vars_can_change indicates whether the values of
   12732             : variables can have changed since the first reference.
   12733             : */
   12734             : {
   12735             :   an_expr_node_ptr comp_expr;
   12736             : 
   12737             :   if (is_constant_node(expr) && node_constant_is(expr, ck_ptr_to_member)) {
   12738             :     a_targ_ptrdiff_t delta, idx, offset;
   12739             :     a_routine_ptr    routine;
   12740             : 
   12741             :     check_assertion(node_constant(expr)
   12742             :                                      ->variant.ptr_to_member.is_function_ptr);
   12743             :     /* Constant case.  Generate an expression for the proper constant
   12744             :        value of the proper component. */
   12745             :     repr_for_ptr_to_member_function_constant(node_constant(expr), &delta, &idx,
   12746             :                                              &routine, &offset);
   12747             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12748             :     if (field == mptr_i_field) {
   12749             :       /* The "i" (index) field. */
   12750             :       comp_expr = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(
   12751             :                                          (long)idx,
   12752             :                                          targ_virtual_function_index_int_kind);
   12753             :     } else 
   12754             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   12755             :     /* Do not add code here. */
   12756             :     if (field == mptr_d_field) {
   12757             :       /* The "d" (delta) field. */
   12758             :       comp_expr = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(
   12759             :                                          (long)delta,
   12760             :                                          targ_delta_int_kind);
   12761             :     } else {
   12762             :       /* The "f" (function) field has a value that is either the address of
   12763             :          a function or an offset.  The expression created has to be of
   12764             :          function-pointer type, however, so in the latter case cast the offset
   12765             :          to a function-pointer type. */
   12766             :       a_constant_ptr constant = local_constant();
   12767             : 
   12768             :       check_assertion(field == mptr_f_field);
   12769             :       if (routine == NULL) {
   12770             :         set_integer_constant(constant, (a_host_large_integer)offset,
   12771             :                              targ_delta_int_kind);
   12772             :       } else {
   12773             :         set_routine_address_constant(routine, constant,
   12774             :                                      /*set_address_taken_flag=*/TRUE);
   12775             :       }  /* if */
   12776             :       /* Cast the constant to a generic function pointer type. */
   12777             :       implicit_cast(constant, make_vptp_type());
   12778             :       /* Make an expression for the constant. */
   12779             :       comp_expr = alloc_node_for_constant(constant);
   12780             :       release_local_constant(&constant);
   12781             :     }  /* if */
   12782             :   } else {
   12783             :     a_variable_ptr  temp_var;
   12784             :     /* The general case -- not an unlowered pointer-to-member-function
   12785             :        constant.  Generate a field selection. */
   12786             :     if (is_constant_node(expr) &&
   12787             :         check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant(node_constant(expr),
   12788             :                                                  &temp_var)) {
   12789             :       /* This expression node is a pointer-to-member-function constant, which
   12790             :          has become a struct represented by a ck_aggregate constant.  Since a
   12791             :          ck_aggregate constant is not allowed here, use the value of a
   12792             :          temporary variable initialized with the ck_aggregate constant. */
   12793             :       set_expr_node_kind(expr, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_variable);
   12794             :       node_variable(expr) = temp_var;
   12795             :       if (!identical_types(expr->type, temp_var->type)) {
   12796             :         /* Preserve the temporary's type if there's a change in type. */
   12797             :         expr->orig_lvalue_type = temp_var->type;
   12798             :       }  /* if */
   12799             :     } else if (need_copy) {
   12800             :       expr = make_reusable_copy(expr, vars_can_change);
   12801             :     }  /* if */
   12802             :     comp_expr = node_to_select_field_from_rvalue(expr, field);
   12803             :     /* For the integral cases, do integral promotion if necessary.  This is
   12804             :        harmless for non-integral cases. */
   12805             :     comp_expr = integral_promote_node(comp_expr);
   12806             :   }  /* if */
   12807             :   return comp_expr;
   12808             : }  /* expr_for_pmf_component */
   12809             : 
   12810             : 
   12811             : static void lower_pm_comparison(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   12812             :                                 a_boolean        operand1_lowered)
   12813             : /*
   12814             : Lower comparison of two pointers to members.  The operands of the expression
   12815             : are usually unlowered.  When operand1_lowered is TRUE, however, the
   12816             : first operand (but not the second) has been lowered already.
   12817             : */
   12818             : {
   12819             :   an_expr_node_ptr select1_node, select2_node, compare_i_node;
   12820             :   an_expr_node_ptr op1_node, op2_node, compare_i0_node, compare_d_node;
   12821             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12822             :   an_expr_node_ptr compare_f_node;
   12823             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   12824             :   an_expr_node_ptr and_node, or_node;
   12825             :   a_type_ptr       int_type, orig_expr_type = expr->type;
   12826             :   a_boolean        ne_case = (expr->variant.operation.kind ==
   12827             :                                                (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne);
   12828             :   a_boolean        vars_can_change, ia64_abi_variant_pmf = FALSE;
   12829             :   a_field_ptr      mptr_if_field;
   12830             : 
   12831             :   /* Determine whether we are using the variant pointer-to-member-function
   12832             :      representation in the IA-64 ABI. */
   12833             : #if IA64_ABI
   12834             :   ia64_abi_variant_pmf = targ_ia64_abi_use_variant_ptr_to_member_function_repr;
   12835             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12836             :   op1_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12837             :   op2_node = op1_node->next;
   12838             :   if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(op1_node->type)) {
   12839             :     /* Pointer-to-member-function comparison.  Turns into
   12840             :          (op1.i == op2.i) && (op1.i == 0 || (op1.d == op2.d && op1.f == op2.f))
   12841             :        for the == case.  The != case is similar, transformed by DeMorgan's
   12842             :        law.  Note that op1 and op2 are rvalues. */
   12843             :     /* The IA-64 ABI version is
   12844             :          (op1.f == op2.f) && (op1.f == 0 || op1.d == op2.d)
   12845             :        In the variant for architectures where the low-order bit of
   12846             :        a function address can be 1, the test is
   12847             :          (op1.f == op2.f) && ((op1.f == 0 && (((op1.d | op2.d) & 1) == 0))
   12848             :                                          || op1.d == op2.d)
   12849             :     */
   12850             :     int_type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   12851             :     /* Make sure the struct type used to represent a pointer-to-member-function
   12852             :        is allocated. */
   12853             :     (void)make_mptr_type();
   12854             :     /* The "i"  (Cfront_like ABI) or "f" (IA-64 ABI) field will be tested
   12855             :        for null. */
   12856             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12857             :     mptr_if_field = mptr_i_field;
   12858             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12859             :     mptr_if_field = mptr_f_field;
   12860             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12861             :     /* Lower the operand nodes if they aren't constants.  If they are
   12862             :        constants, leave them alone and generate code that compares directly
   12863             :        against the components of the pointer-to-member structure. */
   12864             :     if (!is_constant_node(op1_node) && !operand1_lowered) {
   12865             :       lower_expr(op1_node);
   12866             :     }  /* if */
   12867             :     if (!is_constant_node(op2_node)) {
   12868             :       lower_expr(op2_node);
   12869             :     } else {
   12870             :       /* If op2_node is constant and op1_node is not, swap the operands to
   12871             :          make the tests for constants below easier. */
   12872             :       if (!is_constant_node(op1_node)) {
   12873             :         op1_node = op2_node;
   12874             :         op2_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   12875             :       }  /* if */
   12876             :     }  /* if */
   12877             :     /* Make op1.i and op2.i.  (For IA-64, the "f" field is used instead.) */
   12878             :     select1_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op1_node, 
   12879             :                                           mptr_if_field,
   12880             :                                           /*need_copy=*/FALSE,
   12881             :                                           /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12882             :     select2_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op2_node, 
   12883             :                                           mptr_if_field,
   12884             :                                           /*need_copy=*/FALSE,
   12885             :                                           /*vars_can_change=*/FALSE);
   12886             :     select1_node->next = select2_node;
   12887             :     /* Make "op1.i == op2.i" (or "!=" for the ne_case). */
   12888             :     /* "op1.f == op2.f" (or "!=") for the IA-64 ABI case. */
   12889             :     compare_i_node = make_operator_node(
   12890             :                           (an_expr_operator_kind)(ne_case ? eok_ne : eok_eq),
   12891             :                           int_type, select1_node);
   12892             :     if (!ia64_abi_variant_pmf &&
   12893             :         is_constant_node(select1_node) &&
   12894             :         constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(
   12895             :                                               node_constant(select1_node)) &&
   12896             :         is_false_constant(node_constant(select1_node))) {
   12897             :       /* If op1.i is zero, the whole expression reduces to
   12898             :            0 == op2.i
   12899             :          (or != for the ne_case).  This is a test against a null
   12900             :          pointer to member constant.  Note that if op2.i was zero initially,
   12901             :          the operands were swapped. */
   12902             :       /* In the IA-64 ABI, the "f" field is tested. */
   12903             :       overwrite_node(expr, compare_i_node);
   12904             :     } else {
   12905             :       /* Not a comparison against null. */
   12906             :       vars_can_change = node_has_side_effects(op1_node, (a_boolean *)NULL) ||
   12907             :                         node_has_side_effects(op2_node, (a_boolean *)NULL);
   12908             :       select1_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op1_node, 
   12909             :                                             mptr_if_field,
   12910             :                                             /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12911             :                                             vars_can_change);
   12912             :       if (!ia64_abi_variant_pmf &&
   12913             :           is_constant_node(select1_node)) {
   12914             :         /* op1.i is constant, but it's not zero (that case was handled
   12915             :            above).  So the "op1.i == 0 ||" part of the expression is
   12916             :            not needed. */
   12917             :         compare_i0_node = NULL;
   12918             :       } else {
   12919             : #if IA64_ABI
   12920             :         /* Cast the function pointer to a ptrdiff_t. */
   12921             :         select1_node = add_cast(select1_node,
   12922             :                                 type_after_integral_promotion(
   12923             :                                        integer_type(targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind)));
   12924             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12925             :         /* Make "op1.i == 0" (or "!= 0" for the ne_case). */
   12926             :         select1_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(0L,
   12927             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12928             :                                          targ_virtual_function_index_int_kind
   12929             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   12930             :                                                       targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind
   12931             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   12932             :                                                                              );
   12933             :         compare_i0_node = make_operator_node
   12934             :                         ((an_expr_operator_kind) (ne_case ? eok_ne : eok_eq),
   12935             :                          int_type, select1_node);
   12936             :       }  /* if */
   12937             :       if (ia64_abi_variant_pmf) {
   12938             :         /* Add code for "&& (((op1.d | op2.d) & 1) == 0)".  This checks
   12939             :            that the low-order bit (indicating virtual function or not) is
   12940             :            clear in both entries.  Otherwise, we might have a pointer
   12941             :            to member in which "f" is zero to indicate a zero offset
   12942             :            in the virtual function table for a virtual function case.
   12943             :            This applies in the variant of the IA-64 ABI for architectures
   12944             :            where the address of a function can have the low-order bit set. */
   12945             :         select1_node = integral_promote_node(
   12946             :                                 expr_for_pmf_component(op1_node, mptr_d_field,
   12947             :                                                        /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12948             :                                                        vars_can_change));
   12949             :         select1_node->next = integral_promote_node(
   12950             :                                 expr_for_pmf_component(op2_node, mptr_d_field,
   12951             :                                                        /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12952             :                                                        vars_can_change));
   12953             :         select1_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_or, 
   12954             :                                           select1_node->type, 
   12955             :                                           select1_node);
   12956             :         select1_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(
   12957             :                                                       1L,
   12958             :                                                       targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   12959             :         select1_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_and, 
   12960             :                                           select1_node->type,
   12961             :                                           select1_node);
   12962             :         select1_node->next = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(
   12963             :                                                       0L,
   12964             :                                                       targ_ptrdiff_t_int_kind);
   12965             :         select1_node = make_operator_node
   12966             :                            ((an_expr_operator_kind)(ne_case ? eok_ne : eok_eq),
   12967             :                             int_type, select1_node);
   12968             :         compare_i0_node->next = select1_node;
   12969             :         compare_i0_node = make_operator_node
   12970             :                         ((an_expr_operator_kind)(ne_case ? eok_lor : eok_land),
   12971             :                          int_type, compare_i0_node);
   12972             :       }  /* if */
   12973             :       /* Make "op1.d == op2.d" (or "!=" for the ne_case). */
   12974             :       select1_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op1_node, mptr_d_field,
   12975             :                                             /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12976             :                                             vars_can_change);
   12977             :       select2_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op2_node, mptr_d_field,
   12978             :                                             /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12979             :                                             vars_can_change);
   12980             :       select1_node->next = select2_node;
   12981             :       compare_d_node = make_operator_node
   12982             :                         ((an_expr_operator_kind) (ne_case ? eok_ne : eok_eq),
   12983             :                          int_type, select1_node);
   12984             : #if !IA64_ABI
   12985             :       /* Make "op1.f == op2.f" (or "!=" for the ne_case). */
   12986             :       select1_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op1_node, mptr_f_field,
   12987             :                                             /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12988             :                                             vars_can_change);
   12989             :       select2_node = expr_for_pmf_component(op2_node, mptr_f_field,
   12990             :                                             /*need_copy=*/TRUE,
   12991             :                                             vars_can_change);
   12992             :       select1_node->next = select2_node;
   12993             :       compare_f_node = make_operator_node
   12994             :                         ((an_expr_operator_kind) (ne_case ? eok_ne : eok_eq),
   12995             :                          int_type, select1_node);
   12996             :       /* Make "(op1.d == op2.d && op1.f == op2.f)" (or "||" for the
   12997             :          ne_case). */
   12998             :       compare_d_node->next = compare_f_node;
   12999             :       and_node = make_operator_node
   13000             :                        ((an_expr_operator_kind) (ne_case ? eok_lor : eok_land),
   13001             :                         int_type, compare_d_node);
   13002             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   13003             :       and_node = compare_d_node;
   13004             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   13005             :       /* Make "(op1.i == 0 || (op1.d == op2.d && op1.f == op2.f))" (or "&&"
   13006             :          for the ne_case). */
   13007             :       /* In the IA-64 case, "(op1.f == 0 || op1.d == op2.d)", or
   13008             :          simply "(op1.d == op2.d)" in the variant form. */
   13009             :       if (compare_i0_node == NULL) {
   13010             :         /* The "or" was optimized away -- see above. */
   13011             :         or_node = and_node;
   13012             :       } else {
   13013             :         compare_i0_node->next = and_node;
   13014             :         or_node = make_operator_node
   13015             :                        ((an_expr_operator_kind) (ne_case ? eok_land : eok_lor),
   13016             :                         int_type, compare_i0_node);
   13017             :       }  /* if */
   13018             :       /* Overwrite the original node with the "&&" operator to make the full
   13019             :          expression ("||" for the ne_case). */
   13020             :       compare_i_node->next = or_node;
   13021             :       set_node_operator(expr,
   13022             :                         (an_expr_operator_kind)(ne_case ? eok_lor : eok_land),
   13023             :                         or_node->type, /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE, compare_i_node);
   13024             :     }  /* if */
   13025             :   } else {
   13026             :     /* Pointer-to-data-member comparison: turns into integer comparison. */
   13027             :     if (!operand1_lowered) {
   13028             :       lower_expr(op1_node);
   13029             :     }  /* if */
   13030             :     lower_expr(op2_node);
   13031             :     if (!targ_ptr_to_data_member_is_promoted_integral_type()) {
   13032             :       op1_node->next = NULL;
   13033             :       op1_node = integral_promote_pm_node(op1_node);
   13034             :       expr->variant.operation.operands = op1_node;
   13035             :       op2_node = integral_promote_pm_node(op2_node);
   13036             :       op1_node->next = op2_node;
   13037             :     }  /* if */
   13038             :     expr->variant.operation.kind = ne_case ? (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne :
   13039             :                                              (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_eq;
   13040             :   }  /* if */
   13041             :   /* Restore the "bool" type of the expression if it has one, to 
   13042             :      cause a later rewrite step (adding a cast) if appropriate. */
   13043             :   expr->type = orig_expr_type;
   13044             : }  /* lower_pm_comparison */
   13045             : 
   13046             : 
   13047             : static void lower_pm_field(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13048             : /*
   13049             : Lower a pointer-to-member selection (both source form x->*pm and x.*pm)
   13050             : of a data member.  The operands of the expression have already been lowered.
   13051             : The expression can be an lvalue or an rvalue.
   13052             : */
   13053             : {
   13054             :   an_expr_node_ptr       pdm_node, plus_node, object_node;
   13055             :   an_expr_node_ptr       cast_node; /*lint !e578*/
   13056             : #if !IA64_ABI
   13057             :   an_expr_node_ptr       one_node, minus_node;
   13058             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   13059             : 
   13060             :   /* p->*pdm is lowered to *((member-type *)(((char *)p)+(pdm-1))).
   13061             :      pdm, the pointer to data member, has already been turned into an
   13062             :      integral type.  The "-1" reverses the increment done to reserve 0
   13063             :      as a NULL pointer to data member. */
   13064             :   /* In the IA-64 ABI, *((member-type *)((char *)p + pdm)). */
   13065             :   /* In unlowered IL, the first argument is a class selector (class lvalue,
   13066             :      class rvalue, or pointer to class); this argument has already been
   13067             :      converted into a pointer to class by
   13068             :      lower_class_selector_operand_if_any.  */
   13069             :   object_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   13070             :   check_assertion(is_pointer_type(object_node->type) &&
   13071             :                   is_class_struct_union_type(type_pointed_to(
   13072             :                                                           object_node->type)));
   13073             :   pdm_node = object_node->next;
   13074             :   object_node->next = NULL;
   13075             :   /* Cast the object pointer node to "char *" to avoid scaling on the
   13076             :      pointer addition. */
   13077             :   cast_node = add_cast_to_char_star(object_node);
   13078             :   /* Make the node for "pdm-1". */
   13079             :   if (!targ_ptr_to_data_member_is_promoted_integral_type()) {
   13080             :     pdm_node = integral_promote_pm_node(pdm_node);
   13081             :   }  /* if */
   13082             : #if !IA64_ABI
   13083             :   one_node = node_for_promoted_integer_constant(1L,
   13084             :                                              targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind);
   13085             :   pdm_node->next = one_node;
   13086             :   minus_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subtract,
   13087             :                                   pdm_node->type, pdm_node);
   13088             :   /* Make the pointer addition node "((char *)p)+(pdm-1)". */
   13089             :   cast_node->next = minus_node;
   13090             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   13091             :   cast_node->next = pdm_node;
   13092             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   13093             :   plus_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   13094             :                                  cast_node->type, cast_node);
   13095             :   /* Make sure the end result has the same type and lvalueness as the
   13096             :      original expression. */
   13097             :   plus_node = add_cast_if_necessary(plus_node, make_pointer_type(expr->type));
   13098             :   plus_node = add_indirection_to_node(plus_node);
   13099             :   if (!expr->is_lvalue) {
   13100             :     plus_node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(plus_node);
   13101             :   }  /* if */
   13102             :   check_assertion(il_identical_types(expr->type, plus_node->type) &&
   13103             :                   expr->is_lvalue == plus_node->is_lvalue);
   13104             :   overwrite_node(expr, plus_node);
   13105             : }  /* lower_pm_field */
   13106             : 
   13107             : 
   13108             : static void set_address_taken_if_necessary(an_expr_node_ptr node)
   13109             : /*
   13110             : As a result of re-writing expressions (e.g., &(0, x) becoming (0, &x)), the
   13111             : specified operation node has just been created from two previously distinct
   13112             : nodes; set the address_taken flag on the node's operand if that is now
   13113             : appropriate.
   13114             : */
   13115             : {
   13116             :   an_expr_operator_kind op = node->variant.operation.kind;
   13117             :   an_expr_node_ptr      operand = node->variant.operation.operands;
   13118             : 
   13119             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(node) &&
   13120             :                   op != (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_reference_to);
   13121             :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_address_of ||
   13122             :       op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_array_to_pointer) {
   13123             :     /* Set the address taken flag if the operand is a variable or routine. */
   13124             :     set_address_taken_for_variable_or_routine_expr(operand);
   13125             :   }  /* if */
   13126             : }  /* set_address_taken_if_necessary */
   13127             : 
   13128             : 
   13129             : static void optimize_node_if_possible(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13130             : /*
   13131             : Perform some simple optimizations on expr if possible.  Note that operations
   13132             : are optimized regardless of whether or not the operations are compiler
   13133             : generated.  This routine operates only on the current node (and not recursively
   13134             : throughout the entire expression).
   13135             : */
   13136             : {
   13137             :   if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   13138             :     an_expr_node_ptr      child = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   13139             :     if (is_operation_node(child)) {
   13140             :       an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   13141             :       an_expr_node_ptr      gchild = child->variant.operation.operands;
   13142             :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_address_of) {
   13143             :         if (node_operator_is(child, eok_indirect)) {
   13144             :           check_assertion(il_identical_types(expr->type, gchild->type));
   13145             :           /* Optimize "&*x" operation. */
   13146             :           overwrite_node(expr, gchild);
   13147             :         } else if (node_operator_is(child, eok_subscript)) {
   13148             :           /* Optimize &x[y] to x + y. */
   13149             :           child->next = expr->next;
   13150             :           set_node_operator(child, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd,
   13151             :                             expr->type, expr->is_lvalue, gchild);
   13152             :           overwrite_node(expr, child);
   13153             :         } else if (node_operator_is(child, eok_lvalue_adjust) &&
   13154             :                    is_operation_node(gchild) &&
   13155             :                    node_operator_is(gchild, eok_indirect)) {
   13156             :           /* Optimize an "&eok_lvalue_adjust*x" operation to a cast of x to
   13157             :              the type of the expression. */
   13158             :           overwrite_node(expr, add_cast(gchild->variant.operation.operands,
   13159             :                                         expr->type));
   13160             :         }  /* if */
   13161             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_indirect &&
   13162             :                  node_operator_is(child, eok_address_of) &&
   13163             :                  il_identical_types(expr->type, gchild->type)) {
   13164             :         if (expr->is_lvalue == gchild->is_lvalue) {
   13165             :           /* Optimize "*&x" operation. */
   13166             :           overwrite_node(expr, gchild);
   13167             :         } else if (!expr->is_lvalue && gchild->is_lvalue) {
   13168             :           /* expr has been converted to an rvalue, convert the new expression
   13169             :              (after removing "*" and "&" operations) to an rvalue as well. */
   13170             :           overwrite_node(expr, rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(gchild));
   13171             :         }  /* if */
   13172             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_points_to_field &&
   13173             :                  node_operator_is(child, eok_address_of)) {
   13174             :         /* Optimize "(&x)->y" to "x.y". */
   13175             :         rewrite_points_to_field_as_dot_field(expr);
   13176             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_field &&
   13177             :                  node_operator_is(child, eok_indirect)) {
   13178             :         /* Optimize "(*x).y" to "x->y". */
   13179             :         rewrite_dot_field_as_points_to_field(expr);
   13180             :       } /* if */
   13181             :     } /* if */
   13182             :   } /* if */
   13183             : }  /* optimize_node_if_possible */
   13184             : 
   13185             : #if LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST
   13186             : 
   13187             : static void lower_operation_on_const_string_if_possible(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13188             : /*
   13189             : Check to see if the expression is an enk_operation that operates on a
   13190             : const qualified lvalue string literal.  If it is, then this routine looks for
   13191             : some special cases where it can overwrite the operation with an eok_cast.
   13192             : In C, string literals are not const qualified, and the ck_string constant will
   13193             : be lowered to a non-const qualified type (in lower_constant).  This routine is
   13194             : an optimization -- the generic lowering process will ensure that the general
   13195             : case is handled properly.
   13196             : */
   13197             : {
   13198             :   an_expr_node_ptr  operand;
   13199             :   a_type_ptr        orig_expr_type;
   13200             :   a_type_ptr        orig_operand_type;
   13201             : 
   13202             :   if (string_literals_are_const && is_operation_node(expr)) {
   13203             :     operand = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   13204             :     if (is_constant_node(operand) &&
   13205             :         operand->is_lvalue && node_constant_is(operand, ck_string)) {
   13206             :       /* Remove const qualifier from expression and operand.  lower_constant
   13207             :          will remove constness from the ck_string. */
   13208             :       orig_expr_type = expr->type;
   13209             :       orig_operand_type = operand->type;
   13210             :       operand->type = make_unqualified_type(orig_operand_type);
   13211             :       switch (expr->variant.operation.kind) {
   13212             :         case eok_address_of:
   13213             :         case eok_reference_to:
   13214             :           expr->type = make_pointer_type(operand->type);
   13215             :           break;
   13216             :         case eok_array_to_pointer:
   13217             :           expr->type = make_pointer_type(array_element_type(operand->type));
   13218             :           break;
   13219             :         case eok_lvalue_cast:
   13220             :         case eok_lvalue_adjust:
   13221             :         case eok_cast:
   13222             :         case eok_ref_cast:
   13223             :         default:
   13224             :           /* Leave these as is. */
   13225             :           break;
   13226             :       }  /* switch */
   13227             :       if (expr->type != orig_expr_type) {
   13228             :         /* The type of the expression has changed; a cast is necessary. */
   13229             :         overwrite_node(expr, add_cast(copy_node(expr), orig_expr_type));
   13230             :       }  /* if */
   13231             :     }  /* if */
   13232             :   }  /* if */
   13233             : }  /* lower_operation_on_const_string_if_possible */
   13234             : 
   13235             : #endif /* LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST */
   13236             : #if LOWER_LVALUE_RETURNING_OPERATIONS
   13237             : 
   13238             : static void rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(an_expr_node_ptr expr);
   13239             : 
   13240             : static void lower_operations_returning_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue(
   13241             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13242             : /*
   13243             : Transform lvalue-returning assignments, prefix ++/-- operators, and "?" and
   13244             : "," operators to valid C.  If the expression passed in is not one of those
   13245             : it is left alone.  Note that "?" and "," lvalue-returning operations aren't
   13246             : handled directly at this level; they're handled in the context of their
   13247             : parent operation.  Only called for enk_operation nodes.
   13248             : */
   13249             : {
   13250             :   an_expr_operator_kind op, child_op;
   13251             :   an_expr_node_ptr      child1;
   13252             :   a_boolean             first_expr_case;
   13253             : 
   13254             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
   13255             :   op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   13256             :   child1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   13257             :   /* Look at the first operand of this operation (or the second operand of
   13258             :      an eok_bassign) to see if it is an lvalue-returning "?" or ",". */
   13259             :   if ((first_expr_case =
   13260             :        is_operation_node(child1) &&
   13261             :        (child1->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue &&
   13262             :         ((child_op = child1->variant.operation.kind) ==
   13263             :                                         (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question ||
   13264             :          child_op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_vector_question ||
   13265             :          child_op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma))) ||
   13266             :        (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_bassign &&
   13267             :         is_operation_node(child1->next) &&
   13268             :         child1->next->
   13269             :                     variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue &&
   13270             :         ((child_op = child1->next->variant.operation.kind) ==
   13271             :                                         (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question ||
   13272             :          child_op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma))) { /*lint !e820*/
   13273             :     if (op != (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma) {
   13274             :       /* The first operand of expr is an lvalue-returning "?" or "," or the
   13275             :          second operand of an eok_bassign is an lvalue-returning "?" or ",". */
   13276             :       an_expr_node_ptr child2 = child1->next;
   13277             :       /* "gchild" stands for "grandchild". */
   13278             :       an_expr_node_ptr gchild1 = (first_expr_case ?
   13279             :                                            child1->variant.operation.operands :
   13280             :                                            child2->variant.operation.operands);
   13281             :       an_expr_node_ptr gchild2 = gchild1->next;
   13282             :       an_expr_node_ptr gchild3, newop1, newop2;
   13283             :       an_expr_node_ptr copy_init = NULL, node_to_copy;
   13284             :       a_type_ptr       expr_type = expr->type;
   13285             :       a_boolean        orig_expr_result_is_not_used = expr->result_is_not_used;
   13286             :       a_boolean        orig_expr_is_lvalue = expr->is_lvalue;
   13287             :       if (child_op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question ||
   13288             :           child_op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_vector_question) {
   13289             :         /* Lvalue "?" rewrite.  Change
   13290             :              ((g1 ? g2 : g3) = c2)
   13291             :                              S
   13292             :            to
   13293             :              (g1 ? (g2 = c2) : (g3 = c2))
   13294             :                  D     D           D
   13295             :            The operations marked "D" are lvalue operations iff the operation
   13296             :            marked "S" is an lvalue operation.  The operation indicated as
   13297             :            "=" can in fact be any operation (e.g., simple or complex
   13298             :            assignment, prefix ++/--, field selection, cast).  c2 isn't
   13299             :            present for unary operations. */
   13300             :         /* The eok_bassign case is changed from:
   13301             :              eok_bassign(c1, (g1 ? g2 : g3))
   13302             :            to
   13303             :              (g1 ? eok_bassign(c1, g2) : eok_bassign(c1, g3))
   13304             :            */
   13305             :         gchild3 = gchild2->next;
   13306             :         node_to_copy = (first_expr_case ? child2 : child1);
   13307             :         if (node_to_copy != NULL && has_statement_expression(node_to_copy)) {
   13308             :           /* Statement expressions cannot be copied with copy_expr_tree.
   13309             :              Hence we evaluate such expressions into a temporary and copy
   13310             :              the reference to the temporary instead. */
   13311             :           copy_init = node_to_copy;
   13312             :           node_to_copy= assign_expr_to_temp_and_make_expr_for_reuse(copy_init);
   13313             :         }  /* if */
   13314             :         newop1 = copy_node(expr);
   13315             :         newop2 = copy_node(expr);
   13316             :         if (first_expr_case) {
   13317             :           /* Build (g2 = c2). */
   13318             :           newop1->variant.operation.operands = gchild2;
   13319             :           gchild2->next = node_to_copy;
   13320             :           /* Build (g3 = c2) using a copy of c2. */
   13321             :           newop2->variant.operation.operands = gchild3;
   13322             :           gchild3->next = (node_to_copy != NULL) ?
   13323             :                                   copy_expr_tree(node_to_copy, CE_NO_OPTIONS) :
   13324             :                                   NULL;
   13325             :         } else {
   13326             :           /* Build eok_bassign(c1, g2). */
   13327             :           newop1->variant.operation.operands = node_to_copy;
   13328             :           node_to_copy->next = gchild2;
   13329             :           gchild2->next = NULL;
   13330             :           /* Build eok_bassign(c1, g3) using a copy of c1. */
   13331             :           newop2->variant.operation.operands =
   13332             :                                    copy_expr_tree(node_to_copy, CE_NO_OPTIONS);
   13333             :           newop2->variant.operation.operands->next = gchild3;
   13334             :         }  /* if */
   13335             :         /* Replace the original top node with a "?" node. */
   13336             :         gchild1->next = newop1;
   13337             :         newop1->next = newop2;
   13338             :         overwrite_node(expr, first_expr_case ? child1 : child2);
   13339             :       } else {
   13340             :         /* Lvalue "," rewrite.  Change
   13341             :              ((g1 , g2) = c2)
   13342             :                         S
   13343             :            to
   13344             :              (g1 , (g2 = c2))
   13345             :                  D     D
   13346             :            The operations marked "D" are lvalue operations iff the operation
   13347             :            marked "S" is an lvalue operation.  The operation indicated as
   13348             :            "=" can in fact be any operation (e.g., simple or complex
   13349             :            assignment, prefix ++/--, field selection).  c2 isn't present
   13350             :            for unary operations. */
   13351             :         /* The eok_bassign case is changed from:
   13352             :              eok_bassign(c1, (g1, g2))
   13353             :            to
   13354             :              (g1, eok_bassign(c1, g2))
   13355             :            */
   13356             :         newop1 = copy_node(expr);
   13357             :         newop2 = NULL;
   13358             :         if (first_expr_case) {
   13359             :           /* Build (g2 = c2). */
   13360             :           newop1->variant.operation.operands = gchild2;
   13361             :           gchild2->next = child2;
   13362             :         } else {
   13363             :           /* Build eok_bassign(c1, g2). */
   13364             :           newop1->variant.operation.operands = child1;
   13365             :           child1->next = gchild2;
   13366             :         }  /* if */
   13367             :         /* Replace the original top node with a "," node. */
   13368             :         gchild1->next = newop1;
   13369             :         overwrite_node(expr, first_expr_case ? child1 : child2);
   13370             :       }  /* if */
   13371             :       if (!orig_expr_is_lvalue) {
   13372             :         /* The "S" above was an rvalue.  Change the result node to an
   13373             :            rvalue. */
   13374             :         expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = FALSE;
   13375             :         expr->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   13376             :       }  /* if */
   13377             :       /* If a temporary was introduced to hold the value of child2/child1,
   13378             :          insert its initialization now. */
   13379             :       if (copy_init != NULL) {
   13380             :         an_insert_location  insert_loc;
   13381             :         set_expr_insert_location(expr, &insert_loc);
   13382             :         insert_expr(copy_init, &insert_loc);
   13383             :       }  /* if */
   13384             :       /* As a result of the re-writing above, newop1 and newop2 may have
   13385             :          sequences of operators that haven't been seen in tandem during
   13386             :          previous lowering of these operators.  It is possible that these
   13387             :          sequences of operators now represent an opportunity for optimization
   13388             :          that wasn't present before, or that they represent an
   13389             :          lvalue-returning operation that needs to be further rewritten.
   13390             :          Check for each of these cases. */
   13391             :       /* Additionally, make sure the address_taken flag is set properly. */
   13392             :       set_address_taken_if_necessary(newop1);
   13393             :       optimize_node_if_possible(newop1);
   13394             :       if (is_operation_node(newop1)) {
   13395             :         lower_operations_returning_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue(newop1);
   13396             :       }  /* if */
   13397             :       if (newop2 != NULL) {
   13398             :         set_address_taken_if_necessary(newop2);
   13399             :         optimize_node_if_possible(newop2);
   13400             :         if (is_operation_node(newop2)) {
   13401             :           lower_operations_returning_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue(newop2);
   13402             :         }  /* if */
   13403             :       }  /* if */
   13404             :       /* Restore the original expression type.  This matters when the
   13405             :          operation above the "?" or "," is a cast. */
   13406             :       expr->type = expr_type;
   13407             :       if (orig_expr_result_is_not_used) {
   13408             :         /* Record that the expression is not used.  This does something
   13409             :            only in rare cases (e.g., a void cast above an lvalue
   13410             :            assignment). */
   13411             :         set_expr_result_not_used(expr);
   13412             :       }  /* if */
   13413             :     } else {
   13414             :       /* An lvalue-returning "?" or "," operation as the first operand of
   13415             :          a "," operation.  These can arise during lowering when a node
   13416             :          is turned into a "," operation and its first operand is an lvalue.
   13417             :          Fix this here by rewriting this discarded lvalue as an rvalue. */
   13418             :       check_assertion(child1->result_is_not_used);
   13419             :       rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(child1);
   13420             :     }  /* if */
   13421             :   } else if (expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue&&
   13422             :              (op != (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question &&
   13423             :               op != (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_vector_question &&
   13424             :               op != (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma)) {
   13425             :     an_expr_node_ptr child2 = child1->next;
   13426             :     an_expr_node_ptr newop;
   13427             :     a_boolean        vars_can_change;
   13428             :     /* expr is an lvalue-returning operation that is not a "?" or ",".
   13429             :        Rewrite
   13430             :          x = y
   13431             :        using an rvalue-returning operator as
   13432             :          ((x = y), x)
   13433             :        The comma operator in the rewrite is lvalue-returning and will
   13434             :        be rewritten in its turn later.  If necessary, make a reusable copy
   13435             :        of x.  The same kind of rewrite is done for the prefix ++/-- case. */
   13436             :     /* Make a copy of the assignment node that is an rvalue
   13437             :        assignment.  The same process works for the prefix ++/-- case
   13438             :        because the second operand is not touched. */
   13439             :     newop = copy_node(expr);
   13440             :     /* Drop type qualifiers on the result type. */
   13441             :     newop->type = f_skip_typerefs(expr->type);
   13442             :     newop->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = FALSE;
   13443             :     newop->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   13444             :     /* newop->result_is_not_used is cleared by copy_type, as it should be. */
   13445             :     /* For assignments, see if the source expression can have side
   13446             :        effects on the variables used in the destination expression.
   13447             :        Since the operation itself is an assignment, it's possible that
   13448             :        the assignment could change something used in the determination
   13449             :        of the address of child1, though that seems to require something
   13450             :        very strange like ((i <? j) = 2) = 3. */
   13451             :     vars_can_change = !is_invariant_expr(child1, /*vars_can_change=*/TRUE,
   13452             :                                        /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE);
   13453             :     if (child2 != NULL && !vars_can_change) {
   13454             :       vars_can_change = node_has_side_effects(child2, (a_boolean *)NULL);
   13455             :     }  /* if */
   13456             :     /* Attach a copy of the lvalue to the assignment node, as the
   13457             :        second operand of the comma operator. */
   13458             :     newop->next = make_lvalue_reusable_copy(child1, vars_can_change);
   13459             :     /* newop->next->result_is_not_used is properly FALSE, since the
   13460             :        comma expression has non-void type (it's an lvalue). */
   13461             :     /* Change the original node to an lvalue-returning comma node. */
   13462             :     set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   13463             :                       expr->type, expr->is_lvalue, newop);
   13464             :   }  /* if */
   13465             : }  /* lower_operations_returning_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue */
   13466             : 
   13467             : #endif /* LOWER_LVALUE_RETURNING_OPERATIONS */
   13468             : 
   13469             : static void lower_operation_type_kind(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   13470             : /*
   13471             : Lower the type_kind of the operation node as appropriate.
   13472             : */
   13473             : {
   13474             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
   13475             :   switch (expr->variant.operation.type_kind) {
   13476             : #if LOWER_FIXED_POINT
   13477             :     case tk_fixed_point:
   13478             :       /* Fixed-point assignment becomes integer assignment. */
   13479             :       expr->variant.operation.type_kind = (a_type_kind)tk_integer;
   13480             :       break;
   13481             : #endif /* LOWER_FIXED_POINT */
   13482             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   13483             :     case tk_complex:
   13484             :       /* Complex assignment becomes structure assignment. */
   13485             :       expr->variant.operation.type_kind = (a_type_kind)tk_struct;
   13486             :       break;
   13487             :     case tk_imaginary:
   13488             :       /* Imaginary types are lowered to float types. */
   13489             :       expr->variant.operation.type_kind = (a_type_kind)tk_float;
   13490             :       break;
   13491             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   13492             :     case tk_ptr_to_member:
   13493             :       /* Pointer-to-member assignment turns into integer assignment for
   13494             :          pointers to data members, struct assignment for pointers to member
   13495             :          functions. */
   13496             :       if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(
   13497             :                                      expr->variant.operation.operands->type)) {
   13498             :         expr->variant.operation.type_kind = (a_type_kind)tk_struct;
   13499             :       } else {
   13500             :         expr->variant.operation.type_kind = (a_type_kind)tk_integer;
   13501             :       }  /* if */
   13502             :       break;
   13503             :     case tk_nullptr:
   13504             :       /* A nullptr type is lowered to "void *" which corresponds to a lowered
   13505             :          type kind of tk_pointer. */
   13506             :       expr->variant.operation.type_kind = (a_type_kind)tk_pointer;
   13507             :       break;
   13508             :     default:
   13509             :       /* Nothing to do. */
   13510             :       break;
   13511             :   }  /* switch */
   13512             : }  /* lower_operation_type_kind */
   13513             : 
   13514             : 
   13515             : static void rewrite_nullptr_expr_if_necessary(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13516             : /*
   13517             : Called during the lowering post pass to replace rvalue expressions having a
   13518             : nullptr type with an equivalent zero constant (pointer to member cases have
   13519             : been handled during lowering).  Expressions that have side-effects are
   13520             : maintained (as the first operand of a comma operation).  Must not be called
   13521             : as part of a pre-order expression traversal (infinite loop would occur when
   13522             : expression is changed into a comma operation).  This routine can't
   13523             : introduce any lvalue-returning operations (the lowering post pass has
   13524             : already processed these).
   13525             : */
   13526             : {
   13527             :   if (!expr->is_lvalue &&
   13528             :       is_or_was_nullptr_type(expr->type) &&
   13529             :       !is_constant_node(expr) &&
   13530             :       expr->kind != (an_expr_node_kind)enk_field &&
   13531             :       !expr->result_is_not_used) {
   13532             :     /* Replace an rvalue expression having a nullptr type with a constant
   13533             :        zero of the right type (such an expression could contain
   13534             :        uninitialized fields or variables, so we don't want to use its
   13535             :        value).  Constants don't need to be re-written.  Fields aren't
   13536             :        rewritten (but the selection operation above it is). */
   13537             :     overwrite_node(expr, expr_for_nullptr_type(expr->type, expr));
   13538             :   }  /* if */
   13539             : }  /* rewrite_nullptr_expr_if_necessary */
   13540             : 
   13541             : 
   13542             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- tblock is not used. */
   13543             : static void perform_post_pass_on_lowered_node(
   13544             :                                     an_expr_node_ptr                    expr,
   13545             :                                     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   13546             : /*
   13547             : This routine is called for each node of an expression during expression 
   13548             : traversal by perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression.  It is called before
   13549             : the expression has been traversed (pre-order), so it is suited to optimizations
   13550             : where the node is transformed in such a way that the re-written node needs
   13551             : to be further analyzed.  Perform any optimizations or cleanups that are
   13552             : applicable to this expression node.
   13553             : */
   13554             : {
   13555             :   /* Perform some optimizations if they are applicable. */
   13556             :   optimize_node_if_possible(expr);
   13557             :   if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   13558             :     /* Lower the type_kind field of all operation nodes as appropriate.  The
   13559             :        lowering is done here (in the post pass) for two reasons: to keep the
   13560             :        original type_kind in place so that it can be used during lowering, and
   13561             :        to ensure that operations that are added during the lowering process
   13562             :        also have their type_kinds lowered. */
   13563             :     lower_operation_type_kind(expr);
   13564             :   }  /* if */
   13565             : }  /* perform_post_pass_on_lowered_node */
   13566             : 
   13567             : 
   13568             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- tblock is not used. */
