   13569             : static void perform_post_pass_on_lowered_node_post_expr(
   13570             :                                     an_expr_node_ptr                    expr,
   13571             :                                     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   13572             : /*
   13573             : This routine is called for each node of an expression during expression 
   13574             : traversal by perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression.  It is called after
   13575             : the expression has been traversed (post-order), so it is suited to
   13576             : optimizations that require operands be optimized first. 
   13577             : */
   13578             : {
   13579             : #if LOWER_LVALUE_RETURNING_OPERATIONS
   13580             :   /* Transform lvalue-returning assignments, prefix ++/--, and "?" and ","
   13581             :      operators into valid C.  This must be called as part of post processing
   13582             :      during the expression traversal because some lvalue-returning C constructs
   13583             :      are themselves rewritten in terms of lvalue-returning C constructs.  For
   13584             :      example, &(0, A).f is rewritten to &(0, A.f) when the eok_dot_field
   13585             :      operator is processed, resulting in an lvalue-returning eok_comma
   13586             :      operation, which is further rewritten as (0, &A.f) when the eok_address_of
   13587             :      node is processed on the next iteration. */
   13588             :   if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   13589             :     lower_operations_returning_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue(expr);
   13590             :   }  /* if */
   13591             : #endif /* LOWER_LVALUE_RETURNING_OPERATIONS */
   13592             :   /* Nothing invoked at this point in the expression lowering can introduce
   13593             :      lvalue-returning C++ operations (which would need lowering). */
   13594             :   /* Transform expressions involving nullptr types. */
   13595             :   rewrite_nullptr_expr_if_necessary(expr);
   13596             : }  /* perform_post_pass_on_lowered_node_post_expr */
   13597             : 
   13598             : 
   13599             : void perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13600             : /*
   13601             : The expression passed to this routine, expr, is an expression that has been
   13602             : lowered, inlined, or created during lowering.  This routine traverses the
   13603             : entire expression and looks for any optimization opportunities as well as a
   13604             : couple of cases where the lowering or inlining process has created sequences of
   13605             : operations that need further adjusting.  For example, an expression that was
   13606             : originally *(0, &x) may have been lowered to (0, *&x) and this routine is being
   13607             : called to take another look at *&x and optimize it to simply x.  Calling this
   13608             : routine multiple times on the same expression (though not recommended) is
   13609             : harmless.
   13610             : */
   13611             : {
   13612             :   an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
   13613             : 
   13614             :   /* Note that a top-level C++-style lvalue "?" or "," operation will not
   13615             :      be converted to a C-style lvalue (see
   13616             :      lower_operations_returning_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue).  This could
   13617             :      occur when an expression is used as an output value in an asm statement
   13618             :      (e.g., asm("mov %1,%0":"=r"(i,q) : "r"(b))), but the front end no longer
   13619             :      allows compound lvalue expressions in asm statements, so that case is
   13620             :      not handled here. */
   13621             :   clear_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block(&tblock);
   13622             :   tblock.process_expr = perform_post_pass_on_lowered_node;
   13623             :   tblock.process_post_expr = perform_post_pass_on_lowered_node_post_expr;
   13624             :   traverse_expr(expr, &tblock);
   13625             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
   13626             :   check_assertion(tree_has_correct_lvalueness(expr));
   13627             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
   13628             : }  /* perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression */
   13629             : 
   13630             : 
   13631             : static void wrap_throw(an_expr_node_ptr node,
   13632             :                        an_expr_node_ptr question_node)
   13633             : /*
   13634             : node is a lowered throw expression under the "?" operator specified by
   13635             : question_node.  Wrap the throw in a comma expression to give it the same type
   13636             : and lvalueness as question_node.
   13637             : */
   13638             : {
   13639             :   a_boolean        nonscalar;
   13640             :   a_type_ptr       zero_type, question_node_type = question_node->type;
   13641             :   a_constant_ptr   null_constant = local_constant();
   13642             :   an_expr_node_ptr node_copy, zero_node;
   13643             : 
   13644             :   /* Make an operand that has the same type as the other operand.  If the
   13645             :      type is scalar, use a zero cast to that type.  Otherwise (e.g., if
   13646             :      it's a struct), indirect through a null pointer to the right kind. */
   13647             :   zero_type = question_node_type;
   13648             :   nonscalar = !is_simple_scalar_type(question_node_type);
   13649             :   if (question_node->is_lvalue || nonscalar) {
   13650             :     zero_type = make_pointer_type(question_node_type);
   13651             :   }  /* if */
   13652             :   make_zero_of_proper_type(zero_type, null_constant);
   13653             :   zero_node = alloc_node_for_constant(null_constant);
   13654             :   if (question_node->is_lvalue || nonscalar) {
   13655             :     zero_node = add_indirection_to_node(zero_node);
   13656             :     if (!question_node->is_lvalue) {
   13657             :       /* Make sure the node has the correct lvalueness. */
   13658             :       zero_node = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(zero_node);
   13659             :     }  /* if */
   13660             :   }  /* if */
   13661             :   /* Make a copy of the original throw node so the original node can be
   13662             :      overwritten by a comma node. */
   13663             :   node_copy = copy_node(node);
   13664             :   node_copy->next = zero_node;
   13665             :   /* Change the original node to a comma expression. */
   13666             :   change_node_to_operation(node, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   13667             :                            question_node_type, node_copy,
   13668             :                            question_node->is_lvalue);
   13669             :   release_local_constant(&null_constant);
   13670             : }  /* wrap_throw */
   13671             : 
   13672             : 
   13673             : static void rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13674             : /*
   13675             : expr points to a lowered or un-lowered expression tree for an lvalue (or
   13676             : glvalue in some cases -- see below) whose result is discarded (e.g., top level
   13677             : void expression or first operand of a comma operator).  Rewrite it as an rvalue
   13678             : that has the same side effects.  The expression can be optimized to remove any
   13679             : operations related to returning the result (since it is discarded), as long as
   13680             : the side effects remain.  The type of the expression may also be modified if it
   13681             : would allow optimization.  The resulting expression is an rvalue.  The value of
   13682             : expr->next is preserved.  Typically, the xvalue to lvalue conversion has taken
   13683             : place, but a glvalue can occur in cases where this routine is called
   13684             : recursively (and only the top level expression has had its xvalue converted).
   13685             : */
   13686             : {
   13687             :   a_constant_ptr   zero_con = local_constant();
   13688             :   an_expr_node_ptr zero_node;
   13689             :   an_expr_node_ptr next_node = expr->next;
   13690             : 
   13691             :   if (!expr->is_lvalue) {
   13692             :     check_assertion(is_glvalue_node(expr));
   13693             :     /* Convert the glvalue to an lvalue now. */
   13694             :     change_xvalue_node_to_lvalue(expr);
   13695             :   }  /* if */
   13696             :   if (!node_has_side_effects(expr, (a_boolean *)NULL)) {
   13697             :     /* No side effects, so replace the expression with a zero of type int. */
   13698             :     make_zero_of_proper_type(integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int), zero_con);
   13699             :     zero_node = alloc_node_for_constant(zero_con);
   13700             :     overwrite_node(expr, zero_node);
   13701             :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   13702             :     /* The expression has some side effect and must be maintained.  Generally
   13703             :        speaking, taking the address of an lvalue expression will turn it
   13704             :        into an rvalue, but there are some cases to be wary of. */
   13705             :     an_expr_node_ptr  op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   13706             :     an_expr_node_ptr  op2 = op1->next;
   13707             :     if (expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue) {
   13708             :       if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_question) ||
   13709             :           node_operator_is(expr, eok_vector_question)) {
   13710             :         /* Rewrite the second and third operands as rvalues, and then mark
   13711             :            this expression as an rvalue.  Note that an lvalue ?: operator can
   13712             :            have rvalue throw operands (which do not need rewriting). */
   13713             :         an_expr_node_ptr  op3 = op2->next;
   13714             :         if (op2->kind != (an_expr_node_kind)enk_throw) {
   13715             :           rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(op2);
   13716             :         }  /* if */
   13717             :         if (op3->kind != (an_expr_node_kind)enk_throw) {
   13718             :           rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(op3);
   13719             :         }  /* if */
   13720             :         if (!il_identical_types(op2->type, op3->type)) {
   13721             :           /* Re-writing the second and third operands as discarded lvalues
   13722             :              might change one (but not both) of their types to a type that is
   13723             :              difficult to reconcile with the type of the other re-written
   13724             :              operand (they must be identical).  Add a void cast to both. */
   13725             :           overwrite_node(op2, add_cast_to_void(copy_node(op2)));
   13726             :           overwrite_node(op3, add_cast_to_void(copy_node(op3)));
   13727             :           expr->type = void_type();
   13728             :         } else {
   13729             :           expr->type = op2->type;
   13730             :         }  /* if */
   13731             :         expr->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   13732             :         expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = FALSE;
   13733             :       } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_comma)) {
   13734             :         /* Rewrite the second operand as an rvalue, and then mark this
   13735             :            expression as an rvalue. */
   13736             :         rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(op2);
   13737             :         expr->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   13738             :         expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = FALSE;
   13739             :         expr->type = op2->type;
   13740             :       } else {
   13741             :         /* Other lvalue-returning operations (i.e., assignment, pre-incr).
   13742             :            Simply clear the flags to change the operation from an lvalue to
   13743             :            an rvalue (of the correct type). */
   13744             :         expr->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   13745             :         expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = FALSE;
   13746             :         expr->type = prvalue_type(expr->type);
   13747             :       }  /* if */
   13748             :     } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_dot_field)) {
   13749             :       /* Can't take the address of a bit-field selection; drop the
   13750             :          field selection. */
   13751             :       if (is_glvalue_node(op1)) {
   13752             :         rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(op1);
   13753             :       }  /* if */
   13754             :       overwrite_node(expr, op1);
   13755             :     } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_points_to_field)) {
   13756             :       /* Discard the field selection operator. */
   13757             :       overwrite_node(expr, op1);
   13758             :     } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_dot_static) ||
   13759             :                node_operator_is(expr, eok_points_to_static)) {
   13760             :       /* Rewrite the second operand as an rvalue, and then mark this
   13761             :          expression as an rvalue. */
   13762             :       rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(op2);
   13763             :       expr->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   13764             :       expr->type = op2->type;
   13765             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13766             :     } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_gnu_min) ||
   13767             :                node_operator_is(expr, eok_gnu_max)) {
   13768             :       /* Convert the expression to an rvalue using rvalue_expr_for_lvalue
   13769             :          (because operands would be fetched anyway, so changing to rvalue
   13770             :          doesn't add any side effects on volatile). */
   13771             :       overwrite_node(expr, rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(expr));
   13772             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13773             :     } else {
   13774             :       /* Change the lvalue to an rvalue by adding an "&" on top of the
   13775             :          expression (bit-field selections and register variables that
   13776             :          contribute directly to the lvalue address should have been
   13777             :          eliminated).  (The eok_indirect and eok_ref_indirect cases get
   13778             :          optimized automatically because the added "&" cancels with them.) */
   13779             :       overwrite_node(expr, add_address_of_to_node(copy_node(expr)));
   13780             :     }  /* if */
   13781             :     if (is_void_type(expr->type)) {
   13782             :       /* Set result_is_not_used flag if the expression type is void (it is
   13783             :          already set on this node, but it may not be correctly set on operands
   13784             :          of this node if the expression type has been changed to void). */
   13785             :       set_expr_result_not_used(expr);
   13786             :     }  /* if */
   13787             :   } else {
   13788             :     check_assertion(expr->kind != (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime);
   13789             :     /* Change the lvalue to an rvalue by adding an "&" on top of the
   13790             :        expression. */
   13791             :     overwrite_node(expr, add_address_of_to_node(copy_node(expr)));
   13792             :   }  /* if */
   13793             :   expr->next = next_node;
   13794             :   check_assertion(!expr->is_lvalue);
   13795             :   release_local_constant(&zero_con);
   13796             : }  /* rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue */
   13797             : 
   13798             : 
   13799             : static a_boolean is_optimizable_temp_init_indirection(
   13800             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   13801             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr *temp_init_node)
   13802             : /*
   13803             : expr is an rvalue eok_indirect node.  If its operand is a cast
   13804             : over an eok_address_of over an enk_temp_init whose result is a temporary, and
   13805             : the cast only adjusts cv-qualifiers that will be dropped by the indirection
   13806             : (because the result of that is an rvalue), set *temp_init_node to point
   13807             : to the enk_temp_init node and return TRUE.  Otherwise, return FALSE.
   13808             : */
   13809             : {
   13810             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
   13811             :   an_expr_node_ptr  operand_node;
   13812             : 
   13813             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   13814             :                   node_operator_is(expr, eok_indirect) &&
   13815             :                   !expr->is_lvalue);
   13816             :   operand_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   13817             :   *temp_init_node = NULL;
   13818             :   if (is_operation_node(operand_node) &&
   13819             :       node_operator_is(operand_node, eok_cast)) {
   13820             :     an_expr_node_ptr addr_node = operand_node->variant.operation.operands;
   13821             :     if (is_operation_node(addr_node) &&
   13822             :         node_operator_is(addr_node, eok_address_of)) {
   13823             :       an_expr_node_ptr init_node = addr_node->variant.operation.operands;
   13824             :       if (init_node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_temp_init &&
   13825             :           init_node->is_lvalue) {
   13826             :         if (f_skip_typerefs(type_pointed_to(addr_node->type)) ==
   13827             :             f_skip_typerefs(type_pointed_to(operand_node->type))) {
   13828             :           result = TRUE;
   13829             :           *temp_init_node = init_node;
   13830             :         }  /* if */
   13831             :       }  /* if */
   13832             :     }  /* if */
   13833             :   }  /* if */
   13834             :   return result;
   13835             : }  /* is_optimizable_temp_init_indirection */
   13836             : 
   13837             : 
   13838             : static unsigned int assume_operand_non_null_mask(
   13839             :                                       an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   13840             :                                       a_boolean        assume_expr_is_non_null)
   13841             : /*
   13842             : Given the expression node expr (of kind enk_operation), this routine
   13843             : returns a bit mask indicating which of its operands can safely be assumed
   13844             : to have a non-NULL value (for rvalues) or a non-NULL address (for lvalues).
   13845             : assume_expr_is_non_null specifies whether the input expression can be assumed
   13846             : to be non-NULL.  A "1" bit indicates an operand that can be assumed to be
   13847             : non-NULL, with the least-significant bit corresponding to the first operand,
   13848             : the bit after that corresponding to the second operand, etc.  Note that
   13849             : assuming the expression is non-NULL simply suppresses NULL checks in some cases
   13850             : (e.g., related class casting) and doesn't actually mean that the expression
   13851             : cannot have a NULL value.  Note that some operators are lowered as special
   13852             : cases and won't be seen in this routine.
   13853             : */
   13854             : {
   13855             :   an_expr_operator_kind  op;
   13856             :   unsigned int           pointer_dereference_expr_mask = 0;
   13857             : 
   13858             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
   13859             :   op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   13860             :   switch (op) {
   13861             :     case eok_indirect:
   13862             :     case eok_points_to_field:
   13863             :     case eok_points_to_static:
   13864             :     case eok_pm_points_to_field:
   13865             :       /* First operation is a pointer that is dereferenced. */
   13866             :       pointer_dereference_expr_mask = 0x1;
   13867             :       break;
   13868             :     case eok_subscript:
   13869             :       /* Pointer operand can be either first or second. */
   13870             :       if (expr->variant.operation.pointer_operand_is_second) {
   13871             :         pointer_dereference_expr_mask = 0x2;
   13872             :       } else {
   13873             :         pointer_dereference_expr_mask = 0x1;
   13874             :       }  /* if */
   13875             :       break;
   13876             :     case eok_cast:
   13877             :       /* If we're casting one pointer or reference to another, the
   13878             :          operand is assumed to be non-NULL if the expression is
   13879             :          assumed to be non-NULL. */
   13880             :       if (assume_expr_is_non_null && 
   13881             :           is_ptr_or_ref_type(expr->type) &&
   13882             :           is_ptr_or_ref_type(expr->variant.operation.operands->type)) {
   13883             :         pointer_dereference_expr_mask = 0x1;
   13884             :       }  /* if */
   13885             :       break;
   13886             :     case eok_address_of:
   13887             :       /* If the result of an "address of" operation is assumed to be
   13888             :          non-NULL, then its operand is also. */
   13889             :       if (assume_expr_is_non_null) {
   13890             :         pointer_dereference_expr_mask = 0x1;
   13891             :       }  /* if */
   13892             :       break;
   13893             : #if CHECKING
   13894             :     case eok_ref_indirect:
   13895             :     case eok_call:
   13896             :     case eok_dot_member_call:
   13897             :     case eok_points_to_member_call:
   13898             :     case eok_dot_pm_call:
   13899             :     case eok_points_to_pm_call:
   13900             :     case eok_question:
   13901             :       /* These are all handled as special lowering cases and shouldn't get
   13902             :          to this routine. */
   13903             :       unexpected_condition();
   13904             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   13905             :     default:
   13906             :       /* No pointer dereference. */
   13907             :       break;
   13908             :   }  /* switch */
   13909             :   return pointer_dereference_expr_mask;
   13910             : }  /* assume_operand_non_null_mask */
   13911             : 
   13912             : 
   13913             : unsigned int expr_boolean_controlling_expr_mask(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13914             : /*
   13915             : Given the expression node expr (of kind enk_operation), this routine
   13916             : returns a bit mask indicating whether its operands are used as boolean
   13917             : controlling boolean expressions.  A "1" bit indicates a boolean controlling
   13918             : expression, with the least-significant bit corresponding to the first
   13919             : operand, the bit after that corresponding to the second operand, etc.
   13920             : */
   13921             : {
   13922             :   an_expr_operator_kind  op;
   13923             :   unsigned int           bool_controlling_expr_mask = 0;
   13924             : 
   13925             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
   13926             :   op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   13927             :   if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question) {
   13928             :     bool_controlling_expr_mask = 0x1;
   13929             :   } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_land ||
   13930             :              op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lor) {
   13931             :     /* "&&" and "||". */
   13932             :     bool_controlling_expr_mask = 0x3;
   13933             :   } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_not) {
   13934             :     bool_controlling_expr_mask = 0x1;
   13935             :   }  /* if */
   13936             :   return bool_controlling_expr_mask;
   13937             : }  /* expr_boolean_controlling_expr_mask */
   13938             : 
   13939             : 
   13940             : void lower_reuse_value_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   13941             : /*
   13942             : Lower an enk_reuse_value expression, used to indicate a reuse of a value
   13943             : previously computed elsewhere in the current expression.  This is used for
   13944             : some nonstandard extensions (e.g., the GNU two-operand "?") that use an
   13945             : expression twice but evaluate it only once, as well as for certain generated
   13946             : calls of a std::initializer_list constructor (when, as is the case with the
   13947             : Microsoft implementation, that constructor takes two pointers delimiting the
   13948             : underlying array).
   13949             : */
   13950             : {
   13951             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip = expr->variant.reused_value_init;
   13952             : 
   13953             :   /* If the following assertion fails it's probably because the
   13954             :      dynamic init is not executed before the reuse, i.e., there
   13955             :      really is a code ordering problem. */
   13956             :   check_assertion(dip->is_reused_value && dip->variable != NULL);
   13957             :   /* Rewrite the node as a reference to the temporary created for the
   13958             :      initial evaluation. */
   13959             :   overwrite_node(expr, var_rvalue_expr(dip->variable));
   13960             : }  /* lower_reuse_value_expr */
   13961             : 
   13962             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13963             : 
   13964             : static void lower_builtin_offsetof(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   13965             : /*
   13966             : Lower the given __builtin_offsetof node.
   13967             : */
   13968             : {
   13969             :   an_expr_node_ptr  offset = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands->next;
   13970             : 
   13971             :   check_assertion(gnu_mode && offset->is_lvalue);
   13972             :   /* Replace the node with an expression that represents the offset. */
   13973             :   lower_any_expr(offset);
   13974             :   offset = add_address_of_to_node(offset);
   13975             :   offset = add_cast(offset, expr->type);
   13976             :   overwrite_node(expr, offset);
   13977             : }  /* lower_builtin_offsetof */
   13978             : 
   13979             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13980             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
   13981             : 
   13982             : static void lower_builtin_complex(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   13983             : /*
   13984             : Lower the given __builtin_complex node.
   13985             : */
   13986             : {
   13987             :   an_expr_node_ptr  real_node, imag_node, node, real_arg, imag_arg;
   13988             :   a_variable_ptr    temp;
   13989             :   a_type_ptr        underlying_type;
   13990             : 
   13991             :   /* Create a complex temporary whose real and imaginary parts are given
   13992             :      by the arguments to __builtin_complex.  Replace the expression with
   13993             :      a reference to the temporary, i.e.:
   13994             : 
   13995             :        (real(temp) = real_expr, imag(temp) = imag_expr, temp)
   13996             : 
   13997             :      Note that the eok_real_part/eok_imag_part operations that are introduced
   13998             :      here are further lowered (along with the arguments they operate on) and
   13999             :      will produce different IL depending on the setting of LOWER_COMPLEX. */
   14000             :   check_assertion(is_complex_type(expr->type) && !expr->is_lvalue);
   14001             :   underlying_type = float_type(expr->type->variant.float_kind);
   14002             :   /* Get the real and imaginary arguments from the original expression. */
   14003             :   real_arg = expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands;
   14004             :   imag_arg = real_arg->next;
   14005             :   real_arg->next = NULL;
   14006             :   /* Create a temporary. */
   14007             :   temp = make_lowered_temporary(expr->type);
   14008             :   /* Assign the real part to the temporary (and lower the assignment). */
   14009             :   real_node = make_lvalue_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_real_part,
   14010             :                                         underlying_type,
   14011             :                                         var_lvalue_expr(temp));
   14012             :   real_node = make_assignment_expr(real_node,
   14013             :                                    (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   14014             :                                    real_arg);
   14015             :   lower_any_expr(real_node);
   14016             :   /* Assign the imaginary part to the temporary (and lower the assignment). */
   14017             :   imag_node = make_lvalue_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_imag_part,
   14018             :                                         underlying_type,
   14019             :                                         var_lvalue_expr(temp));
   14020             :   imag_node = make_assignment_expr(imag_node,
   14021             :                                    (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   14022             :                                    imag_arg);
   14023             :   lower_any_expr(imag_node);
   14024             :   /* Replace the original expression with those created above. */
   14025             :   node = make_comma_node(real_node, imag_node);
   14026             :   node = make_comma_node(node, var_rvalue_expr(temp));
   14027             :   overwrite_node(expr, node);
   14028             : }  /* lower_builtin_complex */
   14029             : 
   14030             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
   14031             : 
   14032             : static void lower_builtin_addressof(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   14033             : /*
   14034             : Lower the __builtin_addressof construct (by effectively replacing it with
   14035             : an eok_address_of operation).
   14036             : */
   14037             : {
   14038             :   an_expr_node_ptr new_expr;
   14039             : 
   14040             :   lower_expr(expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands);
   14041             :   new_expr = add_address_of_to_node(expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands);
   14042             :   check_assertion(expr->is_lvalue == new_expr->is_lvalue &&
   14043             :                   identical_types(expr->type, new_expr->type));
   14044             :   overwrite_node(expr, new_expr);
   14045             : }  /* lower_builtin_addressof */
   14046             : 
   14047             : 
   14048             : void lower_builtin_operation(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14049             : /*
   14050             : Lower an enk_builtin_operation node.  Most builtin operations currently result
   14051             : in constants, and therefore do not require lowering.  One exception is
   14052             : bok_offsetof, which can include nonconstant subscripts.
   14053             : */
   14054             : {
   14055             :   switch (expr->variant.builtin_operation.kind) {
   14056             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   14057             :     case bok_offsetof:
   14058             :       lower_builtin_offsetof(expr);
   14059             :       break;
   14060             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   14061             : #if GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED
   14062             :     case bok_builtin_shuffle:
   14063             :     case bok_builtin_shufflevector:
   14064             :     case bok_builtin_convertvector:
   14065             :       /* For __builtin_shuffle, etc., just lower the operands. */
   14066             :       lower_expr_list(expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands,
   14067             :                       /*is_bool_controlling_expr_mask=*/0,
   14068             :                       /*assume_expr_is_non_null_mask=*/0);
   14069             :       break;
   14070             : #endif /* GNU_VECTOR_TYPES_ALLOWED */
   14071             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
   14072             :     case bok_builtin_complex:
   14073             :       lower_builtin_complex(expr);
   14074             :       break;
   14075             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
   14076             :     case bok_builtin_addressof:
   14077             :       lower_builtin_addressof(expr);
   14078             :       break;
   14079             :     default:
   14080             :       unexpected_condition();
   14081             :   }  /* switch */ /*lint !e764 */
   14082             : }  /* lower_builtin_operation */
   14083             : 
   14084             : #if DEBUG
   14085             : 
   14086             : static void checksum_bytes(char                                *ptr,
   14087             :                            unsigned long                       size,
   14088             :                            an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14089             : /*
   14090             : This routine is called by traverse_expr or traverse_statement to include
   14091             : the contents of the expression node specified by expr in the
   14092             : computation of a checksum that includes a full expression or statement.
   14093             : tblock is used during the tree traversal and stores the in-progress checksum.
   14094             : */
   14095             : {
   14096             :   /* Multiplier used to compute the checksum.  Should be prime. */
   14097             : #define CACHE_HASH_FACTOR ((unsigned int)73)
   14098             :   while (size-- != 0) {
   14099             :     tblock->checksum = (tblock->checksum * CACHE_HASH_FACTOR) + *ptr++;
   14100             :   }  /* while */
   14101             : #undef CACHE_HASH_FACTOR
   14102             : }  /* checksum_bytes */
   14103             : 
   14104             : 
   14105             : static void checksum_expr(an_expr_node_ptr                    expr,
   14106             :                           an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14107             : /*
   14108             : This routine is called by traverse_expr or traverse_statement to include
   14109             : the contents of the expression node specified by expr in the
   14110             : computation of a checksum that includes a full expression or statement.
   14111             : tblock is used during the tree traversal and stores the in-progress checksum.
   14112             : */
   14113             : {
   14114             :   checksum_bytes((char *)expr, sizeof(an_expr_node), tblock);
   14115             : }  /* checksum_expr */
   14116             : 
   14117             : 
   14118             : static void checksum_statement(a_statement_ptr                     statement,
   14119             :                                an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14120             : /*
   14121             : This routine is called by traverse_expr or traverse_statement to include
   14122             : the contents of the statement specified by statement in the
   14123             : computation of a checksum that includes a full expression or statement.
   14124             : tblock is used during the tree traversal and stores the in-progress checksum.
   14125             : */
   14126             : {
   14127             :   checksum_bytes((char *)statement, sizeof(a_statement), tblock);
   14128             : }  /* checksum_statement */
   14129             : 
   14130             : 
   14131             : static void checksum_constant(a_constant_ptr                      constant,
   14132             :                               an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14133             : /*
   14134             : This routine is called by traverse_expr or traverse_statement to include
   14135             : the contents of the constant specified by constant in the
   14136             : computation of a checksum that includes a full expression or statement.
   14137             : tblock is used during the tree traversal and stores the in-progress checksum.
   14138             : */
   14139             : {
   14140             :   checksum_bytes((char *)constant, sizeof(a_constant), tblock);
   14141             : }  /* checksum_constant */
   14142             : 
   14143             : 
   14144             : static void checksum_dynamic_init(
   14145             :                               a_dynamic_init_ptr                  dynamic_init,
   14146             :                               an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14147             : /*
   14148             : This routine is called by traverse_expr or traverse_statement to include
   14149             : the contents of the dynamic initialization specified by dynamic_init in the
   14150             : computation of a checksum that includes a full expression or statement.
   14151             : tblock is used during the tree traversal and stores the in-progress checksum.
   14152             : */
   14153             : {
   14154             :   checksum_bytes((char *)dynamic_init, sizeof(a_dynamic_init), tblock);
   14155             : }  /* checksum_dynamic_init */
   14156             : 
   14157             : 
   14158             : static void init_tblock_for_computing_checksum(
   14159             :                                     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14160             : /*
   14161             : Initialize the local control block used to traverse expression and statement
   14162             : structures (tblock).
   14163             : */
   14164             : {
   14165             :   clear_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block(tblock);
   14166             :   tblock->process_expr = checksum_expr;
   14167             :   tblock->process_statement = checksum_statement;
   14168             :   tblock->process_constant = checksum_constant;
   14169             :   tblock->process_dynamic_init = checksum_dynamic_init;
   14170             : }  /* init_tblock_for_computing_checksum */
   14171             : 
   14172             : 
   14173             : unsigned long compute_checksum_for_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14174             : /*
   14175             : Compute and return a checksum that can be used to determine if the
   14176             : given expression (expr) is subsequently modified.
   14177             : */
   14178             : {
   14179             :   an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
   14180             :   init_tblock_for_computing_checksum(&tblock);
   14181             :   traverse_expr(expr, &tblock);
   14182             :   return tblock.checksum;
   14183             : }  /* compute_checksum_for_expr */
   14184             : 
   14185             : 
   14186             : unsigned long compute_checksum_for_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   14187             : /*
   14188             : Compute and return a checksum that can be used to determine if the
   14189             : given statement is subsequently modified.
   14190             : */
   14191             : {
   14192             :   an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
   14193             :   init_tblock_for_computing_checksum(&tblock);
   14194             :   traverse_statement(statement, &tblock);
   14195             :   return tblock.checksum;
   14196             : }  /* compute_checksum_for_statement */
   14197             : 
   14198             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   14199             : 
   14200             : a_boolean is_constant_valued_expression(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   14201             :                                         a_boolean        local_vars_change,
   14202             :                                         a_boolean        other_vars_change,
   14203             :                                         a_boolean        this_cannot_be_null,
   14204             :                                         a_boolean        *is_non_null)
   14205             : /*
   14206             : Return TRUE if the indicated expression (which can be an rvalue or lvalue) has
   14207             : an invariant value (or address in the lvalue case) over the duration of an
   14208             : inlined call.  That is, the expression can be evaluated more than once and get
   14209             : the same answer.  That includes things like addresses of automatic variables.
   14210             : If the expression is known to be non-null, return *is_non_null TRUE (in some
   14211             : cases it can be known that the expression is non-null even though it can't be
   14212             : determined to be constant).  If it cannot be determined whether the constant is
   14213             : non-NULL, the safe value is FALSE.  local_vars_change is TRUE if the values of
   14214             : unaliased local variables of the caller might change (e.g., if the argument
   14215             : expressions have side effects).  other_vars_change is TRUE if the values of
   14216             : other variables might change (e.g., if the argument expressions or the called
   14217             : function body have side effects).  When this_cannot_be_null is TRUE, it is
   14218             : assumed that the "this" variable in a member function cannot be NULL
   14219             : (otherwise, it is only assumed that "this" cannot be NULL in virtual member
   14220             : functions).  This routine does not investigate all possible cases (i.e., it may
   14221             : return FALSE when a more complete inspection would return TRUE).  See
   14222             : constant_glvalue_address and constant_prvalue_pointer for more definitive
   14223             : determinations of whether or not an expression is constant valued, but this
   14224             : routine has some differences in underlying assumptions (e.g., "this" is
   14225             : considered constant, addresses of string literals are not) that are specific to
   14226             : inlining and therefore yield different results.
   14227             : */
   14228             : {
   14229             :   a_boolean is_constant_valued = FALSE;
   14230             : 
   14231             :   *is_non_null = FALSE;
   14232             :   if (is_constant_node(expr)) {
   14233             :     a_constant_ptr con = node_constant(expr);
   14234             :     is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14235             :     /* Don't treat string literals as constant, because if we generate C code
   14236             :        and refer to the constant several times, the address of the string
   14237             :        literal will be different on each reference. */
   14238             :     if (con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
   14239             :         con->variant.address.kind == (an_address_base_kind)abk_constant &&
   14240             :         con->variant.address.variant.constant->kind ==
   14241             :                                              (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string) {
   14242             :       is_constant_valued = FALSE;
   14243             :     }  /* if */
   14244             :     *is_non_null = constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(con) &&
   14245             :                    !is_false_constant(con);
   14246             :   } else if (is_ptr_to_member_function_constant_expr(expr)) {
   14247             :     /* A pointer to member function constant is constant. */
   14248             :     is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14249             :   } else if (is_variable_node(expr)) {
   14250             :     a_variable_ptr var = node_variable(expr);
   14251             :     if (expr->is_lvalue) {
   14252             :       is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14253             :       /* We assume that variables other than extern variables have non-null
   14254             :          addresses.  extern variables might have zero addresses because of
   14255             :          linker magic like weak externals. */
   14256             :       *is_non_null = variable_has_non_null_address(var);
   14257             :     } else if ((var->is_parameter && !var->param_value_has_been_changed) ||
   14258             :                var->is_this_parameter) {
   14259             :       /* Unassigned parameters are constant-valued within a function.
   14260             :          The "this" parameter can be considered constant even when
   14261             :          it is assigned in the allocation section of a constructor.
   14262             :          It can't be considered constant if there is an assignment to
   14263             :          "this", but routines with such an assignment are considered
   14264             :          to be not inlinable. */
   14265             :       is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14266             :     } else if (!local_vars_change &&
   14267             :                var->source_corresp.is_local_to_function &&
   14268             :                !var->address_taken &&
   14269             :                !var_has_static_or_thread_storage_duration(var)) {
   14270             :       /* This is a local variable, and local variables are invariant
   14271             :          over the lifetime of the call.  Local static variables are
   14272             :          excluded because the flow of control can get back to the same
   14273             :          function and change a static variable's value. */
   14274             :       is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14275             :     } else if (!other_vars_change) {
   14276             :       /* The values of all variables are invariant over the lifetime
   14277             :          of the call. */
   14278             :       is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14279             :     }  /* if */
   14280             :     if (var->is_this_parameter &&
   14281             :         (is_constant_valued || this_cannot_be_null)) {
   14282             :       /* "this" is always non-null in virtual functions, and may be assumed
   14283             :          to be non-null in other contexts as well (as specified by the
   14284             :          caller). */
   14285             :       if (this_cannot_be_null ||
   14286             :           (innermost_function_scope != NULL &&
   14287             :            innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable
   14288             :                                                                       == var &&
   14289             :            innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->is_virtual)) {
   14290             :         *is_non_null = TRUE;
   14291             :       }  /* if */
   14292             :     }  /* if */
   14293             :   } else if (is_routine_node(expr)) {
   14294             :     is_constant_valued = TRUE;
   14295             :     /* We assume that routines other than extern routines have non-null
   14296             :        addresses.  extern routines might have zero addresses because of
   14297             :        linker magic like weak externals. */
   14298             :     *is_non_null = routine_has_non_null_address(expr->variant.routine.ptr);
   14299             :   } else if (node_includes_glvalue_to_prvalue_conv(expr)) {
   14300             :     /* Node includes an lvalue-to-rvalue conversion ("load from memory"),
   14301             :        so it's not constant valued. */
   14302             :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   14303             :     an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   14304             :     an_expr_node_ptr      operand = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14305             :     switch (op) {
   14306             :       case eok_address_of:
   14307             :       case eok_array_to_pointer:
   14308             :       case eok_ref_cast:
   14309             :       case eok_lvalue_adjust:
   14310             :       case eok_lvalue_cast:
   14311             :       case eok_class_rvalue_adjust:
   14312             :         /* These operations are constant valued provided their first
   14313             :            operand is constant-valued. */
   14314             :         is_constant_valued = is_constant_valued_expression(operand,
   14315             :                                                            local_vars_change,
   14316             :                                                            other_vars_change,
   14317             :                                                            this_cannot_be_null,
   14318             :                                                            is_non_null);
   14319             :         break;
   14320             :       case eok_cast:
   14321             :         /* A cast of a constant address is constant-valued.  This is useful on
   14322             :            a cast of the address of a local variable to adjust its
   14323             :            cv-qualification when it is passed as the "this" parameter to a
   14324             :            constructor or destructor. */
   14325             :         if (is_pointer_type(expr->type)) {
   14326             :           is_constant_valued = is_constant_valued_expression(operand,
   14327             :                                                            local_vars_change,
   14328             :                                                            other_vars_change,
   14329             :                                                            this_cannot_be_null,
   14330             :                                                            is_non_null);
   14331             :         }  /* if */
   14332             :         break;
   14333             :       case eok_padd:
   14334             :       case eok_psubtract:
   14335             :       case eok_subscript:
   14336             :         /* These operations are constant provided both operands are as well.
   14337             :            Note that pointer and integer operands can be in either order 
   14338             :            (for eok_padd and eok_subscript) but we don't care here. */
   14339             :         { a_boolean op1_is_non_null, op2_is_non_null;
   14340             :           if (is_constant_valued_expression(operand,
   14341             :                                             local_vars_change,
   14342             :                                             other_vars_change,
   14343             :                                             this_cannot_be_null,
   14344             :                                             &op1_is_non_null)) {
   14345             :             is_constant_valued = is_constant_valued_expression(
   14346             :                                                            operand->next,
   14347             :                                                            local_vars_change,
   14348             :                                                            other_vars_change,
   14349             :                                                            this_cannot_be_null,
   14350             :                                                            &op2_is_non_null);
   14351             :             if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd ||
   14352             :                 op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_subscript) {
   14353             :               /* If either operand is non-null, the sum will be non-null
   14354             :                  as well. */
   14355             :               *is_non_null = op1_is_non_null || op2_is_non_null;
   14356             :             }  /* if */
   14357             :           }  /* if */
   14358             :         }
   14359             :         break;
   14360             :       case eok_dot_field:
   14361             :       case eok_points_to_field:
   14362             :         /* Field selection lvalue.  Invariant if the first operand is
   14363             :            invariant. */
   14364             :         is_constant_valued = is_constant_valued_expression(operand,
   14365             :                                                            local_vars_change,
   14366             :                                                            other_vars_change,
   14367             :                                                            this_cannot_be_null,
   14368             :                                                            is_non_null);
   14369             :         if (!*is_non_null && expr->is_lvalue &&
   14370             :             node_field(operand->next)->offset != 0) {
   14371             :           /* If the field offset is non-zero, the entire expression will
   14372             :              be non-zero even if the class address is zero. */
   14373             :           *is_non_null = TRUE;
   14374             :         }  /* if */
   14375             :         break;
   14376             :       case eok_ne:
   14377             :         /* In general, we can't tell whether two expressions will or won't
   14378             :            be equal at run time, but look for one specific case that is added
   14379             :            by lowering when LOWERING_NORMALIZES_BOOLEAN_CONTROLLING_EXPRESSIONS
   14380             :            is TRUE: "x != 0".  In this case, the entire operation is known
   14381             :            to be constant if x is known to be constant and non-null. */
   14382             :         if (is_constant_node(operand->next)) {
   14383             :           a_constant_ptr op_con = node_constant(operand->next);
   14384             :           if (constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(op_con) &&
   14385             :               is_false_constant(op_con)) {
   14386             :             is_constant_valued = is_constant_valued_expression(operand,
   14387             :                                                            local_vars_change,
   14388             :                                                            other_vars_change,
   14389             :                                                            this_cannot_be_null,
   14390             :                                                            is_non_null);
   14391             :           }  /* if */
   14392             :         }  /* if */
   14393             :         break;
   14394             :       default:
   14395             :         break;
   14396             :     }  /* switch */
   14397             :   }  /* if */
   14398             :   return is_constant_valued;
   14399             : }  /* is_constant_valued_expression */
   14400             : 
   14401             : 
   14402             : a_boolean bool_value_is_known_at_compile_time(
   14403             :                                           an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   14404             :                                           a_boolean        this_cannot_be_null,
   14405             :                                           a_boolean        *value)
   14406             : /*
   14407             : See if the value of expr can be determined at compile time; if so, determine
   14408             : the boolean value of the expression and set *value as appropriate.  
   14409             : When this_cannot_be_null is TRUE, it can be assumed that "this" cannot
   14410             : be NULL in the specified expression.  Returns TRUE if the value of the
   14411             : expression is known.  This routine does not investigate all possible cases
   14412             : (i.e., it may return FALSE when a more complete inspection would return TRUE).
   14413             : */
   14414             : {
   14415             :   a_boolean value_is_known = FALSE;
   14416             : 
   14417             :   if (is_constant_node(expr)) {
   14418             :     /* A constant expression: See if the constant has a known boolean
   14419             :        control value. */
   14420             :     a_constant_ptr con = node_constant(expr);
   14421             :     if (constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(con)) {
   14422             :       *value = !is_false_constant(con);
   14423             :       value_is_known = TRUE;
   14424             :     }  /* if */
   14425             :   } else {
   14426             :     /* Some non-constant expressions are known to convert to a "true"
   14427             :        boolean value.  Specifically, the address of variables and
   14428             :        functions. */
   14429             :     a_boolean  non_null = FALSE;
   14430             :     if (is_constant_valued_expression(expr,
   14431             :                                       /*local_vars_change=*/TRUE,
   14432             :                                       /*other_vars_change=*/TRUE,
   14433             :                                       this_cannot_be_null,
   14434             :                                       &non_null) &&
   14435             :         non_null) {
   14436             :       /* Value is constant and known to be non-NULL (so it always evaluates
   14437             :          to TRUE). */
   14438             :       *value = TRUE;
   14439             :     } else if (non_null) {
   14440             :       /* Value is not constant, but is known to be non-NULL (so it always
   14441             :          evaluates to TRUE). */
   14442             :       *value = TRUE;
   14443             :     } else {
   14444             :       /* Nothing can be said about the value. */
   14445             :       *value = FALSE;
   14446             :     }  /* if */
   14447             :     value_is_known = *value;
   14448             :   }  /* if */
   14449             :   return value_is_known;
   14450             : }  /* bool_value_is_known_at_compile_time */
   14451             : 
   14452             : 
   14453             : static void examine_expr_for_destructible_temp(
   14454             :                                     an_expr_node_ptr                    node,
   14455             :                                     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   14456             : /*
   14457             : Called during an expression traversal; returns TRUE (via tblock) and
   14458             : terminates the traversal if a temporary init with a destructor is found.
   14459             : */
   14460             : {
   14461             :   if (node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_temp_init &&
   14462             :       node->variant.init.dynamic_init->destructor != NULL &&
   14463             :       /* Ignore expressions in potentially-evaluated parts of trees that
   14464             :          have a destructor but weren't entered into an object lifetime. */
   14465             :       node->variant.init.dynamic_init->lifetime != NULL) {
   14466             :     tblock->result = TRUE;
   14467             :     tblock->terminate = TRUE;
   14468             :   }  /* if */
   14469             : }  /* examine_expr_for_destructible_temp */
   14470             : 
   14471             : 
   14472             : static a_boolean expr_has_destructible_temp(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14473             : /*
   14474             : Return TRUE if the indicated expression contains a temporary init with
   14475             : an associated dynamic init indicating a destruction.
   14476             : */
   14477             : {
   14478             :   an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
   14479             : 
   14480             :   clear_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block(&tblock);
   14481             :   tblock.process_expr = examine_expr_for_destructible_temp;
   14482             :   traverse_expr(expr, &tblock);
   14483             :   return tblock.result;
   14484             : }  /* expr_has_destructible_temp */
   14485             : 
   14486             : 
   14487             : static a_boolean dead_code_expr_can_be_eliminated(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14488             : /*
   14489             : The expression is dead code and is a candidate for removal;
   14490             : return TRUE if the expression can be safely eliminated and FALSE if the
   14491             : expression must remain.  Expressions that contain a destructible entity or
   14492             : statement expression are disqualified.  Note that this test is conservative
   14493             : (i.e., it's always okay to return FALSE) and that a more detailed look at the
   14494             : expression might result in allowing the elimination.
   14495             : */
   14496             : {
   14497             :   return (!has_statement_expression(expr)) && 
   14498             :           (C_mode() || !expr_has_destructible_temp(expr));
   14499             : }  /* dead_code_expr_can_be_eliminated */
   14500             : 
   14501             : 
   14502             : void lower_logical_operator(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14503             : /*
   14504             : In cases where the second operand of an eok_land or eok_lor operation
   14505             : (as specified by expr) is known not to be executed, replace the expression
   14506             : with its first operand.  Note that this optimization is conservative;
   14507             : some values that are known at compile time are not detected as such
   14508             : (e.g., (0, 0)).  On input, expr (and its operands) have not yet been lowered;
   14509             : they are lowered by this routine.  This routine is used in both C and C++
   14510             : lowering and should be careful to call the appropriate routines when lowering
   14511             : expressions.
   14512             : */
   14513             : {
   14514             :   an_expr_operator_kind op;
   14515             :   an_expr_node_ptr      op1, op2;
   14516             :   a_boolean             op1_value;
   14517             : 
   14518             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   14519             :                   (node_operator_is(expr, eok_land) ||
   14520             :                    node_operator_is(expr, eok_lor)));
   14521             :   op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14522             :   op2 = op1->next;
   14523             :   /* Lower the first operand (increases the chance that the value will be
   14524             :      recognized as known at compile time). */
   14525             :   lower_any_boolean_controlling_expr(op1, /*is_full_expr=*/FALSE);
   14526             :   if (bool_value_is_known_at_compile_time(op1,
   14527             :                            assume_this_cannot_be_null_in_conditional_operators,
   14528             :                                           &op1_value) &&
   14529             :       dead_code_expr_can_be_eliminated(op2)) {
   14530             :     /* The first operand is an expression whose value we know at compile time;
   14531             :        see if we can eliminate the second operand altogether based upon the
   14532             :        value of the first operand. */
   14533             :     op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   14534             :     if ((op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_land && !op1_value) ||
   14535             :         (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lor && op1_value)) {
   14536             :       /* Replace the original expression with the first operand (already
   14537             :          lowered above). */
   14538             :       if (il_identical_types(expr->type, op1->type)) {
   14539             :         overwrite_node(expr, op1);
   14540             :       } else {
   14541             :         /* The type might have been adjusted during lowering (e.g., by
   14542             :            adjust_bool_operation_types); make sure we retain the correct
   14543             :            type when replacing the original expression with the first
   14544             :            operand. */
   14545             :         change_to_cast(expr, op1, expr->type);
   14546             :         op1->next = NULL;
   14547             :       }  /* if */
   14548             :     } else {
   14549             :       lower_any_boolean_controlling_expr(op2, /*is_full_expr=*/FALSE);
   14550             :     }  /* if */
   14551             :   } else {
   14552             :     lower_any_boolean_controlling_expr(op2, /*is_full_expr=*/FALSE);
   14553             :   }  /* if */
   14554             : }  /* lower_logical_operator */
   14555             : 
   14556             : 
   14557             : void lower_question_operator(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   14558             :                              a_boolean        assume_expr_is_non_null)
   14559             : /*
   14560             : This routine lowers the specified eok_question expression.  
   14561             : assume_expr_is_non_null indicates whether the expression can be assumed
   14562             : to be non-NULL (or its address is non-NULL for lvalue expressions) and is
   14563             : passed through when lowering the second and third operands.  Lowering of
   14564             : the expression consists of two tasks: eliminating dead code if possible and
   14565             : maintaining the proper types if one (and only one) of the last two operands is
   14566             : a throw.  In cases where the first operand is known at compilation time,
   14567             : overwrite the expression with the second or third operand depending on the
   14568             : value of the first operand.  Note that this optimization is conservative: some
   14569             : values that are known at compile time are not detected as such (e.g., (0, 0)).
   14570             : On input, expr (and its operands) have not yet been lowered; they are lowered
   14571             : by this routine.  This routine is used in both C and C++ lowering and should be
   14572             : careful to call the appropriate routines when lowering expressions.
   14573             : */
   14574             : {
   14575             :   an_expr_node_ptr  op1, op2, op3, removed_op, replacement_op;
   14576             :   an_expr_node_ptr  throw_op = NULL;
   14577             :   a_boolean         op1_value;
   14578             : 
   14579             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   14580             :                   node_operator_is(expr, eok_question));
   14581             :   op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14582             :   op2 = op1->next;
   14583             :   op3 = op2->next;
   14584             :   /* Look for a "?" operator where one of the operands is a throw
   14585             :      expression and the other has a non-void type.  The throw
   14586             :      operation will be adjusted by putting a comma operation over
   14587             :      it to give that operand the right type. */
   14588             :   /* Note that we test now, before lowering, when it's easy to spot
   14589             :      a throw node, but we do the rewrite after lowering. */
   14590             :   if (!is_void_type(expr->type)) {
   14591             :     if (op2->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_throw) {
   14592             :       /* op2 is a throw and op3 is not. */
   14593             :       throw_op = op2;
   14594             :     } else if (op3->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_throw) {
   14595             :       /* op3 is a throw and op2 is not. */
   14596             :       throw_op = op3;
   14597             :     }  /* if */
   14598             :   }  /* if */
   14599             :   /* Lower the conditional first (increases the chance that the value will be
   14600             :      recognized as known at compile time). */
   14601             :   lower_any_boolean_controlling_expr(op1, /*is_full_expr=*/FALSE);
   14602             :   if (bool_value_is_known_at_compile_time(op1,
   14603             :                            assume_this_cannot_be_null_in_conditional_operators,
   14604             :                                           &op1_value)) {
   14605             :     if (op1_value) {
   14606             :       /* Condition is true, rewrite expr with second operand if possible. */
   14607             :       replacement_op = op2;
   14608             :       removed_op = op3;
   14609             :     } else {
   14610             :       /* Condition is false, rewrite expr with third operand if possible. */
   14611             :       replacement_op = op3;
   14612             :       removed_op = op2;
   14613             :     }  /* if */
   14614             :     if (dead_code_expr_can_be_eliminated(removed_op)) {
   14615             :       /* Replace the original expression with the appropriate operand. */
   14616             :       if (throw_op == replacement_op) {
   14617             :         /* We're replacing the expression with a throw operand; make sure
   14618             :            it has the proper type. */
   14619             :         wrap_throw(throw_op, expr);
   14620             :         throw_op = NULL;
   14621             :       }  /* if */
   14622             :       lower_any_expr_full(replacement_op, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   14623             :       check_assertion(il_identical_types(expr->type, replacement_op->type));
   14624             :       overwrite_node(expr, replacement_op);
   14625             :     } else {
   14626             :       /* Make sure the entire expression is lowered. */
   14627             :       lower_any_expr_full(op2, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   14628             :       lower_any_expr_full(op3, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   14629             :     }  /* if */
   14630             :   } else {
   14631             :     /* Make sure the entire expression is lowered. */
   14632             :     lower_any_expr_full(op2, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   14633             :     lower_any_expr_full(op3, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   14634             :   }  /* if */
   14635             :   if (throw_op != NULL) {
   14636             :     /* Wrap a throw in a comma expression to give it the right type and
   14637             :        lvalueness. */
   14638             :     wrap_throw(throw_op, expr);
   14639             :   }  /* if */
   14640             : }  /* lower_question_operator */
   14641             : 
   14642             : #if !PRESERVE_TOP_LEVEL_CASTS_TO_VOID_IN_IL
   14643             : 
   14644             : void lower_comma(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14645             : /*
   14646             : Lower an eok_comma expression by removing a top-level void cast in the
   14647             : first operand (if one exists).  Operands of the expression have already been
   14648             : lowered.  This routine is called in both C and C++ lowering modes.
   14649             : */
   14650             : {
   14651             :   an_expr_node_ptr  node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14652             : 
   14653             :   if (is_operation_node(node) &&
   14654             :       node_operator_is(node, eok_cast) &&
   14655             :       is_void_type(node->type)) {
   14656             :     /* Remove a top-level void cast in the first operator. */
   14657             :     check_assertion(node->result_is_not_used);
   14658             :     overwrite_node(node, node->variant.operation.operands);
   14659             :   }  /* if */
   14660             : }  /* lower_comma */
   14661             : 
   14662             : #endif /* !PRESERVE_TOP_LEVEL_CASTS_TO_VOID_IN_IL */
   14663             : 
   14664             : static void lower_reference_to(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14665             : /*
   14666             : Lower an eok_reference_to expression (expr) by replacing the operation with an
   14667             : eok_address_of.  This is performed before an expression is lowered so the
   14668             : rest of lowering only sees an eok_address_of operator.
   14669             : */
   14670             : {
   14671             :   an_expr_node_ptr  operand;
   14672             : 
   14673             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   14674             :                   node_operator_is(expr, eok_reference_to));
   14675             :   operand = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14676             :   if (!is_glvalue_node(operand)) {
   14677             :     /* eok_reference_to applied to an rvalue.  Get an address, if necessary by
   14678             :        storing into a temporary. */
   14679             :     an_expr_node_ptr addr_expr;
   14680             :     if (is_class_struct_union_type(operand->type)) {
   14681             :       /* Class case. */
   14682             :       addr_expr = rvalue_pointer_for_class_rvalue(operand);
   14683             :       lower_expr(addr_expr);
   14684             :     } else {
   14685             :       /* Non-class case. */
   14686             :       a_variable_ptr temp;
   14687             :       lower_expr(operand);
   14688             :       temp = assign_expr_to_temp(operand);
   14689             :       addr_expr = make_comma_node(expr, var_addr_expr(temp));
   14690             :     }  /* if */
   14691             :     /* Overwrite the eok_reference_to node with an expression that gives the
   14692             :        address of the temp or object. */
   14693             :     overwrite_node(expr, addr_expr);
   14694             :   } else {
   14695             :     /* eok_reference_to applied to an lvalue. */
   14696             :     /* Simply replace the eok_reference_to with an eok_address_of. */
   14697             :     set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_address_of,
   14698             :                       make_pointer_type(operand->type), expr->is_lvalue,
   14699             :                       operand);
   14700             :     /* Lower (and potentially optimize) the new expression. */
   14701             :     lower_expr(expr);
   14702             :   }  /* if */
   14703             : }  /* lower_reference_to */
   14704             : 
   14705             : 
   14706             : static void lower_ref_indirect(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14707             : /*
   14708             : Lower an eok_ref_indirect expression (expr) by changing it to an
   14709             : eok_indirect node and changing the type of the operand from a reference type
   14710             : to a pointer type.  This is performed before an expression is lowered so the
   14711             : rest of lowering only sees an eok_indirect operator.
   14712             : */
   14713             : {
   14714             :   an_expr_node_ptr  operand;
   14715             : 
   14716             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   14717             :                   node_operator_is(expr, eok_ref_indirect));
   14718             :   operand = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14719             :   expr->variant.operation.kind = (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_indirect;
   14720             :   /* Lower (and potentially optimize) the new expression. */
   14721             :   lower_expr(expr);
   14722             :   /* Change reference type to pointer type.  Do this after lowering the
   14723             :      expression so the reference type still exists. */
   14724             :   operand->type = make_pointer_type(type_pointed_to(operand->type));
   14725             : }  /* lower_ref_indirect */
   14726             : 
   14727             : 
   14728             : static void lower_assignment_operator(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   14729             : /*
   14730             : The given node is an eok_assign node.  Lower the node if needed.
   14731             : */
   14732             : {
   14733             :   an_expr_node_ptr  operand_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   14734             : 
   14735             :   check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   14736             :                   node_operator_is(expr, eok_assign));
   14737             :   switch (expr->variant.operation.type_kind) {
   14738             :     case tk_pointer:
   14739             : #if ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED
   14740             :       /* Check for assignment to "this" in a constructor. */
   14741             :       if (innermost_function_scope != NULL) {
   14742             :         a_routine_ptr curr_routine =
   14743             :                                  innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   14744             :         if (curr_routine->special_kind ==
   14745             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
   14746             :           a_variable_ptr this_param_var =
   14747             :                           innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.parameters;
   14748             :           if (operand_node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_variable &&
   14749             :               operand_node->is_lvalue &&
   14750             :               node_variable(operand_node) == this_param_var) {
   14751             :             /* This is an assignment to "this".  Add the wrapper code (to
   14752             :                initialize base classes, etc.) following the assignment to
   14753             :                "this".  Add a comma expression on top that produces the same
   14754             :                value as the original assignment, in case the value of the
   14755             :                assignment is used.  That is,
   14756             :                  this = expr
   14757             :                becomes
   14758             :                  ((this = expr), this)
   14759             :                which then becomes
