   14760             :                  ((this = expr), (initialization, this))
   14761             :             */
   14762             :             an_expr_node_ptr   new_expr, orig_expr_copy;
   14763             :             an_insert_location insert_location;
   14764             :             check_assertion(!innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->
   14765             :                                                            is_delegating_ctor);
   14766             :             if (expr->variant.operation.
   14767             :                                       returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue) {
   14768             :               /* Create an lvalue for the "this" parameter. */
   14769             :               new_expr = var_lvalue_expr(this_param_var);
   14770             :               /* Add a cast to restore the const qualifier on the expression
   14771             :                  type.  The const on the "this" parameter variable type has
   14772             :                  been removed by IL lowering so that assignments can be done,
   14773             :                  but this expression -- built before the const was removed --
   14774             :                  includes the const. */
   14775             :               new_expr = add_cast_if_necessary(new_expr, expr->type);
   14776             :             } else {
   14777             :               /* The assignment returns an rvalue, i.e., the value of the
   14778             :                  "this" parameter. */
   14779             :               new_expr = var_rvalue_expr(this_param_var);
   14780             :             }  /* if */
   14781             :             /* Change "this = expr" to "((this = expr), this)" by converting
   14782             :                the original expression to a comma node.  Make a copy of the
   14783             :                original node so the original node can be overwritten. */
   14784             :             orig_expr_copy = copy_node(expr);
   14785             :             /* The copy is not an lvalue-returning operation. */
   14786             :             orig_expr_copy->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   14787             :             orig_expr_copy->variant.operation.
   14788             :                                 returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue = FALSE;
   14789             :             orig_expr_copy->type = this_param_var->type;
   14790             :             orig_expr_copy->next = new_expr;
   14791             :             change_node_to_operation(expr,
   14792             :                                      (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   14793             :                                      expr->type, orig_expr_copy,
   14794             :                                      /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE);
   14795             :             set_expr_insert_location(new_expr, &insert_location);
   14796             :             /* The insert location now specifies insertion before the final
   14797             :                expression.  Add the wrapper code there. */
   14798             :             add_constructor_wrapper_code(innermost_function_scope,
   14799             :                                          &insert_location);
   14800             :           }  /* if */
   14801             :         }  /* if */
   14802             :       }  /* if */
   14803             : #endif /* ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED */
   14804             :       if (needs_cast_because_type_has_param_passed_via_cctor(
   14805             :                                                    operand_node->next->type)) {
   14806             :         /* Add a cast if the source of the assignment has a type that contains
   14807             :            a function with a copy constructed parameter. */
   14808             :         operand_node->next = add_cast(operand_node->next,
   14809             :                                       cast_type_for_param_passed_via_cctor(
   14810             :                                                       operand_node->next->type,
   14811             :                                                       operand_node->type));
   14812             :       }  /* if */
   14813             :       break;
   14814             :     case tk_struct:
   14815             :       rewrite_class_assignment_if_necessary(expr);
   14816             :       break; 
   14817             :     default:
   14818             :       /* Nothing to do. */
   14819             :       break;
   14820             :   }  /* switch */
   14821             : }  /* lower_assignment_operator */
   14822             : 
   14823             : #if LOWER_CLASS_RVALUE_ADJUST
   14824             : 
   14825             : static void lower_class_rvalue_adjust(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14826             : /*
   14827             : Lower the eok_class_rvalue_adjust expression (which is used to adjust
   14828             : cv-qualifiers on a class rvalue).  The underlying expression has not been
   14829             : lowered yet (a requirement for calling rvalue_pointer_for_class_rvalue)
   14830             : and is lowered by this routine.
   14831             : */
   14832             : {
   14833             :   an_expr_node_ptr  node;
   14834             : 
   14835             :   node = rvalue_pointer_for_class_rvalue(expr->variant.operation.operands);
   14836             :   node = add_cast(node, make_pointer_type(expr->type));
   14837             :   node = add_indirection_to_node(node);
   14838             :   overwrite_node(expr, rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(node));
   14839             :   lower_expr(expr);
   14840             : }  /* lower_class_rvalue_adjust */
   14841             : 
   14842             : #endif /* LOWER_CLASS_RVALUE_ADJUST */
   14843             : 
   14844             : static void remove_qualifiers_from_expr_type_if_needed(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14845             : /*
   14846             : Utility that removes cv-qualifiers from the expression type if needed
   14847             : (because qualifiers are removed from rvalue expression types during
   14848             : lowering).  Note that eok_class_rvalue_adjust operations are not modified here
   14849             : (the original type is used during the lowering of that node).
   14850             : */
   14851             : {
   14852             :   if (!expr->is_lvalue &&
   14853             : #if LOWER_CLASS_RVALUE_ADJUST
   14854             :       !(is_operation_node(expr) &&
   14855             :         node_operator_is(expr, eok_class_rvalue_adjust)) &&
   14856             : #endif /* LOWER_CLASS_RVALUE_ADJUST */
   14857             :       expr->kind != (an_expr_node_kind)enk_field &&
   14858             :       is_qualified_type(expr->type)) {
   14859             :     expr->type = make_unqualified_type(expr->type);
   14860             :   }  /* if */
   14861             : }  /* remove_qualifiers_from_expr_type_if_needed */
   14862             : 
   14863             : 
   14864             : static void lower_param_ref(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14865             : /*
   14866             : The front end uses enk_param_refs to represent "this" in two particular
   14867             : instances: for an implicit use of "this" in a field initializer that is
   14868             : lowered by a constructor init, e.g., a case like:
   14869             : 
   14870             :   struct A { int i = 0; int j = i; };
   14871             : 
   14872             : and in a non-constant aggregate initialization, e.g.:
   14873             : 
   14874             :   struct S {
   14875             :     int a;
   14876             :     struct N { int b; } n = {a};
   14877             :   } s = { 42 };
   14878             : 
   14879             : Replace the enk_param_ref with an enk_variable node that represents "this" in
   14880             : each case.  Note that (as of C++14), the two cases are not mutually exclusive
   14881             : as in this case:
   14882             : 
   14883             :   struct B {
   14884             :     int x = 37;
   14885             :     int y = f();
   14886             :     int f() { return x;}  // enk_param_ref-for-this refers to the B object.
   14887             :   };
   14888             :   struct A {
   14889             :     int g() { return 2; }
   14890             :     B b { g() };  // enk_param_ref-for-this refers to the A object.
   14891             :   } a;
   14892             : 
   14893             : If we're in a non-constant aggregate initialization, search for that first.
   14894             : */
   14895             : {
   14896             :   a_boolean found = FALSE;
   14897             : 
   14898             :   check_assertion(expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_param_ref &&
   14899             :                   expr->variant.param_ref.param_num == 0);
   14900             :   if (aggregate_this_stack != NULL) {
   14901             :     /* We must be lowering an aggregate constant; go backwards through the
   14902             :        stack of nested potential "this" pointers looking for one that matches
   14903             :        the type of the enk_param_ref node (there can only be one) and
   14904             :        create an expression that points to the beginning of that aggregate.
   14905             :        Note that the code below is inefficient in that it creates an
   14906             :        expression representation for the initialization position description
   14907             :        just to find out its type (and discards expression trees that don't
   14908             :        match), but the type is difficult to determine (because of potential
   14909             :        modifiers) and this case doesn't occur frequently. */
   14910             :     an_expr_node_ptr      new_expr = NULL;
   14911             :     an_init_pos_descr_ptr ipdp;
   14912             :     a_type_ptr            new_type, old_type = type_pointed_to(expr->type);
   14913             :     for (ipdp = aggregate_this_stack; ipdp != NULL; ipdp = ipdp->next) {
   14914             :       a_type_ptr subobj_type;
   14915             :       new_expr = make_address_of_init_entity_node(ipdp,
   14916             :                                                   /*using_as_dest=*/FALSE);
   14917             :       new_type = type_pointed_to(new_expr->type);
   14918             :       if (identical_types_ignoring_qualifiers(new_type, old_type) ||
   14919             :           (aggregate_classes_can_have_bases &&
   14920             :            (subobj_type = subobject_for_class(old_type),
   14921             :             identical_types_ignoring_qualifiers(new_type, subobj_type)))) {
   14922             :         found = TRUE;
   14923             :         new_expr = add_cast_if_necessary(new_expr, expr->type);
   14924             :         overwrite_node(expr, new_expr);
   14925             :         break;
   14926             :       }  /* if */
   14927             :     }  /* for */
   14928             :   }  /* if */
   14929             :   if (!found) {
   14930             :     if (ctor_init_this != NULL) {
   14931             :       /* We're lowering a constructor init; use the "this" parameter for
   14932             :          the function. */
   14933             :       check_assertion(identical_types_ignoring_qualifiers(ctor_init_this->type,
   14934             :                                                           expr->type));
   14935             :       set_expr_node_kind(expr, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_variable);
   14936             :       node_variable(expr) = ctor_init_this;
   14937             :     } else {
   14938             :       unexpected_condition();
   14939             :     }  /* if */
   14940             :   }  /* if */
   14941             : }  /* lower_param_ref */
   14942             : 
   14943             : #if USE_LAZY_INITIALIZATION_FOR_THREAD_LOCAL_VARIABLES
   14944             : 
   14945             : static void lower_thread_local_variable(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   14946             : /*
   14947             : Lower a reference to a thread_local variable by replacing its use with a
   14948             : wrapper routine if applicable.
   14949             : */
   14950             : {
   14951             :   a_variable_ptr    var;
   14952             :   a_routine_ptr     wrapper;
   14953             :   an_expr_node_ptr  new_expr;
   14954             :   a_boolean         wrapper_needed = FALSE;
   14955             : 
   14956             :   check_assertion(is_variable_node(expr));
   14957             :   var = node_variable(expr);
   14958             :   check_assertion(var_has_thread_storage_duration(var));
   14959             :   if (var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_extern) {
   14960             :     /* If the variable is defined in another translation unit, a wrapper is
   14961             :        always used (in some cases a definition for the wrapper will not
   14962             :        be emitted, and in other cases the wrapper may do nothing, but the
   14963             :        caller doesn't know that). */
   14964             :     wrapper_needed = TRUE;
   14965             :   } else if ((var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified ||
   14966             :               var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static)) {
   14967             :     if (var->source_corresp.is_local_to_function ||
   14968             :         var->promoted_local_static) {
   14969             :       /* Exclude promoted local statics. */
   14970             :       wrapper_needed = FALSE;
   14971             :     } else if (all_thread_locals_have_wrappers) {
   14972             :       /* To be standard-compliant, all thread_local variables need
   14973             :          wrappers. */
   14974             :       wrapper_needed = TRUE;
   14975             :     } else if (var->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic ||
   14976             :                var->initialization_rewritten_as_assignment) {
   14977             :       /* Wrappers are generated only for thread_local variables with
   14978             :          dynamic initialization (this matches GNU's behavior and is more
   14979             :          efficient, but is not standard-compliant). */
   14980             :       wrapper_needed = TRUE;
   14981             :     }  /* if */
   14982             :   }  /* if */
   14983             :   if (wrapper_needed) {
   14984             :     /* Replace the enk_variable node with "*wrapper()" (the wrapper returns the
   14985             :        address of the variable). */
   14986             :     wrapper = thread_local_wrapper_for_variable(var);
   14987             :     new_expr = make_call_node(wrapper, (an_expr_node_ptr)NULL);
   14988             :     check_assertion(!new_expr->is_lvalue);
   14989             :     new_expr = add_indirection_to_node(new_expr);
   14990             :     if (!expr->is_lvalue) {
   14991             :       new_expr = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(new_expr);
   14992             :     }  /* if */
   14993             :     overwrite_node(expr, new_expr);
   14994             :   }  /* if */
   14995             : }  /* lower_thread_local_variable */
   14996             : 
   14997             : #endif /* USE_LAZY_INITIALIZATION_FOR_THREAD_LOCAL_VARIABLES */
   14998             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   14999             : 
   15000             : void lower_gnu_statement_expression(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   15001             : /*
   15002             : Lower the given enk_statement expression node (which represents a GNU statement
   15003             : expression).  This routine is used in lowering both C and C++.
   15004             : */
   15005             : {
   15006             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   15007             :   a_boolean saved_inlining_enabled;
   15008             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   15009             :   a_statement_ptr  block = expr->variant.statement;
   15010             :   a_statement_ptr  last, result_stmt = NULL;
   15011             :   a_variable_ptr   result_var = NULL;
   15012             : 
   15013             :   check_assertion(block->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block);
   15014             :   last = last_statement_in_block(block);
   15015             :   if (last != NULL && last->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_stmt_expr_result) {
   15016             :     /* The GNU statement expression produces a value. */
   15017             :     result_stmt = last;
   15018             :   }  /* if */
   15019             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   15020             :   saved_inlining_enabled = inlining_enabled;
   15021             :   /* Turn off inlining, because the last statement creates a
   15022             :      value that gets returned, and it needs to be an expression
   15023             :      statement to get returned (inlining would turn it into a
   15024             :      block statement). */
   15025             :   inlining_enabled = FALSE;
   15026             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   15027             :   if (C_mode()) {
   15028             :     a_context context, *saved_curr_context;
   15029             :     /* Create a new context, unrelated to any previous contexts, in
   15030             :        which the statement expression should be lowered. */
   15031             :     save_and_push_context(&context, (a_scope_ptr)NULL,
   15032             :                           (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL,
   15033             :                           &saved_curr_context);
   15034             :     lower_c99_statement(block);
   15035             :     restore_saved_context(saved_curr_context);
   15036             :   } else {
   15037             :     lower_block_statement(block,
   15038             :                           /*is_block_of_function_try=*/FALSE,
   15039             :                           /*is_block_of_stmt_expr=*/TRUE,
   15040             :                           (a_destructor_wrapper_info_block_ptr)NULL,
   15041             :                           (a_statement_ptr *)NULL);
   15042             :   }  /* if */
   15043             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   15044             :   inlining_enabled = saved_inlining_enabled;
   15045             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   15046             :   if (result_stmt != NULL) {
   15047             :     if (result_stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block) {
   15048             :       /* Lowering changed the result statement into a block. */
   15049             :       last = last_statement_in_block(result_stmt);
   15050             :       if (last->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_stmt_expr_result) {
   15051             :         /* The block needs to return a value, so change it into a statement
   15052             :            expression. */
   15053             :         change_block_into_statement_expression(result_stmt);
   15054             :         check_assertion(result_stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr);
   15055             :       }  /* if */
   15056             :     } else {
   15057             :       /* If it's not a block, it should be the original statement (and
   15058             :          any dynamic initialization should have been lowered). */
   15059             :       check_assertion(result_stmt->kind ==
   15060             :                                      (a_statement_kind)stmk_stmt_expr_result &&
   15061             :                       result_stmt->variant.stmt_expr_result.dynamic_init ==
   15062             :                                                                          NULL);
   15063             :     }  /* if */
   15064             :     if (result_stmt->next != NULL &&
   15065             :         result_stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_stmt_expr_result) {
   15066             :       /* Statements have been added by lowering after the stmk_stmt_expr_result
   15067             :          statement (that indicates the statement expression's result).
   15068             :          The back end expects that the last statement in the statement
   15069             :          expression returns the result (i.e., is a stmk_stmt_expr_result).
   15070             :          Transform:
   15071             :             stmk_stmt_expr_result(<result-expr>); <additional-stmts>
   15072             :          into
   15073             :             tmp = <result-expr>; <additional-stmts>; stmk_stmt_expr_result(tmp)
   15074             :          */
   15075             :       a_scope_ptr         scope = block->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope;
   15076             :       an_insert_location  insert_location;
   15077             :       an_expr_node_ptr    result_expr;
   15078             :       check_assertion(scope != NULL);
   15079             :       /* Turn result_stmt into an stmk_expr assignment statement. */
   15080             :       result_var = make_temporary_in_scope(result_stmt->expr->type, scope,
   15081             :                                            /*force_static=*/FALSE,
   15082             :                                            /*promote_if_necessary=*/FALSE);
   15083             :       result_expr = make_var_assignment_expr(result_var, result_stmt->expr);
   15084             :       result_stmt->expr->result_is_not_used = FALSE;
   15085             :       set_expr_result_not_used(result_expr);
   15086             :       set_statement_kind(result_stmt, (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr);
   15087             :       result_stmt->expr = result_expr;
   15088             :       /* Allocate a stmk_stmt_expr_result statement for the temporary and
   15089             :          make it the last statement in the block. */
   15090             :       result_stmt = alloc_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_stmt_expr_result);
   15091             :       result_stmt->expr = var_rvalue_expr(result_var);
   15092             :       last = last_statement_in_block(block);
   15093             :       set_insert_location(last, &insert_location);
   15094             :       insert_statement(result_stmt, &insert_location);
   15095             :     }  /* if */
   15096             :   }  /* if */
   15097             : }  /* lower_gnu_statement_expression */
   15098             : 
   15099             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15100             : 
   15101             : void lower_expr_full(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   15102             :                      a_boolean        assume_expr_is_non_null)
   15103             : /*
   15104             : Do IL lowering of the indicated expression and everything under it.
   15105             : assume_expr_is_non_null indicates whether the expression can be assumed
   15106             : to be non-NULL (or its address is non-NULL for lvalue expressions), thereby
   15107             : suppressing NULL-preservation checks if the expression contains a related class
   15108             : cast.  See lower_expr for typical invocation.
   15109             : */
   15110             : {
   15111             :   an_expr_operator_kind op;
   15112             :   an_expr_node_ptr      operand_node;
   15113             :   an_expr_node_ptr      temp_init_node;
   15114             :   a_variable_ptr        var, temp_var;
   15115             : #if DEBUG
   15116             :   unsigned long         checksum = 0;
   15117             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   15118             : 
   15119             :   mark_as_visited(expr);
   15120             : #if DEBUG
   15121             :   if (db_flag_is_set("lower_expr")) {
   15122             :     checksum = compute_checksum_for_expr(expr);
   15123             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Expression before lowering");
   15124             :     db_expr_range(expr);
   15125             :     fputs(":\n", f_debug);
   15126             :     db_expression(expr);
   15127             :   }  /* if */
   15128             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   15129             :   change_xvalue_node_to_lvalue(expr);
   15130             :   if (expr->is_lvalue && expr->result_is_not_used) {
   15131             : #if DEBUG
   15132             :     if (db_flag_is_set("rewrite_expr") && !db_flag_is_set("lower_expr")) {
   15133             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Lvalue expression before re-writing");
   15134             :       db_expr_range(expr);
   15135             :       fputs(":\n", f_debug);
   15136             :       db_expression(expr);
   15137             :     }  /* if */
   15138             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   15139             :     /* If the result of the lvalue is discarded, rewrite the expression
   15140             :        as an rvalue. */
   15141             :     rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(expr);
   15142             : #if DEBUG
   15143             :     if (db_flag_is_set("rewrite_expr") || db_flag_is_set("lower_expr")) {
   15144             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Expression after being re-written as an rvalue");
   15145             :       db_expr_range(expr);
   15146             :       fputs(":\n", f_debug);
   15147             :       db_expression(expr);
   15148             :       /* Re-compute checksum. */
   15149             :       checksum = compute_checksum_for_expr(expr);
   15150             :     }  /* if */
   15151             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   15152             :   }  /* if */
   15153             :   lower_os_type(expr->type);
   15154             :   /* Remove cv-qualifiers from the types of rvalues.  In C++, such
   15155             :      rvalues retain their type qualifiers, but in C they do not. */
   15156             :   remove_qualifiers_from_expr_type_if_needed(expr);
   15157             :   switch (expr->kind) {
   15158             :     case enk_field:
   15159             :     case enk_address_of_ellipsis:
   15160             :       /* No processing required. */
   15161             :       break;
   15162             :     case enk_routine:
   15163             : #if GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING || LOWER_IFUNC
   15164             :       { a_routine_ptr  rp = node_routine(expr);
   15165             :         if (rp != NULL) {
   15166             : #if GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING
   15167             :           if (is_multiversion_representative(rp)) {
   15168             :             /* Replace a representative routine with a target-specific version
   15169             :                if one is available. */
   15170             :             rp = lowered_mv_routine(rp);
   15171             :             expr->variant.routine.ptr = rp;
   15172             :           }  /* if */
   15173             : #endif /* GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING */
   15174             : #if LOWER_IFUNC
   15175             :           if (rp->is_ifunc) {
   15176             :             /* Re-write the node to avoid calling the wrapper routine. */
   15177             :             lower_ifunc_expr(expr);
   15178             :           }  /* if */
   15179             : #endif /* LOWER_IFUNC */
   15180             :         }  /* if */
   15181             :       }  /* if */
   15182             : #endif /* GNU_FUNCTION_MULTIVERSIONING || LOWER_IFUNC */
   15183             :       break;
   15184             :     case enk_variable:
   15185             :       var = node_variable(expr);
   15186             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   15187             :       if (expr->is_lvalue && (var->is_parameter || var->is_handler_param)) {
   15188             :         /* Set flag indicating that this parameter is used as an lvalue. */
   15189             :         var->param_used_as_lvalue = TRUE;
   15190             :       }  /* if */
   15191             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   15192             :       if (var->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_binding) {
   15193             :         /* The variable is an alias for another expression.  Replace this
   15194             :            node by a lowered clone of that expression.  bound_expr has not been
   15195             :            lowered; copy it (to avoid any memory region issues) and lower the
   15196             :            copy. */
   15197             :         an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
   15198             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
   15199             :         check_assertion(!node_has_side_effects(var->initializer.bound_expr,
   15200             :                                                (a_boolean *)NULL));
   15201             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
   15202             :         expr_copy = copy_expr_tree(var->initializer.bound_expr,
   15203             :                                    CE_COPYING_FROM_ONE_FUNC_TO_ANOTHER);
   15204             :         lower_expr(expr_copy);
   15205             :         if (expr->is_lvalue == expr_copy->is_lvalue) {
   15206             :           /* If lvalue-ness is the same, just use the copy. */
   15207             :         } else {
   15208             :           /* If an rvalue is needed, create one. */
   15209             :           check_assertion(expr_copy->is_lvalue);
   15210             :           expr_copy = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(expr_copy);
   15211             :         }  /* if */
   15212             :         if (!il_identical_types(expr_copy->type, expr->type)) {
   15213             :           /* Assume mismatched types are the result of differences in
   15214             :              cv-qualification and add an appropriate cast. */
   15215             :           if (expr_copy->is_lvalue) {
   15216             :             expr_copy = make_lvalue_operator_node(
   15217             :                                         (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lvalue_cast,
   15218             :                                         expr->type, expr_copy);
   15219             :           } else {
   15220             :             expr_copy = add_cast(expr_copy, expr->type);
   15221             :           }  /* if */
   15222             :         }  /* if */
   15223             :         overwrite_node(expr, expr_copy);
   15224             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   15225             :       } else if (var->is_vla && expr->is_lvalue) {
   15226             :         /* VLAs are lowered to pointers (to automatically managed storage).
   15227             :            The pointer value should be used. */
   15228             :         lower_vla_variable_lvalue(expr);
   15229             :         /* The expression is no longer an enk_variable expression, so
   15230             :            skip the checks below (they don't apply to array variables
   15231             :            anyway). */
   15232             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   15233             :       } else {
   15234             :         /* If the variable is a parameter that's passed by copy constructor,
   15235             :            an implicit indirection must be added. */
   15236             :         /* assoc_param_type is NULL on the "this" parameter variable and
   15237             :            the return value pointer variable. */
   15238             :         if (var->is_parameter && var->variant.assoc_param_type != NULL &&
   15239             :             var->variant.assoc_param_type->passed_via_copy_constructor) {
   15240             :           /* Add an indirection, but don't change the node's type or
   15241             :              lvalueness.  The type was "wrong" because the parameter type
   15242             :              was changed in lowering, but the indirection here cancels
   15243             :              out the extra pointer-to on the parameter type.*/
   15244             :           an_expr_node_ptr new_expr;
   15245             :           an_expr_node_ptr var_copy = copy_node(expr);
   15246             :           /* Make sure the type of the enk_variable node matches that of
   15247             :              the variable. */
   15248             :           var_copy->type = var->type;
   15249             :           if (var_copy->is_lvalue) {
   15250             :             /* Convert this node to an rvalue in preparation for the
   15251             :                indirection. */
   15252             :             var_copy = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(var_copy);
   15253             :           } else if (var_copy->orig_lvalue_type != NULL) {
   15254             :             /* Update the orig_lvalue_type (if one has been captured). */
   15255             :             var_copy->orig_lvalue_type = var_copy->type;
   15256             :           }  /* if */
   15257             :           new_expr = add_indirection_to_node(var_copy);
   15258             :           if (!expr->is_lvalue) {
   15259             :             /* Original expression was an rvalue, make sure new
   15260             :                expression is as well. */
   15261             :             new_expr = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(new_expr);
   15262             :           }  /* if */
   15263             :           check_assertion(il_identical_types(new_expr->type, expr->type) &&
   15264             :                           new_expr->is_lvalue == expr->is_lvalue);
   15265             :           overwrite_node(expr, new_expr);
   15266             : #if DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING
   15267             :         } else if (var_is_return_value_variable(var)) {
   15268             :           /* The variable is the return value optimization variable for the
   15269             :              current function, so rewrite it as an indirection through the
   15270             :              implicit parameter through which the return address is passed by
   15271             :              the caller. */
   15272             :           a_boolean expr_is_lvalue = expr->is_lvalue;
   15273             :           check_assertion(!is_effective_thread_local(var));
   15274             :           operand_node = var_rvalue_expr(return_value_pointer_variable);
   15275             :           /* Make sure the types are consistent (cv-qualification can
   15276             :              be mismatched here). */
   15277             :           operand_node = add_cast_if_necessary(operand_node,
   15278             :                                                make_pointer_type(expr->type));

   15281             :                                    /*is_lvalue=*/TRUE);
   15282             :           if (!expr_is_lvalue) {
   15283             :             /* Convert to an rvalue if necessary. */
   15284             :             expr = rvalue_expr_for_lvalue(expr);
   15285             :           }  /* if */
   15286             : #endif /* DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING */
   15287             : #if ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED
   15288             :         } else if (innermost_function_scope != NULL &&
   15289             :                    innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.
   15290             :                                                   this_param_variable == var &&
   15291             :                    should_drop_const_on_this_param_variable(
   15292             :                         innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr,
   15293             :                         innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->type) &&
   15294             :                    !identical_types(var->type, expr->type)) {
   15295             :           /* If assignment to 'this' is allowed (an anachronism), the
   15296             :              const qualification of the 'this' parameter has already been
   15297             :              stripped in lower_scope.  Change the type of the enk_variable
   15298             :              expression to match that of the variable (most likely this is
   15299             :              simply removing a const qualification).  Note that this changes
   15300             :              the type of the overall expression. */
   15301             :           expr->type = var->type;
   15302             : #endif /* ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED */
   15303             : #if USE_LAZY_INITIALIZATION_FOR_THREAD_LOCAL_VARIABLES
   15304             :         } else if (is_effective_thread_local(var)) {
   15305             :           /* Determine if this thread_local variable needs to be rewritten
   15306             :              to call a wrapper routine. */

   15308             :           /* Note that the expression may no longer be an enk_variable
   15309             :              after this lowering. */
   15310             : #endif /* USE_LAZY_INITIALIZATION_FOR_THREAD_LOCAL_VARIABLES */
   15311             :         } else if (var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_auto &&
   15312             :                    var->source_corresp.enclosing_routine != NULL &&
   15313             :                    var->source_corresp.enclosing_routine !=
   15314             :                                innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr) {
   15315             :           /* A variable with automatic storage duration that isn't local to the
   15316             :              current routine.  This can happen for constexpr arrays, e.g.,
   15317             :                void f() {
   15318             :                  constexpr int x[] { 42,43,44,45,46 };
   15319             :                  auto index = [](int i) { return x[i]; };
   15320             :                }
   15321             :              In this case, x is local to f but referred to by the lambda's
   15322             :              operator() routine.  Replace the variable with a local static
   15323             :              temporary that is initialized with a copy of the original
   15324             :              variable's constant initializer. */
   15325             :           a_constant_ptr new_con, old_con = initializer_constant(var);
   15326             :           if (is_array_type(var->type) && old_con != NULL) {
   15327             :             a_variable_ptr new_var;
   15328             :             /* Copy the constant into the current scope. */
   15329             :             new_con = copy_unshared_constant(old_con);

   15331             :             new_var = make_unnamed_local_static_variable(var->type,

   15334             :                a local-static-variable-init entry. */

   15339             :                                                   (a_dynamic_init_ptr)NULL);

   15341             :           } else {
   15342             :             /* It is possible for lambdas to refer to variables in the
   15343             :                enclosing context when they appear in unevaluated contexts.
   15344             :                For example:
   15345             :                  void f(int n) { auto lm = []{ __assume(n); }; }
   15346             :                Verify that the variable and enclosing routine are in the
   15347             :                same memory region. */

   15350             :                             innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->
   15351             :                                                               memory_region);
   15352             :           }  /* if */
   15353             :         }  /* if */
   15354             :       }  /* if */
   15355             :       break;
   15356             :     case enk_operation:
   15357             :       /* The type_kind of the operation is lowered (if necessary) during
   15358             :          the lowering post pass. */
   15359             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   15360             :       /* Before lowering operands of an expression, look for a couple
   15361             :          of special cases that operate on a VLA operand. */
   15362             :       if (vla_enabled && is_vla_type(expr->variant.operation.operands->type)) {
   15363             :         lower_vla_operations_before_operands_are_lowered(expr);
   15364             :       }  /* if */
   15365             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   15366             : #if LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST
   15367             :       /* See if we can optimize an operation that operates on a ck_string.
   15368             :          Do so before lowering while the ck_strings are still identifiable
   15369             :          (and not turned into variables as they are in some configurations). */
   15370             :       lower_operation_on_const_string_if_possible(expr);
   15371             : #endif /* LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST */
   15372             :       operand_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   15373             :       op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   15374             :       /* Look for some special cases before the expression is lowered.
   15375             :          In each of these cases, the expr subtree must be lowered during
   15376             :          the special processing. */
   15377             :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_reference_to) {
   15378             :         /* Change a reference to operation to an address of operation. */
   15379             :         lower_reference_to(expr);
   15380             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ref_indirect) {
   15381             :         /* Change a reference indirection to a pointer indirection. */
   15382             :         lower_ref_indirect(expr);
   15383             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_base_class_cast ||
   15384             :                  op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_derived_class_cast) {
   15385             :         /* Cast to base or derived class is rewritten.  This call also
   15386             :            lowers any subtree. */
   15387             :         lower_related_class_cast(expr, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   15388             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_pm_base_class_cast ||
   15389             :                  op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_pm_derived_class_cast) {
   15390             :         /* Cast of pointer-to-member to base or derived class is rewritten.
   15391             :            This call also lowers any subtree. */
   15392             :         lower_pm_related_class_cast(expr);

   15396             :                    (a_boolean *)NULL);

   15400             :         /* Lower pointer-to-member comparison before the operands have been
   15401             :            lowered, to allow an optimization on comparisons to constants. */
   15402             :         lower_pm_comparison(expr, /*operand1_lowered=*/FALSE);
   15403             :         change_result_type_of_operator_returning_bool(expr);

   15418             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */

   15420             :                  !expr->is_lvalue &&

   15423             :            enk_temp_init, where the cast only adjusts cv-qualifiers that

   15436             :         lower_question_operator(expr, assume_expr_is_non_null);
   15437             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_land ||
   15438             :                  op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lor) {
   15439             :         /* Lower a logical operator and everything under it. */
   15440             :         lower_logical_operator(expr);
   15441             :         /* Change the type of operators that return "bool" in C++ to
   15442             :            the "int" required in C. */

   15445             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_class_rvalue_adjust) {

   15455             :              bool-producing operation.  This has to be done before lowering
   15456             :              the operand expression because this sets up an optimization
   15457             :              done during lowering. */
   15458             :           a_boolean adjusted;

   15463             :            convert the operand to a pointer to class before the operands

   15477             :                been set by the front end, but in some cases the operand has
   15478             :                since been lowered to a variable and the flag needs setting).

   15480             :                retained in the tree (e.g., operands of sizeof) may not have set
   15481             :                the address_taken flag. */

   15484             :           case eok_address_of:

   15486             :                been set by the front end, but in some cases the operand has
   15487             :                since been lowered to a variable and the flag needs setting).

   15489             :                retained in the tree (e.g., operands of sizeof) may not have set
   15490             :                the address_taken flag. */
   15491             :             set_address_taken_for_variable_or_routine_expr(operand_node);

   15495             :           case eok_indirect:
   15496             :             /* See if an optimization applies. */
   15497             :             optimize_node_if_possible(expr);
   15498             :             break;
   15499             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   15500             :           case eok_negate:

   15505             :           case eok_add:

   15512             :               lower_c99_xsubtract(expr);

   15514             :             break;
   15515             :           case eok_multiply:

   15517             :               lower_c99_xmultiply(expr);

   15529             :             break;
   15530             :           case eok_ne:
   15531             :             if (node_operator_type_kind_is(expr, tk_complex)) {
   15532             :               lower_c99_xne(expr);
   15533             :             }  /*if */
   15534             :             break;
   15535             : #if C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED
   15536             :           case eok_xconj:
   15537             :             lower_xconj(expr);
   15538             :             break;
   15539             :           case eok_real_part:
   15540             :           case eok_imag_part:
   15541             :             lower_complex_projection(expr);
   15542             :             break;
   15543             : #endif /* C99_IL_EXTENSIONS_SUPPORTED */
   15544             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   15545             :           case eok_assign:
   15546             :             lower_assignment_operator(expr);
   15547             :             break;
   15548             :           case eok_virtual_function_ptr:
   15549             :             /* Determine virtual function address. */
   15550             :             lower_virtual_function_ptr(expr);
   15551             :             break;
   15552             :           case eok_dot_vacuous_destructor_call:
   15553             :           case eok_points_to_vacuous_destructor_call:
   15554             :             /* A call of a "destructor" for a class or simple type that does
   15555             :                not have one, e.g., p->int::~int().  Change the node into
   15556             :                a cast to void. */
   15557             :             /* A second operand node is only present to hold a name reference
   15558             :                representing the way the vacuous destructor was expressed in
   15559             :                the source.  Eliminate, since it is not valid as a cast
   15560             :                operand. */
   15561             :             operand_node->next = NULL;
   15562             :             if (operand_node->is_lvalue) {
   15563             :               /* For the lvalue.T::~T() case, change the lvalue to an rvalue
   15564             :                  and then cast that to void. */
   15565             :               rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(operand_node);
   15566             :             }  /* if */
   15567             :             change_to_cast(expr, operand_node, expr->type);
   15568             :             break;
   15569             :           case eok_cast:
   15570             :             /* A cast from one pointer-to-member type to another does nothing.
   15571             :                Note that pointer-to-data-member and pointer-to-member-function
   15572             :                cannot be intercast.  A cast between pointers to data members
   15573             :                cannot be recognized here (it's now an integral cast), but
   15574             :                that's harmless.  The pointer to member function case must
   15575             :                be rewritten, however, since it's now a cast of a struct
   15576             :                type. */
   15577             :             type = expr->type;
   15578             :             if (is_or_was_nullptr_type(type) ||
   15579             :                 ((is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(type) ||
   15580             :                   is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(type)) &&
   15581             :                   is_or_was_nullptr_type(operand_node->type))) {
   15582             :               /* Replace a cast to a nullptr type, or a cast of a nullptr
   15583             :                  type to a pointer to member type, with a constant of the
   15584             :                  proper type. */
   15585             :               overwrite_node(expr, expr_for_nullptr_type(type, operand_node));
   15586             :             } else if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(expr->type)) {
   15587             :               /* Preserve the result type because it tells us how to call
   15588             :                  the kind of routine we've selected. */
   15589             :               overwrite_node(expr, operand_node);
   15590             :               expr->type = type;
   15591             :             }  /* if */
   15592             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   15593             :             if (is_nonreal_floating_type(expr->type) ||
   15594             :                 is_nonreal_floating_type(operand_node->type)) {
   15595             :               lower_c99_complex_cast(expr);
   15596             :             }  /* if */
   15597             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   15598             :             /* If the cast introduces a VLA type, handle that. */
   15599             :             lower_type_of_vla_cast_if_necessary(expr);
   15600             :             if (is_void_type(type) && operand_node->is_lvalue) {
   15601             :               /* We have an lvalue that is cast to a void type.  Rewrite
   15602             :                  this discarded lvalue as an rvalue. */
   15603             :               rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(operand_node);
   15604             :             }  /* if */
   15605             :             break;
   15606             :           case eok_lvalue_cast:
   15607             :           case eok_lvalue_adjust:
   15608             :             /* If the lvalue cast introduces a VLA type, handle that. */
   15609             :             lower_type_of_vla_cast_if_necessary(expr);
   15610             :             break;
   15611             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   15612             :           case eok_dynamic_cast:
   15613             :           case eok_ref_dynamic_cast:
   15614             :             lower_dynamic_cast(expr);
   15615             :             break;
   15616             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   15617             :           case eok_ref_cast:
   15618             :             /* If the ref cast introduces a VLA type, handle that. */
   15619             :             lower_type_of_vla_cast_if_necessary(expr);
   15620             :             /* Rewrite an eok_ref_cast as an eok_lvalue_adjust. */
   15621             :             expr->variant.operation.kind =
   15622             :                                       (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lvalue_adjust;
   15623             :             break;
   15624             :           case eok_bool_cast:
   15625             :             lower_bool_cast(expr);
   15626             :             break;
   15627             :           case eok_unary_plus:
   15628             :             /* Remove this do-nothing operation (it can cause problems in some
   15629             :                lowered code, e.g., with complex types).  The operand has
   15630             :                already been lowered. */
   15631             :             overwrite_node(expr, operand_node);
   15632             :             break;
   15633             :           case eok_post_incr:
   15634             :           case eok_pre_incr:
   15635             :             if (bool_is_keyword) {
   15636             :               /* Incrementing a bool (which is deprecated) sets the bool to
   15637             :                  true. */
   15638             :               if (is_bool_type(operand_node->type)) {
   15639             :                 lower_bool_incr_decr(expr);
   15640             :                 break;
   15641             :               }  /* if */
   15642             :             }  /* if */
   15643             :             /*FALLTHROUGH*/
   15644             :           case eok_pre_decr:
   15645             :           case eok_post_decr:
   15646             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   15647             :             if (vla_enabled && is_pointer_type(expr->type) &&
   15648             :                 is_vla_type(type_pointed_to(expr->type))) {
   15649             :               /* Arithmetic on pointers to VLAs depends on the run-time sizes
   15650             :                  of those VLAs.  Since the VLAs are lowered, the pointer
   15651             :                  arithmetic must be transformed to explicitly include the
   15652             :                  run-time sizes. */
   15653             :               lower_vla_pointer_integer_arithmetic(expr);
   15654             :             }  /* if */
   15655             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   15656             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   15657             :             if (is_complex_type(expr->type)) {
   15658             :               /* In GNU modes, increment/decrement of complex numbers are
   15659             :                  permitted.  */
   15660             :               lower_c99_xincr_decr(expr);
   15661             :             }  /* if */
   15662             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   15663             :             break;
   15664             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   15665             :           case eok_pdiff:
   15666             :             if (vla_enabled && is_vla_type(type_pointed_to(
   15667             :                                    expr->variant.operation.operands->type))) {
   15668             :               /* Arithmetic on pointers to VLAs depends on the run-time sizes
   15669             :                  of those VLAs.  Since the VLAs are lowered, the pointer
   15670             :                  arithmetic must be transformed to explicitly include the
   15671             :                  run-time sizes. */
   15672             :               lower_vla_pointer_difference(expr);
   15673             :             }  /* if */
   15674             :             break;
   15675             :           case eok_subscript:
   15676             :             if (vla_enabled && is_vla_type(expr->type)) {
   15677             :               /* VLA subscript operations depend on the run-time sizes of
   15678             :                  the VLA. */
   15679             :               lower_vla_pointer_integer_arithmetic(expr);
   15680             :             }  /* if */
   15681             :             break;
   15682             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   15683             :           case eok_padd_assign:
   15684             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   15685             :           case eok_padd:
   15686             :           case eok_psubtract:
   15687             :           case eok_psubtract_assign:
   15688             :             if (vla_enabled && is_vla_type(type_pointed_to(expr->type))) {
   15689             :               /* Arithmetic on pointers to VLAs depends on the run-time sizes
   15690             :                  of those VLAs.  Since the VLAs are lowered, the pointer
   15691             :                  arithmetic must be transformed to explicitly include the
   15692             :                  run-time sizes. */
   15693             :               lower_vla_pointer_integer_arithmetic(expr);
   15694             :             }  /* if */
   15695             :             if (op != (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_padd_assign) {
   15696             :               /* An eok_padd_assign operation of the form "bool_val += ptr"
   15697             :                  needs a different transformation handled by the fall-through
   15698             :                  code. */
   15699             :               break;
   15700             :             }  /* if */
   15701             :             /*FALLTHROUGH*/
   15702             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   15703             :           case eok_add_assign:
   15704             :           case eok_subtract_assign:
   15705             :           case eok_multiply_assign:
   15706             :           case eok_divide_assign:
   15707             :           case eok_remainder_assign:
   15708             :           case eok_shiftl_assign:
   15709             :           case eok_shiftr_assign:
   15710             :           case eok_and_assign:
   15711             :           case eok_or_assign:
   15712             :           case eok_xor_assign:
   15713             :             if (bool_is_keyword && is_bool_type(operand_node->type)) {
   15714             :               /* Compound assignments to bool don't exist in C89, and
   15715             :                  must be lowered to get the value reduced to 0/1. */
   15716             :               rewrite_compound_assignment(expr);
   15717             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   15718             :             } else if (node_operator_type_kind_is(expr, tk_complex)) {
   15719             :               rewrite_compound_assignment(expr);
   15720             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   15721             :             }  /* if */
   15722             :             break;
   15723             :           case eok_pm_field:
   15724             :           case eok_pm_points_to_field:
   15725             :             /* Pointer-to-member selection of a data member. */
   15726             :             lower_pm_field(expr);
   15727             :             break;
   15728             :           case eok_dot_pm_func_ptr:
   15729             :           case eok_points_to_pm_func_ptr:
   15730             :             /* Lower an expression for the address of a pointer-to-member
   15731             :                function (a g++ feature). */
   15732             :             lower_pm_func_ptr(expr);
   15733             :             break;
   15734             :           case eok_dot_field:
   15735             :             /* See if an optimization applies. */
   15736             :             optimize_node_if_possible(expr);
   15737             :             /* If a field selection refers to an anonymous union field,
   15738             :                adjust it to make the anonymous union reference(s) explicit. */
   15739             :             adjust_field_selection_for_anonymous_union_references(expr);
   15740             :             break;
   15741             :           case eok_points_to_field:
   15742             :             /* See if an optimization applies. */
   15743             :             optimize_node_if_possible(expr);
   15744             :             /* If a field selection refers to an anonymous union field,
   15745             :                adjust it to make the anonymous union reference(s) explicit. */
   15746             :             adjust_field_selection_for_anonymous_union_references(expr);
   15747             :             break;
   15748             :           case eok_dot_static:
   15749             :           case eok_points_to_static:
   15750             :             /* Static member selection. */
   15751             :             if (!node_has_side_effects(operand_node, (a_boolean *)NULL)) {
   15752             :               /* If the first operand has no side effects, just throw it
   15753             :                  away and replace the expression by the second operand. */
   15754             :               overwrite_node(expr, operand_node->next);
   15755             :             } else {
   15756             :               /* Change a static selection to a comma operator (evaluate first
   15757             :                  operand, discard, evaluate second operand, return). 
   15758             :                  Maintain lvalueness of the overall expression, but simplify
   15759             :                  first operand of the new comma expression if possible. */
   15760             :               if (operand_node->is_lvalue) {
   15761             :                 rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(operand_node);
   15762             :               }  /* if */
   15763             :               set_node_operator(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma,
   15764             :                                expr->type, expr->is_lvalue, operand_node);
   15765             :             }  /* if */
   15766             :             break;
   15767             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15768             :           case eok_gnu_min:
   15769             :           case eok_gnu_max:
   15770             :             /* GNU C++ "<? and ">?". */
   15771             :             lower_gnu_min_max(expr);
   15772             :             break;
   15773             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15774             : #if !PRESERVE_TOP_LEVEL_CASTS_TO_VOID_IN_IL
   15775             :           case eok_comma:
   15776             :             /* Remove void casts from a comma operator. */
   15777             :             lower_comma(expr);
   15778             :             break;
   15779             : #endif /* !PRESERVE_TOP_LEVEL_CASTS_TO_VOID_IN_IL */
   15780             :           /* The following are not explicitly lowered (and must be handled by a
   15781             :              back end).  The operands to these vector operations are lowered,
   15782             :              however. */
   15783             :           case eok_vector_not:
   15784             :           case eok_vector_eq:
   15785             :           case eok_vector_ne:
   15786             :           case eok_vector_lt:
   15787             :           case eok_vector_gt:
   15788             :           case eok_vector_le:
   15789             :           case eok_vector_ge:
   15790             :           case eok_vector_land:
   15791             :           case eok_vector_lor:
   15792             :           case eok_vector_question:
   15793             :           default:
   15794             :             /* No action on most operators. */
   15795             :             break;
   15796             :         }  /* switch */
   15797             :         /* Change the type of operators that return "bool" in C++ to
   15798             :            the "int" required in C. */
   15799             :         change_result_type_of_operator_returning_bool(expr);
   15800             :       }  /* if */
   15801             :       break;
   15802             :     case enk_constant:
   15803             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED && LOWER_COMPLEX
   15804             :       if (node_constant_is(expr,ck_complex))  {
   15805             :         /* The lowering of a complex constant results in an aggregate constant,
   15806             :            which needs special treatment (much like the pointer-to-member case
   15807             :            below). */
   15808             :         lower_c99_constant_expr(expr);
   15809             :       } else
   15810             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED && LOWER_COMPLEX */
   15811             :       /* Do not insert code here. */
   15812             :       {
   15813             :         a_constant_ptr con = node_constant(expr);
   15814             :         if (con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_string && expr->is_lvalue) {
   15815             : #if ASSIGN_STRING_LITERAL_SEQUENCE_NUMBERS
   15816             :           if (con->variant.string.sequence_number != 0) {
   15817             :             /* This string must be the same across multiple translation
   15818             :                units (e.g., a string in an extern inline function).
   15819             :                Create a variable for it. */
   15820             :             rewrite_string_constant_as_variable(expr);
   15821             :             con = NULL;
   15822             :           }  /* if */
   15823             : #endif /* ASSIGN_STRING_LITERAL_SEQUENCE_NUMBERS */
   15824             : #if LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST
   15825             :           if (string_literals_are_const &&
   15826             :               is_const_qualified_type(expr->type)) {
   15827             :             /* During the lowering of the constant below, its constness
   15828             :                will be removed, so add an lvalue cast to preserve the correct
   15829             :                type.  Note that certain operations on strings have already been
   15830             :                optimized by lower_operation_on_const_string_if_possible
   15831             :                (in which case the expression is no longer const qualified
   15832             :                and we won't execute this code). */
   15833             :             a_type_ptr  orig_type = expr->type;
   15834             :             expr->type = make_unqualified_type(orig_type);
   15835             :             overwrite_node(expr, add_cast_to_glvalue(copy_node(expr),
   15836             :                                                      orig_type));
   15837             :           }  /* if */
   15838             : #endif /* LOWER_STRING_LITERALS_TO_NON_CONST */
   15839             :         }  /* if */
   15840             :         if (con != NULL) {
   15841             :           /* If the constant hasn't been rewritten as a variable, lower it. */
   15842             :           lower_os_constant(con);
   15843             :           if (check_for_troublesome_aggregate_constant(con,
   15844             :                                                        &temp_var)) {
   15845             :             /* This expression node is loading the value of a pointer-to-
   15846             :                member-function, which has or will become a struct represented
   15847             :                by a ck_aggregate constant, or an aggregate constant itself.
   15848             :                Since a ck_aggregate constant is not allowed here, use the value
   15849             :                of a temporary variable initialized with the ck_aggregate
   15850             :                constant. */
   15851             :             set_expr_node_kind(expr, (an_expr_node_kind)enk_variable);
   15852             :             node_variable(expr) = temp_var;
   15853             :             /* Note that the type will be lowered to the proper struct type.
   15854             :                The const on the variable type won't be there, but that's
   15855             :                correct; it should be dropped because the reference is an
   15856             :                rvalue. */
   15857             :             if (!identical_types(expr->type, temp_var->type)) {
   15858             :               expr->orig_lvalue_type = temp_var->type;
   15859             :             }  /* if */
   15860             :             check_assertion(f_identical_types(expr->type,
   15861             :                                               make_unqualified_type(con->type),
   15862             :                                               ITF_NO_FLAGS) &&
   15863             :                             f_identical_types(expr->type,
   15864             :                                               make_unqualified_type(
   15865             :                                                                temp_var->type),
   15866             :                                               ITF_NO_FLAGS));
   15867             :           }  /* if */
   15868             :         }  /* if */
   15869             :       }  /* if */
   15870             :       break;
   15871             :     case enk_temp_init:
   15872             :       lower_temp_init(expr);
   15873             :       break;
   15874             :     case enk_new_delete:
   15875             :       lower_new_delete(expr);
   15876             :       break;
   15877             :     case enk_throw:
   15878             :       lower_throw(expr);
   15879             :       break;
   15880             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   15881             :     case enk_typeid:
   15882             :       lower_typeid(expr);
   15883             :       break;
   15884             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   15885             :     case enk_sizeof:
   15886             :       /* enk_sizeof can appear when SIZEOF_TYPE_IS_UNKNOWN is defined or
   15887             :          if VLAs are allowed in C++ mode. */
   15888             :       lower_runtime_sizeof(expr);
   15889             :       break;
   15890             :     case enk_object_lifetime:
   15891             :       unexpected_condition_str("lower_expr: enk_object_lifetime not at top");
   15892             :     case enk_condition:
   15893             :       unexpected_condition_str("lower_expr: enk_condition not at top");
   15894             : #if !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
   15895             :     /* Nodes generated by IL lowering for partial lowering of exception
   15896             :        handling features.  Not expected here. */
   15897             :     case enk_lowered_eh_construct:
   15898             :       unexpected_condition_str("lower_expr: enk_lowered_eh_construct");
   15899             : #endif /* !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING */
   15900             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
   15901             :     /* Node generated as part of the body of an entry function used
   15902             :        as a wrapper for a call of an overriding virtual function
   15903             :        with a covariant return type. */
   15904             :     case enk_result_of_overriding_function:
   15905             :       break;
   15906             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
   15907             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15908             :     case enk_statement:
   15909             :       /* GNU statement expression, ({ ... }). */
   15910             :       lower_gnu_statement_expression(expr);
   15911             :       break;
   15912             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   15913             :     case enk_reuse_value:
   15914             :       lower_reuse_value_expr(expr);
   15915             :       break;
   15916             :     case enk_builtin_operation:
   15917             :       lower_builtin_operation(expr);
   15918             :       break;
   15919             :     case enk_lambda:
   15920             :       /* Lower a lambda expression. */
   15921             :       lower_lambda(expr);
   15922             :       break;
   15923             :     case enk_param_ref:
   15924             :       /* Lower a parameter reference. */
   15925             :       lower_param_ref(expr);
   15926             :       break;
   15927             :     case enk_type_operand:
   15928             :       lower_os_type(expr->variant.type_operand.type);
   15929             :       break;
   15930             :     case enk_braced_init_list:
   15931             :       /* Lower an enk_braced_init_list expression.  These rarely occur in the
   15932             :          IL (the front end typically processes these as initializers), but they
   15933             :          can occur in discarded branches of "if constexpr" statements.  Lower
   15934             :          the expressions in the list. */
   15935             :       lower_expr_list(expr->variant.braced_init_list,
   15936             :                       /*is_bool_controlling_expr_mask=*/0,

   15938             :       break;
   15939             : #if BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED
   15940             :     case enk_builtin_choose_expr:

   15942             :          call by a call to either the second or third operand (depending on the
   15943             :          value of the first operand). */
   15944             :       { an_expr_node *bc_op = expr->variant.builtin_choose_expr.operands->next;
   15945             :         if (!expr->variant.builtin_choose_expr.choose_first) {
   15946             :           bc_op = bc_op->next;
   15947             :         }  /* if */

   15949             :         overwrite_node(expr, bc_op);
   15950             :       }
   15951             :       break;
   15952             : #endif /* BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED */
   15953             : #if VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL
   15954             :     case enk_vla_dealloc:
   15955             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL */
   15956             :     case enk_sizeof_pack:
   15957             :     case enk_alignof:
   15958             :     default:
   15959             :       unexpected_condition_str("lower_expr: bad kind");
   15960             :   }  /* switch */
   15961             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   15962             :   if (vla_enabled && !expr->type->visited_for_vla_lowering) {
   15963             :     /* Collect all VLA types in a list so they can be lowered later on. */
   15964             :     record_vla_component_types_for_lowering(expr->type);
   15965             :   }  /* if */
   15966             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   15967             : #if DEBUG
   15968             :   if (db_flag_is_set("lower_expr") &&
   15969             :       (checksum != compute_checksum_for_expr(expr))) {
   15970             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Expression after lowering");
   15971             :     db_expr_range(expr);
   15972             :     fputs(":\n", f_debug);
   15973             :     db_expression(expr);
   15974             :   }  /* if */
   15975             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   15976             : }  /* lower_expr_full */
   15977             : 
   15978             : 
   15979             : static void release_reusable_temporaries(void)
   15980             : /*
   15981             : Release any reusable temporaries in the current context.  This is used
   15982             : at the end of a full expression.
   15983             : */
   15984             : {
   15985             :   /* NULL test is needed when this code is used to lower expressions
   15986             :      in aggregate initializers in Microsoft C mode. */
   15987             :   if (curr_context != NULL) {
   15988             :     a_temporary_list_entry_ptr tlep;
   15989             :     for (tlep = curr_context->local_temporaries;
   15990             :          tlep != NULL;
   15991             :          tlep = tlep->next) {
   15992             :       tlep->in_use = FALSE;
   15993             :       check_assertion(tlep->var->init_kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_none);
   15994             :     }  /* for */
   15995             :   }  /* if */
   15996             : }  /* release_reusable_temporaries */
   15997             : 
   15998             : 
   15999             : #if !MINIMAL_INLINING
   16000             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- statement is not used in that case. */
   16001             : #endif /* !MINIMAL_INLINING */
   16002             : void lower_full_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   16003             :                      a_statement_ptr  statement)
   16004             : /*
   16005             : Lower a full expression, i.e., a top-level expression, one that is not
   16006             : inside another expression.  If the expression is the one in an
   16007             : expression statement, statement points to the statement; otherwise, it is NULL.
   16008             : */
   16009             : {
   16010             :   a_context              context;
   16011             :   an_insert_location     insert_location, insert_location2;
   16012             :   an_expr_node_ptr       expr_to_lower = expr;
   16013             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime = NULL;
   16014             : 
   16015             :   /* An enk_object_lifetime node can only appear at the top of a full
   16016             :      expression.  Process it if present.  Such a node defines
   16017             :      an object lifetime for the evaluation of the full expression. */
   16018             :   if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   16019             :     expr_to_lower = expr->variant.object_lifetime.expr;
   16020             :     lifetime = expr->variant.object_lifetime.ptr;
   16021             :     push_context(&context, (a_scope_ptr)NULL, lifetime);
   16022             :     /* Begin the object lifetime.  Any code generated is saved off to the
   16023             :        side, attached to insert_location2. */
   16024             :     set_expr_creation_insert_location(&insert_location2);
   16025             :     begin_object_lifetime(lifetime, &insert_location2);
   16026             :     /* Remove cv-qualifiers from the types of rvalues.  In C++, such
   16027             :        rvalues retain their type qualifiers, but in C they do not. */
   16028             :     remove_qualifiers_from_expr_type_if_needed(expr);
   16029             :   }  /* if */
   16030             : #if CHECKING
   16031             :   /* Make sure we're not in a nested full-expression (by definition, that
   16032             :      would make this a subexpression and temporaries might be incorrectly
   16033             :      reused in that case). */
   16034             :   check_assertion(!curr_context->in_full_expression);
   16035             :   curr_context->in_full_expression = TRUE;
   16036             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   16037             :   if (expr->is_lvalue && expr_to_lower->result_is_not_used) {
   16038             : #if DEBUG
   16039             :     if (db_flag_is_set("rewrite_expr")) {
   16040             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Top level lvalue expression before re-writing");
   16041             :       db_expr_range(expr);
   16042             :       fputs(":\n", f_debug);
