   16043             :       db_expression(expr);
   16044             :     }  /* if */
   16045             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   16046             :     /* A C++-style lvalue expression whose value is discarded (often because
   16047             :        it is at the top level).  Rewrite as an rvalue. */
   16048             :     rewrite_discarded_lvalue_as_rvalue(expr_to_lower);
   16049             :     if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   16050             :       /* If the top-level expression is an lvalue object lifetime, it
   16051             :          also needs to be rewritten as an rvalue (to match its operand
   16052             :          that has just been rewritten as an rvalue). */
   16053             :       expr->is_lvalue = FALSE;
   16054             :     }  /* if */
   16055             : #if DEBUG
   16056             :     if (db_flag_is_set("rewrite_expr")) {
   16057             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, 
   16058             :                    "Top level expression after being re-written as an rvalue");
   16059             :       db_expr_range(expr);
   16060             :       fputs(":\n", f_debug);
   16061             :       db_expression(expr);
   16062             :     }  /* if */
   16063             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   16064             :   }  /* if */
   16065             : #if !PRESERVE_TOP_LEVEL_CASTS_TO_VOID_IN_IL
   16066             :   if (expr_to_lower->result_is_not_used &&
   16067             :       is_operation_node(expr_to_lower) &&
   16068             :       node_operator_is(expr_to_lower, eok_cast) &&
   16069             :       is_void_type(expr_to_lower->type)) {
   16070             :     /* Remove a top-level cast to void. */
   16071             :     overwrite_node(expr_to_lower, expr_to_lower->variant.operation.operands);
   16072             :   }  /* if */
   16073             : #endif /* !PRESERVE_TOP_LEVEL_CASTS_TO_VOID_IN_IL */
   16074             :   /* Lower the subexpression. */
   16075             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   16076             :   if (inlining_enabled && statement != NULL && expr_to_lower == expr &&
   16077             :       is_call_node(expr_to_lower)) {
   16078             :     a_boolean expr_has_been_detached;
   16079             :     /* Special-case a call as the top expression so inlining can be
   16080             :        done with statement insertions.  Don't do this if an enk_object_lifetime
   16081             :        appears (it could be done, but it's more complicated because of
   16082             :        statement versus expression insert locations). */
   16083             :     /* Remove cv-qualifiers from the types of rvalues.  In C++, such
   16084             :        rvalues retain their type qualifiers, but in C they do not. */
   16085             :     remove_qualifiers_from_expr_type_if_needed(expr_to_lower);
   16086             :     lower_call(expr_to_lower, (an_init_pos_descr_ptr)NULL, statement,
   16087             :                &expr_has_been_detached);
   16088             :     if (expr_has_been_detached) expr_to_lower = expr = NULL;
   16089             :   } else
   16090             :   /* Normal case, not call. */
   16091             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   16092             :   /* Do not insert code here; this is the "else" of an "if". */
   16093             :   {
   16094             :     lower_expr(expr_to_lower);
   16095             :   }  /* if */
   16096             :   if (lifetime != NULL) {
   16097             :     /* More processing for the enk_object_lifetime case. */
   16098             :     check_assertion(expr_to_lower != NULL);
   16099             :     if (any_cleanup_actions(lifetime)) {
   16100             :       /* Generate any cleanup actions for temporaries built within
   16101             :          the expression.  Note that this is a special "insert after"
   16102             :          mode, which can only be used in very limited circumstances,
   16103             :          e.g., at the top of an expression tree. */
   16104             :       set_after_expr_insert_location(expr_to_lower, &insert_location);
   16105             :       gen_cleanup_actions(lifetime, &insert_location);
   16106             :     }  /* if */
   16107             :     /* The insertions may have changed the type of the node, so copy the
   16108             :        type up to the enk_object_lifetime node. */
   16109             :     expr->type = expr_to_lower->type;
   16110             :     /* Insert any code generated by begin_object_lifetime (e.g.,
   16111             :        initialization of conditional flags). */
   16112             :     if (insert_location2.kind != ilk_expr_creation) {
   16113             :       /* There is code to insert.  It is inserted before the lowered
   16114             :          expression. */
   16115             :       set_expr_insert_location(expr_to_lower, &insert_location);
   16116             :       insert_expr(insert_location2.variant.expr, &insert_location);
   16117             :     }  /* if */
   16118             :     pop_context();
   16119             :     if (!keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il) {
   16120             :       /* Not keeping object lifetime information, so eliminate this node. */
   16121             :       unbind_object_lifetime(expr->variant.object_lifetime.ptr);
   16122             :       overwrite_node(expr, expr_to_lower);
   16123             :     }  /* if */
   16124             :   }  /* if */
   16125             :   if (expr != NULL) {
   16126             :     /* Perform end-of-full-expression processing. */
   16127             :     end_of_full_expr_processing(expr);
   16128             :   }  /* if */
   16129             : #if CHECKING
   16130             :   curr_context->in_full_expression = FALSE;
   16131             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   16132             : }  /* lower_full_expr */
   16133             : 
   16134             : 
   16135             : void end_of_full_expr_processing(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   16136             : /*
   16137             : Do end-of-full-expression processing for the specified expression.  expr may
   16138             : be NULL in cases where the expression was eliminated (e.g., inlining).
   16139             : Also called for C99 expressions.
   16140             : */
   16141             : {
   16142             :   if (expr != NULL) {
   16143             :     /* Perform a second pass on the lowered expression to optimize it
   16144             :        and clean up any remaining issues. */
   16145             :     perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(expr);
   16146             :   }  /* if */
   16147             :   /* Release any reusable temporaries that were allocated. */
   16148             :   release_reusable_temporaries();
   16149             : }  /* end_of_full_expr_processing */
   16150             : 
   16151             : 
   16152             : static void adjust_bool_operation_types(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   16153             :                                         a_boolean        *p_adjusted,
   16154             :                                         a_boolean        see_if_possible)
   16155             : /*
   16156             : The expression expr appears in a boolean controlling expression context.
   16157             : If it is an operation that returns bool (e.g., "!="), change the type of
   16158             : the operation to int.  If the operation is one that has an operand that
   16159             : is an operation returning bool, and this operation passes that boolean
   16160             : through, adjust the operand node as well (and so on down the expression
   16161             : tree).  If a type adjustment is made, return *p_adjusted TRUE.
   16162             : If see_if_possible is TRUE, set *p_adjusted appropriately but do
   16163             : not adjust any types.  This routine should be called only when
   16164             : bool_is_keyword is TRUE.  Note that this routine is called before the
   16165             : expression tree is lowered; setting an operation type to int indicates
   16166             : that lowering need not insert a cast to change the operation type from
   16167             : int to bool (an optimization).  This routine can handle a full expression
   16168             : with an enk_object_lifetime node on top.
   16169             : */
   16170             : {
   16171             :   a_boolean adjusted = FALSE;
   16172             : 
   16173             :   if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   16174             :     an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   16175             :     if (is_operator_returning_bool(op)) {
   16176             :       /* This operator returns a bool.  Rewrite it to return int. */
   16177             :       /* Note that one of the cases handled here is eok_bool_cast. */
   16178             :       if (!see_if_possible) expr->type = integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   16179             :       adjusted = TRUE;
   16180             :     } else {
   16181             :       an_expr_node_ptr operand1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   16182             :       an_expr_node_ptr operand2 = operand1->next;
   16183             :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_comma) {
   16184             :         /* A comma node.  See if the second operand is a node that returns
   16185             :            a bool. */
   16186             :         adjust_bool_operation_types(operand2, &adjusted, see_if_possible);
   16187             :         if (adjusted && !see_if_possible) expr->type = operand2->type;
   16188             :       } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question ||
   16189             :                  op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_vector_question) {
   16190             :         /* A question node.  If both the second and third operands return
   16191             :            bool, both can be rewritten and the result of the question mark
   16192             :            operation can also. */
   16193             :         a_boolean        adjusted2, adjusted3;
   16194             :         an_expr_node_ptr operand3 = operand2->next;
   16195             :         /* Find out if both can be rewritten but do not rewrite yet. */
   16196             :         adjust_bool_operation_types(operand2, &adjusted2,
   16197             :                                     /*see_if_possible=*/TRUE);
   16198             :         adjust_bool_operation_types(operand3, &adjusted3,
   16199             :                                     /*see_if_possible=*/TRUE);
   16200             :         adjusted = adjusted2 && adjusted3;
   16201             :         if (adjusted && !see_if_possible) {
   16202             :           /* Both can be rewritten.  Rewrite them. */
   16203             :           adjust_bool_operation_types(operand2, &adjusted2,
   16204             :                                       /*see_if_possible=*/FALSE);
   16205             :           adjust_bool_operation_types(operand3, &adjusted3,
   16206             :                                       /*see_if_possible=*/FALSE);
   16207             :           expr->type = operand2->type;
   16208             :         }  /* if */
   16209             :       }  /* if */
   16210             :     }  /* if */
   16211             :   } else if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   16212             :     an_expr_node_ptr operand = expr->variant.object_lifetime.expr;
   16213             :     adjust_bool_operation_types(operand, &adjusted, see_if_possible);
   16214             :     if (adjusted && !see_if_possible) {
   16215             :       expr->type = operand->type;
   16216             :     }  /* if */
   16217             :   }  /* if */
   16218             :   *p_adjusted = adjusted;
   16219             : }  /* adjust_bool_operation_types */
   16220             : 
   16221             : 
   16222             : void normalize_boolean_controlling_expr_if_needed(an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
   16223             : /*
   16224             : The given expression is a lowered boolean controlling expression.  If needed
   16225             : (which depends in part on the current configuration) ensure that it produces
   16226             : a 0/1 value.  This routine is called for both C and C++ expressions.
   16227             : */
   16228             : {
   16229             :   an_expr_node_ptr  object_lifetime = NULL;
   16230             : 
   16231             :   if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   16232             :     /* If an enk_object_lifetime node is (still) on top, look under that.
   16233             :        Remember the node to adjust its type later on. */
   16234             :     object_lifetime = expr;
   16235             :     expr = expr->variant.object_lifetime.expr;
   16236             :   }  /* if */
   16237             :   if (is_constant_node(expr) &&
   16238             :       constant_bool_value_known_at_compile_time(node_constant(expr))) {
   16239             :     /* The constant expression can be replaced by a 0 or 1 constant. */
   16240             :     a_constant_ptr  norm_con = local_constant();
   16241             :     set_integer_constant(norm_con,
   16242             :                          (a_host_large_integer)
   16243             :                                       !is_false_constant(node_constant(expr)),
   16244             :                          (an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   16245             : #if RECORD_BACKING_EXPRS_WITH_IL_LOWERING
   16246             :     if (node_constant(expr)->expr != NULL) {
   16247             :       /* Transfer the backing expression to the normalized constant. */
   16248             :       an_expr_node_ptr backing_expr;
   16249             :       if (constant_is_shareable(node_constant(expr))) {
   16250             :         /* In a case like an enumeration constant, the constant has an
   16251             :            expression that's really the definition of the value of the constant
   16252             :            instead of a normal backing expression.  We don't want to point to
   16253             :            that expression from this new constant (because that would give
   16254             :            us two constants pointing to the same expression, which is not
   16255             :            allowed), so switch to a backing expression that is the value
   16256             :            of the shareable (e.g., enumeration) constant. */
   16257             :         backing_expr = alloc_node_for_allocated_constant(node_constant(expr));
   16258             :       } else {
   16259             :         /* If the constant is not shareable, we can just reuse its backing
   16260             :            expression as is, because we're abandoning the constant that
   16261             :            pointed to it. */
   16262             :         backing_expr = node_constant(expr)->expr;
   16263             :       }  /* if */
   16264             :       norm_con->expr = backing_expr;
   16265             :     }  /* if */
   16266             : #endif /* RECORD_BACKING_EXPRS_WITH_IL_LOWERING */
   16267             :     node_constant(expr) = alloc_shareable_constant(norm_con);
   16268             :     expr->type = norm_con->type;
   16269             :     release_local_constant(&norm_con);
   16270             :   } else {
   16271             :     a_boolean  normalize = lowering_normalizes_boolean_controlling_expressions;
   16272             :     if (is_or_was_ptr_to_member_function_type(expr->type) ||
   16273             :         is_or_was_ptr_to_data_member_type(expr->type)) {
   16274             :       /* Uses of pointer-to-member values as boolean controlling expressions
   16275             :          should always be normalized, since such values may be lowered to a
   16276             :          nonscalar type. */
   16277             :       normalize = TRUE;
   16278             :     }  /* if */
   16279             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   16280             :     /* We also normalize the expression if it has a complex type that will be
   16281             :        lowered to a struct type. */
   16282             :     if (is_complex_type(expr->type)) normalize = TRUE;
   16283             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   16284             :     if (normalize) {
   16285             :       if (is_operation_node(expr) &&
   16286             :           is_operator_returning_bool(expr->variant.operation.kind)) {
   16287             :         /* The operator at the top already is known to produce a 0/1 value. */
   16288             :       } else {
   16289             :         /* Ensure that the expression has a 0/1 value by adding a "!= 0" test
   16290             :            on top of it. */
   16291             :         change_node_to_operation(expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ne,
   16292             :                                  integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   16293             :                                  make_operands_for_ne_0(copy_node(expr)),
   16294             :                                  /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE);
   16295             :         expr->variant.operation.compiler_generated = TRUE;
   16296             :         lower_ne_0_normalization(expr);
   16297             :         if (!(is_operation_node(expr) && node_operator_is(expr, eok_ne))) {
   16298             :           /* In some cases (e.g., testing a complex value), lowering the "!= 0"
   16299             :              comparison replaces the operation by a call to a run-time support
   16300             :              routine.  Add another "!= 0" operation on top to avoid surprising
   16301             :              a back end. */
   16302             :           normalize_boolean_controlling_expr_if_needed(expr);
   16303             :         }  /* if */
   16304             :       }  /* if */
   16305             :     } else {
   16306             :       /* This boolean controlling expression is not being normalized -- mark
   16307             :          it as such. */
   16308             :       expr->is_non_normalized_boolean_controlling_expr = TRUE;
   16309             :     }  /* if */
   16310             :   }  /* if */
   16311             :   if (object_lifetime != NULL) {
   16312             :     /* The type of the expression under the object lifetime node may have
   16313             :        changed (e.g., from "bool" to "int").  Adjust the object lifetime node
   16314             :        accordingly. */
   16315             :     object_lifetime->type = object_lifetime->variant.object_lifetime.expr
   16316             :                                            ->type;
   16317             :   }  /* if */
   16318             : }  /* normalize_boolean_controlling_expr_if_needed */
   16319             : 
   16320             : 
   16321             : static void lower_boolean_controlling_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   16322             :                                            a_boolean        is_full_expr)
   16323             : /*
   16324             : Lower a boolean controlling expression, e.g., the expression in an "if"
   16325             : statement.  The expression is not an lvalue.  The expression is a full
   16326             : expression (i.e., not an expression inside some other expression) if
   16327             : is_full_expr is TRUE.
   16328             : */
   16329             : {
   16330             :   an_expr_node_ptr  top_op = expr;
   16331             : 
   16332             :   if (top_op->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   16333             :     check_assertion_str(is_full_expr,
   16334             :              "lower_boolean_controlling_expr: enk_object_lifetime not at top");
   16335             :     top_op = top_op->variant.object_lifetime.expr;
   16336             :   }  /* if */
   16337             :   /* Discard any eok_bool_cast on top of a scalar expression (it is usually
   16338             :      added implicitly in C++ modes): Its effect is identical to normalization
   16339             :      (and is not required if normalization is not required). */
   16340             :   if (is_operation_node(top_op) && node_operator_is(top_op, eok_bool_cast)) {
   16341             :     a_type_ptr  op_type = top_op->variant.operation.operands->type;
   16342             :     if (is_simple_scalar_type(op_type)) {
   16343             :       /* The test for simple scalar types excludes pointer-to-member types. */
   16344             :       overwrite_node(top_op, top_op->variant.operation.operands);
   16345             :     }  /* if */
   16346             :   }  /* if */
   16347             :   if (bool_is_keyword) {
   16348             :     /* When bool is enabled, adjust the result type of top-level
   16349             :        bool-returning operations to be int. */
   16350             :     a_boolean adjusted;
   16351             :     adjust_bool_operation_types(expr, &adjusted, /*see_if_possible=*/FALSE);
   16352             :   }  /* if */
   16353             :   if (is_full_expr) {
   16354             :     lower_full_expr(expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   16355             :   } else {
   16356             :     lower_expr(expr);
   16357             :   }  /* if */
   16358             :   normalize_boolean_controlling_expr_if_needed(expr);
   16359             :   if (is_full_expr &&
   16360             :       lowering_normalizes_boolean_controlling_expressions) {
   16361             :     /* Perform a lowering post-pass on the normalized expression (a post-pass
   16362             :        had been performed above, but the expression may have been changed). */
   16363             :     perform_post_pass_on_lowered_expression(expr);
   16364             :   }  /* if */
   16365             : }  /* lower_boolean_controlling_expr */
   16366             : 
   16367             : 
   16368             : static void add_conditional_flag(a_dynamic_init_ptr dip)
   16369             : /*
   16370             : Add a conditional flag to a dynamic initialization (pointed to by dip).
   16371             : This is needed, for example, inside a conditional operand of a "?", "&&",
   16372             : or "||" operation, to make the corresponding destruction dependent on
   16373             : whether the construction was done.
   16374             : */
   16375             : {
   16376             :   a_destructible_entity_descr_ptr dedp = dip->destructible_entity_descr;
   16377             :   a_variable_ptr                  cond_var;
   16378             : 
   16379             :   cond_var = make_lowered_temporary(integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int));
   16380             :   dedp->conditional_flag_var = cond_var;
   16381             : #if DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
   16382             :   if (exceptions_enabled) {
   16383             :     /* Pre-assign the object address table slot for the conditional variable,
   16384             :        because we're going to have to set that entry of the object address
   16385             :        table right away. */
   16386             :     dedp->conditional_flag_handle = object_addr_table_index();
   16387             :   }  /* if */
   16388             : #endif /* DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING */
   16389             : }  /* add_conditional_flag */
   16390             : 
   16391             : 
   16392             : void initial_processing_on_destructible_initialization(
   16393             :                                            a_dynamic_init_ptr dip,
   16394             :                                            an_insert_location *insert_location)
   16395             : /*
   16396             : Do initial processing on a dynamic initialization entry that indicates
   16397             : destruction.  That includes allocating the destructible entity description
   16398             : entry and generating code to initialize any conditional flag.  Any generated
   16399             : code is inserted at *insert_location, and *insert_location is updated.
   16400             : If insert_location == NULL, no initialization code is generated.
   16401             : */
   16402             : {
   16403             :   a_destructible_entity_descr_ptr dedp;
   16404             : 
   16405             :   /* Allocate a destructible entity description entry pointed to by
   16406             :      the dynamic init entry. */
   16407             :   check_assertion_str(dip->destructible_entity_descr == NULL,
   16408             :   "initial_processing_on_destr...: destructible entity descr already present");
   16409             :   dip->destructible_entity_descr = dedp = alloc_destructible_entity_descr();
   16410             :   if (dip->is_freeing_of_storage_on_exception) {
   16411             :     a_new_delete_supplement_ptr ndsp = dip->assoc_new;
   16412             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_PLACEMENT_DELETE
   16413             :     if (ndsp != NULL) {
   16414             :       /* Take a look at the "new" operator associated with this destruction;
   16415             :          if it's one that we're going to treat as a placement new during
   16416             :          processing in lower_new, set the placement_new flag now and remove it
   16417             :          from the destruction list below. */
   16418             :       treat_as_placement_new_if_has_default_args(ndsp);
   16419             :     }  /* if */
   16420             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_PLACEMENT_DELETE */
   16421             :     if (dip->is_array_freeing || (ndsp != NULL && ndsp->placement_new)) {
   16422             :       /* Freeing of arrays is handled by runtime routines, so the freeing
   16423             :          on exception is no longer visible at this level.  Note that
   16424             :          when an array is initialized, the initialization portion is handled
   16425             :          using an internal "try" mechanism (though the runtime routines
   16426             :          still handle any needed freeing during the allocation portion),
   16427             :          but in either case this destruction can be removed from the list. */
   16428             :       /* Likewise for a placement delete (or operator new with default
   16429             :          arguments).  In that case an internal "try" block is inserted, with
   16430             :          the "catch" a call of the placement delete routine. */
   16431             :       remove_from_destruction_list(dip);
   16432             :       goto end_of_routine;
   16433             :     }  /* if */
   16434             :   }  /* if */
   16435             :   if (dip->inside_conditional_expression
   16436             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES
   16437             :       || (exceptions_enabled &&
   16438             :           (dip->is_freeing_of_storage_on_exception
   16439             : #if DO_UNORDERED_EH_PROCESSING
   16440             :            || dip->unordered
   16441             : #endif /* DO_UNORDERED_EH_PROCESSING */
   16442             :                             ))
   16443             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES */
   16444             :                               ) {
   16445             :     /* This destruction requires a conditional flag that indicates that
   16446             :        the construction was done; add one and initialize it to zero.
   16447             :        This normally comes up for conditionally-executed parts of
   16448             :        expressions, but it's also used for the cleanup for a new-allocation,
   16449             :        which frees the storage if an exception is thrown before the storage
   16450             :        is initialized. */
   16451             : #if DO_UNORDERED_EH_PROCESSING
   16452             :     /* A conditional flag is used for the unordered case if we can't
   16453             :        predict the order in which certain initializations will be
   16454             :        done (because the C language leaves evaluation order weakly
   16455             :        defined; a real back end could figure out the actual evaluation
   16456             :        order and would not need the flags for this case). */
   16457             : #endif /* DO_UNORDERED_EH_PROCESSING */
   16458             :     /* Create and initialize a new conditional flag variable. */
   16459             :     add_conditional_flag(dip);
   16460             :     if (insert_location != NULL) {
   16461             :       init_conditional_flag_var(dedp, insert_location);
   16462             :     }  /* if */
   16463             :   }  /* if */
   16464             : end_of_routine:;
   16465             : }  /* initial_processing_on_destructible_initialization */
   16466             : 
   16467             : 
   16468             : void begin_object_lifetime(an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime,
   16469             :                            an_insert_location     *insert_location)
   16470             : /*
   16471             : Do processing required at the beginning of the indicated object lifetime
   16472             : (a block, block-after-label, or expression temporary lifetime).
   16473             : If any code needs to be inserted, it is inserted at *insert_location,
   16474             : and *insert_location is updated.
   16475             : */
   16476             : {
   16477             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip, dip_next;
   16478             : 
   16479             :   for (dip = lifetime->destructions;
   16480             :        dip != NULL;
   16481             :        dip = dip_next) {
   16482             :     dip_next = dip->next_in_destruction_list;
   16483             :     initial_processing_on_destructible_initialization(dip, insert_location);
   16484             :   }  /* for */
   16485             : }  /* begin_object_lifetime */
   16486             : 
   16487             : 
   16488             : static an_object_lifetime_ptr label_successor_lifetime(
   16489             :                                                an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime)
   16490             : /*
   16491             : Given an olk_block or olk_block_after_label lifetime, return the successor
   16492             : lifetime at the next label or switch case statement (when long_lifetime_temps
   16493             : is TRUE), or NULL if there isn't one.
   16494             : */
   16495             : {
   16496             :   if (!lifetime->has_block_after_label_child_lifetime) {
   16497             :     /* This lifetime has no label successor, so we can save time and not
   16498             :        look for one. */
   16499             :     lifetime = NULL;
   16500             :   } else {
   16501             :     /* Find the label successor lifetime (there must be one, because the flag
   16502             :        is set). */
   16503             :     for (lifetime = lifetime->child_lifetime;
   16504             :          lifetime->kind != (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block_after_label;
   16505             :          lifetime = lifetime->next) {}
   16506             :   }  /* if */
   16507             :   return lifetime;
   16508             : }  /* label_successor_lifetime */
   16509             : 
   16510             : 
   16511             : static void start_label_region_of_lifetime(an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime)
   16512             : /*
   16513             : Start a new label region in the current context (either the original
   16514             : olk_block lifetime or a successor olk_block_after_label lifetime).
   16515             : lifetime indicates the lifetime to begin.  Switch case statements are
   16516             : treated like labels when long_lifetime_temps is TRUE.
   16517             : */
   16518             : {
   16519             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr next_lifetime;
   16520             : 
   16521             :   curr_object_lifetime = curr_context->lifetime = lifetime;
   16522             :   curr_context->latest_initialization = NULL;
   16523             :   /* curr_context->curr_cleanup_state is not changed on purpose. */
   16524             :   /* Set up the context field to watch for the appearance of the statement
   16525             :      that begins the next label lifetime. */
   16526             :   next_lifetime = label_successor_lifetime(lifetime);
   16527             :   curr_context->successor_lifetime_at_statement = next_lifetime;
   16528             : }  /* start_label_region_of_lifetime */
   16529             : 
   16530             : 
   16531             : void begin_block_object_lifetime(an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime,
   16532             :                                  an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
   16533             : /*
   16534             : Do processing required at the beginning of an olk_block lifetime associated
   16535             : with a block.  This includes generating code for things like conditional flag
   16536             : initializations.  Such code is inserted at *insert_location.  Do nothing
   16537             : if lifetime is NULL.
   16538             : */
   16539             : {
   16540             :   if (lifetime != NULL) {
   16541             :     check_assertion(lifetime->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block);
   16542             :     /* Visit all object lifetimes in this lifetime, and all destructions
   16543             :        within those lifetimes. */
   16544             :     begin_object_lifetime(lifetime, insert_location);
   16545             :     start_label_region_of_lifetime(lifetime);
   16546             :   }  /* if */
   16547             : }  /* begin_block_object_lifetime */
   16548             : 
   16549             : 
   16550             : static void begin_block_label_object_lifetime(an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime)
   16551             : /*
   16552             : Do processing required at the beginning of an olk_block_after_label lifetime
   16553             : associated with a label in a block or a switch case statement.
   16554             : */
   16555             : {
   16556             :   a_statement_ptr    stmt;
   16557             :   an_insert_location insert_location;
   16558             : 
   16559             :   /* Get the statement pointer from the lifetime. */
   16560             :   check_assertion(lifetime->entity.kind==(a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_statement);
   16561             :   stmt = (a_statement_ptr)(lifetime->entity.ptr);
   16562             :   set_insert_location(stmt, &insert_location);
   16563             :   /* Visit all object lifetimes in this lifetime, and all destructions
   16564             :      within those lifetimes. */
   16565             :   begin_object_lifetime(lifetime, &insert_location);
   16566             :   start_label_region_of_lifetime(lifetime);
   16567             : }  /* begin_block_label_object_lifetime */
   16568             : 
   16569             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES
   16570             : 
   16571             : static void adjust_region_table_to_remove_long_lifetime_temps(
   16572             :                                               a_boolean need_regions_for_temps)
   16573             : /*
   16574             : We've reached a label in long-lifetime temporaries mode.  We haven't yet
   16575             : started any object lifetime that begins at the label.  Here, logically remove
   16576             : the temporaries from the cleanup region table so they will no longer be part
   16577             : of the cleanup chain.  Called only when exceptions are enabled.  If
   16578             : need_regions_for_temps is TRUE, we will be destroying the temporaries, so we
   16579             : need cleanup regions that will cover them while we destroy them.
   16580             : */
   16581             : {
   16582             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip;
   16583             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr first_temp = NULL, last_temp = NULL;
   16584             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr first_nontemp = NULL, last_nontemp = NULL;
   16585             : 
   16586             :   /* If there are cleanup regions for non-temporaries that are followed
   16587             :      by temporaries, the entries for the non-temporaries must be cloned
   16588             :      so we can set the current region to the clones and have the
   16589             :      destructions for the temporaries out of the list (to reflect the
   16590             :      fact that the temporaries no longer need to be cleaned up on a
   16591             :      throw).  If need_regions_for_temps is TRUE, we need to clone all
   16592             :      but the first of the temporaries too, so we can have a cleanup
   16593             :      region number while doing the temporary destructions.  The
   16594             :      temporaries get moved to the front of the cloned list.  In the
   16595             :      loop here, we split the region table entries into two lists
   16596             :      (one for temporaries, one for nontemporaries), and then rejoin
   16597             :      them with the temporaries first.  Note that the lists we're
   16598             :      working with here are those linked on the next_in_region_table
   16599             :      field, which indicates the next region table entry. */
   16600             :   check_assertion_str2(curr_object_lifetime != NULL &&
   16601             :                        curr_object_lifetime->destructions ==
   16602             :                                            curr_context->latest_initialization,
   16603             :                        "adjust_region_table_to_remove_long_lifetime_temps:",
   16604             :                        "bad current object lifetime");
   16605             :   for (dip = curr_context->latest_initialization;
   16606             :        dip != NULL;
   16607             :        dip = dip->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table) {
   16608             :     if (dip->has_temporary_lifetime) {
   16609             :       /* An initialization for a temporary. */
   16610             :       if (first_temp == NULL) first_temp = dip;
   16611             :       if (last_temp != NULL) {
   16612             :         last_temp->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table = dip;
   16613             :       }  /* if */
   16614             :       last_temp = dip;
   16615             :     } else {
   16616             :       /* An initialization for a nontemporary. */
   16617             :       if (first_nontemp == NULL) first_nontemp = dip;
   16618             :       if (last_nontemp != NULL) {
   16619             :         last_nontemp->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table = dip;
   16620             :       }  /* if */
   16621             :       last_nontemp = dip;
   16622             :     }  /* if */
   16623             :   }  /* for */
   16624             :   if (first_temp != NULL) {
   16625             :     /* There were some temporaries in the lifetime. */
   16626             :     /* Put the list back together again, with the temporaries first. */
   16627             :     a_dynamic_init_ptr first_nontemp_after_temps =
   16628             :                     last_temp->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table;
   16629             :     last_temp->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table = first_nontemp;
   16630             :     if (last_nontemp != NULL) {
   16631             :       last_nontemp->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table = NULL;
   16632             :     }  /* if */
   16633             :     if (first_nontemp_after_temps != first_nontemp) {
   16634             :       /* Some region table entries must be cloned. */
   16635             :       if (need_regions_for_temps) {
   16636             :         /* We need to clone the entries for the temporaries too, except
   16637             :            for the first temporary. */
   16638             :         dip = first_temp->destructible_entity_descr->next_in_region_table;
   16639             :       } else {
   16640             :         /* We need to clone just the nontemporaries. */
   16641             :         dip = first_nontemp;
   16642             :       }  /* if */
   16643             :       /* coverity[var_deref_model] */
   16644             :       clone_region_table_entry_list(dip, first_nontemp_after_temps);
   16645             :       if (need_regions_for_temps) {
   16646             :         /* The entry for the first temporary need not be cloned, but its
   16647             :            cleanup_state_to_set_when_starting_destruction pointer needs to
   16648             :            be updated so we set the right region number when we do the
   16649             :            destruction. */
   16650             :         first_temp->destructible_entity_descr->
   16651             :                               cleanup_state_to_set_when_starting_destruction =
   16652             :                                                                            dip;
   16653             :       }  /* if */
   16654             :     }  /* if */
   16655             :     /* The current position is at the beginning of the regions for the
   16656             :        temporaries if we cloned regions for those because we will be
   16657             :        destroying them, otherwise at the first region for a nontemp. */
   16658             :     dip = need_regions_for_temps ? first_temp : first_nontemp;
   16659             :     curr_context->latest_initialization = dip;
   16660             :     curr_context->curr_cleanup_state = dip;
   16661             :     /* insert_code_to_indicate_cleanup_state is not called on purpose,
   16662             :        because no code need be generated to record the cleanup state. */
   16663             :   }  /* if */
   16664             : }  /* adjust_region_table_to_remove_long_lifetime_temps */
   16665             : 
   16666             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES */
   16667             : 
   16668             : static void destroy_curr_lifetime_temporaries(
   16669             :                                        a_statement_ptr    *statement,
   16670             :                                        a_boolean          *any_temps_destroyed,
   16671             :                                        an_insert_location *insert_location)
   16672             : /*
   16673             : Destroy any temporaries that are active in the current object lifetime.
   16674             : If any destructions are done, *any_temps_destroyed is returned TRUE,
   16675             : *statement is turned into a block, statement is set to the new location
   16676             : of the original statement, the destructions are inserted at the beginning
   16677             : of the block, and *insert_location is returned set to allow insertion after
   16678             : the destructions and before the original statement.
   16679             : */
   16680             : {
   16681             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip;
   16682             : 
   16683             :   *any_temps_destroyed = FALSE;
   16684             :   for (dip = curr_context->latest_initialization;
   16685             :        dip != NULL;
   16686             :        dip = dip->next_in_destruction_list) {
   16687             :     if (dip->has_temporary_lifetime &&
   16688             :         !dip->is_freeing_of_storage_on_exception &&
   16689             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES
   16690             :         !dip->is_freeing_of_exception_object &&
   16691             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES */
   16692             :         !dip->destruction_is_for_partially_constructed_aggregate &&
   16693             :         !dip->is_vla_deallocation &&
   16694             :         !dip->is_guard_var_for_local_static_var_init) {
   16695             :       /* Found a destruction for a temporary.  */
   16696             :       /* If this is the first one, make an insert location by rewriting
   16697             :          the statement as a block. */
   16698             :       if (!*any_temps_destroyed) {
   16699             :         *any_temps_destroyed = TRUE;
   16700             :         turn_statement_into_block(*statement, insert_location, statement);
   16701             :       }  /* if */
   16702             :       /* Generate the cleanup action. */
   16703             :       gen_one_destruction(dip, insert_location);
   16704             :     }  /* if */
   16705             :   }  /* for */
   16706             : }  /* destroy_curr_lifetime_temporaries */
   16707             : 
   16708             : 
   16709             : static void destroy_long_lifetime_temporaries_before_statement(
   16710             :                                                     a_statement_ptr *statement)
   16711             : /*
   16712             : Destroy any long lifetime temporaries that are presently active.
   16713             : The destruction code is inserted preceding the indicated statement.
   16714             : If the statement is turned into a block, *statement will be updated
   16715             : on return to point to the new location of the original statement.
   16716             : Called only in long lifetime temporaries mode.
   16717             : */
   16718             : {
   16719             :   a_boolean          any_temps_destroyed = FALSE;
   16720             :   a_boolean          need_to_destroy_temps;
   16721             :   an_insert_location insert_location;
   16722             : 
   16723             :   /* We need to destroy the temporaries only if the statement is reachable
   16724             :      by flowing into it from the preceding code.  For statements other than
   16725             :      labels or switch cases, assume the statement is reachable because
   16726             :      we don't know. */
   16727             :   if ((*statement)->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_label) {
   16728             :     need_to_destroy_temps = 
   16729             :                     (*statement)->variant.label.ptr->reachable_by_fall_through;
   16730             :   } else if ((*statement)->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_switch_case) {
   16731             :     need_to_destroy_temps = 
   16732             :        (*statement)->variant.switch_case.extra_info->reachable_by_fall_through;
   16733             :   } else {
   16734             :     need_to_destroy_temps = TRUE;
   16735             :   }  /* if */
   16736             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES
   16737             :   if (exceptions_enabled) {
   16738             :     /* If necessary, adjust the cleanup region table to reflect the
   16739             :        fact that the temporaries are no longer in the cleanup chain. */
   16740             :     adjust_region_table_to_remove_long_lifetime_temps(need_to_destroy_temps);
   16741             :   }  /* if */
   16742             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES */
   16743             :   if (need_to_destroy_temps) {
   16744             :     /* Go through the list of destructions, find the ones for temporaries,
   16745             :        and generate destruction code. */
   16746             :     destroy_curr_lifetime_temporaries(statement, &any_temps_destroyed,
   16747             :                                       &insert_location);
   16748             :   }  /* if */
   16749             :   if (exceptions_enabled && any_temps_destroyed) {
   16750             :     /* Set the current cleanup state, but not if the current statement
   16751             :        is a label (because in that case it will be set in a moment
   16752             :        anyway). */
   16753             :     if ((*statement)->kind != (a_statement_kind)stmk_label) {
   16754             :       insert_code_to_indicate_cleanup_state(curr_context->curr_cleanup_state,
   16755             :                                             &insert_location,
   16756             :                                             /*unreachable=*/FALSE);
   16757             :     }  /* if */
   16758             :   }  /* if */
   16759             : }  /* destroy_long_lifetime_temporaries_before_statement */
   16760             : 
   16761             : 
   16762             : /*
   16763             : Return TRUE if the indicated statement is a do-nothing statement
   16764             : created by IL lowering (presumably, it was some other kind of statement
   16765             : and it was replaced by something else; see turn_statement_into_noop).
   16766             : */
   16767             : #define is_noop_statement(statement)                                  \
   16768             :   ((statement)->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block &&               \
   16769             :    (statement)->variant.block.statements == NULL &&                   \
   16770             :    (statement)->variant.block.extra_info->final_position.seq == 0)
   16771             : 
   16772             : 
   16773             : void lower_statement_list(a_statement_ptr statement_list,
   16774             :                           a_statement_ptr *p_last_statement)
   16775             : /*
   16776             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of statements and everything under it.
   16777             : Return a pointer to the last statement in *p_last_statement, or NULL if
   16778             : there are no statements on the list.
   16779             : */
   16780             : {
   16781             :   a_statement_ptr        statement, statement_next, last_statement = NULL;
   16782             :   a_statement_ptr        eff_statement;
   16783             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr next_lifetime;
   16784             :   a_boolean              stmt_begins_block_after_label_lifetime;
   16785             : 
   16786             :   for (statement = statement_list;
   16787             :        statement != NULL;
   16788             :        statement = statement_next) {
   16789             :     /* Save the "next" pointer now, so that any statements inserted by lowering
   16790             :        will not be lowered (in particular, lowering of stmk_init statements
   16791             :        inserts statements, and the expressions therein should not be lowered
   16792             :        again; when not lowering VLAs, new statements are also inserted before
   16793             :        stmk_vla_decl statements). */
   16794             :     statement_next = statement->next;
   16795             :     eff_statement = statement;
   16796             :     code_pos_for_lowering = statement->position;
   16797             :     error_position = code_pos_for_lowering;
   16798             :     /* See if a new object lifetime begins at this statement because
   16799             :        it is a label or switch case statement. */
   16800             :     stmt_begins_block_after_label_lifetime = FALSE;
   16801             :     next_lifetime = curr_context->successor_lifetime_at_statement;
   16802             :     if (next_lifetime != NULL &&
   16803             :         (a_statement_ptr)next_lifetime->entity.ptr == statement) {
   16804             :       /* A new object lifetime begins at this statement. */
   16805             :       stmt_begins_block_after_label_lifetime = TRUE;
   16806             :       if (long_lifetime_temps) {
   16807             :         /* Destroy any long lifetime temporaries.  If the statement is turned
   16808             :            into a block, eff_statement will be updated to point to the original
   16809             :            statement. */
   16810             :         destroy_long_lifetime_temporaries_before_statement(&eff_statement);
   16811             :       }  /* if */
   16812             :     }  /* if */
   16813             :     /* Lower a statement. */
   16814             :     lower_statement(eff_statement);
   16815             :     if (stmt_begins_block_after_label_lifetime) {
   16816             :       /* Start a new object lifetime because of a label or case statement. */
   16817             :       begin_block_label_object_lifetime(next_lifetime);
   16818             :     }  /* if */
   16819             :     /* Remove extra no-op statements (empty blocks) left in the statement
   16820             :        sequence by lowering of some statements (e.g., stmk_init).
   16821             :        Note that this is done in a way that doesn't change the address
   16822             :        of the first statement on the list.  In particular, that means
   16823             :        a block containing just a no-op statement cannot be changed. */
   16824             :     if (is_noop_statement(statement) && statement->next != statement_next) {
   16825             :       /* This is a no-op statement followed by a statement generated
   16826             :          by IL lowering, so we can copy the generated statement on top
   16827             :          of the no-op statement.  Note that in general we cannot move a
   16828             :          statement to a different address, since back ends may depend on
   16829             :          the address to establish identity, but in this case we can because
   16830             :          the generated statement is presumably part of the expansion of
   16831             :          the statement that's now a no-op. */
   16832             :       a_statement_ptr next_stmt = statement->next->next;
   16833             :       copy_statement(statement->next, statement);
   16834             :       statement->next = next_stmt;
   16835             :     }  /* if */
   16836             :     /* Keep track of the last statement (so far) in the statement list. */
   16837             :     last_statement = statement;
   16838             :     /* If there were statements inserted after the current statement, find
   16839             :        the last of those statements.  Those inserted statements have already
   16840             :        been lowered. */
   16841             :     while (last_statement->next != statement_next) {
   16842             :       last_statement = last_statement->next;
   16843             :       check_assertion_str(last_statement != NULL,
   16844             :                           "lower_statement_list: did not find statement_next");
   16845             :     }  /* while */
   16846             :   }  /* for */
   16847             :   *p_last_statement = last_statement;
   16848             : }  /* lower_statement_list */
   16849             : 
   16850             : #if INDICATE_CLEANUP_STATE_IN_UNREACHABLE_CODE
   16851             : 
   16852             : static void reset_cleanup_state_at_unreachable_point(a_statement_ptr statement)
   16853             : /*
   16854             : For the partially-lowered EH modes, we have to assume that the instruction
   16855             : used to indicate the current cleanup state may be used to create a table
   16856             : rather than being left as an executable instruction.  To accommodate that,
   16857             : we insert instructions to set the cleanup state at certain points that
   16858             : are unreachable code (i.e., following transfers of control and throws).
   16859             : An instruction to indicate the cleanup state is inserted following the
   16860             : indicated statement.
   16861             : */
   16862             : {
   16863             :   if (exceptions_enabled) {
   16864             :     an_insert_location insert_location;
   16865             :     set_insert_location(statement, &insert_location);
   16866             :     insert_code_to_indicate_cleanup_state(curr_context->curr_cleanup_state,
   16867             :                                           &insert_location,
   16868             :                                           /*unreachable=*/TRUE);
   16869             :   }  /* if */
   16870             : }  /* reset_cleanup_state_at_unreachable_point */
   16871             : 
   16872             : #endif /* INDICATE_CLEANUP_STATE_IN_UNREACHABLE_CODE */
   16873             : 
   16874             : #if DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
   16875             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- "statement" is not used in that case. */
   16876             : #endif /* DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING */
   16877             : static void reset_cleanup_state_at_transfer_of_control(
   16878             :                                                a_statement_ptr statement,
   16879             :                                                a_statement_ptr block_statement)
   16880             : /*
   16881             : "statement" points to a transfer of control statement (goto, return)
   16882             : that has just been lowered.  Adjust the current cleanup state after the
   16883             : transfer of control.  This is necessary because the cleanup state is
   16884             : updated as destructions are generated preceding the transfer of
   16885             : control, so it no longer indicates the most-constructed state.
   16886             : In addition, for partially-lowered EH configurations a statement
   16887             : must be inserted after the statement to re-establish that
   16888             : most-constructed state.  (Note that the statement is being inserted
   16889             : as unreachable code.  The assumption is that the instruction may be
   16890             : used to build a table, rather than being something executable.)
   16891             : block_statement points to the block statement of which statement is
   16892             : the last statement.
   16893             : */
   16894             : {
   16895             :   /* Don't put out the adjustment at the end of a function.  It's
   16896             :      not necessary and it can be confusing to back ends when an epilogue
   16897             :      label for a destructor follows. */
   16898             :   if (curr_context->scope != innermost_function_scope ||
   16899             :       block_statement->next != NULL ||
   16900             :       innermost_function_scope->assoc_block->kind !=
   16901             :                                                 (a_statement_kind)stmk_block ||
   16902             :       last_statement_in_block(innermost_function_scope->assoc_block) !=
   16903             :                                                              block_statement) {
   16904             :     set_curr_cleanup_state_to_latest_initialization();
   16905             : #if INDICATE_CLEANUP_STATE_IN_UNREACHABLE_CODE
   16906             :     reset_cleanup_state_at_unreachable_point(statement);
   16907             : #endif /* INDICATE_CLEANUP_STATE_IN_UNREACHABLE_CODE */
   16908             :   }  /* if */
   16909             : }  /* reset_cleanup_state_at_transfer_of_control */
   16910             : 
   16911             : 
   16912             : static void lower_switch_case(a_switch_case_entry_ptr  entry)
   16913             : /*
   16914             : Do lowering on the constants pointed to by the given switch case entry.
   16915             : */
   16916             : {
   16917             :   if (entry->case_value != NULL) {
   16918             :     lower_constant(entry->case_value);
   16919             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   16920             :     if (entry->range_end != NULL) {
   16921             :       lower_constant(entry->range_end);
   16922             :     }  /* if */
   16923             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   16924             :   }  /* if */
   16925             : }  /* lower_switch_case */
   16926             : 
   16927             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   16928             : 
   16929             : static void change_block_into_statement_expression(a_statement_ptr block)
   16930             : /*
   16931             : Change the specified block into a GNU statement expression.  This
   16932             : is used when the last statement of an existing GNU statement expression
   16933             : has been changed into a block during lowering.  Changing the block
   16934             : into a statement expression allows the statement to retain a value.
   16935             : Only used in cases where a GNU statement expression returns a value
   16936             : (and hence needs a stmk_stmt_expr_result statement as the last statement
   16937             : in the block).
   16938             : 
   16939             : For a GNU statement expression that had looked like (before lowering):
   16940             : 
   16941             :   ({... stmk_stmt_expr_result(expr); )}
   16942             : 
   16943             : where "expr" has been changed into a stmk_block:
   16944             : 
   16945             :   ({... stmk_stmt_expr_result( {s1; s2; ... sX;} ); )}
   16946             : 
   16947             : this routine transforms the block into a stmk_expr/enk_statement and makes
   16948             : sure the last expression in the statement expression returns a value:
   16949             : 
   16950             :   ({... stmk_stmt_expr_result( ({s1; s2; ... stmk_stmt_expr_result(sX);}) ); )}
   16951             : */
   16952             : {
   16953             :   a_statement_ptr  last_statement;
   16954             :   a_type_ptr       expr_type = void_type();
   16955             :   a_statement_ptr  block_copy;
   16956             : 
   16957             :   check_assertion(block->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block);
   16958             :   last_statement = last_statement_in_block(block);
   16959             :   if (last_statement != NULL) {
   16960             :     if (last_statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block) {
   16961             :       /* Recursively change this block into a statement expression. */
   16962             :       change_block_into_statement_expression(last_statement);
   16963             :       /* Statement will be an stmk_expr/enk_statement on return. */
   16964             :       check_assertion(last_statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr);
   16965             :     } else if (last_statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr) {
   16966             :       /* Change the stmk_expr into a stmk_stmt_expr_result (with the same
   16967             :          underlying expression). */
   16968             :       an_expr_node_ptr expr = last_statement->expr;
   16969             :       set_statement_kind(last_statement,
   16970             :                          (a_statement_kind)stmk_stmt_expr_result);
   16971             :       last_statement->expr = expr;
   16972             :     }  /* if */
   16973             :     check_assertion(last_statement->expr != NULL);
   16974             :     last_statement->expr->result_is_not_used = FALSE;
   16975             :     expr_type = last_statement->expr->type;
   16976             :   }  /* if */
   16977             :   /* Make a copy of the original block. */
   16978             :   block_copy = alloc_statement(block->kind);
   16979             :   copy_statement(block, block_copy);
   16980             :   /* Turn the original block into an stmk_expr statement. */
   16981             :   set_statement_kind(block, (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr);
   16982             :   /* Do not allow a statement expression to have a variably-modified type. */
   16983             :   check_assertion(!is_variably_modified_type(expr_type));
   16984             :   block->expr = alloc_expr_node((an_expr_node_kind)enk_statement);
   16985             :   block->expr->type = expr_type;
   16986             :   block->expr->variant.statement = block_copy;
   16987             :   set_expr_result_not_used(block->expr);
   16988             : }  /* change_block_into_statement_expression */
   16989             : 
   16990             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   16991             : 
   16992             : void turn_statement_into_block(a_statement_ptr        statement,
   16993             :                                an_insert_location_ptr insert_location,
   16994             :                                a_statement_ptr        *orig_statement)
   16995             : /*
   16996             : Turn a statement into a block containing a copy of the statement, and
   16997             : set *insert_location so that statements can be inserted at the beginning
   16998             : of the block (i.e., in front of the original statement).  *orig_statement
   16999             : is set to point to the original statement in its new location.  Note that
   17000             : changing a stmk_stmt_expr_result statement into a block (typically only done
   17001             : during lowering) requires special handling (because that statement is the only
   17002             : statement that returns a value).  See change_block_into_statement_expression.
   17003             : */
   17004             : {
   17005             :   change_statement_into_block(statement, orig_statement);
   17006             :   /* Insert at the start of the added block. */
   17007             :   set_block_start_insert_location(statement, insert_location);
   17008             : }  /* turn_statement_into_block */
   17009             : 
   17010             : 
   17011             : void put_block_around_try_block(a_statement_ptr        statement,
   17012             :                                 an_insert_location_ptr insert_location,
   17013             :                                 a_statement_ptr        *orig_statement)
   17014             : /*
   17015             : Turn a try-block statement into a block containing a copy of the statement,
   17016             : and set *insert_location so that statements can be inserted at the beginning
   17017             : of the block (i.e., in front of the original statement).  *orig_statement
   17018             : is set to point to the original statement in its new location.  Copy the
   17019             : source position information from the original statement into the new
   17020             : block statement (this makes it easy to determine the opening brace
   17021             : position on a function whose top statement is a function-try-block once
   17022             : the try-block has been rewritten).
   17023             : */
   17024             : {
   17025             :   a_statement_ptr    orig_stmt;
   17026             :   a_source_position  final_position;
   17027             : 
   17028             :   check_assertion(statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_try_block);
   17029             :   turn_statement_into_block(statement, insert_location, orig_statement);
   17030             :   orig_stmt = *orig_statement;
   17031             :   statement->position = orig_stmt->position;
   17032             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   17033             :   final_position = orig_stmt->end_position;
   17034             :   statement->end_position = final_position;
   17035             : #else /* !EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   17036             :   /* Get the closing brace position on the final catch clause. */
   17037             :   { a_try_supplement_ptr tsp;
   17038             :     a_handler_ptr        handler;
   17039             :     tsp = orig_stmt->variant.try_block;
   17040             :     for (handler = tsp->handlers;
   17041             :          handler->next != NULL;
   17042             :          handler = handler->next) {}
   17043             :     final_position = handler->statement->variant.block.extra_info
   17044             :                                        ->final_position;
   17045             :   }
   17046             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   17047             :   statement->variant.block.extra_info->final_position = final_position;
   17048             : }  /* put_block_around_try_block */
   17049             : 
   17050             : 
   17051             : static void turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma(
   17052             :                                         a_statement_ptr        statement,
   17053             :                                         an_insert_location_ptr insert_location,
   17054             :                                         a_statement_ptr        *orig_statement,
   17055             :                                         a_scope_ptr            scope)
   17056             : /*
   17057             : Turn a statement into a block containing a copy of the statement, and
   17058             : set *insert_location so that statements can be inserted at the beginning
   17059             : of the block (i.e., in front of the original statement).  *orig_statement
   17060             : is set to point to the original statement in its new location.  If the
   17061             : original statement has an associated pragma, move it to the copy.
   17062             : scope points to the scope immediately surrounding the original statement.
   17063             : */
   17064             : {
   17065             :   turn_statement_into_block(statement, insert_location, orig_statement);
   17066             :   if (statement->has_associated_pragma) {
   17067             :     /* The original statement has an associated pragma (or list of pragmas).
   17068             :        Reattach it/them to the copy. */
   17069             :     a_pragma_ptr assoc_pragma, prev_assoc_pragma = NULL;
   17070             :     while ((assoc_pragma = find_assoc_pragma((char *)statement,
   17071             :                                              scope,
   17072             :                                              (a_type_ptr)NULL,
   17073             :                                              prev_assoc_pragma)) != NULL) {
   17074             :       /* Relink the pragma to the copy of the original statement. */
   17075             :       assoc_pragma->entity.ptr = (char *)*orig_statement;
   17076             :       prev_assoc_pragma = assoc_pragma;
   17077             :     }  /* while */
   17078             :     statement->has_associated_pragma = FALSE;
   17079             :     (*orig_statement)->has_associated_pragma = TRUE;
   17080             :   }  /* if */
   17081             : }  /* turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma */
   17082             : 
   17083             : 
   17084             : void turn_branch_into_block(a_statement_ptr        statement,
   17085             :                             an_insert_location_ptr insert_location,
   17086             :                             a_statement_ptr        *orig_statement)
   17087             : /*
   17088             : Turn a branch statement (goto or return) into a block, and set *insert_location
   17089             : so that statements can be inserted at the beginning of the block (i.e.,
   17090             : in front of the original branch statement).  *orig_statement is set to point
   17091             : to the original statement in its new location.
   17092             : */
   17093             : {
   17094             :   turn_statement_into_block(statement, insert_location, orig_statement);
   17095             :   /* We know the original statement is a branch of some sort, so
   17096             :      the end of the block is not reachable. */
   17097             :   statement->variant.block.extra_info->end_of_block_reachable = FALSE;
   17098             : }  /* turn_branch_into_block */
   17099             : 
   17100             : 
   17101             : a_context_ptr context_for_lifetime(an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime)
   17102             : /*
   17103             : Find and return a pointer to the context associated with the given object
   17104             : lifetime.  The lifetime must be present on the current context stack.
   17105             : */
   17106             : {
   17107             :   a_context_ptr context;
   17108             : 
   17109             :   for (context = curr_context;
   17110             :        context != NULL &&
   17111             :        (!context->new_lifetime || context->lifetime != lifetime);
   17112             :        context = context->parent) {}
   17113             :   check_assertion_str(context != NULL,
   17114             :                       "context_for_lifetime: lifetime not found");
   17115             :   return context;
   17116             : }  /* context_for_lifetime */
   17117             : 
   17118             : 
   17119             : static a_dynamic_init_ptr first_destruction_in_unordered_set(
   17120             :                                                    a_dynamic_init_ptr orig_dip)
   17121             : /*
   17122             : orig_dip points to a destruction that is a member of an unordered set.
   17123             : Find and return a pointer to the first member of the set (i.e., the first
   17124             : in order on the next_in_destruction_list field).
   17125             : */
   17126             : {
   17127             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip, first_in_unordered_set = NULL;
   17128             : 
   17129             :   for (dip = orig_dip->lifetime->destructions;
   17130             :        ;
   17131             :        dip = dip->next_in_destruction_list) {
   17132             :     check_assertion(dip != NULL);
   17133             :     if (dip->unordered) {
   17134             :       if (first_in_unordered_set == NULL) {
   17135             :         /* Remember the first in a set of unordered entries. */
   17136             :         first_in_unordered_set = dip;
   17137             :       }  /* if */
   17138             :     } else {
   17139             :       first_in_unordered_set = NULL;
   17140             :     }  /* if */
   17141             :     /* Stop on reaching the entry we are looking for. */
   17142             :     if (dip == orig_dip) break;
   17143             :   }  /* for */
   17144             :   return first_in_unordered_set;
   17145             : }  /* first_destruction_in_unordered_set */
   17146             : 
   17147             : 
   17148             : static void dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting(
   17149             :                                      a_boolean          *something_pending,
   17150             :                                      a_dynamic_init_ptr pending_cleanup_state,
   17151             :                                      an_insert_location *insert_location)
   17152             : /*
   17153             : If *something_pending is TRUE, pending_cleanup_state indicates a cleanup
   17154             : state which code should have been emitted to establish.  The output
   17155             : was delayed in the hope that it could be eliminated if another
   17156             : cleanup-state-set came next.  That hasn't happened, so put out the
   17157             : code to indicate the cleanup state (inserting it at insert_location), and
   17158             : reset *something_pending to FALSE.
   17159             : */
   17160             : {
   17161             :   if (*something_pending) {
   17162             :     curr_context->curr_cleanup_state = pending_cleanup_state;
   17163             :     insert_code_to_indicate_cleanup_state(pending_cleanup_state,
   17164             :                                           insert_location,
   17165             :                                           /*unreachable=*/FALSE);
   17166             :     *something_pending = FALSE;
   17167             :   }  /* if */
   17168             : }  /* dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting */
   17169             : 
   17170             : 
   17171             : static a_boolean gen_cleanup_actions_or_check_if_needed(
   17172             :                                         an_object_lifetime_ptr outer_lifetime,
   17173             :                                         an_insert_location_ptr insert_location,
   17174             :                                         a_boolean              check_only)
   17175             : /*
   17176             : Generate any cleanup actions required to exit from the current context
   17177             : (as indicated by curr_object_lifetime and curr_context) through
   17178             : outer_lifetime, inclusive.  Insert the code for the cleanup at
   17179             : *insert_location.  If any cleanup code was needed, return TRUE.
   17180             : If check_only is TRUE, just return that value; do not generate any
   17181             : code.
   17182             : */
   17183             : {
   17184             :   a_boolean              any_cleanup_needed = FALSE, skip_temporaries = FALSE;
   17185             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr     dip = curr_context->latest_initialization;
   17186             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime = curr_object_lifetime;
   17187             :   a_boolean              prev_is_catch = FALSE, curr_is_catch;
   17188             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr     pending_cleanup_state = NULL;
   17189             :   a_boolean              state_set_pending = FALSE;
   17190             : 
   17191             :   /* Do nothing at all if there are no lifetimes involved. */
   17192             :   if (outer_lifetime != NULL) {
   17193             :     /* If the current cleanup entry is part of an unordered set, start with the
   17194             :        first in the set. */
   17195             :     if (dip != NULL && dip->unordered) {
   17196             :       dip = first_destruction_in_unordered_set(dip); 
   17197             :     }  /* if */
   17198             :     /* Loop outward through the indicated scopes.  At each level, there may
   17199             :        be destructions from the current position back to the beginning
   17200             :        of the lifetime, and there may be cleanup actions associated with the
   17201             :        lifetime itself. */
   17202             :     for (;;) {
   17203             :       curr_is_catch = FALSE;
   17204             :       /* Generate destructions in this context. */
   17205             :       for (; dip != NULL; dip = dip->next_in_destruction_list) {
   17206             :         check_assertion_str(dip->destructible_entity_descr != NULL,
   17207             :                  "gen_cleanup_actions_...: missing destructible entity descr");
   17208             :         if (dip->has_temporary_lifetime && skip_temporaries) {
   17209             :           /* Skipping temporaries, so skip this destruction. */
   17210             :         } else if (dip->is_constructor_init) {
   17211             :           /* Also skip entries for constructor inits (in constructors and
   17212             :              destructors).  They apply for exception cleanup but not on
