   17213             :              exit via branch. */
   17214             :           if (exceptions_enabled) {
   17215             :             /* When exceptions are enabled, the cleanup state does need to
   17216             :                be updated. */
   17217             :             pending_cleanup_state = dip->destructible_entity_descr->
   17218             :                                 cleanup_state_to_set_when_starting_destruction;
   17219             :             state_set_pending = TRUE;
   17220             :           }  /* if */
   17221             :         } else if (dip->destruction_is_for_partially_constructed_aggregate) {
   17222             :           /* Also skip entries for partial aggregate cleanup,
   17223             :              if an exception is thrown before the initialization is
   17224             :              completed.  They apply for exception cleanup but not on
   17225             :              exit via branch. */
   17226             :         } else if (dip->is_guard_var_for_local_static_var_init ||
   17227             :                    dip->is_freeing_of_storage_on_exception
   17228             : #if GENERATE_EH_TABLES
   17229             :                    || dip->is_freeing_of_exception_object
   17230             : #endif /* GENERATE_EH_TABLES */
   17231             :                                                          ) {
   17232             :           /* Remove the cleanup entry that requests clearing the guard
   17233             :              variable for a local static variable initialization, or
   17234             :              that requests freeing of the storage allocated for a "new",
   17235             :              or that requests the freeing of the runtime exception object
   17236             :              when a catch clause terminates.  There is no actual cleanup
   17237             :              action on exit via branch; the current cleanup state is just
   17238             :              updated. */
   17239             :           /* Note that these are present only when exceptions are
   17240             :              enabled. */
   17241             :           pending_cleanup_state = dip->destructible_entity_descr->
   17242             :                                 cleanup_state_to_set_when_starting_destruction;
   17243             :           state_set_pending = TRUE;
   17244             : #if DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING
   17245             :         } else if (dip->variable == NULL &&
   17246             :                    return_value_pointer_variable != NULL &&
   17247             :                    dip->destructible_entity_descr->init_pos_descr.variable ==
   17248             :                                                return_value_pointer_variable) {
   17249             :           /* This is the initialization of the parameter substituted for the
   17250             :              return value optimization variable.  The destruction doesn't get
   17251             :              done on exit from the routine (the caller does it). */
   17252             : #endif /* DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING */
   17253             : #if VLA_DEALLOCATION_REQUIRED
   17254             :         } else if (dip->is_vla_deallocation) {
   17255             :           /* Deallocation of a variable-length array (VLA).  This is
   17256             :              needed both on exception cleanup and exit via branch. */
   17257             :           any_cleanup_needed = TRUE;
   17258             :           if (check_only) goto done;
   17259             :           dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting(&state_set_pending,
   17260             :                                              pending_cleanup_state,
   17261             :                                              insert_location);
   17262             :           gen_vla_deallocation(dip, insert_location);
   17263             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATION_REQUIRED */
   17264             :         } else {
   17265             :           /* Normal case -- a destruction is needed. */
   17266             :           any_cleanup_needed = TRUE;
   17267             :           if (check_only) goto done;
   17268             :           dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting(&state_set_pending,
   17269             :                                              pending_cleanup_state,
   17270             :                                              insert_location);
   17271             :           gen_one_destruction(dip, insert_location);
   17272             :         }  /* if */
   17273             :       }  /* for */
   17274             :       /* Finished the list of destructions in this context. */
   17275             :       { a_scope_ptr            scope;
   17276             :         /* In some cases, the context itself requires cleanup. */
   17277             :         if (lifetime->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_try_block) {
   17278             :           /* Exit from a "try" block. */
   17279             :           if (innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr->special_kind ==
   17280             :                                      (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor &&
   17281             :               context_for_lifetime(lifetime)->is_function_try_block &&
   17282             :               !prev_is_catch) {
   17283             :             /* In the function-body of a function-try-block of a destructor,
   17284             :                a return does not leave the destructor directly.  It goes
   17285             :                to the member and base destruction code in the epilogue, which
   17286             :                is still inside the try block.  So do not pop the try block
   17287             :                here.  Note that an exit from a catch clause of a
   17288             :                function-try-block of a destructor does pop the try block. */
   17289             :           } else {
   17290             :             any_cleanup_needed = TRUE;
   17291             :             if (check_only) goto done;
   17292             :             dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting(&state_set_pending,
   17293             :                                                pending_cleanup_state,
   17294             :                                                insert_location);
   17295             :             cleanup_on_exit_from_try_block(context_for_lifetime(lifetime),
   17296             :                                     (a_try_supplement_ptr)lifetime->entity.ptr,
   17297             :                                            insert_location);
   17298             :           }  /* if */
   17299             :         } else if ((an_il_entry_kind)lifetime->entity.kind == iek_scope &&
   17300             :                    (scope = (a_scope_ptr)lifetime->entity.ptr,
   17301             :                     (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_block &&
   17302             :                      scope->variant.assoc_handler != NULL))) {
   17303             :           /* Exit from a "catch" clause. */
   17304             :           any_cleanup_needed = TRUE;
   17305             :           if (check_only) goto done;
   17306             :           dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting(&state_set_pending,
   17307             :                                              pending_cleanup_state,
   17308             :                                              insert_location);
   17309             :           cleanup_on_exit_from_catch(scope->variant.assoc_handler,
   17310             :                                      insert_location);
   17311             :           curr_is_catch = TRUE;
   17312             :         }  /* if */
   17313             :       }
   17314             :       /* Stop when the outer lifetime has been processed. */
   17315             :       if (lifetime == outer_lifetime) break;
   17316             :       /* Continuing into the parent. */
   17317             :       /* The lifetime indicates where to start in the destructions list
   17318             :          of the parent. */
   17319             :       dip = lifetime->parent_destruction_sublist;
   17320             :       skip_temporaries = FALSE;
   17321             :       if (lifetime->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block_after_label) {
   17322             :         /* We're going from an olk_block_after_label to a previous lifetime
   17323             :            in the same scope, so skip temporaries in the previous lifetime,
   17324             :            because temporaries will have been destroyed at the label. */
   17325             :         skip_temporaries = TRUE;
   17326             :       }  /* if */
   17327             :       lifetime = lifetime->parent_lifetime;
   17328             :       prev_is_catch = curr_is_catch;
   17329             :     }  /* for */
   17330             :     /* Output any pending code to set the cleanup state, unless we are
   17331             :        at the outermost level in a function in the fully-lowered mode
   17332             :        (in that case, the global variable will be reset to the value for
   17333             :        the caller in a moment anyway). */
   17334             :     if (state_set_pending
   17335             : #if DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
   17336             :         && !(lifetime->kind == (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block &&
   17337             :              lifetime->entity.ptr == (char *)innermost_function_scope)
   17338             : #endif /* DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING */
   17339             :                          ) {
   17340             :       any_cleanup_needed = TRUE;
   17341             :       if (check_only) goto done;
   17342             :       dump_pending_cleanup_state_setting(&state_set_pending,
   17343             :                                          pending_cleanup_state,
   17344             :                                          insert_location);
   17345             :     }  /* if */
   17346             :   }  /* if */
   17347             : done:
   17348             :   return any_cleanup_needed;
   17349             : }  /* gen_cleanup_actions_or_check_if_needed */
   17350             : 
   17351             : 
   17352             : void gen_cleanup_actions(an_object_lifetime_ptr outer_lifetime,
   17353             :                          an_insert_location_ptr insert_location)
   17354             : /*
   17355             : Generate any cleanup actions required to exit from the current context
   17356             : (as indicated by curr_object_lifetime and curr_context) through
   17357             : outer_lifetime, inclusive.  Insert the code for the cleanup at
   17358             : *insert_location.
   17359             : */
   17360             : {
   17361             :   (void)gen_cleanup_actions_or_check_if_needed(outer_lifetime, insert_location,
   17362             :                                                /*check_only=*/FALSE);
   17363             : }  /* gen_cleanup_actions */
   17364             : 
   17365             : 
   17366             : static a_boolean any_cleanup_actions(an_object_lifetime_ptr outer_lifetime)
   17367             : /*
   17368             : Return TRUE if any cleanup actions are required to exit from the current
   17369             : context (as indicated by curr_object_lifetime and curr_context) through
   17370             : outer_lifetime, inclusive.
   17371             : */
   17372             : {
   17373             :   a_boolean any_cleanup_needed = gen_cleanup_actions_or_check_if_needed(
   17374             :                                                     outer_lifetime,
   17375             :                                                     (an_insert_location *)NULL,
   17376             :                                                     /*check_only=*/TRUE);
   17377             :   return any_cleanup_needed;
   17378             : }  /* any_cleanup_actions */
   17379             : 
   17380             : 
   17381             : static void gen_goto_cleanup_actions(a_statement_ptr statement)
   17382             : /*
   17383             : Generate any cleanup actions required preceding the indicated goto statement.
   17384             : */
   17385             : {
   17386             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr common_lifetime = statement->variant.label.lifetime;
   17387             : 
   17388             :   /* If not keeping lifetimes in the IL, clear the lifetime pointer. */
   17389             :   if (!keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il) {
   17390             :     statement->variant.label.lifetime = NULL;
   17391             :   }  /* if */
   17392             :   /* The goto statement has a pointer to an object lifetime that is the
   17393             :      innermost object lifetime that it has in common with the label.
   17394             :      Generate cleanup actions for all lifetimes from the current position
   17395             :      out to the indicated lifetime. */
   17396             :   /* Do nothing if there are no lifetimes involved. */
   17397             :   if (common_lifetime != NULL) {
   17398             :     an_object_lifetime_ptr outer_lifetime = curr_object_lifetime;
   17399             : #if CHECKING
   17400             :     if (curr_object_lifetime == NULL) {
   17401             : #if DEBUG
   17402             :       fprintf(f_debug, "common_lifetime:\n");
   17403             :       db_object_lifetime(common_lifetime);
   17404             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   17405             :       unexpected_condition_str2("gen_goto_cleanup_actions:",
   17406             :                        "curr_object_lifetime is NULL, common_lifetime is not");
   17407             :     }  /* if */
   17408             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   17409             :     if (outer_lifetime == common_lifetime) {
   17410             :       /* No lifetimes are being exited. */
   17411             :       if (long_lifetime_temps) {
   17412             :         /* Destroy any long lifetime temporaries.  This is needed for
   17413             :            user gotos but not for gotos to break and continue labels. */
   17414             :         a_boolean destroy_temps = TRUE;
   17415             :         if (has_name(statement->variant.label.ptr)) {
   17416             :           /* Destroy temporaries on a user goto.  This would be a goto
   17417             :              forward at the same level. */
   17418             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   17419             :         } else if (statement->variant.label.ptr->leave_label) {
   17420             :           /* Destroy temporaries on a __leave. */
   17421             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   17422             :         } else {
   17423             :           /* Other compiler-generated gotos, e.g., for break or continue.
   17424             :              Don't destroy temporaries. */
   17425             :           destroy_temps = FALSE;
   17426             :         }  /* if */
   17427             :         if (destroy_temps) {
   17428             :           /* Destroy temporaries. */
   17429             :           a_boolean          any_temps_destroyed;
   17430             :           an_insert_location insert_location;
   17431             :           /* If the statement is turned into a block, statement will be
   17432             :              updated to point to the original statement. */
   17433             :           destroy_curr_lifetime_temporaries(&statement, &any_temps_destroyed,
   17434             :                                             &insert_location);
   17435             :         }  /* if */
   17436             :       }  /* if */
   17437             :     } else {
   17438             :       /* Some lifetimes are being exited. */
   17439             :       /* Find the last lifetime in the cleanup chain rising from the goto that
   17440             :          should be terminated, i.e., the one right before common_lifetime. */
   17441             :       while (outer_lifetime->parent_lifetime != common_lifetime) {
   17442             :         outer_lifetime = outer_lifetime->parent_lifetime;
   17443             : #if CHECKING
   17444             :         if (outer_lifetime == NULL) {
   17445             : #if DEBUG
   17446             :           fprintf(f_debug, "common_lifetime:\n");
   17447             :           db_object_lifetime(common_lifetime);
   17448             :           db_object_lifetime_stack();
   17449             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   17450             :           unexpected_condition_str2(
   17451             :                                 "gen_goto_cleanup_actions: common lifetime",
   17452             :                                 "not found in curr lifetime parents");
   17453             :         }  /* if */
   17454             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   17455             :       }  /* while */
   17456             :       /* See if any cleanup actions are required on leaving the indicated
   17457             :          lifetimes. */
   17458             :       if (any_cleanup_actions(outer_lifetime)) {
   17459             :         /* Some cleanup actions are needed.  Generate them. */
   17460             :         an_insert_location insert_location;
   17461             :         a_statement_ptr    orig_statement;
   17462             :         /* Turn the goto into a block so code can be inserted in front
   17463             :            of it. */
   17464             :         turn_branch_into_block(statement, &insert_location, &orig_statement);
   17465             :         gen_cleanup_actions(outer_lifetime, &insert_location);
   17466             :         reset_cleanup_state_at_transfer_of_control(orig_statement, statement);
   17467             :       }  /* if */
   17468             :     }  /* if */
   17469             :   }  /* if */
   17470             : }  /* gen_goto_cleanup_actions */
   17471             : 
   17472             : 
   17473             : static void push_scopeless_compound_stmt(a_statement_ptr stmt)
   17474             : /*
   17475             : We are entering the indicated statement (a compound statement without
   17476             : an associated scope).  Add an entry for it on the front of the list of
   17477             : such statements attached to the current entry on the context stack.
   17478             : */
   17479             : {
   17480             :   a_scopeless_compound_stmt_ptr scsp;
   17481             : 
   17482             :   /* Get an entry to put on the list. */
   17483             :   if (avail_scopeless_compound_stmts != NULL) {
   17484             :     /* Reuse a freed entry. */
   17485             :     scsp = avail_scopeless_compound_stmts;
   17486             :     avail_scopeless_compound_stmts = scsp->next;
   17487             :   } else {
   17488             :     /* Allocate a new entry. */
   17489             :     scsp = (a_scopeless_compound_stmt_ptr)
   17490             :                                    alloc_fe(sizeof(a_scopeless_compound_stmt));
   17491             : #if DEBUG
   17492             :     num_scopeless_compound_stmts_allocated++;
   17493             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   17494             :   }  /* if */
   17495             :   /* Add the entry to the front of the list. */
   17496             :   scsp->next = curr_context->scopeless_compound_stmts;
   17497             :   curr_context->scopeless_compound_stmts = scsp;
   17498             :   scsp->stmt = stmt;
   17499             :   /* Use a new local temporaries list while within this statement. */
   17500             :   scsp->saved_local_temporaries = curr_context->local_temporaries;
   17501             :   curr_context->local_temporaries = NULL;
   17502             : }  /* push_scopeless_compound_stmt */
   17503             : 
   17504             : 
   17505             : static void push_block_statement_context(
   17506             :                                   a_statement_ptr    block_statement,
   17507             :                                   a_boolean          force_context_push,
   17508             :                                   a_context          *context,
   17509             :                                   a_boolean          *context_pushed,
   17510             :                                   a_boolean          *new_lifetime,
   17511             :                                   a_dynamic_init_ptr *saved_curr_cleanup_state)
   17512             : /*
   17513             : Push a context and start an object lifetime, if necessary (or if
   17514             : force_context_push is TRUE), for the indicated block statement.  If a context
   17515             : is pushed, context (a local variable in the caller) is used as the stack entry
   17516             : and *context_pushed is returned TRUE.  *new_lifetime is returned TRUE if a new
   17517             : object lifetime is begun.  The value of curr_context->curr_cleanup_state is
   17518             : saved in *saved_curr_cleanup_state so it can be restored at the end of the
   17519             : block.
   17520             : */
   17521             : {
   17522             :   a_block_ptr            block = block_statement->variant.block.extra_info;
   17523             :   a_scope_ptr            scope = block->assoc_scope;
   17524             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime = block->lifetime;
   17525             : 
   17526             :   *context_pushed = FALSE;
   17527             :   *new_lifetime = FALSE;
   17528             :   *saved_curr_cleanup_state = curr_context->curr_cleanup_state;
   17529             :   if (scope != NULL || lifetime != NULL || force_context_push) {
   17530             :     push_context(context, scope, lifetime);
   17531             :     *context_pushed = TRUE;
   17532             :     *new_lifetime = curr_context->new_lifetime;
   17533             :     if (scope != NULL) lifetime = scope->lifetime;
   17534             :   } else if (block_statement == innermost_function_scope->assoc_block) {
   17535             :     /* For the topmost block in a function, assoc_scope is NULL, so
   17536             :        no push_context is done.  That's correct, because the caller has
   17537             :        done the push_context already.  A new lifetime may begin here,
   17538             :        however. */
   17539             :     scope = innermost_function_scope;
   17540             :     lifetime = scope->lifetime;
   17541             :     *new_lifetime = (lifetime != NULL);
   17542             :   } else {
   17543             :     /* Keep track of compound statements without scopes that we are inside
   17544             :        of, so they can be used to allocate temporaries. */
   17545             :     push_scopeless_compound_stmt(block_statement);
   17546             :   }  /* if */
   17547             :   if (*new_lifetime) {
   17548             :     /* A new lifetime was pushed. */
   17549             :     /* Do initial processing for the lifetime (e.g., generate conditional
   17550             :        flag variables). */
   17551             :     an_insert_location insert_location;
   17552             :     set_block_start_insert_location(block_statement, &insert_location);
   17553             :     begin_block_object_lifetime(lifetime, &insert_location);
   17554             :   }  /* if */
   17555             : }  /* push_block_statement_context */
   17556             : 
   17557             : 
   17558             : static void pop_scopeless_compound_stmt(void)
   17559             : /*
   17560             : We are leaving a compound statement with no associated scope.  Take its
   17561             : entry off the list of such statements attached to the current entry on
   17562             : the context stack.
   17563             : */
   17564             : {
   17565             :   a_scopeless_compound_stmt_ptr scsp = curr_context->scopeless_compound_stmts;
   17566             : 
   17567             :   check_assertion(scsp != NULL);
   17568             :   /* Reusable temporaries in this scope can no longer be reused. */
   17569             :   free_temporary_list_entry_list(curr_context->local_temporaries);
   17570             :   curr_context->local_temporaries = scsp->saved_local_temporaries;
   17571             :   /* Remove the entry from the context stack list. */
   17572             :   curr_context->scopeless_compound_stmts = scsp->next;
   17573             :   /* Put the entry on the available list for potential reuse. */
   17574             :   scsp->next = avail_scopeless_compound_stmts;
   17575             :   avail_scopeless_compound_stmts = scsp;
   17576             : }  /* pop_scopeless_compound_stmt */
   17577             : 
   17578             : 
   17579             : #if !GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   17580             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- saved_curr_context is unused in that case. */
   17581             : #endif /* !GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   17582             : static void pop_block_statement_context(
   17583             :                                    a_statement_ptr    block_statement,
   17584             :                                    a_statement_ptr    last_statement,
   17585             :                                    a_boolean          context_pushed,
   17586             :                                    a_boolean          new_lifetime,
   17587             :                                    a_dynamic_init_ptr saved_curr_cleanup_state)
   17588             : /*
   17589             : Pop a context and end an object lifetime, if necessary, for the
   17590             : indicated block statement.  context_pushed indicates whether or
   17591             : not a context was pushed and therefore should be popped.  new_lifetime
   17592             : indicates whether or not an object lifetime was begun and therefore
   17593             : should be ended.  If an object lifetime is ended, generate any cleanup
   17594             : actions required at the end of the block.  last_statement points to the
   17595             : last statement within the block, or is NULL if there are no statements
   17596             : in the block or to ask this routine to find the last statement itself.
   17597             : Any cleanup code inserted is placed after the last statement.
   17598             : *saved_curr_cleanup_state contains the value that
   17599             : curr_context->curr_cleanup_state had at the start of the block.
   17600             : */
   17601             : {
   17602             :   a_block_ptr block = block_statement->variant.block.extra_info;
   17603             : 
   17604             :   if (new_lifetime) {
   17605             :     a_scope_ptr            scope = block->assoc_scope;
   17606             :     an_object_lifetime_ptr lifetime = block->lifetime;
   17607             :     an_insert_location     insert_location;
   17608             : 
   17609             :     /* An object lifetime must be ended.  If there were labels in the
   17610             :        block, this may end several object lifetimes.  (That's one reason
   17611             :        why we can't just use curr_context->lifetime here.)   Note also
   17612             :        that for the topmost block in a function, we end the lifetime
   17613             :        here but do not pop the context. */
   17614             :     /* If the block was originally empty but some statements were
   17615             :        added (e.g., to initialize the catch handler parameter), find the
   17616             :        last statement. */
   17617             :     if (last_statement == NULL &&
   17618             :         block_statement->variant.block.statements != NULL) {
   17619             :       last_statement = last_statement_in_block(block_statement);
   17620             :     }  /* if */
   17621             :     /* Determine the insert location for the end of the block. */
   17622             :     if (last_statement == NULL) {
   17623             :       /* The block is empty, so insert at its beginning. */
   17624             :       set_block_start_insert_location(block_statement, &insert_location);
   17625             :     } else {
   17626             :       /* Insert after the last statement. */
   17627             :       set_insert_location(last_statement, &insert_location);
   17628             :     }  /* if */
   17629             :     if (block_statement == innermost_function_scope->assoc_block) {
   17630             :       scope = innermost_function_scope;
   17631             :     }  /* if */
   17632             :     if (scope != NULL) lifetime = scope->lifetime;
   17633             :     /* Insert any cleanup actions after the last statement in the block
   17634             :        if the end of the block is reachable. */
   17635             :     if (block->end_of_block_reachable) {
   17636             :       if (block->final_position.seq != 0) {
   17637             :         code_pos_for_lowering = block->final_position;
   17638             :       }  /* if */
   17639             :       gen_cleanup_actions(lifetime, &insert_location);
   17640             :     } else {
   17641             :       /* The end of the block is not reachable, because of a transfer of
   17642             :          control (goto, return) or a throw.  In the case of a transfer,
   17643             :          the current cleanup state will have been updated previously.
   17644             :          In the case of a throw, however, the current cleanup state may
   17645             :          need to be restored to what it was on entry to the block
   17646             :          (generating the cleanup actions would do that, but we aren't
   17647             :          generating them because the end of the block is not reachable). */
   17648             :       if (curr_context->curr_cleanup_state != saved_curr_cleanup_state) {
   17649             :         curr_context->curr_cleanup_state = saved_curr_cleanup_state;
   17650             : #if INDICATE_CLEANUP_STATE_IN_UNREACHABLE_CODE
   17651             :         reset_cleanup_state_at_unreachable_point(last_statement);
   17652             : #endif /* INDICATE_CLEANUP_STATE_IN_UNREACHABLE_CODE */
   17653             :       }  /* if */
   17654             :     }  /* if */
   17655             :   }  /* if */
   17656             :   if (context_pushed) {
   17657             :     /* Pop the context pushed by push_block_statement_context. */
   17658             :     pop_context();
   17659             :   } else if (block_statement == innermost_function_scope->assoc_block) {
   17660             :     /* This is the top-most block in a function. */
   17661             :   } else {
   17662             :     /* This is a compound statement with no associated scope (or at least
   17663             :        it didn't have one when it was pushed). */
   17664             :     pop_scopeless_compound_stmt();
   17665             :   }  /* if */
   17666             : }  /* pop_block_statement_context */
   17667             : 
   17668             : 
   17669             : void lower_block_statement(
   17670             :                       a_statement_ptr                 statement,
   17671             :                       a_boolean                       is_block_of_function_try,
   17672             :                       a_boolean                       is_block_of_stmt_expr,
   17673             :                       a_destructor_wrapper_info_block *dtor_info,
   17674             :                       a_statement_ptr                 *p_last_statement)
   17675             : /*
   17676             : Lower an stmk_block statement.  is_block_of_function_try is TRUE if the
   17677             : block is the dependent block of a function-try-block in a constructor
   17678             : or destructor.  is_block_of_stmt_expr is TRUE if the block is the block
   17679             : statement for a GNU statement expression.  *dtor_info provides extra
   17680             : information for the destructor case; dtor_info is NULL otherwise.  If
   17681             : p_last_statement is non-NULL, *p_last_statement is set to point to the last
   17682             : statement in the block, or NULL if there are no statements in the block.
   17683             : */
   17684             : {
   17685             :   a_statement_ptr    statement_list, last_statement;
   17686             :   a_boolean          context_pushed, new_lifetime;
   17687             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr saved_curr_cleanup_state;
   17688             :   a_block_ptr        block;
   17689             :   a_context          context;
   17690             :   a_scope_ptr        scope;
   17691             : 
   17692             :   code_pos_for_lowering = statement->position;
   17693             :   error_position = code_pos_for_lowering;
   17694             :   /* Save the statement list pointer early in case code is inserted
   17695             :      to initialize conditional flags or the catch handler parameter. */
   17696             :   statement_list = statement->variant.block.statements;
   17697             :   /* Push a context around the processing of the block if it has a scope
   17698             :      or an object lifetime or if it is the block of a GNU statement
   17699             :      expression. */
   17700             :   push_block_statement_context(statement,
   17701             :                                /*force_context_push=*/is_block_of_stmt_expr,
   17702             :                                &context, &context_pushed, &new_lifetime,
   17703             :                                &saved_curr_cleanup_state);
   17704             :   block = statement->variant.block.extra_info;
   17705             :   scope = block->assoc_scope;
   17706             :   if (scope != NULL) {
   17707             :     if (scope->variant.assoc_handler != NULL) {
   17708             :       /* This statement is the dependent statement of a catch handler.
   17709             :          Generate code to start the catch clause. */
   17710             :       begin_catch_clause(scope->variant.assoc_handler);
   17711             :     }  /* if */
   17712             :   }  /* if */
   17713             :   if (is_block_of_function_try) {
   17714             :     add_function_try_wrapper_code(statement, dtor_info);
   17715             :   }  /* if */
   17716             :   lower_statement_list(statement_list, &last_statement);
   17717             :   /* Generate any cleanup actions and pop the context. */
   17718             :   pop_block_statement_context(statement, last_statement,
   17719             :                               context_pushed, new_lifetime,
   17720             :                               saved_curr_cleanup_state);
   17721             :   if (p_last_statement != NULL) {
   17722             :     /* Return a pointer to the last statement to the caller.  Advance
   17723             :        if necessary in case pop_block_statement_context added some
   17724             :        statements. */
   17725             :     if (last_statement != NULL) {
   17726             :       while (last_statement->next != NULL) {
   17727             :         last_statement = last_statement->next;
   17728             :       }  /* while */
   17729             :     }  /* if */
   17730             :     *p_last_statement = last_statement;
   17731             :   }  /* if */
   17732             : }  /* lower_block_statement */
   17733             : 
   17734             : 
   17735             : static void lower_return_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   17736             : /*
   17737             : Lower an stmk_return statement.
   17738             : */
   17739             : {
   17740             :   an_expr_node_ptr   return_expr = statement->expr;
   17741             :   a_statement_ptr    return_statement, assign_statement;
   17742             :   a_routine_ptr      routine = innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   17743             :   a_type_ptr         routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine->type);
   17744             :   a_boolean          make_block, any_cleanup_on_return, is_reusable_temp;
   17745             :   a_boolean          keep_dynamic_init = FALSE, *eff_keep_dynamic_init = NULL;
   17746             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip;
   17747             :   a_variable_ptr     temp_var;
   17748             :   an_insert_location insert_location;
   17749             :   a_type_ptr         return_type;
   17750             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr rtsp;
   17751             : 
   17752             :   return_type = routine_type->variant.routine.return_type;
   17753             :   if (return_expr != NULL) {
   17754             :     /* Lower the returned expression.  It's an lvalue if the routine returns
   17755             :        a reference type. */
   17756             :     lower_full_expr(return_expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   17757             :   } else if (ctors_return_this &&
   17758             :              routine->special_kind==(a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
   17759             :     /* A constructor returns "this". */
   17760             :     a_variable_ptr this_param_var =
   17761             :                  innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable;
   17762             :     return_expr = statement->expr = var_rvalue_expr(this_param_var);
   17763             :     return_type = return_expr->type;
   17764             :   } else if (dtors_return_this &&
   17765             :              routine->special_kind==(a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   17766             :     /* A destructor returns "(void *)this". */
   17767             :     a_variable_ptr this_param_var =
   17768             :                  innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable;
   17769             :     return_expr = add_cast(var_rvalue_expr(this_param_var), void_star_type());
   17770             :     statement->expr = return_expr;
   17771             :     return_type = return_expr->type;
   17772             :   }  /* if */
   17773             :   /* Keep track of whether or not we have already turned the return
   17774             :      statement into a block.  We haven't so far. */
   17775             :   return_statement = statement;
   17776             :   make_block = TRUE;
   17777             :   dip = statement->variant.return_dynamic_init;
   17778             :   statement->variant.return_dynamic_init = NULL;
   17779             :   rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   17780             :   /* If the routine returns its value via a copy constructor, generate
   17781             :      code for the dynamic initialization.  However, if return value
   17782             :      optimization applies, just skip the copy constructor call
   17783             :      altogether. */
   17784             :   if (dip != NULL) {
   17785             : #if DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING
   17786             :     if (innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.
   17787             :                                                return_value_variable != NULL) {
   17788             :       /* Return value optimization was done. */
   17789             :       if (dip->init_expr_lifetime != NULL) {
   17790             :         unbind_object_lifetime(dip->init_expr_lifetime);
   17791             :       }  /* if */
   17792             :     } else 
   17793             : #endif /* DO_RETURN_VALUE_OPTIMIZATION_IN_LOWERING */
   17794             :     /* Do not insert code here; this is the "else" of an "if". */
   17795             :     {
   17796             :       an_init_pos_descr ipd;
   17797             :       temp_var = NULL;
   17798             :       if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
   17799             :         /* This routine returns its value via a copy constructor.
   17800             :            The dynamic initialization entry indicates the operation to
   17801             :            be done. */
   17802             :         set_var_indirect_init_pos_descr(return_value_pointer_variable, &ipd);
   17803             :       } else {
   17804             :         /* This must be a C++11 list-initializer case, e.g., "return{x};".
   17805             :            Initialize a temporary using the dynamic init entry, and return
   17806             :            the value of the temporary. */
   17807             :         temp_var = make_temporary_for_dynamic_init(skip_typerefs(return_type),
   17808             :                                                    dip, &is_reusable_temp);
   17809             :         if (!is_reusable_temp) eff_keep_dynamic_init = &keep_dynamic_init;
   17810             :         set_var_init_pos_descr(temp_var, &ipd);
   17811             :         check_assertion(dip->variable == NULL);
   17812             :         dip->variable = temp_var;
   17813             :       }  /* if */
   17814             :       /* Put the return statement under a block so we can insert in
   17815             :          front of it. */
   17816             :       turn_branch_into_block(statement, &insert_location, &return_statement);
   17817             :       make_block = FALSE;
   17818             :       lower_dynamic_init(dip, &ipd,
   17819             :                          (an_implied_copy_source *)NULL,
   17820             :                          (a_variable_ptr)NULL,
   17821             :                          LDIO_FULL_EXPR,
   17822             :                          /*others_follow_in_aggr=*/FALSE,
   17823             :                          &insert_location,
   17824             :                          eff_keep_dynamic_init,
   17825             :                          (a_constant **)NULL);
   17826             :       if (temp_var != NULL) {
   17827             :         return_statement->expr = return_expr = var_rvalue_expr(temp_var);
   17828             :         if (keep_dynamic_init) {
   17829             :           /* If the initializer for the dynamic init is to be kept, allocate
   17830             :              an stmk_init for it. */
   17831             :           add_stmk_init_for_temp_init(temp_var, dip);
   17832             :         }  /* if */
   17833             :       }  /* if */
   17834             :     }  /* if */
   17835             :   } else if (!rtsp->value_returned_by_cctor &&
   17836             :              rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
   17837             :     /* This case can only occur if the customer has specifically requested
   17838             :        that the function value be returned through an additional
   17839             :        parameter (by customizing set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag). */
   17840             :     /* A copy constructor isn't being called, but we're to return the function
   17841             :        value in an additional parameter anyway.  Change
   17842             :           return expr;
   17843             :        into
   17844             :           { *arg = expr; return;}
   17845             :     */
   17846             :     an_expr_node_ptr      lvalue_expr;
   17847             :     a_type_ptr            return_value_type;
   17848             :     check_assertion(return_expr != NULL && make_block &&
   17849             :                     return_value_pointer_variable != NULL);
   17850             :     /* Change the return statement so that it returns nothing. */
   17851             :     statement->expr = NULL;
   17852             :     turn_branch_into_block(statement, &insert_location, &return_statement);
   17853             :     make_block = FALSE;
   17854             :     /* Create and insert the assignment statement. */
   17855             :     return_value_type = type_pointed_to(return_value_pointer_variable->type);
   17856             :     lvalue_expr = var_lvalue_expr(return_value_pointer_variable);
   17857             :     lvalue_expr = add_cast_if_necessary(lvalue_expr, make_pointer_type(
   17858             :                          make_pointer_type(skip_typerefs(return_value_type))));
   17859             :     lvalue_expr = add_indirection_to_node(lvalue_expr);
   17860             :     assign_statement = insert_assignment_statement(
   17861             :                                 lvalue_expr, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_assign,
   17862             :                                 return_expr, &insert_location);
   17863             :     set_stmt_pos_to_code_pos_for_lowering(assign_statement);
   17864             :     return_expr = NULL;
   17865             :   }  /* if */
   17866             :   any_cleanup_on_return =
   17867             :                        any_cleanup_actions(innermost_function_scope->lifetime);
   17868             :   if (return_expr != NULL && is_void_type(return_type)) {
   17869             :     a_statement_ptr expr_stmt;
   17870             :     /* A void function returning a void expression.  Change
   17871             :          return expr;
   17872             :        into
   17873             :          {expr; return;}
   17874             :     */
   17875             :     /* Change the return statement so that it returns nothing. */
   17876             :     statement->expr = NULL;
   17877             :     /* Note that if we executed the similar code above we wouldn't
   17878             :        be executing the code here, because a return can have either
   17879             :        a dynamic init entry or an expression, but not both. */
   17880             :     check_assertion(make_block);
   17881             :     turn_branch_into_block(statement, &insert_location,
   17882             :                            &return_statement);
   17883             :     make_block = FALSE;
   17884             :     /* Insert the expression statement. */
   17885             :     expr_stmt = insert_expr_statement(return_expr, &insert_location);
   17886             :     set_stmt_pos_to_code_pos_for_lowering(expr_stmt);
   17887             :   } else if (any_cleanup_on_return ||
   17888             :              (exceptions_enabled &&
   17889             :               (innermost_function_scope->lifetime != NULL ||
   17890             :                rtsp->exception_specification != NULL))) {
   17891             :     /* Some code will have to be inserted on return, either for
   17892             :        cleanup or to pop the exception handling stack entry.  It has
   17893             :        to be inserted after the evaluation of the return expression,
   17894             :        if any, and before the return, so change
   17895             :          return expr;
   17896             :        into
   17897             :          {temp = expr; return temp;}
   17898             :                       ^--- to allow insertion of code here.
   17899             :        Don't rewrite constant expressions or the return expression
   17900             :        in a constructor or destructor (it's "return this;").
   17901             :     */
   17902             :     if (return_expr != NULL &&
   17903             :         !is_invariant_expr(return_expr, /*vars_can_change=*/TRUE,
   17904             :                            /*treat_as_potential_prvalue=*/FALSE) &&
   17905             :         routine->special_kind != (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor &&
   17906             :         routine->special_kind != (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   17907             :       /* There is a nonconstant return expression, so use a temporary.
   17908             :          Note that the return type cannot call for a copy constructor,
   17909             :          or the routine would be returning its value via an added
   17910             :          parameter. */
   17911             :       temp_var = make_lowered_temporary(return_expr->type);
   17912             :       /* Change the return statement to return the temporary's value. */
   17913             :       statement->expr = var_rvalue_expr(temp_var);
   17914             :       /* Put the return statement under a block so we can insert in
   17915             :          front of it. */
   17916             :       /* Note that if we executed the similar code above we wouldn't
   17917             :          be executing the code here, because a return can have either
   17918             :          a dynamic init entry or an expression, but not both. */
   17919             :       check_assertion(make_block);
   17920             :       turn_branch_into_block(statement, &insert_location,
   17921             :                              &return_statement);
   17922             :       make_block = FALSE;
   17923             :       /* Insert the "temp = return-expr;" statement. */
   17924             :       assign_statement = insert_var_assignment_statement(
   17925             :                                       temp_var, return_expr, &insert_location);
   17926             :       set_stmt_pos_to_code_pos_for_lowering(assign_statement);
   17927             :     }  /* if */
   17928             :   }  /* if */
   17929             :   if (any_cleanup_on_return) {
   17930             :     /* Generate any cleanup actions required on exit from the routine. */
   17931             :     if (make_block) {
   17932             :       /* Turn the return into a block so that code can be inserted
   17933             :          in front of the return. */
   17934             :       turn_branch_into_block(statement, &insert_location, &return_statement);
   17935             :     }  /* if */
   17936             :     gen_cleanup_actions(innermost_function_scope->lifetime, &insert_location);
   17937             :     reset_cleanup_state_at_transfer_of_control(return_statement, statement);
   17938             :   }  /* if */
   17939             :   /* Maintain a list of all returns in the routine so that epilogue code
   17940             :      can be added for destructors and for exception handling. */
   17941             :   add_to_return_memo_list(return_statement);
   17942             : }  /* lower_return_statement */
   17943             : 
   17944             : 
   17945             : static void lower_constexpr_if(a_statement_ptr statement)
   17946             : /*
   17947             : Lower the indicated C++17 "if constexpr" statement.
   17948             : */
   17949             : {
   17950             :   a_constexpr_if_ptr    cip;
   17951             : 
   17952             :   cip = statement->variant.constexpr_if;
   17953             :   lower_statement(cip->then_statement);
   17954             :   lower_statement(cip->else_statement);
   17955             : }  /* lower_constexpr_if */
   17956             : 
   17957             : 
   17958             : static void lower_if_dependent_statements(a_statement_ptr statement)
   17959             : /*
   17960             : Lower the dependent statements of the indicated "if" statement.
   17961             : */
   17962             : {
   17963             :   lower_statement(statement->variant.if_stmt.then_statement);
   17964             :   lower_statement(statement->variant.if_stmt.else_statement);
   17965             : }  /* lower_if_dependent_statements */
   17966             : 
   17967             : 
   17968             : static void make_init_statements_for_entity_list(
   17969             :                                       an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr ielep,
   17970             :                                       an_insert_location          *insert_loc)
   17971             : /*
   17972             : The given list contains declared entities that may contain local variable
   17973             : declarations that have initializers but no associated stmk_init statements.
   17974             : (Currently, this only occurs for C++17 initialization statements in the
   17975             : conditions of selection statements.)  Create (and lower) corresponding
   17976             : stmk_init statements.
   17977             : */
   17978             : {
   17979             :   for (; ielep != NULL; ielep = ielep->next) {
   17980             :     if (ielep->entity.kind == (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_variable) {
   17981             :       a_variable_ptr vp = (a_variable_ptr)(ielep->entity.ptr);
   17982             :       if (vp->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic) {
   17983             :         a_statement_ptr init_stmt
   17984             :                                = alloc_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_init);
   17985             :         init_stmt->variant.dynamic_init = vp->initializer.dynamic;
   17986             :         /* Conservatively set follows_an_exec_statement to TRUE to force
   17987             :            the initialization to take place immediately before the
   17988             :            temporary is used. */
   17989             :         vp->initializer.dynamic->follows_an_exec_statement = TRUE;
   17990             :         insert_statement(init_stmt, insert_loc);
   17991             :         lower_stmk_init(init_stmt, insert_loc);
   17992             :       }  /* if */
   17993             :       if (vp->is_struct_binding_container) {
   17994             :         /* Also process any binding variables, if needed. */
   17995             :         make_init_statements_for_entity_list(vp->variant.bindings,
   17996             :                                              insert_loc);
   17997             :       }  /* if */
   17998             :     }  /* if */
   17999             :   }  /* for */
   18000             : }  /* make_lower_init_statements_for_entity_list */
   18001             : 
   18002             : 
   18003             : static void lower_condition(a_statement_ptr statement)
   18004             : /*
   18005             : statement is a statement that has a controlling condition (i.e., it is an
   18006             : if, while, for, or switch).  Lower the condition expression (whether it
   18007             : is an enk_condition or a normal expression), and lower the dependent
   18008             : statement(s) of the statement.  For a "for" loop, also lower the increment
   18009             : expression, if any (the initialization expression has already been
   18010             : handled).  Lowering of for-each statements is performed elsewhere (as these
   18011             : statements don't contain an enk_condition).
   18012             : */
   18013             : {
   18014             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr = statement->expr;
   18015             :   a_statement_kind statement_kind = statement->kind;
   18016             :   a_boolean        is_switch_stmt =
   18017             :                              (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_switch);
   18018             : 
   18019             :   if (expr == NULL || expr->kind != (an_expr_node_kind)enk_condition) {
   18020             :     /* Normal expression.  Lower the expression and the dependent
   18021             :        statement(s). */
   18022             :     if (!is_switch_stmt) {
   18023             :       /* If, while, and for statements. */
   18024             :       /* "for" allows a null expression. */
   18025             :       if (expr != NULL) {
   18026             :         lower_boolean_controlling_expr(expr, /*is_full_expr=*/TRUE);
   18027             :       }  /* if */
   18028             :       /* Lower the dependent statement(s). */
   18029             :       if (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_if) {
   18030             :         lower_if_dependent_statements(statement);
   18031             :       } else if (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_constexpr_if) {
   18032             :         lower_constexpr_if(statement);
   18033             :       } else if (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_while) {
   18034             :         lower_statement(statement->variant.loop_statement);
   18035             :       } else {
   18036             :         a_for_loop_ptr loop_info;
   18037             :         check_assertion(statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for);
   18038             :         lower_statement(statement->variant.for_loop.statement);
   18039             :         loop_info = statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info;
   18040             :         if (loop_info->increment != NULL) {
   18041             :           lower_full_expr(loop_info->increment, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18042             :         }  /* if */
   18043             :       }  /* if */
   18044             :     } else {
   18045             :       /* Switch statement. */
   18046             :       check_assertion(expr != NULL);
   18047             :       lower_full_expr(expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18048             :       lower_statement(statement->variant.switch_stmt.body_statement);
   18049             :     }  /* if */
   18050             :   } else {
   18051             :     /* An initialization statement and/or condition declaration.  Non-loop
   18052             :        cases like
   18053             : 
   18054             :          if (A x = y) { ... }
   18055             :        are transformed into
   18056             :          {
   18057             :            A x = y;
   18058             :            if (x) { ... }
   18059             :          }
   18060             :        Similarly for the initialization statement case.
   18061             : 
   18062             :        The test in the "if" actually uses the expression from the "expr"
   18063             :        field of the condition, which is the value of the declared variable
   18064             :        converted to a testable type if necessary.  Loop cases like
   18065             :          for (w; A x = y; z) { ... }    or  while (A x = y) { ... }
   18066             :        are transformed into
   18067             :          {                                  {
   18068             :            for (w;;) {                        while (1) {
   18069             :              A x = y;                           A x = y;
   18070             :              if (!x) {                          if (!x) {
   18071             :                destroy x if necessary;            destroy x if necessary;
   18072             :                goto break_label;                  goto break_label;
   18073             :              }                                  }
   18074             :              { ... } // Original statement      { ... } // Original statement
   18075             :              z;      // Increment code
   18076             :              destroy x if necessary;            destroy x if necessary;
   18077             :            }                                  }
   18078             :            break_label:;                      break_label:;
   18079             :          }                                  }
   18080             :        Again, the x in "!x" is the value of the declared variable converted
   18081             :        to a testable type if necessary.  If the break_label exists already,
   18082             :        it and the block around the for/while are not added. */
   18083             :     a_condition_supplement_ptr
   18084             :                        csp = expr->variant.condition;
   18085             :     a_scope_ptr        scope;
   18086             :     an_expr_node_ptr   value_expr;
   18087             :     an_insert_location insert_location;
   18088             :     an_insert_location break_label_insert_location;
   18089             :     a_statement_ptr    block_stmt, dep_statement;
   18090             :     a_context          context;
   18091             :     an_init_pos_descr  ipd;
   18092             :     a_label_ptr        break_label = NULL;
   18093             :     a_boolean          created_break_label = FALSE;
   18094             :     a_boolean          is_loop_stmt = 
   18095             :                              (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_while ||
   18096             :                               statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for);
   18097             : 
   18098             :     /* Create a new block statement that will be associated with the
   18099             :        scope for the condition.  For loops, also create the break label. */
   18100             :     if (!is_loop_stmt) {
   18101             :       /* For the non-loop statements, the new block statement is made to
   18102             :          surround the condition statement. */
   18103             :       block_stmt = statement;
   18104             :       turn_statement_into_block(statement, &insert_location, &statement);
   18105             :     } else {
   18106             :       /* For the loop statements, the new block statement is made to
   18107             :          surround the dependent statement of the loop. */
   18108             :       if (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for) {
   18109             :         dep_statement = statement->variant.for_loop.statement;
   18110             :       } else {
   18111             :         check_assertion(statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_while);
   18112             :         dep_statement = statement->variant.loop_statement;
   18113             :       }  /* if */
   18114             :       block_stmt = dep_statement;
   18115             :       turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma(dep_statement,
   18116             :                                                     &insert_location,
   18117             :                                                     &dep_statement,
   18118             :                                                     csp->scope);
   18119             :       /* Create a break label for the loop.  If the loop has a break statement
   18120             :          already, use it instead of creating a new one. */
   18121             :       { a_statement_ptr next_statement = statement->next;
   18122             :         if (next_statement != NULL &&
   18123             :             next_statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_label &&
   18124             :             next_statement->variant.label.ptr->break_label) {
   18125             :           /* There is already a break label. */
   18126             :           break_label = next_statement->variant.label.ptr;
   18127             :         } else {
   18128             :           /* Create a break label.  This involves wrapping the loop statement
   18129             :              inside a block statement and putting the label inside the block,
   18130             :              following the loop.  Note that this must be done before the
   18131             :              context for the condition is pushed, since the surrounding
   18132             :              object lifetime must be recorded in the label. */
   18133             :           /* Note also that if exceptions are enabled, code to set the
   18134             :              cleanup state will be inserted following the label.  That's
   18135             :              done later in this routine. */
   18136             :           created_break_label = TRUE;
   18137             :           turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma(
   18138             :                                                   statement,
   18139             :                                                   &break_label_insert_location,
   18140             :                                                   &statement,
   18141             :                                                   curr_context->scope);
   18142             :           set_insert_location(statement, &break_label_insert_location);
   18143             :           break_label = insert_temp_label(&break_label_insert_location);
   18144             :           break_label->break_label = TRUE;
   18145             :         }  /* if */
   18146             :       }
   18147             :       /* Here, break_label points to the break label, found or created. */
   18148             :     }  /* if */
   18149             :     /* Here, statement points to the statement containing the condition,
   18150             :        block_stmt points to the block added, and insert_location is set
   18151             :        to insert at the beginning of that block. */
   18152             :     /* Attach the condition scope and the block statement to one another. */
   18153             :     scope = csp->scope;
   18154             :     block_stmt->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = scope;
   18155             :     /* Change the condition scope into a normal block scope. */
   18156             :     set_scope_kind(scope, (a_scope_kind)sck_block, (a_routine_ptr)NULL);
   18157             :     scope->assoc_block = block_stmt;
   18158             :     /* Activate the scope and object lifetime for the condition. */
   18159             :     push_context(&context, scope, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18160             :     if (scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18161             :       begin_object_lifetime(scope->lifetime, &insert_location);
   18162             :     }  /* if */
   18163             :     check_assertion(pending_stmk_init_statements == NULL);
   18164             :     if (csp->initialization != NULL) {
   18165             :       /* The condition has a C++17 initialization statement.  The statement
   18166             :          is either a declaration statement or an expression statement and
   18167             :          is basically "freestanding" (i.e., it's not on a list of statements
   18168             :          in a block somewhere). */
   18169             :       lower_statement(csp->initialization);
   18170             :       if (csp->initialization->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_decl) {
   18171             :         /* Dynamic initialization of variables is indicated by an stmk_init
   18172             :            statement, but there are no stmk_init statements in this case.
   18173             :            Loop through all variables in this declaration statement and create
   18174             :            stmk_init statements (at the beginning of the block) for each of the
   18175             :            dynamically initialized variables.  Then lower the statements (to
   18176             :            ensure that lower_dynamic_init is called).  Note that a separate
   18177             :            block is allocated into which the lowered stmk_init statements are
   18178             :            placed -- this ensures that their initialization will be completed
   18179             :            before initialization of a condition declaration (if any). */
   18180             :         an_insert_location  init_block_insert_location;
   18181             :         a_statement_ptr     init_block_stmt;
   18182             :         init_block_stmt = alloc_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_block);
   18183             :         insert_statement(init_block_stmt, &insert_location);
   18184             :         set_block_start_insert_location(init_block_stmt,
   18185             :                                         &init_block_insert_location);
   18186             :         make_init_statements_for_entity_list(
   18187             :                                    csp->initialization->variant.decl.entities,
   18188             :                                    &init_block_insert_location);
   18189             :       } else if (csp->initialization->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr ||
   18190             :                  csp->initialization->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block) {
   18191             :         /* Move this expression statement (or possibly lowered expression
   18192             :            statement) to the beginning of the inserted block. */
   18193             :         insert_statement(csp->initialization, &insert_location);
   18194             :       } else {
   18195             :         unexpected_condition();
   18196             :       }  /* if */
   18197             :     }  /* if */
   18198             :     if (csp->dynamic_init != NULL) {
   18199             :       /* A condition declaration.  Generate code for the initialization, and
   18200             :          insert it at the beginning of the new block. */
   18201             :       set_var_init_pos_descr(csp->dynamic_init->variable, &ipd);
   18202             :       lower_dynamic_init(csp->dynamic_init, &ipd,
   18203             :                          (an_implied_copy_source *)NULL,
   18204             :                          (a_variable_ptr)NULL,
   18205             :                          LDIO_FULL_EXPR,
   18206             :                          /*others_follow_in_aggr=*/FALSE,
   18207             :                          &insert_location, (a_boolean *)NULL,
   18208             :                          (a_constant **)NULL);
   18209             :       if (pending_stmk_init_statements != NULL) {
   18210             :         /* Lowering of the dynamic init may have created some statements to
   18211             :            initialize temporaries (in the case where the value is a simple
   18212             :            constant, e.g., "if (char* const& s = "zzz");"). These statements
   18213             :            need to be inserted within block_stmt (where the temporary is
   18214             :            defined), but before they are used (by code that was inserted by
   18215             :            lower_dynamic_init above). */
   18216             :         insert_pending_stmk_init_statements(block_stmt);
   18217             :       }  /* if */
   18218             :     }  /* if */
   18219             :     /* Lower the value expression. */
   18220             :     value_expr = csp->expr;
   18221             :     if (is_switch_stmt) {
   18222             :       lower_full_expr(value_expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18223             :     } else {
   18224             :       lower_boolean_controlling_expr(value_expr, /*is_full_expr=*/TRUE);
   18225             :     }  /* if */
   18226             :     /* Here, the condition initialization has been lowered and placed at the
   18227             :        beginning of the created block statement.  insert_location gives the
   18228             :        insert position following that code.  The value expression for the
   18229             :        condition has also been lowered, though not inserted anywhere.  It is
   18230             :        pointed to by value_expr. */
   18231             :     if (!is_loop_stmt) {
   18232             :       /* Non-loop cases.  Put the value expression into the original
   18233             :          condition statement in place of the enk_condition node. */
   18234             :       statement->expr = value_expr;
   18235             :       /* Lower the dependent statement(s) of the condition. */
   18236             :       if (is_switch_stmt) {
   18237             :         lower_statement(statement->variant.switch_stmt.body_statement);
   18238             :       } else if (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_if) {
   18239             :         lower_if_dependent_statements(statement);
   18240             :       } else {
   18241             :         check_assertion(statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_constexpr_if);
   18242             :         lower_constexpr_if(statement);
   18243             :       }  /* if */
   18244             :       /* Set the insert location to insert any required destruction code
   18245             :          following the condition statement. */
   18246             :       set_insert_location(statement, &insert_location);
   18247             :     } else {
   18248             :       /* Loop cases. */
   18249             :       /* Insert
   18250             :            if (!value_expr) goto break_label;
   18251             :       */
   18252             :       { a_statement_ptr goto_stmt, if_stmt;
   18253             : 
   18254             :         goto_stmt = alloc_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_goto);
   18255             :         goto_stmt->variant.label.ptr = break_label;
   18256             :         /* The common lifetime for the goto and label is the lifetime of the
   18257             :            label. */
   18258             :         goto_stmt->variant.label.lifetime =
   18259             :                                 break_label->exec_stmt->variant.label.lifetime;
   18260             :         if_stmt = alloc_statement((a_statement_kind)stmk_if);
   18261             :         /* The "if" statement tests the "not" of the value expression. */
   18262             :         if_stmt->expr = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_not,
   18263             :                                          integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int),
   18264             :                                          value_expr);
   18265             :         /* The dependent statement of the "if" is the "goto break_label". */
   18266             :         if_stmt->variant.if_stmt.then_statement = goto_stmt;
   18267             :         /* Insert the "if" statement following the initialization code and
   18268             :            preceding the dependent statement of the loop. */
   18269             :         insert_statement(if_stmt, &insert_location);
   18270             :         /* If the condition variable requires destruction, put destruction
   18271             :            code in preceding the goto. */
   18272             :         gen_goto_cleanup_actions(goto_stmt);
   18273             :       }
   18274             :       /* Lower the dependent statement of the loop. */
   18275             :       lower_statement(dep_statement);
   18276             :       set_insert_location(dep_statement, &insert_location);
   18277             :       /* Adjust the expression of the loop statement. */
   18278             :       if (statement_kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_for) {
   18279             :         a_for_loop_ptr loop_info = statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info;
   18280             :         /* The test expression is not needed. */
   18281             :         statement->expr = NULL;
   18282             :         /* Move the increment expression to a separate statement following
   18283             :            the dependent statement. */
   18284             :         if (loop_info->increment != NULL) {
   18285             :           a_statement_ptr incr_stmt =
   18286             :                                     insert_expr_statement(loop_info->increment,
   18287             :                                                           &insert_location);
   18288             :           lower_full_expr(loop_info->increment, incr_stmt);
   18289             :           loop_info->increment = NULL;
   18290             :         }  /* if */
   18291             :       } else {
   18292             :         check_assertion(statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_while);
   18293             :         /* A "while" statement.  The test expression is replaced by "1" to
   18294             :            make an infinite loop until break. */
   18295             :         statement->expr = node_for_integer_constant(1L,
   18296             :                                                     (an_integer_kind)ik_int);
   18297             :       }  /* if */
   18298             :       /* Note that insert_location is set to insert at the end of the loop. */
   18299             :     }  /* if */
   18300             :     /* Here, insert_location is set for insertion at the end of the block
   18301             :        inserted for the condition.  Generate the destruction for the
   18302             :        condition variable if necessary. */
   18303             :     if (scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18304             :       gen_cleanup_actions(scope->lifetime, &insert_location);
   18305             :     }  /* if */
   18306             :     if (created_break_label && exceptions_enabled &&
   18307             :         has_destructions(innermost_function_scope->lifetime)) {
   18308             :       /* If a break label was inserted, insert code to set the cleanup state
   18309             :          after it. */
   18310             :       insert_code_to_indicate_cleanup_state(curr_context->curr_cleanup_state,
   18311             :                                             &break_label_insert_location,
   18312             :                                             /*unreachable=*/FALSE);
   18313             :     }  /* if */
   18314             :     pop_context();
   18315             :   }  /* if */
   18316             : }  /* lower_condition */
   18317             : 
   18318             : 
   18319             : void reinsert_for_loop_initialization(a_statement_ptr    init_stmt,
   18320             :                                       an_insert_location *insert_location)
   18321             : /*
   18322             : init_stmt is the initialization statement from a for-loop.  It has been
   18323             : detached from the for statement.  Reinsert it at *insert_location.
   18324             : The initialization statement has been lowered already, and may be a
   18325             : sequence of statements starting with init_stmt.  Used in both C++ and C.
   18326             : */
   18327             : {
   18328             :   a_statement_ptr stmt, stmt_next;
   18329             : 
   18330             :   /* If the initialization statement is a block, insert its statements.
   18331             :      This is important for VLA declarations. */
   18332             :   stmt = init_stmt;
   18333             :   if (stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_block &&
   18334             :       stmt->next == NULL) {
   18335             :     check_assertion(stmt->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope == NULL);
   18336             :     stmt = stmt->variant.block.statements;
   18337             :   }  /* if */
   18338             :   /* Insert the statements. */
   18339             :   for (; stmt != NULL; stmt = stmt_next) {
   18340             :     stmt_next = stmt->next;
   18341             :     stmt->next = NULL;
   18342             :     if (!is_noop_statement(stmt)) {
   18343             :       insert_statement(stmt, insert_location);
   18344             :     }  /* if */
   18345             :   }  /* for */
