   18346             : }  /* reinsert_for_loop_initialization */
   18347             : 
   18348             : 
   18349             : static void lower_for_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   18350             : /*
   18351             : Do IL lowering of the indicated "for" statement and everything under it.
   18352             : */
   18353             : {
   18354             :   a_for_loop_ptr     flp = statement->variant.for_loop.extra_info;
   18355             :   a_statement_ptr    for_stmt = statement;
   18356             :   a_statement_ptr    init_stmt = flp->initialization;
   18357             :   a_statement_ptr    block_stmt = NULL;
   18358             :   a_scope_ptr        for_init_scope = flp->for_init_scope;
   18359             :   a_context          context;
   18360             :   an_insert_location insert_location;
   18361             : 
   18362             :   if (for_init_scope != NULL) {
   18363             :     /* With the "new" version of the for-loop, the scope of the for-init
   18364             :        variable is its own block scope. */
   18365             :     push_context(&context, for_init_scope, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18366             :     /* Put a block statement around the for-loop and attach the scope
   18367             :        to that block. */
   18368             :     block_stmt = for_stmt;
   18369             :     turn_statement_into_block(for_stmt, &insert_location, &for_stmt);
   18370             :     block_stmt->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = for_init_scope;
   18371             :     flp->for_init_scope = NULL;
   18372             :     for_init_scope->assoc_block = block_stmt;
   18373             :     if (for_init_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18374             :       begin_object_lifetime(for_init_scope->lifetime, &insert_location);
   18375             :     }  /* if */
   18376             :   }  /* if */
   18377             :   if (init_stmt != NULL) {
   18378             :     /* There is an initialization statement. */
   18379             :     check_assertion(init_stmt->next == NULL);
   18380             :     lower_statement(init_stmt);
   18381             :     if (init_stmt->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_expr &&
   18382             :         init_stmt->next == NULL) {
   18383             :       /* The simple C-like case: the initialization is an expression.
   18384             :          Leave it attached to the for loop. */
   18385             :     } else {
   18386             :       /* The C++ case: move the initialization code out into the
   18387             :          block we created above.  Note that this is particularly
   18388             :          desirable when there is a VLA declaration in the initialization. */
   18389             :       flp->initialization = NULL;
   18390             :       /* Put a block around the for loop if we didn't previously. */
   18391             :       if (block_stmt == NULL) {
   18392             :         block_stmt = for_stmt;
   18393             :         turn_statement_into_block(for_stmt, &insert_location, &for_stmt);
   18394             :       }  /* if */
   18395             :       reinsert_for_loop_initialization(init_stmt, &insert_location);
   18396             :     }  /* if */
   18397             :   }  /* if */
   18398             :   lower_condition(for_stmt);
   18399             :   if (for_init_scope != NULL) {
   18400             :     if (for_init_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18401             :       /* Insert any destructions needed after the loop. */
   18402             :       set_insert_location(for_stmt, &insert_location);
   18403             :       gen_cleanup_actions(for_init_scope->lifetime, &insert_location);
   18404             :     }  /* if */
   18405             :     /* Pop the context pushed for the for-init variable scope. */
   18406             :     pop_context();
   18407             :   }  /* if */
   18408             : }  /* lower_for_statement */
   18409             : 
   18410             : 
   18411             : static void lower_variable_with_initializer(
   18412             :                                            a_variable_ptr     var,
   18413             :                                            an_insert_location *insert_location)
   18414             : /*
   18415             : Lower the dynamic initialization initializer associated with variable var.
   18416             : Insert any needed code at *insert_location.  This is used to lower variables in
   18417             : cases where there is no associated stmk_init.
   18418             : */
   18419             : {
   18420             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr  dip = var->initializer.dynamic;
   18421             :   an_init_pos_descr   ipd;
   18422             : 
   18423             :   check_assertion(var->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic &&
   18424             :                   dip != NULL);
   18425             :   set_var_init_pos_descr(var, &ipd);
   18426             :   lower_dynamic_init(dip, &ipd,
   18427             :                      (an_implied_copy_source *)NULL,
   18428             :                      (a_variable_ptr)NULL,
   18429             :                      LDIO_FULL_EXPR,
   18430             :                      /*others_follow_in_aggr=*/FALSE,
   18431             :                      insert_location, (a_boolean *)NULL,
   18432             :                      (a_constant **)NULL);
   18433             :   lower_variable(var);
   18434             : }  /* lower_variable_with_initializer */
   18435             : 
   18436             : 
   18437             : static void lower_range_based_for_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   18438             : /*
   18439             : Do IL lowering of the indicated range-based-for statement and everything under
   18440             : it.  There are several variants of the range-based-for statement (see
   18441             : [stmt.ranged]), but the IL that is generated is the same for all.  For this
   18442             : source:
   18443             : 
   18444             :   for ( for-range-declaration : expression ) statement
   18445             : 
   18446             : the following lowered C code is generated:
   18447             : 
   18448             :   {
   18449             :     auto && __range = (expression);
   18450             :     for ( auto __begin = begin-expr,
   18451             :                __end = end-expr;
   18452             :           __begin != __end;
   18453             :           ++__begin ) {
   18454             :       for-range-declaration = *__begin;
   18455             :       statement
   18456             :     }
   18457             :   }
   18458             : 
   18459             : Notes:
   18460             :   - The blocks listed above don't exist in the un-lowered IL -- they are
   18461             :     created here to match the range_based_for_scope, begin_end_scope, and
   18462             :     iterator_scope in the range-based-for IL.  Note that the begin_end_scope
   18463             :     block is implied above (it includes the for-init portion of the for loop).
   18464             : */
   18465             : {
   18466             :   a_range_based_for_loop_ptr rbflp =
   18467             :                             statement->variant.range_based_for_loop.extra_info;
   18468             :   a_statement_ptr    range_based_for_stmt = statement;
   18469             :   a_statement_ptr    outer_block, middle_block, inner_block;
   18470             :   a_statement_ptr    sub_statement =
   18471             :                              statement->variant.range_based_for_loop.statement;
   18472             :   a_scope_ptr        range_based_for_scope = rbflp->range_based_for_scope;
   18473             :   a_scope_ptr        begin_end_scope = rbflp->begin_end_scope;
   18474             :   a_scope_ptr        iterator_scope = rbflp->iterator_scope;
   18475             :   a_context          range_based_for_context, begin_end_context,
   18476             :                      iterator_context;
   18477             :   an_insert_location outer_insert_location, middle_insert_location,
   18478             :                      inner_insert_location;
   18479             :   an_expr_node_ptr   ne_call_expr, incr_call_expr;
   18480             :   a_for_loop_ptr     flip;
   18481             : 
   18482             :   check_assertion(statement->expr == NULL &&
   18483             :                   pending_stmk_init_statements == NULL);
   18484             :   /* Push the outermost scope (which contains the range variable and its
   18485             :      initialization). */
   18486             :   push_context(&range_based_for_context, range_based_for_scope,
   18487             :                (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18488             :   /* Put a block statement around the range-based-for and attach the
   18489             :      range_based_for scope to that block.  Note that any pragmas attached to
   18490             :      the range-based-for statement will now be associated with the block. */
   18491             :   outer_block = range_based_for_stmt;
   18492             :   turn_statement_into_block(range_based_for_stmt, &outer_insert_location,
   18493             :                             &range_based_for_stmt);
   18494             :   outer_block->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = range_based_for_scope;
   18495             :   range_based_for_scope->assoc_block = outer_block;
   18496             :   if (range_based_for_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18497             :     begin_object_lifetime(range_based_for_scope->lifetime,
   18498             :                           &outer_insert_location);
   18499             :   }  /* if */
   18500             :   /* The variables in the range-based-for IL don't have stmk-init statements
   18501             :      associated with them, so they must be explicitly lowered here. */
   18502             :   /* Lower variables in the outermost scope. */
   18503             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(rbflp->range, &outer_insert_location);
   18504             :   /* If lowering of expressions in the outer scope created any stmk_init
   18505             :      statements, make sure they are inserted in the proper block. */
   18506             :   insert_pending_stmk_init_statements(outer_block);
   18507             :   /* Push a context for the "begin" and "end" variables. */
   18508             :   push_context(&begin_end_context, rbflp->begin_end_scope,
   18509             :                (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18510             :   /* Put another block statement around the range-based-for and attach the
   18511             :      begin_end_scope to that block.  There are no pragmas in this case
   18512             :      (they are now associated with the outer block if there were any). */
   18513             :   middle_block = range_based_for_stmt;
   18514             :   turn_statement_into_block(range_based_for_stmt, &middle_insert_location,
   18515             :                             &range_based_for_stmt);
   18516             :   middle_block->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = begin_end_scope;
   18517             :   begin_end_scope->assoc_block = middle_block;
   18518             :   if (begin_end_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18519             :     begin_object_lifetime(begin_end_scope->lifetime, &middle_insert_location);
   18520             :   }  /* if */
   18521             :   /* Lower variables in the middle scope. */
   18522             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(rbflp->begin, &middle_insert_location);
   18523             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(rbflp->end, &middle_insert_location);
   18524             :   /* Lower the expressions used in this pattern. */
   18525             :   ne_call_expr = rbflp->ne_call_expr;
   18526             :   incr_call_expr = rbflp->incr_call_expr;
   18527             :   check_assertion(ne_call_expr != NULL && incr_call_expr != NULL);
   18528             :   lower_boolean_controlling_expr(ne_call_expr, /*is_full_expr=*/TRUE);
   18529             :   lower_full_expr(incr_call_expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18530             :   /* If lowering of expressions in the middle scope created any stmk_init
   18531             :      statements, make sure they are inserted in the proper block. */
   18532             :   insert_pending_stmk_init_statements(middle_block);
   18533             :   /* Now push the iterator scope (which contains the iterator and the
   18534             :      dependent statement). */
   18535             :   push_context(&iterator_context, iterator_scope,
   18536             :                (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18537             :   /* Turn the dependent statement into a block; any pragmas associated with
   18538             :      the dependent statement stay with the dependent statement. */
   18539             :   inner_block = sub_statement;
   18540             :   turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma(sub_statement,
   18541             :                                                 &inner_insert_location,
   18542             :                                                 &sub_statement,
   18543             :                                                 curr_context->scope);
   18544             :   inner_block->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = iterator_scope;
   18545             :   iterator_scope->assoc_block = inner_block;
   18546             :   if (iterator_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18547             :     begin_object_lifetime(iterator_scope->lifetime, &inner_insert_location);
   18548             :   }  /* if */
   18549             :   /* The iterator variable has an initializer which needs lowering. */
   18550             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(rbflp->iterator, &inner_insert_location);
   18551             :   /* Lower the dependent statement as well as expressions which will be
   18552             :      used in the lowered "for" statement. */
   18553             :   lower_statement(sub_statement);
   18554             :   if (iterator_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18555             :     /* Insert any needed destructions. */
   18556             :     set_insert_location(sub_statement, &inner_insert_location);
   18557             :     gen_cleanup_actions(iterator_scope->lifetime, &inner_insert_location);
   18558             :   }  /* if */
   18559             :   /* Pop the iterator scope context. */
   18560             :   pop_context();
   18561             :   /* Turn the original range-based-for statement into a for statement (make
   18562             :      sure there's no further reference to the range_based_for_loop variant
   18563             :      beyond this point). */
   18564             :   rbflp = NULL;
   18565             :   set_statement_kind(range_based_for_stmt, (a_statement_kind)stmk_for);
   18566             :   flip = range_based_for_stmt->variant.for_loop.extra_info;
   18567             :   flip->increment = incr_call_expr;
   18568             :   range_based_for_stmt->expr = ne_call_expr;
   18569             :   range_based_for_stmt->variant.for_loop.statement = inner_block;
   18570             :   set_expr_result_not_used(incr_call_expr);
   18571             :   /* Perform cleanup for the middle scope. */
   18572             :   if (begin_end_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18573             :     /* Insert any needed destructions for the middle scope after the
   18574             :        lowered range-based-for (now a "for"). */
   18575             :     set_insert_location(range_based_for_stmt, &middle_insert_location);
   18576             :     gen_cleanup_actions(begin_end_scope->lifetime, &middle_insert_location);
   18577             :   }  /* if */
   18578             :   /* Pop the context pushed for the middle scope. */
   18579             :   pop_context();
   18580             :   /* Perform cleanup for the outer scope. */
   18581             :   if (range_based_for_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18582             :     /* Insert any needed destructions after the middle block. */
   18583             :     set_insert_location(middle_block, &outer_insert_location);
   18584             :     gen_cleanup_actions(range_based_for_scope->lifetime,
   18585             :                         &outer_insert_location);
   18586             :   }  /* if */
   18587             :   /* Pop the context pushed for the outer scope. */
   18588             :   pop_context();
   18589             : }  /* lower_range_based_for_statement */
   18590             : 
   18591             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18592             : 
   18593             : static void lower_for_each_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   18594             : /*
   18595             : Do IL lowering of the indicated for-each statement and everything under it.
   18596             : There are several variants of the for-each statement (see ECMA-372 16.2.1);
   18597             : only variants that don't rely on C++/CLI constructs (i.e., ones that iterate
   18598             : over C++ arrays or appropriate STL-like collections) are currently lowered.
   18599             : */
   18600             : {
   18601             :   a_for_each_loop_ptr felp = statement->variant.for_each_loop.extra_info;
   18602             :   a_statement_ptr    for_each_stmt = statement;
   18603             :   a_statement_ptr    outer_block, inner_block;
   18604             :   a_statement_ptr    sub_statement= statement->variant.for_each_loop.statement;
   18605             :   a_scope_ptr        for_each_scope = felp->for_each_scope;
   18606             :   a_scope_ptr        iterator_scope = felp->iterator_scope;
   18607             :   a_context          for_each_context, iterator_context;
   18608             :   an_insert_location outer_insert_location, inner_insert_location;
   18609             :   an_expr_node_ptr   ne_call_expr, incr_call_expr;
   18610             :   a_for_loop_ptr     flip;
   18611             : 
   18612             :   check_assertion(felp->kind == (a_for_each_pattern_kind)sfepk_stl_pattern ||
   18613             :                   felp->kind == (a_for_each_pattern_kind)sfepk_array_pattern);
   18614             :   check_assertion(statement->expr == NULL);
   18615             :   /* For this input:
   18616             : 
   18617             :        for each (T t in c) <statement>
   18618             : 
   18619             :      the front end produces pieces of IL that are meant to be constructed
   18620             :      as one of these two patterns (the C++/CLI-specific for-each patterns
   18621             :      are not lowered yet):
   18622             : 
   18623             :      // STL pattern
   18624             :      { C &cref = c;
   18625             :        I cend = cref.end();
   18626             :        I i = cref.begin();
   18627             :        for (; i != cend; ++i) {
   18628             :          T t = *i;
   18629             :          <statement>
   18630             :        }
   18631             :      }
   18632             : 
   18633             :      // Array pattern
   18634             :      { C &cref = c;
   18635             :        I *cend = &cref[0]+c_num_elements;
   18636             :        I *i = cref;
   18637             :        for (; i != cend; ++i) {
   18638             :          T t = *i;
   18639             :          <statement>
   18640             :        }
   18641             :      }
   18642             : 
   18643             :     From a lowering point of view, these two patterns are identical.
   18644             : 
   18645             :     Notes:
   18646             :       - The blocks listed above don't exist in the un-lowered IL -- they are
   18647             :         created here to match the for_each_scope and iterator_scope in the IL.
   18648             :   */
   18649             :   /* Push the for-each scope (which contains the collection_expr_ref and
   18650             :      temporary variable). */
   18651             :   push_context(&for_each_context, for_each_scope,
   18652             :                (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18653             :   /* Put a block statement around the for-each and attach the for-each scope
   18654             :      to that block.  Note that any pragmas attached to the for-each statement
   18655             :      will now be associated with the block. */
   18656             :   outer_block = for_each_stmt;
   18657             :   turn_statement_into_block(for_each_stmt, &outer_insert_location,
   18658             :                             &for_each_stmt);
   18659             :   outer_block->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = for_each_scope;
   18660             :   for_each_scope->assoc_block = outer_block;
   18661             :   if (for_each_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18662             :     begin_object_lifetime(for_each_scope->lifetime, &outer_insert_location);
   18663             :   }  /* if */
   18664             :   /* The variables in the for-each IL don't have stmk-init statements
   18665             :      associated with them, so they must be explicitly lowered here. */
   18666             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(felp->collection_expr_ref,
   18667             :                                   &outer_insert_location);
   18668             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(felp->variant.stl_array_pattern.end_variable,
   18669             :                                   &outer_insert_location);
   18670             :   lower_variable_with_initializer(felp->temporary_variable,
   18671             :                                   &outer_insert_location);
   18672             :   /* Lower the expressions used in this pattern. */
   18673             :   ne_call_expr = felp->variant.stl_array_pattern.ne_call_expr;
   18674             :   incr_call_expr = felp->variant.stl_array_pattern.incr_call_expr;
   18675             :   check_assertion(ne_call_expr != NULL && incr_call_expr != NULL);
   18676             :   lower_boolean_controlling_expr(ne_call_expr, /*is_full_expr=*/TRUE);
   18677             :   lower_full_expr(incr_call_expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18678             :   /* Now push the iterator scope (which contains the iterator and the
   18679             :      dependent statement). */
   18680             :   push_context(&iterator_context, iterator_scope,
   18681             :                (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   18682             :   /* Turn the dependent statement into a block; any pragmas associated with
   18683             :      the dependent statement stay with the dependent statement. */
   18684             :   inner_block = sub_statement;
   18685             :   turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma(sub_statement,
   18686             :                                                 &inner_insert_location,
   18687             :                                                 &sub_statement,
   18688             :                                                 curr_context->scope);
   18689             :   inner_block->variant.block.extra_info->assoc_scope = iterator_scope;
   18690             :   iterator_scope->assoc_block = inner_block;
   18691             :   if (iterator_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18692             :     begin_object_lifetime(iterator_scope->lifetime, &inner_insert_location);
   18693             :   }  /* if */
   18694             :   if (felp->uses_prev_decl_iterator) {
   18695             :     /* The iterator for this for-each has been declared in some outside
   18696             :        scope.  In this case there's no initializer associated with the
   18697             :        iterator variable/field (at least not one that's associated with the
   18698             :        iterator's use in the for-each statement).  Insert a statement that
   18699             :        does the assignment to the variable/field. */
   18700             :     lower_full_expr(felp->iterator.prev_decl.assign_expr,
   18701             :                     (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18702             :     (void)insert_expr_statement(felp->iterator.prev_decl.assign_expr,
   18703             :                                 &inner_insert_location);
   18704             :   } else {
   18705             :     /* The iterator variable has an initializer. */
   18706             :     lower_variable_with_initializer(felp->iterator.variable,
   18707             :                                     &inner_insert_location);
   18708             :   }  /* if */
   18709             :   /* Lower the dependent statement as well as expressions which will be
   18710             :      used in the lowered "for" statement. */
   18711             :   lower_statement(sub_statement);
   18712             :   if (iterator_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18713             :     /* Insert any needed destructions. */
   18714             :     set_insert_location(sub_statement, &inner_insert_location);
   18715             :     gen_cleanup_actions(iterator_scope->lifetime, &inner_insert_location);
   18716             :   }  /* if */
   18717             :   /* Pop the iterator scope context. */
   18718             :   pop_context();
   18719             :   /* Turn the original for-each statement into a for statement (make sure
   18720             :      there's no further reference to the for_each_loop variant beyond
   18721             :      this point). */
   18722             :   felp = NULL;
   18723             :   set_statement_kind(for_each_stmt, (a_statement_kind)stmk_for);
   18724             :   flip = for_each_stmt->variant.for_loop.extra_info;
   18725             :   flip->increment = incr_call_expr;
   18726             :   for_each_stmt->expr = ne_call_expr;
   18727             :   for_each_stmt->variant.for_loop.statement = inner_block;
   18728             :   set_expr_result_not_used(incr_call_expr);
   18729             :   if (for_each_scope->lifetime != NULL) {
   18730             :     /* Insert any needed destructions. */
   18731             :     set_insert_location(for_each_stmt, &outer_insert_location);
   18732             :     gen_cleanup_actions(for_each_scope->lifetime, &outer_insert_location);
   18733             :   }  /* if */
   18734             :   /* Pop the context pushed for the for-each variable scope. */
   18735             :   pop_context();
   18736             : }  /* lower_for_each_statement */
   18737             : 
   18738             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   18739             : 
   18740             : #if !GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18741             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- statement is not used in that case. */
   18742             : #endif /* !GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   18743             : void lower_asm_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   18744             : /*
   18745             : Do IL lowering of the indicated stmk_asm statement and everything
   18746             : under it.  Used in both C++ and C mode.
   18747             : */
   18748             : {
   18749             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18750             :   /* GNU asm statements can have expressions under them. */
   18751             :   an_asm_entry_ptr   aep = statement->variant.asm_entry;
   18752             :   an_asm_operand_ptr aop;
   18753             :   for (aop = aep->operands; aop != NULL; aop = aop->next) {
   18754             :     an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy, expr = aop->expression;
   18755             :     if (is_operation_node(expr) &&
   18756             :         expr->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue) {
   18757             :       /* These kinds of top-level expressions don't produce lvalues in C,
   18758             :          but g++ accepts them.  The front end now accepts them and lowering
   18759             :          needs to re-write them as appropriate.  A single case is handled now,
   18760             :          other cases could be handled if necessary. */
   18761             :       if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_assign)) {
   18762             :         /* Re-write "b = a" as "*((b = a), tmp = &b)". */
   18763             :         a_variable_ptr tmp = make_lowered_temporary(
   18764             :                                                 make_pointer_type(expr->type));
   18765             :         expr_copy = copy_expr_tree(expr->variant.operation.operands,
   18766             :                                    CE_NO_OPTIONS);
   18767             :         expr = make_comma_node(expr,
   18768             :                                make_var_assignment_expr(tmp,
   18769             :                                                         add_address_of_to_node(
   18770             :                                                                   expr_copy)));
   18771             :         expr = add_indirection_to_node(expr);
   18772             :         aop->expression = expr;
   18773             :       } else {
   18774             :         /* Not currently handled; give an error. */
   18775             :         pos_error(ec_compound_lvalue_as_asm_operand, &expr->position);
   18776             :         continue;
   18777             :       }  /* if */
   18778             :     }  /* if */
   18779             :     lower_full_expr(expr, statement);
   18780             :   }  /* for */
   18781             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   18782             : }  /* lower_asm_statement */
   18783             : 
   18784             : 
   18785             : void lower_statement(a_statement_ptr statement)
   18786             : /*
   18787             : Do IL lowering of the indicated statement and everything under it.
   18788             : */
   18789             : {
   18790             :   an_insert_location insert_location;
   18791             :   an_expr_node_ptr   stmt_expr;
   18792             :   a_source_position  saved_error_position, saved_code_pos;
   18793             : #if DEBUG
   18794             :   unsigned long      checksum = 0;
   18795             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   18796             : 
   18797             :   if (statement != NULL) {
   18798             :     a_statement_ptr saved_pending_stmk_init_statements =
   18799             :                                                   pending_stmk_init_statements;
   18800             :     pending_stmk_init_statements = NULL;
   18801             : #if DEBUG
   18802             :     if (db_flag_is_set("lower_statement")) {
   18803             :       checksum = compute_checksum_for_statement(statement);
   18804             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Statement before lowering: ");
   18805             :       db_statement(statement);
   18806             :     }  /* if */
   18807             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   18808             :     /* Track the source position. */
   18809             :     saved_code_pos = code_pos_for_lowering;
   18810             :     code_pos_for_lowering = statement->position;
   18811             :     saved_error_position = error_position;
   18812             :     error_position = code_pos_for_lowering;
   18813             :     stmt_expr = statement->expr;
   18814             :     switch (statement->kind) {
   18815             :       case stmk_empty:
   18816             :         /* No processing required. */
   18817             :         break;
   18818             : #if ASM_FUNCTION_ALLOWED
   18819             :       case stmk_asm_func_body:
   18820             :         /* No processing required. */
   18821             :         break;
   18822             : #endif /* ASM_FUNCTION_ALLOWED */
   18823             :       case stmk_asm:
   18824             :         lower_asm_statement(statement);
   18825             :         break;
   18826             :       case stmk_expr:
   18827             :         lower_full_expr(stmt_expr, statement);
   18828             :         break;
   18829             :       case stmk_goto:
   18830             :         /* Generate any cleanup actions required on exit from any blocks
   18831             :            that the goto is inside of but the label is not. */
   18832             :         gen_goto_cleanup_actions(statement);
   18833             :         break;
   18834             :       case stmk_label:
   18835             :         set_curr_cleanup_state_to_latest_initialization();
   18836             :         if (exceptions_enabled &&
   18837             :             has_destructions(innermost_function_scope->lifetime)) {
   18838             :           /* Exceptions are enabled and the current function has
   18839             :              destructible objects.  Insert code to set the cleanup state. */
   18840             :           set_insert_location(statement, &insert_location);
   18841             :           insert_code_to_indicate_cleanup_state(
   18842             :                                               curr_context->curr_cleanup_state,
   18843             :                                               &insert_location,
   18844             :                                               /*unreachable=*/FALSE);
   18845             :         }  /* if */
   18846             :         break;
   18847             :       case stmk_return:
   18848             :         lower_return_statement(statement);
   18849             :         break;
   18850             :       case stmk_if:
   18851             :       case stmk_while:
   18852             :       case stmk_constexpr_if:
   18853             :         lower_condition(statement);
   18854             :         break;
   18855             :       case stmk_end_test_while:
   18856             :         /* Note that this is *not* a condition. */
   18857             :         lower_boolean_controlling_expr(stmt_expr, /*is_full_expr=*/TRUE);
   18858             :         lower_statement(statement->variant.loop_statement);
   18859             :         break;
   18860             :       case stmk_for:
   18861             :         lower_for_statement(statement);
   18862             :         break;
   18863             :       case stmk_range_based_for:
   18864             :         lower_range_based_for_statement(statement);
   18865             :         break;
   18866             :       case stmk_block:
   18867             :         lower_block_statement(statement,
   18868             :                               /*is_block_of_function_try=*/FALSE,
   18869             :                               /*is_block_of_stmt_expr=*/FALSE,
   18870             :                               (a_destructor_wrapper_info_block_ptr)NULL,
   18871             :                               (a_statement_ptr *)NULL);
   18872             :         break;
   18873             :       case stmk_switch_case:
   18874             :         lower_switch_case(statement->variant.switch_case.extra_info);
   18875             :         set_curr_cleanup_state_to_latest_initialization();
   18876             :         break;
   18877             :       case stmk_switch:
   18878             :         lower_condition(statement);
   18879             :         break;
   18880             :       case stmk_init:
   18881             :         lower_stmk_init(statement, (an_insert_location*)NULL);
   18882             :         break;
   18883             :       case stmk_try_block:
   18884             :         lower_try_block(statement, /*is_function_try_block=*/FALSE,
   18885             :                         (a_destructor_wrapper_info_block_ptr)NULL);
   18886             :         break;
   18887             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18888             :       case stmk_microsoft_try:
   18889             :         lower_statement(statement->variant.microsoft_try->guarded_statement);
   18890             :         if (statement->variant.microsoft_try->except_expr != NULL) {
   18891             :           lower_full_expr(statement->variant.microsoft_try->except_expr,
   18892             :                           (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18893             :         }  /* if */
   18894             :         lower_statement(statement->variant.microsoft_try->cleanup_statement);
   18895             :         break;
   18896             :       case stmk_for_each:
   18897             :         lower_for_each_statement(statement);
   18898             :         break;
   18899             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   18900             :       case stmk_decl:
   18901             :         /* Statement that marks the location of declarations.  Ignored here. */
   18902             :         break;
   18903             :       case stmk_set_vla_size:
   18904             :         /* A statement that marks the point at which a VLA bound should be
   18905             :            computed. */
   18906             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   18907             :         /* Replace this statement by one that computes various variables
   18908             :            describing the size of the VLA. */
   18909             :         lower_set_vla_size(statement);
   18910             : #else /* !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   18911             :         /* Record the associated VLA dimension in a temporary variable. */
   18912             :         create_dimension_variable(statement);
   18913             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   18914             :         break;
   18915             :       case stmk_vla_decl:
   18916             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   18917             :         /* A variably modified typedef or variable.  If it is a VLA variable,
   18918             :            we must allocate memory for it. */
   18919             :         lower_vla_decl(statement);
   18920             : #else /* !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   18921             :         /* The stmk_vla_decl statement must remain in the IL, but an element
   18922             :            count variable is expected by other aspect of C++ lowering.  The
   18923             :            call to create_element_count_variable_for_vla may cause the
   18924             :            insertion of a new statement into which *statement will be copied
   18925             :            (and *statement itself is then replaced by the initialization of
   18926             :            that the count variable). */
   18927             :         create_element_count_variable_for_vla(statement);
   18928             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   18929             :         break;
   18930             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18931             :       case stmk_assigned_goto:
   18932             :         /* Lower the expression for the assigned goto; pass a NULL statement
   18933             :            pointer to prevent inlining from replacing this statement (though
   18934             :            there should never be a top-level call operation). */
   18935             :         lower_full_expr(stmt_expr, (a_statement_ptr)NULL);
   18936             :         break;
   18937             :       case stmk_stmt_expr_result:
   18938             :         /* This statement is the last in a GNU statement expression, and it
   18939             :            returns a value. */
   18940             :         if (stmt_expr != NULL) {
   18941             :           /* Lower the expression. */
   18942             :           check_assertion(statement->variant.stmt_expr_result.dynamic_init ==
   18943             :                                                                          NULL);
   18944             :           lower_full_expr(stmt_expr, statement);
   18945             :         } else {
   18946             :           /* Lower the dynamic initialization.  Determine the target of
   18947             :              the initialization from information previously saved. */
   18948             :           an_init_pos_descr  ipd, *eff_ipdp;
   18949             :           an_insert_location insert_location1;
   18950             :           an_expr_node_ptr   expr = NULL;
   18951             :           a_boolean          keep_dynamic_init;
   18952             :           a_dynamic_init_ptr dip =
   18953             :                               statement->variant.stmt_expr_result.dynamic_init;
   18954             :           check_assertion(dip != NULL &&
   18955             :                           dip->variable == NULL &&
   18956             :                           !dip->static_temp);
   18957             :           /* Lowering of the dynamic initialization requires a "statement"
   18958             :              insertion point; turn the statement into a block to get an
   18959             :              appropriate insertion point.  Note that this block will later be
   18960             :              turned into a statement expression itself so it can return
   18961             :              a value (assuming a value is still returned after lowering). */
   18962             :           turn_statement_into_block_transferring_pragma(statement,
   18963             :                                                         &insert_location1,
   18964             :                                                         &statement,
   18965             :                                                         curr_context->scope);
   18966             :           if (gse_return_value_pointer_variable == NULL) {
   18967             :             /* A case where there's no variable being initialized, e.g.,
   18968             :                  new S(({ S(); }));
   18969             :                In this case, an initialization position description has been
   18970             :                saved that represents the entity being initialized. */
   18971             :             check_assertion(gse_init_position != NULL);
   18972             :             eff_ipdp = gse_init_position;
   18973             :             /* No need to keep this statement (the lowered initialization will
   18974             :                be inserted prior to the statement). */
   18975             :             turn_statement_into_noop(statement);
   18976             :           } else {
   18977             :             /* A variable is being initialized, e.g.,
   18978             :                  A a = ({ A(); });
   18979             :                Create an expression for the variable. */
   18980             :             dip->variable = gse_return_value_pointer_variable;
   18981             :             expr = var_rvalue_expr(dip->variable);
   18982             :             statement->expr = expr;
   18983             :             statement->variant.stmt_expr_result.dynamic_init = NULL;
   18984             :             set_var_init_pos_descr(dip->variable, &ipd);
   18985             :             eff_ipdp = &ipd;
   18986             :           }  /* if */
   18987             :           lower_dynamic_init(dip,
   18988             :                              eff_ipdp,
   18989             :                              (an_implied_copy_source *)NULL,
   18990             :                              (a_variable_ptr)NULL,
   18991             :                              LDIO_NONE,
   18992             :                              /*others_follow_in_aggr=*/FALSE,
   18993             :                              &insert_location1,
   18994             :                              &keep_dynamic_init,
   18995             :                              (a_constant **)NULL);
   18996             :           check_assertion(!keep_dynamic_init);
   18997             :         }  /* if */
   18998             :         break;
   18999             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   19000             :       default:
   19001             :         unexpected_condition_str("lower_statement: bad kind");
   19002             :     }  /* switch */
   19003             :     insert_pending_stmk_init_statements(statement);
   19004             :     pending_stmk_init_statements = saved_pending_stmk_init_statements;
   19005             :     error_position = saved_error_position;
   19006             :     code_pos_for_lowering = saved_code_pos;
   19007             : #if DEBUG
   19008             :     if (db_flag_is_set("lower_statement") &&
   19009             :         (checksum != compute_checksum_for_statement(statement))) {
   19010             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Statement after lowering:  ");
   19011             :       db_statement(statement);
   19012             :     }  /* if */
   19013             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19014             :   }  /* if */
   19015             : }  /* lower_statement */
   19016             : 
   19017             : 
   19018             : static void promote_constants(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19019             : /*
   19020             : Promote the constants on the constants list of the indicated scope
   19021             : (a class or namespace scope) into the file scope.
   19022             : */
   19023             : {
   19024             :   a_constant_ptr constant, next_constant;
   19025             : 
   19026             :   /* Why is promotion into the file scope?  Because there are no constants
   19027             :      on the constants lists of function and block scopes otherwise, so
   19028             :      it seems unwise to put any there in this case.  Besides, the constants
   19029             :      we are promoting here are rare -- they're member constants of classes,
   19030             :      which are an extension (enum constants don't appear on the constant
   19031             :      list).  Note that since we are promoting constants out of a class or
   19032             :      namespace, all the constants will already be allocated in the file
   19033             :      scope memory region (fortunately). */
   19034             :   /* Promote the constants to the end of the file-scope constants list. */
   19035             :   for (constant = scope->constants;
   19036             :        constant != NULL;
   19037             :        constant = next_constant) {
   19038             :     next_constant = constant->next;
   19039             : #if DEBUG
   19040             :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19041             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting constant out of scope ");
   19042             :       db_scope(scope);
   19043             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19044             :       db_name(&constant->source_corresp);
   19045             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19046             :     }  /* if */
   19047             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19048             :     add_to_constants_list(constant, /*at_file_scope=*/TRUE);
   19049             :   }  /* for */
   19050             :   /* Clear the list of promoted constants.  Since the scope is for a class
   19051             :      or namespace, we know it cannot be on the scope stack now, and therefore
   19052             :      we do not need to update a corresponding last pointer. */
   19053             :   scope->constants = NULL;
   19054             : }  /* promote_constants */
   19055             : 
   19056             : 
   19057             : static void promote_variables(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19058             : /*
   19059             : Promote the static variables on the variables list of the indicated scope
   19060             : (a class or namespace scope) into the file scope.
   19061             : */
   19062             : {
   19063             :   a_variable_ptr variable, next_variable;
   19064             : 
   19065             :   /* Why is promotion into the file scope?  Well, we are promoting static
   19066             :      data members here, and local classes cannot have static data members.
   19067             :      (Or namespace member variables, and namespaces cannot be local.)
   19068             :      That means the only cases that come up involve promoting static data
   19069             :      members out of file-scope classes or classes nested within them.
   19070             :      (Or namespaces in the file scope or nested within such namespaces.)
   19071             :      For those, the file scope is the right place to promote to. */
   19072             :   /* Promote the variables to the end of the file-scope variables list. */
   19073             :   for (variable = scope->variables;
   19074             :        variable != NULL;
   19075             :        variable = next_variable) {
   19076             :     next_variable = variable->next;
   19077             : #if DEBUG
   19078             :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19079             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting variable out of scope ");
   19080             :       db_scope(scope);
   19081             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19082             :       db_variable(variable);
   19083             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19084             :     }  /* if */
   19085             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19086             :     add_to_variables_list(variable, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
   19087             : #if IA64_ABI
   19088             :     if (variable->is_template_variable && 
   19089             :         variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified) {
   19090             :       put_variable_into_comdat_group(variable);
   19091             :     }  /* if */
   19092             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   19093             :   }  /* for */
   19094             :   /* Clear the list of promoted variables.  Since the scope is for a class
   19095             :      or namespace, we know it cannot be on the scope stack now, and therefore
   19096             :      we do not need to update a corresponding last pointer. */
   19097             :   scope->variables = NULL;
   19098             : }  /* promote_variables */
   19099             : 
   19100             : 
   19101             : static void promote_routines(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19102             : /*
   19103             : Promote the routines on the routines list of the indicated scope (a class
   19104             : or namespace scope) into the file scope.
   19105             : */
   19106             : {
   19107             :   a_routine_ptr routine, next_routine;
   19108             : 
   19109             :   /* Why is promotion into the file scope?  Because routines are only
   19110             :      allowed in the file scope and in class/namespace scopes. */
   19111             :   for (routine = scope->routines; routine != NULL; routine = next_routine) {
   19112             :     next_routine = routine->next;
   19113             : #if DEBUG
   19114             :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19115             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting routine out of scope ");
   19116             :       db_scope(scope);
   19117             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19118             :       db_name(&routine->source_corresp);
   19119             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19120             :     }  /* if */
   19121             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19122             :     add_to_routines_list(routine, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
   19123             : #if IA64_ABI
   19124             :     /* Alternate entry points of constructors and destructors get
   19125             :        promoted right after the primary routine. */
   19126             :     if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
   19127             :         routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   19128             :       a_routine_list_entry_ptr rlep;
   19129             :       for (rlep = routine->variant.ctor_dtor.alternate_entry_points;
   19130             :            rlep != NULL;
   19131             :            rlep = rlep->next) {
   19132             :         a_routine_ptr arout = rlep->routine;
   19133             : #if DEBUG
   19134             :         if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19135             :           (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting alternate entry out of scope ");
   19136             :           db_scope(scope);
   19137             :           (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19138             :           db_name(&arout->source_corresp);
   19139             :           (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19140             :         }  /* if */
   19141             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19142             :         for (;;) {
   19143             :           a_routine_ptr arout_next = arout->next;
   19144             :           add_to_routines_list(arout, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
   19145             :           /* Also copy any thunks for this alternate entry point. */
   19146             :           arout = arout_next;
   19147             :           if (arout == NULL) break;
   19148             :         }  /* for */
   19149             :       }  /* for */
   19150             :     }  /* if */
   19151             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   19152             :   }  /* for */
   19153             :   /* Clear the list of promoted routines.  Since the scope is for a class
   19154             :      or namespace, we know it cannot be on the scope stack now, and therefore
   19155             :      we do not need to update a corresponding last pointer. */
   19156             :   scope->routines = NULL;
   19157             : }  /* promote_routines */
   19158             : 
   19159             : 
   19160             : static void promote_asm_entries(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19161             : /*
   19162             : Promote the asm entries on the asm_entries list of the indicated scope
   19163             : (a namespace scope) into the file scope.
   19164             : */
   19165             : {
   19166             :   an_asm_entry_ptr asm_entry, next_asm_entry;
   19167             : 
   19168             :   for (asm_entry = scope->asm_entries;
   19169             :        asm_entry != NULL;
   19170             :        asm_entry = next_asm_entry) {
   19171             :     next_asm_entry = asm_entry->next;
   19172             : #if DEBUG
   19173             :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19174             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting asm entry out of scope ");
   19175             :       db_scope(scope);
   19176             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19177             :       db_name(&asm_entry->source_corresp);
   19178             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19179             :     }  /* if */
   19180             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19181             :     add_to_asm_entries_list(asm_entry);
   19182             :   }  /* for */
   19183             :   /* Clear the list of asm entries.  Since the scope is for a namespace,
   19184             :      we know it cannot be on the scope stack now, and therefore we do not
   19185             :      need to update a corresponding last pointer. */
   19186             :   scope->asm_entries = NULL;
   19187             : }  /* promote_asm_entries */
   19188             : 
   19189             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   19190             : 
   19191             : static void move_class_promoted_local_types(a_type_ptr class_type,
   19192             :                                             a_type_ptr *local_types,
   19193             :                                             a_type_ptr *end_local_types)
   19194             : /*
   19195             : If the class class_type has any types on its promoted_local_types list,
   19196             : add them to the end of the list bounded by local_types/end_local_types.
   19197             : The promoted_local_types list contains types promoted out of nested
   19198             : classes and member functions, held off to the side so they can be
   19199             : promoted to the right point in the types list when promotion is
   19200             : done for the parent class.
   19201             : */
   19202             : {
   19203             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr
   19204             :              ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
   19205             :   a_type_ptr first, last;
   19206             : 
   19207             :   first = ctsp->promoted_local_types;
   19208             :   if (first != NULL) {
   19209             :     /* There are types on the promoted_local_types list.  Move them to the
   19210             :        end of the local_types/end_local_types list. */
   19211             :     check_assertion(local_types != NULL);
   19212             :     if (*local_types == NULL) {
   19213             :       *local_types = first;
   19214             :     } else {
   19215             :       (*end_local_types)->next = first;
   19216             :     }  /* if */
   19217             :     last = first;
   19218             :     while (last->next != NULL) last = last->next;
   19219             :     *end_local_types = last;
   19220             :     ctsp->promoted_local_types = NULL;
   19221             :   }  /* if */
   19222             : }  /* move_class_promoted_local_types */
   19223             : 
   19224             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   19225             : 
   19226             : static void promote_type_list(a_type_ptr  type,
   19227             :                               a_scope_ptr promotion_scope,
   19228             :                               a_type_ptr  *insert_pointer,
   19229             :                               a_type_ptr  *local_types,
   19230             :                               a_type_ptr  *end_local_types)
   19231             : /*
   19232             : Promote the types on the indicated types list into the scope promotion_scope
   19233             : (the file scope, a function or block scope, or a namespace scope).
   19234             : *insert_pointer indicates the insertion position, and is updated after
   19235             : the insertion.  Types on the promoted_local_types list of any
   19236             : classes are moved onto the end of the list bounded by local_types/
   19237             : end_local_types for later processing.
   19238             : */
   19239             : {
   19240             :   a_type_ptr next_type;
   19241             : 
   19242             :   /*lint --e{850} type modified in loop (LINTBUG) */
   19243             :   for (; type != NULL; type = next_type) {
   19244             :     next_type = type->next;
   19245             :     /* If the type is a class, promote its members. */
   19246             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
   19247             :         !ignore_type_in_back_end(type)) {
   19248             :       promote_class_members(type, promotion_scope, insert_pointer);
   19249             :     }  /* if */
   19250             : #if DEBUG
   19251             :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19252             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting type out of class: ");
   19253             :       db_type_name(type);
   19254             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n  promotion_scope = ");
   19255             :       db_scope(promotion_scope);
   19256             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "; *insert_pointer = ");
   19257             :       if (*insert_pointer == NULL) {
   19258             :         (void)fprintf(f_debug, "<null>");
   19259             :       } else {
   19260             :         db_type_name(*insert_pointer);
   19261             :       }  /* if */
   19262             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19263             :     }  /* if */
   19264             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19265             :     if (*insert_pointer == NULL) {
   19266             :       type->next = promotion_scope->types;
   19267             :       promotion_scope->types = type;
   19268             :     } else {
   19269             :       type->next = (*insert_pointer)->next;
   19270             :       (*insert_pointer)->next = type;
   19271             :     }  /* if */
   19272             :     *insert_pointer = type;
   19273             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   19274             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(type)) {
   19275             :       /* If some local types of member functions were promoted into the
   19276             :          class on their way to the file scope, add them to the local_types
   19277             :          list for later promotion.  They go out at the end of the scope. 
   19278             :          There will be types on this list for nested classes that are
   19279             :          defined outside of their parent classes, and for template classes
   19280             :          that were first instantiated inside another class. */
   19281             :       move_class_promoted_local_types(type, local_types, end_local_types);
   19282             :     }  /* if */
   19283             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   19284             :   }  /* for */
   19285             : }  /* promote_type_list */
   19286             : 
   19287             : 
   19288             : static void promote_class_scope_types(a_scope_ptr scope,
   19289             :                                       a_scope_ptr promotion_scope,
   19290             :                                       a_type_ptr  *insert_pointer)
   19291             : /*
   19292             : Promote the types on the types list of the indicated class scope into the
   19293             : scope promotion_scope (the file scope, a function or block scope, or a
   19294             : namespace scope).  *insert_pointer indicates the insertion position, and is
   19295             : updated after the insertion.
   19296             : */
   19297             : {
   19298             :   a_type_ptr type_list, local_types, end_local_types;
   19299             : 
   19300             :   check_assertion(scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union);
   19301             :   /* Promote the types to the end of the proper types list.  Also promote
   19302             :      members out of any classes encountered on the types list.  Loop if
   19303             :      necessary to process promoted local types. */
   19304             :   for (type_list = scope->types; type_list != NULL; type_list = local_types) {
   19305             :     local_types = NULL;
   19306             :     end_local_types = NULL;
   19307             :     promote_type_list(type_list, promotion_scope, insert_pointer,
   19308             :                       &local_types, &end_local_types);
   19309             :   }  /* for */
   19310             :   /* Clear the list of promoted types.  Since the scope is for a class,
   19311             :      we know it cannot be on the scope stack now, and therefore we do
   19312             :      not need to update a corresponding last pointer. */
   19313             :   scope->types = NULL;
   19314             : }  /* promote_class_scope_types */
   19315             : 
   19316             : 
   19317             : static void promote_pragmas(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19318             : /*
   19319             : Promote any pragma entries on the pragmas list of the indicated scope into
   19320             : the file scope.
   19321             : */
   19322             : {
   19323             :   a_pragma_ptr pragmas = scope->pragmas, last_fs_pragma;
   19324             : 
   19325             :   if (pragmas != NULL) {
   19326             :     /* Put the pragma list on the end of the file-scope pragma list. */
   19327             :     if (depth_scope_stack >= DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE) {
   19328             :       last_fs_pragma = assoc_pointers_block_of(
   19329             :                                &scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE])->last_pragma;
   19330             :     } else {
   19331             :       last_fs_pragma = il_header.primary_scope->pragmas;
   19332             :       if (last_fs_pragma != NULL) {
   19333             :         for (;
   19334             :              last_fs_pragma->next != NULL;
   19335             :              last_fs_pragma = last_fs_pragma->next) {}
   19336             :       }  /* if */
   19337             :     }  /* if */
   19338             :     if (last_fs_pragma == NULL) {
   19339             :       il_header.primary_scope->pragmas = pragmas;
   19340             :     } else {
   19341             :       last_fs_pragma->next = pragmas;
   19342             :     }  /* if */
   19343             :     if (depth_scope_stack >= DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE) {
   19344             :       /* Find the end of the pragma list and record that as the end of the
   19345             :          file scope pragmas list. */
   19346             :       for (last_fs_pragma = pragmas;
   19347             :            last_fs_pragma->next != NULL;
   19348             :            last_fs_pragma = last_fs_pragma->next) {}
   19349             :       assoc_pointers_block_of(&scope_stack[DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE])->last_pragma =
   19350             :                                                                 last_fs_pragma;
   19351             :     }  /* if */
   19352             :     scope->pragmas = NULL;
   19353             :   }  /* if */
   19354             : }  /* promote_pragmas */
   19355             : 
   19356             : 
   19357             : static void promote_class_members(a_type_ptr  class_type,
   19358             :                                   a_scope_ptr promotion_scope,
   19359             :                                   a_type_ptr  *insert_pointer)
   19360             : /*
   19361             : Promote the members of the class class_type out of the class.  Most
   19362             : members are promoted into the file scope.  Types are promoted into
   19363             : promotion_scope (the file scope, a function or block scope, or a
   19364             : namespace scope), at the position indicated by *insert_pointer, and
   19365             : *insert_pointer is updated.
   19366             : */
   19367             : {
   19368             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp;
   19369             :   a_scope_ptr                 scope;
   19370             : 
   19371             :   ctsp = class_type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
   19372             :   scope = ctsp->assoc_scope;
   19373             :   /* If the class has constants, static data members, member functions,
   19374             :      or local types, promote them out of the class scope. */
   19375             :   if (scope != NULL) {
   19376             : #if DEBUG
   19377             :     if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19378             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting the members out of ");
   19379             :       db_scope(scope);
   19380             :       (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19381             :     }  /* if */
   19382             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19383             :     /* Constants, static data members, and member functions are promoted
   19384             :        to the file scope. */
   19385             :     promote_constants(scope);
   19386             :     promote_variables(scope);
   19387             :     promote_routines(scope);
   19388             :     /* Types are promoted to promotion_scope. */
   19389             :     promote_class_scope_types(scope, promotion_scope, insert_pointer);
   19390             :     promote_pragmas(scope);
   19391             :     /* There are no asm declarations in class scopes. */
   19392             :   }  /* if */
   19393             : }  /* promote_class_members */
   19394             : 
   19395             : 
   19396             : static void set_last_type_pointer_for_scope(a_scope_ptr scope,
   19397             :                                             a_type_ptr  type)
   19398             : /*
   19399             : If a last_type pointer is being maintained for the indicated scope,
   19400             : set it to point to the indicated type.
   19401             : */
   19402             : {
   19403             :   a_scope_pointers_block *pointers_block = get_pointers_block_for_scope(scope);
   19404             : 
   19405             :   if (pointers_block != NULL) pointers_block->last_type = type;
   19406             : }  /* set_last_type_pointer_for_scope */
   19407             : 
   19408             : 
   19409             : static void do_scope_class_member_promotion(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19410             : /*
   19411             : Do promotion of members of classes out of those classes in the indicated
   19412             : scope (the file scope, a function or block scope, or a namespace scope)
   19413             : and all subscopes.
   19414             : */
   19415             : {
   19416             :   a_type_ptr      type, next_type, insert_pointer;
   19417             :   a_type_ptr      local_types, end_local_types;
   19418             :   a_scope_ptr     block_scope;
   19419             :   a_namespace_ptr nsp;
   19420             : 
   19421             : #if DEBUG
   19422             :   if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19423             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "do_scope_class_member_promotion on ");
   19424             :     db_scope(scope);
   19425             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19426             :   }  /* if */
   19427             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19428             :   /* Visit all types to find all classes. */
   19429             :   /* Note that when processing a function or block scope we will be crossing
   19430             :      into the file scope here, but these types are truly local types
   19431             :      and are not used in the file scope, so it's okay to promote their
   19432             :      members now.  In fact, it's necessary -- we have to update the scope
   19433             :      types and variables pointers before they are recorded in the orphan
   19434             :      lists.  Note that in that case the class has not been lowered yet
   19435             :      when the members are promoted out of it, and that's as intended.
   19436             :      The members must be promoted out, but the lowering cannot be done yet
   19437             :      (because if you did the lowering, you wouldn't know where to stop
   19438             :      lowering, because you wouldn't know where the local types shade over
   19439             :      into normal file-scope types). */
   19440             :   /* See if there are any types to process. */
   19441             :   type = scope->types;
   19442             :   if (type != NULL) {
   19443             :     insert_pointer = NULL;
   19444             :     local_types = end_local_types = NULL;
   19445             :     for (; type != NULL; type = next_type) {
   19446             :       next_type = type->next;
   19447             :       /* If the type is a class, promote its members out of the class.
   19448             :          Ignore types such as prototype instantiations. */
   19449             :       if (is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
   19450             :           !ignore_type_in_back_end(type)) {
   19451             :         promote_class_members(type, scope, &insert_pointer);
   19452             :         insert_pointer = type;
   19453             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   19454             :         /* If some local types of member functions were promoted into the
   19455             :            class on their way to the file scope, add them to the local_types
   19456             :            list for later promotion.  They go out at the end of the scope. 
   19457             :            There will only be types on this list for non-nested classes
   19458             :            (because the promoted types go to the outermost enclosing class). */
   19459             :         move_class_promoted_local_types(type, &local_types, &end_local_types);
   19460             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   19461             :       } else {
   19462             :         /* Not a class type: Set the insert location after the type. */
   19463             :         insert_pointer = type;
   19464             :       }  /* if */
   19465             :       /* At the end of the list, process any function-local types that
   19466             :          were encountered in the process.  We want them to follow all other
   19467             :          types. */
   19468             :       if (next_type == NULL && local_types != NULL) {
   19469             :         if (insert_pointer == NULL) {
   19470             :           scope->types = local_types;
   19471             :         } else {
   19472             :           check_assertion(insert_pointer->next == NULL);
   19473             :           insert_pointer->next = local_types;
   19474             :         }  /* if */
   19475             :         next_type = local_types;
   19476             :         local_types = end_local_types = NULL;
   19477             :       }  /* if */
   19478             :     }  /* for */
   19479             :     check_assertion(insert_pointer == NULL ||
   19480             :                     insert_pointer->next == NULL);
   19481             :     set_last_type_pointer_for_scope(scope, insert_pointer);
   19482             :   }  /* if */
   19483             :   /* Visit all namespaces. */
   19484             :   for (nsp = scope->namespaces; nsp != NULL; nsp = nsp->next) {
   19485             :     if (!nsp->is_namespace_alias) {
   19486             :       do_scope_class_member_promotion(nsp->variant.assoc_scope);
   19487             :     }  /* if */
   19488             :   }  /* for */
   19489             :   /* Visit all block scopes. */
   19490             :   for (block_scope = scope->scopes;
   19491             :        block_scope != NULL;
   19492             :        block_scope = block_scope->next) {
   19493             :     do_scope_class_member_promotion(block_scope);
   19494             :   }  /* for */
   19495             : }  /* do_scope_class_member_promotion */
   19496             : 
   19497             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   19498             : 
   19499             : static a_boolean local_entities_should_be_promoted(a_scope_ptr scope)
   19500             : /*
   19501             : Return TRUE if the local entities of the indicated scope or any of its
   19502             : subscopes should be promoted to the file scope because they are referenced
   19503             : by things that will be in the file scope.
   19504             : */
   19505             : {
   19506             :   a_boolean          promotion_needed = FALSE;
   19507             :   a_routine_ptr      rout;
   19508             :   a_variable_ptr     var;
   19509             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip;
   19510             :   a_type_ptr         type;
   19511             :   a_scope_ptr        class_scope, block_scope;
   19512             : 
   19513             :   /* See if anything in this scope would force promotion of its types
   19514             :      or static variables to the file scope. */
   19515             :   if (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function ||
   19516             :       scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_block ||
   19517             :       scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_condition) {
   19518             :     /* Function or block scope. */
   19519             : #if ENSURE_LOWERED_TYPE_LIST_ORDERING
   19520             :     if (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
   19521             :       a_routine_ptr routine = scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   19522             :       a_type_ptr    routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine->type);
   19523             :       a_type_ptr    return_type = skip_typerefs(
   19524             :                                    routine_type->variant.routine.return_type);
   19525             :       if (return_type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function &&
   19526             :           enclosing_routine_for_local_type_or_null(return_type) == routine) {
   19527             :         /* A function is returning a type that is local to the function (which
   19528             :            can happen in nested lambdas).  Once the local type is promoted,
   19529             :            fix_type_list_ordering_problems will ensure that the local type is
   19530             :            placed in the proper order. */
   19531             :         promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19532             :       }  /* if */
   19533             :     }  /* if */
   19534             :     if (!promotion_needed && local_types_as_template_args_enabled) {
   19535             :       /* A local type being used as a template argument creates an ordering
   19536             :          issue for types; in many instances the local type must be defined
   19537             :          prior to being used in the template.  To ensure the proper order,
   19538             :          promote all local types to the file scope list, then call
   19539             :          fix_type_list_ordering_problems during wrapup processing to ensure
   19540             :          that the type list is properly ordered. */
   19541             :       promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19542             :     }  /* if */
   19543             : #endif /* ENSURE_LOWERED_TYPE_LIST_ORDERING */
   19544             :     if (!promotion_needed) {
   19545             :       /* Look for a local static variable with a destructor.  That might force
   19546             :          the variable to be at the file scope, because if the destruction is
   19547             :          complicated, a routine is generated to contain the destruction
   19548             :          code. */
   19549             :       for (var = scope->variables; var != NULL; var = var->next) {
   19550             :         an_init_kind       init_kind;
   19551             :         an_initializer_ptr initializer;
   19552             :         get_variable_initializer(var, scope, &init_kind, &initializer);
   19553             :         if (init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic) {
   19554             :           dip = initializer->dynamic;
   19555             :           if (dip->destructor != NULL ||
   19556             :               (dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_nonconstant_aggregate ||
   19557             :                dip->kind == (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_constructor)) {
   19558             :             /* The initialization has a destructor, or it's an aggregate or a
   19559             :                constructor that might have a ck_dynamic_init with a destructor
