   19560             :                somewhere in it (it's not worth the effort to look). */
   19561             :             promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19562             :             break;
   19563             :           }  /* if */
   19564             :         }  /* if */
   19565             :       }  /* for */
   19566             :     }  /* if */
   19567             :   } else {
   19568             : #if CHECKING
   19569             :     if (scope->kind != (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union) {
   19570             :       internal_error("local_entities_should_be_promoted: bad scope kind");
   19571             :     }  /* if */
   19572             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   19573             :     /* Class scope. */
   19574             :     /* See if the class has defined member functions (just the existence
   19575             :        of member functions is not enough, since all classes have an
   19576             :        assignment operator function).  The member function definition
   19577             :        will have its own memory region, so anything from this function
   19578             :        that it references must be in the file scope. */
   19579             :     for (rout = scope->routines; rout != NULL; rout = rout->next) {
   19580             :       if (rout->function_def_number != NULL_function_def_number) {
   19581             :         promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19582             :         break;
   19583             :       }  /* if */
   19584             :     }  /* for */
   19585             :   }  /* if */
   19586             :   if (!promotion_needed) {
   19587             :     /* If nothing in this scope forces promotion, look at any subscopes.
   19588             :        If something there requires promotion, the local entities of this
   19589             :        scope will also have to be promoted (because the promoted entities
   19590             :        might refer to the types etc. of the surrounding scopes). */
   19591             :     /* Visit all types to find all class types and their scopes. */
   19592             :     for (type = scope->types; type != NULL; type = type->next) {
   19593             :       if (is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
   19594             :           !ignore_type_in_back_end(type)) {
   19595             :         if (class_type_supp(type)->is_lambda_closure_class) {
   19596             :           /* The presence of a lambda inside a function forces promotion of
   19597             :              local entities.  Otherwise a lambda might make reference to a
   19598             :              local type that isn't visible in generated C code. */
   19599             :           promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19600             :           break;
   19601             :         }  /* if */
   19602             :         class_scope = type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->assoc_scope;
   19603             :         if (class_scope != NULL) {
   19604             :           if (local_entities_should_be_promoted(class_scope)) {
   19605             :             promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19606             :             break;
   19607             :           }  /* if */
   19608             :         }  /* if */
   19609             :       }  /* if */
   19610             :     }  /* for */
   19611             : #if CHECKING
   19612             :     /* The only namespace entries that should appear at this level are
   19613             :        namespace aliases. */
   19614             :     { a_namespace_ptr nsp;
   19615             :       for (nsp = scope->namespaces;
   19616             :            nsp != NULL;
   19617             :            nsp = nsp->next) {
   19618             :         check_assertion(nsp->is_namespace_alias);
   19619             :       }  /* for */
   19620             :     }
   19621             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   19622             :     /* Visit all block scopes. */
   19623             :     for (block_scope = scope->scopes;
   19624             :          block_scope != NULL;
   19625             :          block_scope = block_scope->next) {
   19626             :       if (local_entities_should_be_promoted(block_scope)) {
   19627             :         promotion_needed = TRUE;
   19628             :         break;
   19629             :       }  /* if */
   19630             :     }  /* for */
   19631             :   }  /* if */
   19632             :   return promotion_needed;
   19633             : }  /* local_entities_should_be_promoted */
   19634             : 
   19635             : 
   19636             : static void delete_types_from_decl_stmts(a_scope_ptr    scope,
   19637             :                                          unsigned long  n_types)
   19638             : /*
   19639             : Types declared in the indicated scope (sck_function or sck_block) have been
   19640             : promoted out of the enclosing function.  Remove any references to these types
   19641             : from declaration statements (stmk_decl).  n_types is the total number of types
   19642             : that have been promoted (excluding lambda closure classes).  Usually, n_types
   19643             : equals the number D of types to be removed from declaration statements, but
   19644             : n_types can be larger than D if some types have been introduced outside of
   19645             : declaration statements (e.g., in casts).
   19646             : */
   19647             : {
   19648             :   a_statement_ptr  block = scope->assoc_block, *p_stmt;
   19649             : 
   19650             :   if (block == NULL) goto done;
   19651             :   p_stmt = &block->variant.block.statements;
   19652             :   while (*p_stmt != NULL) {
   19653             :     if (n_types == 0) goto done;
   19654             :     if ((*p_stmt)->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_decl) {
   19655             :       an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr  *p_entry =
   19656             :                                             &(*p_stmt)->variant.decl.entities;
   19657             :       /* Traverse the entities list and remove the entries referring to
   19658             :          types. */
   19659             :       while (*p_entry != NULL && n_types > 0) {
   19660             :         if ((*p_entry)->entity.kind == (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_type) {
   19661             :           n_types -= 1;
   19662             :           *p_entry = (*p_entry)->next;
   19663             :         } else {
   19664             :           p_entry = &(*p_entry)->next;
   19665             :         }  /* if */
   19666             :       }  /* while */
   19667             :       if ((*p_stmt)->variant.decl.entities == NULL
   19668             : #if PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING
   19669             :            && (*p_stmt)->source_sequence_entry == NULL
   19670             : #endif /* PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING */
   19671             :                                                       ) {
   19672             :         /* If there are no entities left associated with the statement, remove
   19673             :            the statement altogether. */
   19674             :         *p_stmt = (*p_stmt)->next;
   19675             :       } else {
   19676             :         p_stmt = &(*p_stmt)->next;
   19677             :       }  /* if */
   19678             :     } else {
   19679             :       p_stmt = &(*p_stmt)->next;
   19680             :     }  /* if */
   19681             :   }  /* while */
   19682             : done:;
   19683             : }  /* delete_types_from_decl_stmts */
   19684             : 
   19685             : 
   19686             : static void promote_types_out_of_function(a_scope_ptr   scope,
   19687             :                                           a_routine_ptr routine)
   19688             : /*
   19689             : Promote the types in the indicated scope (a function or block scope that
   19690             : is part of the indicated routine) to the file scope.  When promoting out
   19691             : of a member function, the local types are placed on a list associated
   19692             : with the outermost enclosing class, for later promotion out of the class
   19693             : (and into the file scope) along with the class members.  VLA typedefs (when
   19694             : VLAs aren't lowered) cannot be promoted (they may reference local variables)
   19695             : so they are left in the scope.
   19696             : */
   19697             : {
   19698             :   unsigned long  n_promoted_source_types = 0;
   19699             :   a_type_ptr     type, next_type;
   19700             : #if !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   19701             :   a_type_ptr     last_vla_typedef = NULL, vla_typedefs = NULL;
   19702             : #endif /* !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   19703             : 
   19704             :   /* See if there are types to promote. */
   19705             :   type = scope->types;
   19706             :   if (type != NULL) {
   19707             :     /* Promote local types to file scope.  When promoting out of a member
   19708             :        function, promote the types to the end of the promoted_local_types
   19709             :        list of the class. */
   19710             :     a_type_ptr last_class_type = NULL;
   19711             :     a_type_ptr routine_class = NULL;
   19712             : 
   19713             :     if (routine->source_corresp.is_class_member &&
   19714             :         !routine->defined_outside_of_parent) {
   19715             :       routine_class = parent_class_of(routine);
   19716             :       /* Promoting out of a member function.  Get the promoted_local_types
   19717             :          list. */
   19718             :       /* If the class is a nested class, work out to the outermost
   19719             :          enclosing class.  This is important for ordering reasons, because
   19720             :          we want all these promoted local types to have access to all of
   19721             :          the types in all of the surrounding classes. */
   19722             :       while (routine_class->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
   19723             :         routine_class = parent_class_of(routine_class);
   19724             :       }  /* while */
   19725             :       last_class_type = class_type_supp(routine_class)->promoted_local_types;
   19726             :       if (last_class_type != NULL) {
   19727             :         /* Find the end of the list. */
   19728             :         while (last_class_type->next != NULL) {
   19729             :           last_class_type = last_class_type->next;
   19730             :         }  /* while */
   19731             :       }  /* if */
   19732             :     }  /* if */
   19733             :     for (; type != NULL; type = next_type) {
   19734             :       if (!(is_immediate_class_type(type) &&
   19735             :             (class_type_supp(type)->compiler_generated ||
   19736             :              class_type_supp(type)->is_lambda_closure_class))) {
   19737             :         /* Count the number of local types declared in the source -- this
   19738             :            excludes generated classes (closure classes and classes generated
   19739             :            by lowering).  The count is used later to optimize the removal of
   19740             :            these types from stmk_decl statements. */
   19741             :         n_promoted_source_types += 1;
   19742             :       }  /* if */
   19743             :       next_type = type->next;
   19744             :       if (type_is_typedef(type) &&
   19745             :           type->variant.typeref.has_variably_modified_type) {
   19746             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   19747             :         /* Variably modified types cannot be moved outside their scope.
   19748             :            This type will just disappear. */
   19749             :         clear_local_scope_ref_if_present(&type->source_corresp);
   19750             : #else /* !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   19751             :         /* VLA typedefs may reference local variables and therefore cannot be
   19752             :            promoted. */
   19753             :         if (vla_typedefs == NULL) {
   19754             :           vla_typedefs = type;
   19755             :         } else {
   19756             :           last_vla_typedef->next = type;
   19757             :         }  /* if */
   19758             :         last_vla_typedef = type;
   19759             :         last_vla_typedef->next = NULL;
   19760             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   19761             :         continue;
   19762             :       }  /* if */
   19763             : #if DEBUG
   19764             :       if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19765             :         (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting local type out of routine ");
   19766             :         db_name(&routine->source_corresp);
   19767             :         (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19768             :         db_type_name(type);
   19769             :         (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19770             :       }  /* if */
   19771             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19772             :       /* Mangle the name if necessary (e.g., if it is part of a template
   19773             :          function). */
   19774             :       mangle_promoted_entity_name(&type->source_corresp, iek_type,
   19775             :                                   /*final=*/FALSE, routine, scope);
   19776             :       /* The is_local_to_function flag in the type is not cleared yet.  That
   19777             :          happens at the end of lowering. */
   19778             :       clear_local_scope_ref_if_present(&type->source_corresp);
   19779             :       if (routine_class == NULL) {
   19780             :         /* Not promoting from a member function: just add to the file-scope
   19781             :            types list. */
   19782             :         add_to_types_list(type, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
   19783             :       } else {
   19784             :         /* Promoting from a member function: add to the list associated with
   19785             :            the class. */
   19786             :         if (last_class_type == NULL) {
   19787             :           routine_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->
   19788             :                                                    promoted_local_types = type;
   19789             :         } else {
   19790             :           last_class_type->next = type;
   19791             :         }  /* if */
   19792             :         last_class_type = type;
   19793             :         type->next = NULL;
   19794             :       }  /* if */
   19795             :       /* If the type is an enum, mangle the names of its constants. */
   19796             :       if (is_immediate_enum_type(type)) {
   19797             :         a_constant_ptr enum_con;
   19798             : #if DEBUG
   19799             :         if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19800             :           (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Enum constants promoted too\n");
   19801             :         }  /* if */
   19802             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19803             :         for (enum_con = enum_constants(type);
   19804             :              enum_con != NULL;
   19805             :              enum_con = enum_con->next) {
   19806             :           mangle_promoted_entity_name(&enum_con->source_corresp, iek_constant,
   19807             :                                       /*final=*/TRUE, routine, scope);
   19808             :           enum_con->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = FALSE;
   19809             :         }  /* for */
   19810             :       } else if (is_immediate_class_type(type)) {
   19811             :         /* Mangle member functions of promoted local classes.  In cases where
   19812             :            an inline function is not inlinable, a static definition may
   19813             :            be needed and its name must be mangled. */
   19814             :         a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp = class_type_supp(type);
   19815             :         if (ctsp->assoc_scope != NULL) {
   19816             :           do_scope_other_name_mangling(ctsp->assoc_scope);
   19817             :         }  /* if */
   19818             :       }  /* if */
   19819             :     }  /* for */
   19820             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   19821             :     /* Clear the types list now that all types have been promoted. */
   19822             :     scope->types = NULL;
   19823             : #else /* !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   19824             :     /* Clear the types list of all non-VLA typedefs now that types have
   19825             :        been promoted. */
   19826             :     scope->types = vla_typedefs;
   19827             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   19828             :     set_last_type_pointer_for_scope(scope, (a_type_ptr)NULL);
   19829             :     /* Remove the types from any stmk_decl statements they are referred
   19830             :        from. */
   19831             :     delete_types_from_decl_stmts(scope, n_promoted_source_types);
   19832             :   }  /* if */
   19833             : }  /* promote_types_out_of_function */
   19834             : 
   19835             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   19836             : 
   19837             : static void examine_constant_for_function_scope_limitation(
   19838             :                                     a_constant_ptr                      con,
   19839             :                                     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   19840             : /*
   19841             : Returns TRUE if the constant contains some piece that forces it to remain
   19842             : in the function scope.  Currently this means that it contains a reference
   19843             : to a GNU address label.  The utility has_non_file_scope_ref is similar in
   19844             : some respects, but this is specific to constants that cannot ever be moved
   19845             : to the file scope.
   19846             : */
   19847             : {
   19848             :   if (con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_address &&
   19849             :       con->variant.address.kind == (an_address_base_kind)abk_label) {
   19850             :     tblock->result = TRUE;
   19851             :     tblock->terminate = TRUE;
   19852             :   }  /* if */
   19853             : }  /* examine_constant_for_function_scope_limitation */
   19854             : 
   19855             : 
   19856             : a_boolean constant_must_remain_in_function_scope(a_constant_ptr  constant)
   19857             : /*
   19858             : Returns TRUE if the constant (or some portion of it) contains some piece that
   19859             : forces it to remain in the function scope.  Currently this means that it
   19860             : contains a reference to a GNU address label.
   19861             : */
   19862             : {
   19863             :   a_boolean                       result = FALSE;
   19864             :   an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
   19865             : 
   19866             :   if (gnu_mode) {
   19867             :     clear_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block(&tblock);
   19868             :     tblock.process_constant = examine_constant_for_function_scope_limitation;
   19869             :     traverse_constant(constant, &tblock);
   19870             :     result = tblock.result;
   19871             :   }  /* if */
   19872             :   return result;
   19873             : }  /* constant_must_remain_in_function_scope */
   19874             : 
   19875             : 
   19876             : static void promote_static_variable_out_of_function(
   19877             :                                                a_variable_ptr variable,
   19878             :                                                a_scope_ptr    scope,
   19879             :                                                a_routine_ptr  routine)
   19880             : /*
   19881             : Promote the indicated local static variable out of indicated routine.
   19882             : scope is the scope of the variable (though the variable has already
   19883             : been removed from the scope variables list).
   19884             : */
   19885             : {
   19886             : #if DEBUG
   19887             :   if (debug_level >= 4) {
   19888             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting local variable out of routine ");
   19889             :     db_name(&routine->source_corresp);
   19890             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, ": ");
   19891             :     db_variable(variable);
   19892             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   19893             :   }  /* if */
   19894             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19895             :   /* Mangle the name if necessary (e.g., if it is part of a template
   19896             :      function). */
   19897             :   mangle_promoted_entity_name(&variable->source_corresp, iek_variable,
   19898             :                               /*final=*/FALSE, routine, scope);
   19899             :   variable->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = FALSE;
   19900             :   clear_local_scope_ref_if_present(&variable->source_corresp);
   19901             :   if (has_name(variable) &&
   19902             :       routine_might_exist_in_multiple_copies(routine)) {
   19903             :     /* A routine whose body might exist in multiple copies, such as
   19904             :        an extern inline routine.  Make the promoted variable externally
   19905             :        visible.  This uses the relaxed ref/def model for externals. */
   19906             :     variable->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
   19907             :     variable->source_corresp.name_linkage = (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external;
   19908             : #if IA64_ABI
   19909             :     put_variable_into_comdat_group(variable);
   19910             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   19911             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   19912             :     if ((routine->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) != 0) {
   19913             :       /* The promoted variable should have the same DLL flags as the routine
   19914             :          out of which it is promoted. */
   19915             :       check_assertion((variable->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS) == 0);
   19916             :       variable->decl_modifiers |= (routine->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLFLAGS);
   19917             :     }  /* if */
   19918             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   19919             : #if GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
   19920             :     /* The variable acquires the same ELF module visibility as its enclosing
   19921             :        routine. */
   19922             :     variable->ELF_visibility = routine->ELF_visibility;
   19923             : #endif /* GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
   19924             :   }  /* if */
   19925             :   add_to_variables_list(variable, DEPTH_OF_FILE_SCOPE);
   19926             :   variable->promoted_local_static = TRUE;
   19927             :   /* If the variable has an associated local-static-variable-init
   19928             :      entry, transfer the initialization to the variable itself. */
   19929             :   if (variable->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_function_local) {
   19930             :     a_local_static_variable_init_ptr lsvip, prev_lsvip;
   19931             : 
   19932             :     /* Find the local static initialization entry. */
   19933             :     for (prev_lsvip = NULL, lsvip = scope->local_static_variable_inits;
   19934             :          ;
   19935             :          prev_lsvip = lsvip, lsvip = lsvip->next) {
   19936             :       check_assertion_str2(lsvip != NULL,
   19937             :                            "promote_static_variable_out_of_function:",
   19938             :                            "local static init not found");
   19939             :       if (lsvip->variable == variable) break;
   19940             :     }  /* for */
   19941             :     /* Remove the local static initialization entry from the scope list,
   19942             :        and save it on the promoted_local_static_variable_inits list so it
   19943             :        can still be found (see lower_dynamic_init for one use). */
   19944             :     if (prev_lsvip == NULL) {
   19945             :       scope->local_static_variable_inits = lsvip->next;
   19946             :     } else {
   19947             :       prev_lsvip->next = lsvip->next;
   19948             :     }  /* if */
   19949             :     lsvip->next = promoted_local_static_variable_inits;
   19950             :     promoted_local_static_variable_inits = lsvip;
   19951             :     variable->promoted_local_static_init = TRUE;
   19952             :     /* Transfer the initialization information to the variable itself. */
   19953             :     variable->init_kind = lsvip->init_kind;
   19954             :     switch (lsvip->init_kind) {
   19955             :       case initk_none:
   19956             :       case initk_zero:
   19957             :         break;
   19958             :       case initk_static:
   19959             :         /* The promoted static variable has a constant initialization.  This
   19960             :            occurs for aggregates as well as for constants that refer to
   19961             :            non-file scope entities (see has_non_file_scope_ref).  In most
   19962             :            such cases (e.g., strings with sequence numbers or constants with
   19963             :            backing expressions), copying the constant to the file scope (with
   19964             :            CE_REPLACE_STRINGS_BY_VARIABLES) will result in a constant with only
   19965             :            file-scope entities, but in the case of a constant that refers to
   19966             :            a GNU address label, the constant cannot be copied into the file
   19967             :            scope (but needs to be copied so that any strings are properly
   19968             :            replaced).  In that case, copy the constant to the function scope
   19969             :            and rewrite the initialization as executable code. */
   19970             :         /* This might be expensive space-wise, since this might be
   19971             :            an aggregate, but there are no good alternatives. */
   19972             :         { a_memory_region_number region_to_switch_back_to = NULL_region_number;
   19973             :           a_boolean keep_in_function_scope =
   19974             :            constant_must_remain_in_function_scope(lsvip->initializer.constant);
   19975             : 
   19976             :           if (!keep_in_function_scope) {
   19977             :             switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
   19978             :           }  /* if */
   19979             :           variable->initializer.constant =
   19980             :                            copy_constant_full(lsvip->initializer.constant,
   19981             :                                               (a_constant_ptr)NULL,
   19982             :                                               CE_REPLACE_STRINGS_BY_VARIABLES);
   19983             :           if (!keep_in_function_scope) {
   19984             :             switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
   19985             :           }  /* if */
   19986             :           if (keep_in_function_scope ||
   19987             :               (variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified
   19988             :                && variable->comdat_group == NULL)) {
   19989             :             /* A constant initialization that can't be done in the file scope
   19990             :                or a static variable of an extern inline function initialized
   19991             :                to a constant.  Rewrite the initialization as executable code
   19992             :                because we want the variable to be a tentative definition
   19993             :                (and therefore it cannot be statically initialized). */
   19994             :             lower_constant_init_of_promoted_static(variable,
   19995             :                                                variable->initializer.constant);
   19996             :           }  /* if */
   19997             :         }
   19998             :         break;
   19999             :       case initk_dynamic:
   20000             :         /* This dynamic initialization will be rewritten when the
   20001             :            stmk_init is processed, so leave it alone for now.  The code
   20002             :            there will copy the remaining constant if necessary. */
   20003             :         variable->initializer.dynamic = lsvip->initializer.dynamic;
   20004             :         break;
   20005             :       default:
   20006             :         unexpected_condition_str(
   20007             :           "promote_static_variable_out_of_function: bad static var init_kind");
   20008             :     }  /* switch */
   20009             :   } else if (variable->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_static &&
   20010             :              variable->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified
   20011             :              && variable->comdat_group == NULL) {
   20012             :     /* A static variable of an extern inline function initialized
   20013             :        to a constant.  Rewrite the initialization as executable code
   20014             :        because we want the variable to be a tentative definition
   20015             :        (and therefore it cannot be statically initialized). */
   20016             :     lower_constant_init_of_promoted_static(variable,
   20017             :                                            variable->initializer.constant);
   20018             :   }  /* if */
   20019             :   if (variable->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_binding) {
   20020             :     /* The expression for a structured binding variable is allocated in the
   20021             :        function scope that it appears in.  Copy the expression to the file
   20022             :        scope. */
   20023             :     a_memory_region_number region_to_switch_back_to;
   20024             :     switch_to_file_scope_region(&region_to_switch_back_to);
   20025             :     variable->initializer.bound_expr =
   20026             :                            copy_expr_tree(variable->initializer.bound_expr,
   20027             :                                           CE_COPYING_FROM_ONE_FUNC_TO_ANOTHER);
   20028             :     switch_back_to_original_region(region_to_switch_back_to);
   20029             :   }  /* if */
   20030             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   20031             :   if ((variable->decl_modifiers & DM_DLLIMPORT) != 0) {
   20032             :     /* If the variable has become dllimport as a consequence of its promotion,
   20033             :        it should be turned into a non-defining declaration (dllimport variables
   20034             :        cannot be defined). */
   20035             :     variable->init_kind = (an_init_kind)initk_none;
   20036             :     variable->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_extern;
   20037             : #if IA64_ABI
   20038             :     variable->comdat_group = NULL;
   20039             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20040             :   }  /* if */
   20041             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   20042             : }  /* promote_static_variable_out_of_function */
   20043             : 
   20044             : 
   20045             : static void delete_static_variables_from_decl_stmts(a_scope_ptr    scope,
   20046             :                                                     unsigned long  n_vars)
   20047             : /*
   20048             : Static variables declared in the indicated scope (sck_function or sck_block)
   20049             : have been promoted out of the enclosing function.  Remove any references to
   20050             : these variables from declaration statements (stmk_decl).  n_vars is the number
   20051             : of variables that have been promoted.
   20052             : */
   20053             : {
   20054             :   a_statement_ptr  block = scope->assoc_block, *p_stmt;
   20055             : 
   20056             :   if (block == NULL) goto done;
   20057             :   p_stmt = &block->variant.block.statements;
   20058             :   while (*p_stmt != NULL) {
   20059             :     if (n_vars == 0) goto done;
   20060             :     if ((*p_stmt)->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_decl) {
   20061             :       an_il_entity_list_entry_ptr  *p_entry =
   20062             :                                             &(*p_stmt)->variant.decl.entities;
   20063             :       /* Traverse the entities list and remove the entries referring to
   20064             :          static variables. */
   20065             :       while (*p_entry != NULL && n_vars > 0) {
   20066             :         if ((*p_entry)->entity.kind == (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_variable &&
   20067             :             var_has_static_or_thread_storage_duration(
   20068             :                                       ((a_variable*)(*p_entry)->entity.ptr))) {
   20069             :           n_vars -= 1;
   20070             :           *p_entry = (*p_entry)->next;
   20071             :         } else {
   20072             :           p_entry = &(*p_entry)->next;
   20073             :         }  /* if */
   20074             :       }  /* while */
   20075             :       if ((*p_stmt)->variant.decl.entities == NULL
   20076             : #if PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING
   20077             :            && (*p_stmt)->source_sequence_entry == NULL
   20078             : #endif /* PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING */
   20079             :                                                       ) {
   20080             :         /* If there are no entities left associated with the statement, remove
   20081             :            the statement altogether. */
   20082             :         *p_stmt = (*p_stmt)->next;
   20083             :       } else {
   20084             :         p_stmt = &(*p_stmt)->next;
   20085             :       }  /* if */
   20086             :     } else {
   20087             :       p_stmt = &(*p_stmt)->next;
   20088             :     }  /* if */
   20089             :   }  /* while */
   20090             :   check_assertion(n_vars == 0);
   20091             : done:;
   20092             : }  /* delete_static_variables_from_decl_stmts */
   20093             : 
   20094             : 
   20095             : static void promote_static_variables_out_of_function(
   20096             :                                                 a_scope_ptr   scope,
   20097             :                                                 a_routine_ptr routine)
   20098             : /*
   20099             : Promote the static variables in the indicated scope (a function or block
   20100             : scope that is part of the indicated routine) to the file scope.
   20101             : */
   20102             : {
   20103             :   unsigned long  n_promoted_source_vars = 0;
   20104             :   a_variable_ptr variable;
   20105             : 
   20106             :   /* See if there are local static variables to promote. */
   20107             :   if (scope->variables != NULL) {
   20108             :     /* The list of static variables can change while we're promoting statics
   20109             :        (due typically to adding local static temporaries), so lower the
   20110             :        exiting list (which may include some lowering-generated temporaries),
   20111             :        but don't promote any temporaries that are generated during the
   20112             :        promotion process (added at the head, i.e., scope->variables). */
   20113             :     a_variable_ptr list = scope->variables;
   20114             :     scope->variables = NULL;
   20115             :     while (list != NULL) {
   20116             :       variable = list;
   20117             :       if (variable->source_corresp.decl_position.seq != 0 &&
   20118             :           !variable->is_anonymous_parent_object &&
   20119             :           !variable->is_struct_binding) {
   20120             :         /* Count the number of variables declared in the source (that excludes
   20121             :            compiler-generated variables and binding variables for structured
   20122             :            bindings).  The count is used later to optimize the removal of these
   20123             :            variables from stmk_decl statements. */
   20124             :         n_promoted_source_vars += 1;
   20125             :       }  /* if */
   20126             :       list = list->next;
   20127             :       /* Promote the local static variable to file scope. */
   20128             :       promote_static_variable_out_of_function(variable, scope, routine);
   20129             :     }  /* while */
   20130             :     /* Reset the scope stack pointer to the last static variable now that
   20131             :        the list has been altered. */
   20132             :     { a_scope_depth depth = scope->depth_in_scope_stack;
   20133             :       if (depth != NO_SCOPE_DEPTH) {
   20134             :         a_variable_ptr  last;
   20135             :         for (last = scope->variables;
   20136             :             last != NULL && last->next != NULL;
   20137             :             last = last->next) {
   20138             :           check_assertion(last->lowering_generated);
   20139             :         }  /* for */
   20140             :         assoc_pointers_block_of(&scope_stack[depth])->last_variable = last;
   20141             :       }  /* if */
   20142             :     }
   20143             :     /* Remove the variables from any stmk_decl statements they are referred
   20144             :        from. */
   20145             :     delete_static_variables_from_decl_stmts(scope, n_promoted_source_vars);
   20146             :   }  /* if */
   20147             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   20148             :   routine->statics_have_been_promoted = TRUE;
   20149             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   20150             : }  /* promote_static_variables_out_of_function */
   20151             : 
   20152             : 
   20153             : #if !PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   20154             : /*ARGSUSED*/ /* <-- promote_types is not used if local entities are
   20155             :                     not being promoted. */
   20156             : #endif /* !PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   20157             : static void r_promote_local_entities_to_file_scope(
   20158             :                                                a_scope_ptr   scope,
   20159             :                                                a_scope_ptr   scope_with_block,
   20160             :                                                a_routine_ptr routine,
   20161             :                                                a_boolean     do_type_promotion)
   20162             : /*
   20163             : Promote the local types and static variables of the indicated
   20164             : scope and its subscopes to the file scope.  The scope is a function or
   20165             : block scope and is (directly or indirectly) part of the indicated routine.
   20166             : scope_with_block gives the innermost scope that has an associated
   20167             : block -- scopes for "for" init blocks do not have one.
   20168             : */
   20169             : {
   20170             :   a_scope_ptr block_scope;
   20171             : 
   20172             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   20173             :   if (do_type_promotion) {
   20174             :     /* Promote types from this scope. */
   20175             :     promote_types_out_of_function(scope, routine);
   20176             :   }  /* if */
   20177             : #else /* !PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   20178             :   check_assertion_str(!do_type_promotion,
   20179             :           "r_promote_local_entities_to_file_scope: do_type_promotion is TRUE");
   20180             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   20181             :   /* Promote static variables from this scope. */
   20182             :   promote_static_variables_out_of_function(scope, routine);
   20183             :   /* Note that any pragmas associated with promoted entities are already on
   20184             :      the file scope list, so they do not need to be moved. */
   20185             : #if CHECKING
   20186             :   /* The only namespace entries that should appear at this level are
   20187             :      namespace aliases. */
   20188             :   { a_namespace_ptr nsp;
   20189             :     for (nsp = scope->namespaces;
   20190             :          nsp != NULL;
   20191             :          nsp = nsp->next) {
   20192             :       check_assertion(nsp->is_namespace_alias);
   20193             :     }  /* for */
   20194             :   }
   20195             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   20196             :   /* Visit all block scopes and promote the local entities therein. */
   20197             :   for (block_scope = scope->scopes;
   20198             :        block_scope != NULL;
   20199             :        block_scope = block_scope->next) {
   20200             :     r_promote_local_entities_to_file_scope(block_scope,
   20201             :                                            (block_scope->assoc_block != NULL) ?
   20202             :                                              block_scope : scope_with_block,
   20203             :                                            routine,
   20204             :                                            do_type_promotion);
   20205             :   }  /* for */
   20206             : }  /* r_promote_local_entities_to_file_scope */
   20207             : 
   20208             : 
   20209             : static void promote_local_entities_to_file_scope(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20210             : /*
   20211             : Promote the local types and static variables of the indicated
   20212             : (function) scope and its subscopes to the file scope if appropriate.
   20213             : Note that the entities being promoted have not been lowered yet;
   20214             : they will get lowered (as normal list members, not as orphans) as
   20215             : part of the lowering of the file scope memory region.
   20216             : */
   20217             : {
   20218             :   a_routine_ptr routine = scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   20219             :   a_boolean     do_type_promotion = FALSE, do_static_promotion = FALSE;
   20220             : 
   20221             : #if DEBUG
   20222             :   if (debug_level >= 4 || db_has_traced_name(routine, iek_routine)) {
   20223             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "Promoting local entities out of ");
   20224             :     db_scope(scope);
   20225             :     (void)fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   20226             :   }  /* if */
   20227             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   20228             : #if PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE
   20229             :   if (local_entities_should_be_promoted(scope)) {
   20230             :     /* Local entities need to be promoted because they're potentially
   20231             :        referenced from code outside the routine. */
   20232             :     do_type_promotion = do_static_promotion = TRUE;
   20233             :   } else
   20234             : #endif /* PROMOTE_LOCAL_ENTITIES_TO_FILE_SCOPE */
   20235             :   /* Do not insert code here. */
   20236             :   if (routine_might_exist_in_multiple_copies(routine)) {
   20237             :     /* Promote static variables out of a function that might exist in
   20238             :        multiple copies, such as an extern inline routine, making
   20239             :        them external so the same ones are accessed from all copies of the
   20240             :        function. */
   20241             :     do_static_promotion = TRUE;
   20242             :   }  /* if */
   20243             :   if (do_type_promotion || do_static_promotion) {
   20244             :     r_promote_local_entities_to_file_scope(scope, scope, routine,
   20245             :                                            do_type_promotion);
   20246             :   }  /* if */
   20247             : }  /* promote_local_entities_to_file_scope */
   20248             : 
   20249             : 
   20250             : static void unlink_pointless_local_static_variable_inits(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20251             : /*
   20252             : Remove any local static variable initialization entries on the given
   20253             : scope that no longer do anything useful after lowering has been done.
   20254             : */
   20255             : {
   20256             :   a_local_static_variable_init_ptr lsvip, prev_lsvip;
   20257             : 
   20258             :   for (prev_lsvip = NULL, lsvip = scope->local_static_variable_inits;
   20259             :        lsvip != NULL;
   20260             :        lsvip = lsvip->next) {
   20261             :     a_boolean keep = TRUE;
   20262             :     if (lsvip->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_static) {
   20263             :       /* keep = TRUE; -- Already set. */
   20264             :     } else if (lsvip->init_kind == (an_init_kind)initk_dynamic) {
   20265             :       keep = FALSE;
   20266             :       check_assertion(lsvip->initializer.dynamic->kind ==
   20267             :                                                 (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_none);
   20268             :     } else {
   20269             :       unexpected_condition_str(
   20270             :                         "lower_scope: bad init kind in local static var init");
   20271             :     }  /* if */
   20272             :     if (!keep) {
   20273             :       /* Unlink the entry. */
   20274             :       if (prev_lsvip == NULL) {
   20275             :         scope->local_static_variable_inits = lsvip->next;
   20276             :       } else {
   20277             :         prev_lsvip->next = lsvip->next;
   20278             :       }  /* if */
   20279             :     } else {
   20280             :       /* Keep the entry. */
   20281             :       prev_lsvip = lsvip;
   20282             :     }  /* if */
   20283             :   }  /* for */
   20284             : }  /* unlink_pointless_local_static_variable_inits */
   20285             : 
   20286             : 
   20287             : static void promote_namespace_scope_types(a_scope_ptr  scope)
   20288             : /*
   20289             : Move the types list in the given namespace scope to the end of the types list
   20290             : in the file scope.
   20291             : */
   20292             : {
   20293             :   if (scope->types != NULL) {
   20294             :     /* There are types to move. */
   20295             :     a_scope_pointers_block
   20296             :                  *ns_ptrs = get_pointers_block_for_scope(scope),
   20297             :                  *fs_ptrs = &curr_translation_unit->file_scope_pointers_block;
   20298             :     check_assertion(ns_ptrs != NULL && ns_ptrs->last_type != NULL);
   20299             :     if (fs_ptrs->last_type != NULL) {
   20300             :       fs_ptrs->last_type->next = scope->types;
   20301             :     } else {
   20302             :       il_header.primary_scope->types = scope->types;
   20303             :     }  /* if */
   20304             :     fs_ptrs->last_type = ns_ptrs->last_type;
   20305             :     /* Clear the types list of the source scope. */
   20306             :     scope->types = NULL;
   20307             :     ns_ptrs->last_type = NULL;
   20308             :   }  /* if */
   20309             : }  /* promote_namespace_scope_types */
   20310             : 
   20311             : 
   20312             : static void do_namespace_member_promotion(a_namespace_ptr nsp)
   20313             : /*
   20314             : Promote the members out of the indicated namespace.
   20315             : */
   20316             : {
   20317             :   a_scope_ptr scope;
   20318             : 
   20319             :   check_assertion(!nsp->is_namespace_alias);
   20320             :   scope = nsp->variant.assoc_scope;
   20321             :   /* Do namespaces nested within this one. */
   20322             :   do_scope_namespace_member_promotion(scope);
   20323             :   /* Promote the member types out of the namespace (to the file scope). */
   20324             :   promote_namespace_scope_types(scope);
   20325             :   /* Promote the member constants out of the namespace. */
   20326             :   promote_constants(scope);
   20327             :   /* Promote the member variables of the namespace. */
   20328             :   promote_variables(scope);
   20329             :   /* Promote the member functions out of the namespace. */
   20330             :   promote_routines(scope);
   20331             :   /* Promote the asm declarations out of the namespace. */
   20332             :   promote_asm_entries(scope);
   20333             :   /* Promote the pragmas out of the namespace. */
   20334             :   promote_pragmas(scope);
   20335             : }  /* do_namespace_member_promotion */
   20336             : 
   20337             : 
   20338             : static void do_scope_namespace_member_promotion(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20339             : /*
   20340             : Promote all members out of all namespaces in the indicated scope (the
   20341             : file scope or a namespace scope).
   20342             : */
   20343             : {
   20344             :   a_namespace_ptr nsp;
   20345             : 
   20346             :   /* Process namespaces within this scope. */
   20347             :   for (nsp = scope->namespaces;
   20348             :        nsp != NULL;
   20349             :        nsp = nsp->next) {
   20350             :     if (!nsp->is_namespace_alias) {
   20351             :       do_namespace_member_promotion(nsp);
   20352             :     }  /* if */
   20353             :   }  /* for */
   20354             : }  /* do_scope_namespace_member_promotion */
   20355             : 
   20356             : 
   20357             : static void lower_scope_list(a_scope_ptr scope_list)
   20358             : /*
   20359             : Do IL lowering of the indicated list of scopes and everything under it.
   20360             : (Well, actually, everything under it except statements, since they get
   20361             : handled at the function level.)
   20362             : */
   20363             : {
   20364             :   a_scope_ptr scope;
   20365             : 
   20366             :   for (scope = scope_list; scope != NULL; scope = scope->next) {
   20367             :     lower_scope(scope);
   20368             :     lower_scope_list(scope->scopes);
   20369             :   }  /* for */
   20370             : }  /* lower_scope_list */
   20371             : 
   20372             : 
   20373             : static void add_constructor_params(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20374             : /*
   20375             : Add any required implicit parameter variables to the indicated constructor
   20376             : scope.
   20377             : */
   20378             : {
   20379             :   a_variable_ptr         prev_param_var;
   20380             : #if !IA64_ABI
   20381             :   a_base_class_ptr       bcp;
   20382             :   a_variable_ptr         vbase_param_var;
   20383             :   a_type_ptr             class_type, subobject_type;
   20384             :   a_class_type_supplement_ptr
   20385             :                          ctsp;
   20386             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   20387             :   a_routine_ptr          ctor_routine = scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   20388             : 
   20389             :   prev_param_var = scope->variant.routine.parameters;
   20390             : #if !IA64_ABI
   20391             :   class_type = parent_class_of(ctor_routine);
   20392             :   ctsp = class_type_supp(class_type);
   20393             :   if (class_type->variant.class_struct_union.any_virtual_base_classes) {
   20394             :     /* Loop through the virtual base classes of the current class. */
   20395             :     for (bcp = ctsp->base_classes; bcp != NULL; bcp = bcp->next) {
   20396             :       if (bcp->is_virtual) {
   20397             :         /* Add a parameter for the virtual base class.  These parameters are
   20398             :            added after the "this" parameter.  Each one points to the space
   20399             :            allocated for the associated virtual base class once the base class
   20400             :            has been constructed, or is NULL if the base class should be
   20401             :            constructed on this call.  lower_constructor_routine_type does the
   20402             :            similar processing for the param type list.  See ARM p. 296. */
   20403             :         /* Use the type of the virtual base class when used as a subobject. */
   20404             :         subobject_type = subobject_for_class(bcp->type);
   20405             :         vbase_param_var =
   20406             :                 make_lowered_param_variable(make_pointer_type(subobject_type));
   20407             :         vbase_param_var->next = prev_param_var->next;
   20408             :         prev_param_var->next = vbase_param_var;
   20409             :         prev_param_var = vbase_param_var;
   20410             :       }  /* if */
   20411             :     }  /* for */
   20412             :   }  /* if */
   20413             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   20414             :   set_primary_ctor_or_dtor_kind(ctor_routine);
   20415             :   if (ctor_needs_vtt_argument(ctor_routine)) {
   20416             :     /* Add the VTT parameter. */
   20417             :     a_variable_ptr vtt_param_var = make_lowered_param_variable(
   20418             :                                       make_virtual_table_table_pointer_type());
   20419             :     vtt_param_var->next = prev_param_var->next;
   20420             :     prev_param_var->next = vtt_param_var;
   20421             :   }  /* if */
   20422             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20423             : }  /* add_constructor_params */
   20424             : 
   20425             : 
   20426             : static void add_destructor_params(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20427             : /*
   20428             : Add any required implicit parameter variables to the indicated destructor
   20429             : scope.
   20430             : */
   20431             : {
   20432             :   a_variable_ptr this_param_var = scope->variant.routine.parameters;
   20433             : #if !IA64_ABI
   20434             :   {
   20435             :     /* Add a parameter of type int after the "this" parameter.  The new
   20436             :        parameter has the 0x2 bit on if a complete object is being destroyed,
   20437             :        and the 0x1 bit on if the storage should be freed. */
   20438             :     /* lower_destructor_routine_type adds the parameter to the routine type
   20439             :        param_type_list. */
   20440             :     a_variable_ptr complete_obj_param_var =
   20441             :             make_lowered_param_variable(integer_type((an_integer_kind)ik_int));
   20442             :     complete_obj_param_var->next = this_param_var->next;
   20443             :     this_param_var->next = complete_obj_param_var;
   20444             :   }
   20445             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   20446             :   { a_routine_ptr dtor_routine = scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   20447             :     set_primary_ctor_or_dtor_kind(dtor_routine);
   20448             :     if (dtor_needs_vtt_argument(dtor_routine)) {
   20449             :       /* Add the VTT parameter. */
   20450             :       a_variable_ptr vtt_param_var = make_lowered_param_variable(
   20451             :                                       make_virtual_table_table_pointer_type());
   20452             :       vtt_param_var->next = this_param_var->next;
   20453             :       this_param_var->next = vtt_param_var;
   20454             :     }  /* if */
   20455             :   }
   20456             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20457             : }  /* add_destructor_params */
   20458             : 
   20459             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
   20460             : 
   20461             : static void add_required_wrapper_routines(a_routine_ptr routine)
   20462             : /*
   20463             : routine is an overriding virtual function.  routine either has a covariant
   20464             : return type (in which case a wrapper function is required to adjust the return
   20465             : type as needed), or (in the IA-64 ABI) to implement "adjusting entry points"
   20466             : (also called "thunks") which are used to adjust the "this" pointer as necessary
   20467             : from the caller's view to the callee's view.  Generate declarations for all
   20468             : necessary wrapper functions used to call this routine.  Definitions (if needed)
   20469             : will be put out later.
   20470             : */
   20471             : {
   20472             :   a_type_ptr       rout_class = parent_class_of(routine);
   20473             :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
   20474             : 
   20475             : #if !IA64_ABI
   20476             :   check_assertion(routine->covariant_return_virtual_override);
   20477             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   20478             :   /* Look at each base class (both direct and indirect). */
   20479             :   for (bcp = rout_class->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info->base_classes;
   20480             :        bcp != NULL;
   20481             :        bcp = bcp->next) {
   20482             :     /* Look at each virtual function override in the base class. */
   20483             :     an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr ovf = bcp->overriding_virtual_functions;
   20484             :     for (; ovf != NULL; ovf = ovf->next) {
   20485             :       if (ovf->overriding_function == routine) {
   20486             :         /* This is an override for the function we care about. */
   20487             :         a_base_class_ptr      adjustment_bcp = 
   20488             :                                              ovf->return_adjustment_base_class;
   20489             :         a_targ_ptrdiff_t      delta = 0;
   20490             :         a_virtual_table_index vcall_index = 0;
   20491             : #if IA64_ABI
   20492             :         find_delta_and_vcall_index(ovf->primary_function, ovf->base_class,
   20493             :                                    bcp, /*subobject_bcp=*/NULL,
   20494             :                                    adjustment_bcp, /*filling_vtable=*/FALSE,
   20495             :                                    /*overriding_function=*/NULL,
   20496             :                                    &delta, &vcall_index, /*thunk=*/NULL);
   20497             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20498             :         /* Ignore this entry if in this case the override is not covariant
   20499             :            (it is covariant for the overrides in other base classes) or
   20500             :            no "this" offset adjustment is needed (IA-64 ABI). */
   20501             :         if ((adjustment_bcp != NULL &&
   20502             :              (adjustment_bcp->offset != 0 || adjustment_bcp->is_virtual))
   20503             : #if IA64_ABI
   20504             :             || delta != 0 || vcall_index != 0
   20505             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20506             :                                                                          ) {
   20507             :           /* The adjustment offset is non-NULL, or the base class is
   20508             :              virtual, so an entry/wrapper routine is needed. */
   20509             : #if IA64_ABI
   20510             :           /* Add thunks for any alternate entry points.  For destructors, the
   20511             :              primary routine might be the complete destructor, or it might be
   20512             :              the subobject destructor and require no thunk.  Constructors do
   20513             :              not get here because they cannot be virtual. */
   20514             :           if (routine->special_kind ==
   20515             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   20516             :             a_routine_list_entry_ptr rlep;
   20517             :             if (routine->ctor_dtor_kind == (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_complete) {
   20518             :               a_routine_ptr arouto =
   20519             :                        alternate_entry_point(ovf->primary_function,
   20520             :                                              (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_complete,
   20521             :                                              /*define_now=*/FALSE);
   20522             :               (void)make_wrapper_routine(routine,
   20523             :                                          arouto,
   20524             :                                          adjustment_bcp,
   20525             :                                          delta,
   20526             :                                          vcall_index);
   20527             :             }  /* if */
   20528             :             for (rlep = routine->variant.ctor_dtor.alternate_entry_points;
   20529             :                  rlep != NULL;
   20530             :                  rlep = rlep->next) {
   20531             :               a_routine_ptr arout = rlep->routine, arouto;
   20532             :               if (arout->ctor_dtor_kind == (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_complete ||
   20533             :                   arout->ctor_dtor_kind == (a_ctor_or_dtor_kind)cdk_deleting) {
   20534             :                 arouto = alternate_entry_point(ovf->primary_function,
   20535             :                                                arout->ctor_dtor_kind,
   20536             :                                                /*define_now=*/FALSE);
   20537             :                 (void)make_wrapper_routine(arout,
   20538             :                                            arouto,
   20539             :                                            adjustment_bcp,
   20540             :                                            delta,
   20541             :                                            vcall_index);
   20542             :               }  /* if */
   20543             :             }  /* for */
   20544             :           } else
   20545             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20546             :           /* Do not insert code here. */
   20547             :           {
   20548             :             (void)make_wrapper_routine(routine,
   20549             :                                        ovf->primary_function,
   20550             :                                        adjustment_bcp,
   20551             :                                        delta,
   20552             :                                        vcall_index);
   20553             :           }  /* if */
   20554             :         }  /* if */
   20555             :       }  /* if */
   20556             :     }  /* for */
   20557             :   }  /* for */
   20558             : }  /* add_required_wrapper_routines */
   20559             : 
   20560             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
   20561             : 
   20562             : static void lower_function_body(a_statement_ptr statement)
   20563             : /*
   20564             : Lower the body of a function.  The function is not a constructor or destructor.
   20565             : statement is the statement pointed to by assoc_block in the function scope.
   20566             : */
   20567             : {
   20568             :   if (statement->kind == (a_statement_kind)stmk_try_block) {
   20569             :     /* A function try block.  Insert a block statement around the try
   20570             :        block so that the function will have an stmk_block statement
   20571             :        as the body.  That makes the function try block into a "normal"
   20572             :        try block. */
   20573             :     an_insert_location insert_location;
   20574             :     a_statement_ptr    orig_statement;
   20575             :     put_block_around_try_block(statement, &insert_location, &orig_statement);
   20576             :   }  /* if */
   20577             :   lower_statement(statement);
   20578             : }  /* lower_function_body */
   20579             : 
   20580             : 
   20581             : static void lower_scope(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20582             : /*
   20583             : Do IL lowering of the indicated scope and everything under it.
   20584             : */
   20585             : {
   20586             :   a_context        context;
   20587             :   a_routine_ptr    routine = NULL;
   20588             :   a_type_ptr       routine_type, return_type;
   20589             :   a_variable_ptr   param_var, var;
   20590             :   a_routine_type_supplement_ptr
   20591             :                    rtsp;
   20592             :   a_scope_kind     scope_kind = scope->kind;
   20593             :   a_scope_ptr      saved_innermost_function_scope = innermost_function_scope;
   20594             : 
   20595             :   db_enter(2, "lower_scope");
   20596             :   /* Add a context entry for the scope, but not for the file scope (the caller
   20597             :      has done that already). */
   20598             :   if (scope_kind != (a_scope_kind)sck_file) {
   20599             :     push_context(&context, scope, (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   20600             :   }  /* if */
   20601             :   /* Mark the scope as lowered.  This is used by
   20602             :      check_for_done_with_memory_region to tell whether the code for a function
   20603             :      has been lowered yet. */
   20604             :   mark_as_visited(scope);
   20605             :   if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
   20606             :     /* The scope is for a function. */
   20607             :     innermost_function_scope = scope;
   20608             :     routine = scope->variant.routine.ptr;
   20609             : #if DEBUG
   20610             :     if (debug_level >= 1) {
   20611             :       if (routine->source_corresp.name != NULL) {
   20612             :         fprintf(f_debug, "lower_scope: function \"%s\"\n",
   20613             :                          routine->source_corresp.name);
   20614             :       } /* if */
   20615             :     }  /* if */
   20616             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   20617             :     if (routine->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
   20618             :       /* Member function.  Make sure that the class it is a member of has
   20619             :          been pre-lowered. */
   20620             :       prelower_class_type(parent_class_of(routine));
   20621             :     }  /* if */
   20622             :     routine_type = routine->type;
   20623             :     routine_type = skip_typerefs(routine_type);
   20624             :     rtsp = routine_type->variant.routine.extra_info;
   20625             :     return_value_pointer_variable = NULL;
   20626             :     /* Make sure we initialize value_returned_as_parameter before using it. */
   20627             :     set_lowered_routine_calling_method_flag(routine_type);
   20628             :     /* Rewrite the parameters if necessary. */
   20629             :     if (rtsp->value_returned_as_parameter) {
   20630             :       /* If there is an implicit parameter for the return value address,
   20631             :          add it as an explicit first parameter.  In the Cfront-like ABI,
   20632             :          if there is also a "this" parameter, the return value address
   20633             :          will end up being the second parameter.  Note that the variable is
   20634             :          then lowered as part of the parameters below. */
   20635             :       /* The variable is saved in a global variable for use in processing
   20636             :          return statements. */
   20637             :       return_type = routine_type->variant.routine.return_type;
   20638             :       return_value_pointer_variable =
   20639             :                    make_lowered_param_variable(make_pointer_type(return_type));
   20640             :       return_value_pointer_variable->next = scope->variant.routine.parameters;
   20641             :       scope->variant.routine.parameters = return_value_pointer_variable;
   20642             :     }  /* if */
   20643             :     if (scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable != NULL) {
   20644             :       /* If there is an implicit "this" parameter, add it as an explicit
   20645             :          parameter.  Note that the variable is then lowered as
   20646             :          part of the parameters below. */
   20647             :       param_var = scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable;
   20648             :       if (return_value_pointer_variable != NULL &&
   20649             :           !rtsp->return_value_parameter_follows_this) {
   20650             :         /* There is a "this" parameter and a return value address --
   20651             :            the return value address comes first. */
   20652             :         param_var->next = return_value_pointer_variable->next;
   20653             :         return_value_pointer_variable->next = param_var;
   20654             :       } else {
   20655             :         param_var->next = scope->variant.routine.parameters;
   20656             :         scope->variant.routine.parameters = param_var;
   20657             :       }  /* if */
   20658             :       /* this_param_variable is not cleared.  It's harmless and it's
   20659             :          helpful to be able to check it when one does not know whether or
   20660             :          not it has been lowered. */
   20661             :       if (should_drop_const_on_this_param_variable(routine, routine_type)) {
   20662             :         /* Drop the top-level "const" on the "this" parameter because it has
   20663             :            to be modifiable.  Do this in a way that preserves "restrict" if
   20664             :            that's present. */
   20665             :         param_var->type = implicit_this_param_type_of(routine_type);
   20666             :       }  /* if */
   20667             :     }  /* if */
   20668             :     lower_variable_list(scope->variant.routine.parameters);
   20669             :     /* For any parameters that are passed by copy constructor, change the
   20670             :        parameter type to pointer-to-class. */
   20671             :     for (param_var = scope->variant.routine.parameters;
   20672             :          param_var != NULL;
   20673             :          param_var = param_var->next) {
   20674             :       /* assoc_param_type is NULL on the "this" parameter variable and
   20675             :          the return value pointer variable. */
   20676             :       if (param_var->variant.assoc_param_type != NULL &&
   20677             :           param_var->variant.assoc_param_type->passed_via_copy_constructor) {
   20678             :         param_var->type = make_pointer_type(param_var->type);
   20679             :       }  /* if */
   20680             :     }  /* for */
   20681             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
   20682             :     if (routine->
   20683             : #if IA64_ABI
   20684             :                  is_virtual
   20685             : #else /* !IA64_ABI */
   20686             :                  covariant_return_virtual_override
   20687             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   20688             :                                                   ) {
   20689             :       /* Generate any wrapper routine declarations that may be needed for
   20690             :          overriding virtual functions.  Wrappers are required for handling
   20691             :          covariant return types (in both ABIs) as well as adjusting the
   20692             :          "this" pointer in IA-64 ABI thunks. */
   20693             :       /* Note that this must be done before the promote-local-entities
   20694             :          code so that routine_might_exist_in_multiple_copies can know
   20695             :          whether any thunks are needed. */
   20696             : #if IA64_ABI
   20697             :       if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor &&
   20698             :           routine->primary_ctor_or_dtor == NULL) {
   20699             :         /* Create all the alternate entry points for a destructor so we
   20700             :            can add thunks if necessary. */
   20701             :         create_alternate_entry_points(routine, /*define_now=*/FALSE);
   20702             :       }  /* if */
   20703             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20704             :       add_required_wrapper_routines(routine);
   20705             :     }  /* if */
   20706             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
   20707             :   }  /* if */
   20708             :   lower_constant_list(scope->constants);
   20709             :   if (lowering_file_scope) {
   20710             :     /* Lower the file-scope lists or the lists for a class or namespace
   20711             :        scope. */
   20712             :     lower_variable_list(scope->variables);
   20713             :     lower_type_list(scope->types);
   20714             :     if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union &&
   20715             :         allow_anachronisms) {
   20716             :       /* Change the storage class of static data members that have external
   20717             :          linkage to sc_unspecified to accommodate the anachronism that
   20718             :          does not require static data members to be defined somewhere. */
   20719             :       var = scope->variables;
   20720             :       if (var != NULL) {
   20721             :         if (class_type_supp(parent_class_of(var))->template_arg_list != NULL) {
   20722             :           /* Don't do this for static data members of template classes. */
   20723             :         } else {
   20724             :           for (; var != NULL; var = var->next) {
   20725             :             /* Don't do this for static data members with incomplete types. */
   20726             :             if (var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_extern &&
   20727             :                 !is_incomplete_type(var->type)) {
   20728             :               var->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
   20729             :               var->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
   20730             : #if IA64_ABI
   20731             :               /* Allow the variable to potentially be defined in multiple
   20732             :                  translation units. */
   20733             :               put_variable_into_comdat_group(var);
   20734             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20735             :             }  /* if */
   20736             :           }  /* for */
   20737             :         }  /* if */
   20738             :       }  /* if */
   20739             :     }  /* if */
   20740             :   } else {
   20741             :     /* Function or block scope. */
   20742             :     /* In function and block scopes, the types and variables lists point into
   20743             :        the file scope memory region, and are not lowered at this time.
   20744             :        They are lowered as part of lowering the file scope memory region. */
   20745             :     /* Note that an entry for this scope will be placed on the
   20746             :        il_header.scope_orphaned_list_headers list if either of those
   20747             :        pointers is non-NULL.  The entry is created after IL lowering
   20748             :        runs so that IL lowering can alter those local lists. */
   20749             :     /* If there is reason to promote the local types and static variables
   20750             :        to the file scope, do that now and clear the lists.  That makes the
   20751             :        promoted entities part of the file scope and no longer orphans.
   20752             :        For member functions, the local types get lowered, put onto a list
   20753             :        associated with the class, and promoted when the class members get
   20754             :        promoted out later. */
   20755             :     if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
   20756             :       promote_local_entities_to_file_scope(scope);
   20757             :       if (scope->variant.routine.ptr->special_kind ==
   20758             :                                     (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor &&
   20759             :           class_type_supp(parent_class_of(scope->variant.routine.ptr))->
   20760             :                                                        has_field_initializer) {
   20761             :         /* For classes that contain non-static data members that are
   20762             :            initialized, do the necessary lowering of the field initializers.
   20763             :            This is done early so that the rest of lowering can treat
