   20764             :            these field initializers just like member initializers. */
   20765             :         copy_non_static_data_member_initializers_if_necessary(scope);
   20766             :       }  /* if */
   20767             : #if LOWERING_REMOVES_UNNEEDED_CONSTRUCTIONS_AND_DESTRUCTIONS
   20768             :       /* Before the scope is lowered, scan it (and recursively blocks
   20769             :          contained therein) for any constructions or destructions that aren't
   20770             :          needed and remove them (before initializations and exception handling
   20771             :          code is generated for them).  This is done early in the lowering
   20772             :          process to prevent an exception handling prologue from being added
   20773             :          if none is necessary. */
   20774             :       remove_unneeded_constructions_and_destructions(scope);
   20775             : #endif /* LOWERING_REMOVES_UNNEEDED_CONSTRUCTIONS_AND_DESTRUCTIONS */
   20776             :     }  /* if */
   20777             :   }  /* if */
   20778             :   lower_variable_list(scope->nonstatic_variables);
   20779             :   lower_label_list(scope->labels);
   20780             :   lower_routine_list(scope->routines);
   20781             :   lower_asm_entry_list(scope->asm_entries);
   20782             :   lower_namespace_list(scope->namespaces);
   20783             : #if !PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING
   20784             :   /* Remove using-declarations from the scope list, because they prevent the
   20785             :      removal of otherwise unreferenced routines.  It's not sufficient to clear
   20786             :      the scope pointer: The "next" pointers must also be cleared because some
   20787             :      of the using-declaration entries may be pointed to from inheriting
   20788             :      constructor routine entries.  Note also that this relies on the fact that
   20789             :      source sequence entries are not maintained when IL lowering is done.  If
   20790             :      a back end would like to see using-declarations for some reason, this
   20791             :      code can just be removed. */
   20792             :   if (scope->using_decls != NULL) { 
   20793             :     a_using_decl_ptr  udp = scope->using_decls, next_udp = udp->next;
   20794             :     for (; next_udp != NULL; udp = next_udp, next_udp = next_udp->next) {
   20795             :       udp->next = NULL;
   20796             :     }  /* for */
   20797             :     scope->using_decls = NULL;
   20798             :   }  /* if */
   20799             : #endif /* !PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING */
   20800             : #if RECORD_HIDDEN_NAMES_IN_IL
   20801             :   /* Remove the hidden names list.  This list is not maintained during
   20802             :      lowering (e.g., when removing property fields in lower_field_list)
   20803             :      and can result in inconsistent IL. */
   20804             :   scope->hidden_names = NULL;
   20805             : #endif /* RECORD_HIDDEN_NAMES_IN_IL */
   20806             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   20807             : #if !PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING
   20808             :   check_assertion_str2(source_sequence_entries_disallowed,
   20809             :                        "lower_scope: source sequence entries not allowed",
   20810             :                        "with IL lowering of using decls");
   20811             : #endif /* !PRESERVE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS_WITH_IL_LOWERING */
   20812             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   20813             :   if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
   20814             :     /* A function scope. */
   20815             :     /* Lower any block scopes within it.  Note that statements are not
   20816             :        lowered during this processing; they are handled in the lowering
   20817             :        of assoc_block below. */
   20818             :     lower_scope_list(scope->scopes);
   20819             :     if (routine->source_corresp.is_class_member) {
   20820             :       /* Add implicit parameters to constructors and destructors. */
   20821             :       if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
   20822             :         add_constructor_params(scope);
   20823             :       } else if (routine->special_kind ==
   20824             :                                      (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   20825             :         add_destructor_params(scope);
   20826             :       }  /* if */
   20827             :     }  /* if */
   20828             :     /* Initialize for lowering a function. */
   20829             :     function_lower_init();
   20830             :     /* Lower the executable code. */
   20831             :     if (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor) {
   20832             :       /* For a constructor, add wrapper code around the user code, and also
   20833             :          lower the user code. */
   20834             :       lower_constructor_code(scope);
   20835             :     } else if (routine->special_kind ==
   20836             :                                      (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   20837             :       /* For a destructor, add wrapper code around the user code, and also
   20838             :          lower the user code. */
   20839             :       lower_destructor_code(scope);
   20840             :     } else {
   20841             :       /* Normal case.  Lower the statements.  Note that this call (at the
   20842             :          function level) lowers all the statements in the function, even those
   20843             :          inside block scopes. */
   20844             :       lower_function_body(scope->assoc_block);
   20845             :     }  /* if */
   20846             :     /* Add prologue code for exceptions. */
   20847             :     if (exceptions_enabled
   20848             : #if ASM_FUNCTION_ALLOWED
   20849             :         && scope->assoc_block->kind != (a_statement_kind)stmk_asm_func_body
   20850             : #endif /* ASM_FUNCTION_ALLOWED */
   20851             :                           ) add_eh_function_prologue(scope);
   20852             : #if !IA64_ABI || ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION <= 301
   20853             :     /* If the routine is the main program, insert a call of _main at its
   20854             :        start.  This is done after inserting the exception handling function
   20855             :        prologue, if any, so that the call to _main is always first. */
   20856             :     if (routine == il_header.main_routine) {
   20857             :       a_routine_ptr      underscore_main = NULL;
   20858             :       an_insert_location insert_location;
   20859             :       (void)make_prototyped_runtime_routine("_main", &underscore_main,
   20860             :                                             void_type(), NULL, NULL,
   20861             :                                             NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
   20862             :       set_block_start_insert_location(scope->assoc_block, &insert_location);
   20863             :       make_call_statement(underscore_main, (an_expr_node_ptr)NULL,
   20864             :                           (an_expr_node_ptr)NULL, &insert_location);
   20865             :     }  /* if */
   20866             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI || ABI_COMPATIBILITY_VERSION <= 301 */
   20867             :     /* Free any return memos that were not used. */
   20868             :     free_return_memo_list(return_memo_list);
   20869             :     return_memo_list = NULL;
   20870             :     return_value_pointer_variable = NULL;
   20871             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   20872             :     if (inlining_enabled && routine->is_inline) {
   20873             :       /* For an inline routine, set the inlinable flag now that the body has
   20874             :          been processed. */
   20875             :       set_up_routine_for_inlining(scope);
   20876             :     }  /* if */
   20877             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   20878             : #if IA64_ABI
   20879             :     if ((routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
   20880             :          routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) &&
   20881             :         routine->primary_ctor_or_dtor == NULL) {
   20882             :       /* Create all the alternate entry points for a constructor or
   20883             :          destructor, and give them definitions. */
   20884             :       create_alternate_entry_points(routine, /*define_now=*/TRUE);
   20885             :     }  /* if */
   20886             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   20887             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   20888             :     if (vla_enabled) {
   20889             :       /* Lower the type of any VLA variables in this function scope. */
   20890             :       lower_vla_variable_types_in_scope(scope);
   20891             :     }  /* if */
   20892             :     /* Discard the VLA dimensions list since the VLAs have all been lowered. */
   20893             :     scope->vla_dimensions = NULL;
   20894             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   20895             :   }  /* if */
   20896             :   /* Lowering of a function body may generate local static variable entries,
   20897             :      which point to constants that have not yet been lowered; lower these after
   20898             :      the function body lowering has taken place. */
   20899             :   lower_local_static_variable_init_list(scope->local_static_variable_inits);
   20900             :   if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
   20901             :     /* Unlink any local static variable initialization entries that
   20902             :        no longer do anything. */
   20903             :     unlink_pointless_local_static_variable_inits(scope);
   20904             :   }  /* if */
   20905             :   if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_file) {
   20906             :   } else {
   20907             :     pop_context();
   20908             :   }  /* if */
   20909             : #if LOWERING_REMOVES_UNNEEDED_CONSTRUCTIONS_AND_DESTRUCTIONS
   20910             :   if (scope_kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function &&
   20911             :       (routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
   20912             :        routine->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor)) {
   20913             :     /* Now that the scope has been lowered, we know everything we're ever
   20914             :        going to know about this routine.  If the body of the function has
   20915             :        no effect, note that now (before the memory region is written out). */
   20916             :     routine->has_no_effect = ctor_or_dtor_body_has_no_effect(scope);
   20917             :   }  /* if */
   20918             : #endif /* LOWERING_REMOVES_UNNEEDED_CONSTRUCTIONS_AND_DESTRUCTIONS */
   20919             :   innermost_function_scope = saved_innermost_function_scope;
   20920             :   /* Make sure no pending stmk_init statements remain. */
   20921             :   check_assertion(pending_stmk_init_statements == NULL);
   20922             :   db_exit();
   20923             : }  /* lower_scope */
   20924             : 
   20925             : 
   20926             : static void lower_orphaned_entries(void)
   20927             : /*
   20928             : Lower any "orphaned" entries in the file scope, entries that are pointed
   20929             : to only from a function scope, and are therefore in the file scope but
   20930             : not reachable from the normal file-scope IL tree.
   20931             : */
   20932             : {
   20933             :   a_scope_orphaned_list_header_ptr solhp;
   20934             :   an_il_entry_kind                 kind;
   20935             :   char                             *entry_ptr;
   20936             : 
   20937             :   /* First lower the list of orphaned types and variables from function
   20938             :      and block scopes. */
   20939             :   for (solhp = il_header.scope_orphaned_list_headers;
   20940             :        solhp != NULL;
   20941             :        solhp = solhp->next) {
   20942             :     /* Don't process routines that are prototype instantiations. */
   20943             :     if (ignore_routine_in_back_end(solhp->assoc_routine)) continue;
   20944             :     lower_type_list(solhp->orphaned_types);
   20945             :     lower_variable_list(solhp->orphaned_variables);
   20946             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   20947             :     if (vla_enabled) {
   20948             :         lower_vla_variable_types(solhp->orphaned_variables);
   20949             :     }  /* if */
   20950             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   20951             :     /* Since orphaned namespace entries are always namespace aliases, the
   20952             :        following call is not currently necessary (because lowering a namespace
   20953             :        alias is currently a no-op).  We leave the call to avoid future
   20954             :        surprises, however. */
   20955             :     lower_namespace_list(solhp->orphaned_namespaces);
   20956             :     /* The source sequence sublist list need not be visited. */
   20957             :   }  /* for */
   20958             :   /* Now visit all the orphaned entries recorded by the more general scheme. */
   20959             :   /* Look at each IL entry kind (e.g., types, constants). */
   20960             :   for (kind = (an_il_entry_kind)0;
   20961             :        (int)kind < (int)iek_last;
   20962             :        kind = (an_il_entry_kind)((int)kind + 1)) {
   20963             :     /* Visit each entry on the list of orphaned entries of that kind. */
   20964             :     for (entry_ptr = orphaned_file_scope_il_entries[(int)kind].first_entry;
   20965             :          entry_ptr != NULL; 
   20966             :          entry_ptr = fs_orphan_pointer_of(entry_ptr)) {
   20967             :       switch (kind) {
   20968             :         case iek_type:
   20969             :           lower_type((a_type_ptr)entry_ptr);
   20970             :           break;
   20971             :         case iek_constant:
   20972             :           lower_constant((a_constant_ptr)entry_ptr);
   20973             :           break;
   20974             :         case iek_variable:
   20975             :           lower_variable((a_variable_ptr)entry_ptr);
   20976             :           break;
   20977             :         default:
   20978             :           /* There may be other kinds of entries recorded by an IL walk,
   20979             :              but we don't care about them. */
   20980             :           goto next_kind;
   20981             :       }  /* switch */
   20982             :     }  /* for */
   20983             : next_kind:;
   20984             :   }  /* for */
   20985             : }  /* lower_orphaned_entries */
   20986             : 
   20987             : 
   20988             : #if !(NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR || DELETE_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_DTOR)
   20989             : /*ARGSUSED*/
   20990             : #endif /* !(NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR || DELETE_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_DTOR) */
   20991             : static void do_class_lowering_wrapup(a_scope_ptr scope)
   20992             : /*
   20993             : Do any wrapup processing on classes that has to wait until the very
   20994             : end of the lowering process for a memory region.  Note that this is done
   20995             : for each memory region.
   20996             : */
   20997             : {
   20998             : #if NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR || DELETE_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_DTOR 
   20999             :   a_type_ptr  type;
   21000             :   a_scope_ptr block_scope;
   21001             : 
   21002             :   /* Visit all types to find all class types.  Note that this routine is
   21003             :      called at the end of lowering a memory region, so the IL is flattened
   21004             :      here; there are no nested classes and no namespaces. */
   21005             :   /* Note that when processing a function or block scope we will be crossing
   21006             :      into the file scope here, but these class types are truly local types
   21007             :      and are not used in the file scope, so it's okay to process them
   21008             :      now. */
   21009             :   for (type = scope->types; type != NULL; type = type->next) {
   21010             :     if (is_immediate_class_type(type)) {
   21011             :       /* Found a class type. */
   21012             :       /* Clear any pointers that we do not want going on to the back end.
   21013             :          In particular, clear any pointers that would introduce spurious
   21014             :          "needed" flag dependencies if left alone.  Note that this clearing
   21015             :          is done at the end of lowering of each function so that the fields
   21016             :          are cleared before the IL is walked to set the "needed" flag. */
   21017             :       a_class_type_supplement_ptr ctsp =
   21018             :                                    type->variant.class_struct_union.extra_info;
   21019             : #if NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR
   21020             :       ctsp->assoc_operator_new_routine = NULL;
   21021             : #endif /* NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR */
   21022             : #if DELETE_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_DTOR
   21023             :       ctsp->assoc_operator_delete_routine = NULL;
   21024             : #endif /* DELETE_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_DTOR */
   21025             :     }  /* if */
   21026             :   }  /* for */
   21027             :   /* Visit all block scopes. */
   21028             :   for (block_scope = scope->scopes;
   21029             :        block_scope != NULL;
   21030             :        block_scope = block_scope->next) {
   21031             :     do_class_lowering_wrapup(block_scope);
   21032             :   }  /* for */
   21033             : #endif /* NEW_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_CTOR || DELETE_CAN_BE_FOLDED_INTO_DTOR */
   21034             : }  /* do_class_lowering_wrapup */
   21035             : 
   21036             : 
   21037             : static void clear_parent_info_on_constants(void)
   21038             : /*
   21039             : Clear class/namespace membership information from all file-scope constants.
   21040             : Also clear the is_local_to_function flag (that's needed for member constants
   21041             : that were promoted out of local classes).
   21042             : */
   21043             : {
   21044             :   a_constant_ptr con;
   21045             : 
   21046             :   for (con = il_header.primary_scope->constants;
   21047             :        con != NULL;
   21048             :        con = con->next) {
   21049             :     clear_parent(&con->source_corresp);
   21050             :     con->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = FALSE;
   21051             :   }  /* for */
   21052             : }  /* clear_parent_info_on_constants */
   21053             : 
   21054             : 
   21055             : static void clear_parent_info_on_variables(void)
   21056             : /*
   21057             : Clear class/namespace membership information from all file-scope variables.
   21058             : Also clear the is_local_to_function flag (that's probably not needed, since
   21059             : there are no static data member variables in local classes, but for
   21060             : completeness ...).
   21061             : */
   21062             : {
   21063             :   a_variable_ptr var;
   21064             : 
   21065             :   for (var = il_header.primary_scope->variables;
   21066             :        var != NULL;
   21067             :        var = var->next) {
   21068             :     clear_parent(&var->source_corresp);
   21069             :     var->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = FALSE;
   21070             :   }  /* for */
   21071             : }  /* clear_parent_info_on_variables */
   21072             : 
   21073             : 
   21074             : static void clear_parent_info_on_routines(void)
   21075             : /*
   21076             : Clear class/namespace membership information from all file-scope routines.
   21077             : Also clear the is_local_to_function flag (that's needed for member functions
   21078             : that were promoted out of local classes).  This is done late in file
   21079             : scope lowering so that class membership information remains in constructors
   21080             : and destructors for the use of IL lowering; that information is the easiest
   21081             : way to know the associated class for those.
   21082             : */
   21083             : {
   21084             :   a_routine_ptr rout;
   21085             : 
   21086             :   for (rout = il_header.primary_scope->routines;
   21087             :        rout != NULL;
   21088             :        rout = rout->next) {
   21089             :     clear_parent(&rout->source_corresp);
   21090             :     rout->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = FALSE;
   21091             :   }  /* for */
   21092             : }  /* clear_parent_info_on_routines */
   21093             : 
   21094             : 
   21095             : static void clear_parent_info_on_types(void)
   21096             : /*
   21097             : Clear class/namespace membership information and the is_local_to_function
   21098             : flag (where appropriate) on all file-scope types.  This is done late in
   21099             : file scope lowering so that the information is around for the use of IL
   21100             : lowering.
   21101             : */
   21102             : {
   21103             :   a_type_ptr type;
   21104             : 
   21105             :   for (type = il_header.primary_scope->types;
   21106             :        type != NULL;
   21107             :        type = type->next) {
   21108             :     clear_parent(&type->source_corresp);
   21109             :     type->source_corresp.is_local_to_function = FALSE;
   21110             :   }  /* for */
   21111             : }  /* clear_parent_info_on_types */
   21112             : 
   21113             : 
   21114             : static void clear_parent_info_on_asm_entries(void)
   21115             : /*
   21116             : Clear class/namespace membership information on all asm entries in the
   21117             : file scope.
   21118             : */
   21119             : {
   21120             :   an_asm_entry_ptr aep;
   21121             : 
   21122             :   for (aep = il_header.primary_scope->asm_entries;
   21123             :        aep != NULL;
   21124             :        aep = aep->next) {
   21125             :     clear_parent(&aep->source_corresp);
   21126             :   }  /* for */
   21127             : }  /* clear_parent_info_on_asm_entries */
   21128             : 
   21129             : 
   21130             : void clear_parent_information(void)
   21131             : /*
   21132             : Clear class/namespace membership information and the is_local_to_function
   21133             : flag on entities promoted out of classes, namespaces, and functions.
   21134             : This must be done very late, because make_typeinfo_name calls the il_to_str
   21135             : routines on entities, and the parent information is used to generate
   21136             : class/namespace qualifiers.  Note that this is optional: if the back end
   21137             : would prefer to see the parent information, this processing can be removed
   21138             : (however, it would probably still be best to clear the is_local_to_function
   21139             : flag).
   21140             : */
   21141             : {
   21142             :   /* Clear parent information in constants. */
   21143             :   clear_parent_info_on_constants();
   21144             :   /* Clear parent information in variables. */
   21145             :   clear_parent_info_on_variables();
   21146             :   /* Clear parent information in routines. */
   21147             :   clear_parent_info_on_routines();
   21148             :   /* Clear parent information on types. */
   21149             :   clear_parent_info_on_types();
   21150             :   /* Clear parent information on asm entries. */
   21151             :   clear_parent_info_on_asm_entries();
   21152             : }  /* clear_parent_information */
   21153             : 
   21154             : 
   21155             : void externalize_source_correspondence(a_source_correspondence *scp,
   21156             :                                        a_boolean               is_variable)
   21157             : /*
   21158             : Change the source correspondence information for a static variable
   21159             : (is_variable TRUE) or routine (is_variable FALSE) to make it external with
   21160             : a generated name.  This is used for static entities that are referenced
   21161             : by instantiations, when the instantiations are placed in separate object
   21162             : files.  The static entity must be made external so the instantiation
   21163             : files can reference it.
   21164             : */
   21165             : {
   21166             :   /* The entity name should have been mangled already if it needs to
   21167             :      be mangled (externalize_mangled_name checks that).  Note that
   21168             :      that does not mean the entity has been lowered yet. */
   21169             :   /* Generate a mangled name to keep this entity's name unique. */
   21170             :   externalize_mangled_name(scp, is_variable);
   21171             :   scp->name_linkage = visited_yet(scp) ?
   21172             :                                    (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_external :
   21173             :                                    (a_name_linkage_kind)nlk_cplusplus_external;
   21174             :   /* Clear the same_name_as_external_entity_in_secondary_trans_unit flag
   21175             :      because it should be set only for entities without external linkage. */
   21176             :   scp->same_name_as_external_entity_in_secondary_trans_unit = FALSE;
   21177             : }  /* externalize_source_correspondence */
   21178             : 
   21179             : #if ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT
   21180             : 
   21181             : void make_statics_referenced_from_instantiations_external(void)
   21182             : /*
   21183             : When generating instantiations in separate object files, make any
   21184             : static variables or functions referenced from instantiations external.
   21185             : This must be called after IL lowering for the file scope, and after
   21186             : the needed-flag walk for the file scope.  Not done in secondary
   21187             : translation units (their statics are picked up after copying).
   21188             : */
   21189             : {
   21190             :   a_routine_ptr  rout;
   21191             :   a_variable_ptr var;
   21192             :   a_scope_ptr    scope = il_header.primary_scope;
   21193             : 
   21194             :   check_assertion(is_primary_translation_unit);
   21195             :   /* This processing is done in a separate routine, rather than in
   21196             :      lower_variable and lower_routine, because entities created by IL
   21197             :      lowering, e.g., typeinfo variables and virtual function tables,
   21198             :      (a) are created with the IL lowering flag set, and therefore do not
   21199             :      get lowered further, and (b) have storage classes that get changed
   21200             :      as lowering proceeds. */
   21201             :   for (rout = scope->routines;
   21202             :        rout != NULL;
   21203             :        rout = rout->next) {
   21204             :     if (ignore_routine_in_back_end(rout)) {
   21205             :       /* Ignore any prototype instantiations. */
   21206             :     } else if (rout->source_corresp.static_used_by_instantiation &&
   21207             : #if DUPLICATE_SPECIAL_STATICS_IN_INSTANTIATION_SLICES
   21208             :         !rout->source_corresp.duplicate_static_in_instantiation_slices &&
   21209             : #endif /* DUPLICATE_SPECIAL_STATICS_IN_INSTANTIATION_SLICES */
   21210             :         !rout->is_tls_init_routine) {
   21211             :       if (rout->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
   21212             :         externalize_source_correspondence(&rout->source_corresp,
   21213             :                                           /*is_variable=*/FALSE);
   21214             :         rout->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
   21215             :         /* If the routine has any local statics, turn it into a non-inline
   21216             :            function because we've missed our chance to promote the
   21217             :            local static variables out and externalize them. */
   21218             :         if (rout->is_inline && rout->contains_local_static_variable) {
   21219             :           set_inline_flag(rout, FALSE);
   21220             :         }  /* if */
   21221             : #if LOWER_EXTERN_INLINE
   21222             :         if (treat_as_extern_inline(rout)) {
   21223             :           /* If this now looks like an extern inline routine, and we're
   21224             :              lowering those to static, do what we would have done
   21225             :              previously. */
   21226             :           lower_extern_inline_routine(rout);
   21227             :         } else
   21228             : #endif /* LOWER_EXTERN_INLINE */
   21229             :         /* Do not insert code here. */
   21230             :         {
   21231             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
   21232             :           mark_as_needed((char *)rout, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_routine);
   21233             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
   21234             :         }  /* if */
   21235             :       }  /* if */
   21236             :     }  /* if */
   21237             :   }  /* for */
   21238             :   for (var = scope->variables;
   21239             :        var != NULL;
   21240             :        var = var->next) {
   21241             : #if USE_PATCH_INIT_STARTUP
   21242             :     char *var_name = var->source_corresp.name;
   21243             :     if (var_name != NULL && var_name[0] == '_' &&
   21244             :         strcmp(var_name, "__link") == 0) {
   21245             :       /* Do not rename the __link variable.  It is specific to a particular
   21246             :          slice. */
   21247             :     } else
   21248             : #endif /* USE_PATCH_INIT_STARTUP */
   21249             :     /* Do not insert code here.  This is the "else" of an "if". */
   21250             :     if (var->source_corresp.static_used_by_instantiation
   21251             : #if DUPLICATE_SPECIAL_STATICS_IN_INSTANTIATION_SLICES
   21252             :         && !var->source_corresp.duplicate_static_in_instantiation_slices
   21253             : #endif /* DUPLICATE_SPECIAL_STATICS_IN_INSTANTIATION_SLICES */
   21254             :                                                                         ) {
   21255             :       if (var->storage_class == (a_storage_class)sc_static) {
   21256             :         externalize_source_correspondence(&var->source_corresp,
   21257             :                                           /*is_variable=*/TRUE);
   21258             :         var->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
   21259             : #if MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS
   21260             :         mark_as_needed((char *)var, (an_il_entry_kind)iek_variable);
   21261             : #endif /* MAINTAIN_NEEDED_FLAGS */
   21262             :       }  /* if */
   21263             :     }  /* if */
   21264             :   }  /* for */
   21265             : }  /* make_statics_referenced_from_instantiations_external */
   21266             : 
   21267             : #endif /* ONE_INSTANTIATION_PER_OBJECT */
   21268             : 
   21269             : static void lower_top_level_scope(a_scope_ptr                   scope,
   21270             :                                   a_memory_region_number        region_number)
   21271             : /*
   21272             : Lower the intermediate language of a "top-level" scope, which is associated
   21273             : with the memory region specified by region_number.  A top-level scope is
   21274             : the file scope or a function scope (including function scopes for lambdas
   21275             : and member functions of local classes).  Lowering translates IL from C++
   21276             : terms into C ones, so that a C back end can handle it without change.
   21277             : */
   21278             : {
   21279             :   a_context   context;
   21280             :   /* Save/restore curr_object_lifetime in this routine. */
   21281             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr
   21282             :               saved_curr_object_lifetime = curr_object_lifetime;
   21283             :   a_scope_ptr saved_innermost_function_scope = innermost_function_scope;
   21284             : 
   21285             :   db_enter(1, "lower_il_memory_region");
   21286             :   /* The lowering is only needed if the source language is C++, if the
   21287             :      lowering phase is to be run, and if there have been no errors. */
   21288             :   if (il_lowering_needed()) {
   21289             :     a_memory_region_number  saved_region_number = curr_il_region_number;
   21290             :     il_lowering_underway = TRUE;
   21291             :     curr_context = NULL;
   21292             :     innermost_function_scope = NULL;
   21293             :     curr_object_lifetime = il_header.primary_scope->lifetime;
   21294             :     promoted_local_static_variable_inits = NULL;
   21295             :     switch_il_region(region_number);
   21296             :     /* Mark entries created during this traversal as having already been
   21297             :        visited by IL lowering. */
   21298             :     initial_value_for_il_lowering_flag = TRUE;
   21299             :     if (region_number == file_scope_region_number) {
   21300             :       /* The file scope. */
   21301             :       lowering_file_scope = TRUE;
   21302             :     } else {
   21303             :       /* A function scope. */
   21304             :       lowering_file_scope = FALSE;
   21305             :     }  /* if */
   21306             : #if DEBUG
   21307             :     if (db_flag_is_set("lowering")) {
   21308             :       fprintf(f_debug, "Lowering top level scope: ");
   21309             :       db_scope(scope);
   21310             :       fprintf(f_debug, "\n");
   21311             :     }  /* if */
   21312             :     if (debug_level >= 1 ||
   21313             :         db_flag_is_set("dump_type_lists") ||
   21314             :         db_flag_is_set("dump_lifetimes")) {
   21315             :       fprintf(f_debug, "Lowering IL in memory region %lu\n",
   21316             :                        (unsigned long)region_number);
   21317             :       if (db_flag_is_set("dump_type_lists")) {
   21318             :         db_type_lists(scope, 0);
   21319             :       }  /* if */
   21320             :       if (db_flag_is_set("dump_lifetimes")) {
   21321             :         fprintf(f_debug, "Object lifetime for ");
   21322             :         db_scope(scope);
   21323             :         fprintf(f_debug, ":\n");
   21324             :         db_object_lifetime_tree(scope->lifetime);
   21325             :       }  /* if */
   21326             :     }  /* if */
   21327             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   21328             :     /* Put the file-scope context on the context stack.  This is also done
   21329             :        for function scope memory regions so there will be a file-scope
   21330             :        context above the function context. */
   21331             :     push_context(&context, il_header.primary_scope,
   21332             :                  (an_object_lifetime_ptr)NULL);
   21333             :     /* Create definitions for virtual function tables.  This must be done
   21334             :        early when virtual function information is still available. */
   21335             :     define_scope_virtual_function_tables(scope);
   21336             :     if (lowering_file_scope) {
   21337             :       /* Create any needed typeinfo variables.  This must be done after
   21338             :          virtual function table definition but before most lowering. */
   21339             :       generate_typeinfo_vars();
   21340             :     }  /* if */
   21341             :     /* Lower the scope and its subscopes in the same memory region. */
   21342             :     lower_scope(scope);
   21343             :     if (lowering_file_scope) {
   21344             :       /* Lower any orphaned types and other entries from the function and
   21345             :          block scopes.  They are allocated in the file scope memory region but
   21346             :          are not linked into the file scope memory region IL tree, so they have
   21347             :          to be found through a separate list. */
   21348             :       lower_orphaned_entries();
   21349             :     }  /* if */
   21350             :     /* Promote class members out of the classes. */
   21351             :     do_scope_class_member_promotion(scope);
   21352             :     if (lowering_file_scope) {
   21353             :       do_scope_namespace_member_promotion(il_header.primary_scope);
   21354             :       /* Generate code to handle file-scope dynamic initializations and
   21355             :          the corresponding destructions.  This is done after scope class
   21356             :          member promotions so that the initialization routine is last. */
   21357             :       lower_file_scope_dynamic_inits();
   21358             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   21359             :       if (inlining_enabled) {
   21360             :         /* For any inline routines for which all calls were expanded inline,
   21361             :            mark the routines as being unreferenced. */
   21362             :         mark_inlined_routines_as_unreferenced();
   21363             :       }  /* if */
   21364             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   21365             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   21366             :       if (vla_enabled) {
   21367             :         /* We can now safely lower all the VLA types that have been collected
   21368             :            while lowering this translation unit. */
   21369             :         lower_vla_types();
   21370             :       }  /* if */
   21371             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   21372             : #if LOWER_COMPLEX
   21373             :       lower_c99_nonreal_float_types();
   21374             : #endif /* LOWER_COMPLEX */
   21375             :     }  /* if */
   21376             :     /* Do any processing on classes that has to wait until the very end. */
   21377             :     do_class_lowering_wrapup(scope);
   21378             :     /* Pop the file-scope context. */
   21379             :     pop_context();
   21380             :     initial_value_for_il_lowering_flag = FALSE;
   21381             :     curr_object_lifetime = saved_curr_object_lifetime;
   21382             :     innermost_function_scope = saved_innermost_function_scope;
   21383             :     il_lowering_underway = FALSE;
   21384             :     if (region_number == file_scope_region_number) {
   21385             :       il_header.il_has_C_semantics = TRUE;
   21386             :     }  /* if */
   21387             :     switch_il_region(saved_region_number);
   21388             :   } else if (c99_il_lowering_needed()) {
   21389             :     lower_c99_il_memory_region(region_number);
   21390             :   }  /* if */
   21391             :   /* Make sure no pending stmk_init statements remain. */
   21392             :   check_assertion(pending_stmk_init_statements == NULL);
   21393             :   db_exit();
   21394             : }  /* lower_top_level_scope */
   21395             : 
   21396             : 
   21397             : void lower_file_scope(void)
   21398             : /*
   21399             : Lower the file scope (everything that is not in a function memory region).
   21400             : */
   21401             : {
   21402             :   lower_top_level_scope(il_header.primary_scope, file_scope_region_number);
   21403             : }  /* lower_file_scope */
   21404             : 
   21405             : 
   21406             : void lower_function_scope(a_routine_ptr routine,
   21407             :                           a_scope_ptr   scope)
   21408             : /*
   21409             : Lower the function scope specified by routine and scope.
   21410             : */
   21411             : {
   21412             :   a_memory_region_number        memory_region;
   21413             : 
   21414             :   memory_region = mem_region_for_routine(routine);
   21415             :   lower_top_level_scope(scope, memory_region);
   21416             : }  /* lower_function_scope */
   21417             : 
   21418             : 
   21419             : static void visit_object_lifetime_tree(an_object_lifetime_ptr olp,
   21420             :                                        a_boolean              detach)
   21421             : /*
   21422             : Visit the indicated object lifetime and all its children to do end-of-lowering
   21423             : cleanup.  If detach is TRUE, detach all the object lifetimes from the IL tree
   21424             : so they're not reachable.  Do nothing if olp is NULL.
   21425             : */
   21426             : {
   21427             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr child_olp;
   21428             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr     dip, dip_next;
   21429             : 
   21430             :   if (olp != NULL) {
   21431             :     /* Visit all children. */
   21432             :     for (child_olp = olp->child_lifetime;
   21433             :          child_olp != NULL;
   21434             :          child_olp = child_olp->next) {
   21435             :       visit_object_lifetime_tree(child_olp, detach);
   21436             :     }  /* if */
   21437             :     /* Visit the dynamic init entries on the destructions list of
   21438             :        the lifetime. */
   21439             :     for (dip = olp->destructions; dip != NULL; dip = dip_next) {
   21440             :       dip_next = dip->next_in_destruction_list;
   21441             :       check_assertion_str2(dip->lifetime == olp,
   21442             :                            "visit_object_lifetime_tree:",
   21443             :                            "bad lifetime pointer in dynamic init");
   21444             :       /* Disassociate the dynamic init entry from the lifetime. */
   21445             :       if (detach) remove_from_destruction_list(dip);
   21446             :       /* Free any attached entity description.  The pointer would
   21447             :          normally be expected to be non-NULL, but if a subtree is
   21448             :          detached and then visited again later, the pointer will be
   21449             :          NULL the second time. */
   21450             :       if (dip->destructible_entity_descr != NULL) {
   21451             :         free_destructible_entity_descr(dip->destructible_entity_descr);
   21452             :         dip->destructible_entity_descr = NULL;
   21453             :       }  /* if */
   21454             :     }  /* for */
   21455             :     if (detach) {
   21456             :       /* Unbind this object lifetime from its attached entity. */
   21457             :       /* Label lifetimes don't have two-way binding with an entity. */
   21458             :       if (olp->kind != (an_object_lifetime_kind)olk_block_after_label) {
   21459             :         /* Watch out for lifetimes that have already been unbound (e.g., those
   21460             :            associated with enk_object_lifetime nodes). */
   21461             :         if (olp->entity.kind != (a_byte_il_entry_kind)iek_none) {
   21462             :           unbind_object_lifetime(olp);
   21463             :         }  /* if */
   21464             :       }  /* if */
   21465             :     }  /* if */
   21466             :   }  /* if */
   21467             : }  /* visit_object_lifetime_tree */
   21468             : 
   21469             : 
   21470             : void eliminate_expr_object_lifetime(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   21471             : /*
   21472             : If the given expression has an enk_object_lifetime node at the top,
   21473             : eliminate the object lifetime and all its children.  "Eliminate"
   21474             : means to detach them from the IL tree so they're not reachable.
   21475             : */
   21476             : {
   21477             :   if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   21478             :     visit_object_lifetime_tree(expr->variant.object_lifetime.ptr,
   21479             :                                /*detach=*/TRUE);
   21480             :   }  /* if */
   21481             : }  /* eliminate_expr_object_lifetime */
   21482             : 
   21483             : 
   21484             : void clean_up_all_object_lifetimes(a_scope_ptr scope)
   21485             : /*
   21486             : Visit all object lifetime entries attached to the indicated scope and
   21487             : its subtree to do end-of-lowering cleanup.  If we're not supposed to
   21488             : pass object lifetime information to the back end, detach all the object
   21489             : lifetime information from the IL tree.  This is done late so that the
   21490             : object lifetimes are available during the entire lowering process.
   21491             : The scope is the top scope in a memory region.
   21492             : */
   21493             : {
   21494             :   a_boolean detach = !keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il;
   21495             : 
   21496             :   visit_object_lifetime_tree(scope->lifetime, detach);
   21497             :   if (scope->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_function) {
   21498             :     visit_object_lifetime_tree(
   21499             :                          scope->variant.routine.lifetime_of_local_static_vars,
   21500             :                          detach);
   21501             :     if (detach) {
   21502             :       /* Clear the object lifetime pointers in all stmk_label statements.
   21503             :          They are cleared late (rather than when the label is encountered)
   21504             :          because they are needed each time the label is referenced. */
   21505             :       a_label_ptr lab;
   21506             :       for (lab = scope->labels; lab != NULL; lab = lab->next) {
   21507             :         a_statement_ptr lab_stmt = lab->exec_stmt;
   21508             :         lab_stmt->variant.label.lifetime = NULL;
   21509             :       }  /* for */
   21510             :     }  /* if */
   21511             :   } else {
   21512             :     /* File scope. */
   21513             : #if ORPHAN_PROCESSING_NEEDED
   21514             :     if (detach) {
   21515             :       /* Clear the orphan list for object lifetimes. */
   21516             :       char                      *entry_ptr, *next_entry_ptr;
   21517             :       an_orphaned_il_entry_list *orphan_header =
   21518             :                      &orphaned_file_scope_il_entries[(int)iek_object_lifetime];
   21519             :       for (entry_ptr = orphan_header->first_entry;
   21520             :            entry_ptr != NULL; 
   21521             :            entry_ptr = next_entry_ptr) {
   21522             :         next_entry_ptr = fs_orphan_pointer_of(entry_ptr);
   21523             :         fs_orphan_pointer_of(entry_ptr) = NULL;
   21524             :       }  /* for */
   21525             :       orphan_header->first_entry = NULL;
   21526             :       orphan_header->last_entry = NULL;
   21527             :     }  /* if */
   21528             : #endif /* ORPHAN_PROCESSING_NEEDED */
   21529             :   }  /* if */
   21530             : }  /* clean_up_all_object_lifetimes */
   21531             : 
   21532             : 
   21533             : #if DEBUG
   21534             : unsigned long show_lowering_space_used(void)
   21535             : /*
   21536             : Display and return the amount of space used for various IL lowering tables.
   21537             : */
   21538             : {
   21539             :   unsigned long num, size, total, grand_total = 0;
   21540             : 
   21541             :   db_space_used_header("IL lowering table use:");
   21542             : 
   21543             :   db_space_used("Name strings", allocated_name_string_length, char);
   21544             :   db_space_used_lost("init pos modifier", avail_init_pos_modifiers,
   21545             :                      num_init_pos_modifiers_allocated, an_init_pos_modifier);
   21546             :   db_space_used_lost("destr. entity descrs", avail_destructible_entity_descrs,
   21547             :                      num_destructible_entity_descrs_allocated,
   21548             :                      a_destructible_entity_descr);
   21549             :   db_space_used_lost("return memos", avail_return_memos,
   21550             :                      num_return_memos_allocated, a_return_memo);
   21551             :   db_space_used_lost("temp list entries", avail_temporary_list_entries,
   21552             :                      num_temporary_list_entries_allocated,
   21553             :                      a_temporary_list_entry);
   21554             :   db_space_used_lost("scopeless comp stmts", avail_scopeless_compound_stmts,
   21555             :                      num_scopeless_compound_stmts_allocated,
   21556             :                      a_scopeless_compound_stmt);
   21557             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21558             :   db_space_used_lost("compressible string pos", avail_compressible_string_pos,
   21559             :                      num_compressible_string_pos_allocated,
   21560             :                      a_compressible_string_pos);
   21561             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   21562             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
   21563             :   db_space_used("construction vtbls", num_construction_vtbls_allocated,
   21564             :                  a_construction_vtbl);
   21565             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
   21566             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   21567             :   if (inlining_enabled) {
   21568             :     db_space_used_lost("variable remappings",
   21569             :                        avail_variable_remappings_for_inlining,
   21570             :                        num_variable_remappings_for_inlining,
   21571             :                        a_variable_remapping_for_inlining);
   21572             :   }  /* if */
   21573             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   21574             : 
   21575             :   db_space_used_total();
   21576             : 
   21577             :   return grand_total;
   21578             : }  /* show_lowering_space_used */
   21579             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   21580             : 
   21581             : 
   21582             : void function_lower_init(void)
   21583             : /*
   21584             : Do initialization at the beginning of lowering a function.
   21585             : */
   21586             : {
   21587             :   /* Clear the list of return statements found in the routine.  This list
   21588             :      is built so that epilogue code can be added at each return. */
   21589             :   return_memo_list = NULL;
   21590             :   /* Initialize for exception handling lowering. */
   21591             :   eh_function_lower_init();
   21592             : }  /* function_lower_init */
   21593             : 
   21594             : 
   21595             : void il_lower_one_time_init(void)
   21596             : /*
   21597             : Do one-time initialization of variables related to IL lowering.
   21598             : */
   21599             : {
   21600             :   /* Save variables from lower_il.h and lower_il.c that are needed for
   21601             :      precompiled headers */
   21602             :   if (precompiled_header_processing_required) {
   21603             :     static a_pch_saved_variable saved_vars[] = {
   21604             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(avail_init_pos_modifiers),
   21605             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(avail_destructible_entity_descrs),
   21606             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(avail_return_memos),
   21607             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(avail_temporary_list_entries),
   21608             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(avail_scopeless_compound_stmts),
   21609             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(pure_virtual_called_routine),
   21610             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(deleted_virtual_called_routine),
   21611             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(vptp_type),
   21612             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(mptr_type),
   21613             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(mptr_d_field),
   21614             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21615             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(mptr_i_field),
   21616             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   21617             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(mptr_f_field),
   21618             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   21619             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21620             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(dynamic_cast_ref_routine),
   21621             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   21622             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(bad_cast_routine),
   21623             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   21624             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(dynamic_cast_routine),
   21625             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   21626             : #if DEBUG
   21627             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(num_temporary_list_entries_allocated),
   21628             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(num_scopeless_compound_stmts_allocated),
   21629             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(num_init_pos_modifiers_allocated),
   21630             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(num_destructible_entity_descrs_allocated),
   21631             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(allocated_name_string_length),
   21632             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(num_return_memos_allocated),
   21633             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
   21634             :       pch_saved_var_array_elem(num_construction_vtbls_allocated),
   21635             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
   21636             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   21637             :       pch_saved_var_array_terminating_elem()
   21638             :     };
   21639             :     register_pch_saved_variables(saved_vars);
   21640             :   }  /* if */
   21641             :   /* Register variables that must be saved and restored when switching
   21642             :      between translation units. */
   21643             :   register_trans_unit_variable(pure_virtual_called_routine);
   21644             :   register_trans_unit_variable(deleted_virtual_called_routine);
   21645             :   register_trans_unit_variable(vptp_type);
   21646             :   register_trans_unit_variable(mptr_type);
   21647             :   register_trans_unit_variable(mptr_d_field);
   21648             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21649             :   register_trans_unit_variable(mptr_i_field);
   21650             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   21651             :   register_trans_unit_variable(mptr_f_field);
   21652             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   21653             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21654             :   register_trans_unit_variable(dynamic_cast_ref_routine);
   21655             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   21656             :   register_trans_unit_variable(bad_cast_routine),
   21657             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */
   21658             :   register_trans_unit_variable(dynamic_cast_routine);
   21659             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   21660             :   il_lowering_underway = FALSE;
   21661             :   init_lower_one_time_init();
   21662             :   eh_lower_one_time_init();
   21663             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   21664             :   /* Do inline.c initialization. */
   21665             :   if (inlining_enabled) inline_one_time_init();
   21666             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   21667             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   21668             :   check_assertion_str2(!rtti_enabled || generate_rtti_typeinfo,
   21669             :                        "Configuration problem: RTTI information must be",
   21670             :                        "generated when RTTI is enabled");
   21671             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   21672             : }  /* il_lower_one_time_init */
   21673             : 
   21674             : 
   21675             : void il_lower_trans_unit_init(void)
   21676             : /*
   21677             : Initialize static variables related to IL lowering that must be initialized
   21678             : for each translation unit.
   21679             : */
   21680             : {
   21681             :   lowering_file_scope = FALSE;
   21682             :   curr_context = NULL;
   21683             :   return_value_pointer_variable = NULL;
   21684             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   21685             :   gse_return_value_pointer_variable = NULL;
   21686             :   gse_init_position = NULL;
   21687             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   21688             :   pure_virtual_called_routine = NULL;
   21689             :   deleted_virtual_called_routine = NULL;
   21690             :   vptp_type = NULL;
   21691             :   mptr_type = NULL;
   21692             :   mptr_d_field = NULL;
   21693             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21694             :   mptr_i_field = NULL;
   21695             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   21696             :   mptr_f_field = NULL;
   21697             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI
   21698             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21699             :   dynamic_cast_ref_routine = NULL;
   21700             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   21701             :   bad_cast_routine = NULL;
   21702             : #endif /* !IA64_ABI */
   21703             :   dynamic_cast_routine = NULL;
   21704             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_RTTI */
   21705             :   init_lower_trans_unit_init();
   21706             :   eh_lower_trans_unit_init();
   21707             : }  /* il_lower_trans_unit_init */
   21708             : 
   21709             : 
   21710             : void il_lower_init(void)
   21711             : /*
   21712             : Initialize static variables related to IL lowering that must be initialized
   21713             : for each compilation.
   21714             : */
   21715             : {
   21716             :   /* Object lifetime information is only kept if it will be needed by the
   21717             :      back end.  It's only needed if exception handling is enabled. */
   21718             : #if KEEP_OBJECT_LIFETIME_INFO_IN_LOWERED_IL_WHEN_EH_ENABLED
   21719             :   keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il = exceptions_enabled;
   21720             : #else /* ! KEEP_OBJECT_LIFETIME_INFO_IN_LOWERED_IL_WHEN_EH_ENABLED */
   21721             :   keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il = FALSE;
   21722             : #endif /* KEEP_OBJECT_LIFETIME_INFO_IN_LOWERED_IL_WHEN_EH_ENABLED */
   21723             :   /* For both the Cfront-like ABI and the IA-64 ABI, typeinfo variables
   21724             :      can go out independently of the corresponding vtable variable if the
   21725             :      vtable variable is "optional" (meaning it is not required to go out and
   21726             :      goes out only if referenced). */
   21727             :   typeinfo_uncoupled_when_vtable_is_optional = TRUE;
   21728             : #if CHECKING && ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED
   21729             :   /* lower_dynamic_init can't handle preserving an object lifetime
   21730             :      for a constructor init in an assignment to "this".  Assignment to
   21731             :      "this" is disabled when exception handling is enabled.  Don't allow
   21732             :      the combination that can't be handled. */
   21733             :   if (!exceptions_enabled && keep_object_lifetime_info_in_lowered_il) {
   21734             :     unexpected_condition_str2("ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED must be disabled",
   21735             :                               "to keep object lifetimes when EH is disabled");
   21736             :   }  /* if */
   21737             : #endif /* CHECKING && ASSIGNMENT_TO_THIS_ALLOWED */
   21738             :   avail_init_pos_modifiers = NULL;
   21739             :   avail_destructible_entity_descrs = NULL;
   21740             : #if DEBUG
   21741             :   num_temporary_list_entries_allocated = 0;
   21742             :   num_scopeless_compound_stmts_allocated = 0;
   21743             :   num_init_pos_modifiers_allocated = 0;
   21744             :   num_destructible_entity_descrs_allocated = 0;
   21745             : #if ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS
   21746             :   num_construction_vtbls_allocated = 0;
   21747             : #endif /* ABI_CHANGES_FOR_CONSTRUCTION_VTBLS */
   21748             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   21749             :   code_pos_for_lowering = null_source_position;
   21750             :   avail_return_memos = NULL;
   21751             :   avail_temporary_list_entries = NULL;
   21752             :   avail_scopeless_compound_stmts = NULL;
   21753             : #if DEBUG
   21754             :   allocated_name_string_length  = 0;
   21755             :   num_return_memos_allocated    = 0;
   21756             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   21757             : #if ENSURE_LOWERED_TYPE_LIST_ORDERING
   21758             :   /* If we are going to run the C-generating back end, the types list must be
   21759             :      ordered to ensure that when the definition of a type T is rendered, all
   21760             :      the types X that T depends on have been declared/defined appropriately.
   21761             :      ENSURE_LOWERED_TYPE_LIST_ORDERING can also be set to TRUE for other back
   21762             :      ends that want to see the types in a C-compatible order. */
   21763             :   perform_type_list_ordering = TRUE;
   21764             : #endif /* ENSURE_LOWERED_TYPE_LIST_ORDERING */
   21765             :   /* Determine targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind from
   21766             :      targ_sizeof_ptr_to_data_member.  That is, find the integer kind to be
   21767             :      used for pointers to data members.  An unsigned type is always used.
   21768             :      Note that cfront uses "int *".  The IA-64 ABI uses a signed type
   21769             :      because -1 is used to indicate NULL. */
   21770             :   targ_ptr_to_data_member_int_kind =
   21771             :                int_kind_for_size_and_alignment(targ_sizeof_ptr_to_data_member,
   21772             :                                                targ_alignof_ptr_to_data_member,
   21773             : #if !IA64_ABI
   21774             :                                                /*is_signed=*/FALSE
   21775             : #else /* IA64_ABI */
   21776             :                                                /*is_signed=*/TRUE
   21777             : #endif /* IA64_ABI */                                
   21778             :                                                                  );
   21779             :   /* name_lower_init is called from fe_init.c because name mangling can
   21780             :      be used separately from the rest of IL lowering. */
   21781             :   prelower_aggr_con_ipdp = NULL;
   21782             :   prelower_aggr_con_insert_location = NULL;
   21783             :   /* Do lower_init.c initialization. */
   21784             :   init_lower_init();
   21785             :   /* Do lower_eh.c initialization. */
   21786             :   eh_lower_init();
   21787             : #if MINIMAL_INLINING
   21788             :   /* Do inline.c initialization. */
   21789             :   if (inlining_enabled) inline_init();
   21790             : #endif /* MINIMAL_INLINING */
   21791             : }  /* il_lower_init */
   21792             : 
   21793             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
   21794             : #endif /* NEED_NAME_MANGLING */
   21795             : 
   21796             : /******************************************************************************
